markers.description: BY NATIONAL OCEAN SERVICE 1982 (RHH) THE STATION IS LOCATED ON THE SOUTH SIDE OF WILMINGTON, ON A PENN CENTRAL RAILROAD BRIDGE ACROSS THE CHRISTINA RIVER. TO REACH THE STATION FROM THE JUNCTION OF U.S. HIGHWAY 13 AND STATE ROAD 54 IN THE EAST EDGE OF DELMAR, GO EAST ON STATE ROAD 54 FOR 1.3 MILES TO POWERLINE POLE NUMBER 65 AND THE STATION ON THE LEFT, CONTINUE EAST ON STATE ROAD 54 FOR 0.4 MILE TO A SIDE ROAD RIGHT AND RM 3 (AZ. MK.) ON THE RIGHT.  STATION MARKS ARE STANDARD DISKS STAMPED ANDREWS 1974.  THE SURFACE DISK IS SET IN THE TOP OF A 12-INCH CYLINDRICAL CONCRETE MONUMENT THAT IS FLUSH WITH THE GROUND SURFACE.  IT IS 26 FEET NORTH OF THE CENTERLINE OF STATE ROAD 54 AND 5 FEET EAST-SOUTHEAST OF POWERLINE POLE NUMBER 65.  THE UNDERGROUND DISK IS SET IN THE TOP OF AN IRREGLUAR MASS OF CONCRETE 42 INCHES BELOW THE GROUND SURFACE.  REFERENCE MARK 1, A STANDARD DISK STAMPED ANDREWS NO 1 1974, IS SET IN THE TOP OF A 12-INCH CYLINDRICAL CONCRETE MONUMENT THAT IS FLUSH WITH THE GROUND SURFACE.  IT IS 23 FEET SOUTH OF THE CENTERLINE OF STATE ROAD 54 AND 5 FEET NORTH OF A DRAINAGE DITCH.  REFERENCE MARK 2, A STANDARD DISK STAMPED ANDREWS NO 2 1974, IS SET IN THE TOP OF A 12-INCH CYLINDRICAL CONCRETE MONUMENT THAT IS FLUSH WITH THE GROUND SURFACE.  IT IS 32 FEET SOUTH OF THE CENTERLINE OF STATE ROAD 54 AND 3 FEET EAST OF POWERLINE POLE NUMBER 48B.  REFERENCE MARK 3, A STANDARD DISK STAMPED ANDREWS NO 3 1974, IS SET IN THE TOP OF A 12-INCH CYLINDRICAL CONCRETE MONUMENT THAT IS FLUSH WITH THE GROUND SURFACE.  IT IS 53 FEET EAST OF THE CENTER OF A PAVED ROAD, 27 FEET SOUTH OF THE CENTERLINE OF STATE ROAD 54, 8 FEET NORTHWEST OF POWERLINE POLE NUMBER 48B-10 AND 4 FEET EAST-SOUTHEAST MELSON ROAD SIGN.  THE MARK SERVES AS AN AZIMUTH MARK.                            STATION RECOVERY (1974)  RECOVERY NOTE BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 1974 RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION.                            STATION RECOVERY (1976)  RECOVERY NOTE BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 1976 (CLN) THE STATION AND ALL MARKS WERE RECOVERED AND FOUND IN GOOD CONDITION AS DESCRIBED IN THE 1974 DESCRIPTION.  A SHORTER DISTANCE OF 0.04 FOOT OR 0.011 METER WAS NOTED TO REFERENCE MARK ONE.  A SHORTER DISTANCE OF 0.02 FOOT OR 0.003 METER WAS NOTED TO REFERENCE MARK 2.  THE DIRECTION TO BOTH MARKS WERE WITHIN CLOSE AGREEMENT WITH THE 1974 OBSERVATIONS.  IT IS BELIEVED THE 1974 MEASUREMENTS WERE SLOPE MEASUREMENTS.  THE MARYLAND-DELAWARE BOUNDARY MONUMENT NUMBER 26 WAS ESTABLISHED AT THIS DATE, SEE DESCRIPTION THEREOF.  AIRLINE DISTANCE AND DIRECTION FROM NEAREST TOWN 2-1/2 MILES EAST OF DELMAR.                            STATION RECOVERY (1981)  RECOVERY NOTE BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 1981 THE STATION MARK, BOTH REFERENCE MARKS AND THE AZIMUTH MARK WERE RECOVERD AND FOUND IN GOOD CONDITION AS DESCRIBED IN THE MOST RECENT INFORMATION.  A LONGER DISTANCE OF 0.03 FOOT (0.01 M) OR 0.008 METER (0.026 FT) WAS NOTED TO REFERENCE MARK ONE.  A LONGER DISTANCE OF 0.04 FOOT (0.01 M) OR 0.012 METER (0.039 FT) WAS NOTED BETWEEN THE REFERENCE MARKS.  IT IS BELIEVED THAT THE DIFFERENCES MAY HAVE BEEN CAUSED BY THE LARGE AMOUNT OF WATER WHICH THE DITCHES NEAR THE REFERENCE MARKS HAVE IN THEM DURING THE WINTER MONTHS.  IT MAY CAUSE THE MARKS TO SETTLE OR SLIP AROUND A SMALL AMOUNT.  THE STATION MARK IS NOT NEAR THE DITCH.                            STATION RECOVERY (2013)  RECOVERY NOTE BY DELAWARE COASTAL PROGRAM 2013 THE STATION WAS NOT RECOVERED.  RM 3 WAS RECOVERED AND THE MONUMENT IS LOOSE IN THE GROUND.  THE POWERPOLE IN THE DESCRIPTION FOR RM 3 IS NOW LABELED T 69 48842/96382.

BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 1974 (LAL) NO MEASUREMENT WAS MADE FROM RM 1 TO RM 2 DUE TO A HOUSE ON LINE.  THE STATION IS LOCATED ABOUT 5 MILES NORTHEAST OF PITTSVILLE, MARYLAND, 5 MILES NORTHWEST OF WHALEYSVILLE, MARYLAND AND 2 MILES SOUTHEAST OF GUMBORO, DELAWARE, ON PROPERTY OWNED BY THE BETHEL UNITED METHODIST CHURCH.  TO REACH THE STATION FROM THE AYERS METHODIST CHURCH IN PITTSVILLE, MARYLAND, GO NORTH ON STATE ROAD 353 FOR 4.0 MILES TO A CROSSROAD AT THE MARYLAND-DELAWARE STATE LINE AND THE JUNCTION WITH MARYLAND STATE ROAD 54, TURN RIGHT AND GO EAST ON A PAVED ROAD FOR 1.35 MILES TO A CROSSROAD AND REFERENCE MARK 3 ON THE LEFT.  CONTINUE EAST ON THE PAVED ROAD FOR 0.7 MILE TO A SIDE ROAD ON THE LEFT, TURN LEFT AND GO NORTH ON A PAVED ROAD FOR 0.05 MILE TO THE BETHEL UNITED METHODIST CHURCH ON THE LEFT AND THE STATION.  STATION MARKS ARE STANDARD DISKS STAMPED BETHEL 1974.  THE SURFACE DISK IS SET IN THE TOP OF A 12-INCH CYLINDRICAL CONCRETE MONUMENT THAT IS FLUSH WITH THE GROUND SURFACE.  THE UNDERGROUND DISK IS SET IN AN IRREGULAR MASS OF CONCRETE THAT IS 42 INCHES BELOW THE GROUND SURFACE.  IT IS 262 FEET NORTHWEST OF THE CENTER OF THE PAVED ROAD, 71 FEET NORTH OF THE NORTHWEST CORNER OF A FRAME HOUSE AND NEAR THE WEST END OF THE CHURCH LAWN.  REFERENCE MARK 1, A STANDARD DISK STAMPED BETHEL NO 1 1974, SET IN THE TOP OF A 12-INCH CYLINDRICAL CONCRETE MONUMENT THAT IS 1 INCH BELOW THE GROUND SURFACE.  IT IS 59.3 FEET WEST-NORTHWEST OF THE SOUTHWEST CORNER OF THE CHURCH, 2.5 FEET EAST OF THE NORTHEAST CORNER OF THE FRAME HOUSE AND 2 FEET NORTHEAST OF A POWERLINE POLE.  REFERENCE MARK 2, A STANDARD DISK STAMPED BETHEL NO 2 1974, SET IN THE TOP OF A 12-INCH CYLINDRICAL CONCRETE MONUMENT THAT IS FLUSH WITH THE GROUND SURFACE.  IT IS 46 FEET WEST OF THE NORTHWEST CORNER OF THE FRAME HOUSE, 44 FEET NORTHWEST OF THE SOUTHWEST CORNER OF THE FRAME HOUSE AND 4.5 FEET NORTHEAST OF A 16-INCH PINE TREE.  REFERENCE MARK 3, A STANDARD DISK STAMPED BETHEL NO 3 1974, SET IN THE TOP OF A 12-INCH CYLINDRICAL CONCRETE MONUMENT THAT IS FLUSH WITH THE GROUND SURFACE.  IT IS 43 FEET NORTHWEST OF THE CENTER OF THE CROSSROAD, 31 FEET WEST OF THE CENTER OF THE PAVED ROAD GOING NORTH AND 4.5 FEET NORTH OF A STOP SIGN.  THIS MARK SERVES AS AN AZIMUTH MARK. STATION RECOVERY (1976)  RECOVERY NOTE BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 1976 (CLN) THE STATION AND ALL MARKS WERE RECOVERED AND FOUND IN GOOD CONDITION AS DESCRIBED IN THE 1974 DESCRIPTION.  THE DISTANCES AND DIRECTIONS TO ALL MARKS WERE WITHIN CLOSE AGREEMENT WITH THE 1974 OBSERVATIONS. markers.description: BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1961 (RWT) THE STATION IS LOCATED IN THE SOUTHEAST CORNER OF THE BETHEL CEMETERY, 1.6 MILES EAST OF CHESAPEAK CITY, 2.8 MILES WEST OF STATE HIGHWAY 896 AND ABOUT 20 YARDS SOUTH OF THE CHESAPEAK-DELAWARE CANAL. THE STATION MARK IS A STANDARD REFERENCE MARK DISK STAMPED BETHEL NO. 3 1961, SET IN TOP OF A SQUARE CONCRETE MONUMENT WHICH IS FLUSH WITH THE GROUND SURFACE.  IT IS 2.4 FEET NORTH OF A STANDARD METAL WITNESS POST LOCATED IN THE EAST AND WEST FENCE LINE AND 20.2 FEET WEST OF THE SOUTHEAST FENCE CORNER.  BETHEL U.S.E. 1934 IS A STANDARD U.S. CORPS OF ENGINEERS TRIANGULATION DISK STAMPED BETHEL USCOFE NO 4734 1934, SET IN TOP OF A SQUARE CONCRETE MONUMENT WHICH IS FLUSH WITH THE GROUND SURFACE.  IT IS 18.6 METERS SOUTH OF THE QUECK AND MOODY TOMBSTONE.  32.5 METERS SOUTH-SOUTHEAST OF THE KERSHAW TOMBSTONE AND 20.90 METERS SOUTHWEST OF KERN TOMBSTONE.  REFERENCE MARK 2 IS A STANDARD U.S. CORPS OF ENGINEERS TRIANGULATION DISK STAMPED BETHEL USC OF E NO 4734 NO 2 1934, SET IN TOP OF A SQUARE CONCRETE MONUMENT WHICH PROJECTS 2 INCHES ABOVE THE GROUND SURFACE.  IT IS 6 INCHES WEST-NORTHWEST OF THE WOVEN FENCE LINE, 3.5 FEET SOUTH-SOUTHWEST OF THE NORTH END OF THE WOVEN FENCE LINE AND 3.9 FEET SOUTH OF BOUNDARY MONUMENT NO. 74.  AZIMUTH MARK IS A STANDARD DISK STAMPED BETHEL 1961, SET IN TOP OF A SQUARE CONCRETE MONUMENT WHICH PROJECTS 4 INCHES ABOVE THE GROUND SURFACE.  IT IS 1.0 FOOT NORTH OF THE EAST AND WEST FENCE LINE AND 88.6 FEET SOUTH OF THE SOUTHWEST CORNER OF FORD TOMBSTONE.  BOUNDARY MONUMENT NO. 74 IS A 11 IN X 11 IN LIMESTONE BOULDER BEARING THE COAT OF ARMS PROJECTION ABOUT 30 INCHES ABOVE THE GROUND SURFACE.  IT IS LOCATED IN THE EAST FENCE LINE AROUND THE BETHEL CEMETERY, AT THE SOUTH END OF AN EVERGREEN HEDGE ROW AND AT THE NORTH END OF A WOVEN FENCE LINE.  THE MONUMENT IS LEANING CONSIDERABLE EAST-SOUTHEAST.  HEIGHT OF LIGHT ABOVE STATION MARK 38.12 METERS. markers.description: BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1932 (GLA) THIS IS A CUT-IN STATION ON THE SW BANK OF DELAWARE BAY, ON BOMBAY HOOK POINT.  25 FEET W OF THE HIGH WATER LINE.  BOMBAY HOOK POINT IS ABOUT 1.8 MILES SE OF WOODLAWN BEACH PARK.  THE STATION IS MARKED BY A 1 1/4-INCH PIPE 6 FEET LONG DRIVEN IN THE GROUND.  OVER THE STATION IS ERECTED A SQUARE SKELETON STEEL TOWER 60 FEET HIGH WITH ITS BASE ANCHORED IN CONCRETE.  A LATTICEWORK TARGET 20 FEET HIGH IS MOUNTED ON THE UPPER SECTIONS OF THE TOWER.                            STATION RECOVERY (1969)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1969 (JKW) LOST.  AN OLD STEEL TOWER WAS FOUND AT THE DESCRIBED LOCATION, BUT THE PIPE COULD NOT BE FOUND.  IT IS QUESTIONABLE THAT THIS IS THE SAME TOWER THAT WAS OVER THE ORIGINAL SITE.                            STATION RECOVERY (1975)  RECOVERY NOTE BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 1975 (RST) THIS STATION IS ON THE SOUTHWEST BANK OF DELAWARE BAY ON BOMBAY HOOK POINT.  IT IS 25 FEET WEST OF THE HIGH WATER LINE, SHORELINE IS SUBJECT TO SMALL PERIODIC CHANGE.  BOMBAY HOOK POINT IS ABOUT 1.8 MILES SOUTHEAST OF WOODLAND BEACH.  THE STATION IS MARKED BY A 1-1/4 INCH IRON PIPE 6 FEET LONG DRIVEN INTO THE GROUND.  OVER THE STATION IS A SQUARE SKELTON STEEL TOWER 60 FEET TALL WITH ITS BASE IN CONCRETE.  A 20 FOOT LATTICE WORK TARGET OCCUPIES THE UPPER PORTION OF THE TOWER.  THE TOWER SHOWS SIGNS OF AGE AND WEATHERING.  SOME OF THE STRUCTURE MEMBERS HAVE FALLEN FROM THE TOWER.  TO REACH THE STATION FROM SMYRNA, GO EAST ON ROUTE 6 TO WOODLAND BEACH, TURN RIGHT AT THE INTERSECTION AND PASS THROUGH A GATE ABOUT 0.2 MILE FROM WOODLAND BEACH.  PASS THROUGH A SECOND GATE AND TURN LEFT AT THIS GATE.  DRIVE TO THE END OF THE ROAD AND WALK DOWN THE RIVER BANK EAST BY SOUTHEAST 1/3 MILE TO THE STATION.  GATE KEYS MAY BE OBTAINED FROM MR. TOM TRIBBIT (653-9741), MR. BILL DUPONT AND MR. LEWIS EDGEL (653-7416) OWN PROPERTY OVER WHICH THE ACCESS ROAD PASSES.
markers.setting: OBJECT DRIVEN INTO GROUND
markers.stability: MARK OF QUESTIONABLE OR UNKNOWN STABILITY

markers.description: BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1935 (JB) STATION IS LOCATED ON THE SOUTHWESTERN ARC CORNER BETWEEN PA. AND DEL. ABOUT 3 MILES N BY W OF NEWARK, DEL.  STATION MARK IS A MONOLITHIC GRANITE SHAFT, 5 FEET HIGH AND 12 INCHES SQUARE AT THE TOP, MARKED IN TOP WITH AN ANGLE WITHIN A CIRCLE, THE ANGLE SHOWING THE DIRECTIONS OF THE STATE LINES.  IT IS IN A SMALL FIELD 30 METERS DUE S OF THE INTERSECTION OF TWO DIRT ROADS.  REFERENCE AND AZIMUTH MARKS ARE STANDARD BRONZE DISKS SET IN CONCRETE AS DESCRIBED IN NOTE 11A.  REFERENCE MARK NO.1 IS 25.343 METERS (80.15 FEET) NNE OF STATION, 3 PACES N OF CENTER OF ROAD.  IT PROJECTS 8 INCHES.  REFERENCE MARK NO.2 IS 21.500 METERS (70.54 FEET) E OF STATION ON FENCE LINE 4 PACES S OF CENTER OF ROAD.  IT PROJECTS 8 INCHES.  AZIMUTH MARK IS 0.9 MILE N BY W OF STATION ON W SIDE OF LANE WHICH LEADS DIRECTLY FROM STATION TO MARK, 57 PACES S OF A MACADAM ROAD, 6 PACES W OF CENTER OF LANE, 1 FOOT E OF FENCE AND IN SLOPE OF LOW CUT BANK.  IT PROJECTS 6 INCHES.  TO REACH FROM OXFORD, PA., GO E ON U.S. HIGHWAY 1 FOR 4.3 MILES TO MACADAM T-ROAD RIGHT, TURN RIGHT AND GO 0.8 MILE TO FORK, BEAR RIGHT AND GO 1.3 MILES ALONG MAIN-TRAVELED ROAD TO ROUTE 796.  FOLLOW ROUTE 796 S FOR 7.9 MILES TO PA.-MD. LINE, CONTINUE STRAIGHT AHEAD 0.6 MILE TO DIRT T-ROAD LEFT, JUST BEYOND RED BRICK HOUSE, TURN LEFT AND GO 0.6 MILE TO CROSS ROAD AND STATION ON RIGHT.  A 100-FOOT TOWER WAS USED.  NO CUTS VISIBLE FROM GROUND.  POSITION CHECKS WITH INITIAL POINT, 1892.                            STATION RECOVERY (1983)  RECOVERY NOTE BY US POWER SQUADRON 1983 (JLM) STATION RECOVERED GOOD.  ALL FOUND.  MET STATE OF DELAWARE SURVEYING PARTY LOOKING FOR MARKS - EXCHANGED DATA 1ST SIDE FIELD WORK EXECUTED BY US COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 2ND SIDE DELAWARE THOMAS EBAYARD JOHN H. HOFFECKER B L LEWIS MD COMMISSIONERS DANIEL FARRA SURVEYOR.  3RD SIDE 1892 4TH SIDE PENNSYLVANIA.                            STATION RECOVERY (2001)  RECOVERY NOTE BY US POWER SQUADRON 2001 (SAL) RM 1 NOT FOUND.  FOUND CEMENT BASE NEARBY WITHOUTH DISK ON IT. RM 2 NOT FOUND.  WOODEN FOOT BRIDGE NOW COVERS THIS AREA. AZ MARK FOUND IN POOR CONDITION.  NOTE 0.7 MILE NORTHWEST OF STATION. AZ MARK BASE SEEMS TO HAVE BEEN HIT WITH PLOW AND ACCURACY MAY BE IN DOUBT.                              STATION RECOVERY (2003)  RECOVERY NOTE BY US POWER SQUADRON 2003 (RBG) RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION.                            STATION RECOVERY (2008)  RECOVERY NOTE BY GEOCACHING 2008 (EK) NEW TO-REACH IS AS FOLLOWS - FROM PA ROUTE 896 AT THE PA-MD LINE, CONTINUE AHEAD, SE FOR 0.6 MILE TO HOPKINS BRIDGE ROAD RUNNING NE, TURN LEFT AND PROCEED 0.6 MILE TO THE STATION ON THE RIGHT AT THE CROSSING OF A DIM WOODS ROAD.                            STATION RECOVERY (2010)  RECOVERY NOTE BY GEOCACHING 2010 (LPC) RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION.                            STATION RECOVERY (2013)  RECOVERY NOTE BY DELAWARE COASTAL PROGRAM 2013 RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION.                            STATION RECOVERY (2018)  RECOVERY NOTE BY BASE 9 GEODETIC CONSULTING SERVICE 2018 (DRD) RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION.

BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1932 (CDM) STATION IS LOCATED AT SW CORNER OF DELAWARE AND AT THE S END OF N-S LINE BETWEEN DELAWARE AND MARYLAND.  MARK IS SET IN THE TOP OF THE LARGER STONE MONUMENT, WHICH IS A POST ABOUT 1-1/2 FEET SQUARE AND THREE FEET HIGH, AROUND WHICH WAS POURED CONCRETE TO ASSURE ITS PERMANENCY.  STONE HAS NO INSCRIPTION ON IT, BUT HAS TWO DIFFERENT COATS-OF-ARMS ON IT.  STATION MARK IS STANDARD BRONZE DISK WEDGED IN DRILL HOLE IN BOULDER, AS DESCRIBED.  REFERENCE MARKS ARE STANDARD BRONZE DISKS SET IN CONCRETE, AS DESCRIBED.  REFERENCE MARK NO.1 IS 1/2 MILE E OF STATION, ABOUT 5 METERS S OF CENTER LINE OF ROAD, 2 FEET S OF TELEPHONE POLE NO.149.  REFERENCE MARK NO.2 IS S OF STATION, ABOUT 5 METERS N OF CENTER LINE OF ROAD, AND 5 METERS E OF TELEPHONE POLE NO.87.  REFERENCE MARK NO.3 IS SW OF STATION, ABOUT 5 METERS N OF CENTER LINE OF ROAD, AND 2 FEET E OF TELEPHONE POLE NO.88.  TO REACH GO NW FROM SALISBURY, MARYLAND, ON HIGHWAY 213, PASS DEL-MAR-VA AIRPORT AT 7.3 MILES, TURN E ON A DIRT ROAD AT 8.5 MILES.  STATION IS ABOUT 0.3 MILE E OF THE JUNCTION OF THIS ROAD AND THE ROAD LEADING TO DELMAR, DELAWARE, LOCATED 101 FEET N OF THE CENTER LINE OF THIS ROAD.  HEIGHT OF SIGNAL ABOVE STATION MARK - 38 METERS.                            STATION RECOVERY (1932)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1932 RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION.                            STATION RECOVERY (1934)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1934 (JB) STATION WAS RECOVERED AS DESCRIBED.  ALL MARKS FOUND IN GOOD CONDITION.  DISTANCE TO REFERENCE MARK NO.3 COULD NOT BE MEASURED AS IT WAS ON THE OTHER SIDE OF A CORN FIELD.  TO CLEAR THIS LINE WOULD CAUSE CONSIDERABLE DESTRUCTION TO CORN CROP.  MARKS STAMPED MD.-DEL. CORNER - 1932.  NO PROMINENT OBJECTS VISIBLE FROM GROUND.  A 103-FOOT TOWER WILL CLEAR ALL LINES OBSERVED.                            STATION RECOVERY (1941)  RECOVERY NOTE BY MD BUR SURV AND MAPS 1941 (CBK) LETTER OF MR. C.B. KEGARICE, BUREAU OF CONTROL SURVEYS AND MAPS, UNIVERSITY OF MARYLAND, COLLEGE PARK, MD., DATED 6/9/42--  DUE TO ROAD CONSTRUCTION IT WAS NECESSARY TO MOVE R.M.S 2 AND 3.  THESE REFERENCE MARKS APPEARED TO HAVE BEEN DISTURBED, THEREFORE IT WAS NOT POSSIBLE TO MOVE THEM ON LINE TO THE TRIANGULATION STATION.  THE STATION MARK WAS NOT DISTURBED.  REFERENCE MARK 2 WAS MOVED ON LINE, AS FOUND, 10.0 FEET TOWARD THE STATION.  IT WAS RESET 27 FEET N OF CENTER OF ROADWAY, 74.95 FEET FROM THE STATION.  REFERENCE MARK 3 WAS RESET 29 FEET N OF CENTER LINE OF HIGHWAY, 179.01 FEET FROM THE STATION, AND 156.36 FEET FROM THE NEW LOCATION OF R.M. 2.  ANGLES CLOCKWISE--  AT STATION MARK--  R.M. 2 TO R.M. 3 60 DEG 30 MIN 10 SEC  AT R.M. 2--  R.M. 3 TO STATION 94 DEG 50 MIN 20 SEC  AT R.M. 3--  STATION MARK TO R.M. 2 24 DEG 39 MIN 30 SEC                            STATION RECOVERY (1942)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1942 (WDP) THE FOLLOWING DISCREPANCIES WERE NOTED IN THE FIELD WITH ORIGINAL DESCRIPTION--  (1) TELEPHONE POLE 149 HAS BEEN REMOVED.  (2) 8 METERS N OF CENTER LINE OF ROAD, NOT 5 METERS (REFERENCE MARK NO.3).  (3) 26 METERS W OF TELEPHONE POLE NO.87, NOT 2 FEET E OF TELEPHONE POLE NO.88.  (4) REFERENCE MARK NO.3 IS LOCATED 179.05 FEET SW OF THE STATION, NOT 188.2 FEET (REFERENCE MARK NO.3 WAS MOVED WHEN THE ROAD WAS REBUILT).  (5) REFERENCE MARK NO.2 IS LOCATED 74.97 FEET S OF THE STATION, NOT 84.95 FEET (REFERENCE MARK NO.2 WAS MOVED WHEN THE ROAD WAS REBUILT).  THIS STATION IS LOCATED IN THE SW CORNER OF DELAWARE, AND AT THE S END OF THE N-S LINE BETWEEN DELAWARE AND MARYLAND, 101 FEET N OF THE CENTER LINE OF THE ROAD LEADING TO DELMAR.  THE STATION IS A BRONZE DISK, STAMPED MD.-DEL. CORNER 1932, SET IN THE TOP OF A 1 1/2-FOOT SQUARE SANDSTONE BLOCK (WHICH HAS CONCRETE POURED AROUND IT TO INSURE ITS PERMANENCY) WHICH EXTENDS 3 FEET ABOVE THE GROUND.  THE STATION IS IN GOOD CONDITION.  REFERENCE MARK NO.1 IS LOCATED 1/2 MILE E OF THE STATION AND IS 4 METERS S OF THE CENTER LINE OF THE ROAD.  THE MARK IS A BRONZE DISK, WITH THE ARROW POINTING TOWARD THE STATION, STAMPED MD.-DEL. CORNER NO.1, 1932, SET IN THE TOP OF A 12-INCH SQUARE CONCRETE MONUMENT, WHICH IS FLUSH WITH THE GROUND.  THE MONUMENT HAS BEEN CHIPPED BY A ROAD GRADER, BUT IS IN GOOD CONDITION.  REFERENCE MARK NO.2 IS LOCATED 74.97 FEET S OF THE STATION, 7 METERS N OF THE CENTER LINE OF THE ROAD.  THE MARK IS A BRONZE DISK, WITH THE ARROW POINTING TOWARD THE STATION, STAMPED MD.-DEL. CORNER NO.2 1932, SET IN THE TOP OF A 12-INCH SQUARE MONUMENT, WHICH EXTENDS 1 INCH ABOVE THE GROUND.  THE MARK IS IN GOOD CONDITION.  REFERENCE MARK NO.3 IS LOCATED 179.05 FEET SW OF THE STATION, 8 METERS N OF THE CENTER LINE OF THE ROAD AND 26 METERS W OF TELEPHONE POLE NO.87.  THE MARK IS A BRONZE DISK, WITH THE ARROW, POINTING TOWARD THE STATION, STAMPED MD.-DEL. CORNER NO.3 1932, SET IN THE TOP OF A 12-INCH SQUARE CONCRETE MONUMENT, WHICH EXTENDS 5 INCHES ABOVE THE GROUND.  THE MARK IS IN GOOD CONDITION.  TO REACH THE STATION FROM SALISBURY, TAKE ROUTE 213 NW, AT 8.5 MILES TURN E ON A DIRT ROAD (1.2 MILES BEYOND DEL.-MAR.-VA. AIRPORT) AND FOLLOW THIS ROAD 0.9 MILE TO THE JUNCTION OF THIS ROAD AND THE ROAD LEADING TO DELMAR, THEN PROCEED E 0.3 MILE TO THE STATION.  THE STATION IS LOCATED 101 FEET N OF THE CENTER LINE OF THE ROAD.                            STATION RECOVERY (1962)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1962 (RWT) STATION MARK, REFERENCE MARK 2 AND 3 WERE RECOVERED AND FOUND IN GOOD CONDITION.  THE AZIMUTH MARK WAS RECOVERED AND FOUND TO HAVE BEEN HIT BY ROAD MACHINERY AND THE DISK HAD BEEN KNOCKED OUT.  THE ABOVE OBSERVATIONS WERE MADE BY PLACING ANOTHER DISK IN THE HOLE TO HOLD THE OLD POINT.  THIS AZIMUTH MARK WAS REPLACED BY A NEW MARK TO MD-DEL CORNER RM 4 AS THE OLD STATION CAN NEVER BE OCCUPIED AGAIN DUE TO SHELTER ERECTED OVER THE MONUMENT AND STATION.  THE NEW DISTANCE AND DIRECTIONS CHECKED WITH THE PREVIOUS DATA.  REFERENCE MARK 2 HAS BEEN COVERED OVER BY FILL IT IS ABOUT 12 INCHES BELOW THE SURFACE OF THE GROUND.  THE STATION IS THE U.S.C. AND G.S. DISK SET IN THE TOP AND THE APPROXIMATE CENTER OF THE MONUMENT.  IT IS LOCATED ABOUT 6-1/2 MILES EAST OF DELMAR, 6.0 MILES SOUTH OF SHARPTOWN AND 3-1/2 MILES WEST OF MARDELA SPRINGS, MARYLAND AND ON PROPERTY OWNED BY THE STATES.  IT IS A SAND STONE MONUMENT WITH THE COAT OF ARMS ON ALL FOUR SIDES OF THE MONUMENT.  IT PROJECTS ABOUT 30 INCHES ABOVE THE SURFACE OF THE GROUND.  THE DISK IS STAMPED MD DEL CORNER 1932, IS LEANING TO THE SOUTH AND HAS CONCRETE POURED AROUND THE BASE TO INSURE THE PERMANENCY OF THE MONUMENT.  IT HAS A 12 X 12 FOOT SHELTER ERECTED OVER THE MONUMENT.  IT IS 101.0 FEET NORTH OF THE APPROXIMATE CENTER OF STATE HIGHWAY 467.  THE SHELTER HAS FOUR 12 X 12 INCH SQUARE RED BRICK COLUMNS AND HAS A CONICAL SHAPED ROOF PAINTED BLACK AND WHITE.  A TRAVERSE CONNECTION WAS MADE TO TRIANGULATION MD DEL CORNER RM 4, DISTANCE BEING (30.876 FEET) AND 9.411 METERS EAST OF STATION MD DEL CORNER RM 4.  HEIGHT OF LIGHT ABOVE STATION MARK 31 METERS.                            STATION RECOVERY (1974)  RECOVERY NOTE BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 1974 (LAL) THE MONUMENT IS LOCATED ABOUT 6.0 MILES WEST OF DELMAR AND AT THE SOUTHWEST CORNER OF DELAWARE AND AT THE SOUTH END OF THE NORTH AND SOUTH LINE BETWEEN DELAWARE-MARYLAND.  THE MARK, A SAND STONE MONUMENT WITH THE COAT OF ARMS ON THE NORTH AND SOUTH SIDES OF THE MONUMENT AND ALSO ON THE EAST AND WEST SIDE.  IT HAS A U.S.C. AND G.S. TRIANGULATION DISK CEMENTED IN THE TOP, STAMPED MD DEL CORNER 1932.  THE MONUMENT IS BROKE AT THE BASE AND LEANING TO THE SOUTH.  IT HAS A 12 BY 12 FOOT SHELTER ERECTED OVER THE MONUMENT.  THIS PARTY HAS NO DATA ON THE MONUMENTS THAT ARE ESTABLISHED TO THE NORTH OF BOUNDARY MONUMENT 0.  THEY ARE TWO SMALL MONUMENTS THAT PROJECTS 2 FEET ABOVE THE GROUND SURFACE.  ONE MONUMENT IS 3.8 FEET NORTH AND THE OTHER MONUMENT IS 2.8 FEET NORTH-NORTHEAST.  AIRLINE DISTANCE AND DIRECTION FROM NEAREST TOWN 6 MILES WEST OF DELMAR, DELAWARE.                            STATION RECOVERY (1974)  RECOVERY NOTE BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 1974 (LAL) THE STATION MARK WAS RECOVERED AND FOUND TO BE LEANING TO THE SOUTH, REFERENCE MARKS 2, 3 AND THE AZIMUTH MARK WERE RECOVERED AND FOUND IN GOOD CONDITION AS DESCRIBED IN 1962.  THE STATION MARK, A STANDARD DISK STAMPED MD DEL CORNER 1932, IS CEMENTED IN A DRILL HOLE IN THE TOP OF BOUNDARY MONUMENT NUMBER 0 OR 35-B THAT PROJECTS 30 INCHES ABOVE THE GROUND SURFACE.  IT HAS A 12 BY 12 FOOT SHELTER ERECTED OVER THE MONUMENT.  IT IS 3.8 FEET SOUTH OF MONUMENT 35-A, WHICH WAS ESTABLISHED IN 1760.  NO DATA AVAILABLE TO CHECK THE HORIZONTAL DIRECTIONS OR DISTANCE TO THE MARKS.  FOR ADDITIONAL INFORMATION SEE DESCRIPTION MD DEL CORNER 1932 RM 4.  AIRLINE DISTANCE AND DIRECTION FROM NEAREST TOWN 6 MILES WEST OF DELMAR, DELAWARE. AIRLINE DISTANCE AND DIRECTION FROM NEAREST TOWN 6 MILES WEST OF DELMAR.                            STATION RECOVERY (1985)  RECOVERY NOTE BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 1985 THE MONUMENT IS LOCATED ABOUT 6.0 MILES WEST OF DELMAR AND AT THE SOUTHWEST CORNER OF DELAWARE AND AT THE SOUTH END OF THE NORTH AND SOUTH LINE BETWEEN DELAWARE-MARYLAND. THE OLD MASON-DIXON MONUMENT WAS FOUND BROKEN OFF AT ITS BASE.  THE MONUMENT WAS RESET ON ITS ORIGINAL BASE AT THIS DATE.  IT WAS ATTACHED WITH A SPECIAL CEMENT SUPPLIED BY THE MARYLAND-DELEWARE BOUNDARY COMMISIONS.  CARE WAS TAKEN TO ASSURE THE PRECISE POSITION OF THE DISK IN THE TOP OF THE MONUMENT.  ALL INDICATIONS ARE THAT THE DISK AND MONUMENT ARE WITHIN 0.001 M (0.0 FT) OF ITS ORIGINAL LOCATION.  THE STATION IS NOW IN A STEEL BAR CAGE AND ACCESS CAN ONLY BE OBTAINED FROM ONE OF THE FOLLOWING LOCATIONS.  MR. ROBERT JORDAN, DELEWARE BOUNDARY COMMISION, DELEWARE GEOLOGICAL SURVEY, DELEWARE UNIVERSITY, 101 PENNY HALL, NEWARK, DELEWARE, 19711, TELEPHONE NUMBER 302-451-2833.  MR. KENNETH WEAVER, MARYLAND BOUNDARY COMMISION, MARYLAND GEOLOGICAL SURVEY, THE ROTUNDA SUITE 440, BALTIMORE, MARYLAND, 21211, TELEPHONE NUMBER 301-338-7084.  MARYLAND STATE HIGHWAY ADMINISTRATION, SALISBURY DISTRICT ONE OFFICE, SALISBURY, MARYLAND, TELEPHONE NUMBER 301-543-6715. THE AZIMUTH MARK WAS POSITIONED AT THIS DATE, SEE DESCRIPTION THEREOF. REFERENCE MARK TWO WAS FOUND IN GOOD CONDITION, HOWEVER A SHORTER DISTANCE WAS NOTED TO IT.  THE HORIZONTAL ANGLE FROM THE AZIMUTH MARK TO IT WAS WITHIN CLOSE AGREEMENT. REFERENCE MARK THREE WAS FOUND BUT BEEN HIT AND DAMAGED.  IT IS NOW SOLID AND IN FAIR CONDITION.  NO CHECK WAS ATTEMPED TO BE MADE TO IT. markers.description: BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1934 (JB) THE STATION IS A SQUARE SANDSTONE MONUMENT PROJECTING 24 INCHES ABOVE GROUND, A CROSS CUT IN TOP MARKS THE STATION.  THIS SECOND-ORDER STATION IS APPROXIMATELY 150 YARDS W OF CANNING FACTORY, 54.3 FEET WNW OF A 40-INCH OAK TREE, 32.6 FEET NE OF THE CENTER LINE OF THE MAIN RAILROAD TRACK, AND 2.05 FEET NE OF A MARYLAND-DELAWARE BOUNDARY MARKER.  THE STATION MARKER HAS AN M ON ITS W SIDE AND A P ON ITS E SIDE.  THE MARYLAND-DELAWARE BOUNDARY MARKER IS THUS MARKED P B AND W R R -- V.S. 3 - MARYLAND -- CAROLINE CO. ON THE W SIDE AND P B AND W R R -- V.S. 1 -- DELAWARE -- SUSSEX CO. ON THE E SIDE.  THE BOUNDARY MARKER PROJECTS ABOUT 4 FEET ABOVE GROUND.  REFERENCE MARKS ARE STANDARD BRONZE DISKS SET IN CONCRETE .  REFERENCE MARK NO.1 IS 240.26 FEET NE OF THE STATION, AND 1 FOOT W OF A CORNER FENCE POST.  THE MARK PROJECTS 6 INCHES ABOVE GROUND AND IS STAMPED OAK GROVE NO.1 1934.  REFERENCE MARK NO.2 IS 146.69 FEET E OF THE STATION, 66.15 FEET SW OF A 12-INCH OAK TREE, AND 3.67 FEET WNW OF THE NW CORNER OF A BRICK HOUSE OCCUPIED BY EMPLOYEES OF A CANNING FACTORY.  THE MARK PROJECTS 6 INCHES ABOVE GROUND AND IS STAMPED OAK GROVE NO.2 1934. REFERENCE MARK NO.3, AZIMUTH MARK, IS APPROXIMATELY 0.5 MILE SW OF THE STATION, APPROXIMATELY 100 YARDS SE OF A WHITE 2-STORY FRAME HOUSE, ABOUT 3 PACES S OF THE CENTER LINE OF THE DIRT ROAD, AND 1 PACE E OF TELEPHONE POLE NO. 27.  THE MARK PROJECTS 6 INCHES ABOVE GROUND AND IS STAMPED OAK GROVE 3 1934.  TO REACH THE STATION FROM THE BRIDGE OVER THE NANTICOKE RIVER ON U.S. HIGHWAY 13 AT SEAFORD GO N ON U.S. HIGHWAY 13 FOR ABOUT 0.5 MILE TO A Y-ROAD WHICH IS THE JUNCTION OF STATE HIGHWAY 20, TURN LEFT (W) ON STATE HIGHWAY 20 FOR ABOUT 4.7 MILES TO A T-ROAD N AND A PYROL GASOLINE SIGN IN THE NW ANGLE, TURN RIGHT (N) ON A TAR ROAD FOR ABOUT 1.5 MILES TO A RAILROAD CROSSING, TURN LEFT ON THE N SIDE OF THE CROSSING AND FOLLOW A DIRT ROAD ALONG THE TRACK FOR ABOUT 0.2 MILE TO THE STATION.  A 103-FOOT TOWER WILL CLEAR ALL LINES OBSERVED.                            STATION RECOVERY (1962)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1962 (RWT) THE STATION MARK, REFERENCE MARKS 1, 2, AND 3 WAS RECOVERED AS DESCRIBED AND IN GOOD CONDITION.  A BUILDING IS NOW ON LINE TO REFERENCE MARK 2 AND COULD NOT BE MEASURED TO BUT WAS OBSERVED TO.  REFERENCE MARK 4 WAS ESTABLISHED.  IT IS LOCATED 2.7 FEET NORTH OF A TELEPHONE POLE, 19.2 FEET SOUTHWEST OF THE APPROXIMATE CENTER OF THE RAILROAD TRACKS AND 55.2 FEET SOUTHWEST OF THE SOUTHWEST CORNER OF A CINDER BLOCK BUILDING. A CROSS MARK IS SCRIBED ON THE APEX OF THE MONUMENT AND USED FOR TRIANGULATION STATION OAK GROVE 1934.  THE MONUMENT WAS RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION.  IT IS LOCATED 2.05 FEET NORTHEAST OF THE CAROLINE-SUSSEX COUNTY LINE MARKER, 32.6 FEET NORTHEAST OF THE APPROXIMATE CENTER OF THE RAILROAD TRACKS, 54.3 FEET WEST-NORTHWEST OF A 40-INCH OAK TREE, 150 YARDS WEST OF A CANNING FACTORY, 2.0 MILES NORTH OF RELIANCE, 4-1/2 MILES SOUTHEAST OF FEDERALSBURG, 5-3/4 MILES WEST-NORTHWEST OF SEAFORD AND ON PROPERTY OWNED BY W AND R KIRWIN OF CAMBRIDGE, MARYLAND. markers.description: BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 1981 THE POSITION OF THIS MONUMENT WAS SELECTED AND TEMPORARILY MARKED DURING A JOINT MEETING BETWEEN THE NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY, THE STATE OF MARYLAND AND THE STATE OF DELAWARE ON AUGUST 26, 1980.  IT WAS AGREED THAT MONUMENT 30 SHOULD BE PLACED IN THE SOUTH EDGE OF AN EAST-WEST PAVED ROAD AND COVERED WITH A STEEL MANHOLE.  THE TEMPORARY POINT WAS MARKED AND REFERENCED ON AUGUST 26, 1980, AND A PERMANENT MONUMENT WAS ESTABLISHED ON JUNE 24, 1981 AS DESCRIBED IN THIS TEXT. THE MONUMENT IS LOCATED APPROXIMATELY 7-1/2 MILES NORTH-NORTHWEST OF SALISBURY, 1-1/4 MILES WEST OF DELMAR, AND 1/2 MILE SOUTH OF STATE HIGHWAY 54.  IT IS ON ROAD RIGHT-OF-WAY. TO REACH FROM A POINT WHERE STATE HIGHWAY 54 CROSSES A RAILROAD IN DELMAR, GO WEST ON STATE HIGHWAY 54 FOR 0.2 MILE (0.3 KM) TO A FORK. KEEP LEFT AND CONTINUE WEST ON WALLER ROAD FOR 0.35 MILE (0.56 KM) TO A FORK.  KEEP RIGHT AND CONTINUE WEST ON A PAVED ROAD FOR 0.75 MILE (1.21 KM) TO THE MONUMENT ON THE LEFT. THE SURFACE MARK IS A STANDARD MARYLAND-DELAWARE BOUNDARY DISK STAMPED E-W NO. 30 1981, SET IN THE TOP OF A 14-INCH SQUARE CONCRETE MONUMENT WHICH IS 20 INCHES BELOW THE ROAD SURFACE.  THE SUB-SURFACE MARK IS A STANDARD NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY HORIZONTAL CONTROL STATION DISK STAMPED E-W NO. 30 1981, SET IN THE TOP OF AN 8-INCH MASS OF CONCRETE WHICH IS 4.6 FEET (1.4 M) BELOW THE SURFACE OF THE ROAD. THE MONUMENT IS COVERED WITH A 26-INCH STEEL MANHOLE INSCRIBED -SANITARY SEWER-. THE MONUMENT IS 63.3 FEET (19.3 M) WEST OF THE WEST END OF A 48 INCH CULVERT ALONG THE SOUTH SIDE OF THE ROAD, 34.8 FEET (10.6 M) SOUTH-SOUTHWEST OF A 16 INCH OAK TREE WITH A TRIANGULAR BLAZE, 25.4 FEET (7.7 M) SOUTH-SOUTHWEST OF A WITNESS POST, 10.6 FEET (3.2 M) NORTH-NORTHWEST OF ANOTHER WITNESS POST, 9 FEET (2.7 M) SOUTH OF THE CENTER OF THE ROAD, AND 7.9 FEET (2.4 M) NORTH OF A POWERLINE POLE NUMBERED 46798 96468.  FOR ADDITIONAL INFORMATION SEE THE DESCRIPTION FOR STATION CONNELLY 2.                            STATION RECOVERY (1989)  RECOVERY NOTE BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 1989 0.5 KM (0.31 MI) WESTERLY ALONG WALLER ROAD FROM ITS JUNCTION WITH STATE HIGHWAY 54 IN DELMAR, THENCE 1.1 KM (0.68 MI) WESTERLY ALONG A PAVED ROAD, 25.5 M (83.66 FT) WEST OF THE EXTENDED CENTER OF A TRACK ROAD, 2.7 M (8.86 FT) SOUTH OF THE CENTER OF THE ROAD, 2.6 M (8.53 FT) NORTH OF A WITNESS POST, 2.4 M (7.87 FT) NORTH OF UTILITY POLE NUMBER 40F 20, AND IN A CONCRETE MONUMENT THAT IS 0.5 M (1.64 FT) BELOW THE ROAD SURFACE.  NOTE--ACCESS TO THE MONUMENT IS THROUGH A 26-INCH MANHOLE COVER PRECAST -SANITARY SEWER-.

markers.description: BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 1981 THE COMPUTED POSITION OF THIS MONUMENT WAS FOUND TO BE IN THE EDGE OF A WATER FILLED AREA.  A NEW POINT WAS SELECTED ON THE BOUNDARY AND ON A STRAIGHT LINE BETWEEN THE OLD BOUNDARY MONUMENT 32 AND HORIZONTAL CONTROL STATION DUMP 1974. THE MARKER IS LOCATED 3-1/2 MILES WEST OF DELMAR, 3-1/2 MILES NORTH OF HEBRON, AND IN THE NORTHWEST EDGE OF THE WICOMICO COUNTY SANITARY LAND FILL COMPLEX. TO REACH FROM A POINT WHERE STATE HIGHWAY 54 CROSSES THE RAILROAD IN DELMAR, GO WEST ON STATE HIGHWAY 54 FOR 0.2 MILE (0.3 KM) TO A FORK. KEEP LEFT AND CONTINUE WEST ON WALLER ROAD FOR 0.35 MILE (0.56 KM) TO A FORK.  KEEP LEFT AND FOLLOW WALLER ROAD SOUTHWEST AND WEST FOR 3.6 MILES (5.8 KM) TO A SIDE ROAD RIGHT AND A GATE ON THE RIGHT. TURN RIGHT AND GO NORTH ON A SAND ROAD PICKING WAY THROUGH THE DUMP FOR 0.3 MILE (0.5 KM) TO THE MOST NORTHWEST CORNER OF THE DUMP AND THE MONUMENT IN A WOODED AREA WHICH SEPARATES THE DUMP FROM CULTIVATED FIELDS. THE SURFACE MARKER IS A STANDARD MARYLAND-DELAWARE BOUNDARY DISK STAMPED E-W NO. 32 1981, SET IN THE TOP OF A 10-INCH ROUND CONCRETE MONUMENT WHICH PROJECTS 4 INCHES.  THE SUB-SURFACE MARKER IS A STANDARD NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY HORIZONTAL CONTROL STATION DISK STAMPED E-W NO. 32 1981, SET IN A 6-INCH MASS OF CONCRETE WHICH IS 3.2 FEET (1.0 M) BELOW THE SURFACE. THE MARK IS 44 FEET (13.4 M) NORTH OF THE CENTER OF A DIM EAST-WEST SAND ROAD, 25 FEET (7.6 M) WEST OF THE WEST EDGE OF A WATER FILLED SWAMP, 24.0 FEET (7.3 M) WEST-NORTHWEST OF A 6-INCH SQUARE CONCRETE BOUNDARY MARKER FOR THE DUMP, AND 2.5 FEET (0.8 M) EAST OF A WITNESS POST. markers.description: BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 1981 THE COMPUTED POSITION OF THIS BOUNDARY MONUMENT WAS FOUND TO BE IN A CULTIVATED FIELD.  THE STATES OF MARYLAND AND DELAWARE AGREED THAT THE MONUMENT WOULD BE IN A MUCH SAFER LOCATION IF IT WERE PLACED UNDER A MANHOLE IN THE WEST PART OF SPRING HILL LANE. THE MARKER IS LOCATED ABOUT 2-1/2 MILES NORTH OF HEBRON, AND 4-1/2 MILES WEST OF DELMAR.  IT IS ON THE ROAD RIGHT-OF-WAY. TO REACH FROM A POINT WHERE STATE HIGHWAY 54 CROSSES A RAILROAD IN DELMAR, GO WEST ON STATE HIGHWAY 54 FOR 0.2 MILE (0.3 KM) TO A FORK. KEEP LEFT AND CONTINUE WEST ON WALLER ROAD FOR 0.35 MILE (0.56 KM) TO A FORK.  KEEP LEFT AND FOLLOW WALLER ROAD SOUTHWEST AND WEST FOR 4.5 MILES (7.2 KM) TO A T-INTERSECTION AND STATION BRADLEY AZ MK 2 ON THE LEFT.  TURN RIGHT AND GO NORTH ON SPRING HILL LANE FOR 0.3 MILE (0.5 KM) TO THE MONUMENT ON THE LEFT. THE SURFACE MARKER IS A MARYLAND-DELAWARE BOUNDARY DISK STAMPED E-W NO. 33 1981, SET IN THE TOP OF A 11-1/2 INCH SQUARE CONCRETE MONUMENT WHICH IS 13 INCHES BELOW THE SURFACE OF SPRING HILL LANE.  THE SUB-SURFACE MARKER IS A STANDARD NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY HORIZONTAL CONTROL STATION DISK STAMPED E-W NO. 33 1981, SET IN THE TOP OF A 12- INCH SQUARE BLOCK OF CONCRETE WHICH IS 4.5 FEET (1.4 M) BELOW THE SURFACE OF THE ROAD.  THE MONUMENT IS COVERED BY A 26-INCH ROUND MARYLAND STATE HIGHWAY ADMINISTRATION MANHOLE COVER WITH - SHA - INSCRIBED ON THE TOP. THE MONUMENT IS 94.0 FEET (28.7 M) NORTHEAST OF THE NORTHEAST CORNER OF A HOUSE OWNED BY MRS. MYRA BRADLEY, 44 FEET (13.4 M) NORTH OF THE CENTER OF A DRIVE LEADING TO THE BRADLEY HOUSE, 38.5 FEET (11.7 M) NORTHEAST OF A POWERLINE POLE NUMBERED 45058 96562 D9 Z2, AND 7.5 FEET (2.3 M) WEST OF THE CENTER OF SPRING HILL LANE. markers.description: BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1968 (JCB) BOUNDARY MONUMENT NO. 45 WAS RECOVERED AS DESCRIBED AND FOUND TO BE IN GOOD CONDITION.  THE 1961 SURVEY SHOWED THE BOUNDARY MONUMENT TO BE APPROXIMATELY 5 FEET EAST OF THE STATE BOUNDARY.  AT THE REQUEST OF THE MARYDEL, DELAWARE CIVIC CLUB, THE MARK WAS RESET ON THE STATE LINE IN MAY 1968, AFTER PERMISSION WAS OBTAINED FROM OFFICIALS OF MARYLAND AND DELAWARE.  THE MONUMENT WAS MOVED 1.834 METERS ON LINE TO STATION TOWN 1961 AND NORTH 10.473 METERS ALONG THE STATE LINE.                            STATION RECOVERY (2007)  RECOVERY NOTE BY GEOCACHING 2007 (WD) RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION.                            STATION RECOVERY (2008)  RECOVERY NOTE BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 2008 (DRD) RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION.

BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1932 (CDM) LOCATED ON MARYLAND-DELAWARE BOUNDARY LINE ABOUT 1.2 MILES NE OF TEMPLEVILLE, MARYLAND, AND 0.1 MILE SE OF HIGHWAY LEADING FROM TEMPLEVILLE, MARYLAND, TO HARTLY, DELAWARE, ON PROPERTY OWNED AND OCCUPIED BY MR. FRED MASKE.  STATION IS MARKED BY A REGULATION STATION DISK SET IN THE TOP OF SAND STONE BOUNDARY MONUMENT 12 INCHES SQUARE AND ABOUT 2-1/2 OR 3 FEET ABOVE GROUND.  WHEN ORIGINALLY VISITED, THIS MONUMENT WAS VERY UNSTEADY, BUT OWNER STATED THAT A SURVEY WHICH HAD BEEN MADE SHOWED THAT STONE WAS IN ITS CORRECT POSITION.  POSITION OF STONE WAS HELD FIXED.  IT WAS THEN DUG OUT AND UNDERGROUND MARK WAS SET.  THE MONUMENT WAS THEN SET IN ITS ORIGINAL POSITION AND REINFORCED BY CONCRETE PLACED AROUND BASE.  IT IS NOW VERY STEADY.  ON ONE FACE OF STONE, THERE IS AN M, AND ON OPPOSITE FACE IS A P.  AT ONE TIME THIS PART OF DELAWARE WAS PART OF PENNSYLVANIA.  STATION IS IN OPEN FIELD JUST SW OF MR. MASKES HOUSE 26.2 METERS SW OF SW CORNER OF HOUSE, 15.8 METERS WSW OF MAPLE TREE IN FRONT OF HOUSE.  UNDERGROUND AND REFERENCE MARKS ARE STANDARD BRONZE DISKS SET IN CONCRETE.  REFERENCE MARK NO.1 IS SE OF STATION AT NW CORNER OF CHICKEN HOUSE.  REFERENCE MARK NO.2 IS IN FENCE LINE ON W SIDE OF FIELD, SW OF STATION, 6.7 METERS S OF 12-INCH CEDAR TREE IN FENCE LINE.  REFERENCE MARK NO.3 IS WSW OF STATION, 6 METERS SE OF CENTER LINE OF HIGHWAY, AT NE END OF ENTRANCE TO LANE, 1 METER NE OF 8-INCH LEANING CEDAR TREE WHICH IS THE NE GATEPOST OF GATE TO LANE.  FROM TEMPLEVILLE, MARYLAND, TAKE PAVED ROAD TO HARTLY 1.2 MILES NE TO STATE LINE, THEN RIGHT OR SE 0.1 MILE TO MR. MASKES HOUSE AND STATION.  HEIGHT OF SIGNAL ABOVE STATION MARK - 34 METERS.                            STATION RECOVERY (1942)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1942 (CS) THIS MARK IS ABOUT 1.2 MILES SW ALONG HIGHWAY 11 FROM THE INTERSECTION AT WRIGHTS CROSSROADS, ON THE STATE LINE BETWEEN DELAWARE AND MARYLAND, IN THE TOP OF A STATE-LINE MARKER, ABOUT 390 FEET S OF THE CENTER LINE OF HIGHWAY 11, 95.3 FEET SW OF THE W CORNER OF AN UNPAINTED 2-STORY HOUSE, 78.2 FEET SOUTH OF A MAPLE TREE THAT IS IN LINE WITH THE N SIDE OF THE HOUSE, 57.7 FEET NW OF THE MOST S OF A LINE OF MAPLE TREES, ABOUT 2.5 FEET HIGHER THAN GROUND.  A BRONZE TRIANGULATION STATION DISK SET IN A DRILL HOLE AND STAMPED MARYDEL 1932.  ALL THREE REFERENCE MARKS WERE RECOVERED AND USED AS BENCH MARKS.  FOLLOWING IS REPORTED ON R.M. 2--THIS DISK HAS BEEN CUT HALF IN TWO, THE UPPER HALF OF THE DISK HAS BEEN REMOVED.  THE LOWER HALF OF THE DISK IS STILL ATTACHED TO THE SHANK AND IS HELD FIRMLY IN PLACE.                            STATION RECOVERY (1942)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1942 1.2 MI SW FROM WRIGHTS CROSSROADS. 1.2 MILES SOUTHWEST ALONG STATE HIGHWAY 11 FROM THE INTERSECTION OF A DIRT ROAD AT WRIGHTS CROSSROADS, KENT COUNTY, ON THE DELAWARE-MARYLAND STATE LINE, IN THE TOP OF THE STATE LINE MARKER, 390 FEET SOUTH OF THE CENTERLINE OF THE HIGHWAY, 95.3 FEET SOUTHWEST OF THE WEST CORNER OF A TWO STORY UNPAINTED HOUSE, 78.2 FEET SOUTH OF A MAPLE TREE IN LINE WITH THE NORTH SIDE OF THE HOUSE, 57.7 FEET NORTHWEST OF THE SOUTHERNMOST OF A LINE OF MAPLE TREES, AND 2.5 FEET ABOVE THE LEVEL OF THE GROUND.  A STANDARD TRIANGULATION STATION DISK, STAMPED MARYDEL 1932.                            STATION RECOVERY (1961)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1961 (RWT) THE STATION MARK, REFERENCE MARK 1,2, 3 (AZIMUTH MARK) WERE RECOVERED AS DESCRIBED AND FOUND IN GOOD CONDITION.  REFERENCE MARK 1 WAS RESET ON THIS DATE, SINCE THE HOUSE WAS ON LINE, AT THE PROPERTY OWNERS REQUEST.  THE MARK WAS RESTAMPED 5.  IT WAS RESET 447.674 FEET AND 136.449 METERS NORTHWEST OF THE NEW STATION MARYDEL RM 4.  HALF OF THE DISK WAS FOUND BROKEN OFF OF REFERENCE MARK 2.  THE STATION COULD NOT BE BUILT OVER ON THIS DATE, DUE TO A POWERLINE BEING IN LINE OF A STEEL TOWER BEING ERECTED.  STATION MARYDEL RM 4 WAS ESTABLISHED AND USED AS A STATION ON THIS DATE.  THE STATION IS LOCATED ABOUT 3.0 MILES SOUTHWEST OF HARTLEY, DELAWARE, 1.2 MILES NORTHEAST OF TEMPLEVILLE, MARYLAND, 65.0 FEET WEST-SOUTHWEST OF CENTERLINE OF GRAVELED DRIVEWAY, 36.1 FEET NORTH OF THE NORTHWEST CORNER OF A CONCRETE BLOCK FARM-HOUSE, 12.1 FEET NORTH OF NORTHWEST CORNER OF A STURDILY CONSTRUCTED STOVE AND CONCRETE OUT-DOOR FIRE PLACE AND ON PROPERTY OWNED BY MR. MASKE.  THE MONUMENT IS A 12-INCH SQUARE GRANITE STONE PROJECTING ABOUT 30 INCHES ABOVE THE SURFACE OF THE GROUND WITH A U.S COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY TRIANGULATION DISK SET IN ITS TOP AND CENTER, STAMPED MARYDEL 1932.  THE MONUMENT IS INSCRIBED WITH THE LETTER M ON ITS WEST SIDE AND P ON ITS EAST SIDE.  THE MONUMENT IS ERECT AND IN GOOD CONDITION.  A TRAVERSE CONNECTION WAS MADE TO TRIANGULATION STATION MARYDEL RM 4, DISTANCE BEING 9.289 METERS AND 30.475 FEET EAST-NORTHEAST OF STATION MARYDEL RM 4.                            STATION RECOVERY (1974)  RECOVERY NOTE BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 1974 (CLN) THE STATION MARK AND REFERENCE MARK 2 WERE RECOVERED AND FOUND IN GOOD CONDITION.  REFERENCE MARKS 1, 3, 4 AND 5 WERE NOT FOUND.  THEY WERE REPORTED DESTROYED BY MARYLAND HIGHWAY DEPARTMENT.  A NEW REFERENCE MARK 6 WAS ESTABLISHED AT THIS DATE.  THERE IS NO PLACE TO SET A AZIMUTH MARK EXCEPT WITHIN 0.15 MILE AND REFERENCE MARK 2 IS NEARLY THAT DISTANCE.  A COMPLETE NEW DESCRIPTION OF THE STATION FOLLOWS.  THE STATION IS LOCATED ON THE MARYLAND-DELAWARE LINE ABOUT 10 MILES WEST OF DOVER DELAWARE, 1-1/2 MILES NORTHEAST OF TEMPLEVILLE AND JUST SOUTH OF STATE HIGHWAY 11.  THE PROPERTY OWNERS NAME IS UNKNOWN.  TO REACH THE STATION FROM A POINT WHERE STATE HIGHWAY 11 CROSSES THE MARYLAND-DELAWARE LINE, GO WEST ON STATE HIGHWAY 15 FOR 0.05 MILE TO A SIDE ROAD LEFT.  TURN LEFT AND GO SOUTH ON A FARM ROAD FOR 0.15 MILE TO A FARM HOUSE AND THE STATION JUST NORTHWEST OF THE HOUSE AND NEAR A OUTSIDE FIREPLACE.  THE STATION MARK IS A STANDARD DISK STAMPED MARYDEL 1932, SET IN THE TOP OF A 12-INCH SQUARE MARYLAND-DELAWARE BOUNDARY MONUMENT WHICH PROJECTS 18-INCHES.  IT IS 16 FEET NORTH OF THE CHIMNEY OF THE FIRE PLACE, 35 FEET NORTH OF THE NORTHWEST CORNER OF THE FARM HOUSE AND 65 FEET WEST OF THE FARM ROAD.  REFERENCE MARK 2 IS A STANDARD DISK STAMPED MARYDEL NO 2 1932, SET IN THE TOP OF A 12-INCH SQUARE CONCRETE MONUMENT WHICH PROJECTS 6-INCHES.  IT IS IN A FENCE LINE ACROSS THE OPEN CULTIVATED FIELD TO THE WEST OF THE STATION.  IT IS 3 FEET WEST OF THE WEST EDGE OF THE CULTIVATED FIELD, 6 FEET EAST OF A SMALL DITCH AND 22 FEET SOUTH OF A 14-INCH CEDAR TREE.  REFERENCE MARK 6 IS A STANDARD DISK STAMPED MARYDEL 1932 NO 6 1973, CEMENTED IN A DRILL HOLE IN A LARGE CONCRETE SLAB IN THE CENTER OF THE FARM LANE.  IT IS 83 FEET NORTHEAST OF THE FIREPLACE CHIMNEY AND 96 FEET NORTHEAST OF THE NORTHWEST CORNER OF THE FARM HOUSE.                            STATION RECOVERY (1981)  RECOVERY NOTE BY UNIVERSITY OF DELAWARE 1981 MARK NOT FOUND.                            STATION RECOVERY (1991)  RECOVERY NOTE BY US GEOLOGICAL SURVEY 1991 NOTE, THIS MARK WAS REPORTED NOT FOUND IN 1981 BY THE UNIVERSITY OF DELAWARE.  THIS MARK WAS FOUND AS DESCRIBED. TO REACH FROM THE INTERSECTION OF STATE HIGHWAYS 302 AND 454 IN TEMPLEVILLE, GO NORTHEAST ALONG STATE HIGHWAY 302 FOR 1.1 MI (1.77 KM) TO A TREE LINED DRIVEWAY LEADING SOUTHEAST. TURN RIGHT AND GO SOUTHEAST FOR 0.1 MI (0.16 KM) TO A 1 STORY BRICK HOUSE ON THE LEFT AND THE STATION ON THE RIGHT. THERE IS NO WAY POSSIBLE TO MOVE THE POINT ON LINE.  THE MARYLAND HIGHWAY DEPARTMENT SET A MANHOLE ON THE POINT AND A STANDARD MONUMENT WAS PLACED UNDER THE MANHOLE.  THE MONUMENT IS LOCATED ABOUT 4-1/2 MILES NORTH OF PITTSVILLE, MARYLAND, AND 3-1/4 MILES SOUTHWEST OF GUMBORO, DELAWARE.  TO REACH FROM THE INTERSECTION OF U.S. HIGHWAY 13 AND STATE HIGHWAY 54 IN DELMAR, GO EAST ON STATE HIGHWAY 54 FOR 5.7 MILES TO THE MANHOLE AND THE MONUMENT.  THE SURFACE MARK IS A MARYLAND-DELAWARE BOUNDARY DISK STAMPED E-W NO. 22 1976, SET IN THE TOP OF A 12-INCH ROUND CONCRETE MONUMENT WHICH IS 20-INCHES BELOW THE ROAD SURFACE.  THE SUB-SURFACE MARKER IS A SIMILAR DISK BEARING THE SAME STAMPING, SET IN AN 8 BY 12 INCH MASS OF CONCRETE 48 INCHES BELOW THE ROAD SURFACE.  THEY ARE 30.8 FEET NORTH OF A WITNESS POST, 30 FEET NORTH-NORTHWEST OF A CULVERT AT A WOODS ROAD, AND 4 FEET SOUTH OF THE CENTER OF STATE HIGHWAY 54.  FOR ADDITIONAL INFORMATION, SEE DESCRIPTION FOR STATION RACCOON 1974.                            STATION RECOVERY (1976)  RECOVERY NOTE BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 1976 RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION.                            STATION RECOVERY (1990)  RECOVERY NOTE BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 1990 9.1 KM (5.65 MI) EASTERLY ALONG STATE HIGHWAY 54 FROM ITS JUNCTION WITH U.S. HIGHWAY 13 IN DELMAR, 0.9 KM (0.56 MI) WEST OF THE INTERSECTION OF GUY WARD ROAD, 9.3 M (30.51 FT) NORTH OF TRIANGULATION STATION RACCOON, 3.5 M (11.48 FT) WEST OF THE EXTENDED CENTER OF A TRACK ROAD, 1.3 M (4.27 FT) SOUTH OF THE HIGHWAY CENTERLINE, 0.4 M (1.31 FT) BELOW THE LEVEL OF THE HIGHWAY, AND IN A CONCRETE MONUMENT THAT IS 0.4 M (1.31 FT) BELOW THE GROUND SURFACE. NOTE--ACCESS TO THE MONUMENT IS THROUGH A 24-INCH MANHOLE COVER PRECAST -STORM DRAIN-. THE DISK IS CAST HORIZONTAL CONTROL AND BOUNDARY MONUMENT.

THE IRON PIN MENTIONED ABOVE WAS SET BY THE HIGHWAY DEPARTMENT IN THE SAME POSITION AS THE ORIGINAL SITE OF THE 1751 MONUMENT. markers.description: BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 1981 THE COMPUTED POSITION OF THIS MONUMENT WAS FOUND TO BE IN THE SOUTH PART OF STATE HIGHWAY 54. THE MONUMENT IS LOCATED APPROXIMATELY 16 AIRLINE MILES WEST OF SELBYVILLE, 2-1/2 MILES EAST OF DELMAR, AND ON STATE HIGHWAY 54 RIGHT-OF-WAY. TO REACH FROM THE INTERSECTION OF U. S. HIGHWAY 13 AND STATE HIGHWAY 54 IN DELMAR, GO EAST ON STATE HIGHWAY 54 FOR 1.5 MILES (2.4 KM) TO THE MONUMENT ON THE RIGHT. THE SURFACE MARK IS A STANDARD MARYLAND-DELAWARE BOUNDARY DISK STAMPED E-W NO. 26 1981, SET IN THE TOP OF A 14-INCH SQUARE CONCRETE MONUMENT WHICH IS 17 INCHES BELOW THE ROAD SURFACE. THE MONUMENT IS COVERED BY A 26-INCH ROUND SANITARY SEWER MANHOLE COVER, 144.4 FEET (44.0 M) NORTH-NORTHWEST OF THE NORTHWEST CORNER OF THE R. E. BENNETT HOME, 36.2 FEET (11.0 M) SOUTH OF A TELEPHONE POLE NUMBERED 65, 36.0 FEET (11.0 M) SOUTH OF A WITNESS POST, 26.5 FEET (8.1 M) NORTH-NORTHEAST OF A POWERLINE POLE NUMBERED 48842 96382 48 B 15, AND 7.7 FEET (2.3 M) SOUTH OF THE CENTER OF STATE HIGHWAY 54.  FOR ADDITIONAL INFORMATION, SEE RECOVERY FOR ANDREWS 1974.                            STATION RECOVERY (1989)  RECOVERY NOTE BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 1989 4.2 KM (2.61 MI) EASTERLY ALONG STATE HIGHWAY 54 FROM ITS JUNCTION WITH THE CONRAIL RAILROAD IN DELMAR, 44.0 M (144.36 FT) NORTH-NORTHWEST OF THE NORTHWEST CORNER OF A HOUSE, 8.1 M (26.57 FT) NORTH-NORTHEAST OF UTILITY POLE NUMBER 45843 96382, 2.4 M (7.87 FT) SOUTH OF THE CENTERLINE OF THE HIGHWAY, AND IN A CONCRETE MONUMENT THAT IS 0.5 M (1.64 FT) BELOW THE HIGHWAY SURFACE. TO REACH THE MONUMENT FROM THE JUNCTION OF STATE ROAD 14 AND 54 IN FENWICK ISLAND, GO SOUTH ON STATE ROAD 14 FOR 0.05 MILE TO THE STATE LINE AND A SIDE ROAD RIGHT.  TURN RIGHT AND GO WEST ON A SAND ROAD FOR 0.1 MILE TO THE MONUMENT ON THE RIGHT.  THE MARK, A 6 BY 12 INCH GRANITE MONUMENT WITH A U.S.C. AND G.S. REFERENCE MARK DISK CEMENTED IN THE TOP, STAMPED FENWICK ISLAND NO 2 1932.  THE MONUMENT IS PROJECTING 36 INCHES ABOVE THE GROUND SURFACE.  FOR ADDITIONAL INFORMATION SEE DESCRIPTION FOR FENWICK ISLAND RM 5.  AIRLINE DISTANCE AND DIRECTION FROM NEAREST TOWN IN FENWICK ISLAND. markers.description: BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1962 (RWT) THE STATION IS THE CENTER OF THE SMALL CROSS INSCRIBED IN THE APEX AND CENTER OF BOUNDARY MONUMENT NO. 1.  LOCATED ABOUT 7.0 MILES WEST OF DELMAR, DELAWARE, 5.0 MILES SOUTH-SOUTHEAST OF SHARPTOWN, MARYLAND, 3.5 MILES EAST-NORTHEAST OF MARDELA SPRINGS, MARYLAND, IN DENSE WOODS LAND.  THE PROPERTY ON THE MARYLAND SIDE IS OWNED BY MRS MAY TWILLEY WHO LIVES AT THE FIRST HOUSE WEST OF THE STATION AND THE LAND ON THE DELAWARE SIDE IS OWNED BY MR. LEE WRIGHT.  IT IS A 12-INCH SQUARE LIMESTONE MONUMENT PROJECTING ABOUT 26 INCHES ABOVE THE SURFACE OF THE GROUND, AND LEANS SLIGHTLY TO THE SOUTH.  THE STONE IN GENERAL GOOD CONDITION.  IT HAS THE LETTER M INSCRIBED ON THE WEST SIDE AND P ON THE EAST SIDE.  A SMALL CROSS WAS INSCRIBED IN THE APEX AND CENTER OF THE MONUMENT FOR TRAVERSE PURPOSE ON THIS DATE. IT IS 46.0 FEET NORTHEAST OF A 14-INCH PINE TREE, 28.5 FEET EAST-NORTHEAST OF A STANDARD METAL WITNESS POST AND MARKER AND 16.6 FEET NORTHEAST OF A 12-INCH OAK TREE.  A TRAVERSE CONNECTION WAS MADE TO TRIANGULATION STATION TWILLEY, DISTANCE BEING (25.348 FEET) AND 7.726 METERS SOUTHEAST OF STATION TWILLEY.                            STATION RECOVERY (2007)  RECOVERY NOTE BY GEOCACHING 2007 (WD) THE STONE IS ERECT AND STABLE, AND PROJECTS 26 INCHES.  IT IS LOCATED IN MODERATELY DENSE WOODS ABOUT 240 FEET WEST OF THE WEST EDGE OF A CULTIVATED FIELD, AND ABOUT 0.2 MILES WEST OF A GRAVEL DRIVEWAY THAT LEADS SOUTH FROM MAY TWILLEY ROAD TO THE DELAWARE-SIDE LANDOWNER'S RESIDENCE.

BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 1976 (CLN) THE POSITION OF THIS MONUMENT WAS FOUND TO BE IN THE CENTER OF THE SOUTH BOUND LANE OF STATE LINE ROAD.  A 24-INCH ROUND MANHOLE WAS PLACED IN THE ROAD AND THE MONUMENT SET UNDER THE MANHOLE.  THE MARKER IS LOCATED 5-1/2 MILES WEST-SOUTHWEST OF SEAFORD, DELAWARE, 8-1/2 MILES NORTHWEST OF LAUREL, DELAWARE, AND 2 MILES SOUTH OF RELIANCE.  IT IS ON ROAD RIGHT-OF-WAY.  TO REACH FROM THE INTERSECTION OF MARYLAND STATE HIGHWAY 392 AND 577, DELAWARE STATE HIGHWAY 20 IN RELIANCE, GO SOUTH ON STATE LINE ROAD FOR 2.1 MILES TO THE MANHOLE AND THE MARKER BELOW THE MANHOLE.  THE SURFACE MARK IS A MARYLAND-DELAWARE BOUNDARY DISK STAMPED N-S NO. 10 1976, SET IN THE TOP OF A 12-INCH CONCRETE MONUMENT WHICH IS 20 INCHES BELOW THE TOP OF THE MANHOLE.  THE SUB-SURFACE DISK IS SET IN A 8-INCH MASS OF CONCRETE WHICH IS 48 INCHES BELOW THE SURFACE OF THE ROAD.  THEY ARE 104 FEET WEST OF THE NORTHWEST CORNER OF MR. RALPH MOORES HOUSE, 40 FEET SOUTHWEST OF A POWERLINE POLE NUMBERED 148 49, 26 FEET SOUTHWEST OF MR. MOORES MAILBOX, AND 3 FEET WEST OF THE CENTER OF THE ROAD.  FOR ADDITIONAL INFORMATION, SEE DESCRIPTION FOR STATION DELA 1962.  NEAREST TOWN--RELIANCE.

markers.description: BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 1976 (CLN) THE POSITION OF THIS MONUMENT WAS FOUND TO BE IN THE CENTER OF STATE LINE ROAD.  IT WAS SET UNDER A 24-INCH ROUND MANHOLE AT THIS DATE.  THE ORIGINAL MONUMENT FOR THIS POINT WAS FOUND IN DENTON, MARYLAND, AND IT WAS SET ON POINT NORTH-SOUTH NUMBER 42.  THE STATES OF MARYLAND AND DELAWARE AGREED TO SETTING THE OLD STONE WHERE IT COULD BE VIEWED INSTEAD OF UNDER THE ROAD.  THE MARKER IS LOCATED 9 MILES NORTHWEST OF LAUREL, DELAWARE, 6 MILES WEST-SOUTHWEST OF SEAFORD, DELAWARE, AND 1-1/4 MILES SOUTH OF RELIANCE.  IT IS ON ROAD RIGHT-OF-WAY.  TO REACH FROM THE INTERSECTION OF MARYLAND STATE HIGHWAYS 392 AND 577 AND DELAWARE STATE HIGHWAY 20, GO SOUTH ON STATE LINE ROAD FOR 1.15 MILES TO THE MANHOLE AND THE MARKER BELOW THE MANHOLE.  THE SURFACE MARK IS A MARYLAND-DELAWARE BOUNDARY DISK STAMPED N-S NO. 11 1976, SET IN THE TOP OF A 12-INCH CONCRETE MONUMENT WHICH IS 20-INCHES BELOW THE TOP OF THE MANHOLE.  THE SUB-SURFACE DISK IS SET IN AN 8-INCH MASS OF CONCRETE WHICH IS 48-INCHES BELOW THE SURFACE.  THEY ARE 99.9 FEET NORTHWEST OF A POWERLINE POLE NUMBERED 34-1, 28.1 FEET EAST OF A WITNESS POST, AND 26 FEET EAST OF A CULVERT AT A T-DITCH.

markers.description: BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 1976 (CLN) THE OLD MARYLAND-DELAWARE BOUNDARY MONUMENT NUMBER 12 WAS FOUND IN THE PRONE POSITION ABOUT 3 FEET BELOW THE SURFACE OF THE STATE LINE ROAD.  IT WAS PLACED THERE BY THE DELAWARE HIGHWAY DEPARTMENT, WHEN THE ROAD WAS PAVED IN 1951.  IT WAS DUG UP AT THIS DATE AND RESET 134 METERS TO THE NORTH AND OUT OF THE ROADWAY.  THE MONUMENT HAD BEEN BROKEN HALFWAY IN TWO SOMETIME IN THE PAST. IT WAS REPAIRED AT THIS DATE BY THE DELAWARE HIGHWAY DEPARTMENT AND SET IN A LARGE CONCRETE BASE.  THE MARKER IS LOCATED ON THE NORTH SIDE OF DELAWARE STATE HIGHWAY 20 AND MARYLAND STATE HIGHWAY 392 AT THE T-INTERSECTION OF THE TWO STATE HIGHWAYS AND STATE LINE ROAD IN RELIANCE.  THE LOCATION OF THIS MARKER IS ADEQUATE TO LOCATE IT WITH, NO TO REACH IS NECESSARY.  THE SURFACE MARKER IS A 12-INCH SQUARE LIMESTONE MONUMENT SET IN A MASS OF CONCRETE PROJECTING ONE FOOT.  IT HAS AN M CARVED IN THE WEST SIDE, AND THE EAST SIDE HAS BEEN BUSTED AWAY WHERE THE P WAS.  THE SUB-SURFACE MARKER IS A MARYLAND-DELAWARE BOUNDARY DISK SET IN AN 8-INCH MASS OF CONCRETE 48-INCHES BELOW THE SURFACE.  IT IS STAMPED N-S NO. 12 1976.  THEY ARE 79 FEET SOUTHEAST OF THE SOUTHEAST CORNER OF A 2-STORY HOUSE, 40 FEET NORTH OF THE CENTER OF THE T-INTERSECTION, 19 FEET WEST-NORTHWEST OF A POWERLINE POLE, 7 FEET NORTH-NORTHWEST OF A TELEPHONE UNDERGROUND CABLE BOX, AND 6.5 FEET NORTHWEST OF A POWERLINE POLE NUMBERED UK 233.                            STATION RECOVERY (2007)  RECOVERY NOTE BY GEOCACHING 2007 (WD) THE STONE IS ERECT AND STABLE, AND PROJECTS SIX INCHES.  THE TOP HAS BEEN BADLY DAMAGED.  ITS SHAPE IS IRREGULAR AND IT NO LONGER RESEMBLES A MASON-DIXON STONE.  IT IS LOCATED ABOUT 40 FEET NORTH OF THE INTERSECTION OF THE GALESTOWN-RELIANCE ROAD AND DELAWARE STATE HIGHWAY 20, AND SIX FEET NORTH OF WOOD UTILITY POLE 233.
markers.setting: SET IN TOP OF CONCRETE MONUMENT

markers.description: BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 1976 (CLN) THE OLD BOUNDARY MONUMENT NUMBER 18 WAS RECOVERED AND FOUND IN GOOD CONDITION.  IT WAS FOUND TO BE OFF OF THE BOUNDARY SO IT WAS RESET AT THIS DATE.  THE MONUMENT IS LOCATED 3-1/2 MILES EAST-NORTHEAST OF FEDERALSBURG, 2 MILES NORTHWEST OF ATLANTA AND ON PROPERTY OWNED BY MRS. MARIE W. JOHNSON, ROUTE 1, BOX 342, FEDERALSBURG, MARYLAND.  MRS. JOHNSONS TELEPHONE NUMBER IS (301) 754-9192.  TO REACH FROM THE INTERSECTION OF MAIN STREET AND EAST CENTRAL AVENUE IN FEDERALSBURG, GO EAST ON CENTRAL AVENUE FOR 0.2 MILE TO RELIANCE AVENUE FOR 0.45 MILE TO THE INTERSECTION OF STATE HIGHWAYS 313 AND 318.  TURN LEFT AND GO SOUTHEAST AND EAST ON STATE HIGHWAY 318 FOR 2.85 MILES TO A SIDE ROAD LEFT JUST AFTER PASSING A CHURCH ON THE LEFT.  TURN LEFT AND GO NORTH ON WHITE ROAD FOR 0.3 MILE TO A SIDE ROAD RIGHT.  TURN RIGHT AND GO EAST ON HARDY ROAD FOR 0.95 MILE TO A SIDE ROAD LEFT, JUST AFTER CROSSING A SMALL BRIDGE.  TURN LEFT AND GO NORTH ON A FARM ROAD FOR 0.05 MILE TO MRS. JOHNSONS HOME ON THE LEFT AND THE STATION.  THE SURFACE MARK IS A SMALL CROSS CUT IN THE TOP OF A 12-INCH SQUARE LIMESTONE MONUMENT WHICH PROJECTS 18-INCHES.  THE MONUMENT IS SET IN A BASE CONSISTING OF 5 CUBIC FEET OF CONCRETE.  THE MONUMENT HAS A P ON THE EAST SIDE AND AN M ON THE WEST SIDE.  THE SUB-SURFACE MARK IS A STANDARD DISK STAMPED N-S NO. 18 1976, SET IN THE TOP OF AN 8-INCH ROUND MASS OF CONCRETE WHICH IS 48 INCHES BELOW THE SURFACE.  IT IS 36.8 FEET SOUTHWEST OF THE SOUTHEAST CORNER OF A CHICKEN COOP, 34 FEET SOUTH OF THE SOUTH SIDE OF THE CHICKEN COOP, 32 FEET WEST OF THE CENTER OF THE ROAD, 21 FEET SOUTH OF THE CENTER OF AN EAST-WEST FARM ROAD, 6 FEET SOUTHWEST OF A FENCE CORNER AND 5 FEET NORTH OF A TRIPLE TRUNK WILD CHERRY TREE.  FOR ADDITIONAL INFORMATION, SEE DESCRIPTION FOR STATION JOHNSON.                            STATION RECOVERY (2007)  RECOVERY NOTE BY GEOCACHING 2007 (WD) THE STONE IS ERECT AND STABLE, AND PROJECTS 20 INCHES.  IT IS LOCATED ABOUT 460 FEET NORTH OF HANDY ROAD AND 34 FEET WEST OF A GRAVEL DRIVEWAY.

markers.description: BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1962 (RWT) STATION IS LOCATED ABOUT 1.0 MILE NORTH OF THE SMALL SETTLEMENT OF RELIANCE, 5.0 MILES SOUTHEAST OF FEDERALSBURG MARYLAND, AND ABOUT 5.5 MILES WEST OF SEAFORD DELAWARE, ON THE PROPERTY OWNED BY MR. GEORGE WRIGHT.  TO REACH THE STATION FROM THE INTERSECTIONS OF MAIN STREET AND CENTRAL AVE. IN FEDERALSBURG MARYLAND, GO EAST ON CENTRAL AVE. FOR 0.2 MILE TO A SIDE STREET RIGHT TURN RIGHT, GO SOUTHERLY ON STATE HIGHWAY 313 FOR 1.7 MILES, HIGHWAY 313 TURNS TO THE RIGHT, CONTINUE SOUTHEASTERLY ON STATE HIGHWAY 577 FOR 2.8 MILES TO AZIMUTH ON THE RIGHT, CONTINUE ON STATE HIGHWAY FOR 0.1 MILE TO A SIDE ROAD ON THE LEFT, TURN LEFT GO EAST ON ROAD THAT LEADS TO A SAW MILL FOR 0.35 MILE TO AN OLD CABIN IN THE EDGE OF THE WOODS, HERE TURN LEFT GO NORTH ON AN OLD WOODS ROAD FOR 0.15 MILE TO STATION ON THE RIGHT.  BOUNDARY MONUMENT NO. 13, A 12 X 12 INCH SQUARE MONUMENT, PROJECTING 30 INCHES FROM GROUND SURFACE, WITH AN M ON THE WEST SIDE AND A P ON THE EAST SIDE.  IT IS 26.9 FEET EAST-SOUTHEAST OF A STANDARD METAL WITNESS POST.  50.3 FEET EAST-SOUTHEAST OF A 12 INCH PINE TREE.  68.6 FEET EAST OF A WOODS ROAD.  A TRAVERSE CONNECTION WAS MADE TO TRIANGULATION STATION WRIGHT, DISTANCE BEING 17.035 METERS AND (55.889) FEET EAST-SOUTHEAST OF STATION WRIGHT.                            STATION RECOVERY (2009)  RECOVERY NOTE BY GEOCACHING 2009 (WD) BOUNDARY MONUMENT MILE 13 DEL MD IS AN 11.75-INCH BY 12-INCH LIMESTONE SHAFT THAT PROJECTS 27 INCHES.  THE STONE IS LOCATED IN HEAVY WOODS ABOUT ONE MILE NORTH OF THE CROSSROADS KNOWN AS RELIANCE, DE, 0.54 MILES SOUTHWEST OF DELAWARE STATE HIGHWAY 549 AND 0.39 MILES NORTHEAST OF MARYLAND STATE HIGHWAY 577 (RELIANCE ROAD).  THE STONE IS AN INTERMEDIATE MILE MARKER WITH A CUT M ON THE WEST FACE AND A CUT P ON THE EAST FACE.   THE STONE HAS SUFFERED SOME DAMAGE, IS IN GENERALLY POOR CONDITION AND LEANS ABOUT FIVE DEGREES TO THE SOUTHEAST.  THE TOP HORIZONTAL EDGES ARE ALL CHIPPED, AND THERE IS A LARGE CHIP AT THE NORTHEAST CORNER OF THE TOP THAT RUNS ABOUT SIX INCHES DOWN THE NORTHEAST VERTICAL EDGE OF THE SHAFT.  ALSO, THERE IS A TWO INCH DEEP GOUGE ABOUT SIX INCHES ABOUT THE GROUND ON THE NORTH FACE, AND TWO-INCH BY TWO-INCH CHIP AT THE GROUND LEVEL OF THE SOUTHEAST VERTICAL EDGE.  THE TOP IS ROUGHLY PYRAMIDAL.  SOME FLUTING IS VISIBLE ON ALL FOUR FACES, BUT NONE ON THE TOP.  BOTH THE CUT M AND CUT P ARE IN GOOD CONDITION.  THE STONE IS LOCATED IN HEAVY WOODS, ABOUT 75 FEET EAST OF THE CENTERLINE OF A DIM, NORTH-SOUTH ROAD, AND 55.9 FEET EAST OF TRIANGULATION STATION WRIGHT.

BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1962 (RWT) STATION IS LOCATED ABOUT 1.0 MILE NORTH OF OAK GROVE, 4.0 MILES SOUTHEAST OF FEDERALSBURG MARYLAND, 5.5 MILES NORTHEAST OF SEAFORD DELAWARE.  TO REACH THE STATION FROM THE INTERSECTION OF MAIN STREET AND CENTRAL AVE. IN FEDERALSBURG MARYLAND, GO EASTERLY ON STATE HIGHWAY 318 FOR 0.35 MILE TO THE JUNCTION OF STATE HIGHWAYS 318 AND 306, KEEP THE RIGHT FORK AND CONTINUE EASTERLY ON STATE HIGHWAY 318 FOR 2.8 MILES TO A CHURCH ON THE LEFT AND A SIDE ROAD ON THE RIGHT, TURN RIGHT, GO SOUTHERLY ON THE MACADAM ROAD FOR 1.5 MILES TO FORKS AT THE BETHEL CEMETERY ON THE LEFT, TAKE THE RIGHT FORK AND GO SOUTHERLY FOR 0.4 MILE TO A SIDE ROAD RIGHT, CONTINUE FOR 0.1 MILE TO THE STATION ON THE LEFT.  BOUNDARY MONUMENT NO. 15, A 12 X 12 INCH SQUARE MONUMENT, PROJECTING 30 INCHES FROM THE GROUND SURFACE, WITH A COAT OF ARMS ON THE EAST AND WEST SIDE.  IT IS 17.0 FEET WEST OF A BLACK TOP ROAD.  18.0 FEET EAST OF A NORTH-SOUTH WOODS LINE.  30.0 FEET WEST OF A CULTIVATED FIELD.  A TRAVERSE CONNECTION WAS MADE TO TRIANGULATION STATION ALLEN, DISTANCE BEING 20.599 METERS AND (67.582) FEET WEST OF STATION ALLEN.                            STATION RECOVERY (2007)  RECOVERY NOTE BY GEOCACHING 2007 (WD) THE STONE PROJECTS 27 INCHES AND LEANS ABOUT FIVE DEGREES TO THE SOUTH.  IT IS 17 FEET WEST OF THE CENTERLINE OF DELAWARE SUSSEX COUNTY ROAD 549.

BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1962 (RWT) THE STATION IS THE CROSS INSCRIBED IN THE TOP AND CENTER OF BOUNDARY MONUMENT NO. 17.  LOCATED ABOUT 6.5 MILES WEST-SOUTHWEST OF BRIDGEVILLE, DELAWARE, 3.5 MILES EAST-NORTHEAST OF FEDERALSBURG, MARYLAND AND IN A CULTIVATED FIELD 200.0 FEET NORTH OF THE CENTERLINE OF STATE HIGHWAY 318 AND STATE HIGHWAY 306 AND 150.0 FEET EAST OF THE CENTERLINE OF A GRAVELED DRIVEWAY.  IT IS A 12-INCH SQUARE GRANITE STONE PROJECTING ABOUT 30 INCHES ABOVE THE SURFACE OF THE GROUND, LEANS ABOUT 6 DEGREES TO THE SOUTH, CHIPPED BADLY ON THE EAST SIDE, WITH THE LETTER M CUT IN ON ITS WEST SIDE AND P ON THE EAST SIDE.  A SMALL CROSS WAS INSCRIBED IN ITS TOP AND CENTER FOR TRAVERSE PURPOSE ON THIS DATE.  TO REACH THE STATION FROM THE INTERSECTIONS OF MAIN STREET AND CENTRAL AVENUE IN FEDERALSBURG.  GO EAST ON STATE HIGHWAY 318 FOR 0.35 MILE TO THE JUNCTION OF STATE HIGHWAYS 306 AND 318.  TAKE THE RIGHT HAND FORK AND GO EAST-NORTHEAST ON STATE HIGHWAY 318 FOR 3.15 MILES TO THE MARYLAND AND DELAWARE STATE LINE AND THE STATION.  A TRAVERSE CONNECTION WAS MADE TO TRIANGULATION STATION ATLANTA, DISTANCE BEING 93.746 METERS AND (307.756) FEET NORTH OF STATION ATLANTA.

BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1962 (RWT) THE STATION IS THE CENTER OF A SMALL CROSS INSCRIBED IN THE TOP AND CENTER OF THE BOUNDARY MONUMENT NO. 19.  LOCATED ABOUT 6.0 MILES WEST OF BRIGGEVILLE, DELAWARE, 4.0 MILES NORTHEAST OF FEDERALSBURG, IN A DENSE WOODS LAND AND ON PROPERTY OWNED BY MR. GILBERT KINDIG.  THE MONUMENT IS A 12-INCH SQUARE GRANITE STONE PROJECTING ABOUT 30 INCHES ABOVE THE SURFACE OF THE GROUND, WITH THE LETTER M CUT IN ON THE WEST SIDE AND THE LETTER P ON THE EAST SIDE.  THE MONUMENT WAS RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION, STURDY AND PLUMB.  IT IS 38.7 FEET EAST-NORTHEAST OF A STANDARD METAL WITNESS POST AND MARKER, 13.0 FEET SOUTH OF THE APPROXIMATE CENTERLINE OF A TRACK WOODS ROAD AND 9.6 FEET SOUTHEAST OF A 4-TRUNKED OAK TREE.  TO REACH THE STATION FROM THE INTERSECTION OF MAIN STREET AND CENTRAL AVENUE IN FEDERALSBURG, MARYLAND.  GO EAST ON STATE HIGHWAY 318, EAST CENTRAL AVENUE, FOR 0.35 MILE TO THE JUNCTION OF STATE HIGHWAYS 318 AND 306 TO A FORK.  TAKE THE LEFT HAND FORK AND GO NORTH-NORTHEAST ON STATE HIGHWAY 306 FOR 3.5 MILES TO A SIDE ROAD ON THE RIGHT, EAST, SIDE OF THE HIGHWAY, JUST AFTER PASSING A SMALL TAVERN ON THE RIGHT HAND SIDE OF THE HIGHWAY.  TURN RIGHT AND GO EAST-NORTHEAST ON A GRAVELED ROAD FOR 0.5 MILE TO A FARM LANE ON THE LEFT HAND SIDE OF THE GRAVELED ROAD.  TURN LEFT AND GO WEST ON THE FARM LANE FOR 0.24 MILE TO A FARM HOME AND THE EAST END OF A SMALL GARAGE. TURN RIGHT AND GO EAST-NORTHEAST ON A TRACK ROAD ALONG THE EAST SIDE OF A CHICKEN HOUSE FOR A SHORT DISTANCE TO THE EDGE OF A CULTIVATED FIELD.  CONTINUE NORTHEAST ON A FIELD TRACK ROAD FOR 0.13 MILE TO THE EDGE OF A WOODS AND THE ENTRANCE OF A WOODS ROAD, CONTINUE NORTHEAST AND EAST ON THE WOODS ROAD FOR 0.2 MILE TO WHERE THE WOODS ROAD MAKES A 90 DEGREE TURN TO THE LEFT, A STANDARD METAL WITNESS POST, BOUNDARY MONUMENT NO. 19 AND THE STATION ON THE RIGHT, HAND SIDE OF THE WOODS ROAD.  A TRAVERSE CONNECTION WAS MADE TO TRIANGULATION STATION KINDIG, DISTANCE BEING 12.995 METERS AND (42.634) FEET EAST OF STATION KINDIG.

BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1961 (RWT) THE STATION IS LOCATED ON THE DELAWARE AND PENNSYLVANIA BOUNDARY LINE, ALONG THE SOUTH SIDE OF A BLACKTOP EAST AND WEST ROAD, ABOUT 10.0 MILES SOUTH-SOUTHEAST OF WEST CHESTER, PENNSYLVANIA, 7.0 MILES NORTH OF THE CENTRAL SECTION OF WILMINGTON, DELAWARE, 5.0 MILES NORTHWEST OF ARDEN, PENNSYLVANIA, 4.0 MILES WEST OF BOOTH COR, PENNSYLVANIA, 2.0 MILES SOUTH OF ELAM, PENNSYLVANIA.  IT IS 149.54 FEET WEST OF THE CENTERLINE OF THE SOUTH BOUND TRAFFIC LANE OF U.S. HIGHWAY 202, 62.7 FEET WEST-NORTHWEST OF A TELEPHONE POLE, 16.9 FEET NORTHEAST OF A 10-INCH ELM TREE, 14.1 FEET SOUTH OF AN EAST AND WEST FENCELINE AND 6.2 FEET SOUTH OF THE CENTERLINE OF A BLACKTOP ROAD.  THE MARK IS A 8-INCH SQUARE CONCRETE MONUMENT WITH A CHISLED CROSS WITH A CENTER PUNCH MARK IN ITS CENTER.  THE MONUMENT PROJECTS ABOUT 1 INCH ABOVE THE SURFACE OF THE GROUND.  THE MONUMENT HAS A 3-INCH BRONZE BENCH MARK DISK IN ITS TOP AND NEAR THE SOUTH EDGE OF THE MONUMENT.  THE USGS DESCRIPTION OF 1900 STATES--IN THE TOP OF STATE LINE STONE NO. 16 ALUMINUM TABLET STAMPED 384 HARRISBURG 1900.  THE MONUMENT WAS FOUND TO HAVE BEEN PUSHED OVER SO AS TO BE LEANING A 53 DEGREE ANGLE AND WAS RESET AND LOWERED AS DESCRIBED ABOVE.                            STATION RECOVERY (2005)  RECOVERY NOTE BY GEOCACHING 2005 (WD) DUE TO REPAVING, THE TOP OF THE MONUMENT IS NOW TWO INCHES BELOW THE LEVEL OF THE PAVED DRIVEWAY AND PARKING LOT, AND TWO INCHES BELOW THE SURFACE OF THE SURROUNDING SOD.  ACCORDING TO THE DELAWARE GEOLOGICAL SURVEY, THE DESCRIBED DISK IN THE TOP OF THE MONUMENT WAS REMOVED SOMETIME PRIOR TO 1984. THE MONUMENT IS LOCATED 14.75 FEET SOUTH OF WOOD UTILITY POLE NUMBER 14346, AT THE SOUTH EDGE OF PAVEMENT THAT SERVES AS BOTH A DRIVEWAY LEADING WEST FROM US ROUTE 202 TO CHADDSFORD COLLISION SERVICE AND A PARKING LOT FOR A SMALL STRIP MALL ON THE WEST SIDE OF US ROUTE 202 IMMEDIATELY NORTH OF THE PA-DE STATE BOUNDARY LINE.                            STATION RECOVERY (2010)  RECOVERY NOTE BY GEOCACHING 2010 (LPC) RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION.                            STATION RECOVERY (2013)  RECOVERY NOTE BY DELAWARE COASTAL PROGRAM 2013 MARK NOT FOUND.

BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1933 STATION EBRIGHT IS LOCATED NEAR A BOUNDARY MONUMENT BETWEEN THE STATES OF DELAWARE AND PENNSYLVANIA, ALONG THE CIRCULAR BOUNDARY, ON PROPERTY OWNED BY JAMES AND GRANT EBRIGHT AND ABOUT 6-3/4 MILES NNE OF THE CENTER OF WILMINGTON.  THE GRANITE BOUNDARY MONUMENT IS 141.74 FEET E OF STATION EBRIGHT. 36.2 FEET N OF SW CORNER OF HOUSE.  25.5 FEET W OF NW CORNER OF HOUSE.  THE MONUMENT IS ABOUT 10 INCHES SQUARE ON TOP AND 2-1/2 FEET HIGH.  CARVED ON THE FOUR SIDES ARE.  N SIDE--P,S SIDE--D,E SIDE--1892, W SIDE--17.  TO REACH STA EBRIGHT FROM WILMINGTON GO NE ON HIGHWAY 13, 7.5 MILES FROM CENTER OF TOWN OR 0.4 MILE FROM WORTH STEEL COMPANY RAILROAD UNDERPASS, HERE TAKE LEFT ON PAVED ROAD (A CAUTION LIGHT AT ENTRANCE) AND CONTINUE IN A WESTERNLY DIRECTION 4.55 MILES TO A T-INTERSECTION, TAKE RIGHT (N) ON MACADAM ROAD AND GO 0.75 MILE TO LANE JUST N OF STONE FENCE, TAKE THIS LANE (W) 0.1 MILE TO GATE, THEN CONTINUE W ON THE N SIDE OF EBRIGHTS HOUSE 0.05 MILE TO GATE.  THE STATION IS BACK OF THE HOUSE IN WOODED LOT.  167 FEET W OF NW CORNER OF HOUSE.  146 FEET N OF W OF SW CORNER OF HOUSE.  19-1/2 FEET E OF 30-INCH MAPLE TREE.  THE MARK PROJECTS 2 INCHES.                            STATION RECOVERY (1992)  RECOVERY NOTE BY US POWER SQUADRON 1992 (BC) RECOVERED AS DESCRIBED.                            STATION RECOVERY (2001)  RECOVERY NOTE BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 2001 (DB) THIS REPORT WAS SUBMITTED BY THE US POWER SQUADRONS.                            STATION RECOVERY (2006)  RECOVERY NOTE BY US POWER SQUADRON 2006 (SAL) RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION.                            STATION RECOVERY (2010)  RECOVERY NOTE BY GEOCACHING 2010 (LPC) RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION.                            STATION RECOVERY (2013)  RECOVERY NOTE BY DELAWARE COASTAL PROGRAM 2013 RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION.                            STATION RECOVERY (2015)  RECOVERY NOTE BY GEOCACHING 2015 (RLM) RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION.

BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1960 (JCC) STATION IS LOCATED ABOUT 6-1/2 MILES NORTH OF WILMINGTON, DELAWARE.  ABOUT 1/2 MILE EAST OF U.S. HIGHWAY 202 AT THE DELAWARE-PENNSYLVANIA STATE LINE CROSSING.  ON THE DELAWARE-PENNSYLVANIA STATE LINE.  TO REACH FROM THE TALLEYVILLE FIRE COMPANY, TALLEYVILLE, DELAWARE.  GO NORTH ON U.S. HIGHWAY 202 FOR 2.35 MILES TO THE DELAWARE-PENNSYLVANIA STATE LINE AND A CROSSROAD.  TURN RIGHT ON GRAVEL ROAD AND GO 0.5 MILE TO END OF TRUCK TRAVEL.  AT THIS POINT NEW ROADS ARE BEING CONSTRUCTED SO YOU MUST PACK NORTH ABOUT 100 YARDS TO STATION.  STATION MARK, A STANDARD DISK CEMENTED IN A DRILL HOLE IN THE TOP CENTER OF THE BOUNDARY MONUMENT WHICH IS A CONCRETE POST THAT IS 6 1/2-INCHES SQUARE AT THE TOP.  PROJECTS ABOUT 1.8 FEET.  WITH 1/2 CUT ON THE WEST SIDE OF THE MONUMENT.  STAMPED BOUNDARY MONUMENT 16-1/2 1960.  IT IS 20.1 FEET NORTHWEST OF A 6-INCH CEDAR TREE.  36.3 FEET SOUTH-SOUTHWEST OF A TRIPPLE TRUNK APPLE TREE.  56.0 FEET NORTHEAST OF A 6-INCH CEDAR TREE.  REFERENCE MARK NO. 1, A STANDARD DISK SET IN THE TOP OF A 10-INCH SQUARE CONCRETE MONUMENT, STAMPED BOUNDARY MONUMENT 16-1/2 NO 1 1960.  PROJECTS ABOUT 3 INCHES.  IT IS ABOUT 100 FEET SOUTH-SOUTHEAST OF A BRICK HOUSE.  ABOUT 100 FEET EAST OF A BRICK GARAGE.  MARK IS ABOUT 4 FEET LOWER IN ELEVATION THAN STATION DISK.  REFERENCE MARK NO. 2, A STANDARD DISK SET IN THE TOP OF A 10-INCH SQUARE CONCRETE MONUMENT, STAMPED BOUNDARY MONUMENT 16-1/2 NO 2 1960.  SET FLUSH WITH GROUND SURFACE.  IT IS 21.1 FEET SOUTHWEST OF A 6-INCH CEDAR TREE.  90.7 FEET NORTH OF POWERLINE POLE 6.  MARK IS ABOUT THE SAME ELEVATION AS STATION.  AZIMUTH MARK, IS A STANDARD DISK CEMENTED IN A DRILL HOLE IN THE SOUTH END OF A BRIDGE RAILING.  STAMPED BOUNDARY MONUMENT 16-1/2 1960.  IT IS 22.5 FEET SOUTHEAST OF THE CENTERLINE OF THE NORTH BOUND TRAFFIC LANE OF U.S. HIGHWAY 202.  68.0 FEET NORTH OF POWERLINE POLE 181.  96.0 FEET SOUTHWEST OF POWERLINE POLE 182.  TO REACH FROM THE STATION GO WEST ON GRAVEL ROAD FOR 0.5 MILE TO U.S. HIGHWAY 202.  TURN LEFT, SOUTH, AND GO 0.2 MILE TO BRIDGE AND MARK ON THE LEFT.  HEIGHT OF LIGHT ABOVE STATION MARK 29.76 METERS.                            STATION RECOVERY (1993)  RECOVERY NOTE BY US POWER SQUADRON 1993 (EWK) RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION.

markers.description: BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1962 (RWT) THE STATION IS THE CENTER OF THE INSCRIBED CROSS AT THE APEX AND CENTER OF BOUNDARY MONUMENT NO. 2.  LOCATED ABOUT 7.0 MILES WEST-NORTHWEST OF DELMAR, DELAWARE, 4.0 MILES NORTHEAST OF MARDELA SPRINGS, MARYLAND, 4.0 MILES SOUTH-SOUTHEAST OF SHARPTOWN, MARYLAND, IN A DENSE WOODS LAND.  THE PROPERTY ON THE DELAWARE SIDE IS OWNED BY MR. CLYDE COOPER AND THE PROPERTY ON THE MARYLAND SIDE IS OWNED BY THE ADKINS LUMBER COMPANY.  IT IS A 12-INCH SQUARE GRANITE STONE PROJECTING ABOUT 20 INCHES ABOVE THE SURFACE OF THE GROUND, WITH THE LETTER M INSCRIBED ON THE WEST SIDE AND P ON THE EAST SIDE.  THE MONUMENT HAS PREVIOUSLY BEEN BROKEN OFF FLUSH WITH THE SURFACE OF THE GROUND.  AT THIS DATE THE STONE WAS PLACED IN ITS EXACT LOCATION, A SMALL CROSS WAS INSCRIBED IN ITS TOP AND CENTER FOR TRAVERSE PURPOSE.  THE STONE WAS NOT REINFORCED ON THIS DATE.  IT IS PAINTED ORANGE ON TOP AND ABOUT HALF WAY DOWN ON THE MONUMENT.  OTHER THAN HAVE BEEN BROKEN OFF THE STONE IS IN GOOD CONDITION.  IT IS 30.2 FEET SOUTH-SOUTHEAST OF A STANDARD METAL WITNESS POST AND MARKER, 8.6 FEET NORTH OF A 12-INCH OAK TREE AND 6.0 FEET EAST OF A 30-INCH TRIANGULAR BLAZED OAK TREE.  A TRAVERSE CONNECTION WAS MADE TO TRIANGULATION STATION VINE, DISTANCE BEING (26.067 FEET) AND 7.945 METERS SOUTHEAST OF STATION VINE.                            STATION RECOVERY (2008)  RECOVERY NOTE BY GEOCACHING 2008 (WD) THE STATION IS AN 11.5 INCH BY 11.75 INCH DRESSED PORTLAND STONE SHAFT THAT PROJECTS ABOUT 18 INCHES.  IT IS LOCATED IN THICH BRUSH ON UNDEVELOPED PRIVATE PROPERTY ABOUT ABOUT 0.5 MILES SOUTH OF CROSS ROAD (ROAD 507 IN DELAWARE) AND ABOUT 0.42 MILES EAST OF NORRIS TWILLEY ROAD.  THE STONE HAS A CUT P ON THE EAST FACE AND A CUT M ON THE WEST FACE.  THE STONE IS ERECT AND STABLE, BUT THE CHISELED CROSS ON THE TOP IS BARELY DISCERNABLE.  THERE ARE TRACES OF ORANGE PAINT ON THE TOP, AND PROMINENT DRIP MARKS ALONG THE TOP TWO INCHES OF ALL THE SIDES.  THE STONE WAS REPAIRED UNDER THE SUPERVISION OF THE DELAWARE GEOLOGICAL SURVEY IN 1986, AND THE SEAM IS VISIBLE AROUND THE BASE OF THE STONE.  TO REACH FROM THE INTERSECTION OF US HIGHWAY 50 AND MARYLAND STATE HIGHWAY 54 NEAR MARDELA SPRINGS, MARYLAND, GO EAST ON STATE HIGHWAY 54 FOR ABOUT 2.4 MILES TO THE INTERSECTION WITH NORRIS TWILLEY ROAD.  TURN LEFT AND GO NORTHERLY ON NORRIS TWILLEY ROAD FOR ABOUT 2.3 MILES TO THE INTERSECTION WITH CROSS ROAD.  TURN RIGHT AND GO EAST ON CROSS ROAD FOR ABOUT 0.5 MILES TO THE STATE BOUNDARY LINE.  CONTINUE EAST, NOW ON ROAD 507, FOR ABOUT 0.10 MILES TO A GRAVEL DRIVE LEADING NORTH ON THE LEFT AND A FIELD ENTRANCE ON THE RIGHT.  PACK DUE SOUTH ACROSS A CORN FIELD FOR 700 YARDS TO THE WOODS LINE.  AT THE WOODS LINE, TURN RIGHT AND PACK SOUTHWEST THROUGH   THE WOODS FOR 350 YARDS TO THE STONE.  THE WOODS TO THE EAST OF THE STONE IS A MATURE MIXED HARDWOOD AND PINE FOREST.  TO THE WEST, THE WOODS IS A RECOVERING LOGGING AREA OF YOUNG WHITE PINE.

markers.description: BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 1976 (CLN) THE OLD MARYLAND-DELAWARE CROWN STONE WAS RECOVERED IN THE PRONE POSITION ABOUT 150 FEET SOUTHEAST OF ITS COMPUTED POSITION.  IT WAS RESET AT THIS DATE.  THE MONUMENT IS LOCATED IN A WOODED AREA ABOUT 6 MILES WEST OF BRIGGSVILLE, DELAWARE, 5 MILES NORTHEAST OF FEDERALSBURG, AND ON PROPERTY OWNED BY MR. SAMUEL G. MITCHELL.  MR. MITCHELL LIVES IN THE FIRST HOUSE TO THE SOUTHWEST OF THE MONUMENT.  TO REACH THIS AREA FROM THE INTERSECTION OF MAIN STREET AND CENTRAL AVENUE IN FEDERALSBURG, MARYLAND, GO EAST ON STATE HIGHWAY 318 WHICH IS E. CENTRAL AVENUE FOR 0.35 MILE TO A JUNCTION OF STATE HIGHWAY 318 AND 306.  KEEP LEFT AND GO NORTH-NORTHEAST ON STATE HIGHWAY 306 FOR 4.2 MILES TO A FORK, KEEP LEFT ON GRAVELED ROAD, GO NORTH-NORTHEAST FOR 0.5 MILE TO A POWER LINE POLE ON THE RIGHT AND THE AZIMUTH MARK, CONTINUE NORTH-NORTHEAST ON A GRAVELED ROAD FOR 0.2 MILE TO THE SOUTHWEST CORNER OF A WOODED AREA AND THE POINT ON THE RIGHT 250 FEET FROM THE SOUTHWEST CORNER OF THE TIMBER.  THE POINT IS MARKED BY A 1-INCH CUTCROSS IN THE TOP OF THE 12-INCH LIMESTONE MONUMENT.  IT HAS THE PENNSYLVANIA COAT OF ARMS CARVED IN THE EAST SIDE AND THE CALVERTS COAT OF ARMS CARVED ON THE WEST SIDE.  THE SUB-SURFACE MARK IS A MARYLAND-DELAWARE BOUNDARY DISK STAMPED N-S NO. 20 1976, SET IN A 10-INCH MASS OF CONCRETE 38 INCHES BELOW THE SURFACE.  THEY ARE 251 FEET NORTHEAST OF A TRIANGULAR BLAZED TREE AT THE POINT WHERE YOU LEAVE THE TRUCK, 84 FEET NORTH OF A WITNESS POST, 62 FEET SOUTH OF A WITNESS POST, 8 FEET SOUTHEAST OF A 14-INCH PINE TREE WITH A TRIANGULAR BLAZE, AND 8 FEET WEST OF A DIRT FIELD ROAD.

LOCATED ABOUT 6.5 MILES NORTHEAST OF FEDERALSBURG, MARYLAND, 6.5 MILES WEST-NORTHWEST OF BRIDGEVILLE, DELAWARE, IN A DENSE WOODS AND BRUSH AND ON PROPERTY OWNED BY MISS SADIE DE VORE.  IT IS A 12-INCH SQUARE GRANITE STONE PROJECTING ABOUT 30 INCHES ABOVE THE SURFACE OF THE GROUND, WITH THE LETTER M CUT IN ON ITS WEST SIDE AND P ON THE EAST SIDE, A SMALL CROSS WAS INSCRIBED IN THE TOP AND CENTER OF THE MONUMENT ON THIS DATE FOR TRAVERSE PURPOSE. IN GENERAL THE MONUMENT IS IN GOOD CONDITION.  IT IS 119.7 FEET SOUTHWEST OF A STANDARD METAL WITNESS POST AND MARKER.  TO REACH THE STATION FROM THE RAILROAD STATION IN BRIDGEVILLE, DELAWARE.  GO NORTHWEST ON STATE HIGHWAY 404 FOR 6.5 MILES TO A CROSSROAD, THIS IS ABOUT 1.05 MILE SOUTHEAST OF THE FOUNTAINVILLE, INTERSTATE LOOKOUT TOWER.  TURN LEFT AND GO SOUTHWEST ON A BLACKTOP ROAD FOR 1.05 MILE TO A NARROW GRADED ROAD ON THE RIGHT, WEST SIDE OF THE BLACKTOP ROAD.  TURN RIGHT AND GO WEST ON THE NARROW BLADED ROAD FOR 0.45 MILE TO A DRIVEWAY ON THE LEFT, SOUTH SIDE OF THE ROAD.  TURN LEFT AND GO SOUTH ON DRIVEWAY FOR ABOUT 200.0 FEET TO THE NORTHEAST CORNER OF FIELD, JUST AFTER PASSING A TRAILER HOUSE RESIDENCE ON THE LEFT.  CONTINUE SOUTH ON A DIM TRACK FIELD ROAD FOR 0.25 MILE TO THE SOUTHEAST CORNER OF A CULTIVATED FIELD AND NORTHWEST CORNER OF TIMBER AND A TRACK WOODS ROAD.  CONTINUE SOUTH-SOUTHWEST ON THE TRACK WOODS ROAD FOR 0.2 MILE TO A DEEP HOLE OFF THE WOODS ROAD TO THE LEFT, APPEARS TO HAVE BEEN AN OLD WELL AT ONE TIME AND A 10-INCH TRIANGULAR BLAZED PINE TREE AND A DIM TRACK WOODS ROAD ON THE LEFT.  TURN LEFT AND GO SOUTH ON THE DIM TRACK WOODS ROAD FOR 0.1 MILE TO A 10-INCH TRIANGULAR BLAZED OAK TREE, A STANDARD METAL WITNESS POST AND THE STATION.  A TRAVERSE CONNECTION WAS MADE TO TRIANGULATION STATION DE VORE, DISTANCE BEING (115.09 FEET) AND 35.081 METERS EAST-SOUTHEAST OF STATION DE VORE.

E. HARPER OF BRIDGEVILLE, DELAWARE.  POINT OBSERVED AND MEASURED TO WAS A CROSS MARK SCRIBED IN THE APPROXIMATE CENTER OF THE BASE OF THE MONUMENT.

STATION RECOVERY (1987)  RECOVERY NOTE BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 1987 (RGP) THE DESIGNATED MARK WAS RECOVERED WITH CHANGES NOTED BELOW -- THE BOUNDARY MONUMENT WAS RECOVERED AND WAS FOUND TO HAVE BEEN MOVED SLIGHTLY DURING THE CONSTRUCTION OF A LARGE DRAINAGE DITCH. IT WAS RESET BACK TO ITS POSITION INDICATED BY THE MOST RECENT INFORMATION AVAILABLE.  NO NEW DESCRIPTION IS REQUIRED. THERE IS A LONG, DEEP DRAINAGE DITCH ABOUT 3 METERS TO THE WEST OF THE STATION AND BETWEEN TRIANGULATION STATION HU1971 AND THIS MONUMENT. A TIE WAS MADE TO TRIANGULATION STATION HU1971.                            STATION RECOVERY (2009)  RECOVERY NOTE BY GEOCACHING 2009 (WD) BOUNDARY MONUMENT MILE 24 DEL MD IS A 12-INCH BY 12-INCH LIMESTONE SHAFT THAT PROJECTS 25 INCHES.  THE STONE IS LOCATED IN A CLEARED AREA ABOUT SIX FEET EAST OF THE EAST EDGE OF A LARGE NORTH-SOUTH DRAINAGE DITCH, AND ABOUT 330 YARDS EAST OF NOBLE ROAD.  THE STONE IS AN INTERMEDIATE MILE MARKER WITH A CUT M ON THE WEST FACE AND A CUT P ON THE EAST FACE.   THE STONE HAS SUFFERED A GREAT DEAL OF DAMAGE AND IS IN POOR CONDITION.  A LARGE PORTION OF THE TOP HALF OF THE STONE, COMPRISING ABOUT ONE-THIRD OF THE TOP SURFACE AND EXTENDING 18 INCHES   DOWN THE NORTH FACE, IS MISSING.  THE TOP IS IRREGULAR AND POCK-MARKED, AND A VERY LARGE CHIP IS MISSING FROM THE SOUTH EDGE OF THE TOP.  THERE IS ALSO A LARGE CHIP MISSING FROM THE SOUTHEAST VERTICAL EDGE OF THE SHAFT.  THERE IS SOME FLUTING VISIBLE ON THE WEST AND SOUTH FACES.  THE CUT M IS SLIGHTLY DAMAGED, AND THE CUT P IS VERY DAMAGED.  METAL WITNESS POSTS HAVE BEEN DRIVEN INTO THE GROUND ABUTTING THE NORTH AND EAST FACES OF THE STONE.  THE STONE IS ERECT AND STABLE, BUT THE PREVIOUSLY DESCRIBED SMALL CROSS IN THE TOP IS NOT VISIBLE.

markers.description: BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1961 (RWT) THE STATION IS THE SMALL CROSS INSCRIBED IN THE TOP AND CENTER OF BOUNDARY MONUMENT NO. 28. IT IS A 12-INCH SQUARE LIME STONE MONUMENT PROJECTING ABOUT 30 INCHES ABOVE THE SURFACE OF THE GROUND, PLUMB AND IN GENERAL GOOD CONDITION, WITH THE LETTER M CUT IN ON ITS WEST SIDE AND P ON THE EAST SIDE.  A SMALL CROSS WAS INSCRIBED IN ITS TOP AND CENTER FOR TRAVERSE PURPOSE ON THIS DATE.  TO REACH THE STATION FROM THE INTERSECTION OF STATE HIGHWAY 317 AND A BLACKTOP ROAD, THE OLD HIGHWAY, A CROSSROAD IN BURRSVILLE, MARYLAND.  GO SOUTH-SOUTHEAST ON THE OLD HIGHWAY FOR 0.15 MILE TO A SIDE ROAD RIGHT.  CONTINUE SOUTHEAST ON A BLACKTOP ROAD FOR 1.05 MILES TO A CROSSROAD.  TURN RIGHT AND GO SOUTHWEST ON A GRAVELED ROAD FOR 0.7 MILE TO A T-ROAD INTERSECTION*.  TURN RIGHT AND GO NORTH ON A GRAVELED ROAD FOR 0.15 MILE TO A GRAVELED DRIVEWAY, A STANDARD METAL WITNESS POST AT A FENCE CORNER AND THE AZIMUTH MARK ON THE LEFT, WEST, SIDE OF THE ROAD.  *CONTINUE WEST ON THE GRAVELED ROAD FOR 0.15 MILE TO A SIDE ROAD ON THE RIGHT, NORTH, AND A SMALL CULVERT ACROSS A SMALL DITCH ON THE LEFT, SOUTH, SIDE OF THE ROAD.  TURN LEFT ACROSS THE CULVERT AND GO SOUTH-SOUTHEAST ACROSS THE FIELD FOR 0.1 MILE TO THE NORTHEAST CORNER OF A WOODS, CONTINUE SOUTH ALONG THE EAST SIDE OF TIMBER FOR ABOUT 0.05 MILE TO  THE STATION.  A TRAVERSE CONNECTION WAS TO TRIANGULATION STATION PULP, DISTANCE BEING 66.799 METERS AND (219.156 FEET) NORTHEAST OF STATION PULP.

BOUNDARY MONUMENT NO. 25, A STANDARD METAL WITNESS POST AND MARKER. LOCATED IN A NORTH AND SOUTH FENCELINE BETWEEN TWO CULTIVATED FIELD, ABOUT 5.5 MILES EAST OF DENTON, MARYLAND AND ABOUT 1.0 MILE SOUTH OF THE SMALL SETTLEMENT OF BURRSVILLE, MARYLAND. TURN RIGHT AND GO SOUTH-SOUTHEAST ON A GRAVELED ROAD FOR 0.65 MILE TO A FORK. BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 1976 (CLN) THE OLD BOUNDARY MONUMENT WAS FOUND IN THE PRONE POSITION ABOUT 100 YARDS NORTH OF THE COMPUTED POSITION.  THE COMPUTED POSITION OF THIS MONUMENT WAS FOUND TO BE IN A CULTIVATED FIELD.  A NEW POINT WAS SELECTED TO THE SOUTH AND OUT OF ANY DANGER OF FARM OPERATIONS.  THE OLD MONUMENT WAS THEN RESET IN THE NEW LOCATION.  THE STATION IS LOCATED 2-1/2 MILES NORTH OF WHITLEYSBURG, 3-3/4 MILES SOUTHEAST OF GOLDSBORO, AND 4 MILES NORTHEAST OF GREENSBORO.  THE STATION IS ON ROAD RIGHT-OF-WAY.  TO REACH FROM THE INTERSECTION OF STATE HIGHWAYS 313, 314, AND 404 IN THE EAST EDGE OF GREENSBORO, GO EAST ON STATE HIGHWAY 314 FOR 100 FEET TO A SIDE ROAD LEFT.  TURN LEFT AND GO NORTHWEST ON A PAVED ROAD FOR 1.0 MILE TO A SIDE ROAD LEFT.  CONTINUE STRAIGHT AHEAD AND GO EAST ON ROAD 110 FOR 3.15 MILES TO A CROSSROADS AND THE STATION ON THE LEFT.  THE SURFACE MARK IS A 12-INCH SQUARE LIMESTONE MONUMENT WITH A P ON THE EAST SIDE AND AN M ON THE WEST SIDE WHICH IS CARVED IN THE STONE.  IT HAS A 1-INCH CARVED CROSS IN THE APEX OF THE STONE WHICH MARKS THE POINT INTERSECTED.  IT PROJECTS 24 INCHES ABOVE THE SURFACE.  THE SUB-SURFACE MARKER IS A MARYLAND-DELAWARE BOUNDARY DISK STAMPED N-S NO. 37 1976, SET IN AN 8-INCH MASS OF CONCRETE WHICH IS 42 INCHES BELOW THE SURFACE.  THEY ARE 225 FEET WEST OF THE CENTER OF HOLLY SPRINGS ROAD, 201 FEET WEST OF THE POWERLINE POLE, AND 3 FEET EAST OF A WITNESS POST.  FOR ADDITIONAL INFORMATION, SEE DESCRIPTION FOR STATION SCHULTIE 1962.                            STATION RECOVERY (2012)  RECOVERY NOTE BY DELAWARE COASTAL PROGRAM 2012 RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION.

BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1962 (RWT) STATION IS LOCATED IN A CULTIVATED FIELD, ON THE PROPERTY OWNED BY MR. STEWARD, ABOUT 1.0 MILE SOUTH OF WHITELEYSBURG, ABOUT 4.0 MILES SOUTHEAST OF GREENSBORO MARYLAND.
