USE WITH CAUTION - THE STONE HAS BEEN ROTATED 90 DEGREES FROM ITS POSITION AS DESCRIBED IN 1961 SO THAT THE SIDE WITH THE CUT  P  NOW FACES SOUTH AND THE SIDE WITH THE CUT  M  NOW FACES NORTH.  THE STONE IS BADLY CHIPPED, ESPECIALLY AT THE NORTHEAST AND NORTHWEST CORNERS OF THE TOP, AND THE NORTHEAST VERTICAL EDGE NEAR THE TOP.  THERE ARE SEVERAL HORIZONTAL SCRATCHES IN THE SOUTH FACE OF THE STONE BELOW THE CUT  P .  THE TOP IS WEATHERED AND ROUNDED.  THE STONE LEANS ABOUT FOUR DEGREES TO THE WEST.  THE STONE IS LOCATED IN THE NORTHWEST CORNER OF THE BACKYARD OF THE RESIDENCE AT NUMBER 447 WESTVILLE ROAD . IT ABUTS AN EIGHT-INCH, THREE-TRUNKED TREE, AND IS ABOUT 10 FEET WEST OF THE NORTHWEST CORNER OF A SMALL WOOD SHED.  TO REACH FROM THE INTERSECTION OF MD STATE HIGHWAY 302 AND MD STATE HIGHWAY 454 IN THE VILLAGE OF TEMPLETON, MD, GO SOUTHERLY ON MD STATE HIGHWAY 454 (MAY BE SIGNED AS  MARYDEL ROAD  OR  CROWN STONE ROAD ) FOR ABOUT 2.1 MILES TO THE INTERSECTION WITH MD STATE HIGHWAY 311 IN THE VILLAGE OF MARYDEL, MD-DE.  TURN RIGHT AND GO SOUTHWEST ON MD STATE HIGHWAY 311 FOR ABOUT 100 YARDS TO THE INTERSECTION WITH MAIN STREET.  TURN LEFT AND GO SOUTHEAST ON MAIN STREET FOR ABOUT 300 YARDS TO THE STATE BOUNDARY LINE.  CONTINUE SOUTHEAST AND SOUTH, NOW ON MAHAN CORNER ROAD FOR ABOUT 1.0 MILES TO THE INTERSECTION WITH GYRO ROAD.  BEAR RIGHT AND GO SOUTH ON GYRO ROAD FOR ABOUT 1.0 MILES TO THE INTERSECTION WITH WESTVILLE ROAD.  TURN RIGHT AND GO SOUTHWEST ON WESTVILLE ROAD FOR ABOUT 0.4 MILES TO THE DRIVEWAY LEADING TO HOUSE NUMBER 447.  TURN RIGHT AND GO NORTHWEST ON THE DRIVEWAY FOR ABOUT 300 YARDS TO THE HOUSE.  PACK NORTHWEST FOR ABOUT 150 FEET TO THE NORTHWEST CORNER OF THE BACK YARD AND THE STONE.                            STATION RECOVERY (2021)  RECOVERY NOTE BY US POWER SQUADRON 2021 (DLT) MONUMENT IS LEANING TO WEST DUE TO ADJACENT TREE GROWTH PUSHING THE MONUMENT AWAY.

BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1961 (RWT) BOUNDARY MONUMENT NO. 44, LOCATED IN THE WEST EDGE OF A CULTIVATED FIELD IN THE EAST EDGE OF A HEAVY WOODED AREA, 1.0 MILE SOUTH OF MARYDALE, 2.0 MILES NORTHEAST OF HENDERSON AND ON PROPERTY OWNED BY MR. SALVADOR SHEPENIS.  THE MONUMENT IS A 12 X 12 INCH LIMESTONE MONUMENT PROJECTING ABOUT 30 INCHES ABOVE THE GROUND SURFACE AND MARKED WITH THE LETTERS M AND P AND IN GOOD CONDITION EXCEPT SMALL CHIPS ON THE EDGES.  POINT OBSERVED TO AND TRAVERSED TO WAS A SMALL CROSS MARK SCRIBED ON THE APEX OF THE MONUMENT.  A TRAVERSE MEASUREMENT WAS MADE TO TRIANGULATION STATION SCHEPENIS 1961, DISTANCE BEING 26.555 FEET 8.0942 METERS.                            STATION RECOVERY (2008)  RECOVERY NOTE BY GEOCACHING 2008 (WD) BOUNDARY MONUMENT 44 DEL MD IS AN 11.75-INCH BY 12-INCH PORTLAND STONE (OOLITIC LIMESTONE) SHAFT THAT PROJECTS 29 INCHES.  THE STONE HAS A CUT  M  ON THE WEST FACE AND A CUT  P  ON THE EAST FACE.  THE STONE IS BADLY CHIPPED, ESPECIALLY ON THE SOUTH SIDE OF THE TOP AND ALONG THE TOP ONE-THIRD OF ALL FOUR VERTICAL EDGES.  THE TOP IS CHIPPED AND WEATHERED, AND THE PREVIOUSLY-DESCRIBED ETCHED CROSS IS NOT VISIBLE.  THE STONE IS ERECT AND STABLE.  THE STONE IS LOCATED IN EXTREMELY THICK BRUSH ABOUT 45 FEET WEST OF THE WEST EDGE OF A CULTIVATED FIELD, ABOUT EIGHT FEET WEST OF A METAL WITNESS POST, AND ABOUT THREE FEET NORTH OF A MULTI-TRUNKED TREE.  TO REACH FROM THE INTERSECTION OF MD STATE HIGHWAY 302 AND MD STATE HIGHWAY 454 IN THE VILLAGE OF TEMPLETON, MD, GO SOUTHERLY ON MD STATE HIGHWAY 454 (MAY BE SIGNED AS  MARYDEL ROAD  OR  CROWN STONE ROAD ) FOR ABOUT 2.1 MILES TO THE INTERSECTION WITH MD STATE HIGHWAY 311 IN THE VILLAGE OF MARYDEL, MD-DE.  TURN RIGHT AND GO SOUTHWEST ON MD STATE HIGHWAY 311 FOR ABOUT 100 YARDS TO THE INTERSECTION WITH MAIN STREET.  TURN LEFT AND GO SOUTHEAST ON MAIN STREET FOR ABOUT 300 YARDS TO THE STATE BOUNDARY LINE.  CONTINUE SOUTHEAST AND SOUTH, NOW ON MAHAN CORNER ROAD FOR ABOUT 1.0 MILES TO THE INTERSECTION WITH GYRO ROAD.  BEAR RIGHT AND GO SOUTH ON GYRO ROAD FOR ABOUT 0.19 MILES TO A DIRT DRIVEWAY LEADING WEST.  TURN RIGHT AND GO WEST ON THE DRIVEWAY FOR ABOUT 0.2 MILES TO A FARMHOUSE.  PACK NORTHEAST ACROSS A CULTIVATED FIELD FOR ABOUT 600 FEET TO A DRAINAGE DITCH.  CROSS THE DITCH AND PACK NORTHWEST FOR ABOUT 150 FEET TO A TREE LINE.  PACK WEST ALONG THE NORTH SIDE OF THE TREELINE FOR ABOUT 500 FEET TO THE SOUTHWEST CORNER OF A CULTIVATED FIELD.  PACK NORTH ALONG THE WEST SIDE OF THE FIELD FOR ABOUT 400 FEET TO THE STONE ON THE LEFT.

BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 1976 (CLN) THE OLD BOUNDARY MONUMENT WAS FOUND IN THE PRONE POSITION ABOUT 10 FEET NORTH OF ITS COMPUTED POSITION.  THE OLD MONUMENT WAS RESET AT THIS DATE.  THE MONUMENT IS LOCATED 1 MILE NORTH OF MARYDALE, MARYLAND, AND 1 MILE EAST OF KEPPLEVILLE, MARYLAND.  THE PROPERTY IS OWNED BY MR. MATHEW R. TARAILA.  TO REACH THIS AREA FROM THE POST OFFICE IN TEMPLEVILLE, GO EASTERLY ON STATE HIGHWAY 302 FOR 1.1 MILE TO THE MARYLAND-DELAWARE STATE LINE.  CONTINUE EAST FOR 0.25 MILE TO A GRAVELED ROAD ON THE RIGHT, TURN RIGHT GO SOUTHERLY ON THE GRAVELED ROAD FOR 0.95 MILE TO MR. TARAILAS HOUSE ON THE RIGHT, TURN RIGHT AND GO EAST PASSING TO THE RIGHT OF MR. TARAILAS HOUSE FOR 0.35 MILE TO THE RUINS OF AN OLD BUILDING IN THE CENTER OF A CULTIVATED FIELD, TURN LEFT AND GO SOUTHERLY ACROSS THE FIELD FOR 0.15 MILE TO AN EXTENDED TIMBER AREA AND THE END OF TRUCK TRAVEL.  PACK SOUTHERLY THROUGH WOODS FOR 0.05 MILE TO THE STATION.  BOUNDARY MONUMENT NUMBER 46 IS A 12 BY 12 INCH SQUARE LIMESTONE MONUMENT WITH A P ON THE EAST SIDE AND AN M ON THE WEST SIDE.  THE LIMESTONE POST IS SET ON A 2 X 2 FEET SQUARE CONCRETE BASE AND SET IN CONCRETE TO WHERE THE OLD MONUMENT IS PROJECTING 16 INCHES.  IT IS 22.7 FEET EAST OF A WITNESS POST, 12.5 FEET NORTHWEST OF A 20-INCH PINE TREE, AND 10 FEET WEST OF AN OLD FENCE LINE.  DUE TO WATER, THERE IS NO SUB-SURFACE DISK AT THIS POINT.  FOR ADDITIONAL INFORMATION, SEE DESCRIPTION FOR STATION TARAILA 1961.                            STATION RECOVERY (2007)  RECOVERY NOTE BY GEOCACHING 2007 (WD) RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION.
markers.stability: MARK OF QUESTIONABLE OR UNKNOWN STABILITY

markers.description: BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1961 (RWT) THE STATION IS LOCATED IN A DENSE WOODS AND LOW SWAMP AREA, ON PROPERTY OWNED BY MR. SZELESTEI, ABOUT 2.0 MILES SOUTHWEST OF HARTLY, DELAWARE AND ABOUT 1.5 MILES NORTHEAST OF TEMPLEVILLE, MARYLAND.  IT IS A 12-INCH SQUARE MONUMENT PROJECTING ABOUT 30 INCHES ABOVE THE SURFACE OF THE GROUND, BADLY ERODED AT THE BOTTOM, THE UPPER PART IS IN GOOD CONDITION, BUT SLIGHTLY OUT OF PLUMB.  IT IS 87.7 FEET SOUTHWEST OF A STANDARD METAL WITNESS POST AND MARKER, 79.0 FEET SOUTHWEST OF A 8-INCH TRIANGULAR BLAZED OAK TREE.  TO REACH STATION WONDER FROM THE POST OFFICE IN TEMPLEVILLE, MARYLAND.  GO EAST ABOUT 100 YARDS TO A SIDE ROAD LEFT.  TURN LEFT AND GO NORTH-NORTHEAST ON A GRAVELED ROAD FOR 2.0 MILES TO A TRIANGULAR BLAZED TREE ON THE RIGHT AT A PILE OF RUBBISH AND NO DUMPING SIGN AND A DIM TRACK ROAD.  TURN RIGHT AND GO SOUTH ON THE WOODS ROAD FOR 0.3 MILE TO A DIM CROSS ROAD AND A TRIANGULAR BLAZED TREE ON THE RIGHT IN A REASONABLE OPEN AREA IN THE WOODS.  TURN RIGHT AND GO EAST-NORTHEAST ON A WOODS ROAD FOR 0.1 MILE TO A FORK.  TAKE THE RIGHT FORK AND CONTINUE EAST ON THE WOODS ROAD FOR 0.15 MILE TO A FORK, ABOUT 100.0 FEET BEFORE REACHING THE CORNER OF A CULTIVATED FIELD AND AN OLD BRIDGE OVER A DITCH, THE BRIDGE IS IN POOR CONDITION.  TURN SHARP LEFT AND GO SOUTH-SOUTHWEST ON A TRACK WOODS ROAD FOR 0.3 MILE, KEEPING THE MAIN TRAVELED ROAD TO A TRIANGULAR BLAZED TREE ON THE LEFT.  TURN LEFT AND GO SOUTHEAST ON A VERY DIM TRACK WOODS ROAD FOR 0.15 MILE TO A STANDARD METAL WITNESS POST AND MARKER, THE BOUNDARY MONUMENT AND THE STATION.  A TRAVERSE CONNECTION WAS MADE TO TRIANGULATION STATION WONDER, DISTANCE BEING 25.228 METERS AND (82.70 FEET) SOUTHWEST OF STATION WONDER.                            STATION RECOVERY (2007)  RECOVERY NOTE BY GEOCACHING 2007 (WD) THE STONE IS ERECT AND STABLE.  TO REACH FROM THE INTERSECTION OF DELAWARE  STATE HIGHWAY 11 AND DELAWARE STATE HIGHWAY 44 IN HARTLY, GO SOUTHWEST ON DELAWARE STATE HIGHWAY 11 FOR ABOUT 1.5 MILES TO THE INTERSECTION WITH BUTTERPAT ROAD (MAY BE LABELED AS BUTTERNUT ROAD ON   SOME MAPS).  TURN RIGHT AND GO NORTHWEST ON BUTTERPAT ROAD FOR ABOUT 1.0 MILES TO HOUSE NUMBER 757 ON THE LEFT, AND A FARM ROAD LEADING WEST ON THE NORTH SIDE OF THE PROPERTY.  TURN LEFT AND GO WEST-SOUTHWEST ON THE FARM ROAD, ALONG THE NORTH SIDE OF A DITCH, FOR   ABOUT 0.55 MILES TO A PIPE CROSSING ON THE LEFT.  TURN LEFT, CROSS THE DITCH AND GO SOUTHWEST AND WEST ON A DIM TRACK ROAD FOR ABOUT 0.14 MILES TO A CLEARING IN THE WOODS, THE INTERSECTION OF SEVERAL TRACK ROADS, AND THE STONE.  THE PROPERTY OWNER LIVES AT THE LARGE FARMSTEAD 0.9 MILES NORTH-NORTHEAST OF THE STONE.

BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1961 (RWT) THE STATION IS LOCATED IN A DENSE WOODS AND VERY SWAMPY LAND, 2.0 MILES WEST OF HARTLY, DELAWARE, 2-1/2 MILES NORTH-NORTHEAST OF TEMPLEVILLE, MARYLAND AND ON PROPERTY OWNED BY MR. STEVE SZELESTEI.  THE BOUNDARY MONUMENT WAS RECOVERED BROKEN OR ERODED OFF WITH THE TOP PORTION LYING IN A PRONE POSITION.  THE REMAINING BASE IS BADLY ERODED.  THE TOP IS IN EXCELLENT CONDITION.  THE POINT MEASURED TO AND OBSERVED TO WAS A CROSS MARK SCRIBED IN THE FOUNDATION OF THE MONUMENT.  THE FOUNDATION IS LOCATED 35.0 FEET WEST-NORTHWEST OF A 12-INCH TRIANGULAR BLAZED MAPLE TREE AND 74.6 FEET WEST OF A STANDARD METAL WITNESS POST AND MARKER.  A TRAVERSE MEASUREMENT WAS MADE TO TRIANGULATION STATION SZELESTEI 1961 BEING 24.629 METERS WEST-NORTHWEST OF THE STATION.                            STATION RECOVERY (2007)  RECOVERY NOTE BY GEOCACHING 2007 (WD) THE STONE IS LOCATED IN A HEAVILY WOODED AREA, AND IS ERECT AND STABLE.  TO REACH FROM THE INTERSECTION OF US HIGHWAY 301 AND MARYLAND STATE HIGHWAY 300 (SUDLERSVILLE ROAD),  GO EASTERLY ON MD STATE HIGHWAY 300 FOR ABOUT 8.5 MILES TO THE INTERSECTION WITH ANDERSON CORNER ROAD.  TURN RIGHT AND GO SOUTHEAST ON ANDERSON CORNER ROAD FOR ABOUT 1.5 MILES TO THE STATE BOUNDARY LINE.  CONTINUE SOUTHEAST, NOW ON BUTTERPAT ROAD, FOR ABOUT 0.6 MILES TO THE SZELESTEI FARM ON THE RIGHT.  FROM THE NORTHWEST CORNER OF THE FARM YARD, PACK WEST FOR ABOUT 80 FEET TO AN EARTHEN CROSS-OVER OF AN EAST-WEST DRAINAGE DITCH.  TURN RIGHT AND PACK NORTH ALONG THE WEST SIDE OF A NORTH-SOUTH DRAINAGE DITCH FOR ABOUT 0.1 MILES TO A DIM TRACK ROAD LEADING WEST.  TURN LEFT AND PACK WESTERLY ALONG THE DIM TRACK ROAD FOR ABOUT 250 FEET TO THE STONE.

BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1962 (RWT) THE STATION IS THE SMALL CROSS INSCRIBED IN THE TOP AND CENTER OF THE BOUNDARY MONUMENT NO. 5.  LOCATED ABOUT 1.0 MILE EAST-SOUTHEAST OF SHARPTOWN, MARYLAND, ALONG THE EAST SIDE OF A NORTH AND SOUTH TRACK ROAD AND ON PROPERTY OWNED BY MR. RIDER.  IT IS A 12-INCH SQUARE GRANITE STONE PROJECTING ABOUT 30 INCHES ABOVE THE SURFACE OF THE GROUND, WITH THE COAT OF ARMS ON THE EAST AND WEST SIDES AND IS CHIPPED ON THE EAST SIDE NEAR THE TOP.  THE MONUMENT IS PLUMB AND IN GENERAL GOOD CONDITION. A SMALL CROSS WAS INSCRIBED IN ITS TOP AND CENTER FOR TRAVERSE PURPOSE.  IT IS 69.5 FEET NORTH OF A STANDARD METAL WITNESS POST AND MARKER, 42.0 FEET NORTH-NORTHWEST OF A TWIN TRUNKED TRIANGULAR BLAZED WHITE OAK TREE.  THE MONUMENT IS LOCATED ABOUT 5 MILES NORTH OF THE MARYLAND-DELAWARE CORNER BOUNDARY 6 MILES WEST-NORTHWEST OF DELMAR AND 1 MILE EAST OF SHARPTOWN.  IT IS ON ROAD RIGHT-OF-WAY.  A TRAVERSE CONNECTION WAS MADE TO TRIANGULATION STATION SHARPTOWN, DISTANCE BEING 19.240 METERS AND (63.123) FEET NORTH OF STATION SHARPTOWN.                            STATION RECOVERY (1962)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1962 RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION.                            STATION RECOVERY (1976)  RECOVERY NOTE BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 1976 (CLN) THE OLD MONUMENT WAS FOUND ABOUT 5 MILES EAST OF THE ORIGINAL POINT, IN THE PRONE POSITION IN THE FRONT OF A BARN OWNED BY MR. DONALD RALPH.  MR. RALPH HAD FOUND THE MONUMENT ALONG A ROAD WITH A CHAIN AROUND IT.  THE OLD MONUMENT HAS DEEP CHAIN MARKS AROUND THE UPPER PART OF IT.  THE OLD MONUMENT WAS RESET IN THE SAME POSITION AS IT WAS FOUND IN 1961.  THE MONUMENT IS LOCATED ABOUT 5 MILES NORTH OF THE MARYLAND-DELAWARE CORNER BOUNDARY 6 MILES WEST-NORTHWEST OF DELMAR AND 1 MILE EAST OF SHARPTOWN.  IT IS ON ROAD RIGHT-OF-WAY.  TO REACH FROM THE INTERSECTION OF STATE HIGHWAYS 313 AND 348 IN SHARPTOWN, GO EAST ON STATE HIGHWAY 348 FOR 1.7 MILES TO A SIDE ROAD LEFT AT THE STATE LINE.  TURN LEFT AND GO NORTH ON A DIRT ROAD FOR 0.75 MILE TO THE MONUMENT ON THE RIGHT.  THE SURFACE MARK IS A MARYLAND-DELAWARE CROWN STONE WITH A SMALL CROSS CUT IN THE APEX OF THE 12-INCH SQUARE LIMESTONE MONUMENT WHICH PROJECTS 2-1/2 FEET.  THE SUB-SURFACE IS MARKED WITH A MARYLAND-DELAWARE BOUNDARY DISK STAMPED N-S NO. 5 1976, SET IN AN 8-INCH MASS OF CONCRETE 42 INCHES BELOW THE SURFACE.  THEY ARE 66 FEET NORTH OF A WITNESS POST, 42 FEET NORTH OF A TRIANGULAR BLAZED TREE, 7 FEET EAST OF THE CENTER OF THE SAND ROAD, AND 1.3 FEET NORTHEAST OF A WITNESS POST.  FOR ADDITIONAL INFORMATION, SEE DESCRIPTION FOR TRIANGULATION STATION SHARPTOWN.                            STATION RECOVERY (1984)  RECOVERY NOTE BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 1984 THE MONUMENT IS LOCATED ABOUT 5 MILES NORTH OF THE MARYLAND-DELAWARE CORNER BOUNDARY 6 MILES WEST-NORTHWEST OF DELMAR AND 1 MILE EAST OF SHARPTOWN.  IT IS ON ROAD RIGHT-OF-WAY. TO REACH FROM THE INTERSECTION OF STATE HIGHWAYS 313 AND 348 IN SHARPTOWN, GO EAST ON STATE HIGHWAY 348 FOR 1.7 MILES TO A SIDE ROAD LEFT AT THE STATE LINE.  TURN LEFT AND GO NORTH ON A DIRT ROAD FOR 0.75 MILE TO THE MONUMENT ON THE RIGHT. THE SURFACE MARK IS A MARYLAND-DELAWARE CROWN STONE WITH A SMALL CROSS CUT IN THE APEX OF THE 12-INCH SQUARE LIMESTONE MONUMENT WHICH PROJECTS 2-1/2 FEET.  THE SUB-SURFACE IS MARKED WITH A MARYLAND-DELAWARE BOUNDARY DISK STAMPED N-S NO. 5 1976, SET IN AN 8-INCH MASS OF CONCRETE 42 INCHES BELOW THE SURFACE.  THEY ARE 66 FEET NORTH OF A WITNESS POST, 42 FEET NORTH OF A TRIANGULAR BLAZED TREE, 7 FEET EAST OF THE CENTER OF THE SAND ROAD, AND 1.3 FEET NORTHEAST OF A WITNESS POST.

BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1961 (RWT) THE STATION IS LOCATED IN A DENSE LOW SWAMPY WOODS LAND, ON PROPERTY OF MRS MARTHA G. WALMSLEY, ABOUT 6.0 MILES EAST OF SUDLERSVILLE, MARYLAND, 3.5 MILES NORTH-NORTHEAST OF TEMPLEVILLE, MARYLAND AND 2.5 MILES NORTHWEST OF HARTLY, DELAWARE.  IT IS A 12-INCH SQUARE STONE PROJECTING ABOUT 24 INCHES ABOVE THE SURFACE OF THE GROUND WITH THE COAT OF ARMS INSCRIBED ON THE EAST AND WEST SIDES.  THE MONUMENT HAS BEEN PREVIOUSLY BROKEN OFF ABOUT 10 INCHES ABOVE THE SURFACE OF THE GROUND AND IS PRESENTLY JUST SITTING IN ITS ORIGINAL PLACE.  THE UPPER PART IS IN GOOD CONDITION.  A SMALL CROSS WAS ETCHED IN ITS TOP AND CENTER FOR TRAVERSE CONNECTION AND INTERSECTION PURPOSE.  IT IS 76.3 FEET SOUTHEAST OF A STANDARD METAL WITNESS POST AND MARKER AND 66.5 FEET SOUTHEAST OF AN 18-INCH TRIANGULAR BLAZED TREE.  TO REACH STATION WALMSLEY FROM THE CROSSROADS IN SUDLERSVILLE.  GO EASTERLY ON STATE HIGHWAY 300 FOR 5.0 MILES TO A FORK AT A POINT WHERE HIGHWAY 300 CURVES TO THE LEFT.  CONTINUE STRAIGHT AHEAD ON A GRAVELED ROAD FOR 0.65 MILE TO A DIM TRACK WOODS ROAD.  TURN LEFT AND GO NORTHEAST ON THE WOODS TRACK ROAD FOR 0.25 MILE TO A WOODS CROSSROAD.  TURN SHARP RIGHT AND GO ABOUT 100.0 FEET TO A STANDARD METAL WITNESS POST AND THE STATION.  A TRAVERSE CONNECTION WAS MADE TO TRIANGULATION STATION WALMSLEY, DISTANCE BEING 24.170 METERS AND 79.30 FEET SOUTHEAST OF STATION WALMSLEY.                            STATION RECOVERY (2004)  RECOVERY NOTE BY US POWER SQUADRON 2004 (KN) MARK NOT FOUND.                            STATION RECOVERY (2008)  RECOVERY NOTE BY GEOCACHING 2008 (WD) THE STONE IS CROWN STONE WITH THE ARMORIAL CRESTS OF THE PENN FAMILY ON THE EAST FACE AND THE ARMORIAL CREST OF THE CALVERT FAMILY ON THE WEST FACE.  THE STONE IS IN OVERALL GOOD CONDITION, THOUGH IT LEANS TO THE SOUTH BY ABOUT ONE DEGREE.  THERE IS A LARGE CHIP MISSING FROM THE SOUTHWEST CORNER OF THE TOP, AND THE SOUTHEAST ONE-THIRD OF THE TOP IS BADLY DAMAGED.  THERE IS A VERY LARGE CHIP MISSING FROM THE NORTHEAST VERTICAL EDGE NEAR THE TOP.  THERE IS A HORIZONTAL CRACK AROUND THE ENTIRE STONE ABOUT SIX INCHES ABOVE THE GROUND.  TO REACH FROM THE INTERSECTION OF MD STATE HIGHWAYS 300 AND 313 IN SUDLERSVILLE, MD, GO EASTERLY ON MD STATE HIGHWAY 300 FOR ABOUT 5.2 MILES TO THE INTERSECTION WITH ANDERSON CORNER ROAD.  TURN RIGHT AND GO SOUTHEAST ON ANDERSON CORNER ROAD FOR ABOUT 1.0 MILES TO THE SOUTHWEST CORNER OF A LARGE PASTURE ON THE EAST SIDE OF THE ROAD. FROM THE SOUTHWEST CORNER OF THE PASTURE, PACK NORTHEAST FOR ABOUT 600 FEET TO THE SOUTHEAST CORNER OF THE PASTURE, THEN PACK NORTHWEST FOR ABOUT 400 FEET TO A DRAINAGE DITCH RUNNING NORTHEAST THROUGH THE WOODS.  PACK NORTHEAST ALONG THE SOUTH SIDE OF THE DITCH FOR ABOUT 300 FEET (UNTIL REACHING HIGHER GROUND PAST THE SWAMP TO THE SOUTH), AND THEN PACK SOUTHEAST THROUGH THE WOODS FOR ABOUT 700 FEET TO THE STONE.  THE PROPERTY OWNER LIVES AT MAR DEL VIEW FARM, ABOUT 0.65 MILES NORTHWEST OF THE STONE.

BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1961 (RWT) BOUNDARY MONUMENT NO. 51 IS LOCATED IN A NORTH AND SOUTH PROPERTY FENCE LINE, 3.0 MILES NORTHWEST OF HARTLY, DELAWARE, 5.0 MILES WEST-SOUTHWEST OF KENTON, DELAWARE, 6.0 MILES EAST OF SUDLERSVILLE AND ON PROPERTY OWNED BY MRS. EARNEST FORD.  BOUNDARY MONUMENT NO. 51 IS A 12 X 12 INCH LIMESTONE MONUMENT WITH THE LETTERS M AND P ON THE EAST AND WEST SIDES AND PROJECTS ABOUT 20 INCHES ABOVE THE GROUND SURFACE.  THE MONUMENT IS FIRMLY SET AND IS IN EXCELLENT CONDITION EXCEPT THE CORNERS ARE SLIGHTLY CHIPPED.  IT IS LOCATED 1.5 FEET WEST OF A NORTH AND SOUTH FENCE LINE, 3.0 FEET NORTH OF A LARGE LONE WILD CHERRY TREE AND 97.0 FEET NORTH OF A FIELD ENTRANCE.  THE POINT OBSERVED AND MEASURED TO WAS A CROSS MARK SCRIBED IN THE APEX OF THE MONUMENT.  A TRAVERSE CONNECTION WAS MADE TO TRIANGULATION STATION FORD 1961, DISTANCE BEING 25.783 METERS 84.59 FEET.                            STATION RECOVERY (2004)  RECOVERY NOTE BY US POWER SQUADRON 2004 (KN) REFERENCED CHERRY IS NOW A HOLLOW STUMP, MONUMENT IS 131.4 FEET N OF THE CENTERLINE OF HIGHWAY 300.

BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1961 (RWT) THE STATION IS LOCATED IN A DENSE WOODED AREA AND ON PROPERTY OWNED BY MR. R. DUNNING, ABOUT 5.0 MILES SOUTHEAST OF MILLINGTON, MARYLAND AND 5.0 MILES WEST OF KENTON, DELAWARE.  IT IS A 12-INCH SQUARE STONE MONUMENT PROJECTING ABOUT 32 INCHES ABOVE THE SURFACE OF THE GROUND WITH THE LETTER M INSCRIBED ON THE WEST SIDE AND P ON THE EAST SIDE.  THE MONUMENT WAS FOUND LYING IN A PRONE POSITION.  IT WAS PLUMBED AND INTERSECTED WITH A SMALL CROSS ETCHED IN ITS TOP AND CENTER.  TO REACH STATION DUNNING FROM THE CROSSROADS IN SUDLERSVILLE.  GO EASTERLY ON STATE HIGHWAY 300 FOR 3.0 MILES TO A SIDE ROAD ON THE LEFT, NORTH, SIDE OF THE HIGHWAY.  TURN RIGHT AND GO NORTH AND NORTHEAST ON A GRAVELED ROAD FOR 0.9 MILES TO A CROSSROAD.  CONTINUE NORTHEAST ON A BLACKTOP ROAD FOR 2.7 MILES TO A FARM ROAD ON THE RIGHT HAND SIDE OF THE ROAD.  TURN RIGHT AND GO EAST ON THE GRAVELED FARM ROAD FOR 0.15 MILE TO A BOARD GATE AT THE NORTHEAST CORNER OF FARM HOUSE.  PASS THROUGH THE BOARD GATE, TURN RIGHT AND GO SOUTH THROUGH THE BARN LOT, PASSING TO THE WEST SIDE OF BARN AND IMPLEMENT SHED, TO A GATE AT THE SOUTHWEST CORNER OF BARN LOT.  PASS THROUGH THE GATE AND GO EAST DOWN A FARM LANE FOR 0.15 MILE TO THE WEST EDGE OF PASTURE AT THE END OF THE LANE. TURN SOUTH ON A DIM TRACK ROAD ACROSS PASTURE LAND AND GO 0.35 MILE TO THE SOUTHEAST CORNER OF PASTURE AND EDGE OF TIMBER, A STANDARD METAL WITNESS POST AND THE STATION.  A TRAVERSE CONNECTION WAS MADE TO A TRIANGULATION STATION DUNNING, DISTANCE BEING *66.100 METERS AND (216.863) FEET WEST-SOUTHWEST OF STATION DUNNING.  *TRAVERSED WITH NON-STANDARDIZED TAPES AS MONUMENT HAD FALLEN OVER SINCE OBSERVATIONS WERE MADE AT WHICH TIME THE MONUMENT WAS IN A PRONE POSITION ALSO.                            STATION RECOVERY (1977)  RECOVERY NOTE BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 1977 (RGP) THE MARYLAND DELAWARE BOUNDARY MONUMENT NO. 52 WAS FOUND IN A PRONE POSITION AND WAS RESET USING THE 1961 DISTANCE AND DIRECTION.  TO REACH STATION DUNNING FROM THE POST OFFICE IN KENTON, DELAWARE, GO WESTERLY ON STATE HIGHWAY 30 FOR 3.35 MILES TO A SIDE ROAD RIGHT. TURN RIGHT AND GO NORTHWEST ON COUNTY ROAD 95 FOR 0.55 MILE TO ROAD 140 ON THE RIGHT.  CONTINUE NORTHWEST ON COUNTY ROAD 95 FOR 1.6 MILES TO A T-INTERSECTION ON THE RIGHT.  (ROAD 95 TURNS RIGHT).  CONTINUE AHEAD, NORTHWEST ON ROAD 96 FOR 0.5 MILE TO A ROAD FORK.  KEEP LEFT AND GO WEST ON ROAD 93 FOR 0.5 MILE TO A FARM ROAD LEFT.  TURN LEFT AND GO SOUTHEAST ON THE FARM BUILDINGS FOR ABOUT 0.15 MILE TO MR. DUNNINGS FARM BUILDINGS.  PICK WAY THROUGH THE FARM BUILDINGS FOR ABOUT 0.15 MILE TO A GAP IN A WOODED FENCE LINE.  BEAR RIGHT AND GO SOUTHERLY ACROSS A CULTIVATED FIELD FOR 0.35 MILE TO THE SOUTHWEST EDGE OF THE FIELD AND THE STATION.  BOUNDARY MONUMENT NO. 52, IS A 12-INCH SQUARE LIMESTONE MONUMENT ABOUT 48 INCHES IN LENGTH, SET IN A MASS OF CONCRETE ALLOWING IT TO PROJECT ABOUT 20-INCHES.  THE UNDERGROUND MARK IS A STANDARD TRIANGULATION STATION DISK STAMPED N-S NO. 52 1977, SET IN A 10-INCH MASS OF CONCRETE 3-1/2 FEET BELOW THE SURFACE OF THE GROUND.  IT IS 10 FEET SOUTHEAST OF A TRIPLE TRUNKED HOLLOW BIRCH TREE, 5.3 FEET NORTHWEST OF A WITNESS POST, 220 FEET WEST OF A CULTIVATED FIELD, AND THERE IS A M CHISELED ON THE WEST FACE OF THE MONUMENT AND A P ON THE EAST FACE.  A TRAVERSE CONNECTION WAS MADE FROM STATION DUNNING TO A SMALL CROSS CUT IN THE TOP CENTER OF THIS MONUMENT, DISTANCE BEING 66.100 METERS (216.86 FEET) WEST-SOUTHWEST OF STATION DUNNING.                            STATION RECOVERY (2008)  RECOVERY NOTE BY GEOCACHING 2008 (WD) THE STONE IS AN INTERMEDIATE MILE MARKER WITH A CUT  M  ON THE WEST FACE AND A CUT  P  ON THE EAST FACE, AND IS IN FAIR CONDITION.  THERE ARE VERY LARGE CHIPS MISSING FROM ALL FOUR CORNERS OF THE TOP, AND THE STONE IS SPLIT (ALTHOUGH REPAIRED) VERTICALLY ALONG ITS NORTH-SOUTH AXIS.  BOTH THE CUT LETTERS ARE DAMAGED DUE TO CHIPPING. THE TOP IS ROUGHLY PYRAMIDAL, AND SOME FLUTING IS VISIBLE ON THE EAST AND WEST FACES.  THE STONE IS 18 FEET NORTH-NORTHEAST OF A 20-INCH DIAMETER TREE AND SIX FEET EAST-NORTHEAST OF A METAL WITNESS POST. TO REACH FROM THE INTERSECTION OF MD STATE HIGHWAYS 300 AND 313 IN SUDLERSVILLE, MD, GO EASTERLY ON MD STATE HIGHWAY 300 FOR ABOUT 3.0 MILES TO THE INTERSECTION WITH STILLTOWN ROAD.  TURN LEFT AND GO NORTHEASTERLY ON STILLTOWN ROAD FOR ABOUT 3.5 MILES TO THE FARMSTEAD AT MAILBOX NUMBER 1921 ON THE RIGHT.  (THE FARMSTEAD IS LOCATED ABOUT 0.4 MILES SOUTHWEST OF THE STATE BOUNDARY LINE, AND IS ACROSS STILLTOWN ROAD FROM JACKSON DIAMOND FARM LANE LEADING NORTHWEST.) FROM THE, GO SOUTHEAST ON A FARM LANE FOR ABOUT 300 YARDS TO A PROMINENT, DOUBLE-TRUNK TREE IN A TREE LINE THAT RUNS SOUTHWEST NORTHEAST.  UPON REACHING THE TREE LINE, PACK DUE SOUTH ACROSS (OR AROUND) ANOTHER LARGE FIELD FOR ABOUT 0.25 MILES TO THE SOUTH-MOST POINT IN THE FIELD.  CONTINUE SOUTHWEST THOUGH THE WOODS FOR ABOUT 200 FEET TO THE STONE.

BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1961 (RWT) THE STATION IS LOCATED IN A CULTIVATED FIELD ALONG THE EAST SIDE OF A NORTH AND SOUTH FENCE LINE, 5.0 MILES WEST OF KENTON, DELAWARE, 5.0 MILES EAST-SOUTHEAST OF MILLINGTON, MARYLAND AND ON PROPERTY OWNED BY MR. GEORGE PEARSONS.  TO REACH STATION PEARSONS FROM THE CROSSROADS IN SUDLERSVILLE, GO EAST ON STATE HIGHWAY 300 FOR 3.0 MILES TO A GRAVELED ROAD LEFT, TURN LEFT AND GO NORTH ON THE GRAVELED ROAD FOR 0.8 MILE TO A CROSSROAD, CONTINUE NORTH ON THE MACADAM ROAD FOR 3.25 MILE TO THE END OF THE MACADAM AND THE STATE LINE AND THE STATION LOCATED ON THE LEFT AS DESCRIBED.  THE MONUMENT IS A 12 X 12 INCH GRANITE STONE MARKED M AND P AND PROJECTS ABOUT 30 INCHES ABOVE THE GROUND SURFACE.  THE MONUMENT WAS RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION.  IT IS 1.2 FEET EAST OF A NORTH AND SOUTH FENCE LINE, 30.2 FEET SOUTH OF A NORTHEAST FENCE CORNER AND 115.0 FEET WEST OF THE APPROXIMATE CENTER OF A GRAVELED ROAD.  A TRAVERSE CONNECTION WAS MADE TO TRIANGULATION STATION PEARSONS, DISTANCE OF 120.761 METERS (396.20) FEET NORTH OF STATION PEARSONS.                            STATION RECOVERY (2004)  RECOVERY NOTE BY US POWER SQUADRON 2004 (KN) FROM THE CROSSROADS OF 313 AND 300 IN SUDLERSVILLE, PROCEED E ON HIGHWAY 300 FOR 3 MILES TO STULLTOWN ROAD, NOW PAVED.  TURN LEFT FOR .8 MILE TO PETER'S CORNER ROAD, CROSS AND CONTINUE N FOR 3.25 MILES TO THE STATE LINE, THEN APPROXIMATELY .1 MILE N TO THE T INTERSECTION OF PEARSON'S GROVE ROAD AND DOWNS CHAPEL ROAD AND THE STATION ON THE LEFT. THE STONE MONUMENT IS 385.6 FEET W OF A CONCRETE FOUNDATION LOCATED IN THE SE CORNER OF THE ABOVE INTERSECTION.  THE MONUMENT LEANS SEVERAL DEGREES E.                            STATION RECOVERY (2009)  RECOVERY NOTE BY GEOCACHING 2009 (WD) BOUNDARY MONUMENT MILE 53 DEL MD IS AN 11-INCH BY 12.25-INCH LIMESTONE SHAFT THAT PROJECTS 30 INCHES. THE STONE IS LOCATED ON THE BOUNDARY BETWEEN THE YARD OF A PRIVATE RESIDENCE AND A CULTIVATED FIELD, ABOUT 115 YARDS WEST-SOUTHWEST OF THE INTERSECTION OF PEARSON S GROVE ROAD AND DOWN S CHAPEL ROAD (THE INTERSECTION KNOWN AS PEARSON S GROVE).  THE STONE IS AN INTERMEDIATE MILE MARKER WITH A CUT M ON THE WEST FACE AND A CUT P ON THE EAST FACE. THE STONE HAS SUFFERED ONLY MINOR DAMAGE AND IS IN VERY GOOD CONDITION. THE EDGES OF THE TOP ARE CHIPPED, ESPECIALLY ALONG THE EAST EDGE AND AT THE NORTHEAST AND SOUTHEAST CORNERS OF THE TOP. THERE IS A SHALLOW, HORIZONTAL SCRAPE ON THE WEST FACE ABOUT EIGHT INCHES ABOUT THE GROUND. THE TOP IS WEATHERED BUT RETAINS SOME SEMBLANCE OF ITS ORIGINAL PYRAMIDAL SHAPE. THE CUT M IS SLIGHTLY DAMAGED, AND THE CUT P IS IN GOOD CONDITION. THERE IS SOME FLUTING VISIBLE ON ALL FOUR FACES, BUT NOT ON THE TOP. THE STONE IS STABLE, BUT LEANS TO THE EAST ABOUT FIVE DEGREES.

BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1961 (RWT) THE STATION IS LOCATED IN A NORTH AND SOUTH FENCE LINE IN A CULTIVATED FIELD, 4-1/2 MILES EAST-SOUTHEAST OF MILLINGTON, MARYLAND, 6.0 MILES NORTHWEST KENTON, DELAWARE AND ON PROPERTY OWNED BY MR. GEORGE MOFFETT.  IT IS A 12 X 12 INCH GRANITE STONE MARKED M AND P AND PROJECTS ABOUT 30 INCHES ABOVE THE GROUND SURFACE.  IT IS LEANING SLIGHTLY SOUTH AND HAS SEVERAL BULLET MARKS ON THE SIDES AND IS CHIPPED SLIGHTLY ON THE CORNERS.  THE MONUMENT IS CONSIDERED IN GOOD CONDITION.  IT IS ABOUT 125 YARDS NORTH-NORTHEAST OF TRIANGULATION MOFFETT.  TO REACH STATION MOFFETT FROM THE CROSSROADS IN SUDLERSVILLE, GO EAST ON STATE HIGHWAY 300 FOR 3.0 MILES TO A GRAVELED SIDE ROAD LEFT, TURN LEFT AND GO NORTH ON THE GRAVELED ROAD FOR 0.9 MILE TO A CROSSROADS, CONTINUE NORTH ON THE MACADAM ROAD FOR 3.0 MILES TO THE STATE LINE AND THE END OF THE PAVEMENT, CONTINUE NORTH ON THE GRAVELED ROAD FOR 0.15 MILE TO FORKS OF THE ROAD, TAKE THE LEFT FORK AND GO NORTH ON THE GRAVELED ROAD FOR 0.55 MILE TO A DRIVEWAY RIGHT, TURN RIGHT AND GO NORTHEAST ON THE GRAVELED DRIVEWAY FOR 0.55 MILE TO THE RESIDENCE OF MR. MOFFETTS ON THE LEFT, CONTINUE NORTH FOR ABOUT 150 FEET TO THE SOUTHEAST CORNER OF THE BARN, TURN RIGHT AND GO EAST ON A FIELD LANE FOR 0.05 MILE TO A GATE, TO REACH THE AZIMUTH MARK FROM THIS POINT, GO NORTH ALONG THE EAST SIDE OF A NORTH AND SOUTH FENCE LINE FOR 0.2 MILE TO THE EAST AND WEST FENCE LINE AND THE AZIMUTH MARK IS LOCATED IN THE NORTHWEST FENCE CORNER, CONTINUE EAST THROUGH THE GATE AND GO EAST ON THE FIELD LANE FOR 0.15 MILE TO THE STATION ON THE RIGHT.  A TRAVERSE CONNECTION WAS MADE TO TRIANGULATION STATION MOFFETT, DISTANCE BEING 119.353 METERS (391.58) FEET NORTH-NORTHEAST OF STATION MOFFETT.                            STATION RECOVERY (2008)  RECOVERY NOTE BY GEOCACHING 2008 (WD) BOUNDARY MONUMENT 54 DEL MD IS AN 11.75-INCH BY 11.5-INCH PORTLAND STONE (OOLITIC LIMESTONE) SHAFT THAT PROJECTS 31 INCHES.  THE STONE HAS A CUT  M  ON THE WEST FACE AND A CUT  P  ON THE EAST FACE.  THERE ARE MINOR CHIPS MISSING FROM ALL VERTICAL AND HORIZONTAL EDGES.  THE TOP IS WEATHERED AND ROUNDED.  THE STONE LEANS ABOUT SEVEN DEGREES TO THE SOUTH.  THE STONE IS LOCATED IN EXTREMELY THICK BRUSH ABOUT 15 FEET EAST OF THE EAST EDGE OF A CULTIVATED FIELD, AND ABOUT SIX FEET NORTH OF A MULTI-TRUNKED, 20-INCH DIAMETER TREE.  TO REACH FROM THE THREE-WAY INTERSECTION OF STILLTOWN ROAD, BLANCO ROAD AND DOWNS CHAPEL ROAD KNOWN AS PEARSONS CORNER, GO NORTHWESTERLY ON BLANCO ROAD FOR ABOUT 0.5 MILES TO THE INTERSECTION WITH PROVIDENCE LANE.  TURN RIGHT AND GO NORTH ON PROVIDENCE LANE FOR ABOUT 0.5 MILES TO THE RED BRICK RESIDENCE AND FARMSTEAD AT THE END OF THE LANE.  PACK EASTERLY FROM THE MOST NORTHEASTERLY BUILDING OF THE FARMSTEAD FOR ABOUT 300 YARDS TO THE NORTHWEST CORNER OF WOODS.  CONTINUE EAST ALONG THE NORTH EDGE OF THE WOODS (AND SOUTH EDGE OF A CULTIVATED FIELD) FOR ABOUT 260 YARDS TO THE SOUTHEAST CORNER OF THE FIELD AND A BRUSH- AND TREE-LINE LEADING NORTH.  PACK NORTH ALONG THE BRUSH LINE FOR ABOUT 100 YARDS TO THE STONE.

BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1962 (RWT) THE STATION IS THE SMALL CROSS INSCRIBED IN THE TOP AND CENTER OF BOUNDARY MONUMENT NO. 6.  LOCATED ABOUT 7.0 MILES WEST-SOUTHWEST OF LAUREL, DELAWARE, 1.75 MILES SOUTHEAST OF GALESTOWN, MARYLAND AND 1.0 MILE EAST OF SHARPTOWN, MARYLAND AND ON PROPERTY OWNED BY THE WALLER ESTATE.  THE ESTATE IS BEING TAKEN CARE OF BY A MRS MARY SPICER WHO LIVES IN LAUREL, DELAWARE.  IT IS A 12-INCH SQUARE GRANITE STONE, CHIPPED ON ALL FOUR CORNERS NEAR THE TOP, WITH THE LETTER M CUT IN ON ITS WEST SIDE AND THE LETTER P ON THE EAST SIDE.  THE MONUMENT IS PLUMB AND IN GENERAL GOOD CONDITION AND PROJECTS ABOUT 24 INCHES ABOVE THE SURFACE OF THE GROUND.  IT IS 33.0 FEET WEST OF THE NORTHWEST CORNER OF A CULTIVATED FIELD.  A SMALL CROSS WAS INSCRIBED IN ITS TOP AND CENTER FOR TRAVERSE PURPOSE ON THIS DATE.  A TRAVERSE CONNECTION WAS MADE TO TRIANGULATION STATION COD, DISTANCE BEING 48.458 METERS AND (158.98) FEET WEST OF STATION COD.                            STATION RECOVERY (1984)  RECOVERY NOTE BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 1984 (CLN) THE STATION WAS RECOVERED AS DESCRIBED.  THE MARYLAND-DELAWARE BOUNDARY MONUMENT 6 MAY SERVE AS A REFERENCE MARK.  IT IS A 12-INCH LIMESTONE POST WITH AN M CARVED ON THE WEST SIDE AND A P CARVED ON THE EAST SIDE AND IT PROJECTS 0.5 METER (1.6 FT) A SMALL CROSS CUT IN THE APEX OF THE MONUMENT WAS THE POINT CUT IN.  THE STATION IS LOCATED 172.5 METERS (565.9 FT) NORTH FROM THE CENTER OF WATER STREET, 28.0 METERS (91.9 FT) SOUTH FROM THE WITNESS POST, 3.8 METERS (12.5 FT) SOUTH-SOUTHEAST FROM THE 24-INCH OAK TREE AND 0.6 METERS (2.0 FT) NORTH FROM THE EDGE OF THE CULTIVATED FIELD.                            STATION RECOVERY (2007)  RECOVERY NOTE BY GEOCACHING 2007 (WD) THE STONE IS ERECT AND STABLE, AND PROJECTS 33 INCHES.  IT IS LOCATED ABOUT 625 FEET NORTH OF THE CENTERLINE OF LINE ROAD, 28 FEET WEST OF A GRAVEL DRIVEWAY THAT LEADS TO HOUSE 217-J, AND AT THE NORTH END OF A SPLIT-RAIL FENCE.                            STATION RECOVERY (2013)  RECOVERY NOTE BY DELAWARE COASTAL PROGRAM 2013 RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION.

BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 1976 (CLN) A SEARCH WAS MADE FOR THE OLD BOUNDARY MONUMENT NUMBER 7 AND NO EVIDENCE OF IT WAS FOUND.  IT IS BELIEVED THAT IT SANK INTO THE SWAMP SOMETIME IN THE PAST.  A NEW MONUMENT WAS SET AT THIS DATE.  IT IS ABOUT 23.5 FEET NORTH OF THE COMPUTED POSITION AND OUT OF THE SWAMP AREA.  IT IS LOCATED 1-1/2 MILES NORTHEAST OF SHARPTOWN, 0.8 MILE SOUTHEAST OF THE SMALL SETTLEMENT OF GALESTOWN AND ON THE NORTH BANK OF THE NANTICOKE RIVER.  THE PROPERTY IS OWNED BY MR. FRED BOYCE.  MR. BOYCE LIVES IN REHOBOTH BEACH, DELAWARE.  TO REACH THE STATION FROM THE SMALL TOWN OF SHARPTOWN, MARYLAND, GO NORTH-NORTHWEST ON STATE HIGHWAY 313, FOR 0.8 MILE TO A SIDE ROAD RIGHT, TURN RIGHT AND GO EAST AND NORTHEAST ON A PAVED ROAD FOR 1.35 MILES TO A PAVED CROSSROAD IN GALESTOWN, TURN RIGHT AND GO EAST ON A PAVED ROAD ACROSS A SMALL DAM FOR 0.15 MILE TO A FORK JUST AFTER CROSSING THE DAM.  KEEP RIGHT AND GO SOUTH AND SOUTHEAST ON A PAVED ROAD FOR 0.55 MILE TO WHERE THE MAIN ROAD CURVES EAST AND A FARM ROAD STRAIGHT AHEAD SOUTH, CONTINUE STRAIGHT AHEAD SOUTH ON FARM ROAD FOR 0.2 MILE TO MR. BOYCES FARM AND END OF TRUCK TRAVEL.  FROM THIS POINT AT THE FARM PACK SOUTHEAST ACROSS THE PASTURE AND TO THE SWAMP FOR ABOUT 0.15 MILE TO A SMALL POINT OF LAND THAT EXTENDS OUT IN THE NANTICOKE RIVER AT AN OLD BOAT DOCK AND TRIANGULATION STATION BOYCE.  TO REACH THE BOUNDARY MONUMENT MARKER FROM THIS POINT, GO DUE EAST TO THE SWAMP FOR 152 METERS TO THE POINT WHICH WAS SELECTED.  THE SURFACE MARK IS A MARYLAND-DELAWARE BOUNDARY DISK STAMPED N-S NO. 7 1976, SET IN THE TOP OF A 12-INCH ROUND CONCRETE POST PROJECTING 1 FOOT.  THE SUB-SURFACE MARKER IS A MARYLAND-DELAWARE BOUNDARY DISK STAMPED N-S NO. 7 1976 SET IN AN 8-INCH MASS OF CONCRETE 42-INCHES BELOW THE SURFACE.  THEY ARE 50 FEET NORTH OF THE NORTH SHORE OF THE NANTICOKE RIVER, 23.6 FEET SOUTHWEST OF A 15-INCH GUM TREE WITH A TRIANGLE BLAZE, 20.2 FEET SOUTHEAST OF A 14-INCH GUM TREE WITH A TRIANGLE BLAZE, AND 7 FEET NORTH OF A WITNESS POST.  FOR ADDITIONAL INFORMATION, SEE DESCRIPTION FOR TRIANGULATION STATION BOYCE 1962.                            STATION RECOVERY (2018)  RECOVERY NOTE BY MD DEPT OF NAT RES 2018 (LCW) RECOVERED PROJECTING 30 CM (12 INCHES) ABOVE MARSH ON NORTH SIDE OF NANTICOKE RIVER IN DORCHESTER COUNTY MD.  THE MARK IS SURROUNDED BY STAKES FOR INSTRUMENT STABILIZATION.  IT IS BEST REACHED BY BOAT FROM THE RAMP AT SHARPTOWN AND WILL ALSO REQUIRE HIP BOOTS TO CROSS THE MARSH.  CAUTION SHOULD BE USED AS THE GROUND IS VERY SOFT.  THE MARK IS NORTH OF THE NORTHERLY OF 2 MD-DE STEEL PILES THAT MARK THE STATE LINE ACROSS THE RIVER.  A CARSONITE WITNESS POST HAS BEEN SET ON THE SOUTH SIDE OF THE MONUMENT AND IS VISIBLE FROM THE RIVER.

markers.description: BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1962 (RWT) BOUNDARY MONUMENT NO. 8 IS A 12 X 12 INCH LIMESTONE MONUMENT MARKED WITH THE LETTERS M AND P AND PROJECTS ABOUT 26 INCHES ABOVE THE SURFACE OF THE GROUND.  IT IS LOCATED IN A HEAVY WOODED AREA, 1.0 MILE NORTH OF THE SMALL VILLAGE OF GALESTOWN, 2-1/2 MILES NORTH-NORTHEAST OF SHARPTOWN, 6.0 FEET SOUTH OF A 12-INCH PINE TREE, 74.0 FEET NORTHWEST OF A U.S. COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY METAL WITNESS POST AND MARKER AND ON PROPERTY OWNED BY MR. H.F. PORTER.  THE CONDITION OF THE MONUMENT IS CONSIDERED POOR AS THE TOP PORTION OF THE MONUMENT HAS BEEN BROKEN OFF AT GROUND LEVEL, BUT IS STILL SETTING IN PLACE ON THE FOUNDATION.  THE POINT OBSERVED AND MEASURED TO WAS A SMALL CROSS MARK SCRIBED ON THE APEX OF THE MONUMENT.  A TRAVERSE CONNECTION WAS MADE TO TRIANGULATION STATION PORTER 1962 DISTANCE BEING (74.196 FEET) 22.615 METERS.                            STATION RECOVERY (2009)  RECOVERY NOTE BY GEOCACHING 2009 (WD) BOUNDARY MONUMENT 8 DEL MD IS  A 12-INCH BY 12-INCH LIMESTONE SHAFT THAT PROJECTS 26 INCHES.  THE STONE IS LOCATED IN HEAVY WOODS ABOUT 0.54 MILES EAST OF THE GALESTOWN-RELIANCE ROAD (MD STATE HIGHWAY 531), ABOUT 0.62 MILES SOUTH OF DELAWARE LINE ROAD (ELLIS MILL ROAD ON THE DELAWARE SIDE OF THE BOUNDARY), AND ABOUT 650 FEET SOUTH OF THE SOUTHWEST CORNER OF A CULTIVATED FIELD ON LAND OWNED BY THE RESIDENT OF 28965 ELLIS MILL ROAD.  THE STONE IS AN INTERMEDIATE MILE MARKER WITH A CUT M ON THE WEST FACE AND A CUT P ON THE EAST FACE. THE STONE HAS SUFFERED SOME DAMAGE, BUT IS IN GENERALLY GOOD CONDITION. THERE IS A LARGE CHUNK MISSING FROM THE SOUTHEAST CORNER OF THE SHAFT AT GROUND LEVEL, A LARGE CHIP MISSING FROM THE NORTHWEST CORNER OF THE TOP, AND EIGHT LARGE POCK-MARKS IN THE TOP. BOTH THE CUT  M  AND THE CUT  P  ARE IN GOOD CONDITION. THE PREVIOUSLY DESCRIBED CROSS IN THE TOP IS NO LONGER VISIBLE. THE STONE IS BROKEN AT THE GROUND LEVEL, BUT THE TOP 26 INCHES RESTS FAIRLY SECURELY ON THE BURIED BASE.  TO REACH FROM THE INTERSECTION OF MARYLAND STATE HIGHWAY 392 AND THE GALESTOWN-RELIANCE ROAD IN THE VILLAGE OF RELIANCE, DE, GO SOUTH ON THE GALESTOWN-RELIANCE ROAD FOR ABOUT 3.6 MILES TO THE INTERSECTION WITH DELAWARE LINE ROAD LEADING EAST. TURN LEFT AND GO EAST ON DELAWARE LINE ROAD FOR ABOUT 0.3 MILES TO THE STATE BOUNDARY LINE. CONTINUE EAST, NOW ON ELLIS MILL ROAD, FOR ABOUT 0.33 MILES TO A GRAVEL DRIVEWAY LEADING SOUTH TO HOUSE 28965.  THE LAND OWNER AT THAT ADDRESS WILL PROVIDE ADDITIONAL TO REACH INSTRUCTIONS.

BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1934 TO REACH THE STATION FROM SALISBURY, MD., GO NW ON HIGHWAY 213, 11.4 MILES TO THE INTERSECTION WITH STATE HIGHWAY 313, AT MARDELA SPRINGS, HERE TURN RIGHT N ON 313 AND GO 6.0 MILES TO SHARPTOWN, AT THE INTERSECTION OF 313 AND THE LAUREL ROAD, CONTINUE ON 313, 0.5 MILE AND TURN LEFT AND GO 1.05 MILES OVER BRIDGE ACROSS NANTICOKE RIVER TO A T-ROAD, LEAVE HIGHWAY 313 HERE AND TURN RIGHT AND GO 1.35 MILES TO GALESTON AND CROSS ROADS.  TURN RIGHT OVER BRIDGE AND FILL AND CONTINUE NORTHERLY FOR 2 MILES.  (THIS POINT IS 50 YARDS S OF MR. WHITES HOUSE).  TURN SHARP RIGHT, AT N END OF PINE WOODS, AND GO S 0.1 MILE ALONG FARM ROAD TO STATION, AND BOUNDARY MONUMENT.  BOUNDARY MONUMENT NO. 9, IS A 12 X 12 INCH SQUARE MONUMENT, PROJECTING 30 FROM THE GROUND SURFACE.  IT IS 9.7 FEET WEST OF A FIELD ROAD.  39.7 FEET SOUTHEAST OF A STANDARD METAL WITNESS POST.  4.0 FEET SOUTHEAST OF A 12 INCH OAK TREE. JOSEPH ELLIS.  BOUNDARY MONUMENT NO. 9, A 12 X 12 INCH SQUARE MONUMENT, PROJECTING 30 INCHES FROM THE GROUND SURFACE. IT IS LOCATED ALONG THE EAST PROPERTY LINE AT THE REAR OF THE RESIDENCE AT 5833 GALESTOWN-RELIANCE ROAD (MARYLAND STATE HIGHWAY 531), AND ON THE WEST EDGE OF A FIELD ROAD ALONG THE WEST EDGE OF A CULTIVATED FIELD.  THERE IS A US GEOLOGICAL SURVEY BENCH MARK DISK MOUNTED IN THE TOP OF THE STONE. markers.description: BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 1976 (CLN) THE OLD MARYLAND-DELAWARE BOUNDARY MONUMENT NUMBER 34 WAS RECOVERED AND FOUND IN GOOD CONDITION WITH THE DISK FOR TRIANGULATION STATION WHITELEY 1934 IN THE APEX OF THE MONUMENT.  THE MONUMENT WAS FOUND TO BE 8 FEET TO THE EAST OF THE BOUNDARY LINE.  THEREFORE, IT WAS REMOVED FROM ITS POSITION AND RESET ON THE COMPUTED STATE LINE. THE TRIANGULATION DISK WAS REMOVED AND A MODERN MARYLAND-DELAWARE BOUNDARY DISK PLACED IN THE APEX OF THE MONUMENT.  THE MARK IS LOCATED ABOUT 1/4 MILE SOUTHEAST OF WHITELEYSBURG, 3 1/4 MILES EAST-SOUTHEAST OF GREENSBORO AND 18-1/2 MILES SOUTHWEST OF DOVER.  IT IS PROPERTY OWNED BY MR. MARVIN SENNEY AND MR. SENNEY LIVES JUST NORTHEAST OF THE STATION.  TO REACH FROM THE INTERSECTION OF MARYLAND STATE HIGHWAY 314, DELAWARE STATE HIGHWAY 12, DELAWARE COUNTY ROAD 452 AND 59 IN THE SMALL TOWN OF WHITELEYSBURG, GO SOUTH-SOUTHWEST ON DELAWARE STATE HIGHWAY 12 FOR 0.1 MILE TO THE END OF TRUCK TRAVEL IN WET WEATHER.  TURN LEFT AND GO EAST ACROSS A CULTIVATED FIELD FOR 0.2 MILE TO THE STATION JUST WEST OF A WOODED AREA AND IN THE CULTIVATED FIELD.  THE MARK IS A 12-INCH LIMESTONE POST SET IN A CONCRETE BASE PROJECTING 18-INCHES.  THE MARYLAND-DELAWARE BOUNDARY DISK WHICH IS SET IN A DRILL HOLE IN THE APEX OF THE MONUMENT IS STAMPED N-S NO. 34 1976.  A SIMILAR DISK WAS SET IN AN 8-INCH MASS OF CONCRETE 60 INCHES DIRECTLY BELOW THE SURFACE DISK AND IT IS STAMPED THE SAME AS THE SURFACE DISK.  THE MONUMENT IS 174 FEET NORTHWEST OF A WITNESS POST, 171 FEET NORTH OF A FIELD DITCH, 101 FEET WEST OF A WOODED AREA, AND 2 FEET WEST OF A WITNESS POST.  FOR ADDITIONAL INFORMATION, SEE DESCRIPTION FOR STATION WHITELEY 1934.                            STATION RECOVERY (2002)  RECOVERY NOTE BY MARYLAND DOT HIGHWAY ADMINISTRATION 2002 (SFK) RECOVERED AS DESCRIBED.                            STATION RECOVERY (2007)  RECOVERY NOTE BY GEOCACHING 2007 (WD) FOUND THE STATION IN GOOD CONDITION IN THE SOUTHWEST CORNER OF AN OVERGROWN ORCHARD AND ABOUT 100 FEET NORTHEAST OF A FARM ROAD.  THE STATION IS SURROUNDED BY THREE I-BEAMS AND AN ORANGE CARSONITE WITNESS POST.  TO REACH FROM THE INTERSECTION OF DELAWARE STATE HIGHWAY 12, WHITELEYSBURG ROAD AND WHITES LANE IN THE SMALL TOWN OF WHITELEYSBYRG, GO SOUTHWEST ON WHITES LANE FOR ABOUT 0.2 MILES TO A FARM ROAD LEADING SOUTHEAST.  TURN LEFT AND GO SOUTHEAST ON THE FARM ROAD FOR ABOUT 0.15 MILES TO THE SOUTHWEST CORNER OF THE ORCHARD AND THE STONE AND STATION ON THE LEFT.

markers.description: BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1958 (JCE) STATION IS LOCATED IN THE NORTHWEST PART OF WILMINGTON, ABOUT 1/4 MILE NORTHEAST OF THE BRANDYWINE RIVER, ACROSS THE STREET FROM SALESIANUM SCHOOL AND IN BRANDWINE PARK.  STATION IS 49 FEET SOUTHWEST OF THE EDGE OF SIDEWALK AND 43 FEET NORTHWEST OF THE APPROXIMATE CENTER OF BLACKTOP DRIVE.  THE MARK IS FLUSH WITH THE GROUND AND THE DISK IS STAMPED BRANDYWINE 1958.  REFERENCE MARK NO. 1 IS 19 FEET NORTHWEST OF THE APPROXIMATE CENTER OF BLACKTOP DRIVE.  THE MARK IS FLUSH WITH THE GROUND AND THE DISK IS STAMPED BRANDYWINE NO 1 1958.  REFERENCE MARK NO. 2 IS 70 FEET SOUTHWEST OF THE EDGE OF SIDEWALK.  THE MARK IS FLUSH WITH THE GROUND AND THE DISK IS STAMPED BRANDYWINE NO 2 1958.  AZIMUTH MARK IS 6 FEET WEST OF AN 18 INCH OAK TREE, 5 FEET EAST OF WITNESS POST AND AT THE NORTH EDGE OF A LARGE MOUND OF DIRT.  THE MARK IS FLUSH WITH THE GROUND AND THE DISK IS STAMPED BRANDYWINE 1958.  TO REACH STATION FROM THE POST OFFICE AT 12TH AND MARKET STREET IN WILMINGTON, GO WEST ON 12TH STREET FOR 0.2 MILE TO WASHINGTON STREET.  TURN RIGHT ON WASHINGTON STREET AND GO 0.5 MILE TO WEST 18TH STREET.  TURN LEFT ON WEST 18TH STREET FOR 0.35 MILE TO SALESIANUM SCHOOL ON THE RIGHT AND STATION ON THE LEFT AS DESCRIBED.  TO REACH AZIMUTH MARK FROM STATION FOLLOW BLACKTOP ROADS ACROSS PARK FOR 0.3 MILE IN A WEST SOUTHWESTERLY DIRECTION TO AZIMUTH MARK AS DESCRIBED.  HEIGHT OF LIGHT ABOVE STATION MARK 30 METERS.                            STATION RECOVERY (1959)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1959 AT WILMINGTON. AT WILMINGTON, 85 YARDS NORTHWEST OF INTERSECTION OF WEST 18TH AND NORTH BROOM STREET, ACROSS W. 18TH STREET FROM SALESIANIUM SCHOOL, IN BRANDYWINE PARK, 55 FEET SOUTHWEST OF SOUTHWEST CURB OF W. 18TH STREET, 42 FEET NORTHWEST OF CENTER LINE OF A BLACK TOP DRIVE LEADING SOUTHWEST, 80.9 FEET NORTHEAST OF RM NO. 1, 71.9 FEET SOUTHEAST OF RM NO. 2, ABOUT LEVEL WITH W. 18TH STREET AND SET IN THE TOP OF A CONCRETE POST ABOUT 2 INCHES UNDERGROUND.                            STATION RECOVERY (1964)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1964 (JCB) STATION WAS RECOVERED AS DESCRIBED AND ALL MARKS EXCEPT THE AZIMUTH MARK WERE FOUND TO BE IN GOOD CONDITION.  THE AZIMUTH MARK HAS BEEN DESTROYED BY CONSTRUCTION.                            STATION RECOVERY (1981)  RECOVERY NOTE BY UNIVERSITY OF DELAWARE 1981 MARK NOT FOUND.                            STATION RECOVERY (1984)  RECOVERY NOTE BY LOCAL ENGINEER (INDIVIDUAL OR FIRM) 1984 (CT) BRANDYWINE 1958 RECOVERED GOOD.  RMS 1 AND 2 WERE NOT RECOVERED AFTER A 20 MIN. SEARCH AND ARE BELIEVED TO BE LOST.                            STATION RECOVERY (1984)  RECOVERY NOTE BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 1984 (CLN) THE STATION MARK WAS RECOVERED AND FOUND IN GOOD CONDITION.  BOTH REFERENCE MARKS AND AZIMUTH MARK WERE FOUND DESTROYED.  NEW REFERENCE MARKS THREE AND FOUR WERE ESTABLISHED.  THERE IS NO SUITABLE LOCATION AVAILABLE TO SET A NEW AZIMUTH MARK AT THIS DATE.  STATION BRANDYWINE A 1959 IS NO LONGER VISIBLE FROM THE GROUND.  IT IS VISIBLE FROM THE STATION REFERENCE MARKS, SO IT WAS INTERSECTED FROM BOTH REFERENCE MARKS THREE AND 4.  A COMPLETE NEW DESCRIPTION FOLLOWS.  THE STATION IS LOCATED IN THE NORTH PART OF WILMINGTON AT THE BRANDYWINE CITY PARK.  OWNERSHIP--CITY OF WILMINGTON.  TO REACH THE STATION FROM THE INTERSECTION OF INTERSTATE HIGHWAY 95 AND U.S HIGHWAY 202 IN THE NORTH PART OF WILMINGTON, GO SOUTH ON U.S HIGHWAY 202 (CONCORD PIKE) FOR 0.4 KM (0.25 MI) TO A CROSSROAD.  TURN RIGHT AND GO SOUTHWEST ON BROOM STREET FOR 0.8 KM (0.50 MI) TO A T-INTERSECTION.  TURN RIGHT AND GO NORTHWEST ON WEST EIGHTEENTH STREET FOR 0.1 KM (0.05 MI) TO THE STATION ON THE LEFT IN THE NORTH EDGE OF A PARKING AREA. markers.description: BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 1984 (CLN) THE STATION MARK WAS RECOVERED AND FOUND IN GOOD CONDITION AS DESCRIBED IN THE MOST RECENT INFORMATION AVAILABLE.  THE STATION WAS FOUND TO BE IN DANGER OF DESTRUCTION.  THE CITY OF WILMINGTON IS CONSTRUCTION A NEW SIDEWALK WHERE THE STATION IS PRESENTLY SET. SEVERAL POINTS WERE SET PRIOR TO ANY CONSTRUCTION TO ASSURE THE RE-ESTABLISHMENT OF THE STATION AFTER THE NEW SIDEWALK WAS SET.  THE CITY OF WILMINGTON THEN REMOVED THE OLD SIDEWALK AND IMMEDIATELY SET A NEW SIDEWALK.  THE ENTIRE PROJECT TOOK THE CITY OF WILMINGTON LESS THAN HALF OF A DAY.  AFTER THE NEW SIDEWALK WAS IN PLACE THE STATION DISK WAS REPLACED IN ITS ORIGINAL POSITION AS FOUND EARLIER IN THAT DAY.  A COMPLETE NEW DESCRIPTION FOLLOWS.  THE STATION IS LOCATED IN THE NORTH OF WILMINGTON, 1/2 KM NORTHEAST FROM THE BRANDYWINE CREEK AND 1/4 KM SOUTHEAST FROM INTERSTATE HIGHWAY 95.  OWNERSHIP--CITY OWNED PROPERTY.  TO REACH FROM THE INTERSECTION OF INTERSTATE HIGHWAY 95 AND U.S HIGHWAY 202 (CONCORD PIKE) IN THE NORTH PART OF WILMINGTON, GO SOUTH ON U.S HIGHWAY 202 FOR 0.4 KM (0.25 MI) TO A CROSSROADS. TURN RIGHT AND GO SOUTHWEST ON NORTH BROOM STREET FOR 0.8 KM (0.50 MI) TO A T-INTERSECTION AND THE STATION TO THE SOUTHWEST OF THE INTERSECTION.  THE STATION MARK IS A STANDARD, NGS, STATION MARK DISK STAMPED---BRANDYWINE A 1959 1984---.  SET IN A DRILL HOLE NEAR THE CENTER OF THE SIDEWALK ALONG THE SOUTHWEST SIDE OF EIGHTEENTH STREET. IT IS 17.9 METERS (58.7 FT) SOUTHEAST FROM THE MOST SOUTHEAST ANCHOR BOLT FOR THE SOUTHEAST CORNER OF A BUS STOP WAITING SHELTER, 4.7 METERS (15.4 FT) EAST FROM A 36-INCH BIRCH TREE AND 7.8 METERS (25.6 FT) NORTHWEST FROM ANOTHER 36-INCH BIRCH TREE. IT IS ALSO ABOUT 154.5 METERS (506.9 FT) SOUTH FROM THE SOUTH END OF A BRIDGE WHERE WEST EIGHTEENTH STREET CROSSES INTERSTATE HIGHWAY 95. FOR ADDITIONAL INFORMATION SEE THE DESCRIPTION FOR STATION BRANDYWINE 1958. BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 1974 (LAL) THE STATION IS LOCATED ABOUT 4.5 MILES NORTHEAST OF WHALEYSVILLE, MARYLAND AND 2.0 MILES WEST OF SELBYVILLE, DELAWARE, ON PROPERTY OWNED BY MR. JOHN R. DAVIS OF SELBYVILLE, DELAWARE.  TO REACH THE STATION FROM THE POST OFFICE IN SELBYVILLE, DELAWARE, GO SOUTHWEST ON CHURCH STREET FOR 0.6 MILE TO THE JUNCTION WITH U.S. HIGHWAY 113.  TURN RIGHT AND GO NORTH ON U.S. HIGHWAY 113 FOR 0.2 MILE TO THE JUNCTION WITH STATE ROAD 54.  TURN LEFT AND GO NORTHWEST ON STATE ROAD 54 FOR 0.25 MILE TO A Y-INTERSECTION, BEAR LEFT AND GO SOUTH ON THE PAVED ROAD FOR 0.1 MILE TO A CROSSROAD, CONTINUE SOUTH ON THE PAVED ROAD FOR 0.1 MILE TO A CROSSROAD AND WOODEN BRIDGE, CONTINUE SOUTHERLY CROSSING BRIDGE FOR 0.85 MILE TO THE STATE LINE AND A FIELD ROAD ON THE RIGHT AND STATION DAVIS ON THE RIGHT. TURN RIGHT AND GO WEST ON THE FIELD ROAD FOR 0.5 MILE TO DAVIS RM 3 ON THE LEFT, CONTINUE WEST ON THE FIELD ROAD FOR 0.2 MILE TO AN OLD ABANDONED HOUSE, BEAR LEFT AND GO WEST CROSSING A FIELD FOR 0.2 MILE TO THE WEST END OF THE FIELD AND THE STATION.  THE STATION MARK IS A STANDARD DISK STAMPED BRIAR 1974.  THE DISK IS BRAIZED TO THE TOP OF A 4-INCH GALVANIZED PIPE THAT PROJECTS 9 INCHES ABOVE THE GROUND SURFACE.  IT IS 18 FEET NORTH-NORTHEAST OF A 10-INCH OAK TREE, 11 FEET WEST OF THE WEST EDGE OF THE FIELD, 7 FEET EAST OF A DITCH AND 4 FEET NORTH OF A METAL WITNESS POST.  REFERENCE MARK 1, A STANDARD DISK STAMPED BRIAR NO 1 1974.  THE DISK IS BRAIZED TO THE TOP OF A 4-INCH GALVANIZED PIPE THAT PROJECTS 9 INCHES ABOVE THE GROUND SURFACE.  IT IS 11 FEET EAST OF A TRIPLE TRUNK OAK TREE 20 INCHES IN DIAMETER, 11 FEET EAST OF THE DITCH AND 8 FEET WEST OF THE WEST EDGE OF THE FIELD.  REFERENCE MARK 2, A STANDARD DISK STAMPED BRAIR NO 2 1974.  THE DISK IS BRAIZED TO THE TOP OF A 4-INCH GALVANIZED PIPE THAT PROJECTS 7 INCHES ABOVE THE GROUND SURFACE.  IT IS 11 FEET WEST OF THE WEST EDGE OF THE FIELD, 7 FEET EAST OF THE DITCH AND 7 FEET NORTH OF A 10-INCH WHITE OAK TREE.  DAVIS RM 3 SERVES AS AN AZIMUTH MARK, IT IS A STANDARD DISK STAMPED DAVIS NO 3 1974, SET IN THE TOP OF A 12-INCH CYLINDRICAL CONCRETE MONUMENT THAT PROJECTS 3 INCHES ABOVE THE GROUND SURFACE.  IT IS 11 FEET SOUTHWEST OF THE CENTER OF THE FIELD ROAD, 9 FEET NORTHWEST OF A 14-INCH PINE TREE AND 3 FEET NORTHEAST OF A METAL WITNESS POST.  HEIGHT OF LIGHT ABOVE STATION MARK 1.21 METERS.                            STATION RECOVERY (1976)  RECOVERY NOTE BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 1976 (CLN) UNABLE TO MEASURE BETWEEN RMS.  THE STATION AND ALL MARKS WERE RECOVERED AND FOUND IN GOOD CONDITION AS DESCRIBED IN THE 1974 DESCRIPTION.  A SHORTER DISTANCE OF 0.30 FEET OR 0.090 METERS WAS NOTED TO REFERENCE MARK ONE.  A DIFFERENCE OF 12 MINUTES AND 7 SECONDS IN DIRECTION WAS ALSO NOTED TO IT.  IT IS BELIEVED THAT THE REFERENCE MARK MAY HAVE BEEN DISTURBED BY FARM OPERATIONS SOMETIME IN THE PAST.  IT IS NOW SOLID AND IN GOOD CONDITION.  THE DISTANCES AND DIRECTIONS TO REFERENCE MARK TWO WERE WITHIN CLOSE AGREEMENT WITH THE 1974 OBSERVATIONS.  THE 1974 DESCRIPTION IS ADEQUATE.  THE MARYLAND-DELAWARE E-W LINE BOUNDARY MONUMENT NUMBER 12 WAS SET AT THIS DATE, SEE DESCRIPTION THEREOF.  AIRLINE DISTANCE AND DIRECTION FROM NEAREST TOWN 2-1/2 MILES WEST OF SELBYVILLE.

markers.description: BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1933 (GLA) THIS STATION IS LOCATED NEAR THE WATERS EDGE AT BROADKILL BEACH, DELAWARE.  SURFACE, UNDERGROUND, AND REFERENCE MARKS ARE STANDARD BRONZE DISKS SET IN CONCRETE .  REFERENCE MARK NO.1 IS NW OF THE STATION.  IT PROJECTS 8 INCHES AND IS 60 FEET S OF THE HIGH WATER LINE.  REFERENCE MARK NO.2 IS SW OF THE STATION.  IT PROJECTS 8 INCHES AND IS 18 FEET W OF THE CENTER LINE OF THE ROAD.  MARK IS 2 FEET N OF A SMALL CEDAR.  TO REACH FROM MILFORD, DELAWARE--BEGIN AT THE PAVED CROSSROADS 1/2 MILE E OF MILFORD AND GO S 11.3 MILES TO DIRT ROAD ON THE LEFT AND LARGE YELLOW SIGN READING BROADKILL BEACH.  TURN LEFT ON DIRT ROAD, GO 3.2 MILES AND TAKE LEFT FORK.  GO 1.0 MILE TO THE END OF THE ROAD AND STATION WILL BE BOUND ON THE RIGHT OPPOSITE THE END OF THE ROAD.  STATION IS 90 FEET S OF THE HIGH WATER LINE AND 27 FEET E OF THE CENTER LINE OF THE ROAD.  MARK PROJECTS 4 INCHES.                            STATION RECOVERY (1943)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1943 (FLG) RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION AS DESCRIBED EXCEPT FOR THE FOLLOWING DISCREPANCIES--  1.  THE ROAD IS NOW PAVED AND THE STATION IS 9 METERS E OF THE END OF THE PAVEMENT.  2.  THE MARK IS NOW 2.0 FEET BELOW THE SURFACE OF THE GROUND.  3.  REFERENCE MARK 1 COULD NOT BE FOUND AS A HOUSE HAD BEEN BUILT OVER THE DESCRIBED POSITION.  DISTANCE FROM THE STATION TO REFERENCE MARK 2 CHECKED WITHIN 0.04 FEET.                            STATION RECOVERY (1945)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1945 (TBR) THE STATION IS ON BROADKILL BEACH, ON THE E SIDE OF THE MACADAM HIGHWAY LEADING DIRECTLY INTO THE SETTLEMENT AND TERMINATING AT THE BEACH, 472 FEET FROM THE NEAR ABUTMENT OF THE BRIDGE ACROSS THE CREEK, 65 FEET FROM THE HIGH-WATER LINE, 28.3 FEET FROM THE CENTER LINE OF THE HIGHWAY, AND 5.9 FEET NW OF ELECTRIC POWER POLE NEAREST BEACH.  IT IS COVERED BY 1 FOOT OF SAND.  STATION MARK IS A BRONZE STATION DISK SET IN CONCRETE.  SUBSURFACE MARK IS A BRONZE STATION DISK SET IN CONCRETE.  REFERENCE MARK 1 WAS DESTROYED BY WAVE ACTION.  REFERENCE MARK 2 IS A BRONZE REFERENCE DISK SET IN CONCRETE.  IT IS SW AND ACROSS THE ROAD FROM THE STATION, ALSO ACROSS THE ROAD FROM THE N CORNER OF THE GENERAL STORE OWNED BY O.C. BEIDEMAN, 287.5 FEET NE OF NEAR ABUTMENT OF BRIDGE, 19.2 FEET FROM THE CENTER LINE OF THE ROAD, AND PROJECTS 4 INCHES ABOVE SURFACE OF SAND.  SMALL CEDAR TREE REFERRED TO IN ORIGINAL DESCRIPTION HAS BEEN CUT DOWN.  MARK IS 2 FEET NE OF THE STUMP.  REFERENCE MARK 3 IS A BRONZE REFERENCE DISK SET IN CONCRETE.  IT WAS ESTABLISHED ACROSS THE ROAD (W) FROM THE STATION, 2.2 FEET FROM THE SIDE AND 19.7 FEET FROM FRONT CORNER OF A COTTAGE WITH GREEN COMPOSITION SIDING, FACING WATER, 28.0 FEET FROM CENTER LINE OF ROAD, AT A POINT 431 FEET FROM NEAR ABUTMENT OF BRIDGE, AND PROJECTS 4 INCHES ABOVE SURFACE OF SAND.  AZIMUTH MARK-TANK, BLACK, ELEVATED (MILTON) WAS NOT VISIBLE FROM THE GROUND.                            STATION RECOVERY (1946)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1946 (ELJ) STATION MARK AND REFERENCE MARK 2 WERE RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION.  REFERENCE MARK 1 WAS NOT FOUND.  THE DISTANCE TO REFERENCE MARK 2 WAS MEASURED AND FOUND TO BE CORRECT.  THE 1933 DESCRIPTION IS ADEQUATE EXCEPT FOR THE FOLLOWING CHANGES--  1.  DELETE DESCRIPTION OF REFERENCE MARK 1.  2.  REFERENCE MARK 1 IS LOST.  3.  DELETE MARK IS 2 FEET FROM A SMALL CEDAR IN DESCRIPTION OF REFERENCE MARK 2 AS THE SMALL CEDAR IS NO LONGER THERE.  4.  ADD REFERENCE MARK 3 IS 66.7 FEET SW OF THE STATION, 18 FEET W OF THE CENTER LINE OF THE ROAD AND ALONGSIDE A HOUSE.  THE MARK PROJECTS 3 INCHES ABOVE THE SURFACE AND IS A BRONZE REFERENCE DISK.  5.  CHANGE DIRT ROAD TO READ BLACK-TOP ROAD IN DESCRIPTION OF THE STATION MARK.  6.  CHANGE BOUND TO FOUND IN THE STATION MARK DESCRIPTION.  7.  CHANGE STATION IS 90 FEET S OF THE HIGH-WATER LINE TO STATION IS 20 FEET S OF THE HIGH-WATER LINE.  THE ANGLE BETWEEN REFERENCE MARKS 2 AND 3 IS 42 DEGREES AND 15 MINUTES.                            STATION RECOVERY (1954)  RECOVERY NOTE BY US GEOLOGICAL SURVEY 1954 STATION NOT RECOVERED, IF IT STILL EXISTS, IT IS BENEATH ABOUT SIX FEET OF SAND.  REFERENCE MARK 2 DESTROYED, FOUND LYING ON ITS SIDE.  REFERENCE MARK 3 DESTROYED BY WAVE ACTION.                            STATION RECOVERY (1961)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1961 (JKW) LOST.  THE STATION MARK COULD NOT BE FOUND AFTER A VERY THOROUGH SEARCH.  THE ROAD HAS BEEN WIDENED, THE AREA LEVELED AND THE SHORELINE ERODED.  IT IS BELIEVED THAT THIS STATION IS DESTROYED.  R.M. 1 WAS PREVIOUSLY REPORTED DESTROYED. markers.description: BY US COAST SURVEY 1835 (JF) ON THE HIGH BANK ON THE SOUTH SIDE OF THE CHESAPEAKE AND DELAWARE CANAL, ABOUT 550 YARDS WEST OF THE SUMMIT BRIDGE.  STATION IS 15 FEET FROM NORTH EDGE OF BANK.  MARKING NOT KNOWN.                            STATION RECOVERY (1934)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1934 (FGJ) DESCRIPTION IS INADEQUATE.  THE STATION WAS SEARCHED FOR ON JUNE 28 AND NOT FOUND.  THE HILL ON WHICH THE STATION IS LOCATED WAS FOUND.  THE STATION WAS PLACED 15 FEET BACK OF THE BANK ON THE SOUTH SIDE OF THE CANAL WHICH AT THAT TIME WAS A LOCAL LEVEL CANAL.  SINCE THE STATION WAS ESTABLISHED THE CANAL HAS BEEN DEEPENED TO A SEA-LEVEL CANAL AND WIDENED.  HENCE, THE BANK HAS UNDOUBTEDLY SLOUGHED OFF FAR MORE THAN 15 FEET, AND THE STATION IS LOST.  THIS OPINION IS SHARED BY THE CORPS OF ENGINEERS OFFICE AT CHESAPEAKE CITY, WHO HAVE SEARCHED FOR BUCK 2.

BY NATIONAL OCEAN SERVICE 1984 THE STATION IS LOCATED ON TOP OF A BUNKER IN A SAND DUNE AT FORT MILES ARMY RECREATIONAL AREA ON CAPE HENLOPEN, DELAWARE.  THIS SAND DUNE IS THE HIGHEST POINT IN THE IMMEDIATE AREA. TO REACH STATION FROM THE LEWES FERRY TERMINAL FOLLOW ROUTE 9 E FOR 0.9 MI TO CAPE HENLOPEN STATE PARK AND FORT MILES ARMY RECREATIONAL AREA.  TAKE FIRST RIGHT IN PARK TOWARD FT. MILES AND FOLLOW MAIN ROAD FOR 0.8 MI TO FORK ON LEFT WITH A LOCKED ENTRANCE GATE.  FOLLOW ROAD UP THE HILL FOR 0.2 MI TO THE LOCKED GATE AT BUNKER WITH A WHITE WHIP ANTENNA ON THE TOP.  STATION IS ON THE TOP OF THE BUNKER APPROXIMATELY 49 FT NW OF THE ANTENNA ON A FOUR FT HIGH CONCRETE BLOCK. STATION MARK IS A STANDARD NOS BRONZE DISK SET IN A DRILL HOLE IN A FOUR FT HIGH CONCRETE BUNKER. RM 1 IS 18.725 M (61.4 FT) N OF STATION.  RM 1 IS STAMPED---BUNKER 1984 RM 1---, SET 6-INCHES BELOW THE SAND SURFACE AND IS LOCATED NNE OF A RDF ANTENNA. RM 2 IS A 80 FT WHIP RDF ANTENNA WHICH IS LOCATED 15.021 M (49.3 FT) NW OF THE STATION. markers.description: BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1943 (FLG) THE STATION IS THE CHIMNEY IN THE CENTER OF THE MOST E OF TWO HOUSES ON BURTONS ISLAND.                            STATION RECOVERY (1961)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1961 (JKW) LOST.  NO TRACE OF THE HOUSE COULD BE FOUND.  IT APPEARS THIS HOUSE HAS BEEN TORN DOWN.  STATION SHOULD BE CLASSIFIED LOST.

BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1909 (ES) THIS STATION IS NEAR THE CENTER OF BURTONS ISLAND WHICH LIES BETWEEN REHOBOTH BAY AND INDIAN RIVER.  IT IS ABOUT NE FROM THE CLUBHOUSE IN AN OLD FIELD THAT HAS NOT BEEN CULTIVATED FOR SOME YEARS.  IT IS ON THE HIGHEST PART OF THIS PART OF THE ISLAND.  THE GROUND IS VERY HARD.  THE MARK IS A COPPER TRIANGULATION-STATION MARK SET IN CEMENT 2 FEET BELOW SURFACE.  ABOVE THIS A BLOCK OF CEMENT IN WHICH IS SET A COPPER TRIANGULATION MARK FASTENED IN 1-INCH GALVANIZED-IRON PIPE 18 INCHES LONG.  THIS CEMENT BLOCK PROJECTS 8 INCHES ABOVE GROUND AND IS 10 INCHES SQUARE.  REFERENCE MARK IS N NEAR A SMALL CLUMP OF TREES AND IS A CEMENT BLOCK WITH CIRCLE AND NAIL TO MARK CENTER.                            STATION RECOVERY (1934)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1934 (JCT) UNDERGROUND STATION MARK RECOVERED IN PLACE.  THE SURFACE STATION MARK WAS FOUND PARTIALLY DUG UP AND LEANING BADLY.  NO TRACE OF THE REFERENCE MARK COULD BE FOUND, AND THE CLUMP OF TREES MENTIONED IN THE ORIGINAL DESCRIPTION NO LONGER EXISTS.  THE FIELD HAS BEEN CULTIVATED RECENTLY, AND THE MARKS WERE PROBABLY DISTURBED IN PLOWING.  THE SURFACE STATION MARK WAS RE-CENTERED OVER THE UNDERGROUND MARK, AND TWO NEW REFERENCE MARKS, STANDARD BRONZE DISKS SET IN CONCRETE.  DESCRIPTION OF STATION SHOULD READ AS FOLLOWS--ON THE NE SHORE OF INDIAN RIVER BAY ON BURTON ISLAND ON THE SE PORTION OF THE ISLAND PROPER AND ABOUT 1800 METERS W FROM INDIAN RIVER INLET.  ALL OF THE HIGH GROUND ON BURTON ISLAND HAS RECENTLY BEEN CULTIVATED, AND THE STATION IS IN THE EASTERLY PART OF THIS CULTIVATED AREA.  THE MARK IS ABOUT 400 METERS E OF THE BURTON ISLAND GUN CLUB, AND ABOUT 60 METERS SW FROM THE MARSH AT THE CENTER OF THE E SIDE OF THE ISLAND.  TO REACH THE STATION, LAND WITH BOAT AT THE BURTON ISLAND GUN CLUB DOCK, THEN WALK E ACROSS THE ISLAND TO EASTERLY PART OF FIELD.  THE UNDERGROUND STATION MARK IS A COPPER TRIANGULATION DISK SET IN CEMENT 2 FEET BELOW THE SURFACE.  THE SURFACE STATION MARK IS A STANDARD DISK FASTENED IN A 1-INCH GALVANIZED-IRON PIPE 18 INCHES LONG, WHICH IS SET IN A BLOCK OF CONCRETE 10 INCHES SQUARE AT THE TOP AND PROJECTING 6 INCHES ABOVE GROUND.  TWO ADDITIONAL REFERENCE MARKS, STANDARD BRONZE DISKS SET IN CONCRETE , STAMPED NO.2 AND NO.3, 1909 WERE ESTABLISHED.  THEY ARE SET IN A NORTHEASTERLY DIRECTION FROM THE STATION IN THE EDGE OF THE FIELD AMONG TALL WEEDS AND SMALL BUSHES WHICH LINE THE EDGE OF THE MARSH AREA.                            STATION RECOVERY (1943)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1943 (FLG) STATION RECOVERED AS DESCRIBED WITH THE EXCEPTION OF THE FOLLOWING DISCREPANCIES--  1.  NEITHER REFERENCE MARK 1 NOR REFERENCE MARK 2 WAS RECOVERED, ALTHOUGH A WIDE AREA WAS SEARCHED OVER, USING THE DISTANCES IN THE DESCRIPTION.  2.  THE STATION IS 68 METERS SW OF THE W END OF THE MARSH, AT A POINT DIRECTLY ABOVE A LONG HIGH NECK WHICH EXTENDS INTO THE MARSH.                            STATION RECOVERY (1962)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1962 (JKW) NOT RECOVERED.  A THOROUGH SEARCH WAS MADE FOR THIS STATION FOR TWO HOURS.  THE AREA HAS GROWN UP WITH BUSHES, BRIARS AND TALL GRASS.  IT IS PROBABLY INTACT BUT COVERED-OVER BY SAND.

markers.description: BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1933 (GLA) STATION IS ON LAND OWNED BY RAYNOR CARROW, CLARENCE SHAHON, TENANT, ABOUT 3 MILES WNW OF PORT PENN, 4-1/2 MILES SSW OF DELAWARE CITY AND 1/2 MILE A LITTLE N OF E OF LISTON REAR LIGHT.  SURFACE, UNDERGROUND, AND REFERENCE MARKS ARE STANDARD BRONZE DISKS SET IN CONCRETE AS DESCRIBED IN NOTES 1B, 7A, AND 11B.  REFERENCE MARK NO.1 IS S OF THE STATION.  3-1/2 FEET W OF NW CORNER OF SHED.  16 FEET SW OF SW FACE OF BARN.  THE MARK PROJECTS 3 INCHES.  REFERENCE MARK NO.2 IS SW OF THE STATION.  2 FEET NE OF BARBWIRE FENCE.  121 FEET SE OF CENTER ONE OF THREE CHERRY TREES ON FENCE LINE.  THE MARK PROJECTS 4 INCHES.  TO REACH FROM ST. GEORGE, WHICH IS A LITTLE TOWN ON HIGHWAY 13 BETWEEN SMYRNA AND WILMINGTON, TAKE HIGHWAY 13 S FROM THE CANAL CROSSING, AT THE DRAWBRIDGE, FOR 1.9 MILES AND TURN LEFT (E) AT PAVED T-ROAD AT ARROW PORT PENN.  FOLLOW THIS ROAD 0.95 MILE OR 0.45 MILE BEYOND THE LISTON REAR LIGHTHOUSE ON THE LEFT AND TURN LEFT (NE) ON ASPHALT T-ROAD.  PROCEED 0.15 MILE TO CLARENCE SHAHONS HOUSE, FIRST ON LEFT SIDE OF ROAD.  THE STATION IS ABOUT 70 YARDS BEHIND (NW) OF THE HOUSE.  70.5 FEET NW OF NW FACE OF BARN.  17 FEET SW OF PLANK FENCE.  AND 45 FEET W OF 2-FOOT BLACK WALNUT TREE.  THE MARK IS FLUSH WITH THE GROUND.                            STATION RECOVERY (1946)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1946 (ELJ) STATION MARKS, REFERENCE MARK 1 AND REFERENCE MARK 2 RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION.  DISTANCES TO REFERENCE MARKS WERE MEASURED AND FOUND TO BE CORRECT.  THE 1933 DESCRIPTION IS ADEQUATE EXCEPT FOR THE FOLLOWING CHANGE--DELETE 45 FEET W OF 2-FOOT BLACK WALNUT TREE.                            STATION RECOVERY (1961)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1961 (RWT) THE STATION MARK, REFERENCE MARKS 1 AND 2 WERE RECOVERED AND FOUND IN GOOD CONDITION.  THERE WAS NO AZIMUTH MARK AT THIS STATION SO A NEW AZIMUTH MARK WAS ESTABLISHED AT THIS DATE.  THE PREVIOUS DESCRIPTION TO THE TO REACH THE STATION IS ADEQUATE.  A NEW TO REACH TO THE STATION AND THE AZIMUTH MARK IS A FOLLOWS--  TO REACH THE STATION FROM THE ST. GEORGE BRIDGE WHICH CROSSES OVER THE CANAL ON U.S. HIGHWAY 13, GO SOUTH ON U.S. HIGHWAY 13 FOR 1.4 MILES TO A T-ROAD, TURN LEFT AND GO EAST ON ASPHALT ROAD AT ARROW PORT PENN. FOR 0.4 MILES TO THE LISTON LIGHTHOUSE ON THE LEFT, CONTINUE ON ASPHALT ROAD FOR 0.45 MILE TO A SIDE ROAD LEFT, TURN LEFT AND GO NORTH ON ASPHALT ROAD FOR 0.15 MILE TO MR. CLARENCE SHAHONS HOUSE AND DRIVEWAY ON THE LEFT, TURN LEFT AND GO WEST ON DRIVEWAY FOR 0.05 MILE TO THE STATION IN THE BARN YARD, CONTINUE FROM THE STATION 0.2 MILES WEST TO THE AZIMUTH MARK.  AZIMUTH MARK, IS A STANDARD DISK SET IN THE TOP OF A 10 X 10 INCH CONCRETE MONUMENT WHICH IS FLUSH WITH THE SURFACE OF THE GROUND, STAMPED CARROW 1933.  IT IS 2.0 FEET SOUTHEAST OF A HEDGE ROW AND 1.6 FEET SOUTH OF A STANDARD METAL WITNESS POST AND MARKER.  HEIGHT OF LIGHT ABOVE STATION MARK 34 METERS.                            STATION RECOVERY (1975)  RECOVERY NOTE BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 1975 (RST) STATION AND REFERENCE MARKS WERE FOUND IN GOOD CONDITION.  A NEW SILO HAS BEEN ERECTED NEAR STATION APPROX. 50 FEET SW OF THE STATION.  THE NAMES OF THE OWNERS HAVE CHANGED SINCE THE ORIGINAL DESCRIPTION TO MR. J. BAXTER, PRESENT OWNER OF THE FARM.  ORIGINAL DESCRIPTION IS ADEQUATE FOR RECOVERY.                            STATION RECOVERY (1980)  RECOVERY NOTE BY LOCAL ENGINEER (INDIVIDUAL OR FIRM) 1980 (WW) RECOVERED BY VANDEMARK LYNCH INC.  CARROW 1933 GOOD- STATION AND REFERENCE.  REFERENCE MARK 1 GOOD- MARKS ADEQUATLY.  REFERENCE MARK 2 GOOD- DESCRIBED.  NOTE- A NEW FRAME STORAGE SHED HAS BEEN CONSTRUCTED 18 IN NORTHEASTERLY OF STATION CARROW 1933- MAKING IT DIFFICULT TO OCCUPY THIS STATION.                            STATION RECOVERY (1998)  RECOVERY NOTE BY US POWER SQUADRON 1998 RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION.

markers.description: BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 1974 (LAL) NO MEASUREMENT WAS MADE FROM RM 1 TO RM 2 DUE TO BRUSH ON LINE.  THE STATION IS LOCATED ABOUT 3.5 MILES NORTHEAST OF OCEAN CITY, 1.6 MILES WEST OF FENWICK ISLAND, ON ROAD RIGHT-OF-WAY AND NEAR THE MARYLAND-DELAWARE STATE LINE.  TO REACH THE STATION FROM THE JUNCTION OF STATE ROADS 14 AND 54 IN FENWICK ISLAND, GO WEST-NORTHWEST AND SOUTHEAST ON STATE ROAD 54 FOR 4.15 MILES TO A SIDE ROAD LEFT AND THE SOUND METHODIST CHURCH ON THE LEFT.  TURN LEFT AND GO SOUTHEAST ON A PAVED ROAD FOR 0.7 MILE TO A T-ROAD AND A STOP SIGN.  TURN LEFT AND GO SOUTHEASTERLY ON A PAVED ROAD FOR 0.45 MILE TO A SIDE ROAD RIGHT, CONTINUE EASTERLY ON THE PAVED ROAD FOR 0.8 MILE TO RM 3 (AZI. MK.) ON THE LEFT, CONTINUE EASTERLY ON THE PAVED ROAD FOR 0.2 MILE TO THE END OF THE ROAD AND THE STATION ON THE LEFT.  STATION MARKS ARE STANDARD DISKS STAMPED CEDAR 1974.  THE SURFACE DISK IS SET IN THE TOP OF A 12-INCH CYLINDRICAL CONCRETE MONUMENT THAT PROJECTS 4 INCHES ABOVE THE GROUND SURFACE.  IT IS 35 FEET NORTHEAST OF THE CENTER OF THE PAVED ROAD, 18 FEET WEST OF THE WATERS EDGE AND 5 FEET EAST-SOUTHEAST OF A METAL WITNESS POST.  THE UNDERGROUND DISK IS SET IN THE TOP OF AN IRREGULAR MASS OF CONCRETE 42 INCHES BELOW THE GROUND SURFACE.  REFERENCE MARK 1, A STANDARD DISK STAMPED CEDAR NO 1 1974, IS SET IN THE TOP OF A 12-INCH CYLINDRICAL CONCRETE MONUMENT THAT PROJECTS 2 INCHES ABOVE THE GROUND SURFACE.  IT IS 26 FEET WEST OF THE WATERS EDGE AND 24 FEET SOUTH OF THE CENTER OF THE PAVED ROAD.  REFERENCE MARK 2, A STANDARD DISK STAMPED CEDAR NO 2 1974, IS SET IN THE TOP OF A 12-INCH CYLINDRICAL CONCRETE MONUMENT THAT PROJECTS 5 INCHES ABOVE THE GROUND SURFACE.  IT IS 13 FEET SOUTH-SOUTHWEST OF THE CENTER OF THE PAVED ROAD.  REFERENCE MARK 3, A STANDARD DISK STAMPED CEDAR NO 3 1974, IS SET IN THE TOP OF A 12-INCH CYLINDRICAL CONCRETE MONUMENT THAT PROJECTS 3 INCHES ABOVE THE GROUND SURFACE.  IT IS 53 FEET WEST OF AN 8-INCH CEDAR TREE AND 18 FEET NORTH OF THE CENTER OF THE PAVED ROAD.  THE MARK SERVES AS AN AZIMUTH MARK.                            STATION RECOVERY (1976)  RECOVERY NOTE BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 1976 (CLN) THE STATION AND ALL MARKS WERE RECOVERED AND FOUND IN GOOD CONDITION.  THE DISTANCES AND DIRECTIONS WERE WITHIN CLOSE AGREEMENT WITH THE 1974 OBSERVATIONS.  THE MARYLAND-DELAWARE BOUNDARY MONUMENT NUMBER 2 WAS ESTABLISHED AT THIS DATE.  THE MARK IS A MARYLAND-DELAWARE BOUNDARY DISK STAMPED E-W NO. 2 1976, SET IN THE TOP OF A 10-INCH ROUND CONCRETE MONUMENT PROJECTING 1 FOOT.  THE SUB-SURFACE MARKER IS A STANDARD NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY TRIANGULATION STATION DISK STAMPED E-W NO. 2 1976, SET IN A 12-INCH MASS OF CONCRETE 42 INCHES BELOW SURFACE.  THEY ARE 68.0 FEET SOUTHEAST OF A WITNESS POST, 30 FEET SOUTH OF THE CENTER OF THE ROAD, 22.6 FEET EAST OF A PILE OF CONCRETE SLABS, 22 FEET SOUTHWEST OF THE SHORELINE, AND 1.2 FEET NORTH OF A WITNESS POST.  AIRLINE DISTANCE AND DIRECTION FROM NEAREST TOWN 3-1/2 MILES NORTHWEST OF OCEAN CITY.                            STATION RECOVERY (2012)  RECOVERY NOTE BY DELAWARE COASTAL PROGRAM 2012 MARK NOT FOUND.

STATION RECOVERY (1961)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1961 (JKW) LOST.  STATION COULD NOT BE FOUND.  NO TRACE OF A HOUSE FITTING THIS DESCRIPTION WAS IN THIS AREA.

BY US GEOLOGICAL SURVEY 1950 STATION WAS SEARCHED FOR AND NOT FOUND.  THE STATION IS NOT DESCRIBED.                            STATION RECOVERY (1982)  RECOVERY NOTE BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 1982 (CLN) THE STATION WAS RECOVERED AND FOUND IN GOOD CONDITION.  THE REFERENCE MARKS WERE ESTABLISHED.  A COMPLETE NEW DESCRIPTION FOLLOWS.  THE STATION IS LOCATED 6.8 KM (4.20 MI) NORTH ALONG STATE HIGHWAY 52 (KENNETT PIKE) FROM THE POST POST OFFICE IN GREENVILLE, 58.2 METERS (190.9 FT) WEST FROM THE CENTER OFF STATE HIGHWAY 52, 31.1 METERS (102.0 FT) SOUTH FROM THE CENTER OF A EAST-WEST PAVED STREET.  25.5 METERS (83.7 FT) WEST-SOUTHWEST FROM THE SOUTHWEST CORNER OF HOUSE 5720 KENNETT PIKE, 8.5 METERS (27.9 FT) SOUTHWEST FROM THE CENTER OF A PAVED PRIVATE DRIVE AND 3.4 METERS (11.2 FT) WEST FROM THE WEST OF TWO 26-INCH MAPLE TREES.  THE STATION IS LOCATED 10.5 KM (6.50 MI) NORTH-NORTHWEST FROM WILMINGTON, 6.8 KM (4.20 MI) NORTH FROM GREENVILLE AND IN A SMALL VILLAGE CALLED CENTERVILLE. OWNERSHIP--DONALD R KNOX, POST OFFICE BOX 2149, DUXBURY, MAINE 02322. TO REACH THE STATION FROM THE POST OFFICE AT GREENVILLE, GO NORTHERLY ON STATE HIGHWAY 52 (KENNETT PIKE) FOR 6.8 KM (4.20 MI) TO THE STATION ON THE LEFT, BEHIND THE THREE STORY FRAME HOUSE.  THE STATION IS THE CENTER OF A 10 MM DRILL HOLE IN THE TOP OF A 14 CM SQUARE GRANITE POST WHICH IS ABOUT 0.7 METERS (2.3 FT) LONG AND EMBEDDED INTO THE GROUND. THE LETTERS U.S AND A DATE 1892 ARE CARVED IN THE TOP OF THE POST AND IT PROJECTS 4 CM ABOVE THE TOP OF THE GROUND.                            STATION RECOVERY (2013)  RECOVERY NOTE BY DELAWARE COASTAL PROGRAM 2013 RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION.

markers.description: BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1934 (JCT) LOCATED ON THE S BANK OF INDIAN RIVER ON CHAMPLIN NECK ABOUT MIDWAY BETWEEN SANDY LANDING AND THE MOUTH OF BLACKWATER CREEK AND DUE SE OF ROCK POINT ON PINE NECK.  THE STATION IS SET AT THE NW EDGE OF A HEAVILY WOODED SECTION OF HIGH GROUND EXTENDING TO THE RIVERS EDGE AND BOUNDED ON THE E AND W BY MARSH.  IT IS SET IN FLAT SANDY SOIL ABOUT 20 METERS BACK FROM THE HIGH-WATER LINE ON THE N AND 10 METERS E OF THE MARSH AREA ON THE W.  STATION AND REFERENCE MARKS ARE SURROUNDED BY SMALL PINES AND BRUSH WITH LARGER AND DENSER PINES LYING JUST INSHORE.  SURFACE AND REFERENCE MARKS ARE STANDARD BRONZE DISKS SET IN A TILE.  NO UNDERGROUND STATION MARK COULD BE SET DUE TO WETNESS OF THE GROUND WHEN THE MARKS WERE ESTABLISHED.  THE STATION IS BEST REACHED BY WATER.                            STATION RECOVERY (1943)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1943 (FLG) RECOVERED AS DESCRIBED, EXCEPT FOR THE FOLLOWING DISCREPANCIES--  1.  REFERENCE MARK 1 IS 49.75 FEET OR 15.165 METERS SE OF THE STATION.  2.  REFERENCE MARK 2 IS 42.17 FEET OR 12.853 METERS S OF THE STATION.  3.  FROM REFERENCE MARK 1 TO REFERENCE MARK 2 IT IS 48.63 FEET OR 14.823 METERS.                            STATION RECOVERY (1962)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1962 (CFO) THE STATION IS NOW IN THE AREA OF NEW DEVELOPMENT AND NEW COTTAGES HAVE BEEN BUILT NEAR THE STATION LOCATION, ALSO A SEA-WALL ALONG THE SHORE LINE, AND THE AREA HAS BEEN FILLED IN WITH ABOUT 1 FOOT OF SAND.  THE STATION MARK WAS RECOVERED AND FOUND TO BE IN GOOD CONDITION, IT IS 29.35 FEET N OF THE NW CORNER OF THE CONCRETE SLAB FOUNDATION OF A PAINTED RED COTTAGED, 35.10 FEET NNW OF THE NE CORNER OF SAME COTTAGE AND 26.0 FEET SOUTH OF THE SEA-WALL.  THE MARK IS ABOUT 1 FOOT BELOW THE SURFACE OF THE GROUND.  THE REFERENCE MARKS WERE NOT FOUND, REFERENCE MARK NO.1 PROBABLY RECOVERABLE ABOUT 1 FOOT BELOW THE SURFACE OF THE GROUND, REFERENCE MARK NO.2 IS UNDER THE CONCRETE SLAB OF THE RED COTTAGE.                            STATION RECOVERY (1974)  RECOVERY NOTE BY LOCAL ENGINEER (INDIVIDUAL OR FIRM) 1974 RECOVERED BY GILBERT INC.  STATION FOUND IN GOOD CONDITION.  STATION WAS FOUND BY USING RECOVERY NOTE BY C.F.O. IN 1962.                            STATION RECOVERY (2012)  RECOVERY NOTE BY DELAWARE COASTAL PROGRAM 2012 MARK NOT FOUND.

TO REACH THE STATION FROM THE OVERPASS OF EDGEMOOR ROAD OVER THE PENNSYLVANIA RAILROAD, GO EAST ON EDGEMOOR ROAD INTO THE DUPONT CHEMICAL COMPANY GATE, AND GO TO THE LOADING DOCK AND THE VICINITY OF THE STATION. markers.description: BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1958 (JCE) STATION IS LOCATED ABOUT 2.0 MILES SOUTHWEST OF NEWARK, ABOUT 4-1/2 MILES NORTHEAST OF ELKTON, ABOUT 1.0 MILE EAST OF THE MARYLAND-DELAWARE STATE LINE AND ON A HIGH HILL LOCALLY KNOWN AS CHESTNUT HILL.  STATION IS IN THE NORTHEAST CORNER OF CLEARED FIELD, 40 FEET NORTH-NORTHWEST OF A WILD CHERRY TREE, 13 FEET WEST OF FENCELINE, 13-1/2 FEET SOUTHWEST OF THE NORTHEAST CORNER OF CLEARED FIELD, 13-1/2 FEET SOUTHWEST OF A PERSIMMON TREE AND 2-1/2 FEET WEST-SOUTHWEST OF WITNESS POST.  THE MARK IS A STANDARD DISK SET IN A 12X12 INCH CONCRETE MONUMENT, PROJECTS 4 INCHES AND THE DISK IS STAMPED CHESTNUT 1958.  REFERENCE MARK NO. 1 IS 5 FEET WEST OF FENCELINE,8 FEET SOUTHWEST OF CHERRY TREE AND 6-1/2 FEET NORTHWEST OF CHERRY TREE.  THE MARK IS A STANDARD REFERENCE MARK DISK SET IN A 12X12 INCH CONCRETE MONUMENT, PROJECTS 4 INCHES AND THE DISK IS STAMPED CHESTNUT NO 1 1958.  REFERENCE MARK NO. 2 IS 27 FEET SOUTHEAST OF A TWIN POPLAR TREE AND 7 FEET SOUTH OF A WILD CHERRY TREE.  THE MARK IS A STANDARD REFERENCE MARK DISK SET IN A 12X12 INCH CONCRETE MONUMENT, PROJECTS 3 INCHES AND THE DISK IS STAMPED CHESTNUT NO 2 1958.  AZIMUTH MARK IS 22 FEET SOUTHEAST OF APPROXIMATE CENTERLINE OF STATE HIGHWAY NO. 279, 43-1/2 FEET EAST-SOUTHEAST OF POWERLINE POLE NO. 35 AND 2-1/2 FEET NORTH-NORTHEAST OF A WITNESS POST.  THE MARK IS A STANDARD AZIMUTH DISK SET IN A 12X12 INCH CONCRETE MONUMENT, FLUSH WITH THE GROUND AND THE DISK IS STAMPED CHESTNUT 1958.  TO REACH FROM THE POST OFFICE IN ELKTON, MARYLAND, GO EASTERLY ON STATE HIGHWAY NO. 7 FOR 0.05 MILE TO JUNCTION OF STATE HIGHWAY NO. 279.  TURN LEFT AND GO NORTHERLY ON STATE HIGHWAY NO. 279 FOR 2.0 MILES TO FORKS.  TAKE RIGHT FORK AND GO EASTERLY ON STATE HIGHWAY NO. 279 FOR 0.4 MILE TO SERVICE STATION ON RIGHT (SOUTH) SIDE OF HIGHWAY.  CONTINUE EASTERLY ON STATE HIGHWAY NO. 279 FOR 0.85 MILE TO AZIMUTH MARK ON RIGHT (SOUTH) SIDE OF HIGHWAY AS DESCRIBED.  CONTINUE EASTERLY ON STATE HIGHWAY NO. 279 FOR 0.65 MILE TO SIDE ROAD RIGHT.  TURN RIGHT AND GO SOUTHERLY ON GRAVELED ROAD FOR 0.35 MILE TO RAILROAD TRACKS.  CROSS TRACKS AND CONTINUE SOUTHERLY ON GRAVELED ROAD FOR 0.25 MILE TO T INTERSECTION. TURN LEFT AND GO EASTERLY ON SURFACED ROAD FOR 0.65 MILE TO CROSSROADS.  CONTINUE EASTERLY ON SURFACED ROAD FOR 0.5 MILE TO FIELD DRIVEWAY ON LEFT (NORTH) SIDE OF ROAD.  TURN LEFT THENCE RIGHT AND GO EASTERLY ALONG THE SOUTH EDGE OF FIELD FOR 0.05 MILE TO SOUTHEAST CORNER OF FIELD.  TURN LEFT AND GO NORTHERLY ALONG THE EAST EDGE OF FIELD FOR 0.05 MILE TO NORTHEAST CORNER OF FIELD AND STATION NEAR FENCE CORNER AS DESCRIBED.  NOTE--A 77 FT. TOWER AT STATION GRAYS HILL IS VG.  HEIGHT OF LIGHT ABOVE STATION MARK 23 METERS.                            STATION RECOVERY (1964)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1964 (CFO) THE STATION MARK AND THE TWO REFERENCE MARKS WERE RECOVERED AS DESCRIBE AND FOUND TO BE IN GOOD CONDITION, THE AZIMUTH MARK WAS RECOVERED AND IS IN GOOD CONDITION, IT IS NEAR THE NORTHEAST RAMP OF MARYLAND STATE HIGHWAY 279 AND THE NORTHEASTERN EXPRESSWAY, 84 FEET SOUTHWEST OF POWERLINE POLE NO. 33, 76 FEET SOUTHEAST OF CENTERLINE OF THE HIGHWAY, 77 FEET NORTHEAST OF THE ELECTRIC LIGHT POLE OF THE INTERCHANGE, 13 FEET WEST OF THE BOUNDARY FENCE AND 2.5 FEET NORTHEAST OF THE METAL WITNESS POST.  A STANDARD AZIMUTH MARK DISK SET IN A 12 X 12-INCH CONCRETE MONUMENT FLUSH WITH THE GROUND AND THE DISK IS STAMPED CHESTNUT 1958.  TO REACH THE STATION FROM THE PENNSYLVANIA RAILROAD OVERPASS IN THE SOUTH PART OF NEWARK, GO SOUTHERLY ON HIGHWAY 896 FOR 1.0 MILE THEN WESTERLY ON A MACADAM ROAD FOR 1.25 MILE TO TOP OF THE HILL, TURN RIGHT GO NORTH ALONG OLD FENCE AND WEST EDGE OF THE FIELD FOR 0.05 MILE TO CORNER OF THE WOOD AND STATION.  TO REACH THE AZIMUTH MARK CONTINUE WEST ON THE MACADAM ROAD FOR 1.2 MILES TO A SIDE ROAD RIGHT, TURN RIGHT, GO NORTH 0.6 MILE TO HIGHWAY 279, TURN LEFT, GO SOUTHWEST ON THE HIGHWAY FOR 0.7 MILE TO AZIMUTH MARK ON THE LEFT AS DESCRIBED. NEAR SOUTHEAST CORNER OF THE WOODS, 13.5 FEET SOUTHWESET OF A PERSIMMON TREE, 12 FEET WEST OF THE FENCE LINE AND 3.5 FEET SOUTHWEST OF A METAL WITNESS POST, A STANDARD STATION MARK DISK IN THE TOP OF A CONCRETE MONUMENT AND PROJECTS 3-INCHES. BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1958 (JCE) STATION IS LOCATED ABOUT 6-1/2 MILES SOUTHWEST OF THE POST OFFICE IN WILMINGTON, AND ABOUT 1-1/2 MILES NORTHEAST OF CHRISTIANA, AND ON THE NORTH SIDE OF CHURCHMANS ROAD.  IT IS 3 FEET SOUTHEAST OF POWERLINE POLE NO. 8, 35-1/2 FEET NORTH OF THE CENTERLINE OF CHURCHMANS ROAD, 138 FEET SOUTHWEST OF THE SOUTHWEST CORNER OF HOUSE, AND 3 FEET SOUTHEAST OF WITNESS MARKER. REFERENCE MARK NO. 2 IS 35 FEET NORTH OF THE CENTERLINE OF CHURCHMANS ROAD, AND 40 FEET EAST OF POWERLINE POLE.  THE MARK IS A STANDARD REFERENCE MARK DISK SET IN A 10 BY 10 INCH CONCRETE MONUMENT. AZIMUTH MARK IS 37 FEET NORTH OF THE CENTERLINE OF CHURCHMANS ROAD, 5 FEET SOUTHWEST OF POWERLINE POLE NO. 15, AND 2 FEET WEST OF WITNESS MARKER. REFERENCE MARK NO. 1 IS 35 FEET NORTH OF THE CENTERLINE OF CHURCHMANS ROAD, 29 FEET WEST-SOUTHWEST OF LOT CORNER POST, 125 FEET SOUTHWEST OF THE SOUTHWEST CORNER OF HOUSE. TO REACH FROM THE ADMINISTRATION BUILDING OF THE NEW CASTLE COUNTY AIRPORT, GO SOUTHWEST ON U.S. HIGHWAYS NO. 13 AND 40 FOR 0.8 MILE TO JUNCTION OF STATE HIGHWAY NO. 273, TURN RIGHT ON STATE HIGHWAY NO. 273 AND GO NORTHWEST FOR 0.3 MILE, TURN RIGHT ON CHURCHMANS ROAD AND GO 2.25 MILE TO AZIMUTH MARK ON RIGHT, CONTINUE STRAIGHT AHEAD FOR 0.25 MILE TO STATION ON RIGHT AS DESCRIBED. BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 1984 (CLN) THE STATION IS LOCATED 11-1/4 KM WEST-SOUTHWEST FROM LAUREL, DELAWARE, 2-3/4 KM SOUTHEAST FROM GALESTOWN, 1-1/2 KM EAST FROM SHARPTOWN AND IN A CULTIVATED FIELD JUST SOUTH FROM A LOW RIDGE.  OWNERSHIP--MR AND MRS WILLIAM COOPER, ROUTE 3, BOX 217-G LAUREL DELAWARE 19956. TELEPHONE NUMBER 302 875 5317.  TO REACH FROM THE POST OFFICE AT SHARPTOWN, GO EAST ON FOURTH STREET FOR 0.05 KM (0.05 MI) TO A CROSSROADS.  TURN LEFT AND GO NORTH ON FERRY STREET FOR 0.25 KM (0.15 MI) TO A CROSSROADS.  TURN RIGHT AND GO EAST ON WATER STREET FOR 1.7 KM (1.05 MI) TO THE STATION ON THE RIGHT.  THE STATION IS A STANDARD CGS AZIMUTH MARK DISK STAMPED---COD 1962---.  SET IN THE TOP OF A 25 CM SQUARE CONCRETE POST WHICH PROJECTS 10 CM.  IT IS 69.3 METERS (227.4 FT) SOUTH FROM THE CENTER OF WATER STREET, 69.3 KM (43.05 MI) SOUTH-SOUTHWEST FROM A POWERLINE POLE NUMBERED D9 282 43999 99721, 31.7 METERS (104.0 FT) WEST FROM THE MARYLAND-DELAWARE BOUNDARY, 2.1 METERS (6.9 FT) SOUTH FROM THE SOUTH EDGE OF A CULTIVATED FIELD, 1.1 METERS (3.6 FT) NORTH FROM A WITNESS POST AND ABOUT 276 METERS (905.5 FT) SOUTH FROM A LOW RIDGE.  FOR ADDITIONAL INFORMATION SEE THE DESCRIPTION FOR STATION COD 1962.  AZIMUTH MARK NO 1, IS A STANDARD, CGS, DISK STAMPED,---COD 1962---.  SET INTO THE TOP OF A SQUARE CONCRETE MONUMENT, 10 INCHES, 25 CM IN DIAMETER ON SIDE.  PROJECTING 2 INCHES, 5 CM ABOVE THE GROUND.  TO REACH THE AZIMUTH MARK FROM THE STATION, GO SOUTH ACROSS THE CULTIVATED FIELD, CROSSING WATER STREET FOR 235 METERS (771.0 FT) TO THE EDGE OF A TIMBERED AREA AND THE MARK.
