markers.description: BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 1984 THE STATION SURFACE MARK AND BOTH REFEREENCE MARKS WERE FOUND DESTROYED.  THE STATION SUB-SURFACE MARK, THE AZIMUTH MARK AND THE BOUNDARY MONUMENT SIX WERE FOUND IN GOOD CONDITION.  A NEW STATION SURFACE MARK AND A NEW REFERENCE MARK THREE WERE SET.  A DIFFERENCE OF FOURTEEN SECONDS IN DIRECTION WAS NOTED BETWEEN THE AZIMUTH MARK AND THE SHARPTOWN MUNICIPAL TANK.  THE DIFFERENCE WAS CHECKED AND NOTED BUT THE REASON FOR THE DIFFERENCE COULD NOT BE DETERMINED.  ALL OTHER OBSERVATIONS AGREED WITH THE MOST RECENT DATA.  THE LOCATION OF THE STATION PREVENTS IDEAL LOCATION TO SET THE ONLY REFERENCE MARK NOR ARE THERE ARE OTHER LOCATIONS TO ESTABLISH ADDITIONAL MARKS.  A COMPLETE NEW DESCRIPTION OF THIS STATION FOLLOWS.  THE STATION IS LOCATED ABOUT 11-1/4 KM WEST FROM LAUREL, DELAWARE, 2-3/4 KM SOUTHEAST FROM GALESTOWN, MARYLAND, 1-1/2 KM EAST FROM SHARPTOWN, MARYLAND AND JUST SOUTH FROM A LOW RIDGE.  OWNERSHIP--MR AND MRS WILLIAM COOPER, ROUTE 3, BOX 217-6, LAUREL, DELAWARE, 19956.  TO REACH THE STATION FROM POST OFFICE AT SHARPTOWN, MARYLAND, GO EAST ON FOURTH STREET FOR 0.05 KM (0.05 MI) TO A CROSSROADS.  TURN LEFT AND GO NORTH ON FERRY STREET FOR 0.25 KM (0.15 MI) TO A CROSSROADS.  TURN RIGHT AND GO EAST ON WATER STREET FOR 1.7 KM (1.05 MI) TO THE STATION ON THE LEFT.  FOR ADDITIONAL INFORMATION SEE THE DESCRIPTION FOR STATION COD 1961.  THE STATION IS  SET INTO THE TOP OF AN IRREGULAR MASS OF CONCRETE, 24 INCHES, 61 CM IN DIAMETER ON SIDE, RECESSED 14 INCHES, 36 CM BELOW THE GROUND. THE STATION IS LOCATED 60.7 METERS (199.1 FT) SOUTHEAST FROM A CARSONITE WITNESS POST, 49.2 METERS (161.4 FT) EAST FROM THE SOUTHEAST EDGE OF A WOODED AREA AT A 24-INCH OAK, 162.2 METERS (532.2 FT) NORTH FROM THE CENTER OF WATER STREET, 39.6 METERS (129.9 FT) SOUTH FROM THE TOP OF THE RIDGE AND 167.8 METERS (550.5 FT) NORTH FROM A POWERLINE POLE NUMBERED 44018 99719.  THE UNDERGROUND MARK IS A STANDARD CGS DISK STAMPED COD 1962 IN AND IRREGULAR MASS OF CONCRETE 4 FT (1.2 M) BELOW THE SURFACE.  RM 3 IS A STANDARD NGS DISK STAMPED COD 1962 NO 3 1984 SET INTO THE TOP OF A ROUND CONCRETE MONUMENT 12 INCHES IN DIAMETER FLUSH WITH THE GROUND.  LOCATED 657.5 FT (200.4 M) N FROM THE CENTER OF WATER STREET, 80.0 FT (24.4 M) N FROM THE 24 INCH OAK TREE, 4.0 FT (1.2 M) W FROM THE WEST EDGE OF THE FIELD AND 1.4 FT (0.4 M) E FROM THE WITNESS POST.

markers.description: BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1932 (CDM) LOCATED ON THE GROUNDS OF THE DELAWARE STATE COLLEGE, ABOUT 2-1/2 MILES N OF DOVER, ABOUT 1/4 MILE OFF STATE HIGHWAY 13.  THE STATION IS 75 FEET E OF CENTER PIPE OF COLLEGE WATER TANK, 30.2 FEET E OF SE CORNER OF SMALL BRICK BUILDING, AND 48.7 FEET NW OF NW CORNER OF DORMITORY CALLED LORE HALL.  SURFACE, UNDERGROUND AND REFERENCE MARKS ARE STANDARD BRONZE DISKS SET IN CONCRETE.  REFERENCE MARK NO.1 IS ABOUT 1/4 MILE NE OF THE STATION, IN THE FENCE LINE ALONG THE HIGHWAY, AND ABOUT 12 METERS SW OF CENTER LINE OF HIGHWAY.  REFERENCE MARK NO.2 IS S OF THE STATION, ABOUT 6 METERS E OF CENTER LINE OF DRIVE, IN LINE OF SHADE TREES.  REFERENCE MARK NO.3 IS W OF THE STATION IN THE CONCRETE BASE OF THE MOST SOUTHERLY LEG OF A WATER TANK.  HEIGHT OF SIGNAL ABOVE STATION MARK - 37 METERS.                            STATION RECOVERY (1957)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1957 (CTH) THE STATION WAS RECOVERED AS DESCRIBED AND THE STATION MARK AND REFERENCE MARKS 1 AND 3 WERE FOUND IN GOOD CONDITION.  REFERENCE MARK 2 HAS BEEN DAMAGED BY MACHINERY AND IS LEANING SLIGHTLY.  THE PREVIOUS DESCRIPTION IS ADEQUATE.                            STATION RECOVERY (1963)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1963 (RRG) THE STATION MARK AND REFERENCE MARKS 1, 2, AND 3 WERE ALL RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION AS DESCRIBED ON LIST NO. 298, DELAWARE BAY, NEW JERSEY, DELAWARE.  THE STATION MAY BE REACHED BY GOING 1.65 MILES NORTHWEST ALONG THE PENNSYLVANIA RAILROAD FROM THE CROSSING OF STATE HIGHWAY 8 AT DOVER, THENCE 0.4 MILE NORTHEAST ALONG A BLACK TOP ROAD, THENCE 0.1 MILE NORTH ALONG A BLACK TOP ROAD TO STATION.                            STATION RECOVERY (1963)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1963 2.2 MI NW FROM DOVER. 1.65 MILES NORTHWEST ALONG THE PENNSYLVANIA RAILROAD FROM THE CROSSING OF STATE HIGHWAY 8 AT DOVER, THENCE 0.4 MILE NORTHEAST ALONG A BLACK TOP ROAD, THENCE 0.1 MILE NORTH ALONG A BLACK TOP STREET, AT DELAWARE STATE COLLEGE, 48.7 FEET NORTHWEST OF THE NORTHWEST CORNER OF ANOTHER DORMITORY (LORE HALL), 30.2 FEET EAST OF SOUTHEAST CORNER OF A SMALL BRICK BUILDING, 75 FEET EAST OF THE WATER TANK STANDPIPE, ABOUT LEVEL WITH STREET, AND SET IN THE TOP CENTER OF AN ABANDONED 2-FOOT BY 2-FOOT CONCRETE BLOCK PROJECTING 4 INCHES.                            STATION RECOVERY (1968)  RECOVERY NOTE BY LOCAL ENGINEER (INDIVIDUAL OR FIRM) 1968 (KCH) STATION MARK, RM 2 AND RM 3 WERE FOUND IN VERY GOOD CONDITION.  RM 1 WAS NOT SEARCHED FOR.  ORIGINAL DESCRIPTION IS ADEQUATE EXCEPT FOR THE WATER TANK.  THE WATER TANK HAS BEEN REMOVED, BUT THE LEG FOUNDATIONS ARE STILL THERE AND THE OLD PUMP HOUSE (SMALL BRICK BUILDING) IS STILL THERE.  DESCRIPTION SHOULD READ--OLD WATER TANK IS REMOVED.                            STATION RECOVERY (1969)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1969 (JKW) STATION MARK AND RMS 2 AND 3 WERE RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION.  THE DISTANCES TO THE REFERENCE MARKS WERE VERIFIED.  THE ORIGINAL DESCRIPTION IS ADEQUATE WITH THE FOLLOWING CORRECTIONS--OLD WATER TANK HAS BEEN RAZED AND ONLY THE FOUNDATION REMAINS.  STATION IS LOCATED ABOUT 600 FEET EAST OF A NEW WATER TANK.                            STATION RECOVERY (1973)  RECOVERY NOTE BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 1973 (CLN) UNABLE TO MEASURE BETWEEN THE RMS.  THE STATION AND ALL MARKS WERE RECOVERED AND FOUND IN GOOD CONDITION.  A SMALLER ANGLE OF 3 MINUTES AND 32 SECONDS WAS NOTED BETWEEN THE REFERENCE MARKS.  THE WATER TANK WHICH WAS AT THE STATION SITE HAS BEEN RELOCATED.  THE FOUNDATION OF THE TANK REMAINS AND REFERENCE MARK 3 IS SET IN THE SOUTHWEST FOUNDATION. IT IS BELIEVED THAT REFERENCE MARK 3 MAY HAVE BEEN MOVED SLIGHTLY WHEN THE TANK WAS DISMANTLED.  THE DISTANCE TO BOTH REFERENCE MARKS WERE WITHIN CLOSE AGREEMENT WITH THE 1932 MEASUREMENTS. THE AZIMUTH MARK IS NO LONGER VISIBLE FROM THE GROUND. THERE ARE SEVERAL PINE TREES ON LINE.  THE 1932 DESCRIPTION IS ADEQUATE.  AIRLINE DISTANCE AND DIRECTION FROM NEAREST TOWN IN NORTH EDGE OF DOVER.                            STATION RECOVERY (1981)  RECOVERY NOTE BY UNIVERSITY OF DELAWARE 1981 THE MARK IS LOCATED JUST SOUTH AND BEHIND LOCKERMAN HALL, NOT LORE HALL.  THE WATER TOWER IS THE ORIGINAL ONE AND ONLY THE FOOTINGS ARE LEFT.                            STATION RECOVERY (1981)  RECOVERY NOTE BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 1981 (RGP) THE STATION MARK AND REFERENCE MARKS TWO AND THREE WERE RECOVERED AND FOUND IN GOOD CONDITION.  THE REFERENCE MARK ONE (AZ MK) WAS DESTROYED BY CONSTRUCTION.  THE ANGLES AND DISTANCES AGREED WITH THE MOST RECENT INFORMATION AVAILABLE TO THE REFERENCE MARKS.  A NEW AZIMUTH MARK WAS SET AT THIS DATE.  A COMPLETE NEW DESCRIPTION FOLLOWS.  THE STATION IS LOCATED ABOUT 2-3/4 KM NORTHWEST OF DOVER AND ABOUT 1/4 KM SOUTHWEST OF THE DELAWARE STATE COLLEGE ADMINISTRATION BUILDING. OWNERSHIP--DELAWARE STATE COLLEGE, DOVER, DELAWARE.  TO REACH THE STATION FROM THE INTERSECTION OF U S HIGHWAYS 13 AND 113 IN THE SOUTH PART OF DOVER, GO NORTH ON U.S HIGHWAY 13 FOR 0.6 KM (0.35 MI) TO ITS JUNCTION WITH STATE HIGHWAY 8.  CONTINUE NORTH ON U.S HIGHWAY 13 FOR 2.9 KM (1.80 MI) TO A SIDE ROAD LEFT. TURN LEFT AND GO NORTHWEST ON COUNTY ROAD 99A FOR 0.8 KM (0.50 MI) TO THE AZIMUTH MARK ON THE RIGHT. CONTINUE NORTHWEST ON COUNTY ROAD 99A FOR 0.25 KM (0.15 MI) TO A SIDE STREET ON THE RIGHT.  TURN RIGHT AND GO NORTHEAST ON THE PAVED STREET FOR 0.25 KM (0.15 MI) TO THE SITE OF THE OLD WATER TANK ON THE RIGHT AND THE STATION AS DESCRIBED.  THE STATION IS A STANDARD CGS DISK STAMPED,--COLLEGE 1932--, CEMENTED IN A DRILL HOLE IN THE TOP OF A 3 FOOT (0.9 M) SQUARE CONCRETE PAD FOR THE FORMER COLLEGE WATER TANK AND IT PROJECTS 0.15 METERS. markers.description: BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1933 (GLA) THIS STATION IS ON COLLINS BEACH ABOUT 3.6 MILES NE OF SMYRNA, DELAWARE AND 2 MILES NNW OF THE MOUTH OF THE SMYRNA RIVER. REFERENCE MARK NO.1 IS S OF THE STATION.  32-1/2 FEET SE OF THE SE CORNER OF AN OLD CELLAR PARTLY FULL OF WATER, THE CELLAR IS PART OF THE RUINS OF THE OLD HOTEL WHICH WAS ON COLLINS BEACH YEARS AGO. markers.description: BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 1981 THE STATION IS LOCATED ABOUT 7-1/2 MILES NORTH-NORTHWEST OF SALISBURY, 1-1/4 MILES WEST OF DELMAR, AND 1/2 MILE SOUTH OF STATE HIGHWAY 54. IT IS ON ROAD RIGHT-OF-WAY. TO REACH FROM A POINT WHERE STATE HIGHWAY 54 CROSSES A RAILROAD IN DELMAR, GO WEST ON STATE HIGHWAY 54 FOR 0.2 MILE (0.3 KM) TO A FORK. KEEP LEFT AND GO WEST ON WALLER ROAD FOR 0.35 MILE (0.56 KM) TO A FORK.  KEEP RIGHT AND GO WEST ON A PAVED ROAD FOR 0.75 MILE (1.21 KM) TO THE STATION ON THE RIGHT. THE STATION SURFACE MARK IS A STANDARD DISK STAMPED CONNELLY 2 1981, SET IN THE TOP OF A 10-INCH ROUND CONCRETE MONUMENT WHICH IS 1 INCH BELOW THE SURFACE.  THE SUB-SURFACE MARK IS A STANDARD DISK STAMPED CONNELLY 2 1981, SET IN A 6-INCH MASS OF CONCRETE 36 INCHES BELOW THE SURFACE.  THE STATION IS 65.5 FEET (20.0 M) NORTHWEST OF THE WEST EDGE OF A 48-INCH CULVERT, 30.5 FEET (9.3 M) NORTH-NORTHEAST OF A WITNESS POST, 28.9 FEET (8.8 M) NORTH-NORTHEAST OF A POWERLINE POLE NUMBERED 46798 96468, 13.5 FEET (4.1 M) SOUTHWEST OF A 16-INCH OAK TREE WITH A TRIANGULAR BLAZE, 10 FEET (3.0 M) NORTH OF THE CENTER OF THE ROAD, AND 4.6 FEET (1.4 M) SOUTH OF A WITNESS POST. REFERENCE MARK 2 IS A STANDARD DISK STAMPED CONNELLY NO 2 1974, SET IN THE TOP OF A 12-INCH ROUND CONCRETE POST WHICH PROJECTS 2 INCHES. IT IS 50.1 FEET (15.3 M) NORTHWEST OF THE WITNESS POST WHICH IS NEAR THE OLD STATION CONNELLY, 46.4 FEET (14.1 M) NORTHWEST OF THE POWERLINE POLE, 35.7 FEET (10.9 M) WEST OF THE WITNESS POST WHICH IS NEAR THE NEW STATION CONNELLY 2, AND 18.7 FEET (5.7 M) NORTH OF THE CENTER OF THE ROAD. MARYLAND-DELAWARE BOUNDARY MONUMENT 30 1981, AND E-W NO. 30 1976 1981 WILL SERVE AS REFERENCE MARKS FOR THIS STATION.  SEE DESCRIPTIONS THEREOF. CONNELLY RM 3 1974 (AZ MK) WILL SERVE AS THE AZIMUTH MARK FOR THIS STATION.  ORIGNIAL DESCRIPTION IS ADEQUATE.                            STATION RECOVERY (2013)  RECOVERY NOTE BY DELAWARE COASTAL PROGRAM 2013 RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION.

markers.description: BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1958 (JCE) STATION IS ABOUT 2-1/2 MILES SOUTH SOUTHEAST OF NEWARK, ABOUT 2-1/2 MILES NORTH OF GLASGOW AND ABOUT 3/4 MILE NORTH NORTHWEST OF COOCHS BRIDGE.  STATION IS 39 FEET WEST OF THE CENTER OF ROAD, 26 FEET NORTH OF WOODS ROAD, 15 FEET SOUTH OF TRIANGLE BLAZED TREE AND 3.5 FEET SOUTHEAST OF WITNESS POST.  THE MARK IS A STANDARD TRIANGULATION STATION DISK SET IN THE TOP OF A 12 X 12 INCH CONCRETE POST WHICH PROJECTS ABOUT 2 INCHES AND THE DISK IS STAMPED COOCH 1958.  REFERENCE MARK NO. 1 IS 72.5 FEET NORTH OF POWER LINE POLE NO. 37 AND 15 FEET EAST OF CENTER OF ROAD.  THE MARK IS A STANDARD REFERENCE MARK DISK SET IN TOP OF A 12 X 12 INCH CONCRETE POST WHICH PROJECTS ABOUT 4 INCHES AND THE DISK IS STAMPED COOCH NO 1 1958.  REFERENCE MARK NO. 2 IS 38 FEET NORTH OF WOODS ROAD AND 17 FEET SOUTH OF A 36 INCH TREE.  THE MARK IS A STANDARD REFERENCE MARK DISK SET IN TOP OF A 12 X 12 INCH CONCRETE POST WHICH PROJECTS ABOUT 4 INCHES AND THE DISK IS STAMPED COOCH NO 2 1958.  AZIMUTH MARK IS 33.5 FEET EAST OF POWER LINE POLE NO. 48, 27.5 FEET NORTHWEST OF THE NORTH CORNER OF A SMALL WOODEN BRIDGE, 19 FEET NORTHEAST OF THE CENTER OF ROAD, 2 FEET NORTHEAST OF WITNESS POST AND 1.5 FEET NORTHEAST OF STEEL GUARD RAIL.  THE MARK IS A STANDARD AZIMUTH MARK DISK SET IN THE TOP OF A 12 X 12 INCH CONCRETE POST WHICH PROJECTS ABOUT 6 INCHES AND THE DISK IS STAMPED COOCH 1958.  TO REACH THE STATION FROM THE MAIN ENTRANCE TO THE CHRYSLER CORPORATION IN THE SOUTHWEST PART OF NEWARK GO SOUTHERLY ON STATE HIGHWAY 896 FOR 1.9 MILES TO CROSSROADS.  TURN RIGHT AND GO EASTERLY ON COOCHS BRIDGE ROAD FOR 0.55 MILE TO A SIDE ROAD LEFT JUST AFTER PASSING SMALL BRIDGE.  TURN LEFT AND GO NORTHWEST FOR 0.25 MILE TO THE AZIMUTH MARK ON THE RIGHT AS DESCRIBED.  CONTINUE NORTHWEST FOR 0.25 MILE TO THE STATION ON THE LEFT AS DESCRIBED.  HEIGHT OF LIGHT ABOVE STATION MARK 29 METERS.                            STATION RECOVERY (1959)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1959 1.9 MI SE FROM NEWARK. 1.15 MILES SOUTH ALONG STATE HIGHWAY 896 FROM THE CENTER OF THE HIGHWAY OVERPASS OVER THE PENNSYLVANIA RAILROAD IN THE SOUTH PART OF NEWARK, THENCE ABOUT 0.75 MILE SOUTHEAST ALONG COOCH BRIDGE ROAD, 39 FEET WEST-SOUTHWEST OF THE CENTER LINE OF THE ROAD, 61 FEET WEST OF AND ACROSS THE ROAD FROM POWER LINE AND TELEPHONE POLE 37, 68.8 FEET SOUTH-SOUTHWEST OF AND ACROSS THE ROAD FROM R M 1, 77.8 FEET EAST OF R M 2, 15 FEET SOUTH-SOUTHEAST OF A 14-INCH BLACK WALNUT TREE WITH TRIANGULAR BLAZE, 25 FEET NORTH-NORTHWEST OF THE CENTERLINE OF A TRAIL ROAD LEADING WEST, ABOUT 3 FEET ABOVE THE LEVEL OF THE ROAD, AND SET IN TOP OF A CONCRETE POST PROJECTING 4 INCHES ABOVE THE GROUND. NOTE--REFERENCE MARK NO 1 IS NORTH-NORTHEAST OF THE STATION AND REFERENCE MARK NO 2 IS WEST OF THE STATION, ALSO THERE IS A WRONG TURN AND DIRECTION IN THE TO REACH.  A TO REACH FOLLOWS.  TO REACH FROM THE MAIN ENTRANCE TO THE CHRYSLER CORPORATION AT THE SOUTH EDGE OF NEWARK.  GO SOUTH ON STATE HIGHWAY 896 FOR 1.9 MILES TO A CROSSROADS.  TURN LEFT (EAST) ON COOCHS BRIDGE RD. FOR 0.55 MILE TO A SIDE ROAD LEFT (SIGN ROAD CLOSED).  TURN LEFT NORTHWESTERLY FOR 0.25 MILE TO THE AZIMUTH MARK ON THE RIGHT.  CONTINUE NORTHWESTERLY FOR 0.25 MILE TO THE STATION ON THE LEFT. markers.description: BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1934 (JB) STATION IS ABOUT 5.5 MILES FROM DELMAR AND 5.8 MILES FROM LAUREL, DEL. STATION IS THE PROPERTY OF MR. H.H. COOPER.  STATION IS 14 INCHES BELOW THE SURFACE OF THE GROUND TO PERMIT TILLAGE, 50 FEET E OF THE CENTER LINE OF THE DIRT ROAD N FROM THE CHURCH, AT A POINT OPPOSITE THE NE CORNER OF THE PINE WOODS AND OPPOSITE TELEPHONE POLE NO.55.  SURFACE, UNDERGROUND, AND REFERENCE MARKS ARE STANDARD BRONZE DISK SET IN CONCRETE, AS DESCRIBED IN NOTES 1A, 7A, AND 11A.  REFERENCE MARK NO.3 IS 157.01 FEET SW OF THE STATION ON THE W SIDE OF THE DIRT ROAD, 15 FEET W OF THE CENTER LINE, 4 FEET S OF TELEPHONE POLE NO.56, 10 FEET S OF AN 18-INCH PINE.  MARK PROJECTS 6 INCHES ABOVE THE SURFACE OF THE GROUND.  REFERENCE MARK NO.1 IS 173.30 FEET N OF THE STATION, 15 FEET W OF THE CENTER LINE OF THE ROAD, 4 FEET S OF TELEPHONE POLE NO. 54.  MARK PROJECTS 6 INCHES ABOVE THE SURFACE OF THE GROUND.  REFERENCE MARK NO.2, THE AZIMUTH MARK, IS 0.3 MILE N OF THE STATION, 25 FEET N OF THE ROAD LEADING FROM MAIN DIRT ROAD TO MR. COOPERS HOUSE, 45 FEET E OF THE CENTER LINE OF THE MAIN DIRT ROAD, 60 FEET E OF RALPHS STORE, 5 FEET S OF A 10-INCH BLACK WALNUT TREE.  THE MARK IS VISIBLE FROM THE GROUND AT THE STATION AND PROJECTS 6 INCHES ABOVE THE SURFACE OF THE GROUND.  TO REACH THE STATION FROM DELMAR GO W ON THE ROAD WHICH INTERSECTS HIGHWAY NO.13 WHICH TURNS N IN DELMAR, FOLLOW THIS ROAD TO THE RAILROAD, CROSS THE RAILROAD AND CONTINUE 0.2 MILE TO A ROAD FORK AND CURVE TAKE THE RIGHT FORK, CONCRETE ROAD, AND FOLLOW THIS ROAD FOR 3 MILES TO A DIRT CROSS ROAD AT A WHITE CHURCH WHICH IS IN THE SE ANGLE OF THE CROSSROADS.  TURN RIGHT ON THIS DIRT ROAD AND FOLLOW THIS ROAD FOR 2.2 MILES TO ST. MARKS EPISCOPAL CHURCH AND GRAVEYARD.  TURN RIGHT AT THE CHURCH AND FOLLOW THE ROAD 0.1 MILE TO THE STATION SITE.  A 103-FOOT TOWER WILL CLEAR ALL LINES AT THIS STATION.  THERE ARE NO PROMINENT OBJECTS VISIBLE FROM THE GROUND AT THIS STATION.                            STATION RECOVERY (1942)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1942 (WDP) THE FOLLOWING DISCREPANCIES WERE NOTED IN THE FIELD WITH THE ORIGINAL DESCRIPTION--  (1) THE AZIMUTH MARK IS 16 FEET N OF ROAD LEADING FROM A MAIN DIRT ROAD, NOT 25 FEET.  (2) REFERENCE MARK NO.2 IS 42 FEET E OF THE CENTER LINE OF THE MAIN DIRT ROAD, NOT 45 FEET.  THE STATION IS LOCATED ABOUT 5.5 MILES FROM DELMAR AND 5.8 MILES FROM LAUREL, DELAWARE, ON THE PROPERTY OF MR. H.H. COOPER, 46.9 FEET E OF THE CENTER LINE OF A DIRT ROAD, AND 68.8 FEET FROM THE NE CORNER OF A PINE WOODS AT TELEPHONE POLE NO.55.  THE STATION IS MARKED BY A BRONZE DISK, STAMPED COOPER 1934, SET IN THE TOP OF A 12-INCH SQUARE CONCRETE MONUMENT, WHICH IS 14 INCHES BELOW THE GROUND.  THE STATION IS IN GOOD CONDITION.  REFERENCE MARK NO.1 IS LOCATED 173.30 FEET N OF THE STATION, 15 FEET W OF THE CENTER LINE OF THE ROAD, AND 4 FEET S OF TELEPHONE POLE NO.54.  THE MARK IS A BRONZE DISK, WITH THE ARROW POINTING TOWARD THE STATION, STAMPED COOPER 1934 NO.1, SET IN THE TOP OF A 12-INCH SQUARE CONCRETE MONUMENT, WHICH EXTENDS 6 INCHES ABOVE THE GROUND.  THE MARK IS IN GOOD CONDITION.  REFERENCE MARK NO.2 (AZIMUTH MARK) IS LOCATED 0.3 MILE N OF THE STATION, 16 FEET N OF THE ROAD LEADING FROM THE MAIN DIRT ROAD TO A TWO-STORY WHITE HOUSE, 42 FEET E OF THE CENTER LINE OF THE MAIN DIRT ROAD, AND 60 FEET E OF AN ABANDONED STORE.  THE MARK IS A BRONZE DISK, WITH THE ARROW POINTING TOWARD THE STATION, STAMPED COOPER 1934 NO.2, SET IN THE TOP OF A 12-INCH SQUARE CONCRETE MONUMENT, WHICH EXTENDS 3 INCHES ABOVE THE GROUND.  THE MARK IS IN GOOD CONDITION.  REFERENCE MARK NO.3 IS LOCATED 157.01 FEET SW OF THE STATION ON THE W SIDE OF THE DIRT ROAD, 15 FEET W OF THE CENTER LINE, 10 FEET S OF TELEPHONE POLE NO.56, AND 10 FEET S OF A 20-INCH PINE STUMP.  THE MARK IS A BRONZE DISK, WITH THE ARROW POINTING TOWARD THE STATION, STAMPED COOPER 1934 NO.3, SET IN THE TOP OF A 12-INCH SQUARE CONCRETE MONUMENT, WHICH EXTENDS 3 INCHES ABOVE THE GROUND.  THE MARK IS IN GOOD CONDITION.  TO REACH THE STATION FROM DELMAR, GO W ON THE ROAD WHICH INTERSECTS HIGHWAY 13 WHICH TURNS N IN DELMAR, FOLLOW THIS ROAD TO THE RAILROAD, CROSS THE RAILROAD AND CONTINUE 0.2 MILE TO A ROAD FORKS AND CURVE TAKE THE RIGHT FORK, CONCRETE ROAD, AND FOLLOW THIS ROAD FOR 3 MILES TO A DIRT CROSS ROAD AT A WHITE CHURCH WHICH IS IN THE SE ANGLE OF THE CROSSROADS, TURN RIGHT ON THIS DIRT ROAD AND FOLLOW THIS ROAD FOR 2.2 MILES TO ST. MARKS EPISCOPAL CHURCH AND GRAVEYARD.  TURN RIGHT AT THE CHURCH AND FOLLOW THE ROAD 0.1 MILE TO THE STATION SITE.                            STATION RECOVERY (1962)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1962 (RWT) THE STATION WAS RECOVERED BUT FOUND TO BE LEANING.  IT WAS RESET BY HOLDING THE SUBSURFACE MARK.  IT IS NOW ABOUT 18 INCHES BELOW THE GROUND SURFACE AND SET IN TOP OF A LARGE CONCRETE CYLINDER DESCRIBED BY NOTE 1B-7A AND STAMPED COOPER 1934.  IT IS LOCATED 74.3 FEET EAST OF THE APPROXIMATE CENTER OF THE MACADAM ROAD, 98.4 FEET NORTHEAST OF A POWERLINE POLE, 107.0 FEET EAST OF A POWERLINE POLE NUMBER 55, 210.0 FEET SOUTHEAST OF A POWERLINE POLE NUMBER D.E.C.-ST2-75-10 AND 40.0 FEET EAST OF A DRAINAGE DITCH.  REFERENCE MARKS 1, 2, AND 3 (AZIMUTH MARK) WAS DESTROYED DUE TO HIGHWAY CONSTRUCTION.  AN OBSERVATION TOWER CAN NOT BE ERECTED OVER STATION COOPER 1934 DUE TO A POWERLINE CONSTRUCTED OVER STATION MARK.  REFERENCE MARK NUMBER 4 WAS ESTABLISHED AND OBSERVED FROM.  THE STATION TO REACH DESCRIPTION WAS ADEQUATE.  A TRAVERSE MEASUREMENT WAS MADE TO STATION COOPER R.M. NO 4 1962, DISTANCE BEING 25.365 FEET AND 7.7314 METERS.                            STATION RECOVERY (1974)  RECOVERY NOTE BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 1974 (LAL) THE STATION MARK, REFERENCE MARKS 4,5,6 AND THE AZIMUTH MARK WERE RECOVERED AND FOUND IN GOOD CONDITION AS DESCRIBED IN 1962.  FOR ADDITIONAL INFORMATION SEE DESCRIPTION COOPER 1934 RM 4.  AIRLINE DISTANCE AND DIRECTION FROM NEAREST TOWN 4.5 MILES NORTHWEST OF DELMAR.                            STATION RECOVERY (2013)  RECOVERY NOTE BY DELAWARE COASTAL PROGRAM 2013 MARK NOT FOUND.

markers.description: BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1962 (RWT) THE STATION IS LOCATED IN THE WEST EDGE OF A CULTIVATED FIELD, 4-3/4 MILES NORTHWEST OF DELMAR, DELAWARE, 5.0 MILES SOUTHEAST OF SHARPTOWN, MARYLAND, 5-1/2 MILES SOUTHWEST OF LAUREL, DELAWARE AND ON PROPERTY OWNED BY MR. H.H. COOPER.  TO REACH THE STATION FROM THE JUNCTION OF U.S. HIGHWAY 13 (ALTERNATE) AND STATE HIGHWAY 24, GO SOUTHERLY ON STATE HIGHWAY 24 FOR 1.9 MILES TO A Y-FORK, KEEP THE LEFT FORK AND CONTINUE SOUTH ON THE MACADAM ROAD FOR 1.2 MILES TO A FORK AND A CHURCH, KEEP THE RIGHT FOR AND CONTINUE SOUTH ON THE MACADAM ROAD FOR 2.2 MILES TO THE STATION ON THE LEFT, 0.1 MILE BEFORE REACHING A CHURCH AND CEMETERY ON THE LEFT.  THE STATION MARK IS A STANDARD REFERENCE MARK DISK STAMPED COOPER NO 4 1962, SET IN TOP OF A SQUARE CONCRETE MONUMENT WHICH IS ABOUT 18 INCHES BELOW THE GROUND SURFACE.  A SUBSURFACE DISK WAS SET PLUMB THE SURFACE DISK IN A 6-INCH CONCRETE CYLINDER ABOUT 40 INCHES BELOW THE GROUND SURFACE AND STAMPED COOPER NO 4 1962.  THE STATION IS LOCATED 74.3 FEET EAST OF THE APPROXIMATE CENTER OF THE MACADAM ROAD, 40.0 FEET EAST OF A DRAINAGE DITCH, 98.4 FEET NORTH OF A POWERLINE POLE, 107.0 FEET EAST OF A POWERLINE POLE NUMBER 55 AND 210.0 FEET SOUTHEAST OF A POWERLINE POLE NUMBER DEC-ST2-75-10.  REFERENCE MARK 5 IS A STANDARD DISK STAMPED COOPER NO 5 1934, SET IN TOP OF A SQUARE CONCRETE MONUMENT WHICH PROJECTS ABOUT 3 INCHES ABOVE THE GROUND SURFACE.  IT IS 1.0 FOOT SOUTHWEST OF A POWERLINE POLE, 6.0 FEET EAST OF A DRAINAGE DITCH AND 44.0 FEET EAST OF THE APPROXIMATE CENTER OF THE MACADAM ROAD.  REFERENCE MARK 6 IS A STANDARD DISK STAMPED COOPER NO 6 1934, SET IN TOP OF A SQUARE CONCRETE MONUMENT WHICH IS ABOUT 14 INCHES BELOW THE GROUND SURFACE.  IT IS 1.0 FOOT EAST OF A POWERLINE POLE NUMBER DEC-ST2-75-10, 6.0 FEET EAST OF A DRAINAGE DITCH AND 44.0 FEET EAST OF THE APPROXIMATE CENTER OF THE MACADAM ROAD.  COOPER 1934 IS A STANDARD DISK STAMPED COOPER 1934, SET IN TOP OF A LARGE CONCRETE CYLINDER WHICH IS ABOUT 18 INCHES BELOW THE GROUND SURFACE.  IT IS 49.0 FEET EAST OF THE APPROXIMATE CENTER OF THE MACADAM ROAD, 81.8 FEET EAST OF A POWERLINE POLE NUMBER 55 AND 148.7 FEET SOUTH OF A POWERLINE POLE WITH WIRE BRACES ON EACH SIDE.  TO REACH THE AZIMUTH MARK FROM THE STATION, GO SOUTH ON THE MACADAM ROAD FOR 0.1 MILE TO A SIDE ROAD LEFT, TURN LEFT AND GO EAST ON THE MACADAM ROAD FOR 0.3 MILE TO THE AZIMUTH MARK ON THE LEFT AS DESCRIBED.  THE AZIMUTH MARK IS A STANDARD DISK STAMPED COOPER 1934 RESET 1962, SET IN TOP OF A SQUARE CONCRETE MONUMENT WHICH PROJECTS 3 INCHES ABOVE THE GROUND SURFACE.  IT IS 1.0 FOOT NORTH OF A STANDARD METAL WITNESS POST AND MARKER, 1.5 FEET NORTH OF A POWERLINE POLE NUMBER DEC-ST2-75-11-4 AND 26.0 FEET NORTH OF THE APPROXIMATE CENTER OF THE MACADAM ROAD.  HEIGHT OF LIGHT ABOVE STATION MARK 30.56 METERS.                            STATION RECOVERY (1974)  RECOVERY NOTE BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 1974 (LAL) THE STATION MARK, COOPER 1934, AZIMUTH MARK, REFERENCE MARKS 5 AND 6 WERE RECOVERED AND FOUND IN GOOD CONDITION.  THE DISTANCE TO ALL MARKS WERE FOUND ADEQUATE TO THE 1962 DATE.  THE HORIZONTAL DIRECTIONS TO THE REFERENCE MARKS WERE FOUND ADEQUATE.  THE HORIZONTAL DIRECTIONS TO STATION COOPER 1934 WAS FOUND IN ERROR BY 1 MINUTE AND 26.2 SECONDS.  A COMPLETE NEW DESCRIPTION FOLLOWS.  THE STATION IS LOCATED ABOUT 5.0 MILES SOUTHWEST OF LAUREL, DELAWARE, 4.5 MILES NORTHWEST OF DELMAR, DELAWARE AND ON LAND OWNED BY MR. EDGAR L. WARRINGTON, ROUTE 3, LAUREL, DELAWARE.  TO REACH THE STATION FROM THE RAILROAD CROSSING AND STATE ROAD 54 IN DELMAR, GO WEST ON STATE ROAD 54 FOR 4.0 MILES TO A PAVED CROSSROAD.  TURN RIGHT AND GO NORTHEAST ON THE PAVED ROAD FOR 2.15 MILES TO A PAVED SIDE ROAD RIGHT AND A CHURCH ON THE RIGHT.  (TURN RIGHT AND GO SOUTHEAST ON THE PAVED ROAD FOR 0.25 MILE TO A DRIVEWAY LEADING TO MR. WARRINGTON RESIDENCE AND THE AZIMUTH MARK.) FROM THE CHURCH GO NORTHEAST ON A FIELD ROAD FOR 0.1 TO THE STATION.  STATION MARKS ARE STANDARD REFERENCE MARK DISKS STAMPED COOPER NO 4 1934.  THE SURFACE DISK IS SET IN THE TOP OF A 12 INCH SQUARE CONCRETE MONUMENT THAT IS 2 INCHES BELOW THE GROUND SURFACE.  IT IS 210 FEET NORTHEAST OF POWERLINE POLE NUMBER ST2-75-10, 153 FEET SOUTH OF POWERLINE POLE NUMBER DEC ST2-75-9, 74 FEET EAST OF THE CENTER OF A PAVED ROAD AND 40 FEET EAST OF A DRAINAGE DITCH.  THE UNDERGROUND DISK IS SET IN THE TOP OF AN IRREGULAR MASS OF CONCRETE 40 INCHES BELOW THE GROUND SURFACE.  COOPER STATION MARKS ARE STANDARD DISKS STAMPED COOPER 1934.  THE SURFACE DISK IS SET IN THE TOP OF A 12 INCH SQUARE CONCRETE MONUMENT THAT IS 6 INCHES BELOW THE GROUND SURFACE.  IT IS 200 FEET NORTHEAST OF POWERLINE POLE NUMBER ST2-75-10, 150 FEET SOUTH OF POWERLINE POLE NUMBER DEC ST2-75-9 AND 49 FEET EAST OF THE CENTER OF THE PAVED ROAD.  THE UNDERGROUND DISK IS SET IN THE TOP OF AN IRREGULAR MASS OF CONCRETE 42 INCHES BELOW THE GROUND SURFACE.  REFERENCE MARK 5, A STANDARD DISK STAMPED COOPER NO 5 1934, IS SET IN THE TOP OF A 12 INCH SQUARE CONCRETE MONUMENT THAT PROJECTS 1 INCH ABOVE THE GROUND SURFACE.  IT IS 44 FEET EAST OF THE CENTER OF THE PAVED ROAD, 6 FEET EAST OF THE DRAINAGE DITCH AND 1 FOOT SOUTHWEST OF POWERLINE POLE NUMBER DEC ST2-75-9.  REFERENCE MARK 6, A STANDARD DISK STAMPED COOPER NO 6 1934, IS SET IN THE TOP OF A 12 INCH SQUARE CONCRETE MONUMENT THAT IS 18 INCHES BELOW THE GROUND SURFACE.  IT IS 44 FEET SOUTHEAST OF THE CENTER OF THE PAVED ROAD, 6 FEET EAST-SOUTHEAST OF THE DRAINAGE DITCH AND 1 FOOT EAST-SOUTHEAST OF POWERLINE POLE NUMBER ST2-75-10.  AZIMUTH MARK, A STANDARD DISK STAMPED COOPER 1934 RESET 1962, IS SET IN THE TOP OF A 12 INCH SQUARE CONCRETE MONUMENT THAT PROJECTS 1 INCH ABOVE THE GROUND SURFACE.  IT IS 35 FEET SOUTH OF THE CENTER OF THE DRIVEWAY LEADING TO MR. WARRINGTON HOUSE, 27 FEET EAST-SOUTHEAST OF THE CENTER OF THE PAVED ROAD, 1 FOOT NORTH OF POWERLINE POLE NUMBER ST2-75-11-4 AND 1 FOOT NORTH OF A METAL WITNESS POST.  HEIGHT OF LIGHT ABOVE STATION MARK 100.3 FEET.  AIRLINE DISTANCE AND DIRECTION FROM NEAREST TOWN 4.5 MILES NORTHWEST OF DELMAR.                            STATION RECOVERY (2013)  RECOVERY NOTE BY DELAWARE COASTAL PROGRAM 2013 MARK NOT FOUND.

markers.description: BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1909 (ES) THIS STATION IS ON A SAND HILL ABOUT HALFWAY BETWEEN INDIAN RIVER INLET AND BETHANY BEACH.  THE STATION IS ON THE HIGHEST PART OF THE HIGH HILL AND CANNOT FAIL TO BE FOUND SO LONG AS THE HILL REMAINS.  ON THE OCEAN SIDE THE HILL IS MORE OF A BLUFF AND ON THE LAND SIDE IT IS COVERED WITH WILD PLUM BUSHES THAT REACH TO THE TOP.  JUST A FEW METERS NE OF THE HILL IS A LIFE SAVING BOATHOUSE.  IT IS MARKED WITH A COPPER TRIANGULATION-STATION MARK SET IN CEMENT 3 FEET BELOW SURFACE AND ABOVE THIS A CEMENT BLOCK IN WHICH IS SET 1-INCH GALVANIZED-PIPE 18 INCHES LONG, IN WHICH IS FASTENED A COPPER TRIANGULATION-STATION MARK.  THIS HILL IS 40 TO 50 FEET HIGH.                            STATION RECOVERY (1920)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1920 (OWF) RECOVERED O.K.  WIND THREATENING TO EXCAVATE IT OUT, HAD IT FILLED IN.                            STATION RECOVERY (1920)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1920 (HAS) SITE OF STATION NOT VISITED.  SIGNAL STANDING WHICH WAS ERECTED OVER THIS STATION IN 1919.  USED AS A HYDROGRAPHIC SIGNAL.                            STATION RECOVERY (1932)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1932 (ERM) STATION RECOVERED APPARENTLY IN ORIGINAL POSITION.  THE REFERENCE CONCRETE POST, WHICH WAS SET SOMETIME AFTER THE STATION WAS ESTABLISHED HAS FALLEN DOWN THE HILL AND THE STATION MARK ITSELF IS IN SERIOUS DANGER OF COLLAPSE, BECAUSE THE SAND HAS BEEN BLOWN AWAY FROM IT.                            STATION RECOVERY (1932)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1932 (CDM) LOCATED ON A SAND HILL ON THE SHORE ABOUT 2.9 MILES N OF BETHANY BEACH, DELAWARE.  BETWEEN THE ROAD AND BEACH.  ABOUT 100 YARDS SW OF A COAST GUARD BOATHOUSE.  ON THE HIGHEST PART OF THE HILL.  A NEW SURFACE AND THREE NEW REFERENCE MARKS WERE SET.  STATION AND REFERENCE MARKS ARE STANDARD BRONZE DISKS SET IN CONCRETE.  REFERENCE MARK NO.1 IS A NEW MARK SET AT THE FOOT OF THE HILL, NE OF THE STATION.  REFERENCE MARK NO.2 IS AN OLD MARK SET S OF STATION.  REFERENCE MARK NO.3 IS A NEW MARK SET NW OF STATION ON THE SAME HILL.  REFERENCE MARK NO.4 IS A NEW MARK SET ABOUT 0.25 MILE NW OF STATION.  ABOUT 8 METERS E OF THE CENTER LINE OF ROAD, ABOUT 8 METERS SE OF SE CORNER OF SMALL BRIDGE.  TO REACH, TURN E FROM HIGHWAY 113 AT DAGSBORO, DELAWARE, GO TO BETHANY BEACH AND TURN N.                            STATION RECOVERY (1934)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1934 (JCT) STATION AND REFERENCE MARKS RECOVERED AS DESCRIBED BY C.D. MEANEY IN 1932 IN GOOD CONDITION.  THE DESCRIPTION BY C.D. MEANEY IS ADEQUATE.  THE SAND DUNES ON WHICH THE STATION IS LOCATED ARE KNOWN LOCALLY AS COTTON PATCH HILL.                            STATION RECOVERY (1942)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1942 (WDP) THIS STATION IS LOCATED ON COTTON PATCH HILL, A SAND HILL LOCATED 2.9 MILES N OF BETHANY BEACH ON HIGHWAY 14, ON THE EXTREME PEAK OF THE HILL, LOCATED IN A SAND STRIP 27.22 FEET W OF THE E EDGE OF THE STRIP, AND 71.0 FEET S OF THE N EDGE OF THE STRIP.  THE STATION IS A BRONZE DISK TRIANGULATION STATION MARK, STAMPED COTTON PATCH 1909, 1932, SET IN THE TOP OF AN 18-INCH IN DIAMETER CONCRETE MONUMENT, WHICH PROJECTS 12 INCHES ABOVE THE GROUND.  THE STATION IS IN FAIR CONDITION - STORMS HAVE SWEPT AWAY 12 INCHES OF SUPPORTING SAND FROM AROUND THE MONUMENT.  REFERENCE MARK NO.1 IS LOCATED 88.83 FEET ENE OF THE STATION.  THE MARK IS A BRONZE DISK REFERENCE MARK, WITH THE ARROW POINTING TOWARD THE STATION, STAMPED COTTON PATCH 1909, 1932 NO.1, SET IN A 12-INCH SQUARE CONCRETE MONUMENT, WHICH PROJECTS 12 INCHES ABOVE THE GROUND.  THE MARK IS IN GOOD CONDITION.  REFERENCE MARK NO.2 IS LOCATED 69.80 FEET SSW OF THE STATION.  THE MARK IS A BRONZE DISK REFERENCE MARK, WITH THE ARROW POINTING TOWARD THE STATION, STAMPED COTTON PATCH 1909, 1932 NO.2, SET IN AN 18-INCH IN DIAMETER CONCRETE MONUMENT WHICH PROJECTS 3 INCHES ABOVE GROUND.  THE MARK IS IN GOOD CONDITION.  REFERENCE MARK NO.3 IS LOCATED 273.86 FEET N OF THE STATION.  THE MARK IS A BRONZE DISK REFERENCE MARK, WITH THE ARROW POINTING TOWARD THE STATION, STAMPED COTTON PATCH 1909, 1932 NO.3, SET IN A 12-INCH CONCRETE MONUMENT WHICH PROJECTS 12 INCHES ABOVE THE GROUND.  THE MARK IS IN GOOD CONDITION.  REFERENCE MARK NO.4 IS LOCATED APPROXIMATELY 0.25 MILE NW OF THE STATION, ABOUT 20 FEET E OF CENTER LINE OF HIGHWAY AND 20 FEET SE OF SE CORNER OF BRIDGE.  THE MARK IS A BRONZE DISK REFERENCE MARK, WITH THE ARROW POINTING TOWARD THE STATION, STAMPED COTTON PATCH 1909, 1932 NO.4, SET IN THE TOP OF A 12-INCH CONCRETE MONUMENT, WHICH EXTENDS 12 INCHES ABOVE THE GROUND.  THE MARK IS IN GOOD CONDITION.                            STATION RECOVERY (1943)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1943 (FLG) RECOVERED AS DESCRIBED WITH THE FOLLOWING DISCREPANCIES--  REFERENCE MARK 1 IS 88.46 FT. OR 26.960 M. NE OF THE STATION.  REFERENCE MARK 2 IS 69.30 FT. OR 21.120 M. S OF THE STATION.  REFERENCE MARK 3 IS 273.95 FT. N OF THE STATION.  THE MARK NOW EXTENDS 2 FT. ABOVE THE GROUND, BUT IT IS STILL FIRMLY EMBEDDED.                            STATION RECOVERY (1958)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1958 (JAW) THE STATION MARK WAS FOUND LAYING ON ITS SIDE AT THE BOTTOM OF THE SAND DUNE, 9 PACES S OF RM NO 1.  A NEW SUMMER HOME, OWNED BY JUDGE O. R. LAYTON, OF WILMINGTON, DEL. HAS BEEN BUILT ON TOP OF THIS HIGH SAND DUNE.  IT IS BELIEVED THE OLD STATION SITE IS ABOUT 10 PACES S OF THE SCREEN POARCH OF THE NEW HOUSE, NEAR A FENCE LINE.  R. M. NO 1 1909, 1932 WAS RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION ABOUT 10 PACES S OF THE BOARDWALK LEADING TO THE BEACH.  THE MARK PROJECTS ABOUT 6 INCHES.  R. M. NO 2 WAS SEARCHED FOR BUT NOT FOUND.  R. M. NO 3 1909,1932 WAS RECOVERED BUT IT IS IN VERY POOR CONDITION DUE TO WIND EROSION.  THE WHOLE E SIDE OF THIS MARK IS SHOWING.  IT SHOULD BE LOWERED ABOUT 4 FT.  THIS MARK IS NOW LOCATED ON THE NEXT HIGH SAND DUNE N OF THE NEW HOUSE, AND ABOUT 65 PACES N OF POWER POLE NO 295 O.  RM NO 4 WAS DESTROYED ROAD MACHINERY ACCORDING TO P.SHORT.  REACHED FROM THE JCT. OF ROUTES NOS. 14 AND 26 IN BETHANY BEACH AS FOLLOWS--GO N ON ROUTE NO 14 FOR 2.8 MILES TO A DRIVEWAY TO A NEW HOUSE AT A SMALL LOCKED GATE AND STATION SITE ON THE SAND DUNE JUST S. OF THE HOUSE.                            STATION RECOVERY (1958)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1958 (WER) STATION WAS RECOVERED AS DESCRIBED IN RECOVERY NOTE WRITTEN BY JAW.  THE STATION MARK WAS FOUND LAYING ON ITS SIDE.  NO ATTEMPT WAS MADE TO REESTABLISH THE STATION MARK.  REFERENCE MARK NO. 1, 1909, 1932 WAS RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION.  REFERENCE MARK NO. 2 WAS NOT RECOVERED.  REFERENCE MARK NO. 3, 1909, 1932 WAS RECOVERED.  THE MARK WAS PROJECTING ABOUT 2 FEET DUE TO WIND EROSION.  THIS MARK WAS LOWERED, HOLDING THE ORIGINAL POSITION.  THE MARK NOW PROJECTS APPROXIMATELY 4 INCHES.  THIS STATION WAS NOT VISITED BY AN OBSERVING UNIT.                            STATION RECOVERY (1958)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1958 (CRR) REFERENCE MARK 4 WAS MOVED FROM ORIGINAL LOCATION TO THE RIGHT-OF-WAY LINE. BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1909 (ES) THIS STATION IS ON A VERY PROMINENT SAND HILL N OF FENWICK LIFE SAVING STATION.  IT IS JUST BACK OF A POINT OF MARSH PROJECTING INTO LITTLE ASSAWOMAN BAY.  STATION IS MARKED WITH A 1-INCH GALVANIZED-IRON PIPE IN WHICH IS SET ONE OF THE COPPER TRIANGULATION MARKS.  THE PIPE IS 8 FEET LONG AND 4 FEET OF IT IS SET IN CEMENT.  IT IS QUITE USELESS TO PUT IN ANY REFERENCE MARKS.  SO LONG AS THE SAND HILL REMAINS IT WILL BE EASILY FOUND.  TO THE N OF IT ARE THE REMAINS OF TWO OLD WRECKS AND SE WAY UP ON THE SAND ARE THE REMAINS OF ANOTHER WRECK. THE MARK IS IN GOOD CONDITION.  REFERENCE MARK NO.3 (AZIMUTH MARK) WAS SEARCHED FOR BUT NOT FOUND.  THE FIELD WHERE THE MARK WAS SET IS IN CULTIVATION, AND THE GROUND HAS BEEN DUG MORE THAN 1.0 FOOT DEEP BY A POTATO DIGGER, AND THE MARK WAS NOT STRUCK, AND AS IT ORIGINALLY EXTENDED 6 INCHES ABOVE THE GROUND IT IS BELIEVED TO BE DESTROYED. A SMALL CREEK ABOUT 180.0 FEET BEYOND THE STATION. A SEARCH FAILED TO FIND THE UNDERGROUND MARK AND IS BELIEVED ALSO TO BE DESTROYED.

markers.description: BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1933 (GLA) TO REACH THIS STATION FROM LEWES, DELAWARE--BEGINNING AT THE INTERSECTION OF THE MAIN HIGHWAY INTO TOWN FROM THE N WITH SECOND STREET, GO W ON WEST SECOND STREET TO THE END, TURN RIGHT FOR ONE BLOCK, AND THEN LEFT.  CONTINUE ON THIS STREET (W FRONT) FOR 1 MILE AND STATION WILL BE FOUND ON THE RIGHT.  STATION MARK IS A STANDARD DISK CEMENTED IN DRILL HOLE IN THE CONCRETE PLATFORM SUPPORTING THE MONUMENT TO DE VRIES.  MONUMENT IS GRAY GRANITE AND BEARS THE INSCRIPTION ERECTED BY THE STATE OF DELAWARE TO COMMEMORATE THE SETTLEMENT ON THIS SPOT, OF THE FIRST DUTCH COLONY UNDER DE VRIES.  A.D. 1631.  HERE WAS THE CRADLING OF A STATE. STATION IS 6.61 FEET N OF THE CENTER OF THE MONUMENT, 4.55 FEET S OF THE N EDGE OF THE CONCRETE PLATFORM, 12.42 FEET W OF THE E EDGE OF THE CONCRETE PLATFORM, 129 FEET S OF THE S BANK OF LEWES CREEK, AND 50 FEET N OF THE CENTER LINE OF THE ROAD.  NO REFERENCE OR AZIMUTH MARKS WERE SET.                            STATION RECOVERY (1933)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1933 RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION.                            STATION RECOVERY (1962)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1962 (RWT) THE STATION AND REFERENCE MARK 1 WERE FOUND AS DISCRIBED AND IN GOOD CONDITION.  THE TO REACH IS ADEQUATE.  STATION MARK IS A STANDARD DISK STAMPED DE VRIES 1933, SET IN A DRILL HOLE IN THE FOUNDATION OF THE MONUMENT, WHICH IS ABOUT 3 FEET HIGHER THAN THE GROUND SURFACE.  IT IS 4.5 FEET EAST OF THE MONUMENT.  9.2 FEET SOUTH OF THE NORTH EDGE OF THE RAILING ON THE MONUMENT.  7.0 FEET NORTH OF THE SOUTH EDGE OF THE MONUMENT.  14.0 FEET EAST OF THE STEPS THAT LEAD UP TO THE MONUMENT.  A TRAVERSE CONNECTION WAS MADE TO REFERENCE MARK 1.  REFERENCE MARK 1 IS A STANDARD DISK STAMPED DE VRIES NO 1 1962 1933, SET IN A 10 X 10 INCH SQUARE CONCRETE MONUMENT.  THE DISK IS FLUSH WITH THE GROUND.  IT IS 26.0 FEET EAST OF THE CENTER OF A BLACKTOP ROAD.  75.0 FEET NORTH-NORTHEAST OF POWERLINE POLE NUMBER RA 60.  82.0 FEET WEST OF THE BANK OF THE ROOSEVELT CANAL.  HEIGHT OF LIGHT ABOVE STATION MARK 1 METER.                            STATION RECOVERY (1963)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1963 (FHG) STATION FOUND IN GOOD CONDITION.  AN ADDITIONAL MONUMENT (AZIMUTH) ON BEACH APPEARS TO HAVE BEEN SET RECENTLY.                            STATION RECOVERY (1969)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1969 (JKW) STATION MARK AND REFERENCE MARK RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION.  THE AZIMUTH MARK WAS REPORTED DESTROYED IN 1969.  THE ORIGINAL DESCRIPTION PLUS THE RECOVERY NOTE BY R.W.T. IN 1962 ARE ADEQUATE.                            STATION RECOVERY (1980)  RECOVERY NOTE BY LOCAL ENGINEER (INDIVIDUAL OR FIRM) 1980 (WW) RECOVERED BY VANDEMARK LYNCH INC.  DE VRIES 1933 RECOVERED GOOD.  DE VRIES NO. 1 1962 - 1933 RECOVERED GOOD.  STATION AND REFERENCE MARK ADEQUATLY DESCRIBED.                            STATION RECOVERY (1984)  RECOVERY NOTE BY NATIONAL OCEAN SERVICE 1984 THE STATION IS LOCATED IN THE NW SECTION OF LEWES, DELAWARE, ON STATE PROPERTY. TO REACH THE STATION FROM THE POST OFFICE IN LEWES, GO WNW ON WEST FRONT STREET FOR 1.25 MI TO THE STATION NEAR A MONUMENT COMMEMORATING THE FIRST SETTLEMENT OF THE DUTCH COLONY UNDER DE VRIES, A.D. 1631. THE MONUMENT IS GRAY GRANITE AND BEARS THE INSCRIPTION---ERECTED BY THE STATE OF DELAWARE TO COMMEMORATE THE SETTLEMENT OF THIS SPOT OF THE FIRST DUTCH COLONY UNDER DE VRIES A.D. 1631---. markers.description: BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1962 (RWT) NOTE--NO REFERENCE MARKS WERE ESTABLISHED AT THIS STATION.  THE STATION IS LOCATED ABOUT 1.5 MILES NORTHEAST OF LEWES, DELAWARE BUSINESS DISTRICT.  0.3 MILE NORTH OF STATION DE VRIES RM 1, AT THE WESTERN END OF THE NARROW STRIP OF LAND BETWEEN THE CANAL AND THE OCEAN AND ON THE EASTERLY SIDE OF THE ROOSEVELT CANAL OR INLET.  TO REACH THE STATION FROM THE POST OFFICE IN LEWES, GO SOUTHEAST ON MAIN STREET FOR 0.05 MILE TO THE INTERSECTION OF GILLS NECK ROAD AND SAVANNAH ROAD.  TURN LEFT AND GO NORTHEAST ON SAVANNAH ROAD FOR 0.43 MILE TO THE INTERSECTION OF WEST CEDAR STREET. THE AZIMUTH MARK, A STANDARD DISK STAMPED DE VRIES 1962, IS SET IN THE TOP OF A 10 INCH SQUARE CONCRETE MONUMENT PROJECTING ABOUT 4 INCHES ABOVE THE SURFACE OF THE GROUND. markers.description: BY US ARMY CORPS OF ENGINEERS 1933 (GLA) THIS IS A CUT-IN STATION, ON THE SW BANK OF DELAWARE BAY, ON DELAWARE POINT.  50 FEET NW OF HIGH WATER LINE.  DELAWARE POINT IS ABOUT 0.8 MILE SE OF COLLINS BEACH AND 0.9 MILE NW OF THE MOUTH OF THE SMYRNA RIVER.  THE STATION IS MARKED BY A 1-1/4 -INCH PIPE 6 FEET LONG DRIVEN IN THE GROUND.  OVER THE STATION IS ERECTED A SQUARE SKELETON STEEL TOWER 60 FEET HIGH WITH ITS BASE ANCHORED IN CONCRETE.  A LATTICEWORK TARGET 20 FEET HIGH IS MOUNTED ON THE UPPER SECTIONS OF THE TOWER.                            STATION RECOVERY (1975)  RECOVERY NOTE BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 1975 (RST) THIS STATION IS ON THE SOUTHWEST BANK OF THE DELAWARE RIVER ON DELAWARE POINT, 50 FEET SOUTH BY SOUTHWEST OF THE HIGH WATER LINE.  DELAWARE POINT IS ABOUT 0.9 MILE NORTHWEST OF THE MOUTH OF THE SMYRNA RIVER.  THE STATION IS MARKED BY A 6 FOOT, 1-1/4 - INCH IRON PIPE DRIVEN INTO THE GROUND.  OVER THE STATION, A 60 FOOT FRAME STEEL TOWER STANDS.  A 20 FOOT LATTICE TARGET IS ON THE UPPER PORTION OF THE TOWER.  THE TOWER AND TARGET HAVE BEEN SUBJECT TO WEATHERING AND SOME FRAME MEMBERS HAVE FALLEN FROM THE TOWER.  TO REACH THE STATION FROM SMYRNA, TAKE ROUTE 6 EAST AND TURN LEFT ON ROUTE 9.  PROCEED ACROSS THE SMYRNA RIVER AND TURN RIGHT (ON ROUTE 9) AT A FORK IN THE ROAD.  TURN RIGHT AGAIN 150 YARDS FROM THE FORK AND PROCEED TO AN INTERSECTION.  PROCEED THROUGH THE GATE FROM THE STATE ROAD TO A PRIVATE ROAD.  CONTINUE PAST A FARM HOUSE (THE MAJOR PORTION OF WHICH WAS THE BASE TO A WIND MILL--A TRUNKATED PYRAMID) ON A DIRT ROAD TO A MARSH. PROCEED ON FOOT THROUGH THE MARSH ABOUT 1/3 MILE TO THE TOWER AND STATION.  (PERMISSION TO CROSS PRIVATE PROPERTY AND PERHAPS KEYS MAY BE OBTAINED FROM TENANTS OR OWNER, MR. GREEN.)
markers.setting: OBJECT DRIVEN INTO GROUND
markers.stability: MARK OF QUESTIONABLE OR UNKNOWN STABILITY

markers.description: BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1934 (JB) STATION IS ABOUT 0.35 MILE W OF THE VILLAGE OF DELMAR, ON N SIDE OF THE CONCRETE DELMAR-PROVIDENCE HIGHWAY, ON PROPERTY BELONGING TO THE STATE BOARD OF EDUCATION, AND OCCUPIED BY THE DELMAR SCHOOLHOUSE.  STATION IS LOCATED 159 FEET E OF THE SCHOOLHOUSE.  15 FEET N OF THE 5-FOOT CONCRETE WALK.  17 FEET W OF A 4-FOOT WIRE FENCE WHICH SEPARATES THE SCHOOL GROUNDS FROM A PATCH OF THICK WOODS.  SURFACE, UNDERGROUND, AND REFERENCE MARKS ARE STANDARD BRONZE DISKS SET IN CONCRETE, AS DESCRIBED IN NOTES 1A, 7A, AND 11A.  REFERENCE MARK NO.1 IS 171.58 FEET N OF THE STATION.  7 FEET E OF THE 4-FOOT WIRE FENCE AND PROJECTS 4 INCHES ABOVE THE GROUND.  REFERENCE MARK NO.2 IS 158.27 FEET W OF THE STATION AND IS SET IN THE E CONCRETE STOOP OF THE SCHOOL BUILDING.  8 INCHES E OF THE E SIDE OF THE BUILDING AND 1 FOOT S OF THE N EDGE OF STOOP.  FLUSH.  REFERENCE MARK NO.3, THE AZIMUTH MARK, IS ABOUT 1/2 MILE NW OF STATION AND 8 PACES SW OF THE DELMAR-PROVIDENCE HIGHWAY.  3 FEET SE OF FENCE CORNER AT A SIGN READING TUXEDO FEEDS.  IT PROJECTS 1-INCH ABOVE THE GROUND.  TO REACH FROM SALISBURY, FOLLOW U.S. HIGHWAY 13 TO DELMAR DEPOT.  CONTINUE STRAIGHT AHEAD ACROSS RAILROAD TRACKS W ON THE DELMAR-PROVIDENCE CONCRETE ROAD FOR 0.35 MILE TO THE DELMAR SCHOOL AND THE STATION SITE ON THE RIGHT.                            STATION RECOVERY (1942)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1942 (WDP) THE FOLLOWING DISCREPANCIES WERE NOTED IN THE FIELD WITH THE DESCRIPTION.  (1) REFERENCE MARK NO.1 EXTENDS 2 INCHES ABOVE THE GROUND, NOT 4 INCHES.  (2) REFERENCE MARK NO.2 EXTENDS 0.05 INCH ABOVE THE STOOP, NOT FLUSH WITH THE STOOP.  (3) REFERENCE MARK NO.3 IS LOCATED 1/4 MILE NW OF THE STATION, NOT 1/2 MILE NW.  (4) DELETE 3 FEET SE OF FENCE CORNER AT A SIGN READING TUXEDO FEEDS.  THE SIGN HAS BEEN MOVED.  THE STATION IS LOCATED ABOUT 0.35 MILE W OF THE TOWN OF DELMAR, ON PROPERTY BELONGING TO THE STATE BOARD OF EDUCATION, 159 FEET E OF A SCHOOLHOUSE, 15 FEET N OF A 5-FOOT CONCRETE WALK AND 17 FEET W OF A 4-FOOT WIRE FENCE SEPARATING THE SCHOOL PROPERTY FROM A PATCH OF THICK BRUSH.  THE STATION IS A BRONZE DISK, STAMPED DELMAR 1934 N, SET IN THE TOP OF A 12-INCH SQUARE CONCRETE MONUMENT, WHICH EXTENDS 3 INCHES ABOVE THE GROUND. THE STATION IS IN GOOD CONDITION.  REFERENCE MARK NO.1 IS LOCATED 171.58 FEET N OF THE STATION, AND 7 FEET E OF THE 4-FOOT WIRE FENCE.  THE MARK IS A BRONZE DISK, WITH THE ARROW POINTING TOWARD THE STATION, STAMPED DELMAR 1934 NO.1, SET IN THE TOP OF A 12-INCH SQUARE CONCRETE MONUMENT, WHICH EXTENDS 2 INCHES ABOVE THE GROUND.  THE MARK IS IN GOOD CONDITION.  REFERENCE MARK NO.2 IS LOCATED 158.27 FEET W OF THE STATION.  THE MARK IS A BRONZE DISK, WITH THE ARROW POINTING TOWARD THE STATION, STAMPED DELMAR 1934, NO.2, SET IN THE E STEP OF THE SCHOOL BUILDING WHICH EXTENDS ABOUT 0.05 INCH ABOVE THE SURFACE OF THE STEP.  THE MARK IS IN FAIR CONDITION AS IT IS SLIGHTLY LOOSE AND SHOWS EVIDENCE OF PRYING.  REFERENCE MARK NO.3 (AZIMUTH MARK) IS LOCATED ABOUT 1/4 MILE NW OF THE STATION, 8 YARDS SW OF THE CENTER LINE OF THE DELMAR-PROVIDENCE HIGHWAY, AND 3 FEET SE OF A FENCE CORNER.  THE MARK IS A BRONZE DISK, WITH THE ARROW POINTING TOWARD THE STATION, STAMPED DELMAR 1934 NO.3, SET IN THE TOP OF A 12-INCH SQUARE CONCRETE MONUMENT, WHICH EXTENDS 1 INCH ABOVE THE GROUND.  THE MARK IS IN GOOD CONDITION.                            STATION RECOVERY (1963)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1963 0.4 MI W FROM DELMAR. 0.3 MILE WEST ALONG STATE HIGHWAY 455 FROM THE CROSSING OF THE PENNSYLVANIA RAILROAD AT DELMAR, THENCE 0.05 MILE NORTHWEST ALONG STATE HIGHWAY 76, AT THE DELMAR SCHOOL, AT THE SOUTHEAST CORNER OF THE PLAYGROUND, 156.5 FEET EAST OF THE SOUTHEAST CORNER OF THE SCHOOL (FRAME BUILDING), 35.5 FEET NORTH OF CENTER LINE OF A BLACK TOP ROAD LEADING EAST AND WEST ALONG SOUTH SIDE OF SCHOOL, 15.2 FEET NORTH OF NORTH EDGE OF A SIDEWALK, 22 1/2 FEET NORTHWEST OF A 24-INCH PINE TREE, 1 FOOT WEST OF A STEEL WITNESS POST, ABOUT LEVEL WITH ROAD, AND SET IN THE TOP OF A CONCRETE POST PROJECTING 1 INCH.                            STATION RECOVERY (1965)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1965 (JCB) THE STATION AND REFERENCE MARKS 1 AND 2 WERE RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION.  REFERENCE MARK NO. 2 HAS BEEN MUTILATED AND THE LEGEND IS NOT READABLE BUT IT IS STILL IN POSITION AND SHOULD BE CONSIDERED GOOD.  REFERENCE MARK NO. 3 WAS RECOVERED IN APPARENT GOOD CONDITION BUT IT HAD A GRADER BLADE SCAR ON ITS NORTH SIDE.  THIS MARK WAS DESTROYED THIS DATE AFTER A NEW AZIMUTH MARK WAS ESTABLISHED.  THE ORIGINAL DESCRIPTION IS INADEQUATE.  A COMPLETE NEW DESCRIPTION FOLLOWS.  THE STATION IS ABOUT 0.35 MILE WEST OF THE VILLAGE OF DELMAR, NEAR THE SOUTHWEST CORNER OF A WOODED AREA, IN THE SOUTHEAST CORNER OF A SCHOOLYARD, ON PROPERTY OWNED BY THE STATE BOARD OF EDUCATION. IT IS 157 FEET EAST OF THE SOUTHEAST CORNER OF THE SCHOOLHOUSE, 35 FEET NORTH OF THE APPROXIMATE CENTERLINE OF A MACADAM ROAD, 15 FEET NORTH OF THE NORTH EDGE OF THE SIDEWALK, 20 FEET NORTHWEST OF A POWERLINE POLE AND 1 FOOT WEST OF A STEEL WITNESS POST.  THE MONUMENT PROJECTS 1 INCH AND THE DISK IS STAMPED DELMAR NO 1 1934.  REFERENCE MARK 1 IS IN A DENSELY WOODED AREA 171.58 FEET NORTH OF THE STATION, 200 FEET NORTHEAST OF THE NORTHEAST CORNER OF THE SCHOOLHOUSE AND 29 FEET EAST OF THE WEST EDGE OF THE WOODS.  THE MONUMENT PROJECTS 4 INCHES AND THE DISK IS STAMPED DELMAR NO 1 1934.  REFERENCE MARK 2 IS 158.27 FEET WEST OF THE STATION, AND IS A STANDARD REFERENCE MARK DISK SET IN A DRILL HOLE IN THE CONCRETE STOOP AT THE EAST SIDE OF THE SCHOOLHOUSE, 8 INCHES EAST OF THE EAST WALL OF THE BUILDING.  THE DISK HAS BEEN MUTILATED AND IS NOT READABLE.  THE AZIMUTH MARK IS 0.3 MILE WEST-NORTHWEST OF THE STATION, 53 FEET SSW OF THE CENTERLINE OF A PAVED ROAD, 32 FEET SSW OF A FENCE CORNER AND 15 FEET SSW OF A WILD CHERRY TREE.  THE MONUMENT IS FLUSH AND THE DISK IS STAMPED DELMAR 1934 RESET 1965.  TO REACH THE STATION FROM THE RAILROAD CROSSING, ABOUT 0.05 MILE SOUTH OF THE RAILROAD DEPOT IN DELMAR, GO WEST ON STATE HIGHWAY 76 FOR 0.2 MILE TO A FORK.  BEAR RIGHT AND GO NORTHWEST FOR 0.1 MILE TO A SIDE-STREET RIGHT.  TURN RIGHT AND GO EAST FOR 0.05 MILE TO THE SOUTHEAST CORNER OF A SCHOOLYARD AND THE STATION.  TO REACH THE AZIMUTH MARK FROM THE STATION, GO WEST FOR 0.05 MILE TO STATE HIGHWAY 76.  TURN RIGHT AND GO NORTHWEST ON HIGHWAY 76 FOR 0.25 MILE TO A DRIVEWAY RIGHT, A FENCE CORNER AND THE AZIMUTH MARK ON THE LEFT.  HEIGHT OF LIGHT ABOVE STATION MARK 1 METER.                            STATION RECOVERY (1965)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1965 RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION.                            STATION RECOVERY (1966)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1966 (JCB) STATION, REFERENCE MARK NO. 1 AND AZIMUTH MARK WERE RECOVERED AS DESCRIBED BY J.C.B. IN 1965 AND FOUND TO BE IN GOOD CONDITION.  REFERENCE MARK NO. 2 HAD BEEN MUTILATED AND THE DISK WAS LOOSE.  THE SCHOOLHOUSE WAS IN THE PROCESS OF BEING TORN DOWN SO THE MARK WAS DESTROYED AND A REFERENCE MARK NO. 4 WAS ESTABLISHED.  THE PROPERTY OWNER REQUESTED THAT THE AZIMUTH MARK BE MOVED SO A NEW AZIMUTH MARK WAS ESTABLISHED AND THE OLD MARK WAS THEN DESTROYED.  BECAUSE OF A HEAVY GROWTH OF TREES AND BRUSH REFERENCE MARK NO. 1 COULD NOT BE SEEN SO THE DISTANCE AND DIRECTION WAS NOT CHECKED.  THE 1965 DESCRIPTION IS ADEQUATE FOR RECOVERY.  REFERENCE MARK NO. 4 IS 40 FEET EAST OF UTILITY POLE 3 Q, 24 FEET NORTH OF THE CENTERLINE OF STREET AND AT THE SOUTH EDGE OF WOODS.  THE MARK IS A STANDARD DISK SET FLUSH IN A CONCRETE MONUMENT ABOUT 10 INCHES SQUARE, FLUSH WITH THE GROUND AND THE DISK IS STAMPED DELMAR NO 4 1934.  NOTE 11A.  AZIMUTH MARK IS 31 FEET SOUTH OF THE CENTERLINE OF STATE HIGHWAY 76, 5 FEET EAST OF UTILITY POLE 6 11 AND 1 FOOT EAST OF STEEL WITNESS POST.  THE MARK IS A STANDARD DISK SET FLUSH IN A CONCRETE MONUMENT ABOUT 10 INCHES IN DIAMETER, PROJECTS ABOUT 2 INCHES AND THE DISK IS STAMPED DELMAR AZ 2 1966 1934.  NOTE 16B.  AIRLINE DISTANCE AND DIRECTION FROM NEAREST TOWN AT DELMAR.                            STATION RECOVERY (1974)  RECOVERY NOTE BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 1974 (LAL) NO SUITABLE PLACE FOR AN AZIMUTH MARK TO BE ESTABLISHED.  THE STATION MARK WAS RECOVERED AND FOUND TO BE IN GOOD CONDITION.  REFERENCE MARK 1, REFERENCE MARK 2 AND REFERENCE MARK 3 WERE SEARCHED FOR AND ARE BELIEVED DESTROYED.  REFERENCE MARKS 4 AND 5 WERE ESTABLISHED AT THIS TIME.  THE STATION IS ON THE PROPERTY OF MRS. LUCY SPARROW, BOX 192, DELMAR, DELAWARE. DUE TO THE CHANGES A NEW DESCRIPTION FOLLOWS.  THE STATION IS LOCATED IN THE WEST PART OF DELMAR, DELAWARE.  TO REACH THE STATION FROM THE RAILROAD CROSSING AND STATE HIGHWAY 54 IN DELMAR, DELAWARE, GO WEST ON STATE HIGHWAY 54 FOR 0.2 MILE TO A FORK.  TAKE THE RIGHT FORK AND GO NORTHWESTERLY ON STATE HIGHWAY 54 FOR 0.1 MILE TO A PAVED ROAD RIGHT AND REFERENCE MARK 4 ON THE RIGHT.  TURN RIGHT AND GO EAST ON PAVED ROAD FOR 0.05 MILE TO THE STATION ON THE LEFT AS DESCRIBED.  THE STATION MARKS ARE STANDARD DISKS STAMPED DELMAR 1934.  THE SURFACE DISK IS SET IN THE TOP OF A 12-INCH SQUARE CONCRETE MONUMENT THAT IS FLUSH WITH THE GROUND SURFACE.  IT IS 34 FEET NORTH OF THE CENTER OF THE PAVED ROAD, 21 FEET NORTHWEST OF A POWERLINE POLE NUMBER 3 Q, 8.6 FEET SOUTH OF A 12-INCH MAPLE TREE AND 3.5 FEET SOUTH-SOUTHWEST OF A METAL WITNESS POST WITH SIGN.  IT IS ASSUMED THAT THE UNDERGROUND DISK IS AS DESCRIBED IN PREVIOUS DESCRIPTIONS.  (NOTE 1A 7A).  REFERENCE MARK 4, A STANDARD DISK STAMPED DELMAR NO 4 1934 1974, IS SET IN THE TOP OF A 12-INCH CYLINDRICAL CONCRETE MONUMENT THAT IS FLUSH WITH THE GROUND SURFACE.  IT IS 107 FEET SOUTHEAST OF THE INTERSECTION OF THE PAVED ROAD AND STATE HIGHWAY 54, 43 FEET NORTHEAST OF THE CENTER OF STATE HIGHWAY 54 AND 39 FEET SOUTH OF THE CENTER OF THE PAVED ROAD.  THE UNDERGROUND DISK IS SET IN THE TOP OF AN IRREGULAR MASS OF CONCRETE 42 INCHES BELOW THE GROUND SURFACE.  (NOTE 11B DESC.)  REFERENCE MARK 5, A STANDARD DISK STAMPED DELMAR NO 5 1934 1974, IS SET IN THE TOP OF A 12-INCH CYLINDRICAL CONCRETE MONUMENT THAT IS FLUSH WITH THE GROUND SURFACE.  IT IS 17 FEET NORTH OF THE CENTER OF THE PAVED ROAD, 13 FEET EAST OF A SIGN SHARPTOWN AND 1.8 FEET SOUTH-SOUTHWEST OF A POWERLINE POLE NUMBER 3 R.  (NOTE 11B)  HEIGHT OF LIGHT ABOVE STATION MARK 4.49 FEET.  AIRLINE DISTANCE AND DIRECTION FROM NEAREST TOWN IN THE WEST PART OF DELMAR, DELAWARE.                            STATION RECOVERY (1974)  RECOVERY NOTE BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 1974 (CLN) THE STATION AND ALL MARKS WERE RECOVERED AND FOUND IN GOOD CONDITION.  REFERENCE MARK 5 WILL BE DESTROYED BY CONSTRUCTION DURING THE FALL OF 1974.  A NEW REFERENCE MARK 6 WAS ESTABLISHED AT THIS DATE.  THE DISTANCES AND DIRECTION TO ALL MARKS WERE WITHIN CLOSE AGREEMENT WITH THE PREVIOUS OBSERVATIONS.  A COMPLETE NEW DESCRIPTION OF THE STATION FOLLOWS.  THE STATION IS LOCATED JUST NORTH OF THE MARYLAND AND DELAWARE LINE IN THE WEST PORT OF DELMAR.  THE PROPERTY IS OWNED BY MRS. LUCY SPARROW, BOX 192, DELMAR, DELAWARE.  TO REACH THE STATION FROM A POINT IN DELMAR WHERE STATE HIGHWAY 54 CROSSES A RAILROAD TRACKS.  GO WEST ON STATE HIGHWAY 54 FOR 0.2 MILE TO A FORK.  BEAR RIGHT AND GO NORTHWEST ON STATE HIGHWAY 54 FOR 0.1 MILE TO A REVERST Y-FORK.  TURN SHARP RIGHT AND GO EAST ON A PAVED ROAD FOR 0.05 MILE TO THE STATION ON THE LEFT, IN THE SOUTHWEST EDGE OF A WOODS.  THE STATION MARK IS A STANDARD DISK STAMPED DELMAR 1934, SET IN THE TOP OF A 12-INCH SQUARE CONCRETE MONUMENT WHICH IS FLUSH WITH THE SURFACE.  IT IS 80.2 FEET EAST OF THE SOUTHEAST CORNER OF A HOUSE, 34 FEET NORTH OF THE CENTER OF THE PAVED ROAD, 21 FEET NORTHWEST OF POWERLINE POLE NUMBERED 3Q 8.6 FEET SOUTH OF A 12-INCH MAPLE TREE AND 3.5 FEET SOUTH-SOUTHWEST OF A WITNESS POST.  (NOTE 1A 7A)  REFERENCE MARK 4 IS A STANDARD DISK STAMPED DELMAR NO 4 1934 1974, SET IN THE TOP OF A 12-INCH ROUND CONCRETE MONUMENT WHICH IS FLUSH WITH THE SURFACE.  IT IS 107 FEET EAST OF THE CENTER OF THE REVERST Y-FORK, 43 FEET NORTH OF THE CENTER OF STATE HIGHWAY 54 AND 39 FEET SOUTH OF THE CENTER OF THE PAVED ROAD LEADING TO THE STATION.  (NOTE 11B)  REFERENCE MARK 6 IS A STANDARD DISK STAMPED DELMAR 1934 NO 6 1974, SET IN THE TOP OF A 10-INCH ROUND CONCRETE MONUMENT WHICH IS FLUSH WITH THE SURFACE.  IT IS 81.9 FEET EAST OF THE SOUTHEAST CORNER OF THE HOUSE 73 FEET NORTH OF THE CENTER OF THE PAVED ROAD AND 36 FEET NORTH OF THE WITNESS POST.  (NOTE 11B).  REFERENCE MARKS 1, 2, AND 3 WERE PREVIOUSLY REPORTED DESTROYED AND VARIFIED AS DESTROYED AT THIS DATE.  AIRLINE DISTANCE AND DIRECTION FROM NEAREST TOWN IN WEST PART OF DELMAR.                            STATION RECOVERY (1976)  RECOVERY NOTE BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 1976 (CLN) THE STATION AND ALL MARKS WERE RECOVERED AND FOUND IN GOOD CONDITION, AS PREVIOUSLY DESCRIBED.  THE MARYLAND-DELAWARE BOUNDARY MONUMENT NUMBER 28 WAS SET AT THIS DATE, SEE DESCRIPTION THEREOF.  AIRLINE DISTANCE AND DIRECTION FROM NEAREST TOWN IN THE WEST EDGE OF DELMAR.                            STATION RECOVERY (1981)  RECOVERY NOTE BY UNIVERSITY OF DELAWARE 1981 RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION.                            STATION RECOVERY (1981)  RECOVERY NOTE BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 1981 RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION.                            STATION RECOVERY (1989)  RECOVERY NOTE BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 1989 IN DELMAR, AT 211 WEST JEWELL STREET, 10.4 M (34.12 FT) NORTH OF THE CENTER OF THE STREET, 10.0 M (32.81 FT) SOUTH-SOUTHWEST OF THE SOUTHWEST CORNER OF THE HOUSE AT 211 WEST JEWELL STREET, 3.6 M (11.81 FT) NORTH-NORTHEAST OF UTILITY POLE NUMBER 47339 96485, 0.5 M (1.64 FT) SOUTH OF A WITNESS POST, LEVEL WITH THE STREET, AND IN A CONCRETE MONUMENT THAT IS 0.1 M (0.33 FT) BELOW THE GROUND SURFACE.                            STATION RECOVERY (2013)  RECOVERY NOTE BY DELAWARE COASTAL PROGRAM 2013 MARK NOT FOUND.

markers.description: BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1965 0.6 MI W FROM DELMAR. 0.2 MILE WEST ALONG STATE HIGHWAY 76 FROM THE RAILROAD CROSSING IN DELMAR, THENCE BEAR RIGHT AND GO NORTHWEST FOR 0.1 MILE TO A SIDE STREET RIGHT, TURN RIGHT AND GO EAST FOR 0.05 MILE TO THE SOUTHEAST CORNER OF A SCHOOL YARD AND STATION DELMAR, THENCE 0.05 MILE WEST TO STATE HIGHWAY 76, THENCE 0.25 MILE NORTHWEST ALONG STATE HIGHWAY 76 TO A DRIVEWAY ON THE RIGHT, 53 FEET SOUTH-SOUTHWEST OF THE CENTERLINE OF PAVED ROAD, 32 FEET SOUTH-SOUTHWEST OF A FENCE CORNER, 15 FEET SOUTH-SOUTHWEST OF A WILD CHERRY TREE. NOTE-- THE MARK ALSO CAN REACHED BY GOING 0.35 MILE WEST ALONG STATE HIGHWAY 455 FROM THE CROSSING OF THE PENNSYLVANIA RAILROAD OF DELMAR, THENCE 0.3 MILE NORTHWEST ALONG STATE HIGHWAY 76.

markers.description: BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1962 (RWT) THE STATION IS THE RED LIGHT AT THE APEX AND CENTER OF THE EASTERN SHORE PUBLIC SERVICE POWER COMPANY, MAST.  LOCATED 1.0 MILE NORTHWEST OF THE CENTRAL SECTION OF TOWN.  IT IS A 3.0 FOOT TRIANGULAR SHAPED LACED STEEL STRUCTURE, WITH ONE VOICE MIRROR MOUNTED ON THE EAST SIDE NEAR THE APEX, ONE VOICE MIRROR MOUNTED ON THE WEST SIDE ABOUT MIDWAY OF THE MAST, ONE MIRROR MOUNTED ON THE NORTH AND ONE ON THE SOUTH SIDE ABOUT 35.0 FEET FROM THE BOTTOM OF THE MAST.  THE STRUCTURE IS MOUNTED ON A 6.0 FOOT SQUARE CONCRETE BASE AND IS PAINTED ALTERNATELY ORANGE AND WHITE AND THE OVERALL HEIGHT IS APPROXIMATELY 210.0 FEET.                            STATION RECOVERY (1995)  RECOVERY NOTE BY US POWER SQUADRON 1995 RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION.

BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1962 (RWT) THE STATION IS THE BALL SHAPED VENT AT THE APEX AND CENTER OF THE RALSTON PURINA COMPANY WATER TANK.  LOCATED ABOUT 1.5 MILES NORTH OF DELMAR, 0.15 MILE WEST OF ALTERNATE U.S. HIGHWAY 13 AND AT THE NORTH END OF THE PLANT YARD.  THE STRUCTURE IS MOUNTED ON TOP AND AT THE NORTHEAST CORNER OF THE CONCRETE ELEVATORS OF THE MILLS.  IT IS A 4-TUBLAR STEEL COLUMN LEGS WITH AN ELLIPSOIDAL TOP AND BOTTOM TANK, WITH A BALL SHAPED VENT MOUNTED ON TOP OF THE ROOF.  THE CENTER PART OF THE TANK IS PAINTED CHECKERED RED AND WHITE, THE ROOF, BOTTOM AND THE LEGS ARE GRAY AND IS MOUNTED ABOUT 35.0 FEET ABOVE THE TOP OF THE ELEVATOR.  THE OVERALL HEIGHT OF BOTH STRUCTURES IS APPROXIMATELY 190.0 FEET.                            STATION RECOVERY (1995)  RECOVERY NOTE BY US POWER SQUADRON 1995 RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION.                            STATION RECOVERY (2009)  RECOVERY NOTE BY GEOCACHING 2009 (DPB) RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION.

BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 1974 (LAL) THE STATION IS LOCATED IN THE WEST EDGE OF DELMAR, DELAWARE AND ON THE PROPERTY OF MRS. LUCY SPARROW, BOX 192, DELMAR, DELAWARE.  TO REACH THE STATION FROM THE RAILROAD CROSSING AND STATE HIGHWAY 54 IN DELMAR, DELAWARE, GO WEST ON STATE HIGHWAY 54 FOR 0.3 MILE TO A REVERSE Y AND THE STATION ON THE RIGHT AS DESCRIBED.  THE STATION IS A STANDARD REFERENCE MARK DISK STAMPED DELMAR NO 4 1934 1974, SET IN THE TOP OF A 12-INCH CYLINDRICAL CONCRETE MONUMENT THAT IS FLUSH WITH THE GROUND SURFACE.  IT IS 107 FEET SOUTHEAST OF THE INTERSECTION OF STATE HIGHWAY 54 AND A PAVED ROAD, 43 FEET NORTHEAST OF THE CENTER OF STATE HIGHWAY 54 AND 39 FEET SOUTH OF THE CENTER OF THE PAVED ROAD.  THE UNDERGROUND DISK IS A STANDARD DISK STAMPED DELMAR NO 4 1934 1974, SET IN THE TOP OF AN IRREGULAR MASS OF CONCRETE 42 INCHES BELOW THE GROUND SURFACE.  DELMAR 1934 RM 5, A STANDARD REFERENCE MARK DISK STAMPED DELMAR NO 5 1934 1974, SET IN THE TOP OF A CYLINDRICAL CONCRETE MONUMENT THAT IS FLUSH WITH THE GROUND SURFACE.  IT IS 17 FEET NORTH OF THE CENTER OF THE PAVED ROAD, 13 FEET EAST OF A SIGN POST WITH SIGN SHARPTOWN ATTACHED AND 1.8 FEET SOUTH-SOUTHWEST OF A POWERLINE POLE NUMBER 3 R.  DELMAR 1934, A STANDARD DISK STAMPED DELMAR 1934, SET IN THE TOP OF A 12-INCH SQUARE CONCRETE MONUMENT THAT IS FLUSH WITH THE GROUND SURFACE.  IT IS 34 FEET NORTH OF THE CENTER OF THE PAVED ROAD, 21 FEET NORTHWEST OF A POWERLINE POLE NUMBER 3 Q, 8.6 FEET SOUTH OF A 12-INCH MAPLE TREE AND 3.5 FEET SOUTH-SOUTHWEST OF A METAL WITNESS POST WITH SIGN.  THE UNDERGROUND DISK IS ASSUMED TO BE AS DESCRIBED PREVIOUSLY.  (NOTE 1A 7A)  HEIGHT OF LIGHT ABOVE STATION MARK 34.3 METERS.                            STATION RECOVERY (1974)  RECOVERY NOTE BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 1974 (CLN) THE STATION WAS RECOVERED AND FOUND IN GOOD CONDITION AS DESCRIBED IN THE PREVIOUS 1974 DESCRIPTION.  THE REFERENCE MARK 5, FOR TRIANGULATION STATION DELMAR 1934, WILL BE DESTROYED BY CONSTRUCTION IN THE NEAR FUTURE.  A NEW REFERENCE MARK 6 WAS ESTABLISHED AT THIS DATE TO REPLACE THE SUBJECT MARKER.  THE NEW REFERENCE MARK 6 WAS INTERSECTED FROM THIS STATION.  THE NEW REFERENCE MARK IS DESCRIBED IN THE DESCRIPTION FOR TRIANGULATION STATION DELMAR 1934.  THE DISTANCES AND DIRECTIONS TO ALL REFERENCE MARKS WERE WITHIN CLOSE AGREEMENT WITH THE PREVIOUS DESCRIPTION.  AIRLINE DISTANCE AND DIRECTION FROM NEAREST TOWN IN WEST PART OF DELMAR.                            STATION RECOVERY (1976)  RECOVERY NOTE BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 1976 (CLN) THE STATION WAS RECOVERED AND FOUND IN GOOD CONDITION AS PREVIOUSLY DESCRIBED.  THE DISTANCE TO DELMAR 1934 WAS CHECKED AND FOUND TO BE WITHIN CLOSE AGREEMENT WITH THE PREVIOUS MEASUREMENT.  THE MARYLAND-DELAWARE BOUNDARY MONUMENT NUMBER 29 WAS SET AT THIS DATE, SEE DESCRIPTION THEREOF.  NO OTHER OBJECTS INTERSECTED FROM THIS POINT.  AIRLINE DISTANCE AND DIRECTION FROM NEAREST TOWN IN THE WEST EDGE OF DELMAR.

markers.description: BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 1974 (LAL) THE STATION IS LOCATED ABOUT 3 MILES NORTH OF OCEAN CITY.  0.8 MILE WEST OF FENWICK ISLAND, ON ROAD RIGHT-OF-WAY AND NEAR THE MARYLAND-DELAWARE STATE LINE.  TO REACH THE STATION FROM THE JUNCTION OF STATE ROADS 14 AND 54 IN FENWICK ISLAND, GO WEST ON STATE ROAD 54 FOR 0.75 MILE TO JEFFERSON AVENUE ON THE LEFT.  TURN LEFT AND GO SOUTH-SOUTHWEST ON JEFFERSON AVENUE FOR 0.1 MILE TO HAYES AVENUE ON THE RIGHT.  TURN RIGHT AND GO WEST ON HAYES AVENUE FOR 0.15 MILE TO POWERLINE POLE NUMBER 15 AND THE STATION ON THE RIGHT, AT THE END OF HAYES AVENUE.  TO REACH RM 3 (AZI. MK.) FROM THE JUNCTION OF STATE ROAD 54 AND JEFFERSON AVENUE, GO WEST ON STATE ROAD 54 FOR 0.3 MILE TO THE MARK ON THE LEFT.  STATION MARKS ARE STANDARD DISKS STAMPED DIVISION 1974.  THE STATION DISK IS SET IN THE TOP OF A 12-INCH CYLINDRICAL CONCRETE MONUMENT THAT IS FLUSH WITH THE GROUND SURFACE.  IT IS 43 FEET SOUTHWEST OF THE SOUTHEAST CORNER OF A HOUSE, 18 FEET NORTH OF THE CENTER OF HAYES AVENUE AND 3 FEET SOUTHEAST OF POWERLINE POLE NUMBER 15.  THE UNDERGROUND DISK IS SET IN THE TOP OF AN IRREGULAR MASS OF CONCRETE 42 INCHES BELOW THE GROUND SURFACE.  REFERENCE MARK 1, A STANDARD DISK STAMPED DIVISION NO 1 1974, IS SET IN THE TOP OF A 12-INCH CYLINDRICAL CONCRETE MONUMENT THAT IS FLUSH WITH THE GROUND SURFACE.  IT IS 22 FEET SOUTH OF THE CENTER OF HAYES AVENUE AND 4 FEET WEST OF A METAL WITNESS POST.  REFERENCE MARK 2, A STANDARD DISK STAMPED DIVISION NO 2 1974, IS SET IN THE TOP OF A 12-INCH CYLINDRICAL CONCRETE MONUMENT THAT IS FLUSH WITH THE GROUND SURFACE.  IT IS 57 FEET WEST OF THE SOUTHWEST CORNER OF THE HOUSE AND 2 FEET SOUTH-SOUTHWEST OF POWERLINE POLE NUMBER 16.  REFERENCE MARK 3, A STANDARD DISK STAMPED DIVISION NO 3 1974, IS SET IN THE TOP OF A 12-INCH CYLINDRICAL CONCRETE MONUMENT THAT IS FLUSH WITH THE GROUND SURFACE.  IT IS 34 FEET SOUTHWEST OF THE CENTERLINE OF STATE ROAD 54 AND 14 FEET NORTHEAST OF POWERLINE POLE NUMBER 69A1A-10.  THE MARK SERVES AS AN AZIMUTH MARK.                            STATION RECOVERY (1976)  RECOVERY NOTE BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 1976 (CLN) THE STATION AND ALL MARKS WERE RECOVERED AND FOUND IN GOOD CONDITION AS DESCRIBED.  THE DISTANCE AND DIRECTION TO ALL MARKS CHECKED THE 1974 OBSERVATIONS. PROCEED SOUTHEAST ON KITTS HUMMOCK ROAD FOR 0.8 MI (1.3 KM), TURN RIGHT INTO THE ST JONES RESERVE VIA A GRAVEL DRIVEWAY, TRAVEL SOUTH APPROXIMATELY 1 MI (1.6 KM) ON THE GRAVEL ROAD TO A PARKING AREA.  PARK AND TRAVEL ON FOOT APPROXIMATELY 110 YARDS (100.6 M) EASTERLY BEHIND THE MAIN BUILDING TO THE MONUMENT ON THE EAST SIDE OF A GRAVEL DRIVE.  IT IS 119.1 FT (36.3 M) SOUTHEAST OF THE SOUTHEAST CORNER OF MAIN BUILDING WITH RED ROOF, 102.1 FT (31.1 M) SOUTH-SOUTHEAST OF THE SOUTHWEST CORNER OF A POLE BUILDING, 90.6 FT (27.6 M) NORTHEAST OF Y-FORK IN THE GRAVEL DRIVE, 21.4 FT (6.5 M) EAST OF GRAVEL DRIVE, 1 FT (0.3 M) WEST OF A FIBERGLASS WITNESS POST AND SET IN THE TOP OF A 12-IN (30 CM) ROUND CONCRETE POST AND ABOUT LEVEL WITH THE ROAD.  OWNERSHIP--STATE OF DELAWARE.                            STATION RECOVERY (2021)  RECOVERY NOTE BY US POWER SQUADRON 2021 (DLT) RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION.

markers.description: BY DELAWARE COASTAL PROGRAM 2013 (ARD) THE STATION IS LOCATED ABOUT 6.1 MI (9.8 KM) SOUTHEAST OF MIDDLETOWN, 4.7 MI (7.6 KM) SOUTH OF ODESSA AND 3.2 MI (5.1 KM) EAST OF TOWNSEND.  TO REACH FROM THE POST OFFICE IN TOWNSEND, PROCEED NORTHEAST ON MAIN STREET TOWARDS COMMERCE STREET FOR 0.6 MI (1.0 KM) CONTINUE ONTO PINE TREE ROAD AND PROCEED FOR 1.3 MI (2.1 KM) TO BLACKBIRD LANDING ROAD. PROCEED FOR 1.8 MI (2.9 KM) AND TURN INTO A DIRT PARKING LOT OF THE LEFT (OLD CAMPGROUND).  ON FOOT, PROCEED THROUGH THE GATE FURTHEST LEFT FOR 0.2 MI (0.3 KM) ALONG THE DIRT ROAD TO THE MARK ON THE RIGHT. IT IS 156 FT (47.5 M) WEST OF CROSS COUNTRY MARKER POST, 44.5 FT (13.6 M) NORTH OF AA MANHOLE COVER WITH TWO LARGE HANDLES SET IN CONCRETE, 2.8 FT (0.9 M) SOUTH OF EDGE OF AN OLD SPEED BUMP AND SET IN THE TOP OF A 8-IN (20 CM) ROUND CONCRETE POST AND ABOUT LEVEL WITH THE GROUND.

markers.description: BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 1998 (DBC) FROM THE INTERSECTION OF U.S. ROUTE 13 AND STATE ROUTE 8 (DIVISION STREET) IN DOVER, GO WEST 0.5 MILE (0.80 KM) ALONG STATE ROUTE 8 TO THE INTERSECTION OF KINGS HIGHWAY SW., TURN LEFT ON KINGS HIGHWAY SW AND GO 0.15 MILE (0.2 KM) TO THE MARK ON THE LEFT, AT THE SITE OF THE RICHARDSON AND ROBBINS BUILDING WHICH IS OCCUPIED BY THE DELAWARE DEPARTMENT OF NATURAL RESOURCES AND ENVIRONMENTAL CONTROL (DNREC), 87.3 FEET (26.6 M) SOUTHWEST OF THE CORNER OF THE BRICK DNREC BUILDING , 57.0 FEET (17.4 M) SOUTHEAST OF THE PHYSICAL CENTERLINE OF THE INTERSECTION OF KINGS HIGHWAY SW AND EAST REED STREET, AND 0.5 FOOT (0.15 M) EAST AND SOUTH OF A T CONCRETE SIDEWALK INTERSECTION. THE STATION IS THE CENTER OF A 5 CM (2 IN) SURVEY DISK SET INTO THE TOP OF A 1 M (3.3 FT) LONG FENO PIPE, RECESSED 2 CM BELOW GROUND LEVEL AND ENCASED IN A 5 INCH DIAMETER PVC PIPE WITH A SCREW CAP SURROUNDED BY CONCRETE. THE SCREW CAP AND CONCRETE ARE FLUSH WITH THE GROUND.  THREE CIRCULAR ANCHOR PRONGS EXTEND FROM BOTTOM OF PIPE.                            STATION RECOVERY (2000)  RECOVERY NOTE BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 2000 (MLM) THE STATION IS LOCATED ABOUT IN THE CITY CENTER OF DOVER NEAR THE JUNCTION OF KINGS HIGHWAY SW AND EAST REED STREET, NEAR THE SOUTHWEST CORNER OF THE FRONT LAWN OF THE RICHARDSON AND ROBBINS BUILDING OCCUPIED BY THE DEPARTMENT OF RESOURCES AND ENVIRONMENTAL CONTROL, AT THE T-JUNCTION OF THE SIDEWALKS OF KINGS HIGHWAY SW AND SOUTHERN MOST ENTRANCE WALK OF THE RICHARDSON AND ROBBINS BUILDING. OWNERSHIP--DEPARTMENT OF NATURAL RESOURCES.  TO REACH THE STATION FROM THE JUNCTION OF US HIGHWAY 13 AND STATE HIGHWAY 8 (DIVISON STREET) LOCATED ABOUT IN THE CENTER OF DOVER, GO WEST ON HIGHWAY 8 (DIVISON STREET) FOR 0.08 KM (0.05 MI) TO THE JUNCTION OF KINGS HIGHWAY SW ON THE LEFT, TURN LEFT, SOUTH ON KINGS HIGHWAY SW FOR 0.32 KM (0.20 MI) TO THE JUNCTION OF EAST REED STREET ON THE RIGHT, CONTINUE AHEAD ON KINGS HIGHWAY FOR ABOUT 15.24 M (50.00 FT) TO A PAVED ENTRANCE DRIVE ON THE LEFT ON THE NORTH SIDE OF THE MERRILL LYNCH BUILDING AND THE STATION AT A T-JUNCTION OF THE SIDEWALKS NEAR THE SOUTHWEST CORNER OF THE FRONT LAWN PROPERTY OF THE RICHARDSON AND ROBBINS BUILDING.  THE STATION IS A DELAWARE DEPARTMENT OF TRANSPORTATION ROAD DESIGNATION DISK, A 5 CM DISK ON THE TOP OF A FENO PIPE ENCASED IN A 13 CM PVC PIPE WITH A SCREW CAP, SOUROUNDED BY A 1 X 1-FT SQUARE OF CONCRETE LOCATED AT THE SOUTHEAST ANGLE OF THE T-JUNCTION OF THE SIDEWALKS. LOCATED 36.43 M (119.52 FT) SOUTH OF THE SOUTH EDGE OF THE SIDEWALK LEADING INTO THE MAIN ENTRANCE OF THE RICHARDSON AND ROBBINS BUILDING, 5.79 M (19.00 FT) NORTH OF THE NORTH CURB OF THE ENTRANCE DRIVE LEADING EAST TO THE REAR PARKING LOT OF THE MERRILL LYNCH BUILDING, 4.15 M (13.62 FT) SOUTHEAST OF LAMP POST NUMBER S-13, 2.7 M (8.9 FT) EAST OF THE EAST EDGE OF THE EAST CURB OF KINGS HIGHWAY, 0.23 M (0.75 FT) SOUTH OF THE SOUTH EDGE OF THE RICHARDSON AND ROBBINS SIDEWALK AND 0.25 M (0.82 FT) EAST OF THE EAST EDGE OF THE SIDEWALK OF KINGS HIGHWAY. STATION RECOVERY (2007)  RECOVERY NOTE BY URBAN ENGINEERS INC 2007 (WBF) RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION. markers.description: BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1943 (FLG) THE STATION IS A FLAGPOLE IN THE CENTER OF A SMALL SUMMER HOUSE WHICH STANDS ON A SHORT DOCK ABOUT 10 METERS OFFSHORE FROM A SMALL POINT OF LAND, ON THE N SHORE OF INDIAN RIVER.

BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1933 (GLA) THIS STATION IS AT FORT SAULSBURY, ON THE W SHORE OF THE DELAWARE BAY, ABOUT 6 MILES E OF MILFORD, 11 MILES N OF MILTON, AND 1/2 MILE S OF THE MOUTH OF THE MISPILLION RIVER.  SURFACE, UNDERGROUND, AND REFERENCE MARKS ARE STANDARD BRONZE DISKS SET IN CONCRETE AS DESCRIBED.  REFERENCE MARK NO. 1 IS SW OF THE STATION, IN A GROVE OF SMALL WILLOW TREES, 96 FEET SSW OF A WELL.  REFERENCE MARK NO. 2 IS NW OF THE STATION, 1 FOOT SW OF THE SW CORNER OF AN OLD HOUSE, AND 77 FEET N OF A WELL.  TO REACH FROM MILFORD GO E ABOUT 1 MILE FROM THE MAIN PART OF TOWN TO CROSSROADS, CONTINUE STRAIGHT AHEAD 6.05 MILES TO A DRAWBRIDGE OVER A SMALL CREEK.  CROSS BRIDGE, TAKE LEFT FORK AND PROCEED 0.3 MILE TO POINT WHERE ROAD TURNS RIGHT.  CONTINUE STRAIGHT AHEAD ABOUT 100 YARDS TO THE STATION.  THE STATION IS ON A FLAT SANDY AREA ABOUT 100 FEET W OF THE TOP OF THE SLOPE OF THE BEACH, 77 FEET S OF THE SW CORNER OF AN OLD HOUSE, AND 65 FEET E OF A WELL.  THE MARK PROJECTS ABOUT 6 INCHES ABOVE THE GROUND.  A 90-FOOT TOWER WILL CLEAR ALL LINES.                            STATION RECOVERY (1910)  RECOVERY NOTE BY US GEOLOGICAL SURVEY 1910 MARK NOT FOUND.                            STATION RECOVERY (1943)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1943 (FLG) RECOVERED AS DESCRIBED WITH THE FOLLOWING DISCREPANCY-- THE OLD HOUSE HAS BEEN TORN DOWN AND THERE ARE FOUR FISHERMENS HOUSES W OF THE STATION ALONG THE ROAD. REFERENCE MARK 1 IS 125.41 FEET (38.225 METERS) SW OF THE STATION. REFERENCE MARK 2 IS 99.79 FEET (30.416 METERS) NW OF THE STATION. REFERENCE MARK 1 TO REFERENCE MARK 2 IS 172.16 FEET (52.474 METERS).                            STATION RECOVERY (1946)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1946 (ELJ) STATION MARKS AND REFERENCE MARKS 1 AND 2 WERE RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION.  DISTANCES TO REFERENCE MARKS WERE MEASURED AND FOUND TO BE CORRECT.  THE 1933 DESCRIPTION IS ADEQUATE EXCEPT FOR THE FOLLOWING CHANGES--  1.  DELETE 1 FOOT SW OF THE SW CORNER OF AN OLD HOUSE AS THE OLD HOUSE IS NOW GONE.  2.  ADD MARK IS ON EXTENSION OF ROAD AND COVERED BY 3 INCHES OF SAND.  3.  DELETE 77 FEET S OF THE SW CORNER OF AN OLD HOUSE AS THE OLD HOUSE IS NOW GONE.  4.  ADD 221.7 FEET SE OF T ROAD JUNCTION, 200 FEET E OF ROAD TO S.                            STATION RECOVERY (1962)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1962 (JKW) THE STATION MARK WAS RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION, RM 1 WAS NOT FOUND.  IT IS BELIEVED TO BE DESTROYED.  THERE HAS BEEN CONSIDERABLE LEVELING AND BULLDOZING IN THE AREA.  RM 2 WAS FOUND DESTROYED.  THE DISK WAS REMOVED BY THIS PARTY.  TWO NEW REFERENCE MARKS WERE ESTABLISHED DURING THIS RECOVERY.  THE PREVIOUS DESCRIPTIONS ARE INADEQUATE, A NEW DESCRIPTION AS FOLLOWS.  THE STATION IS LOCATED ON THE WESTERN SHORE OF DELAWARE BAY, ABOUT 11 MILES NORTH OF THE TOWN OF MILTON, ABOUT 6 MILES EAST OF THE TOWN OF MILFORD AND ABOUT 0.5 MILE SOUTH OF THE MOUTH OF THE MISPILLION RIVER.  IT IS 218.0 FEET SOUTHEAST OF THE CENTERLINE OF A GRAVEL ROAD INTERSECTION, 166.0 FEET WEST OF THE BANK OF DELAWARE BAY, 73.0 FEET SOUTH OF THE CENTERLINE OF A SAND TRAIL, 66.0 FEET SOUTH OF A LARGE WILLOW TREE AND 2.5 FEET WEST OF AN IRON WITNESS POST.  THE STATION IS A STANDARD DISK, STAMPED DOCTOR 1933 SET IN THE TOP OF A 12 INCH ROUND CONCRETE MONUMENT, WHICH IS FLUSH WITH THE GROUND.  RM 3 IS NORTHEAST OF THE STATION, 110.0 FEET WEST OF THE BANK OF DELAWARE BAY AND 4.0 FEET NORTHWEST OF A WHITE-BARKED 12 INCH TREE.  IT IS MARKED BY A STANDARD DISK, STAMPED DOCTOR NO 3 1933, SET IN THE TOP OF A 10 INCH ROUND MONUMENT WHICH PROJECTS 3 INCHES ABOVE THE GROUND.  RM 4 IS NORTHWEST OF THE STATION, 136.0 FEET SOUTHEAST OF CENTERLINE OF ROAD INTERSECTION, 20.0 FEET SOUTH OF CENTERLINE OF A SAND TRAIL, AND 7.0 FEET EAST OF THREE WILLOW TREES.  IT IS MARKED BY A STANDARD DISK STAMPED DOCTOR NO 4 1933, SET IN THE TOP OF A 10 INCH ROUND CONCRETE MONUMENT WHICH PROJECTS THREE INCHES ABOVE THE GROUND.  TO REACH THE STATION FROM THE INTERSECTION OF STATE HIGHWAYS 14 AND 36 IN MILFORD, GO EAST ON STATE HIGHWAY 36 FOR 5.7 MILES TO A DRAWBRIDGE, THEN CROSS CANAL AND TAKE FIRST UNPAVED ROAD TO LEFT, THEN GO 0.3 MILE ALONG UNPAVED ROAD TO FLAT SANDY RIDGE AND STATION SITE.                            STATION RECOVERY (1962)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1962 (RWT) THE STATION AND REFERENCE MARKS 1,3,4 WERE RECOVERED AS DESCRIBED, BUT REFERENCE MARK 1, WAS LAYING ON ITS SIDE.  A REFERENCE MARKS 5 AND 6 WERE SET AT THE STATION.  A NEW TO REACH FOLLOWS.  TO REACH THE STATION FROM THE JUNCTIONS OF U.S. HIGHWAY 113 AND STATE ROUTE 36 IN MILFORD, DELAWARE, GO EAST ON STATE ROUTE 36 FOR 1.8 MILES TO A Y-FORK, KEEP RIGHT ON STATE ROUTE 36 FOR 1.2 MILES TO A CROSSROAD, CONTINUE STRAIGHT AHEAD ON ROUTE 36 FOR 0.45 MILE TO THE CEDAR NECK SCHOOL ON THE RIGHT, CONTINUE STRAIGHT AHEAD ON ROUTE 36 FOR 2.5 MILES TO BRIDGE CROSSING THE CANAL.  CROSS BRIDGE AND JUST AFTER CROSSING THERE IS A Y-FORK, KEEP TO THE LEFT ON DIRT ROAD FOR 0.2 MILE TO A Y-FORK, KEEP TO THE RIGHT FOR 0.05 MILE TO A CROSSROAD, CONTINUE STRAIGHT AHEAD FOR 0.05 MILE TO THE STATION AS DESCRIBED.  THE STATION, IS A STANDARD DISK SET IN THE TOP OF A 10 X 10 INCH CONCRETE MONUMENT WHICH IS FLUSH WITH THE SURFACE OF THE GROUND, STAMPED DOCTOR 1933.  IT IS 219.0 FEET EAST-SOUTHEAST OF A ROAD INTERSECTION, 200.3 FEET EAST OF THE APPROXIMATE CENTER OF A DIRT ROAD, 65.7 FEET SOUTH OF A 4-TRUNK TREE AND 3.5 FEET WEST OF A STANDARD METAL WITNESS POST AND MARKER.  REFERENCE MARK 3 IS A STANDARD DISK SET IN THE TOP OF A 10-INCH ROUND SOIL PIPE WHICH PROJECTS ABOUT 2 INCHES ABOVE THE SURFACE OF THE GROUND, STAMPED DOCTOR NO 3 1933.  IT IS 110.0 FEET WEST OF THE BANK OF DELAWARE BAY, 107.0 FEET NORTHEAST OF A STANDARD METAL WITNESS POST AND MARKER AND 4.0 FEET NORTHWEST OF A WHITE BARK TREE.  REFERENCE MARK 4 IS A STANDARD DISK SET IN THE TOP OF A 10-INCH SOIL PIPE WHICH PROJECTS ABOUT 3 INCHES ABOVE THE SURFACE OF THE GROUND, STAMPED DOCTOR NO 4 1933.  IT IS 136.0 FEET SOUTHEAST OF THE APPROXIMATE CENTER OF ROAD INTERSECTION, 41.3 FEET WEST OF A STANDARD METAL WITNESS POST AND MARKER, 20.0 FEET SOUTH OF THE APPROXIMATE CENTER OF A SAND TRAIL AND 7.0 FEET EAST OF A GROUP OF 3-WILLOW TREES.  REFERENCE MARK 5 IS A STANDARD DISK SET IN THE TOP OF A 10 X 10 INCH CONCRETE MONUMENT WHICH PROJECTS ABOUT 4 INCHES ABOVE THE SURFACE OF THE GROUND, STAMPED DOCTOR NO 5 1933.  IT IS 173.0 FEET EAST OF THE APPROXIMATE CENTER OF ROAD INTERSECTION, 15.0 FEET WEST OF A 4-TRUNK WILLOW TREE, 10.0 FEET SOUTH OF A DIM BEACH ROAD AND 2.6 FEET SOUTHEAST OF A STANDARD METAL WITNESS POST AND MARKER.  REFERENCE MARK 6 IS A STANDARD DISK SET IN THE TOP OF A 10 X 10 INCH CONCRETE MONUMENT WHICH PROJECTS ABOUT 3 INCHES ABOVE THE SURFACE OF THE GROUND, STAMPED DOCTOR NO 6 1933.  IT IS 142.0 FEET EAST OF THE APPROXIMATE CENTER OF A DIRT ROAD, 116.0 FEET SOUTH OF A DIM BEACH ROAD AND 101.0 FEET SOUTH-SOUTHWEST OF A 4-TRUNK WILLOW TREE.  HEIGHT OF LIGHT ABOVE STATION MARK 1 METER.                            STATION RECOVERY (1962)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1962 1.7 MI NW FROM SLAUGHTER BEACH. 1.7 MILES NORTHWEST ALONG BLACKTOPPED ROAD FROM THE FIRE HOUSE AT SLAUGHTER BEACH, 221 FEET SOUTHEAST OF A T ROAD JUNCTION, 200 FEET EAST OF A NORTH AND SOUTH SAND ROAD AND 3 FEET WEST OF A METAL WITNESS SIGN.  SET IN A CONCRETE POST ABOUT 3 INCHES BELOW THE SURFACE.NOTE-THE MARK IS ON AN OPEN SAND BEACH AND THE DEPTH MAY VARY WITH EACH HIGH TIDE.                            STATION RECOVERY (1969)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1969 (JKW) STATION MARK, R.M.S 3, 4, AND 6 WERE RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION.  R.M. 5 IS BELIEVED TO BE INTACT BUT COVERED BY ROCKS IN A ROCK GARDEN.  THE RECOVERY NOTES BY J.K.W. AND R.W.T. IN 1962 ARE ADEQUATE WITH THE FOLLOWING ADDITIONAL INFORMATION--THE STATION MARK IS 2-1/2 TENTHS BEYOND THE Y FORK, 175.0 FEET WEST OF MEAN HIGH-WATER LINE, 46.3 FEET NORTHWEST OF NORTHWEST CORNER OF A PINK TWO-STORY HOUSE AND IS ONE FOOT BELOW THE SURFACE OF THE GROUND.  R.M. 3 IS 124.0 FEET WEST OF THE MEAN HIGH-WATER LINE, 68.5 FEET EAST OF SOUTHEAST CORNER OF TIN BUILDING, 24.0 FEET NORTH OF THE CENTERLINE OF DIRT DRIVE AND IS FLUSH WITH THE GROUND. R.M. 4 IS 55.5 FEET SOUTH OF SOUTHWEST CORNER OF TIN BUILDING, 28.0 FEET SOUTH OF THE CENTERLINE OF DIRT DRIVE AND PROJECTS 0.2 FOOT ABOVE THE GROUND.  R.M. 6 IS 89.0 FEET SOUTH OF A LARGE THREE-PRONGED WILLOW TREE, 82.0 FEET WEST OF NORTHWEST CORNER OF PINK HOUSE AND PROJECTS 0.3 FOOT ABOVE THE GROUND.                            STATION RECOVERY (1976)  RECOVERY NOTE BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 1976 (JDS) STATION MARK, R.M. 3, R.M. 4, AND R.M. 6 WERE RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION.  THE RECOVERY NOTE BY J.K.W. IN 1969 IS ADEQUATE.  AIRLINE DISTANCE AND DIRECTION FROM NEAREST TOWN AT SLAUGHTER BEACH.                            STATION RECOVERY (1979)  RECOVERY NOTE BY UNIVERSITY OF DELAWARE 1979 RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION.                            STATION RECOVERY (1980)  RECOVERY NOTE BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 1980 (RGP) RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION AS DESCRIBED.                            STATION RECOVERY (1980)  RECOVERY NOTE BY LOCAL ENGINEER (INDIVIDUAL OR FIRM) 1980 (WW) RECOVERED BY VANDEMARK LYNCH INC. DOCTOR 1933 GOOD. DOCTOR NO 3-1933 GOOD. DOCTOR NO 4-1933 GOOD. DOCTOR NO 6-1933 GOOD. STATION AND REFERENCE MARKS ADEQUATELY DESCRIBED.                            STATION RECOVERY (1983)  RECOVERY NOTE BY NATIONAL OCEAN SERVICE 1983 THE STATION IS LOCATED ON THE WESTERN SHORE OF DELAWARE BAY, ABOUT 11 MI N OF THE TOWN OF MILTON, ABOUT 6 MI E OF THE TOWN OF MILFORD AND ABOUT 0.5 MI S OF THE MOUTH OF THE MISPILLION RIVER. TO REACH STATION FROM THE JUNCTIONS OF U.S. HWY 113 AND STATE ROUTE 36 IN MILFORD, GO E ON STATE ROUTE 36 FOR 1.8 MI TO A Y-FORK, KEEP RIGHT ON STATE ROUTE 36 FOR 1.2 MI TO A CROSSROAD, CONTINUE STRAIGHT AHEAD ON ROUTE 36 FOR 0.45 MI TO THE CEDAR NECK SCHOOL ON THE RIGHT, CONTINUE STRAIGHT AHEAD ON ROUTE 36 FOR 2.5 MI TO BRIDGE CROSSING THE CANAL.  CROSS BRIDGE AND JUST AFTER CROSSING THERE IS A Y-FORK, KEEP TO THE LEFT ON DIRT ROAD FOR 0.2 MI TO A Y-FORK, KEEP TO THE RIGHT FOR 0.05 MI TO A CROSSROAD, CONTINUE STRAIGHT AHEAD FOR 0.05 MI TO THE STATION. STATION MARK IS A STANDARD CGS BRONZE DISK 0.5 M (1.6 FT) BELOW THE GROUND.  IT IS LOCATED 66.752 M (219.0 FT) ESE OF A ROAD INTERSECTION AND 61.052 M (200.3 FT) E OF THE APPROXIMATE CENTER OF DIRT ROAD. RM 3 IS A STANDARD DISK STAMPED---DOCTOR NO 3 1933---, SET IN THE TOP OF A 10-INCH ROUND SOIL PIPE WHICH PROJECTS ABOUT 2-INCHES ABOVE THE SURFACE OF THE GROUND.  IT IS LOCATED 33.528 M (110.0 FT) W OF THE BANK OF THE DELAWARE BAY, 32.614 M (107.0 FT) NE OF A WITNESS POST AND 33.221 M (109.0 FT) NE OF THE STATION. SEE COMPLETE STATION DESCRIPTIONS FOR RMS 4, 5 AND 6 INFORMATION.
