markers.description: BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1958 (JCE) STATION IS LOCATED ABOUT 1.25 MILES SOUTHWEST OF THE POST OFFICE IN WILMINGTON, ABOUT 0.25 MILE NORTHWEST OF CHRISTIANA RIVER AND ABOUT 150 YARDS SOUTHWEST OF A LARGE BLACK GAS TANK.  STATION IS 10-1/2 FEET SOUTH OF CHAIN LINK FENCE, 35-1/2 FEET NORTH OF THE NORTH RAIL OF RAILROAD AND 72 FEET EAST OF FENCE CORNER.  THE MARK IS A STANDARD STATION DISK SET IN A 12X12 INCH CONCRETE MONUMENT WHICH PROJECTS 2 INCHES AND THE DISK IS STAMPED DRAVO 1958.  REFERENCE MARK NO. 1 IS 1 FOOT SOUTH OF A CHAIN LINK FENCE AND 55 FEET NORTH OF NORTH RAIL OF RAILROAD.  THE MARK IS A STANDARD REFERENCE DISK SET IN A 12X12 INCH CONCRETE MONUMENT WHICH IS FLUSH WITH THE GROUND AND THE DISK IS STAMPED DRAVO NO 1 1958.  REFERENCE MARK NO. 2 IS 3 FEET EAST OF FENCE CORNER, 1 FOOT SOUTH OF FENCE AND 27-1/2 FEET EAST OF APPROXIMATE CENTERLINE OF ROAD.  THE MARK IS A STANDARD REFERENCE DISK SET IN A 12X12 INCH CONCRETE MONUMENT WHICH PROJECTS 2 INCHES AND THE DISK IS STAMPED DRAVO NO 2 1958.  DRAVO A IS 10 FEET NORTH OF NORTH RAIL OF RAILROAD, 21 FEET EAST OF EAST RAIL OF RAILROAD, 23 FEET NORTHEAST OF RAILROAD INTERSECTION AND 46 FEET WEST-SOUTHWEST OF UTILITY POLE NO. 43.  THE MARK IS A STANDARD TRAVERSE DISK SET IN A 12X12 INCH CONCRETE MONUMENT WHICH PROJECTS 3 INCHES AND THE DISK IS STAMPED DRAVO A 1958.  A TRAVERSE CONNECTION WAS MADE TO DRAVO A AND THE DISTANCE IS SHOWN ABOVE.  TO REACH FROM THE POST OFFICE IN WILMINGTON, GO SOUTHWESTERLY ON MARKET STREET FOR 0.65 MILE TO WEST FRONT STREET.  TURN RIGHT AND GO NORTHWESTERLY ON FRONT STREET FOR 0.35 MILE TO FIVE WAY INTERSECTION.  BEAR LEFT AND GO WESTERLY ON MARYLAND AVENUE FOR 0.4 MILE TO SIGNAL LIGHT AT INTERSECTION OF BEECH STREET.  TURN LEFT AND GO SOUTH-SOUTHEAST ON BEECH STREET FOR 0.15 MILE TO RAILROAD UNDERPASS.  CONTINUE SOUTHEASTERLY ON BEECH STREET FOR 0.05 MILE TO SIDE ROAD RIGHT AT LARGE BLACK GAS TANK.  TURN RIGHT AND GO SOUTH-SOUTHWEST FOR 0.1 MILE TO SIDE ROAD LEFT AT CORNER OF CHAIN LINK FENCE AND STATION AS DESCRIBED.  HEIGHT OF LIGHT ABOVE STATION MARK 27 METERS.                            STATION RECOVERY (1961)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1961 (WER) STATION AND REFERENCE MARKS RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION AS DESCRIBED.  BECAUSE WEST FRONT STREET IS NOW A ONE WAY STREET EASTERLY, THE DIRECTION TO STATION SHOULD READ AS FOLLOWS--  TO REACH FROM THE POST OFFICE IN WILMINGTON, GO SOUTHWESTERLY ON MARKET STREET FOR 0.6 MILE TO 2ND STREET.  TURN RIGHT AND GO NORTHWESTERLY ON 2ND STREET FOR 0.35 MILE TO S. MADISON STREET.  TURN LEFT AND GO SOUTHWESTERLY ON S. MADISON STREET FOR 0.5 MILE TO FIVE WAY INTERSECTION.  CROSS INTERSECTION AND GO WESTERLY ON MARYLAND AVENUE FOR 0.4 MILE TO SIGNAL LIGHT AT INTERSECTION OF BEECH STREET.  TURN LEFT AND GO SOUTH-SOUTHEAST ON BEECH STREET FOR 0.15 MILE TO RAILROAD UNDERPASS.  CONTINUE SOUTHEASTERLY ON BEECH STREET FOR 0.05 MILE TO SIDE ROAD AT LARGE BLACK GAS TANK.  TURN RIGHT AND GO SOUTH-SOUTHWEST FOR 0.1 MILE TO SIDE ROAD LEFT AT CORNER OF CHAIN LINK FENCE AND STATION AS DESCRIBED.                            STATION RECOVERY (1963)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1963 AT WILMINGTON. AT WILMINGTON, ABOUT 0.9 MILE SOUTHWEST ALONG CITY LINE OF PENNSYLVANIA RAILROAD FROM THE STATION AT WILMINGTON, ABOUT 0.15 MILE SOUTH OF RAILROAD OVERPASS OF BEECH STREET, 0.1 MILE SOUTHWEST OF A LARGE GAS TANK, 0.2 MILE NORTHWEST OF 3-STORY VETERANS ADMINISTRATION BUILDING, 10 FEET SOUTHWEST OF STEEL FENCE AROUND GAS TANK, 96 FEET EAST-SOUTHEAST OF CENTER LINE OF DRAVO ROAD, 71 1/2 FEET EAST-SOUTHEAST OF STEEL FENCE CORNER, 68.8 FEET EAST-SOUTHEAST OF RM NO 2 DESCRIBED, 71.2 FEET WEST OF RM NO 1 DESCRIBED, 1.5 FEET NORTHWEST OF A STEEL WITNESS POST, AND SET IN THE TOP OF A CONCRETE POST PROJECTING 1 INCH.  CHANGED ELEVATION.                            STATION RECOVERY (1964)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1964 (RRG) THE STATION AND THE TWO REFERENCE MARKS WERE RECOVERED AND IN GOOD CONDITION.  THE DESCRIPTION TO REACH IS ADEQUATE.                            STATION RECOVERY (1979)  RECOVERY NOTE BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 1979 MARK NOT FOUND.

markers.description: BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1961 (RWT) THE STATION IS LOCATED ABOUT 5.0 MILES SOUTHEAST OF MILLINGTON, MARYLAND AND 5.0 MILES WEST OF KENTON, DELAWARE.  IN DENSE WOODS AND ON PROPERTY OWNED BY MR. R. DUNNING.  TO REACH THE STATION FROM THE CROSSROADS IN SUDLERSVILLE.  GO EASTERLY ON STATE HIGHWAY 300 FOR 3.0 MILES TO A SIDE ROAD ON THE LEFT, NORTH, SIDE OF THE HIGHWAY.  TURN RIGHT AND GO NORTH AND NORTHEAST ON A GRAVELED ROAD FOR 0.9 MILES TO A CROSSROAD.  CONTINUE NORTHEAST ON A BLACKTOP ROAD FOR 2.7 MILES TO A FARM ROAD ON THE RIGHT HAND SIDE OF THE ROAD.  TURN RIGHT AND GO EAST ON THE GRAVELED FARM ROAD FOR 0.15 MILE TO A BOARD GATE AT THE NORTHEAST CORNER OF FARM HOUSE.  PASS THROUGH THE BOARD GATE, TURN RIGHT AND GO SOUTH THROUGH THE BARN LOT, PASSING TO THE WEST SIDE OF BARN AND IMPLEMENT SHED, TO A GATE AT THE SOUTHWEST CORNER OF BARN LOT.  PASS THROUGH THE GATE AND GO EAST DOWN A FARM LANE FOR 0.15 MILE TO THE WEST EDGE OF PASTURE AT THE END OF THE LANE. TURN SOUTH ON A DIM TRACK ROAD ACROSS PASTURE LAND AND GO 0.35 MILE TO THE SOUTHEAST CORNER OF PASTURE AND EDGE OF TIMBER, A STANDARD METAL WITNESS POST AND THE STATION.  TO REACH THE AZIMUTH MARK FROM THE STATION.  GO NORTH-NORTHEAST ACROSS PASTURE LAND FOR 0.4 MILE TO THE SOUTHWEST CORNER OF TIMBER AND THE MARK.  THE STATION MARK, A STANDARD DISK STAMPED DUNNING 1961, IS SET IN TOP OF A 10-INCH SQUARE CONCRETE MONUMENT PROJECTING ABOUT 1 INCH ABOVE THE SURFACE OF THE GROUND.  IT IS 19.9 FEET NORTHWEST OF A NORTHEAST AND SOUTHWEST FENCELINE, 12.2 FEET NORTH-NORTHWEST OF A STANDARD METAL WITNESS POST AND MARKER AND 12.0 FEET EAST-NORTHEAST OF THE SOUTHWEST CORNER OF PASTURE LAND AND EDGE OF TIMBER.  REFERENCE MARK 1, A STANDARD DISK STAMPED DUNNING NO 1 1961, IS SET IN TOP OF A 10-INCH SQUARE CONCRETE MONUMENT PROJECTING ABOUT 3 INCHES ABOVE THE SURFACE OF THE GROUND.  IT IS 87.3 FEET EAST-NORTHEAST OF THE SOUTHWEST CORNER OF PASTURE FIELD, 78.6 FEET NORTHEAST OF A STANDARD METAL WITNESS POST AND MARKER, 8.0 FEET NORTHWEST OF A NORTHEAST AND SOUTHWEST FENCELINE AND IS ABOUT 16 INCHES HIGHER THAN THE STATION.  REFERENCE MARK 2, A STANDARD DISK STAMPED DUNNING NO 2 1961, IS SET IN TOP OF A 10-INCH SQUARE CONCRETE MONUMENT PROJECTING ABOUT 5 INCHES ABOVE THE SURFACE OF THE GROUND.  IT IS 87.0 FEET WEST-SOUTHWEST OF A STANDARD METAL WITNESS POST AND MARKER, 70.0 FEET NORTHWEST OF THE SOUTHWEST CORNER OF PASTURE, 30.0 FEET WEST-SOUTHWEST OF THE WEST EDGE OF PASTURE AND IS ABOUT 16 INCHES HIGHER THAN THE STATION.  THE AZIMUTH MARK, A STANDARD DISK STAMPED DUNNING 1961, IS SET IN TOP OF A 10-INCH SQUARE CONCRETE MONUMENT PROJECTING ABOUT 4 INCHES ABOVE THE SURFACE OF THE GROUND.  IT IS 9.6 FEET EAST-SOUTHEAST OF A SOUTHEAST FENCE CORNER, 5.7 FEET EAST-SOUTHEAST OF A STANDARD METAL WITNESS POST AND MARKER AND 3.6 FEET SOUTH-SOUTHEAST OF A FENCELINE.  BOUNDARY MONUMENT NO. 52, A 12-INCH SQUARE STONE PROJECTING ABOUT 32 INCHES ABOVE THE SURFACE OF THE GROUND WITH THE LETTER M INSCRIBED ON THE WEST SIDE AND P ON THE EAST SIDE.  THE MONUMENT WAS FOUND LYING PRONE POSITION.  IT WAS PLUMBED AND INTERSECTED WITH A SMALL CROSS ETCHED IN ITS TOP AND CENTER.  TRAVERSED WITH A NON-STANDARDIZED TAPE BECAUSE MONUMENT KNOCKED OVER.  HEIGHT OF LIGHT ABOVE STATION MARK 33 METERS.                            STATION RECOVERY (1977)  RECOVERY NOTE BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 1977 (RGP) NO OTHER OBJECTS V.G.  THE STATION AND ALL MARKS WERE RECOVERED AND FOUND IN GOOD CONDITION.  THE MARYLAND DELAWARE BOUNDARY MONUMENT NO. 52 WAS FOUND IN A PRONE POSITION AND WAS RESET USING THE 1961 DISTANCE AND DIRECTION.  A COMPLETE NEW DESCRIPTION FOLLOWS--  STATION IS LOCATED 12-1/2 MILES NORTHWEST OF DOVER, DELAWARE, 8-1/2 MILES SOUTHWEST OF SMYRNA, DELAWARE, 2-3/4 MILES NORTHEAST OF PETERS CORNERS MARYLAND, AND ON PROPERTY OWNED BY MRS. R. DUNNING, KENTON, DELAWARE.  TO REACH THE STATION FROM THE POST OFFICE IN KENTON, DELAWARE, GO WESTERLY ON STATE HIGHWAY 30 FOR 3.35 MILES TO A SIDE ROAD RIGHT. TURN RIGHT AND GO NORTHWEST ON COUNTY ROAD 95 FOR 0.55 MILE TO ROAD 140 ON THE RIGHT.  CONTINUE NORTHWEST ON COUNTY ROAD 95 FOR 1.6 MILES TO A T-INTERSECTION ON THE RIGHT.  (ROAD 95 TURNS RIGHT). CONTINUE AHEAD, NORTHWEST ON ROAD 96 FOR 0.5 MILE TO A ROAD FORK.  KEEP LEFT AND GO WEST ON ROAD 93 FOR 0.5 MILE TO A FARM ROAD LEFT.  TURN LEFT AND GO SOUTHEAST ON THE FARM ROAD FOR 0.15 MILE TO MR.  DUNNINGS FARM BUILDINGS.  PICK WAY THROUGH THE FARM BUILDINGS FOR ABOUT 0.15 MILE TO THE WEST SIDE OF BUILDINGS AND A FARM LANE.  GO EAST ON FARM LANE FOR 0.15 MILE TO A GAP IN A WOODED FENCE LINE.  BEAR RIGHT AND GO SOUTHERLY ACROSS A CULTIVATED FIELD FOR 0.35 MILE TO THE SOUTHWEST EDGE OF THE FIELD AND THE STATION.  THE STATION MARK IS A STANDARD DISK STAMPED DUNNING 1961, SET IN THE TOP OF A 10-INCH ROUND CONCRETE MONUMENT THAT IS FLUSH WITH THE SURFACE OF THE GROUND.  IT IS 20 FEET NORTHWEST OF A NORTHWEST-SOUTHEAST FENCE, 12 FEET NORTH-NORTHWEST OF METAL WITNESS POST, 12 FEET EAST-NORTHEAST OF THE EDGE OF THE CULTIVATED FIELD AND 1 FOOT SOUTH OF ANOTHER WITNESS POST IN EDGE OF FIELD.  REFERENCE MARK 1 IS A STANDARD DISK STAMPED DUNNING NO. 1 1961, SET IN THE TOP OF A 10-INCH SQUARE CONCRETE MONUMENT WHICH PROJECTS 1 INCH.  IT IS 87 FEET NORTHEAST OF THE SOUTHEAST CORNER OF THE FIELD, 78.5 FEET EAST OF THE WITNESS POST IN THE WOODED AREA, 8 FEET NORTHWEST OF THE FENCE LINE, 76 FEET NORTHEAST OF ANOTHER WITNESS POST SET NEAR THE FIELD.  REFERENCE MARK 2 IS A STANDARD DISK STAMPED DUNNING NO. 2 1961, SET IN THE TOP OF A 10-INCH SQUARE CONCRETE MONUMENT WHICH PROJECTS 1-INCH.  IT IS 87 FEET NORTHWEST OF THE WITNESS POST IN THE WOODED AREA, 76 FEET NORTHWEST OF THE OTHER WITNESS POST, NEAREST THE FIELD, 70 FEET NORTHWEST OF THE SOUTHEAST CORNER OF THE FIELD, 30 FEET WEST OF THE EDGE OF THE FIELD.  THE AZIMUTH MARK IS A STANDARD DISK STAMPED DUNNING 1961, SET IN THE TOP OF A 10-INCH SQUARE CONCRETE MONUMENT WHICH PROJECTS 3-INCHES. IT IS 3.5 FEET SOUTHEAST OF AN OLD FENCE, 5.7 FEET EAST-SOUTHEAST OF A WITNESS POST, 9.5 FEET EAST-SOUTHEAST OF A FENCE.  TO REACH THE AZIMUTH MARK FROM THE STATION GO NORTH-NORTHEAST ACROSS PASTURE LAND FOR 0.4 MILE TO SOUTHWEST CORNER OF TIMBER AND THE MARK AS DESCRIBED.                            STATION RECOVERY (2008)  RECOVERY NOTE BY GEOCACHING 2008 (WD) FOUND THE STATION IN GOOD CONDITION, AND BURIED UNDER ONE FOOT OF AGRICULTURAL WASTE.  THERE ARE NO FENCES IN THE VICINITY, AND THERE IS NO WITNESS POST ONE FOOT NORTH OF THE STATION.  FOUND REFERENCE MARK NO. 1.  THE MONUMENT HAS BEEN DISTURBED AND TILTS 45 DEGREES TO THE NORTH.  COULD NOT FIND REFERENCE MARK NO. 2.  DID NOT SEARCH FOR THE AZIMUTH MARK.  TO REACH FROM THE INTERSECTION OF MD STATE HIGHWAYS 300 AND 313 IN SUDLERSVILLE, MD, GO EASTERLY ON MD STATE HIGHWAY 300 FOR ABOUT 3.0 MILES TO THE INTERSECTION WITH STILLTOWN ROAD.  TURN LEFT AND GO NORTHEASTERLY ON STILLTOWN ROAD FOR ABOUT 3.5 MILES TO THE FARMSTEAD AT MAILBOX NUMBER 1921 ON THE RIGHT.  (THE FARMSTEAD IS LOCATED ABOUT 0.4 MILES SOUTHWEST OF THE STATE BOUNDARY LINE, AND IS ACROSS STILLTOWN ROAD FROM JACKSON DIAMOND FARM LANE LEADING NORTHWEST.)  FROM THE, GO SOUTHEAST ON A FARM LANE FOR ABOUT 300 YARDS TO A PROMINENT, DOUBLE-TRUNK TREE IN A TREE LINE THAT RUNS SOUTHWEST   NORTHEAST.  UPON REACHING THE TREE LINE, PACK DUE SOUTH ACROSS (OR AROUND) ANOTHER LARGE FIELD FOR ABOUT 0.25 MILES TO THE SOUTH-MOST POINT IN THE FIELD AND THE STATION.

markers.description: BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1933 (GLA) THIS STATION IS AT FORT DUPONT, DELAWARE CITY, DELAWARE.  IT IS ON THE HIGH EMBANKMENT SURROUNDING THE MORTAR BATTERIES, BEST AND RODNEY OVERLOOKING THE DELAWARE RIVER.  IT IS 28.7 FEET W OF THE SW CORNER OF THE CONCRETE OBSERVATION ROOM BETWEEN THE TWO BATTERIES, 68.3 FEET E OF A BRICK SENTRY POST AT THE HEAD OF THE STAIRWAY LEADING FROM THE POST TO THE SUMMIT OF THE EMBANKMENT AND 34.04 FEET W OF A UNITED STATES ARMY ENGINEERS STATION WHICH IS A COPPER BOLT SUNK IN A CONCRETE BLOCK.  THE UNITED STATES ARMY ENGINEERS STATION IS 9 FEET N OF THE OBSERVATION ROOM.  STATION, AND UNDERGROUND MARKS ARE STANDARD BRONZE DISKS SET IN CONCRETE AS DESCRIBED IN NOTES 1B, AND 7A.  REFERENCE MARK NO.2 IS N OF THE STATION, ON THE S WALL SURROUNDING THE A SECTION OF THE BEST BATTERY.  IT IS A STANDARD DISK CEMENTED IN DRILL HOLE IN THE CONCRETE WALL.  REFERENCE MARK NO.1 IS SE OF THE STATION ON THE N WALL SURROUNDING THE B SECTION OF THE RODNEY BATTERY AND IS A STANDARD DISK CEMENTED IN DRILL HOLE IN THE CONCRETE WALL.  A 37-FOOT TOWER WAS ERECTED.                            STATION RECOVERY (1947)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1947 (RJS) STATION RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION.  THE 1933 DESCRIPTION IS ADEQUATE.                            STATION RECOVERY (2013)  RECOVERY NOTE BY DELAWARE COASTAL PROGRAM 2013 MARK NOT FOUND.

BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1933 (GLA) THIS STATION IS LOCATED NEAR A BOUNDARY MONUMENT BETWEEN THE STATES OF DELAWARE AND PENNSYLVANIA, ALONG THE CIRCULAR BOUNDARY, ON PROPERTY OWNED BY JAMES AND GRANT EBRIGHT AND ABOUT 6-3/4 MILES NNE OF THE CENTER OF WILMINGTON.  SURFACE, UNDERGROUND, REFERENCE, AND AZIMUTH MARKS ARE STANDARD BRONZE DISKS SET IN CONCRETE AS DESCRIBED IN NOTES 1B, 7A, AND 11B.  REFERENCE MARK NO. 1 IS E OF STATION.  55 FEET NW OF NW CORNER OF HOUSE.  38.9 FEET N OF W OF BOUNDARY MONUMENT.  71.5 FEET N OF SW CORNER OF HOUSE.  THE MARK PROJECTS 5 INCHES.  REFERENCE MARK NO. 2 IS NW OF STATION AND 6-1/2 FEET W OF VERY TALL LOCUST TREE (BLAZE).  MARK PROJECTS 10 INCHES.  THE AZIMUTH MARK IS E OF STATION ON W SIDE OF MACADAM ROAD 21 FEET W OF CENTER OF ROAD.  8 FEET S OF POLE (ELECTRIC).  350 FEET S OF LANE TO EBRIGHTS HOUSE.  THE MARK PROJECTS 3 INCHES.  THE GRANITE BOUNDARY MONUMENT IS E OF STATION.  36.2 FEET N OF SW CORNER OF HOUSE.  25.5 FEET W OF NW CORNER OF HOUSE.  THE MONUMENT IS ABOUT 10 INCHES SQUARE ON TOP AND 2-1/2 FEET HIGH.  CARVED ON THE FOUR SIDES ARE.  N SIDE--P,S SIDE--D,E SIDE--1892, W SIDE--17.  TO REACH FROM WILMINGTON GO NE ON HIGHWAY 13, 7.5 MILES FROM CENTER OF TOWN OR 0.4 MILE FROM WORTH STEEL COMPANY RAILROAD UNDERPASS, HERE TAKE LEFT ON PAVED ROAD (A CAUTION LIGHT AT ENTRANCE) AND CONTINUE IN A WESTERNLY DIRECTION 4.55 MILES TO A T-INTERSECTION, TAKE RIGHT (N) ON MACADAM ROAD AND GO 0.75 MILE TO LANE JUST N OF STONE FENCE, TAKE THIS LANE (W) 0.1 MILE TO GATE, THEN CONTINUE W ON THE N SIDE OF EBRIGHTS HOUSE 0.05 MILE TO GATE.  THE STATION IS BACK OF THE HOUSE IN WOODED LOT.  167 FEET W OF NW CORNER OF HOUSE.  146 FEET N OF W OF SW CORNER OF HOUSE.  19-1/2 FEET E OF 30-INCH MAPLE TREE.  THE MARK PROJECTS 2 INCHES.                            STATION RECOVERY (1933)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1933 RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION.                            STATION RECOVERY (1946)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1946 (ELJ) STATION MARK, REFERENCE MARKS AND AZIMUTH MARK RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION.  DISTANCES TO REFERENCE MARKS MEASURED AND FOUND TO BE CORRECT.  THE 1933 DESCRIPTION IS ADEQUATE EXCEPT FOR THE FOLLOWING CHANGES--  1.  CHANGE JAMES AND GRANT EBRIGHT TO R.E. MERCHANT.  2.  ADD KNOWN AS THE WINTERSET FARM.  3.  CHANGE CAUTION TO TRAFFIC.  4.  CHANGE 4.55 TO 4.75.  5.  DELETE JUST N OF STONE FENCE.  STONE FENCE IS NOW GONE.  6.  ADD MARKED WITH POINTER TO WINTERSET FARM.                            STATION RECOVERY (1957)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1957 (JBW) STATION WAS RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION.  THE OLD DESCRIPTION IS ADEQUATE.  STATION ON PROPERTY OWNED BY R.E. MERCHANT, ABOUT 50 FEET NORTH OF A LINE OF HOUSE TRAILERS.  DISTANCES TO THE REFERENCE MARKS AND THE ANGLE BETWEEN THE MARKS VERIFIED.  AZIMUTH MARK OBSTRUCTED BY HEAVY GROWTH OF BRUSH.                            STATION RECOVERY (1960)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1960 (JCC) STATION IS LOCATED NEAR THE DELAWARE-PENNSYLVANIA BOUNDARY.  ABOUT 6-1/2 MILES NORTH OF WILMINGTON, DELAWARE.  ON PROPERTY OWNED BY MR. R. E. MERCHANT AND LOCALLY KNOWN AS THE WINTERSET FARM.  TO REACH FROM THE POST OFFICE IN WILMINGTON, DELAWARE.  GO NORTHEAST ON KING STREET FOR 0.4 MILE, TURN LEFT AND GO NORTH ON CONCORD AVENUE (U.S. HIGHWAY 202) FOR 5.5 MILES TO CROSSROADS, TURN RIGHT AND GO EAST ON NAAMANS ROAD FOR 1.0 MILE TO EBRIGHT ROAD LEFT.  TURN LEFT ON EBRIGHT ROAD AND GO 0.6 MILE TO SIDE ROAD LEFT LEADING TO TRAILER COURT AND AZIMUTH MARK ON THE LEFT.  CONTINUE 0.05 MILE TO PRIVATE DRIVEWAY LEFT LEADING TO MR. MERCHANTS HOME.  TURN LEFT AND GO 0.1 MILE TO THE SOUTH SIDE OF MR. MERCHANTS HOME AND STATION.  REFERENCE MARK NO. 1 WAS RECOVERED AS DESCRIBED AND FOUND IN GOOD CONDITION.  REFERENCE MARK NO. 2 WAS RECOVERED AS DESCRIBED AND FOUND IN GOOD CONDITION.  THE FOLLOWING MEASUREMENTS WILL ASSIST IN RECOVERING THE MARK.  IT IS 52.8 FEET SOUTHEAST OF THE NORTHEAST CORNER OF A WATER PUMP HOUSE.  38.2 FEET WEST OF POWERLINE POLE 901 140.  12.0 FEET NORTH OF THE APPROXIMATE CENTER OF A DRIVEWAY.  AZIMUTH MARK WAS RECOVERED AND FOUND IN GOOD CONDITION.  IT IS 1.4 FEET SOUTH OF A STANDARD METAL WITNESS POST.  10.0 FEET SOUTH OF POWERLINE POLE 77.  48.0 FEET NORTH OF THE APPROXIMATE CENTER OF A SIDE ROAD.  21.0 FEET WEST OF THE APPROXIMATE CENTER OF EBRIGHT ROAD.  AND ABOUT 150 FEET NORTH-NORTHEAST OF A MICRO-WAVE RELAY TOWER.  BOUNDARY MONUMENT NO. 17 WAS FOUND AS DESCRIBED AND IN GOOD CONDITION.  A PRECISE TIE WAS MADE FROM THE STATION TO THIS MONUMENT.  HEIGHT OF LIGHT ABOVE STATION MARK 30.37 METERS.                            STATION RECOVERY (1965)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1965 (JCB) THE STATION, AZIMUTH MARK, BOUNDARY MONUMENT NO. 17 AND REFERENCE MARKS 1 AND 2 WERE RECOVERED AS DESCRIBED IN THE 1960 RECOVERY NOTE BY JOHN C. CHILDS.  THE STATION IS ADEQUATELY DESCRIBED.  NOTE--THE WITNESS POST AT THE AZIMUTH MARK HAS BEEN REMOVED.                            STATION RECOVERY (1979)  RECOVERY NOTE BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 1979 (RGP) THE STATION MARK, REFERENCE MARK 2, BOUNDARY MONUMENT NUMBER 17 AND THE AZIMUTH MARK WERE RECOVERED AND FOUND IN GOOD CONDITION.  REFERENCE MARK TWO WAS FOUND TILTED 45 DEGREES TO THE NORTHEAST.  A REFERENCE MARK THREE WAS ESTABLISHED TO REPLACE THE DESTROYED REFERENCE MARK TWO.  THE AZIMUTH MARK IS NO LONGER VISIBLE FROM THE GROUND, THERE ARE SEVERAL MOBILE HOMES ON THE LINE.  A COMPLETE NEW DESCRIPTION FOLLOWS.  THE STATION IS LOCATED ABOUT 6-1/2 MILES NORTH OF WILMINGTON AND ON THE PENNSYLVANIA-DELAWARE BOUND.  THE PROPERTY IS OWNED BY MR. R.E. MERCHANT AND IS KNOWN AS THE WINTERSET TRAILER COURT.  TO REACH THE STATION FROM THE POST OFFICE IN WILMINGTON, GO EAST ON KING STREET FOR 0.4 MILE TO U.S. HIGHWAY 202.  TURN LEFT AND GO NORTH ON U.S. HIGHWAY 202 (CONCORD AVENUE FOR 5.5 MILES TO STATE HIGHWAY 92.  TURN RIGHT AND GO EAST ON STATE HIGHWAY 92 (NAAMANS ROAD) FOR 1.0 MILES TO A SIDE ROAD LEFT (THIS IS 1.25 MILES WEST OF THE INTERSECTION OF HIGHWAYS 92 AND 261).  TURN LEFT AND GO NORTH ON EBRIGHT ROAD FOR 0.6 MILE TO THE AZIMUTH MARK ON THE LEFT.  CONTINUE NORTH ON EBRIGHT ROAD FOR 0.1 MILE TO A SIDE ROAD LEFT.  TURN LEFT AND GO WEST ON A PAVED ROAD FOR 0.1 MILE TO THE STATION ON THE LEFT, BEHIND A VERY OLD RESTORED STONE HOUSE.  THE STATION IS A STANDARD US COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY (NOW NOS) DISK STAMPED---EBRIGHT 1933---SET INTO THE TOP OF A ROUND CONCRETE MONUMENT 30 CM (12 INCHES) IN DIAMETER FLUSH WITH THE GROUND LOCATED 50.9 METERS (167 FEET) SW FROM THE NORTHWEST CORNER OF THE HOUSE, 44.5 METERS (146 FEET) SW FROM THE SOUTHWEST CORNER OF THE HOUSE, 4.3 METERS (14 FEET) WNW FROM A 8-INCH HEMLOCK TREE, 9.1 METERS (30 FEET) S FROM THE CENTER OF A PAVED MOBILE HOME PARK STREET, AND 2.1 METERS (7 FEET) N FROM A SIDE WALK. markers.description: BY DE DEPT OF HIGHWAYS 2004 (JRC) 0.5 KILOMETERS (0.3 MILES) SOUTHWEST OF KENTON, ON THE STATE MAINTAINED RIGHT-OF-WAY IN FRONT OF THE OLD KENTON SCHOOL. TO REACH THE STATION FROM THE INTERSECTION OF STATE ROAD 42 (SEVEN HICKORIES ROAD) AND STATE ROAD 300 (SUDLERSVILLE ROAD) IN KENTON, GO SOUTHWEST 0.5 KILOMETERS (0.3 MILE) ON SUDLERSVILLE ROAD TO STAION ON THE RIGHT NEAR THE SOUTHWEST PROPERTY CORNER OF OLD KENTON SCHOOL, 28.8 METERS (94.5 FEET) SOUTH OF THE SOUTHWEST CORNER OF THE OLD KENTON SCHOOL, 12.5 METERS (20.1 FEET) NORTHEAST OF TELPHONE POLE NUMBER DST JD89, AND 9.2 METERS (30.2 FEET) NORTHWEST OF THE CENTERLINE OF SUDLERSVILLE ROAD (SR 300). THE STATION IS THE TOP CENTER OF A STAINLESS STEEL ROD DRIVEN TO REFUSAL A DEPTH OF 19.9 METERS. THE ROD RECESSED 9 CENTIMETERS BELOW GROUND LEVEL IN A 0.9 METER GREASED FILLED FLUTED PLASTIC SLEEVE, AND ENCASED IN A 6-INCH DIAMETER PVC PIPE WITH A NGS LOGO CAP SURROUNDED BY CONCRETE SET FLUSH WITH GROUND. NOTE--SLEEVE DEPTH DOES NOT MEET SPECIFICATIONS FOR A CLASS A MARK. markers.description: BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1933 (GLA) THIS STATION IS ON PROPERTY OF THE LIGHTHOUSE BUREAU, ON THE DELAWARE SIDE OF THE DELAWARE RIVER, ABOUT 3 MILES E OF WILMINGTON AT THE EDGEMOOR LIGHTHOUSE DEPOT.  THE MARK IS IN THE GRASS PLOT JUST W OF THE CINDER DRIVE LEADING TO THE PIER.  IT IS 29.20 METERS N OF THE N CORNER OF THE PAINT STORAGE BUILDING.  3.90 METERS NNW OF THE EDGE OF THE CONCRETE OF THE PIER.  6.50 METERS W OF THE S CORNER OF THE LARGE MACHINE SHOP.  5.70 METERS NE OF THE FLAGPOLE.  IT PROJECTS 1 INCH.  SURFACE, UNDERGROUND, AND REFERENCE MARKS ARE STANDARD BRONZE DISKS SET IN CONCRETE.  REFERENCE MARK NO.1 IS S OF THE STATION.  SET IN THE CONCRETE WHARF 1 FOOT N OF THE INNER CORNER OF THE SW PIER.  IT IS 5.20 METERS E OF THE E CORNER OF THE PAINT STORAGE SHOP.  AND 9.00 METERS NE OF THE SW SIDE OF THE SW PIER.  REFERENCE MARK NO.2 IS N OF THE STATION.  SET AT THE NW EDGE OF THE LAWN.  IT IS 8.10 METERS W OF A LARGE WILD CHERRY TREE.  23 METERS NE OF THE EDGE OF THE CINDER DRIVE JUST NE OF THE GARAGE.  AND 16.5 METERS NW OF THE W CORNER OF A SHOP.  IT PROJECTS 2 INCHES.  THERE ARE THREE OLD MARKS ON THE WHARF AS FOLLOWS--  EDGEMOOR U.S.E. 1900 WHICH HAS BEEN USED BY THE COAST SURVEY BEFORE, IS NOW INSIDE THE PAINT STORAGE SHOP.  IT IS MARKED BY A 1/2-INCH BOLT SET IN THE CONCRETE UNDER THE PAINT RACK ON THE SW SIDE OF THE BUILDING.  0.26 METERS NE OF THE SW WALL.  1.50 METERS SE OF THE NW WALL.  5.45 METERS SW OF THE NE WALL.  AND 1.90 METERS NW OF THE SE WALL.  MOOR U.S.E. 1932 IS SET IN THE CENTER OF THE OUTER END OF THE SW PIER.  IT IS MARKED BY A STANDARD U.S.E. BRONZE DISK STAMPED MOOR 1932.  IT IS 4.75 METERS SW OF THE NE SIDE OF THE PIER.  4.35 METERS NE OF THE SW SIDE OF THE PIER.  AND 2.25 METERS NW OF THE END OF THE PIER.  THIS STATION CAN BE OCCUPIED FOR RIVER TRIANGULATION.  U.S.C. AND G.S. BENCH MARK B1 IS SSE OF THE STATION.  SET IN THE EXTENSION OF THE SW PIER ON WHICH IS LOCATED CHERRY ISLAND FRONT RANGE.  IT IS JUST SE OF THE FRAMEWORK OF THE RANGE LIGHT.  2.20 METERS NE OF THE SW SEA WALL.  AND 2.40 METERS NW OF THE SE CORNER OF THE EXTENSION AND THE PIER.  A TIE WAS MADE TO EDGEMOOR U.S.E. 1900 AND TO MOOR U.S.E. 1932 AS INDICATED IN THE SKETCH BELOW.  TO REACH FROM WILMINGTON, GO NE ABOUT 2 MILES ON U.S. HIGHWAY 13 TO THE POINT WHERE IT CROSSES SHELL POT CREEK AT SHELL POT PARK.  CONTINUE ABOUT 0.05 MILE AND TURN RIGHT ON A MACADAM ROAD.  FOLLOW THIS ROAD 1.4 MILES, OR 0.4 MILE PAST AN OVERPASS, THEN TURN LEFT TOWARD THE DEPOT.  FOLLOW THE ROAD TO THE DEPOT AND THE STATION.                            STATION RECOVERY (1965)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1965 (JCB) THE STATION AND REFERENCE MARK NO. 1 WERE RECOVERED AS DESCRIBED WITH THE FOLLOWING EXCEPTIONS--(1) THE PROPERTY IS NOW BEING USED BY THE U.S. ARMY CORPS OF ENGINEERS.  (2) THE AREA AROUND THE STATION HAS BEEN PAVED AND THE CONCRETE WAS POURED AROUND THE STATION MARK LEAVING A LOW CONE SHAPED PROJECTION ABOVE THE GENERAL LEVEL OF THE PAVEMENT WITH THE STATION MARK IN ITS CENTER.  (3) THE STAMPING ON THE STATION MARK IS ENDGEMOOR 2 1933.  (4) REFERENCE MARK NO. 1 IS STAMPED EDGEMOOR NO 1 1933.  REFERENCE MARK NO. 2 WAS SEARCHED FOR BUT NOT FOUND.  THE STATION AND REFERENCE MARK NO. 1 ARE IN GOOD CONDITION.                            STATION RECOVERY (1965)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1965 0.5 MI E FROM WILMINGTON. 1/2 MILE EAST OF OVERPASS OF EDGEMOOR ROAD OVER THE PENNSYLVANIA RAILROAD, AT EDGEMOOR SUB-OFFICE OF THE U.S. ARMY CORPS OF ENGINEERS, 99 FEET SOUTHEAST OF A TALL ANTENNA POLE, 21.3 FEET SOUTHWEST OF SOUTH CORNER OF GARAGE BUILDING NO. 6, 244 FEET NORTH-NORTHWEST OF BENCH MARK B 1 AND SET IN THE TOP OF A CONCRETE POST PROJECTING 3 INCHES ABOVE PAVED AREA.                            STATION RECOVERY (1981)  RECOVERY NOTE BY UNIVERSITY OF DELAWARE 1981 MARK NOT FOUND.                            STATION RECOVERY (1982)  RECOVERY NOTE BY NATIONAL OCEAN SERVICE 1982 (RHH) THE STATION WAS RECOVERED AS DESCRIBED.  HEIGHT OF LIGHT SHOWN ABOVE THE MARK WAS 1.82 METERS.                            STATION RECOVERY (2013)  RECOVERY NOTE BY DELAWARE COASTAL PROGRAM 2013 BEHIND A LOCKED GATE ON THE PROPERTY OF THE EDGEMOOR DUPONT PLANT.

markers.description: BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1969 LOST.  THE LIGHT WAS REBUILT IN 1954.  ACCORDING TO THE COAST GUARD, THEY BELIEVE THE BASE OF THE STRUCTURE IS THE SAME.  RECOMMEND IT BE USED WITH CAUTION.                            STATION RECOVERY (1983)  RECOVERY NOTE BY NATIONAL OCEAN SERVICE 1983 DESTROYED.  ACCORDING TO THE 1933 LIGHT LIST, THE LIGHT AT THAT TIME WAS A RED BRICK OCTAGONAL DWELLING ON A BROWN CYLINDRICAL PIER, WITH A BROWN LANTERN.  ACCORDING TO THE COAST GUARD DISTRICT OFFICE, THE DWELLING WAS DESTROYED IN 1947, AND THE PRESENT STRUCTURE WAS BUILT ON THE OLD CYLINDRICAL PIER IN 1954.  THE PRESENT LIGHT IS ATOP A RED SKELETON STEEL TOWER WITH A SMALL WHITE HOUSE, BUILT ON AN INTERNATIONAL ORANGE CYLINDRICAL BASE.  THIS LIGHT WAS POSITIONED BY THIS PARTY, AND CALLED ---ELBOW OF CROSS LEDGE LT NEW---.

BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 1997 THE BASE LINE IS LOCATED ABOUT 4.3 KM (2.74 MI) SOUTH SOUTHEAST OF ELLENDALE, 9.2 KM (5.7 MI) NORTH NORTHWEST OF GEORGETOWN, AND 16.1 KM (10.0 MI) SOUTH OF MILFORD ALONG THE WEST SIDE OF U.S.HIGHWAY 113 IN A CLEARED AREA PARALLELING THE HIGHWAY.   THE BASE LINE IS AN NORTH-SOUTH LINE WITH THE 0-METER POINT ON THE SOUTH END. IT CONSISTS OF THE 0, 150, 400, AND 1100 METER POINTS. THERE IS NO 100-FOOT TAPE CALIBRATION STATION LOCATED AT THIS BASE LINE.   TO REACH THE 0-METER POINT FROM INTERSECTION OF US HIGHWAY 113 AND STATE ROUTE 16 LOCATED JUST WEST OF ELLENDALE, GO SOUTH ON US HIGHWAY 113 FOR 2.98 KM (1.85 MI) TO A CROSSOVER ON THE LEFT BETWEEN THE NORTHBOUND AND SOUTHBOUND LANES OF US HIGHWAY 113 AND A PAVED ENTRANCE ON THE RIGHT TO THE 1100 METER POINT. CONTINUE SOUTH ON US HIGHWAY 113 FOR 0.72 KM (0.45 MI) TO ANOTHER CROSSOVER BETWEEN THE NORTHBOUND AND SOUTHBOUND LANES OF U.S.HIGHWAY 113 AND ANOTHER PAVED ENTRANCE ON THE RIGHT TO THE 400 METER POINT. CONTINUE SOUTH ON US HIGHWAY 113 FOR 0.24 KM (0.15 MI) TO A PAVED ENTRANCE ON THE RIGHT TO THE 150 METER POINT.  CONTINUE SOUTH ON US HIGHWAY 113 FOR 0.16 KM (0.10 MI) TO A PAVED ENTRANCE ON THE RIGHT. TURN RIGHT INTO THE PAVED ENTRANCE AND THE 0 METER POINT STRAIGHT AHEAD.   THE 0-METER POINT IS A STANDARD NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY (NGS) CALIBRATION BASE LINE DISK STAMPED--0 1997--, SET IN THE TOP OF A 30 CM (12 IN) DIAMETER CONCRETE POST, FLUSH WITH THE SURFACE OF THE GROUND. IT IS 22.9 M (71.1 FT) WEST OF THE CENTERLINE OF THE SOUTHBOUND LANES OF US HIGHWAY 113, 6.6 M (21.7 FT) WEST OF THE SOUTHWEST CORNER OF THE PAVED ENTRANCE, AND 5.2 M (17.1 FT) EAST OF AN ORANGE FIBERGLASS WITNESS POST.   USER NOTES- CBL USERS SHOULD TAKE CARE IN PLUMBING OVER ALL POINTS. ELEVATIONS ARE FOR CBL USE ONLY.   IMPORTANT NOTE- AT THE TIME OF ESTABLISHMENT, EACH OF THE CBL MARKS WAS SURROUNDED BY A LOOSE FILL OF OLD GRAVEL AND ASPHALT.  THIS MATERIAL IS UNSUITABLE FOR STABLE SETUPS. DRIVE PIPE OR WOODEN STAKES TO SUPPORT TRIPODS LEGS.   THIS CALIBRATION BASE LINE WAS ESTABLISHED WITH ASSISTANCE FROM THE DELAWARE DEPARTMENT OF TRANSPORTATION AND THE NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY GEODETIC ADVISOR FOR THE STATE OF DELAWARE. FOR MORE INFORMATION PLEASE CONTACT MR JOHN WINKLER, DELAWARE DEPARTMENT OF TRANSPORTATION, AT (302) 760-2344. markers.description: BY DELAWARE DEPARTMENT OF TRANSPORTATION 2008 THE STATION IS LOCATED IN SUSSEX COUNTY, DELAWARE, NEAR CEDAR CREEK MILLPOND, 5.37 MI (8.6 KM)  (8.64 KM) SOUTHEAST OF MILFORD, 6.40 MI (10.30 KM) NORTH-NORTHWEST OF MILTON, AND 2.89 MI (4.7 KM)  (4.65 KM) EAST-SOUTHEAST OF LINCOLN.  THE STATION IS LOCATED ON DELAWARE DEPARTMENT OF  TRANSPORTATION RIGHT OF WAY.   TO REACH THE STATION FROM THE INTERSECTION OF STATE ROUTE 30 (CEDAR CREEK ROAD) AND  SUSSEX 214 (CUBBAGE POND ROAD) PROCEED 0.1 MI (0.16 KM) WEST-NORTHWEST ON SUSSEX 214  (CUBBAGE POND ROAD) TO THE INTERSECTION OF SUSSEX 214 (CUBBAGE POND ROAD) AND SUSSEX  216 (BENSON ROAD) AND THE STATION ON THE SOUTHEASTERLY CORNER OF THE INTERSECTION. TO  REACH THE STATION FROM THE RAILROAD CROSSING AND STATE ROUTE 16 (MAIN STREET, ELLENDALE) PROCEED 0.15 MI (0.24 KM) EAST ON STATE ROUTE 16 (MAIN STREET, ELLENDALE) TO THE  INTERSECTION OF STATE ROUTE 16 (MAIN STREET, ELLENDALE) AND SUSSEX 232 (PONDER ROAD)  THENCE PROCEED 2.2 MI (3.54 KM) NORTH-NORTHEAST ALONG SUSSEX 232 (PONDER ROAD) TO THE INTERSECTION OF SUSSEX 232 (PONDER ROAD) AND SUSSEX 232A (CHURCH BRANCH ROAD) THENCE  0.4 MI (0.64 KM) EAST-NORTHEAST ALONG SUSSEX 232A (CHURCH BRANCH ROAD) TO THE  INTERSECTION OF SUSSEX 232A (CHURCH BRANCH ROAD) AND SUSSEX 38 (JEFFERSON ROAD), THENCE 0.4 MI (0.64 KM) ALONG SUSSEX 38 (JEFFERSON ROAD) TO THE INTERSECTION OF SUSSEX 38 (JEFFERSON ROAD) AND SUSSEX 216 (BENSON ROAD), THENCE PROCEED 1.7 MI (2.74 KM)NORTH-  NORTHEAST ALONG SUSSEX 216 (JEFFERSON ROAD) TO THE INTERSECTION OF SUSSEX 216 (BENSON  ROAD AND SUSSEX 214 (CUBBAGE POND ROAD AND THE STATION ON THE RIGHT.  THE STATION IS  LOCATED ON THE SOUTHEASTERLY CORNER OF THE INTERSECTION.  THE STATION IS A BRASS DISK SET IN THE TOP OF A 1 FOOT (30 CM) DIAMETER CONCRETE MONUMENT.   THE STATION IS LOCATED 31 FEET (9.45 M) EAST-SOUTHEAST OF THE PHYSICAL CENTERLINE OF  SUSSEX 216 (BENSON ROAD), 18.4 FEET (5.61 M) OF A UTILITY POLE WITH 2 GUY WIRES (DEC 39109), AND 63.4 FEET (19.32 M) SOUTHWEST OF THE PHYSICAL CENTERLINE 0F SUSSEX 214 (CUBBAGE POND ROAD). markers.description: BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1933 (GLA) STATION IS ON A RIDGE OF HIGH GROUND BORDERED BY THE CREEK ON THE S AND BY MARSH ON THE N.  IT IS 12 FEET N OF THE EDGE OF THE CREEK, 40 FEET S OF THE EDGE OF THE MARSH, AND 70 FEET E OF THE CENTER LINE OF THE ROAD.  IT PROJECTS 3 INCHES ABOVE THE EARTHS SURFACE.  SURFACE, UNDERGROUND, REFERENCE, AND AZIMUTH MARKS ARE STANDARD BRONZE DISKS SET IN CONCRETE.  REFERENCE MARK NO.1 IS A STANDARD DISK CEMENTED IN DRILL HOLE IN BRIDGE ABUTMENT.  MARK IS ON THE E SIDE AND AT THE N END OF THE DRAW SPAN.  IT IS 1 FOOT S OF THE N END OF THE DRAW SPAN AND IN LINE WITH THE E SIDE OF THE BRIDGE.  A SUPPLEMENTAL POINT WAS ESTABLISHED ON THE OPPOSITE END OF THE BRIDGE.  IT IS THE UPPER SE CORNER OF THE LONGITUDINAL STEEL CHANNEL AND IS AT THE EXTREME SE CORNER OF THE BRIDGE.  BOTH REFERENCE MARK NO.1 AND THIS POINT ARE IN LINE WITH THE E EDGE OF THE BRIDGE.  REFERENCE MARK NO.2 IS 15 FEET E OF THE CNETER LINE OF THE ROAD AND 1 FOOT SE OF A FENCE CORNER.  IT PROJECTS 5 INCHES ABOVE THE EARTHS SURFACE.  AZIMUTH MARK IS APPROXIMATELY 0.2 MILE DISTANT AND ABOUT 50 FEET S OF A RED BARN.  IT PROJECTS 8 INCHES ABOVE THE EARTHS SURFACE.  TO REACH THIS STATION FROM ODESSA, DELAWARE--BEGIN AT THE TRAFFIC LIGHT ON THE S BOUND LANE OF U.S. HIGHWAY 13, TURN LEFT, AND GO 0.8 MILE TO A T-ROAD.  TURN LEFT HERE AND GO 1.3 MILES TO ANOTHER T-ROAD.  TURN LEFT AND GO 1.5 MILES TO STEEL BRIDGE OVER APPOQUINIMINK CREEK.                            STATION RECOVERY (1946)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1946 (ELJ) STATION MARK, REFERENCE MARK 1, AND REFERENCE MARK 2 RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION.  DISTANCES TO REFERENCE MARKS WERE MEASURED AND FOUND TO BE CORRECT.  THE 1933 DESCRIPTION IS ADEQUATE EXCEPT FOR THE FOLLOWING CHANGES--  CHANGE 1 FOOT SE TO 50 FEET NW OF FENCE.  DELETE REFERENCE TO AZIMUTH MARK WHICH WAS DESTROYED.  STANDARD BRONZE DISK WAS TURNED IN BY FARMER TO RECOVERY PARTY. REFERENCE MARK NO.1 IS 107.7 FEET SE OF THE STATION MARK NEAR THE NW CORNER OF THE NE OF TWO SHEDS.  REFERENCE MARK NO.2 IS A STANDARD DISK SET IN THE TOP OF THE MARYLAND-DELAWARE BOUNDARY MARK WHICH IS IN THE FENCE LINE JUST S OF THE LIGHTHOUSE.  IT IS 143.8 FEET W OF THE STATION.  REFERENCE MARK NO.3 IS ABOUT 1 MILE WNW OF THE STATION.  IT IS REACHED FROM THE STATION BY GOING W ON THE WILLIAMSVILLE ROAD ACROSS THE BRIDGE AND TAKING THE SECOND ROAD TO THE RIGHT.  GO 0.2 MILE ON THIS ROAD (N).  REFERENCE MARK WILL BE FOUND 80 PACES N OF ANDY MAGEES HOUSE, 7 PACES E OF THE ROAD AND 12 INCHES W OF A WIRE FENCE.  TO REACH FENWICK ISLAND LIGHTHOUSE GO S 0.5 MILE FROM THE POST OFFICE IN SELBYVILLE AND TURN LEFT ON HARD SURFACE ROAD, THROUGH WILLIAMSVILLE 10 MILES TO THE LIGHTHOUSE.  HEIGHT OF SIGNAL ABOVE STATION MARK - 34.4 METERS.                            STATION RECOVERY (1942)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1942 (WDP) LOCATED ON THE GROUNDS OF THE FENWICK ISLAND LIGHTHOUSE ABOUT 145 FEET E OF THE LIGHTHOUSE IN THE SE CORNER OF THE FENCED IN YARD, IN THE LINE WITH THE S FACE OF THE COTTAGE JUST TO THE E OF THE LIGHTHOUSE, 73 FEET E OF THE SE CORNER POST OF THE PORCH AND IS 13.9 FEET N OF THE FENCE ON THE S SIDE OF THE LIGHTHOUSE ENCLOSURE.  THE STATION IS A BRONZE DISK TRIANGULATION STATION MARK, STAMPED FENWICK ISLAND 1932, SET IN THE TOP OF A 12-INCH SQUARE CONCRETE MONUMENT, WHICH EXTENDS 4 INCHES ABOVE THE SURFACE OF THE GROUND.  GOOD CONDITION.  REFERENCE MARK NO.1 IS LOCATED 107.72 FEET SE OF THE STATION, NEAR THE NW CORNER OF THE NE OF TWO SHEDS.  THE MARK IS A BRONZE DISK REFERENCE MARK, STAMPED R.M. NO.1, FENWICK ISLAND 1932, SET IN THE TOP OF A 12-INCH SQUARE CONCRETE MONUMENT, WHICH EXTENDS 3 INCHES ABOVE SURFACE OF THE GROUND.  GOOD CONDITION.  REFERENCE MARK NO.2 IS LOCATED 143.75 FEET W OF THE STATION, IN THE FENCE LINE JUST S OF THE LIGHTHOUSE.  THE MARK IS A BRONZE DISK REFERENCE MARK, STAMPED R.M. NO.2, FENWICK ISLAND 1932, SET IN THE TOP OF AN ORIGINAL MASON-DIXON MARYLAND DELAWARE BOUNDARY MARK WHICH EXTENDS ABOUT 4 FEET ABOVE GROUND.  THE MARK IS IN FAIR CONDITION.  THE BOUNDARY MARKER IS SLIGHTLY LOOSE.  REFERENCE MARK NO.3 IS LOCATED ABOUT 1 MILE WNW OF THE STATION, 80 PACES N OF SMALLER AND SOUTHERLY OF TWO HOUSES OWNED BY S.D. BENNETT, 9 PACES E OF THE ROAD AND 12 INCHES W OF A WIRE FENCE.  THE MARK IS A BRONZE DISK REFERENCE MARK, STAMPED R.M. NO.3, FENWICK ISLAND 1932, SET IN THE TOP OF A 12-INCH SQUARE CONCRETE MONUMENT, WHICH EXTENDS 4 INCHES ABOVE THE SURFACE OF THE GROUND.  GOOD CONDITION.                            STATION RECOVERY (1956)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1956 (EHK) STATION AND REFERENCE MARKS RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION.  THE ORIGINAL DESCRIPTION IS ADEQUATE, EXCEPT THAT THE WIRE FENCE REFERRED TO IN THE DESCRIPTION OF REFERENCE MARK 3 IS DESTROYED.                            STATION RECOVERY (1956)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1956 (JAW) STATION WAS RECOVERED AS DESCRIBED.  THE STATION MARK AND RM NO 1 AND NO 2 WERE FOUND IN GOOD CONDITION.  THE STATION IS 72 FT. E OF THE SE CORNER OF THE 2 STORY HOUSE AND 14 FT. NORTH OF THE MARYLAND-DELAWARE STATE LINE.  R. M. NO. 1 IS IN MARYLAND AND IS NOW IN A VERY THICK BRIER PATCH.  RM NO 3 (AZIMUTH) WAS SEARCHED FOR BUT NOT FOUND.  CONDITIONS HAVE CHANGED IN THAT VICINITY.  A NEW AZIMUTH SHOULD BE ESTABLISHED FOR THIS STATION.                            STATION RECOVERY (1961)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1961 (JKW) STATION, R.M.S 2 AND 3 WERE RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION.  R.M. 1 WAS NOT FOUND.  THE 1942 RECOVERY NOTE BY W.D.P. IS ADEQUATE.                            STATION RECOVERY (1961)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1961 (RMS) STATION MARK, REFERENCE MARK NO 2 AND NO 3 WERE RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION.  REFERENCE MARK NO 1 WAS FOUND DESTROYED AND THE DISK WAS REMOVED BY THIS PARTY.  THE PUBLISHED DESCRIPTION IS ADEQUATE WITH THE FOLLOWING ADDITIONS AND DELETIONS--THE WIRE FENCE ON THE SOUTH SIDE OF THE LIGHTHOUSE ENCLOSURE HAS BEEN REMOVED.  STATION IS 77.7 FT. ESE OF THE NE CORNER OF PORCH.  STATION MARK IS STAMPED FENWICK ISLAND 1932 AND PROJECTS 6 INCHES.  REFERENCE MARK NO 2 IS STAMPED FENWICK ISLAND NO 2 1932.  THE GRANITE POST, IN WHICH IT IS SET, PROJECTS 3 FEET.  REFERENCE MARK NO 3 IS 53 FT. E OF THE CENTERLINE OF DRIVEWAY TO MR. BENNETTS HOUSE, 48 FT. W OF MARSH, 120 FT. NE OF A POWER POLE AND 3 FT. W OF A STEEL WITNESS POST.  THE DISK IS STAMPED FENWICK ISLAND NO 3 1932 AND PROJECTS 3 INCHES.  INITIAL MD.-DEL BOUNDARY (RM 2) RECOVERED AS DESCRIBED IN 1942.  DESCRIBED--L.F.B.                            STATION RECOVERY (1962)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1962 (RWT) THE STATION MARK, REFERENCE MARKS NO. 2 AND NO. 3 WERE RECOVERED AS DESCRIBED.  NO. 2 IN TOP OF THE BOUNDARY MONUMENT LEANS SOME AND IS LOOSE IN THE GROUND, THIS MARK COULD NOT BE MEASURED TO, BECAUSE OF A HEDGE ROW AND A FENCE, WHICH IS AROUND THE LIGHTHOUSE.  REFERENCE MARK NO. 3 WAS DESTROYED ON THIS DATE AS IT WAS NO LONGER VISIBLE FROM THE GROUND.  A NEW AZIMUTH MARK WAS ESTABLISHED.  THE COAST GUARD MARK COULD NOT BE MEASURED TO, BECAUSE OF HEDGE ROW AND FENCE AROUND THE LIGHTHOUSE.  THE LIGHTHOUSE COULD NOT BE MEASURED TO, BECAUSE OF HOUSE NOW IN LINE.  REFERENCE MARK NO. 1 WAS SEARCHED FOR BUT NOT FOUND.  IT IS BELIEVED TO HAVE BEEN DESTROYED.  A NEW REFERENCE MARK NO. 4 WAS ESTABLISHED ON THIS DATE.  THE STATION IS NOW ON PROPERTY OWNED BY MRS. EVERT LONG, WHO LIVES IN SELBYVILLE, DELAWARE.  TO REACH THE STATION FROM THE JUNCTION OF STATE HIGHWAYS 14 AND 26 IN BETHANY BEACH, DELAWARE.  GO SOUTH ON STATE HIGHWAY 14 FOR 6.28 MILES TO A SIDE ROAD RIGHT, JUST NORTH OF STATE LINE SIGNS*.  CONTINUE SOUTH ON STATE HIGHWAY 14 FOR 0.06 MILE TO POWERLINE POLE NO. 156 A, A STANDARD METAL WITNESS POST AND THE MARK ON THE LEFT, EAST, SIDE OF THE HIGHWAY.  *TURN RIGHT AND GO WEST ON A BLACKTOP ROAD FOR 0.15 MILE TO A PRIVATE DRIVEWAY ON THE LEFT.  TURN LEFT AND GO SOUTH ON THE PRIVATE DRIVEWAY FOR 0.06 MILE TO A LARGE FRAME HOUSE THE LIGHTHOUSE AND THE STATION TO THE LEFT OF THE HOUSE.  REFERENCE MARK 4, A STANDARD DISK STAMPED FENWICK ISLAND NO 4 1932, IS SET IN THE TOP OF A 10-INCH SQUARE CONCRETE MONUMENT FLUSH WITH THE SURFACE OF THE GROUND.  IT IS 65.7 FEET NORTHEAST OF THE NORTHEAST CORNER OF HOUSE AND 11.0 FEET EAST OF THE CENTERLINE OF DRIVEWAY AND ABOUT STATION ELEVATION.  THE AZIMUTH MARK, A STANDARD DISK STAMPED FENWICK ISLAND 1932 RESET 1962, IS SET IN TOP OF A 10-INCH SQUARE CONCRETE MONUMENT PROJECTING ABOUT 2 INCHES ABOVE THE SURFACE OF THE GROUND.  IT IS 150.0 FEET SOUTH OF THE STATE LINE AND CENTERLINE OF A GRAVELED ROAD RUNNING EAST, 55.0 FEET EAST OF THE CENTERLINE OF STATE HIGHWAY 528, 1.0 FEET NORTHWEST OF A STANDARD METAL WITNESS POST AND MARKER AND 1.3 FEET WEST OF POWERLINE POLE NO. 156.  HEIGHT OF LIGHT ABOVE STATION MARK 34.0 METERS.                            STATION RECOVERY (1971)  RECOVERY NOTE BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 1971 (LFS) THE STATION, REFERENCE MARK NO. 2, REFERENCE MARK NO. 4, AND THE AZIMUTH MARK, SET IN 1962, WERE ALL RECOVERED AND FOUND TO BE IN GOOD CONDITION.  FOLLOWING IS A MORE DETAILED REPORT--  THE STATION WAS RECOVERED IN A TRAILER PARK WITH THE MARK ONLY 1-INCH NORTH OF THE NORTH SIDE OF A LARGE TRAILER, PERMANENTLY PARKED, AND IS AT A POINT MIDWAY BETWEEN THE TANDUM WHEELS OF THE NORTH SIDE OF THE TRAILER.  IT COULD NOT BE OCCUPIED.  IT IS 72.8 FEET EAST OF THE SOUTHEAST CORNER OF A PORCH ON THE EAST SIDE OF HOUSE, 46 FEET EAST OF THE CENTERLINE OF ROAD, AND 24.4 FEET NORTH OF THE CENTERLINE OF AN ALLEY AND CENTER LINE OF A ROW OF UTILITY POLES.  THE MARK PROJECTS ABOUT 5 INCHES AND THE DISK IS STAMPED FENWICK ISLAND 1932.  REFERENCE MARK NO. 4, STAMPED FENWICK ISLAND NO 4 1932, WAS FOUND TO BE 2-INCHES UNDER SURFACE OF GROUND.  A LARGE HOUSE TRAILER IS ON LINE BETWEEN THIS MARK AND THE STATION.  IT IS IN THE FRONT OF TRAILER LOT NO. 6, 59.7 FEET NORTHEAST OF THE NORTHEAST CORNER OF A PORCH ON A TWO STORY WHITE HOUSE, 11.5 FEET EAST OF THE CENTERLINE OF A ROAD THROUGH THE TRAILER PARK, AND 11.3 FEET WEST OF THE BOTTOM OF THE NORTHWEST CORNER OF TRAILER.  REFERENCE MARK NO. 2 IS A STANDARD REFERENCE MARK DISK SET IN THE TOP OF A GRANITE POST THAT PROJECTS ABOUT 3 FEET.  THE GRANITE POST IS THE ORIGINAL MASON-DIXON MARYLAND-DELAWARE BOUNDARY MARK.  THE POST APPEARS TO BE LEANING.  HOWEVER, THE TOP OF THE STONE IS LEVEL AND THE WEST SIDE IS PERPENDICULAR.  THE SLOPING CUT OF THE EAST SIDE OF THE STONE GIVE IT THE APPEARENCE OF LEANING.  THE POSITION OF THE MARK WAS HELD AND THE STONE JARRED, IT WOULD ALWAYS SPRING BACK TO ITS HELD POSITION.  THE POSITION OF THE MARK WAS HELD AND THE GROUND DUG FROM AROUND THE BASE OF THE STONE AND REINFORCED WITH CONCRETE BELOW THE SURFACE OF GROUND AT BASE OF THE MONUMENT, WHICH GIVE IT A SOLID POSITION AT THE POINT OF LOCATION RECOVERED.  IT WILL NOT SEE TO STATION, NOR CAN THE DISTANCE BE MEASURED DUE TO TWO TRAILERS ON LINE, A LINK WIRE FENCE AND A HEDGE.  THE AZIMUTH MARK ESTABLISHED IN 1962 AND DESCRIBED IN THE 1962 DESCRIPTION, WAS RECOVERED AND FOUND TO BE IN GOOD CONDITION.  IT WAS FOUND TO BE 100 FEET SOUTH OF THE MARYLAND-DELAWARE STATE LINE AND NOT 150 FEET AS DESCRIBED.  IT IS 0.15 MILE EAST OF STATION, 55 FEET EAST OF CENTERLINE OF HIGHWAY, 2 FT. NORTHWEST OF POWERLINE POLE NO. 150A, AND 1.6 FROM WITNESS POST AND SIGN.  AIRLINE DISTANCE AND DIRECTION FROM NEAREST TOWN AT FENWICK ISLAND.                            STATION RECOVERY (1974)  RECOVERY NOTE BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 1974 (LAL) THE STATION MARK, REFERENCE MARK 2, COAST GUARD MARK AND THE AZIMUTH MARK WERE RECOVERED AND FOUND IN GOOD CONDITION AS DESCRIBED IN 1962.  REFERENCE MARK 4 WAS SEARCHED FOR BUT WAS NOT RECOVERED AT THIS DATE, IT IS BELIEVED THAT THE MARK HAS BEEN DESTROYED WHEN THE TRAILER PARK WAS ESTABLISHED.  A NEW REFERENCE MARK 5 WAS ESTABLISHED AT THIS DATE.  NO OBSERVATIONS OR MEASUREMENTS TO THE REFERENCE MARKS WERE TAKEN AT THIS DATE DUE TO A HOUSE TRAILER OVER THE STATION MARK.  A TOWER WAS ERECTED OVER REFERENCE MARK 5 AND ALL OBSERVATIONS TAKEN.  A TRAVERSE DISTANCE WAS MADE TO REFERENCE MARK 5.  FOR ADDITIONAL INFORMATION SEE DESCRIPTION FENWICK ISLAND 1932 RM 5.  AIRLINE DISTANCE AND DIRECTION FROM NEAREST TOWN NORTH EDGE OF FENWICK ISLAND.                            STATION RECOVERY (1974)  RECOVERY NOTE BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 1974 IN FENWICK ISLAND. TO REACH THE STATION FROM THE JUNCTION OF STATE ROADS 14 AND 54 IN FENWICK ISLAND, GO SOUTH ON STATE ROAD 14 FOR 0.05 MILE TO THE STATE LINE AND A SIDE ROAD RIGHT.  TURN RIGHT AND GO WEST ON A SAND ROAD FOR 0.1 MILE TO THE STATION ON THE RIGHT.  IT IS 33 FEET NORTH-NORTHEAST OF THE CENTER OF THE SAND ROAD, 20 FEET NORTHWEST OF POWERLINE POLE NUMBER 24-209AC AND UNDER THE NORTH EDGE OF A WHITE TRAILER HOUSE. markers.description: BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1934 (JCT) STATION RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION AND WAS OCCUPIED BY THIS PARTY.  NO ORIGINAL DESCRIPTION.  LOCATED ABOUT 1 MILE NNW FROM DAGSBORO, DELAWARE.  A 110-FOOT STEEL FRAMED FIRE TOWER WITH SMALL OBSERVATION HOUSE ON TOP.  THE STATION IS THE CENTER OF THE WOODEN ROOF OF THE OBSERVATION HOUSE.  MARKED BY TRIANGLE CUT IN WOOD WITH DRILL HOLE FOR CENTER.                            STATION RECOVERY (1969)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1969 (JKW) STATION RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION.  THE RECOVERY NOTE BY J.C.T.JR. IN 1934 IS ADEQUATE.

BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1933 (GLA) TO REACH THIS STATION FROM DOVER, DELAWARE--BEGINNING AT POST OFFICE, GO N ON U.S. HIGHWAY 13 FOR 11.3 MILES TO THE MAIN STREET INTERSECTION OF SMYRNA, DELAWARE.  CONTINUE STRAIGHT AHEAD FOR 1.1 MILES.  TURN RIGHT AND CONTINUE ON THIS PAVED ROAD FOR 5.95 MILES.  STATION IS ON THE RIGHT HAND SIDE OF THE ROAD APPROXIMATELY 215 FEET DISTANT AND 24 FEET N OF HOUSE ON DOCK.  IT IS 27 FEET S OF A BARBED WIRE FENCE AND IT PROJECTS 2 INCHES ABOVE THE EARTHS SURFACE.  SURFACE, UNDERGROUND, REFERENCE, AND AZIMUTH MARKS ARE STANDARD BRONZE DISKS SET IN CONCRETE.  REFERENCE MARK NO.2 IS A STANDARD DISK CEMENTED IN DRILL HOLE IN BRIDGE ABUTMENT AT THE N END OF THE BRIDGE AND ON THE W SIDE.  IT IS IN THE SAME ABUTMENT AND ALONGSIDE THE U.S.E.D. BENCH MARK.  REFERENCE MARK NO.1 IS N OF THE STATION AND 12 FEET SW CENTER LINE OF THE ROAD JUST INSIDE THE FENCE LINE.  IT PROJECTS 4 INCHES ABOVE THE EARTHS SURFACE.  AZIMUTH MARK IS 21 FEET FROM CENTER LINE OF ROAD AND 12 FEET FROM A 16-INCH CEDAR TREE.  CROSS BRIDGE AND GO SE ON ROAD FOR 0.5 MILE.  IT PROJECTS 12 INCHES ABOVE THE EARTHS SURFACE.  A SQUARE PIN ON THE EXTREME W SIDE OF THE DRAW SPAN AND AT ITS N END WAS ALSO LOCATED.  A DIRECTION WAS TAKEN TO A SIMILAR PIN ON THE W SIDE OF THE DRAW SPAN AND AT THE S END.                            STATION RECOVERY (1946)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1946 (ELJ) STATION, REFERENCE MARKS 1 AND 2, AND AZIMUTH MARKS WERE RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION.  DISTANCES TO REFERENCE MARKS WERE MEASURED AND FOUND TO BE CORRECT.  DUE TO INACCURACIES AND DESTRUCTION OF REFERENCES IN THE 1933 DESCRIPTION, A COMPLETE NEW DESCRIPTION IS SUBMITTED AS FOLLOWS--  TO REACH THIS STATION FROM SMYRNA, DELAWARE, START AT INTERSECTION OF U.S. HIGHWAY 13 AND STATE HIGHWAY 6, GO 1.1 MILES N ON HIGHWAY 13, TURN E ON PAVED ROAD 5.95 MILES TO DRAWBRIDGE OVER SMYRNA RIVER AT FLEMINGS LANDING, DELAWARE.  STATION MARK IS 225 FEET W OF N END OF BRIDGE, 383 FEET N OF MEAN HIGH-WATER LINE, 28.9 FEET N OF NE CORNER OF WAREHOUSE ON WHARF.  IT IS A BRONZE STATION DISK, STAMPED FLEMING 1933 AND IS FLUSH WITH THE GROUND.  IT IS SET IN CONCRETE.  REFERENCE MARK 1 IS N OF THE STATION, 12 FEET SW OF CENTER LINE OF THE ROAD AND JUST INSIDE FENCE.  IT PROJECTS 4 INCHES ABOVE THE GROUND.  IT IS SET IN CONCRETE.  ( A BRONZE REFERENCE DISK.)  REFERENCE MARK 2 IS A BRONZE REFERENCE DISK CEMENTED IN DRILL HOLE IN W END OF N ABUTMENT OF BRIDGE.  IT IS NEAR THE U.S.E.D. BENCH MARK.  IT IS SET IN CONCRETE.  TO REACH AZIMUTH MARK FROM THE STATION, GO ACROSS BRIDGE 0.5 MILE SE ALONG ROAD.  THE MARK IS 21 FEET E OF THE CENTER LINE OF THE ROAD.  THE AZIMUTH MARK IS 12 FEET NORTH OF A LONE 20-INCH PINE TREE.  IT IS NOW MARKED WITH A 4- BY 4-INCH BY 2-FOOT WHITE WOODEN POST STENCILED U S B M.  IT PROJECTS 10 INCHES ABOVE GROUND.  IT IS SET IN CONCRETE.  A SQUARE PIN ON THE EXTREME W SIDE OF THE DRAWSPAN AND AT ITS N END WAS ALSO LOCATED.  A DIRECTION WAS TAKEN TO A SIMILAR PIN OF THE DRAW SPAN AND AT THE S END.                            STATION RECOVERY (1969)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1969 (JKW) STATION MARK, R.M.S 1 AND 2 AND AZIMUTH MARK RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION.  THE RECOVERY NOTE BY E.L.J. IN 1946 IS ADEQUATE WITH THE FOLLOWING EXCEPTIONS--R.M. 1 PROJECTS TWO FEET ABOVE THE GROUND.  THE WAREHOUSE ON WHARF HAS BEEN RAZED AND ONLY ITS FOUNDATION REMAINS.                            STATION RECOVERY (1998)  RECOVERY NOTE BY US POWER SQUADRON 1998 MARK NOT FOUND.                            STATION RECOVERY (2013)  RECOVERY NOTE BY DELAWARE COASTAL PROGRAM 2013 INADEQUATE DESCRIPTION

markers.description: BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1962 (RWT) THE STATION IS LOCATED ON THE TOP CENTER OF FORMER MILITARY OBSERVATION TOWER, LOCATED 2.3 MILES NORTH OF REHOBOTH BEACH, 3.5 MILES SOUTHEAST OF LEWES AND ON PROPERTY OF THE STATE HIGHWAY DEPARTMENT.  TO REACH THE STATION FROM THE POST OFFICE IN REHOBOTH BEACH, GO EAST ON REHOBOTH AVENUE FOR 0.15 MILE TO FIRST STREET, TURN LEFT AND GO NORTHWEST ON FIRST STREET FOR 0.3 MILE TO A T-STREET, TURN RIGHT AND GO 0.05 MILE TO WHERE FIRST STREET TURNS LEFT, TURN LEFT AND GO NORTH ON FIRST STREET FOR 0.3 MILE TO A T-STREET, TURN RIGHT AND GO EAST FOR 0.2 MILE TO A CROSS STREET, CONTINUE EAST FOR 0.1 MILE AND THEN NORTH ALONG THE SHORE LINE FOR 1.55 MILES TO THE AZIMUTH MARK ON THE RIGHT, JUST BEFORE REACHING THE SOUTH ONE OF TWO CONCRETE OBSERVATION TOWERS, CONTINUE NORTH ALONG THE WEST SIDE OF THE TELEPHONE LINE FOR 0.22 MILE TO THE NORTH ONE OF TWO CONCRETE OBSERVATION TOWERS AND THE STATION IS LOCATED ON TOP OF THE OBSERVATION TOWER AS DESCRIBED.  THE STATION MARK IS A STANDARD DISK STAMPED GORDON 1962, SET IN CONCRETE IN A 4-INCH PIPE LOCATED IN THE TOP CENTER OF THE OBSERVATION TOWER, 5.0 FEET WEST OF THE DOOR LEADING TO THE TOP OF THE TOWER, 6.2 FEET NORTHEAST OF A CHIMNEY AND 6.6 FEET EAST OF CONTROLE BOX.  REFERENCE MARK 1 IS A STANDARD DISK STAMPED GORDON NO 1 1962, SET IN TOP OF A SQUARE CONCRETE MONUMENT WHICH PROJECTS 4 INCHES ABOVE THE GROUND SURFACE.  IT IS 3.7 FEET EAST OF A STANDARD METAL WITNESS POST AND MARKER, 27.0 FEET WEST OF THE CENTER OF AN OLD BEACH ROAD, 52.4 FEET NORTHWEST OF A TELEPHONE LINE POLE NUMBER 110, 87.8 FEET SOUTHWEST OF THE SOUTHWEST CORNER OF A METAL BUILDING AND 148.8 FEET WEST-SOUTHWEST OF THE NORTH SIDE OF THE DOOR TO THE CONCRETE OBSERVATION TOWER.  REFERENCE MARK 2 IS A STANDARD DISK STAMPED GORDON NO 2 1962, SET IN TOP OF A SQUARE CONCRETE MONUMENT WHICH PROJECTS 4 INCHES ABOVE THE GROUND SURFACE.  IT IS 2.9 FEET EAST OF A STANDARD METAL WITNESS POST AND MARKER, 112.5 FEET EAST-SOUTHEAST OF A TELEPHONE LINE POLE NUMBER 108, 134.5 FEET NORTH OF THE NORTH SIDE OF THE DOOR TO THE OBSERVATION TOWER, 135.1 FEET EAST OF THE CENTER OF THE OLD BEACH ROAD AND 140.5 FEET NORTHEAST OF THE NORTHEAST CORNER OF THE METAL BUILDING.  THE AZIMUTH MARK IS A STANDARD DISK STAMPED GORDON 1962, SET IN TOP OF A SQUARE CONCRETE MONUMENT WHICH PROJECTS 4 INCHES ABOVE THE GROUND SURFACE.  IT IS 3.2 FEET EAST-NORTHEAST OF A TELEPHONE LINE POLE NUMBER 120, 3.6 FEET SOUTHEAST OF A STANDARD METAL WITNESS POST AND MARKER, 33.0 FEET EAST OF THE OLD BEACH ROAD AND 245.6 FEET SOUTH-SOUTHWEST OF THE SOUTHWEST SIDE OF THE CONCRETE OBSERVATION TOWER.  REFERENCE MARK NUMBER 1 WAS OBSERVED AND TRAVERSED TOO.  HEIGHT OF LIGHT ABOVE STATION MARK 2.0 METERS.                            STATION RECOVERY (1970)  RECOVERY NOTE BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 1970 (JKW) STATION MARK NOT ACTUALLY RECOVERED, BUT TOWER IS IN GOOD CONDITION.  ENTRANCE IS SEALED SO VANDALS CANT GET IN.  RMS 1 AND 2 WERE RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION.  A THOROUGH SEARCH WAS MADE FOR THE AZIMUTH MARK, BUT IT COULD NOT BE FOUND.  THE ORIGINAL DESCRIPTION IS ADEQUATE WITH THE FOLLOWING CHANGES--ALL TELEPHONE POLES AND WITNESS POSTS HAVE BEEN REMOVED.  THE METAL BUILDING HAS BEEN TORN DOWN, BUT THE FOUNDATION STILL REMAINS.  AIRLINE DISTANCE AND DIRECTION FROM NEAREST TOWN 3.5 MILES SE OF LEWES.                            STATION RECOVERY (1975)  RECOVERY NOTE BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 1975 (EAB) THE STATION MARK WAS NOT ACTUALLY RECOVERED, AS MENTIONED IN THE 1962 DESCRIPTION, IT IS IN A DRILL HOLE IN THE ROOF OF A CONCRETE SILO.  THE CONCRETE SILO WAS RECOVERED AND IT WAS FOUND TO BE IN GOOD CONDITION, BUT THE ENTRANCE DOOR NOW IS SEALED.  REFERENCE MARK NO 1 WAS RECOVERED AND IT WAS FOUND TO BE IN GOOD CONDITION.  THIS MARK WAS ALSO OCCUPIED IN 1962.  REFERENCE MARK NO 2 WAS RECOVERED AND IT WAS FOUND TO BE IN GOOD CONDITION.  THE AZIMUTH MARK WAS NOT RECOVERED.  AIRLINE DISTANCE AND DIRECTION FROM NEAREST TOWN 3.5 MILES SOUTHEAST OF LEWES.                            STATION RECOVERY (1995)  RECOVERY NOTE BY US POWER SQUADRON 1995 MARK NOT FOUND.

markers.description: BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1958 (JCE) STATION IS LOCATED IN THE MEDIAN STRIP BETWEEN THE NORTHEAST AND SOUTHWEST BOUND TRAFFIC LANES OF U.S. HIGHWAY NO. 13 AND NEAR A STEEL ARCH SIGN OVER THE SOUTHWEST BOUND TRAFFIC LANE, ABOUT 3-1/2 MILES SOUTH OF POST OFFICE IN WILMINGTON, ABOUT 2-1/2 MILES NORTH-NORTHWEST OF DELAWARE MEMORIAL BRIDGE AND JUST NORTH OF GRACE LAWN CEMETERY.  STATION IS 55 FEET SOUTH-SOUTHEAST OF APPROXIMATE CENTERLINE OF SOUTHWEST BOUND TRAFFIC LANE, 67 FEET SOUTH-SOUTHWEST OF A WALNUT TREE AND 23 FEET SOUTHEAST OF A STEEL ARCH SIGN OVER THE SOUTHWEST BOUND TRAFFIC LANE.  THE MARK IS A STANDARD STATION DISK SET IN A 12X12 INCH CONCRETE MONUMENT, FLUSH WIH THE GROUND AND THE DISK IS STAMPED GRACELAWN 1958.  REFERENCE MARK NO. 1 IS 62 FEET SOUTHWEST OF MEDIAN CROSSOVER, 55-1/2 FEET SOUTHEAST OF APPROXIMATE CENTERLINE OF SOUTHWEST BOUND TRAFFIC LANE AND 28 FEET EAST-SOUTHEAST OF WALNUT TREE.  THE MARK IS A STANDARD REFERENCE DISK SET IN A 12X12 INCH CONCRETE MONUMENT SET FLUSH WITH THE GROUND AND THE DISK IS STAMPED GRACELAWN NO 1 1958.  REFERENCE MARK NO. 2 IS SET IN A DRILL HOLE IN THE NORTHWEST CONCRETE ABUTMENT OF THE STEEL ARCH SIGN AND 8 FEET SOUTHWEST OF EDGE OF DRIVEWAY.  THE DISK IS STAMPED GRACELAWN NO 2 1958.  STATION FARN IS VISIBLE FROM GROUND AND MAY BE USED AS AZIMUTH MARK.  TO REACH FROM ADMINISTRATION BUILDING AT NEW CASTLE COUNTY AIRPORT, GO NORTHEAST ON U.S. HIGHWAYS NO. 13 AND 40 FOR 1.75 MILE TO JUNCTION OF U.S. HIGHWAYS NO. 13 AND 40.  BEAR LEFT AND FOLLOW U.S. HIGHWAY NO. 13 FOR 0.45 MILE TO OVERHEAD ARCH SIGN ON LEFT (NORTHWEST SIDE OF NORTHEAST BOUND TRAFFIC LANE) AND STATION AS DESCRIBED.  HEIGHT OF LIGHT ABOVE STATION MARK 27 METERS.                            STATION RECOVERY (1965)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1965 (JCB) THE STATION AND REFERENCE MARKS 1 AND 2 WERE RECOVERED AND FOUND IN GOOD CONDITION.  THE ORIGINAL DESCRIPTION IS INADEQUATE.  A COMPLETE NEW DESCRIPTION FOLLOWS.  THE STATION IS LOCATED ABOUT 3-1/2 MILES SOUTHWEST OF THE POST OFFICE IN WILMINGTON, 2-1/2 MILES NORTH-NORTHWEST OF THE DELAWARE MEMORIAL BRIDGE, JUST NORTH-NORTHWEST OF THE GRACELAWN CEMETERY, IN THE MEDIAN STRIP OF U.S. HIGHWAY 13 AND NEAR A STEEL ARCH OVER THE SOUTHWEST BOUND TRAFFIC LANE WHICH SUPPORTS ROAD SIGNS.  IT IS 25 FEET EAST-SOUTHEAST OF THE SOUTHEAST END OF THE STEEL ARCH, 55 FEET SOUTHEAST OF THE CENTERLINE OF THE SOUTHWEST BOUND TRAFFIC LANE AND 67 FEET SOUTH-SOUTHWEST OF A WALNUT TREE.  THE MONUMENT IS FLUSH WITH THE GROUND AND THE DISK IS STAMPED GRACELAWN 1958.  (NOTE 1A, 7A)  REFERENCE MARK NO. 1 IS 75.72 FEET NORTH-NORTHEAST OF THE STATION, 62 FEET SOUTHWEST OF THE APPROXIMATE CENTERLINE OF A CROSSOVER, 55-1/2 FEET SOUTHEAST OF THE APPROXIMATE CENTERLINE OF THE SOUTHWEST BOUND LANE AND 28 FEET EAST-SOUTHEAST OF THE WALNUT TREE.  THE MONUMENT IS FLUSH WITH THE GROUND AND THE DISK IS STAMPED GRACELAWN NO 1 1958.  REFERENCE MARK NO. 2 IS SET IN A DRILL HOLE IN THE NORTHWEST CONCRETE PIER OF THE STEEL ARCH SUPPORTING THE HIGHWAY SIGNS AND THE DISK IS STAMPED GRACELAWN NO 2 1958.  TO REACH FROM THE ADMINISTRATION BUILDING AT THE GREATER WILMINGTON AIRPORT, GO NORTHEAST ON U.S. HIGHWAYS 13 AND 40 FOR 1.75 MILES TO THEIR JUNCTION.  BEAR LEFT ON HIGHWAY 13 FOR 0.45 MILE TO AN OVERHEAD STEEL ARCH SUPPORTING HIGHWAY SIGNS, ON THE LEFT AND OVER THE SOUTHWEST BOUND TRAFFIC LANE AND THE STATION AS DESCRIBED.                            STATION RECOVERY (1965)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1965 0.8 MI NE FROM FARNHURST. 0.75 MILE NORTHEAST ALONG U.S. HIGHWAY 13 FROM OVERPASS OVER THE PENNSYLVANIA RAILROAD AT FARNHURST, IN THE DIVIDING STRIP BETWEEN LANES OF HIGHWAY, ABOUT 0.1 MILE SOUTHWEST OF ENTRANCE TO GRACE LAWN CEMETERY AND THE TOP OF A GRADE, 54 FEET SOUTHEAST OF CENTERLINE OF SOUTHWEST BOUND LANE OF HIGHWAY 13, 55 FEET SOUTHEAST OF THE CENTERLINE OF THE SOUTHWEST BOUND TRAFFIC LANE, 67 FEET SOUTH-SOUTHWEST OF A 10-INCH WALNUT TREE, 25 FEET EAST-SOUTHEAST OF THE SOUTHEAST END OF THE STEEL ARCH SUPPORTING HIGHWAY SIGNS OVER THE SOUTHWEST BOUND LANE AND SET IN THE TOP OF A CONCRETE POST FLUSH WITH THE GROUND.                            STATION RECOVERY (1973)  RECOVERY NOTE BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 1973 (CLN) THE STATION MARK AND REFERENCE MARK ONE WAS FOUND DESTROYED.  REFERENCE MARK ONE WAS FOUND IN GOOD CONDITION ACROSS A VERY BUSY HIGHWAY.  THE STATION MARK AND THE REFERENCE MARK WERE DESTROYED DURING THE CONSTRUCTION OF A SEWER.  IT WOULD BE IMPOSSIBLE FOR ONE MAN TO RESTORE THE STATION AT THIS DATE.  THERE IS A CONSTANT FLOW OF TRAFFIC ON LINE TO THE REMAINING REFERENCE MARK.  AIRLINE DISTANCE AND DIRECTION FROM NEAREST TOWN 3-1/2 MILES SOUTH OF WILMINGTON. STATION RECOVERY (1991)  RECOVERY NOTE BY US GEOLOGICAL SURVEY 1991 MARK NOT FOUND. markers.description: BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1933 (GLA) THIS STATION IS ON PROPERTY OWNED BY A. EARNEST GREEN OF WHITE CHRYSTAL BEACH, MARYLAND, ABOUT 3 MILES NE OF CENTER OF WILMINGTON, ALONG THE PHILADELPHIA PIKE (HIGHWAY 13).  SURFACE, UNDERGROUND, REFERENCE, AND AZIMUTH MARKS ARE STANDARD BRONZE DISKS SET IN CONCRETE AS DESCRIBED IN NOTES 1B, 7A, AND 11B.  REFERENCE MARK NO.1 IS SE OF STATION.  42.5 FEET NW OF CENTER OF HIGHWAY 13.  26.6 FEET SW OF CINDER ROAD.  THE MARK PROJECTS 2 INCHES.  REFERENCE MARK NO.2 IS W OF STATION AND ABOUT 40 FEET N OF N CORNER OF A GRAY STONE GARAGE IN THE W CORNER OF WILL CRUMPS YARD.  THE MARK PROJECTS 4 INCHES.  THE AZIMUTH MARK IS W OF STATION.  TO REACH GO SW (TOWARDS WILMINGTON) FROM STATION TO FIRST PAVED ROAD LEADING TO THE RIGHT (NW), TAKE THIS ROAD TO RIGHT 0.2 MILE TO MARK.  THE MARK IS ON THE S SIDE OF THE ROAD JUST N OF A BARB WIRE FENCE.  27 FEET SW OF CENTER OF ROAD AND 102 FEET W OF STONE HOUSE ACROSS ROAD (W CORNER).  THE MARK PROJECTS 3 INCHES.  TO REACH FROM WILMINGTON, TAKE HIGHWAY 13 N FROM CENTER OF TOWN ABOUT 3 MILES OR 0.80 MILE BEYOND THE CROSSING OF SHELL POT CREEK AT SHELL POT PARK TO TOP OF GRADE OPPOSITE AN OLD BROWN STUCCO HOUSE ON THE LEFT DIRECTLY ACROSS THE HIGHWAY FROM A NEW WHITE STUCCO HOUSE.  THERE IS A TRAFFIC POLICE STATION ABOUT 100 YARDS N OF HERE.  THE STATION IS N OF N CORNER OF THE OLD BROWN STUCCO HOUSE (NOW OCCUPIED BY WILL CRUMP) 48 FEET.  45 FEET SW OF CINDER ROAD LEADING N BETWEEN THE HOUSE AND THE POLICE STATION.  121.7 FEET NW FROM CENTER OF HIGHWAY 13.  THE MARK IS IN THE BACK YARD OF WILL CRUMPS HOUSE AND IS FLUSH WITH THE GROUND.  HEIGHT OF SIGNAL ABOVE STATION MARK - 90 FEET.                            STATION RECOVERY (1946)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1946 (ELJ) STATION MARK NOT RECOVERED.  HOUSE OCCUPIED BY WILL CRUMP WAS RAZED AND NEW BUILDINGS CONSTRUCTED IN 1939.  IT IS BELIEVED THAT THE STATION MARK WAS REMOVED DURING THIS CONSTRUCTION.  REFERENCE MARKS 1 AND 2 WERE RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION.  DUE TO THE FOLLOWING CHANGES A COMPLETE NEW DESCRIPTION FOR THE REFERENCE MARKS FOLLOW.  1.  OLD BROWN STUCCO HOUSE ON LEFT IS NOW GONE.  2.  NEW WHITE STUCCO HOUSE IS NOW GONE.  3.  CINDER ROAD IS NOW PAVED ROAD AND NAMED SPEER ROAD.  TO REACH FROM WILMINGTON GO NE ON U.S. 13 (TOWARDS PHILADELPHIA) TO TOP OF HILL BEYOND SHELL POT CREEK.  SPEER ROAD LEAVES U.S. 13 TO NW (TO LEFT) OPPOSITE A DELICATESSEN ON RIGHT.  DELICATESSEN IS A 2-STORY BRICK BUILDING WITH LIVING QUARTERS IN REAR.  THERE IS A ROW OF SMALL 2-STORY RED BRICK DWELLINGS ON RIGHT OF U.S. 13 BEFORE REACHING SPEER ROAD.  THERE IS A DELAWARE STATE POLICE STATION ON LEFT JUST BEYOND SPEER ROAD.  REFERENCE MARK 1 IS IN E CORNER OF YARD OF LAST HOUSE OF ROW OF RED BRICK DWELLINGS, 42.5 FEET NW OF CENTERLINE OF U.S. 13, 26.6 FEET W OF CENTER LINE OF SPEER ROAD, 3 FEET W OF HEDGE ALONG SPEER ROAD.  1 FOOT NW OF HEDGE ALONG SIDEWALK.  REFERENCE MARK 2 IS BACK YARD OF HOUSE OF W.G. LADD, FIRST HOUSE ON LEFT GOING NW ON SPEER ROAD.  IT IS ONE FOOT S OF HEDGE ALONG NW PROPERTY LINE OF LADDS HOME, 56 FEET SW OF W CORNER OF W.G. LADDS HOUSE AND 11.2 FEET NW OF N CORNER OF SCREENED SUMMER HOUSE.

markers.description: BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 1974 (LAL) THE STATION IS LOCATED ABOUT 2.8 MILES WEST OF FENWICK ISLAND, 2.4 MILES SOUTHEAST OF JOHNSON, 1.5 MILES SOUTH-SOUTHEAST OF WILLIAMSVILLE AND ON ROAD RIGHT-OF-WAY.  TO REACH THE STATION FROM THE JUNCTION OF STATE ROADS 14 AND 54 IN FENWICK ISLAND, GO WEST-NORTHWEST AND SOUTHWEST ON STATE ROAD 54 FOR 4.15 MILES TO A SIDE ROAD LEFT AND THE SOUND METHODIST CHURCH ON THE LEFT.  TURN LEFT AND GO SOUTHEAST ON A PAVED ROAD FOR 0.7 MILE TO A T-ROAD AND A STOP SIGN.  TURN LEFT AND GO SOUTHEASTERLY ON A PAVED ROAD FOR 0.45 MILE TO A SIDE ROAD RIGHT.  TURN RIGHT AND GO SOUTHWESTERLY ON A PAVED ROAD FOR 0.3 MILE TO THE STATION ON THE LEFT.  CONTINUE SOUTHWESTERLY ON THE PAVED ROAD FOR 0.25 MILE TO REFERENCE MARK 3 ON THE LEFT.  STATION MARKS ARE STANDARD DISKS STAMPED GREYERS 1974.  THE SURFACE DISK IS SET IN THE TOP OF A 12-INCH CYLINDRICAL CONCRETE MONUMENT THAT IS FLUSH WITH THE GROUND SURFACE.  IT IS 22 FEET SOUTHEAST OF THE CENTER OF THE PAVED ROAD, 3 FEET WEST OF A METAL WITNESS POST AND 2 FEET NORTHWEST OF A FENCE.  THE UNDERGROUND DISK IS SET IN THE TOP OF AN IRREGULAR MASS OF CONCRETE 42 INCHES BELOW THE GROUND SURFACE.  REFERENCE MARK 1, A STANDARD DISK STAMPED GREYERS NO 1 1974, IS SET IN THE TOP OF A 12-INCH CYLINDRICAL CONCRETE MONUMENT THAT IS FLUSH WITH THE GROUND SURFACE.  IT IS 25 FEET SOUTHEAST OF THE CENTER OF THE PAVED ROAD AND 1 FOOT NORTHWEST OF THE FENCE.  REFERENCE MARK 2, A STANDARD DISK STAMPED GREYERS NO 2 1974, IS SET IN THE TOP OF A 12-INCH CYLINDRICAL CONCRETE MONUMENT THAT IS FLUSH WITH THE GROUND SURFACE.  IT IS 21 FEET NORTHWEST OF THE CENTER OF THE PAVED ROAD AND 2 FEET SOUTHEAST OF THE EDGE OF A CULTIVATED FIELD.  REFERENCE MARK 3, A STANDARD DISK STAMPED GREYERS NO 3 1974, IS SET IN THE TOP OF A 12-INCH CYLINDRICAL CONCRETE MONUMENT THAT PROJECTS 2 INCHES ABOVE THE GROUND SURFACE.  IT IS 25 FEET SOUTHEAST OF THE CENTER OF THE PAVED ROAD, 4.2 FEET SOUTHWEST OF A METAL WITNESS POST AND 2 FEET NORTHWEST OF A FENCE.  THE MARK SERVES AS AN AZIMUTH MARK.                            STATION RECOVERY (1976)  RECOVERY NOTE BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 1976 (CLN) THE STATION AND ALL MARKS WERE RECOVERED AND FOUND IN GOOD CONDITION AS DESCRIBED IN THE 1974 DESCRIPTION.  THE DISTANCE AND DIRECTION TO ALL MARKS CHECKED THE 1974 OBSERVATIONS.  THE MARYLAND-DELAWARE BOUNDARY MONUMENT NUMBER 3 WAS ESTABLISHED AT THIS DATE.  THE SURFACE MARK IS A MARYLAND-DELAWARE BOUNDARY DISK STAMPED E-W NO. 3 1976, SET IN THE TOP OF A 10-INCH ROUND CONCRETE MONUMENT PROJECTING 8-INCHES.  THE SUB-SURFACE MARKER IS A STANDARD NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY TRIANGULATION STATION DISK STAMPED E-W NO. 3 1976, SET IN A 12-INCH MASS OF CONCRETE 42-INCHES BELOW THE SURFACE.  THEY ARE 145 FEET SOUTHWEST OF A GAP IN A NORTHEAST-SOUTHWEST FENCE LINE, 24 FEET SOUTHEAST OF THE CENTER OF THE ROAD, 2 FEET NORTHWEST OF THE FENCE, AND 1.3 FEET NORTHWEST OF A WITNESS POST.  AIRLINE DISTANCE AND DIRECTION FROM NEAREST TOWN 1-1/2 MILES SOUTH OF WILLIAMSVILLE.                            STATION RECOVERY (2008)  RECOVERY NOTE BY GEOCACHING 2008 (EK) RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION.                            STATION RECOVERY (2012)  RECOVERY NOTE BY DELAWARE COASTAL PROGRAM 2012 RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION.

markers.description: BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1942 (GWL) THE STATION IS LOCATED IN THE SCHOOLHOUSE YARD (SW CORNER) IN THE VILLAGE OF GUMBORO.  IT IS 87 FEET W OF THE SW CORNER OF THE SCHOOL BUILDING, 72 FEET E OF TELEPHONE POLE NO.136.  IT IS STAMPED GUMBORO 1942 AND IS FLUSH WITH THE SURFACE OF THE GROUND.  SURFACE, UNDERGROUND, AND REFERENCE MARK NO.2 ARE STANDARD BRONZE DISKS SET IN CONCRETE, AS DESCRIBED.  REFERENCE MARK NO.1 IS N OF THE STATION.  IT IS A STANDARD DISK SET IN A DRILL HOLE IN A 3- BY 3-FOOT CONCRETE BASE OF THE SCHOOLHOUSE FLAGPOLE.  IT IS STAMPED GUMBORO NO.1 1942.  REFERENCE MARK NO.2 IS SE OF THE STATION.  IT IS 1 FOOT N OF A FENCE LINE, 88.5 FEET S OF THE SE CORNER OF THE SCHOOL BUILDING AND IS STAMPED GUMBORO NO.2 1942, PROJECTS 4 INCHES.  THE AZIMUTH MARK IS 0.4 MILE S OF THE STATION.  IT IS 21 FEET W OF THE CENTER OF STATE HIGHWAY 26.  IT IS A STANDARD DISK SET IN THE E END OF A CONCRETE ABUTMENT 8 INCHES WIDE AND 5 FEET LONG AND IS STAMPED GUMBORO 1942.  A 116-FOOT TOWER IS NEEDED TO SEE A 103-FOOT LIGHT AT MORRIS 1932.  A 90-FOOT TOWER IS NEEDED TO SEE A 126-FOOT LIGHT AT BERLIN 1932.                            STATION RECOVERY (1943)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1943 AT GUMBORO. AT GUMBORO, SUSSEX COUNTY, ON STATE HIGHWAY 26, AT THE BRICK SCHOOL, IN THE SOUTHWEST CORNER OF THE LAWN, 87.6 FEET SOUTHWEST OF THE SOUTHWEST CORNER OF THE BUILDING, AND 52.3 FEET EAST OF THE CENTERLINE OF THE HIGHWAY.  A STANDARD TRIANGULATION-STATION DISK, STAMPED GUMBORO 1942 AND SET IN THE TOP OF A CONCRETE POST ABOUT FLUSH WITH THE GROUND.                            STATION RECOVERY (1965)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1965 (JCB) STATION AND REFERENCE MARKS WERE RECOVERED AS DESCRIBED AND FOUND TO BE IN GOOD CONDITION.  THE AZIMUTH MARK WAS NOT RECOVERED AND IT IS BELIEVED THAT THE MARK WAS DESTROYED BY HIGHWAY IMPROVEMENTS AS EVEN THE CONCRETE ABUTMENT WAS NOT RECOVERED.                            STATION RECOVERY (1981)  RECOVERY NOTE BY UNIVERSITY OF DELAWARE 1981 RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION.                            STATION RECOVERY (2013)  RECOVERY NOTE BY DELAWARE COASTAL PROGRAM 2013 RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION.

DISK IS SET IN A CONCRETE POST APPROXIMATELY FLUSH WITH THE GROUND. IT IS LOCATED BETWEEN A RAILROAD RIGHT OF WAY TO THE NORTHWEST AND A TWO-STORY FRAME HOUSE TO THE SOUTHEAST. IT IS DIAGONALLY ACROSS THE INTERSECTION OF TRACK AND ROAD FROM MAGGIE S DELI AND SEVERAL OTHER BUSINESSES.  THE STATION BUILDING MENTIONED IN THE 1962 DESCRIPTION WAS NOT OBSERVED.  MEASUREMENTS IN THE DESCRIPTION WERE NOT CONFIRMED BUT APPEAR ACCURATE EXCEPT FOR THE DISTANCE OF 56 YARDS FROM THE STATION BUILDING. THIS ALMOST CERTAINLY SHOULD BE 56 FEET, BUT IN ANY EVENT THE STATION IS NO LONGER THERE.  THE CLOSEST POINT OF THE RAIL, AND THE PLACE APPARENTLY MEASURED TO, IS NEAR WHERE AN SIDE TRACK SWITCH WAS ONCE LOCATED. (SOME OF THE SIDE TRACK IS STILL IN PLACE.)  THE IRON FENCE MENTIONED IN THE 1981 RECOVERY REPORT WAS NOT OBSERVED, NOR WAS THE WOODEN WITNESS POST MENTIONED IN THE 1962 DESCRIPTION.  STATION DISK IS APPROXIMATELY 54.8 FEET WEST OF POWER POLE 58690 07154. STATION RECOVERY (2013)  RECOVERY NOTE BY DELAWARE COASTAL PROGRAM 2013 (ARD) RECOVERED AS DESCRIBED BY ALAN R DRAGOO MASER CONSULTING.

THE STATION IS  A BRASS DISK SET IN THE TOP OF A 1 FOOT (30 CM) DIAMETER CONCRETE POST.   THE STATION IS LOCATED 34.2 FEET (10.42 M) WEST OF THE CENTERLINE OF THE SOUTHBOUND LANES  OF US HIGHWAY 113 (DUPONT BOULEVARD), 26.4 FEET SOUTH OF AN ORANGE FIBERGLASS WITNESS  POST, AND 32.8 FEET (10.0 M) SOUTH-SOUTHEAST FROM A 10 INCH (25 CM) HOLLY  WITH A PAINT BLAZE  AND A STATE FOREST BOUNDARY SIGN ON IT. markers.description: BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 1974 (LAL) NO MEASUREMENTS BETWEEN THE RMS DUE TO HEAVY BRUSH ON LINE.  THE STATION IS LOCATED ABOUT 5 MILES EAST OF SELBYVILLE, 4.5 MILES WEST OF FENWICK ISLAND, 3 MILES EAST-NORTHEAST OF BISHOPVILLE, 0.7 MILE SOUTH-SOUTHWEST OF WILLIAMSVILLE AND ON LAND OWNED BY MR. RALLIE HALL, SELBYVILLE, DELAWARE, TELEPHONE NUMBER 436-8808.  MR. HALL LIVES IN THE HOUSE TRAILER ACROSS THE ROAD FROM THE STATION.  TO REACH THE STATION FROM BOYDS STORE IN WILLIAMSVILLE, GO SOUTHERLY ON A PAVED ROAD FOR 0.6 MILE TO A SIDE ROAD LEFT.  TURN LEFT AND GO EAST ON A PAVED ROAD FOR 0.05 MILE TO AN OPENING IN A FENCE ON THE RIGHT.  TURN RIGHT AND GO SOUTHERLY ACROSS AN OPEN FIELD FOR 0.05 MILE TO A FENCE CORNER AND THE STATION.  STATION MARK, A STANDARD DISK STAMPED HALL 1974, IS SET IN THE TOP OF A 12-INCH CYLINDRICAL CONCRETE MONUMENT THAT IS 18 INCHES BELOW THE GROUND SURFACE.  IT IS 33 FEET NORTH OF A FENCE, 32 FEET NORTHWEST OF A 12-INCH OAK TREE, 28 FEET EAST OF A FENCE AND 24 FEET NORTHEAST OF A 7-INCH PINE TREE.  NO UNDERGROUND DISK WAS ESTABLISHED AT THIS STATION.  REFERENCE MARK 1, A STANDARD DISK STAMPED HALL NO 1 1974, IS SET IN THE TOP OF A 12-INCH CYLINDRICAL CONCRETE MONUMENT THAT PROJECTS 2 INCHES ABOVE THE GROUND SURFACE.  IT IS 21 FEET WEST-NORTHWEST OF A 16-INCH TREE, 1.6 FEET NORTHEAST OF A METAL WITNESS POST AND 1.5 FEET NORTH OF A FENCE.  REFERENCE MARK 2, A STANDARD DISK STAMPED HALL NO 2 1974, IS SET IN THE TOP OF A 12-INCH CYLINDRICAL CONCRETE MONUMENT THAT PROJECTS 2 INCHES ABOVE THE GROUND SURFACE.  IT IS 4 FEET EAST OF A 12-INCH PINE TREE, 2.4 FEET SOUTH OF A METAL WITNESS POST AND 1 FOOT EAST-SOUTHEAST OF A FENCE.  REFERENCE MARK 3, A STANDARD DISK STAMPED HALL NO 3 1974, IS SET IN THE TOP OF A 12-INCH CYLINDRICAL CONCRETE MONUMENT THAT IS FLUSH WITH THE GROUND SURFACE.  IT IS 53 FEET NORTHWEST OF THE NORTHWEST CORNER OF A TIN SHED, 2.5 FEET SOUTHWEST OF A FENCE AND 2 FEET WEST-SOUTHWEST OF A METAL WITNESS POST.  THE MARK SERVES AS AN AZIMUTH MARK.  BOUNDARY MONUMENT NUMBER 5, A 6 BY 12 INCH GRANITE MONUMENT WITH A CHISELED CROSS IN THE TOP AND PROJECTS 2.4 FEET ABOVE THE GROUND SURFACE.  IT IS 14 FEET EAST OF AN 18-INCH OAK TREE AND 10 FEET SOUTHWEST OF THE FENCE CORNER.  TO REACH REFERENCE MARK 3 FROM THE OPENING IN THE FENCE, GO EAST ON THE PAVED ROAD FOR 0.05 MILE TO A DRIVEWAY ON THE LEFT.  TURN LEFT AND GO NORTH ON THE DRIVEWAY FOR 0.05 MILE TO A FENCELINE, TURN RIGHT AND GO EAST FOR 0.1 MILE TO THE MARK ON THE LEFT.  HEIGHT OF LIGHT ABOVE STATION MARK 35.0 METERS.  AIRLINE DISTANCE AND DIRECTION FROM NEAREST TOWN 3 MILES EAST-NORTHEAST OF BISHOPVILLE. markers.description: BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1933 (GLA) THIS STATION IS ON THE W BANK OF THE DELAWARE RIVER, ABOUT 3750 FEET SW OF GAMBLES CUT AND ABOUT 8000 FEET N OF THE MOUTH OF RED LION CREEK.  IT IS AT THE END OF A SMALL INLET ABOUT 300 FEET FROM THE WATER LINE OF THE RIVER.  THE STATION IS MARKED BY A 1 1/4-INCH IRON PIPE 6 FEET LONG DRIVEN IN GROUND.  ABOVE THE STATION IS ERECTED A 60-FOOT SQUARE SKELETON STEEL TOWER WITH THE BASE ANCHORED IN CONCRETE.  FASTENED TO THE UPPER SECTIONS OF THE TOWER IS A WOODEN LATTICEWORK TARGET 20 FEET HIGH. (U.S.E.)                            STATION RECOVERY (1975)  RECOVERY NOTE BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 1975 (RST) THE STATION WAS RECOVERED.  THE TOWER ABOVE THE STATION NEEDS MAINTENANCE.  DUE TO ITS LOCATION ON THE RIVER, THE STATION IS A GOOD POINT FROM WHICH TO OBSERVE ALTHOUGH AN OFFSET MAY BE NEEDED.  TO REACH THE STATION BY LAND, GO APPROXIMATELY TWO MILES SOUTH OF NEW CASTLE, DELAWARE ON ROUTE 9 TO THE DELAWARE STATE RIFLE RANGE, A MILITARY RESERVATION MAINTAINED BY THE DELAWARE NATIONAL GUARD.  STOP AT THE GATE AND OBTAIN DIRECTIONS TO THE TOWER AS THE ACCESS ROADS ARE ACROSS A DISPOSAL AREA.  THE ROAD CHANGES.  BEFORE APPROACHING BY BOAT, MAKE ARRANGEMENTS WITH THE AUTHORITIES.  TOWER IS ON LINE WITH FIRING RANGE.                            STATION RECOVERY (1980)  RECOVERY NOTE BY LOCAL ENGINEER (INDIVIDUAL OR FIRM) 1980 (WW) RECOVERED BY VANDEMARK LYNCH INC.  HAMBURG-(U.S.E.) GOOD-STATION ADEQUATELY DESCRIBED. markers.description: BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1933 (GLA) THIS STATION IS AT CHRISTIANA, A SMALL TOWN ABOUT 6 MILES W OF NEW CASTLE.  SURFACE, UNDERGROUND, AND REFERENCE MARKS ARE STANDARD BRONZE DISKS SET IN CONCRETE AS DESCRIBED IN NOTES 1B, 7A, AND 11B.  REFERENCE MARK NO.1 IS N BY E OF THE STATION, 3 FEET S OF FENCE LINE ON THE N SIDE OF THE LOT, ABOUT 75 FEET S OF A BROWN BUILDING, 100 FEET E OF THE MACADAM ROAD AND PROJECTS 4 INCHES.  REFERENCE MARK NO.2 IS E OF THE STATION, 2 FEET N OF THE FENCE LINE ON S SIDE OF THE LOT, AND PROJECTS 4 INCHES.  TO REACH GO N FROM THE FIRE HOUSE ABOUT 0.2 MILE.  THE MARK IS IN THE SW CORNER OF A FENCED LOT, 34 FEET NE OF THE INTERSECTION OF MACADAM ROAD LEADING N AND A LANE LEADING E, 68 FEET E OF THE CENTER OF THE UNION AMERICAN METHODIST CHURCH, 1897, WHICH IS A BRICK BUILDING ON W SIDE OF THE MACADAM ROAD, 26 FEET N OF THE CENTER LINE OF THE LANE AND 13 FEET NE OF THE SW CORNER OF THE LOT.  THE MARK PROJECTS 3 INCHES.  A 77-FOOT TOWER WAS ERECTED.  A BASE WAS MEASURED AND THE NECESSARY ANGLES OBSERVED TO LOCATE CHRISTIANA.  THE LINE CHRISTIANA-HANCE IS NOT VISIBLE FROM THE GROUND.                            STATION RECOVERY (1941)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1941 (LGS) THE ORIGINAL DESCRIPTION OF THIS STATION IS ENTIRELY ADEQUATE.  THERE HAVE BEEN NO CHANGES THAT WILL ALTER ANY OF THE FACTS.  THE PROPERTY ON WHICH THIS STATION IS LOCATED NOW BELONGS TO MR. ALBERT MUNSON OF CHRISTIANA.  MR. MUNSON IS BUILDING A HOUSE ON THIS PROPERTY BUT THE CONSTRUCTION WILL IN NO WAY INTERFERE WITH THE STATION OR THE REFERENCE MARKS.                            STATION RECOVERY (1958)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1958 (JCE) STATION MARK AND REFERENCE MARK NO. 2 WAS RECOVERED AS DESCRIBED AND FOUND IN GOOD CONDITION.  A SEARCH WAS MADE FOR REFERENCE MARK NO. 1, BUT WAS NOT FOUND AND IS BELIEVED TO BE DESTROYED.  THEREFORE REFERENCE MARK NO. 3 WAS ESTABLISHED.  DUE TO CHANGES IN ROAD NUMBERS AND LAND MARKS, A NEW DESCRIPTION FOLLOWS--  STATION IS LOCATED IN THE SMALL VILLAGE OF ABOUT 6 MILES WEST OF NEW CASTLE.  STATION IS 25 FEET NORTH OF APPROXIMATE CENTERLINE OF BAYARD STREET, 33 FEET EAST OF APPROXIMATE CENTERLINE OF STATE HIGHWAY NO. 7 (OLD BALTIMORE PIKE) AND 19 FEET EASTNORTHEAST OF A POWERLINE POLE. REFERENCE MARK NO. 2 IS 12 FEET NORTH OF APPROXIMATE CENTERLINE OF BAYARD STREET AND 9 FEET WEST OF APPROXIMATE CENTERLINE OF DRIVEWAY.  THE MARK IS A STANDARD REFERENCE MARK DISK SET IN A 12 INCH CONCRETE CYLINDER, FLUSH WITH THE GROUND AND THE DISK IS STAMPED HANCE NO 2 1933.  NOTE--11B.  REFERENCE MARK NO. 3 IS 18-1/2 FEET EAST OF APPROXIMATE CENTERLINE OF STATE HIGHWAY NO. 7 (OLD BALTIMORE PIKE) AND 4-1/2 FEET SOUTH OF A POWERLINE POLE.  THE MARK IS A STANDARD REFERENCE MARK DISK SET IN A 12X12 INCH CONCRETE MONUMENT, FLUSH WITH THE SURFACE OF GROUND AND THE DISK IS STAMPED HANCE NO 3 1933.  NOTE--11A.  NO SUITABLE PLACE WAS FOUND TO ESTABLISH AN AZIMUTH MARK.  TO REACH FROM THE TRAFFIC SIGNAL AT THE JUNCTION OF STATE HIGHWAYS NO. 7 AND 273 IN THE VILLAGE OF CHRISTIANA, GO NORTHERLY ON STATE HIGHWAY NO. 7 FOR 0.2 MILE TO BAYARD STREET RIGHT AND STATION AS DESCRIBED. markers.description: BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1962 (RWT) STATION IS LOCATED ABOUT 7-1/2 MILES SOUTH OF REHOBOTH BEACH, 4-3/4 MILES NORTH OF BETHANY BEACH AND AT INDIAN RIVER INLET ON THE SOUTH SIDE OF THE INLET UNDER A POWER LINE HIGH TENSION TOWER CROSSING THE INLET.  PROPERTY OWNER UNKNOWN BELIEVED TO BE STATE PROPERTY.  TO REACH THE STATION FROM THE JUNCTION OF STATE HIGHWAYS 14 AND 26 AT BETHANY BEACH, GO NORTHERLY ON STATE HIGHWAY 14 FOR 4.45 MILE TO THE END OF GUARD RAIL AT THE END OF THE SOUTH END OF THE BRIDGE OVER THE INDIAN RIVER INLET, TURN LEFT AND GO NORTHWEST FOR 0.05 MILE TO THE HIGH TENSION TOWER AT THE SOUTH PART OF THE INLET.  STATION IS A STANDARD DISK SET IN THE TOP OF A 12 X 12 INCH CONCRETE MONUMENT WHICH PROJECTS ABOUT 8 INCHES ABOVE THE SURFACE OF THE GROUND, STAMPED HAPPY 1962.  IT IS 87 PACES SOUTHWEST OF THE SOUTHWEST END OF THE BRIDGE OVER THE INDIAN RIVER INLET, 28.3 FEET SOUTHEAST OF THE NORTHWEST LEG OF THE HIGH TENSION TOWER, 26.7 FEET SOUTHWEST OF THE NORTHEAST LEG OF THE HIGH TENSION TOWER, 17.6 FEET NORTHEAST OF THE SOUTHWEST LEG OF THE HIGH TENSION TOWER, 15.1 FEET NORTHWEST OF THE SOUTHEAST LEG OF THE HIGH TENSION TOWER AND 4.4 FEET SOUTHWEST OF A STANDARD METAL WITNESS POST AND MARKER.  BM S27 (RM1) IS A STANDARD BENCH MARK DISK SET IN A DRILL HOLE IN THE TOP OF A CONCRETE FOUNDATION WHICH PROJECTS ABOUT 30 INCHES ABOVE THE SURFACE OF THE GROUND, STAMPED S 27 1962.  IT IS 25.8 FEET NORTHEAST OF A STANDARD METAL WITNESS POST AND MARKER AND 2.9 FEET NORTHEAST OF THE HIGH TENSION TOWER LEG.  REFERENCE MARK 2 IS A STANDARD DISK SET IN A DRILL HOLE IN THE NORTHEAST CORNER OF THE NORTHWEST LEG OF HIGH TENSION TOWER FOUNDATION WHICH PROJECTS ABOUT 30 INCHES ABOVE THE SURFACE OF THE GROUND, STAMPED HAPPY NO 2 1962.  IT IS 29.5 FEET NORTHWEST OF A STANDARD METAL WITNESS POST AND MARKER AND 2.1 FEET NORTH-NORTHEAST OF THE NORTHWEST LEG OF HIGH TENSION TOWER.  HEIGHT OF LIGHT ABOVE STATION MARK 1 METER.                            STATION RECOVERY (1966)  RECOVERY NOTE BY LOCAL ENGINEER (INDIVIDUAL OR FIRM) 1966 (RTF) RECOVERED BY BE BEAVIN CO.  STATION AND REFERENCE MARKS FOUND IN GOOD CONDITION.  BETHANY BEACH WATER TANK IS VISIBLE FROM THE GROUND.                            STATION RECOVERY (1975)  RECOVERY NOTE BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 1975 (EAB) STATION MARK WAS RECOVERED AND IT WAS FOUND TO BE IN GOOD CONDITION.  IT IS NOW 10 INCHES BELOW THE GROUND LEVEL.  REFERENCE MARK NO 1 WAS BENCH MARK S 27 AND REFERENCE MARK NO 2 WERE RECOVERED AND THEY WERE FOUND TO BE IN GOOD CONDITION AS THEY ARE DESCRIBED IN THE 1962 DESCRIPTION.  AIRLINE DISTANCE AND DIRECTION FROM NEAREST TOWN 4.5 MILES NORTH OF BETHANY BEACH.                            STATION RECOVERY (1980)  RECOVERY NOTE BY LOCAL ENGINEER (INDIVIDUAL OR FIRM) 1980 (WW) RECOVERED BY VANDEMARK LYNCH INC.  HAPPY 1962 GOOD  BMS 27-RM 1 GOOD  HAPPY-NO. 2 1962 GOOD  STATION AND REFERENCE MARKS ADEQUATELY DESCRIBED

OWNERSHIP--ROAD RIGHT-OF-WAY.  TO REACH FROM EXIT 10 ALONG INTERSTATE HIGHWAY 95 WHERE HARVEY ROAD CROSSES OVER HIGHWAY 95, GO SOUTHWEST ON INTERSTATE HIGHWAY 95 FOR 0.8 KM (0.50 MI) TO THE STATION ON THE RIGHT. THE SUB-SURFACE DISK IS IDENTICAL TO THE SURFACE DISK, IT IS SET IN A MASS OF CEMENT 1.0 METER (3.3 FT) BELOW THE SURFACE.  THEY ARE 8.4 METERS (27.6 FT) NORTHWEST FROM THE CENTER OF THE SOUTH BOUND LANE OF INTERSTATE HIGHWAY 95, 1.3 METERS (4.3 FT) NORTHWEST FROM A GUARD RAIL, 29.6 METERS (97.1 FT) SOUTHWEST FROM THE NORTHEAST END OF THE GUARD RAIL AND 0.5 METER (1.6 FT) NORTHEAST FROM THE CARSONITE WITNESS POST.  TO REACH THE AZIMUTH MARK FROM THE STATION, GO SOUTHWEST ON INTERSTATE HIGHWAY 95 FOR 08 KM (4.95 MI) TO THE MARK ON THE RIGHT.
