markers.description: BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1932 (CDM) STATION IS ABOUT 9 MILES SW OF LEWES ON THE GROUND OF THE PUBLIC SCHOOL AT HARBESON, ALSO ABOUT 6 MILES NE OF GEORGETOWN.  SURFACE, UNDERGROUND, AND REFERENCE MARKS ARE STANDARD BRONZE DISKS SET IN CONCRETE.  REFERENCE MARK NO.1 IS ENE OF STATION.  0.25 MILE E OF INTERSECTION OF PAVED HIGHWAYS.  9 METERS NNW OF CENTER LINE OF E AND W CONCRETE HIGHWAY.  25 METERS SSW OF HOUSE.  15 METERS SW OF 36-INCH GUM TREE.  REFERENCE MARK NO.2 IS SE OF STATION, 12 INCHES ON N SIDE OF E AND W FENCE LINE WHICH DIVIDES SCHOOL GROUNDS ON N AND FIELD ON S.  REFERENCE MARK NO.3 IS SSW OF STATION AT NW CORNER OF FIELD IN OLD E AND W FENCE LINE WHICH DIVIDES SCHOOL GROUNDS ON N AND FIELD ON S.  REACHED FROM GEORGETOWN BY TAKING PAVED ROAD LEADING TO LEWES, TO THE VILLAGE OF HARBESON WHICH IS AT A CROSSROADS.  TAKE PAVED HIGHWAY FROM THIS CROSSROADS S A FEW HUNDRED FEET TO THE PUBLIC SCHOOL ON W SIDE OF HIGHWAY, TURN W JUST N OF SCHOOL AND FOLLOW DIM ROAD 0.1 MILE TO STATION.  STATION IS IN THE NW CORNER OF SCHOOL GROUNDS, 11.3 METERS S OF POINT WHERE GROUND SLOPES TO WATERS EDGE IN CANAL.  0.1 MILE W OF HIGHWAY.  HEIGHT OF SIGNAL ABOVE STATION MARK - 41 METERS.                            STATION RECOVERY (1943)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1943 (FLG) RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION, EXCEPT FOR THE FOLLOWING DISCREPANCIES --  1.  REFERENCE MARK 2 IS NOW 126.58 FEET OR 38.582 METERS FROM THE STATION.  2.  REFERENCE MARK 3 IS NOW 105.49 FEET OR 32.153 METERS FROM THE STATION.  3.  FROM REFERENCE MARK 2 TO REFERENCE MARK 3, THE DISTANCE IS 169.80 FEET OR 51.755 METERS.  4.  THE PUBLIC SCHOOL IS NOW A COMMUNITY HALL.  5.  THE STATION IS 92.5 METERS WSW OF THE W END OF THE COMMUNITY HALL, AND 4 METERS N OF THE CENTER OF A SMALL ROAD WHICH FOLLOWS THE TREE LINE.  6.  REFERENCE MARK 2 IS 129 DEG 31 MIN 37 SEC FROM STATION MARVEL, INSTEAD OF 129 DEG 29 MIN 55.2 SEC.  7.  REFERENCE MARK 3 IS 223 DEG 09 MIN 47 SEC FROM STATION MARVEL, INSTEAD OF 223 DEG 10 MIN 11.2 SEC.                            STATION RECOVERY (1955)  RECOVERY NOTE BY US GEOLOGICAL SURVEY 1955 STATION DESTROYED.  BETWEEN A FOOT AND A HALF TO TWO FEET OF THE AREA HAVE BEEN BULLDOZED AWAY, UP TO THE FENCE LINE DESCRIBED FOR REFERENCE MARK 2.  REFERENCE MARK 2 APPEARS TO HAVE BEEN STRUCK BY BULLDOZER AND SLIGHTLY TILTED.                            STATION RECOVERY (1955)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1955 (RER) STATION WAS SEARCHED FOR BUT NOT RECOVERED.  ALL REFERENCE MARKS WERE RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION.  POINT WHERE STATION WAS SET IS NOW CEMETERY PROPERTY AND APPEARS TO BEEN GRADED SINCE THE ORIGINAL DESCRIPTION WAS MADE.                            STATION RECOVERY (1962)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1962 (CFO) THE STATION IS IN AREA THAT HAS BEEN GRADED AND LEVELED AND HAS DESTROYED THE SURFACE AND SUB-SURFACE MARK.  THE TWO REFERENCE MARKS WERE RECOVERED AND FOUND TO BE IN GOOD CONDITION.  NO SEARCH WAS MADE FOR R.M. NO.1 (AZIMUTH MARK).  THE STATION CAN BE CONSIDERED LOST.                            STATION RECOVERY (1969)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1969 (JKW) STATION MARK DESTROYED.  R.M.S 2 AND 3 WERE RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION.  THE DISTANCE BETWEEN THE REFERENCE MARKS WAS VERIFIED.  THE ORIGINAL DESCRIPTION PLUS THE RECOVERY NOTES BY F.L.G. IN 1943 AND C.F.O. IN 1962 ARE ADEQUATE WITH THE FOLLOWING ADDITIONS -- THE MARKS ARE LOCATED BEHIND THE HARBESON CHURCH HALL (DELAWARE HIGHWAY 5), ACROSS THE ROAD FROM THE HARBESON METHODIST CHURCH, SOUTHWEST OF A PROMINENT CEMETERY AND IN A FENCE ROW.  R.M. 2 IS 3.5 FEET SOUTHWEST OF THE FIRST 8 INCH PINE IN EASTERLY END OF FENCE ROW.  BOTH MARKS PROJECT 1 FOOT ABOVE THE GROUND.                            STATION RECOVERY (1973)  RECOVERY NOTE BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 1973 (LFS) THE STATION SURFACE DISK AND SUB-SURFACE DISK WAS FOUND TO BE DESTROYED.  THE AZIMUTH MARK WAS SEARCHED FOR BUT NOT FOUND, IT IS BELIEVED DESTROYED.  REFERENCE MARKS TWO AND THREE WERE RECOVERED AND FOUND IN GOOD CONDITION.  A NEW STATION MARK WAS ESTABLISHED BY USING THE DISTANCES AND DIRECTION TO THE REFERENCE MARKS.  A NEW AZIMUTH MARK WAS ESTABLISHED BY OBSERVATIONS ON POLARIS.  THE DISTANCES AND DIRECTIONS I OBTAINED TO THE REFERENCE WERE AS CLOSE AS I COULD GET TO THE OLD MEASUREMENTS AND DIRECTIONS.  A LONGER DISTANCE OF 0.05 FOOT WAS NOTED TO REFERENCE MARK 3 AND A LONGER DISTANCE OF 0.01 FOOT TO REFERENCE MARK 2.  THE 1943 DISTANCES WERE USED AS A CHECK.  THE DIRECTIONS I OBTAINED TO THE REFERENCE MARKS FELL BETWEEN THE 1932 OBSERVATIONS AND THE 1943 OBSERVATIONS.  HOWEVER THE 1932 OBSERVATIONS WERE THE CLOSEST.  A DIFFERENCE OF 1 MINUTE AND 56 SECONDS IN DIRECTION WAS NOTED BETWEEN THE REFERENCE MARKS.  A COMPLETE NEW DESCRIPTION OF THE STATION FOLLOWS.  THE STATION IS LOCATED ABOUT 7 MILES EAST-NORTHEAST OF GEORGETOWN, ABOUT 4-1/2 MILES SOUTH OF MILTON AND IN THE WEST PART OF THE SMALL VILLAGE OF HARBESON.  THE PROPERTY IS OWNED BY THE VILLAGE OF HARBESON.  TO REACH THE STATION FROM THE INTERSECTION OF STATE HIGHWAYS 5 AND 18 IN THE VILLAGE OF HARBESON, GO SOUTH ON STATE HIGHWAY 18 FOR 0.1 MILE TO A CEMETERY ON THE RIGHT.  TURN RIGHT AND GO WEST ON A PAVED ROAD ALONG THE SOUTH SIDE OF THE CEMETERY FOR 0.05 MILE TO THE SOUTHWEST EDGE OF THE CEMETERY.  THE STATION IS LOCATED ABOUT 0.05 MILE WEST OF THIS POINT IN THE SOUTHWEST EDGE OF A FLAT GRASS COVERED FIELD.  THE STATION MARK IS A STANDARD DISK STAMPED HARBESON 1932 1973, SET IN THE TOP OF A 10-INCH ROUND CONCRETE MONUMENT WHICH IS FLUSH WITH THE SURFACE.  IT IS 107 FEET NORTH-NORTHEAST OF A WITNESS POST, 126 FEET NORTH OF A WITNESS POST 75 FEET NORTH OF A WOODED FENCE LINE 35 FEET EAST OF A WOODED AREA.  REFERENCE MARK 2 IS A STANDARD DISK STAMPED HARBESON NO 2 1932, SET IN THE TOP OF A 12-INCH SQUARE CONCRETE MONUMENT PROJECTING 6 INCHES.  IT IS 5 FEET WEST-SOUTHWEST OF THE MOST EASTERLY TREE IN THE WOODED FENCE LINE AND 1.5 FEET EAST-NORTHEAST OF THE WITNESS POST.   REFERENCE MARK 3 IS A STANDARD DISK STAMPED HARBESON NO 3 1932, SET IN THE TOP OF A 12-INCH SQUARE CONCRETE MONUMENT WHICH PROJECTS 6-INCHES.  IT IS 4 FEET SOUTH OF THE WOODED FENCE LINE AND 1.5 FEET NORTHEAST OF THE WITNESS POST.  THE AZIMUTH MARK IS A STANDARD DISK STAMPED HARBESON 1932 NO 4 1973, SET IN THE TOP OF A 10-INCH ROUND CONCRETE MONUMENT WHICH IS FLUSH WITH THE SURFACE.  IT IS 124 FEET NORTH OF THE CENTER LINE OF A PAVED ROAD, 5.0 FEET EAST OF THE EDGE OF A PARKING LOT, 2.5 FEET EAST OF POWERLINE POLE NUMBERED P O AND 1.3 FEET EAST OF A WITNESS POST.  TO REACH THE AZIMUTH MARK FROM THE INTERSECTION OF STATE HIGHWAYS 5 AND 18 IN HARBESON, GO SOUTH ON STATE HIGHWAY 5 FOR 0.3 MILE TO A SIDE ROAD RIGHT.  TURN RIGHT AND GO WEST ON A PAVED ROAD FOR 0.1 MILE TO THE MARK ON THE RIGHT JUST EAST OF A LARGE PARKING LOT.

markers.description: BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1927 (GCM) ABOUT 1-1/2 MILES N OF NAVAL RADIO COMPASS STATION ON CAPE HENLOPEN POINT, AND ON THE SOUTHERN EXTREMITY OF THE BREAKWATER, AT THE NORTHEASTERN ENTRANCE TO HARBOR OF REFUGE, AT MOUTH OF DELAWARE BAY.  A CIRCULAR REINFORCED CONCRETE LIGHTHOUSE, 72 FEET HIGH.  THE FINIAL OF THE LANTERN IS THE POINT OBSERVED ON.  THIS STATION CAN BE OCCUPIED.  HEIGHT OF SIGNAL ABOVE STATION MARK - 72 FEET.                            STATION RECOVERY (1927)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1927 RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION.                            STATION RECOVERY (1945)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1945 (TBR) RECOVERED AS DESCRIBED.  THE NAVAL RADIO COMPASS STATION REFERRED TO IN THE ORIGINAL DESCRIPTION HAS BEEN DISCONTINUED AND DISMANTLED.                            STATION RECOVERY (1961)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1961 (CWM) THE STATION WAS NOT VISITED.  AN AZIMUTH CHECK WAS OBTAINED BETWEEN THIS STATION AND LEWES, PRESBYTERIAN CHURCH SPIRE, 1896 FROM STATION DE VRIES, 1933.                            STATION RECOVERY (1962)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1962 (JKW) STATION RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION.  ACCORDING TO LOCAL COAST GUARD PERSONNEL AND THE 1961 LIGHT LIST, THE LIGHT HAS NOT BEEN REBUILT SINCE 1926.                            STATION RECOVERY (1962)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1962 (RWT) THE STATION WAS RECOVERED AS DESCRIBED AND IN GOOD CONDITION.  THE INTERSECTING POINT WAS THE TOP CENTER.                            STATION RECOVERY (1975)  RECOVERY NOTE BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 1975 (EAB) THIS STATION WAS NOT VISITED BY ME.  AS IT APPEARS FROM SHORE IT IS IN GOOD CONDITION.  AIRLINE DISTANCE AND DIRECTION FROM NEAREST TOWN 3.9 MILES NORTHEAST OF LEWES.                            STATION RECOVERY (1984)  RECOVERY NOTE BY NATIONAL OCEAN SERVICE 1984 THE STATION IS LOCATED ABOUT 1.5 MI N OF NAVAL RADIO COMPASS STATION ON CAPE HENLOPEN POINT, AND ON THE SOUTHERN EXTREMITY OF THE BREAKWATER, AT THE NE ENTRANCE TO HARBOR OF REFUGE, AT THE MOUTH OF THE DELAWARE BAY. TO REACH STATION PROCEED TO AREA MENTIONED ABOVE. THE STATION IS THE CENTER OF A FINIAL OF THE LANTERN ATOP A CIRCULAR REINFORECED CONCRETE LIGHTHOUSE ABOUT 72 FT HIGH. BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1933 (GLA) THIS STATION IS ABOUT 5.5 MILES SSW OF WILMINGTON, 2.2 MILES WNW OF NEW CASTLE AND ON LAND OWNED BY ROBERT CANNING.  SURFACE, UNDERGROUND, AND REFERENCE MARKS ARE STANDARD BRONZE DISKS SET IN CONCRETE AS DESCRIBED IN NOTES 1B, 7A, AND 11B.  REFERENCE MARK NO.1 IS NE OF THE STATION AND PROJECTS 6 INCHES.  REFERENCE MARK NO.2 IS SE OF THE STATION, 29 FEET NE OF THE OAK TREE MENTIONED ABOVE AND PROJECTS 4 INCHES.  TO REACH FROM NEW CASTLE GO W ON HIGHWAY 40 2.2 MILES TO THE JUNCTION WITH HIGHWAY 13.  TURN N ON HIGHWAY 13 AND GO 0.65 MILE AND TURN NW (LEFT) ON CINDER ROAD AT CROSSROADS.  THERE IS A GARAGE ON LEFT OF CINDER ROAD.  PROCEED 0.3 MILE TO ROBERT CANNINGS HOUSE WHICH IS A SMALL WHITE HOUSE WITH A GREEN ROOF. THE MARK IS W OF THIS HOUSE, 140 FEET W OF A BARN WHICH IS JUST SW OF THE HOUSE, 141 FEET NW OF A VERY LARGE LONE OAK TREE, AND 30 FEET FROM A POWER POLE, THERE ARE RUINS OF AN OLD HOUSE 100 FEET NE OF THE STATION, A SMALL HOUSE 100 FEET S AND A HEDGE 25 FEET W.  MARK PROJECTS 3 INCHES.  A 90-FOOT TOWER WAS ERECTED.                            STATION RECOVERY (1941)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1941 (LGS) FOUND AS DESCRIBED IN GOOD CONDITION.  NOTE--NEW CASTLE COUNTY IS BUILDING A NEW AIRFIELD OVER THIS STATION AND THE STATION WILL MORE THAN LIKELY BE LOST.  (SEE DESCRIPTION OF HARE 2 SET TO REPLACE HARE.) THE MARKS WERE LEFT INTACT ON THE CHANCE THAT THE STATION WOULD NOT BE DESTROYED.                            STATION RECOVERY (1948)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1948 (BK) THIS STATION WAS DESTROYED WHEN THE AREA WAS GRADED TO BUILD THE RUNWAYS.

markers.description: BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1958 (JEG) THE STATION MARK WAS RECOVERED AS DESCRIBED AND FOUND IN POOR CONDITION.  THE SURFACE MARK WAS FOUND TO BE LOOSE.  IT WAS REMOVED AND A NEW MARK WAS RESET, HOLDING THE EXACT POSITION OVER THE UNDERGROUND MARK.  REFERENCE MARKS 3 AND 4 WERE NOT RECOVERED, APPARENTLY THEY HAVE BEEN DESTROYED.  REFERENCE MARKS 6 AND 7 WERE ESTABLISHED AT THIS DATE.  AN AZIMUTH MARK WAS ESTABLISHED AT THIS DATE.  A COMPLETE DESCRIPTION FOLLOWS--  THE STATION IS LOCATED ABOUT 6 MILES SOUTHWEST OF THE POST OFFICE IN WILMINGTON, IN FRONT OF THE ADMINISTRATION BUILDING OF THE NEW CASTLE COUNTY-WILMINGTON AIRPORT, IN THE SOUTHWEST PART OF THE LARGE GRASSY AREA IN FRONT OF THE AIRPORT BUILDING AND ABOUT OPPOSITE THE MOTEL EL RANCHO.  THE MARK IS 77 FEET NORTHEAST OF THE CENTER OF THE TRIANGULAR INTERSECTION OF THE DRIVE INTO THE AIRPORT, 44 FEET EAST OF A STORM SEWER AND 40 FEET NORTH OF THE CENTER WEST-BOUND TRAFFIC LANES OF U.S. HIGHWAY 13 AND U.S. HIGHWAY 40.  TO REACH THE AZIMUTH MARK FROM THE STATION.  GO NORTHEAST ON U.S. HIGHWAY 13 AND U.S. HIGHWAY 40 FOR 0.5 MILE TO THE OVERPASS.  TURN SHARP LEFT BACK ONTO U.S. HIGHWAY 13 AND U.S. HIGHWAY 40 AND GO SOUTHWEST FOR 0.1 MILE TO A LARGE GRASSY TRIANGULAR ROAD INTERSECTION, JUST ACROSS FROM THE PETER PAN DINER AND THE AZIMUTH MARK AS DESCRIBED.  THE STATION MARK, A STANDARD DISK STAMPED HARE 2 1941 1956 1958, IS SET IN THE TOP OF A SQUARE CONCRETE MONUMENT WHICH IS FLUSH WITH THE SURFACE OF THE GROUND, AS DESCRIBED IN NOTES 1A, 7A.  REFERENCE MARK NUMBER 6, A STANDARD DISK STAMPED HARE NO 6 1941, IS SET IN THE TOP OF A SQUARE CONCRETE MONUMENT WHICH IS FLUSH WITH THE SURFACE OF THE GROUND.  IT IS 28 FEET NORTH OF A SPEED LIMIT SIGN, 13 FEET EAST OF THE CENTER OF A PAVED STREET AND 1 FOOT EAST OF THE STREET CURBING, AS DESCRIBED IN NOTE 11A.  REFERENCE MARK NUMBER 7, A STANDARD DISK STAMPED HARE 2 1941, IS SET IN THE TOP OF A SQUARE CONCRETE MONUMENT WHICH IS FLUSH WITH THE SURFACE OF THE GROUND.  IT IS 55 FEET NORTH OF THE CENTER OF THE WEST BOUND TRAFFIC LANE OF U.S. HIGHWAY 13 AND U.S. HIGHWAY 40, 26 FEET WEST-NORTHWEST OF THE CENTER OF THE TRIANGULAR INTERSECTION OF THE DRIVE INTO THE AIRPORT AND 21 FEET NORTH OF THE NORTH SIDE OF THE PAVEMENT OF THE HIGHWAY, AS DESCRIBED IN NOTE 11A.  THE AZIMUTH MARK, A STANDARD DISK STAMPED HARE 2 1941 1956 1958 RESET, IS SET IN THE TOP OF A SQUARE CONCRETE MONUMENT WHICH IS FLUSH WITH THE SURFACE OF THE GROUND.  IT IS 150 FEET WEST-SOUTHWEST OF THE PETER PAN DINER, 29 FEET WEST OF LIGHT POLE NUMBER W34, 16 FEET WEST OF THE CENTER OF A PAVED ROAD, 1 FOOT WEST OF A GUARD RAIL POST AND 1 FOOT WEST OF A WHITE WITNESS POST, AS DESCRIBED IN NOTE 16A.                            STATION RECOVERY (1963)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1963 (MJT) THE STATION MARK, REFERENCE MARKS NOS. 6 AND 7, AND THE AZIMUTH MARK WERE RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION.  SEVERAL DISCREPANCIES WERE FOUND IN THE PUBLISHED RECOVERY NOTE OF 1958 AND ALSO BECAUSE OF CULTURAL CHANGES NEW DESCRIPTIONS FOR REFERENCE MARKS NOS. 6 AND 7 AND THE AZIMUTH MARK FOLLOWS--  REFERENCE MARK NO. 6, A STANDARD DISK STAMPED HARE 2 1941, IS SET IN THE TOP OF A SQUARE CONCRETE MONUMENT ABOUT 1 INCH BELOW THE SURFACE OF THE GROUND.  IT IS 55 FEET NORTHWEST OF THE CENTER OF THE WESTBOUND LANE OF U.S. HIGHWAY 13 AND U.S. HIGHWAY 40, 14.0 FEET NORTHEAST OF A FIRE HYDRANT ON THE NORTHWEST CORNER OF INTERSECTION OF U.S. HIGHWAYS NO. 13 AND 40 AND ROAD LEADING TO SKYWAYS MOTEL AND WEST ENTRANCE TO TERMINAL BUILDING OF NEW CASTLE COUNTY AIRPORT, AND 19.9 FEET SOUTH OF SW CORNER OF STORM DRAIN COVER ON WEST EDGE OF ROAD TO TERMINAL BUILDING.  REFERENCE MARK NO. 7, A STANDARD DISK STAMPED HARE 2 NO 7 1941, IS SET IN THE TOP OF A SQUARE CONCRETE MONUMENT WHICH IS FLUSH WITH THE SURFACE OF THE GROUND.  IT IS 77.3 FEET EAST-SOUTHEAST OF THE NORTHEAST CORNER OF WESTERLY BRICK SKYWAYS MOTEL, 13.0 FEET EAST OF THE CENTER OF ROAD TO TERMINAL BUILDING, AND ONE FOOT EAST OF ROAD CURBING.  THE AZIMUTH MARK, A STANDARD DISK STAMPED HARE 2 1941 1956 1958 RESET, IS SET IN THE TOP OF A SQUARE CONCRETE MONUMENT WHICH IS FLUSH WITH THE SURFACE OF THE GROUND.  IT IS 150 FEET WEST-SOUTHWEST OF THE SHERWOOD DINER (FORMERLY PETER PAN DINER), 29.0 FEET WEST OF ALUMINUM LIGHT POLE NUMBER W34, 16.0 FEET WEST OF THE CENTER OF A CONCRETE PAVED ROAD, 1.0 FOOT WEST OF THE SOUTH END POST OF GUARD RAIL, AND ONE FOOT WEST OF WHITE WOOD WITNESS POST.                            STATION RECOVERY (1964)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1964 (RRG) THE STATION, RM 6, RM 7 AND THE AZIMUTH MARK WERE ALL RECOVERED AND IN GOOD CONDITION.  THE STATION IN THE SOUTH ANGLE OF A TRIANGLE FORMED BY ROADS LEADING TO THE ADMINISTRATION BUILDING OF THE WILMINGTON MUNICIPAL AIRPORT, 21 FEET NORTHWEST OF THE NORTHWEST EDGE OF THE SOUTHWEST BOUND LANE OF HIGHWAY U.S. 13 AND 40, 63 FEET NORTHEAST OF THE CENTER LINE OF DRIVEWAY, 43 FEET EAST OF THE EAST CORNER OF A 3 1/2-BY-1 1/2-FOOT CATCH BASIN, SET IN THE TOP OF A CONCRETE POST FLUSH WITH THE GROUND AND STAMPED HARE 2 1941 1956 1958.  REFERENCE MARK NO. 6 IS 82.8 FEET SOUTHWEST OF THE STATION, 35 1/2 FEET NORTHWEST OF THE NORTHWEST EDGE OF THE SOUTHWEST BOUND LANE OF THE HIGHWAYS, 19-1/2 FEET SOUTHWEST OF THE CENTER LINE OF DRIVEWAY, 1 FOOT WEST OF A CURVED CURBING OF AIRPORT DRIVE, SET IN THE TOP OF A CONCRETE POST 3 INCHES UNDERGROUND.  THE DISK IS STAMPED HARE 2 NO 6 1941.  REFERENCE MARK NO. 7 IS 134.7 FEET NORTHWEST OF THE STATION, 13 1/2 FEET EAST OF CENTER LINE OF DRIVEWAY, 1-1/2 FEET EAST OF A CURB, 77-1/2 FEET EAST OF AND ACROSS DRIVEWAY FROM THE EAST CORNER OF MOTEL ROOM NO. 71, SET IN THE TOP OF A CONCRETE POST 2 INCHES UNDERGROUND.  THE DISK IS STAMPED HARE 2 NO 7 1947.  THE AZIMUTH MARK IS LOCATED ABOUT 0.5 MILE NORTHEAST OF THE STATION, ABOUT 0.1 MILE SOUTHWEST ALONG U.S. HIGHWAY 40 AND 13 FROM THE STATE HIGHWAY 41 OVERPASS, AT THE JUNCTION OF A ROAD LEADING NORTH, 3.4 FEET WEST OF THE WEST CURB OF ROAD LEADING NORTH, 27-1/2 FEET WEST OF THE WEST EDGE OF CONCRETE BASE FOR LIGHT POLE NO. W 34, AT THE SOUTH END OF A ROW OF GUARDRAIL POST, 1-1/2 FEET SOUTHEAST OF A WHITE WOODEN WITNESS POST, SET IN THE TOP OF A CONCRETE POST FLUSH WITH THE GROUND.  THE DISK IS STAMPED HARE 2 RESET 1941 1956 1958.                            STATION RECOVERY (1964)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1964 AT WILMINGTON. AT WILMINGTON, AT THE WILMINGTON MUNICIPAL AIRPORT, NEAR THE SOUTH ANGLE OF A TRIANGLE FORMED BY ROADS LEADING TO THE ADMINISTRATION BUILDING, 21 FEET NORTHWEST OF THE NORTHWEST EDGE OF THE SOUTHWEST LANE OF U.S. HIGHWAYS 13 AND 40, 63 FEET NORTHEAST OF THE CENTER LINE OF THE AIRPORT DRIVE, 43 FEET EAST OF THE EAST CORNER OF A 3 1/2-BY-1 1/2 FOOT CATCH BASIN AND SET IN THE TOP OF A CONCRETE POST THAT IS FLUSH WITH THE GROUND.                            STATION RECOVERY (1965)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1965 (JCB) THE STATION, AZIMUTH MARK AND REFERENCE MARKS 6 AND 7 WERE RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION.  THE 1958 RECOVERY NOTE BY J. E. GUTH DOES NOT ADEQUATELY DESCRIBE THE STATION.  A COMPLETE NEW DESCRIPTION FOLLOWS.  THE STATION IS LOCATED ABOUT 6 MILES SOUTHWEST OF THE POST OFFICE IN WILMINGTON, NEAR THE SOUTHWEST CORNER OF A GRASSY PARK IN FRONT OF THE GREATER WILMINGTON AIRPORT AND ACROSS U.S. HIGHWAYS 40 AND 13 FROM THE MOTEL EL RANCHO.  IT IS 63 FEET NORTHEAST OF THE APPROXIMATE CENTERLINE OF THE SOUTH ENTRANCE TO THE AIRPORT, 43 FEET EAST OF THE SOUTHEAST CORNER OF A 2 X 4-FT. STORM DRAIN COVER AND 40-1/2 FEET NORTHWEST OF THE APPROXIMATE CENTERLINE OF THE SOUTHWEST BOUND LANE OF U.S. HIGHWAYS 40 AND 13.  THE MONUMENT IS FLUSH WITH THE GROUND AND THE DISK IS STAMPED HARE 2 1941 1956 1958.  (NOTE 1A, 7A)  REFERENCE MARK NO. 6 IS 53-1/2 FEET NORTHWEST OF THE APPROXIMATE CENTERLINE OF THE SOUTHWEST BOUND LANE OF THE HIGHWAY, 14 FEET NORTHEAST OF A FIRE HYDRANT AND 1 FOOT WEST-SOUTHWEST OF THE CURB ALONG THE SOUTHWEST SIDE OF THE SOUTHWEST ENTRANCE TO THE AIRPORT.  THE MONUMENT IS FLUSH WITH THE GROUND AND THE DISK IS STAMPED HARE 2 NO. 6 1941.  (NOTE 11A)  REFERENCE MARK NO. 7 IS 174 FEET NORTHWEST OF THE SOUTHWEST BOUND TRAFFIC LANE OF THE HIGHWAY, 90 FEET EAST-SOUTHEAST OF THE SOUTHWEST CORNER OF A BRICK MOTEL BUILDING, 77-1/2 FEET EAST-SOUTHEAST OF THE SOUTHEAST CORNER OF THE MOTEL BUILDING AND 1 FOOT EAST OF THE EAST CURB OF THE AIRPORT DRIVEWAY.  THE MONUMENT IS FLUSH WITH THE GROUND AND THE DISK IS STAMPED HARE 2 NO. 7 1941.  (NOTE 11A)  THE AZIMUTH MARK IS 0.5 MILE NORTHEAST OF THE STATION, ON THE SOUTHWEST SIDE OF THE EXIT RAMP OF STATE HIGHWAYS 41 AND 141, 112 FEET NORTH OF ITS ENTRY POINT ON U.S. HIGHWAYS 40 AND 13.  IT IS 3 FEET WEST OF THE CURB OF THE EXIT RAMP, 150 FEET SOUTHWEST OF THE SHERWOOD DINER AND 1 FOOT WEST OF THE END POST OF A GUARD RAIL.  THE MONUMENT IS FLUSH WITH THE GROUND AND THE DISK IS STAMPED HARE 2 1941 1956 RESET 1958.  (NOTE 16A)  THE DISTANCE AND DIRECTION FOR REFERENCE MARK NO. 6 AS GIVEN IN THE 1958 RECOVERY NOTE FITS REFERENCE MARK NO. 7 AND VICE VERSA. RM 6 IS 14.4 FEET NNE OF FIRE HYDRANT.                            STATION RECOVERY (1979)  RECOVERY NOTE BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 1979 RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION.                            STATION RECOVERY (1980)  RECOVERY NOTE BY LOCAL SURVEYOR (INDIVIDUAL OR FIRM) 1980 RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION.                            STATION RECOVERY (1981)  RECOVERY NOTE BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 1981 (DRM) STATION, RMS 6 AND 7 RECOVERED AS DESCRIBED IN GOOD CONDITION. AZIMUTH MARK WAS NOT SEARCHED FOR AT THIS TIME. STATION RECOVERY (1988)  RECOVERY NOTE BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 1988 (AJL) THE STATION WAS RECOVERED AT THIS DATE.  STATION RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION, A COMPLETE DESCRIPTION FOLLOWS.   THE STATION IS LOCATED ABOUT 9.7 KM (6.0 MI) SOUTHWEST OF THE POST OFFICE IN WILMINGTON, 3.2 KM (2.0 MI) WEST-NORTHWEST OF NEW CASTLE, 3.0 KM (1.9 MI) SOUTHWEST OF FARNHURST, IN THE SOUTHWEST CORNER OF A GRASSY PARK IN FRONT OF THE WILMINGON AIRPORT, ANC ACROSS U.S. HIGHWAYS 13 AND 40 FROM THE CROWN MOTEL.  OWNERSHIP--DELAWARE DEPARTMENT OF HIGHWAYS AND TRANSPORTATION RIGHT-OF-WAY.   TO REACH THE STATION FROM THE OVERPASS BRIDGE OF INTERSTATE HIGHWAY 295 OVER U.S.HIGHWAY 13 AT FARNHURST, GO SOUTHWEST FOR 3.0 KM (1.9 MI) ON HIGHWAYS 13 AND 40 TO THE STATION ON THE RIGHT, JUST BEFORE REACHING THE SOUTH ACCESS ROAD LEADING TO THE SKYWAYS MOTEL AND THE GREATER WILMINGTON AIRPORT.   THE STATION IS A STANDARD CGS DISK STAMPED ---HARE 2 1941 1956 1958---, SET INTO THE TOP OF A SQUARE CONCRETE MONUMENT 30 CM ON SIDE RECESSED 5 CM BELOW GROUND.  LOCATED 18.9 METERS (62.0 FT) NORTHEAST FROM THE CENTER OF THE ACCESS ROAD, 13.1 METERS (43.0 FT) EAST FROM THE SOUTHEAST CORNER OF A 60-CM BY 120-CM STORM DRAIN COVER, 6.6 METERS (21.7 FT) EAST-SOUTHEAST FROM A METAL POLE SUPPORTING THE TRAFFIC LIGHTS, 3.5 METERS (11.5 FT) NORTHWEST FROM THE PAVED SHOULDER EDGE OF THE SOUTHWEST BOUND HIGHWAY LANES, AND 0.5 METERS (1.7 FT) SOUTHWEST FROM A FIBERGLASS WITNESS POST. markers.description: BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1909 (ES) THIS STATION IS ON THOMAS HARTS FARM IN A CULTIVATED FIELD.  IT IS NOT FAR FROM THE OLD STATION KNOWN AS BURTONS TRIPOD.  THE FARMHOUSE IS ON THE W SIDE OF THE ROAD RUNNING N FROM LOVE CREEK.  IT MAY BE REACHED BY ROAD FROM LEWES OR BY WATER FROM REHOBOTH.  THE FARM IS SURROUNDED BY WOODS FROM 40 TO 70 FEET HIGH.  THE STATION IS NOT ON THE HIGHEST GROUND BUT ON A RISE A LITTLE N OF THE HIGHEST GROUND AND WAS SO PLACED TO AVOID HIGH WOODS THAT WOULD HAVE BEEN IN LINE TO SOME OF THE OTHER STATIONS.  THERE IS A FARM ROAD LEADING BACK FROM THE HOUSE AND THE STATION IS ON N SIDE OF THIS ROAD, THE REFERENCE MARK BEING ON THE S SIDE.  THE SIGNAL WAS A POLE 87 FEET HIGH SUPPORTED BY TWO SETS OF THREE IRON GUYS--THE WATER BEING 12 FEET BELOW TOP OF POLE AND WAS THE POINT OBSERVED UPON.  WHEN OBSERVATIONS WERE COMPLETED, THE POINT DIRECTLY BELOW THE POINT OBSERVED UPON WAS MARKED WITH A COPPER TRIANGULATION-STATION MARK SET IN CEMENT 2 FEET BELOW SURFACE.  REFERENCE MARK NO.1 IS CEMENT POST WITH BOTTLE TO MARK CENTER AND IS SOUTHEASTERLY.  REFERENCE MARK NO.2 IS CEMENT POST WITH CIRCLE AND NAIL TO MARK CENTER AND IS SOUTHWESTERLY.                            STATION RECOVERY (1934)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1934 (JCT) STATION AND REFERENCE MARK NO.1 RECOVERED IN EXCELLENT CONDITION.  MR. HART STATES THAT REFERENCE MARK NO.2 HAS BEEN DESTROYED.  ORIGINAL DESCRIPTION REVISED TO READ AS FOLLOWS--  LOCATED ON THE FARM OF THOMAS HART BETWEEN LOVE CREEK AND THE MACADAM ROAD RUNNING FROM MILLSBORO TO REHOBOTH BEACH THROUGH ANGOLA, DELAWARE.  THE FARM IS ABOUT 1/3 MILE N OF THE ROAD BRIDGE ACROSS LOVE CREEK, AND IS SURROUNDED BY TALL TREES.  THE STATION IS IN A CULTIVATED FIELD DIRECTLY BEHIND THOMAS HARTS BARN, ON A RISE OF GROUND JUST N OF THE HIGHEST GROUND IN THE VICINITY, AND ON THE N SIDE OF A ROAD LEADING PAST THE FARMHOUSE.  THE MARK IS 26.5 METERS NE FROM THE CENTER LINE OF THE FARM ROAD AND 65.7 METERS E FROM THE CORNER OF THE NEAREST PINE WOODS.  REFERENCE MARK NO.1 IS ON THE S SIDE OF THE FARM ROAD SSE OF THE STATION.  MR. HART CAN POINT OUT THE LOCATION OF THE MARKS.  THE STATION IS A STANDARD DISK SET IN CONCRETE 2 FEET BELOW THE SURFACE OF THE GROUND.                            STATION RECOVERY (1943)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1943 (FLG) REFERENCE MARK 1 WAS FOUND IN GOOD CONDITION.  THE STATION MARK COULD NOT BE FOUND AFTER CONSIDERABLE DIGGING, BUT IT SHOULD NOT BE CLASSIFIED AS LOST.                            STATION RECOVERY (1962)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1962 (JKW) LOST.  NONE OF THE MARKS COULD BE FOUND.  THE SITE IS NOW A CULTIVATED FIELD AND THE MARKS HAVE PROBABLY BEEN DESTROYED BY CULTIVATION.
markers.setting: SET IN TOP OF CONCRETE MONUMENT
markers.stability: MAY HOLD, BUT OF TYPE COMMONLY SUBJECT TOSURFACE MOTION

markers.description: BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1896 (FWP) ABOUT 9 MILES W OF DOVER AND 3 MILES FROM HARTLY, ON THE W SIDE OF ROAD LEADING FROM HARTLY TO KENTON, AND JUST N OF ROAD LEADING TO DOVER PAST THE LOCKWOOD CHAPEL, BEING 383.9 FEET FROM THE NE CORNER OF THE CHAPEL, AND 408.6 FEET FROM THE CENTER OF THE CROSSROADS.  ON LAND BELONGING TO E.R. AND J.R. LENKER, 80.37 FEET FROM E.R. LENKERS S GATEPOST, AND 170.03 FEET FROM SW CORNER OF LENKERS HOUSE.  A SMALL CATALPA TREE IN LINE FENCE ON ROAD IS DISTANT 32.28 FEET FROM THE STATION AND THE NEAR FACE OF A GUM TREE ON LONE FENCE IS 99.8 FEET.  THE FOLLOWING DIRECTIONS WERE OBSERVED AT THE STATION--N CHIMNEY OF JAMES PLEASANTONS HOUSE, 29 DEG 19.1 MIN.  CUPOLA ON LOCKWOOD CHAPEL, 54 DEG 48.0 MIN.  CHIMNEY ON SORTS SCHOOLHOUSE, 110 DEG 08.6 MIN.  N CHIMNEY OF OF J. BERRYS HOUSE, 134 DEG 43.5 MIN.  WALNUT TREE ABOUT 200 YARDS DISTANT, 157 DEG 19.9 MIN. CHIMNEY ON MC DOWELLS HOUSE, 215 DEG 46.9 MIN.  THE UNDERGROUND MARK CONSISTS OF A BLOCK OF MARBLE 6 INCHES SQUARE AND 18 INCHES LONG, BURIED 3 FEET BELOW THE SURFACE OF THE GROUND.  THE SURFACE MARK IS A SIMILAR BLOCK 30 INCHES LONG, SET WITH ITS UPPER FACE EVEN WITH THE SURFACE OF THE GROUND.  BOTH STONES HAVE CROSSLINES TO MARK THE CENTER OF THE STATION AND THE LETTERS U.S.C. AND G.S. CUT INTO THEIR UPPER FACES.                            STATION RECOVERY (1932)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1932 (ERM) UNDERGROUND MARK WAS RECOVERED FROM REFERENCES GIVEN IN ORIGINAL DESCRIPTIONS.  SURFACE MARK WAS TAKEN OUT AND FOUND UNDER SW CORNER OF DWELLING OF OWNER, WHO IS THIRD OWNER OF PROPERTY SINCE ORIGINAL STATION WAS ESTABLISHED.                            STATION RECOVERY (1932)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1932 (CDM) ABOUT 9 MILES W OF DOVER AND 3 MILES FROM HARTLY ON LAND BELONGING TO MR. DAVID BLOOM.  SURFACE MARK TO STATION IS LOST, BUT UNDERGROUND MARK, A MARBLE BLOCK 6 INCHES SQUARE AND 18 INCHES LONG WAS RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION.  UNDERGROUND MARK WAS LEFT INTACT AND A SURFACE MARK, A STANDARD BRONZE DISK SET IN CONCRETE. WAS PLACED DIRECTLY OVER UNDERGROUND MARK AND 12 INCHES BELOW SURFACE OF GROUND TO INSURE ITS SAFETY AS MARK IS IN CULTIVATED FIELD.  ORIGINAL STATION WAS CALLED HARTLY.  THROUGH SOME ERROR, NEW MARK WAS STAMPED HARTLEY AND WAS NEVER CORRECTED. STATION IS IN A CULTIVATED FIELD AT SE EDGE, 15.5 METERS NW OF CENTER LINE OF ROAD, 10.37 METERS W OF 24-INCH CATALPA TREE IN FENCE LINE AT SE EDGE OF FIELD, 13.56 METERS NNW OF SMALL CATALPA TREE IN FENCE LINE AT SE EDGE OF FIELD, 30.2 METERS SW OF 36-INCH GUM TREE IN FENCE LINE AT SE EDGE OF FIELD. ALL MEASUREMENTS TAKEN FROM NAILS IN NEAR FACE OF EACH TREE. THREE NEW REFERENCE MARKS, STANDARD BRONZE DISKS SET IN CONCRETE WERE ESTABLISHED AND STAMPED HARTLEY 1932.  REFERENCE MARK NO.1 IS NNE OF STATION AT W EDGE OF PASTURE, 8 METERS E OF CENTER LINE OF ROAD LEADING PAST STATION, 14 METERS N OF CENTER LINE OF LANE TO FARMYARD.  REFERENCE MARK NO.2 IS NE OF STATION AT NE EDGE OF SAME FIELD IN WHICH STATION IS LOCATED, 12.5 METERS NW OF CENTER LINE OF ROAD.  REFERENCE MARK NO.3 IS SSW OF STATION IN FENCE LINE AT SE EDGE OF FIELD IN WHICH STATION IS LOCATED, 6.7 METERS NW OF CENTER LINE OF ROAD.  FROM DOVER TAKE MAIN PAVED ROAD LEADING W TO MARYDEL, MARYLAND.  FOLLOW THIS ROAD 5.0 MILES TO PEARSON CORNER (SIGNS MARYDEL AND HARTLY), TAKE RIGHT-HAND ROAD TO HARTLY, 2 MILES FROM THIS CORNER TO CROSSROADS, TURN RIGHT AND GO 1 MILE TO CROSSROADS AT LOCKWOOD CHAPEL, CONTINUE STRAIGHT AHEAD 0.1 MILE TO FIRST HOUSE ON RIGHT AND GATE TO FIELD ON LEFT, TURN LEFT THROUGH GATE TO FIELD AND BEAR LEFT TO STATION ABOUT 30 FEET WSW OF GATE.                            STATION RECOVERY (1943)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1943 (RLS) RECOVERED.  DESCRIPTION ADEQUATE EXCEPT FOR THE FOLLOWING DISCREPANCIES--  DELETE PHRASE ALL MEASUREMENTS TAKEN FROM NAILS IN NEAR FACE OF EACH TREE.  WITH REFERENCE TO RM 1, DELETE PASTURE AND INSERT CULTIVATED GROUND.                            STATION RECOVERY (1956)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1956 (HG) REFERENCE MARK NO. 3 IS DESTROYED.  THE DISK WAS REMOVED FROM THE DISTURBED MARK AND FORWARDED TO THIS OFFICE BY MR. HENRY GINGERICH, DOVER DELAWARE, R. 2, BOX 315.  R.M. DISK STAMPED HARTLEY NO 3 1932 RECEIVED AT THIS OFFICE NOVEMBER 1956.

markers.description: BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 1995 (ALG) THE STATION IS 3.0 MI (4.8 KM) EAST OF LEWES DE.  IN THE CAPE HENLOPEN STATE PARK.  NOTIFY PAT COOPER ASST. PARK MNGR. 302-856-5339. TO REACH THE STATION FROM THE POST OFFICE IN LEWES, PROCEED EAST ON FRONT STREET FOR 0.05 MI (0.08 KM) TO SAVANNAH ROAD.  TURN LEFT AND GO NORTHEAST ON SAVANNAH ROAD FOR 0.4 MI (0.6 KM) TO HENLOPEN DRIVE ON THE RIGHT.  TURN RIGHT ON HENLOPEN DRIVE FOR 1.6 MI (2.6 KM) AND A FORK IN THE ROAD AND THE ENTRANCE TO CAPE HENLOPEN STATE PARK.  BEAR RIGHT AND GO SOUTH FOR 1.1 MI (1.8 KM) TO THE STATION ON THE LEFT. THE STATION IS A STAINLESS STEEL ROD DRIVEN TO DEPTH 0F 42.1 FT (12.8 M) WITH A 3.0 FT (0.9 M) GREASED SLEEVE, ENCASED IN A 5 IN PVC PIPE WITH LOGO CAP THAT IS STAMPED---HENLO USCG 1995---.  THE STATION IS 14.5 M (47.6 FT) SOUTH SOUTHEAST OF A NO PARKING SIGN ON THE EAST SIDE OF THE ROAD, 8.05 M (26.41 FT) EAST OF THE EAST EDGE OF THE PAVED ROAD, AND 2.86 M (9.38 FT) WEST OF A WOODEN SAND FENCE WHICH PARALLELS THE ROAD.                            STATION RECOVERY (2000)  RECOVERY NOTE BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 2000 (MLM) THE STATION IS LOCATED ABOUT 4.8 KM (3.00 MI) EAST OF LEWES IN CAPE HENLOPEN STATE PARK.  CONTACT PARK MANAGER BEFORE OCCUPYING THE STATION, PHONE (302) 856-5339.  OWNERSHIP--STATE OF DELAWARE.  TO REACH THE STATION FROM THE TOLL BOOTH OF THE CAPE MAY-LEWES FERRY TERMINAL LOCATED ON US HIGHWAY 9 (HENLOPEN ROAD) ON THE EAST SIDE OF LEWES.  GO EAST ON HENLOPEN ROAD FOR 1.36 KM (0.85 MI) TO A FORK AT THE ENTRANCE TO HENLOPEN STATE PARK, BEAR RIGHT, SOUTH ON THE PARK ROAD FOR 1.8 KM (1.10 MI) TO THE STATION ON THE LEFT.  THE STATION IS AN NGS 3D STATION MARK, A PUNCH MARK ON TOP OF A STAINLESS STEEL ROD IN A GREASE-FILLED SLEEVE, ENCASED IN A 13 CM PVC PIPE WITH AN NGS LOGO CAP FLUSH WITH THE GROUND.  LOCATED 14.5 M (47.6 FT) SOUTH-SOUTHEAST OF A NO PARKING SIGN, 8.05 M (26.41 FT) EAST OF THE EAST EDGE OF THE ROAD, 2.87 M (9.42 FT) WEST OF A WOOD SLAT FENCE AND 0.16 M (0.52 FT) WEST OF A FIBERGLASS WITNESS POST.                            STATION RECOVERY (2008)  RECOVERY NOTE BY GEOCACHING 2008 (EK) NOTE - MARK IS ON EAST SIDE OF DUNE RD.                            STATION RECOVERY (2012)  RECOVERY NOTE BY DELAWARE COASTAL PROGRAM 2012 RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION.

BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1961 (RWT) THE STATION IS LOCATED IN THE CENTER HICKMAN, DELAWARE-MARYLAND, 7.0 MILES SOUTHEAST OF DENTON, MARYLAND, 8.0 MILES NORTHWEST OF GREENWOOD AND ON PROPERTY OWNED BY MR. DRUMMOND.  TO REACH THE STATION FROM THE POST OFFICE IN DENTON, GO SOUTHERLY ON STATE HIGHWAY 404 FOR 5.7 MILES TO THE JUNCTION OF STATE HIGHWAY 16, TURN LEFT, GO EASTERLY ON HIGHWAY 16 FOR 2.4 MILES TO A CROSS ROADS, AT THE SOUTH EDGE OF THE SMALL VILLAGE OF HICKMAN, TURN LEFT AND GO NORTH ON THE MACADAM ROAD FOR 0.25 MILE TO THE CROSS ROADS AND THE STATION LOCATED ON THE RIGHT AS DESCRIBED.  THE STATION MARK IS A STANDARD DISK STAMPED HICKMAN 1961, SET IN TOP OF A SQUARE CONCRETE MONUMENT WHICH IS 12 INCHES BELOW THE GROUND SURFACE.  IT IS 32.0 FEET SOUTH OF A GRAVELED DRIVEWAY, 34.7 FEET NORTH OF A STANDARD METAL WITNESS POST AND MARKER AND 66.0 FEET EAST OF THE APPROXIMATE CENTER OF THE MACADAM ROAD.  REFERENCE MARK 1 IS A STANDARD DISK STAMPED HICKMAN NO 1 1961, SET IN TOP OF A SQUARE CONCRETE MONUMENT WHICH PROJECTS 2 INCHES ABOVE THE GROUND SURFACE.  IT IS 1.0 FOOT NORTH OF AN EAST AND WEST FENCE LINE, 27.0 FEET SOUTH OF THE APPROXIMATE CENTER OF THE GRAVELED DRIVEWAY AND 69.1 FEET EAST OF THE WITNESS POST.  REFERENCE MARK 2 IS A STANDARD DISK STAMPED HICKMAN NO 2 1961, SET IN TOP OF A SQUARE CONCRETE MONUMENT WHICH PROJECTS 1 INCH ABOVE THE GROUND SURFACE.  IT IS 1.0 FOOT WEST OF A NORTH AND SOUTH FENCE LINE, 1.6 FEET NORTH OF A POWERLINE POLE, 15.0 FEET EAST OF THE APPROXIMATE CENTER OF THE MACADAM ROAD AND 51.1 FEET SOUTHWEST OF THE WITNESS POST.  BOUNDARY MONUMENT NO. 26 IS A 12 X 12 INCH LIMESTONE MONUMENT MARKED WITH THE LETTERS M AND P AND PROJECTS ABOUT 24 INCHES ABOVE THE GROUND SURFACE.  THE MONUMENT HAS A U.S. GEOLOGICAL SURVEY DISK CEMENTED IN A DRILL IN THE NORTH TOP EDGE OF THE MONUMENT.  THE MONUMENT HAS BEEN BROKEN OFF AND THE PARTS PLACED BACK TOGETHER AND REINFORCED WITH CONCRETE.  IT IS LOCATED 19.0 FEET WEST OF THE APPROXIMATE CENTER OF THE MACADAM ROAD, 28.6 FEET SOUTHEAST OF A POWERLINE POLE 76-6A AND 71.0 FEET SOUTHEAST OF THE SOUTHEAST CORNER OF THE GENERAL STORE.  TO REACH THE AZIMUTH MARK FROM THE STATION AND CROSSROADS IN HICKMAN, GO WEST ON A GRAVELED ROAD FOR 0.2 MILE TO THE AZIMUTH MARK ON THE LEFT AS DESCRIBED.  THE AZIMUTH MARK IS A STANDARD DISK STAMPED HICKMAN 1961, SET IN TOP OF A SQUARE CONCRETE MONUMENT WHICH PROJECTS 2 INCHES ABOVE THE GROUND SURFACE.  IT IS 2.7 FEET NORTH OF A POWERLINE AND TELEPHONE LINE POLE, 43.7 FEET SOUTH OF A STANDARD METAL WITNESS POST AND MARKER, 61.0 FEET SOUTH OF THE APPROXIMATE CENTER OF THE GRAVELED ROAD AND 91.0 FEET SOUTHWEST OF A 20-INCH LONE PINE TREE.  HEIGHT OF LIGHT ABOVE STATION MARK 30.37 METERS.

markers.description: BY CITY OF LEWES DELAWARE 2005 (AWR) THE STATION IS LOCATED IN LEWES, 1.65 MI (2.66 KM) SOUTH-SOUTHWEST OF THE MAIN POST OFFICE,  2.55 MI (4.10 KM) SOUTHWEST OF THE DELAWARE RIVER AND BAY AUTHORITY FERRY TERMINAL, AND  1.34 MI (2.16 KM) SOUTH-SOUTHWEST OF THE BEEBE MEDICAL CENTER.  THE STATION IS ON SECURE PROPERTY BELONGING TO THE CITY OF LEWES, BOARD OF PUBLIC WORKS.  CALL (302) 645-6547 24  HOURS IN ADVANCE FOR ACCESS.   TO REACH THE STATION FROM THE MAIN POST OFFICE IN LEWES, PROCEED 285 FEET (86.87 M)  SOUTHEAST ON FRONT STREET TO THE INTERSECTION OF SAVANNAH ROAD, THEN PROCEED 0.10 MI  (0.16 KM) SOUTHWEST ON SAVANNAH ROAD TO THE JUNCTION OF KINGS HIGHWAY, THEN PROCEED  1.5 MI (2.41 KM) SOUTH-SOUTHWEST ON KINGS HIGHWAY TO STATION ON RIGHT.   THE STATION IS 44.0 FEET (13.41 M) NORTHWEST OF THE CENTERLINE OF KINGS HIGHWAY, 69.0 FT  (21.03 M) SOUTH OF A RADIO ANTENNA MAST, 31.0 FEET (9.45 M) NORTH OF THE CORNER POST OF A 6  FT (1.8 M) CHAIN LINK FENCE, AND 56.0 FEET (17.07 M) SOUTHWEST OF A PAINTED BLACK BLOW OFF HYDRANT.  THE STATION IS A CENTER PUNCHED BRONZE DISK SET IN A 1 FOOT (30 CM) DIAMETER  CONCRETE POST. markers.description: BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 1974 (LAL) THE STATION IS LOCATED ABOUT 3.5 MILES EAST-NORTHEAST OF BISHOPVILLE, 3.5 MILES WEST OF FENWICK ISLAND, 0.8 MILE SOUTHEAST OF WILLIAMSVILLE, ON ROAD RIGHT-OF-WAY AND NEAR THE MARYLAND-DELAWARE STATE LINE.  TO REACH THE STATION FROM THE JUNCTION OF STATE ROAD 14 AND 54 IN FENWICK ISLAND, GO WEST-NORTHWEST AND SOUTHWEST ON STATE ROAD 54 FOR 4.15 MILES TO A SIDE ROAD LEFT AND THE SOUND METHODIST CHURCH ON THE LEFT.  TURN LEFT AND GO SOUTHEASTERLY ON A PAVED ROAD FOR 0.7 MILE TO A T-ROAD AND A STOP SIGN.  TURN LEFT AND GO SOUTHEASTERLY ON A PAVED ROAD FOR 0.45 MILE TO A SIDE ROAD RIGHT.  TURN RIGHT AND GO SOUTHWESTERLY ON A PAVED ROAD 1.1 MILES TO ROLLIC ROAD, CONTINUE WESTERLY ON PAVED ROAD FOR 0.05 MILE AND THE STATION ON THE LEFT.  CONTINUE WESTERLY ON THE PAVED ROAD FOR 0.3 MILE TO REFERENCE MARK 3 ON THE LEFT.  STATION MARK, A STANDARD DISK STAMPED HUDSON 1974, IS SET IN THE TOP OF A 12-INCH CYLINDRICAL CONCRETE MONUMENT THAT IS FLUSH WITH THE GROUND SURFACE.  IT IS 30.5 FEET SOUTH-SOUTHEAST OF A POWERLINE POLE, 19 FEET SOUTH-SOUTHWEST OF THE CENTER OF THE PAVED ROAD, 1.9 FEET SOUTHWEST OF A 10-INCH OAK TREE AND 1.2 FEET NORTHEAST OF A FENCE CORNER.  NO UNDERGROUND DISK WAS ESTABLISHED.  REFERENCE MARK 1, A STANDARD DISK STAMPED HUDSON NO 1 1974, IS SET IN THE TOP OF A 12-INCH CYLINDRICAL CONCRETE MONUMENT THAT IS FLUSH WITH THE GROUND SURFACE.  IT IS 74 FEET SOUTHEAST OF A POWERLINE POLE WITH TRANSFORMER, 59 FEET NORTHWEST OF THE FENCE CORNER AND 17 FEET SOUTHWEST OF THE CENTER OF THE PAVED ROAD.  REFERENCE MARK 2, A STANDARD DISK STAMPED HUDSON NO 2 1974, IS SET IN THE TOP OF A 12-INCH CYLINDRICAL CONCRETE MONUMENT THAT IS FLUSH WITH THE GROUND SURFACE.  IT IS 40 FEET SOUTHWEST OF THE CENTER OF THE PAVED ROAD, 23 FEET SOUTH-SOUTHWEST OF THE POWERLINE POLE WITH TRANSFORMER AND 1 FOOT NORTHWEST OF THE FENCE.  REFERENCE MARK 3, A STANDARD DISK STAMPED HUDSON NO 3 1974, IS SET IN THE TOP OF A 12-INCH CYLINDRICAL CONCRETE MONUMENT THAT IS FLUSH WITH THE GROUND SURFACE.  IT IS 52 FEET NORTHEAST OF THE NORTHEAST CORNER OF A BARN, 31 FEET WEST OF THE CENTER OF THE PAVED ROAD AND 14 FEET SOUTHWEST OF A POWERLINE POLE NUMBER 20.  THE MARK SERVES AS AN AZIMUTH MARK.  HEIGHT OF LIGHT ABOVE STATION MARK 1.39 METERS.                            STATION RECOVERY (1976)  RECOVERY NOTE BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 1976 (CLN) THE STATION AND ALL MARKS WERE RECOVERED AND FOUND IN GOOD CONDITION AS DESCRIBED IN THE 1974 DESCRIPTION.  THE DISTANCES AND DIRECTIONS TO ALL MARKS CHECKED THE 1974 OBSERVATIONS.  THE MARYLAND-DELAWARE BOUNDARY MONUMENT NUMBER 4 WAS ESTABLISHED AT THIS DATE, SEE DESCRIPTION THEREOF.  AIRLINE DISTANCE AND DIRECTION FROM NEAREST TOWN 3/4 MILE SOUTHEAST OF WILLIAMSVILLE. DID NOT SEARDCH FOR RM 2 ON THIS DATE.                            STATION RECOVERY (2012)  RECOVERY NOTE BY DELAWARE COASTAL PROGRAM 2012 RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION.

markers.description: BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 1974 THE STATION IS LOCATED ABOUT 3-1/2 MILES EAST-NORTHEAST OF BISHOPVILLE, AND ABOUT 3-1/2 MILES WEST OF FENWICK ISLAND.  TO REACH THE STATION FROM THE JUNCTION OF STATE ROAD 14 AND 54 IN FENWICK ISLAND, GO WEST-NORTHWEST AND SOUTHWEST ON STATE ROAD 54 FOR 4.15 MILES TO A SIDE ROAD LEFT AND THE SOUND METHODIST CHURCH ON THE LEFT.  TURN LEFT AND GO SOUTHEASTERLY ON A PAVED ROAD FOR 0.7 MILE TO A T-ROAD AND A STOP SIGN.  TURN LEFT AND GO SOUTHEASTERLY ON A PAVED ROAD FOR 0.45 MILE TO A SIDE ROAD RIGHT.  TURN RIGHT AND GO SOUTHWESTERLY ON A PAVED ROAD 1.1 MILES TO ROLLIC ROAD, CONTINUE WESTERLY ON PAVED ROAD FOR 0.05 MILE TO STATION HUDSON ON THE LEFT.  CONTINUE WESTERLY ON THE PAVED ROAD FOR 0.3 MILE TO REFERENCE MARK 3 ON THE LEFT.  REFERENCE MARK 3, A STANDARD DISK STAMPED HUDSON NO 3 1974, IS SET IN THE TOP OF A 12-INCH CYLINDRICAL CONCRETE MONUMENT THAT IS FLUSH WITH THE GROUND SURFACE.  IT IS 52 FEET NORTHEAST OF THE NORTHEAST CORNER OF A BARN, 31 FEET WEST OF THE CENTER OF THE PAVED ROAD AND 14 FEET SOUTHWEST OF A POWERLINE POLE NUMBER 20.  THE MARK SERVES AS AN AZIMUTH MARK.                            STATION RECOVERY (2008)  RECOVERY NOTE BY GEOCACHING 2008 (EK) RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION.                            STATION RECOVERY (2012)  RECOVERY NOTE BY DELAWARE COASTAL PROGRAM 2012 RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION.

markers.description: BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1956 (EHK) LOCATED ON FENWICK ISLAND, DELAWARE, 1.53 MILES NORTH OF THE MARYLAND-DELAWARE STATE LINE.  MARK IS IN SAND DUNES, ON PROPERTY LEASED BY THE NAVY FROM THE STATE OF DELAWARE.  IT IS 274 FEET EAST OF THE CENTER LINE OF DELAWARE STATE HIGHWAY NO. 14 AND NORMAL THEREOF.  164.6 FEET WEST OF THE SOUTHWEST CORNER OF A GREY SHED WITH RED ROOF.  149.8 FEET SOUTHEAST OF THE SOUTHWEST CORNER OF A 1-1/2 STORY GREEN HOUSE.  STATION MARK IS STANDARD DISK SET IN A CONCRETE MONUMENT 8 INCHES SQUARE AT TOP, PROJECTING 6 INCHES ABOVE SURFACE OF THE GROUND.  FENWICK ISLAND LIGHTHOUSE IS NOT VISIBLE FROM THE MARK.  STATIONS HYDRO, 1956 AND SHORAN, 1956 ARE INTERVISIBLE, AND 1094.29 FEET APART.                            STATION RECOVERY (1962)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1962 (CFO) THE STORM OF MARCH 6 1962 DESTROYED THE SAND DUNES AND THE BUILDING USED FOR THE REFERENCES TO THE STATION.  THIS STATION SHOULD BE CONSIDERED LOST.                            STATION RECOVERY (1966)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1966 (JCB) A THOROUGH SEARCH WAS MADE BUT NO TRACE OF STATION WAS FOUND.  THE HOUSE AND THE SHED USED FOR REFERENCES ARE GONE.  THERE ARE NO SAND DUNES IN THE AREA.  IT APPEARS THAT THE AREA WAS LEVELED OFF WHEN THE FENWICK ISLAND, U.S. NAVY TOWER WAS BUILT ON THE SITE.  THIS TOWER HAS BEEN DISMANTLED AND ALL THAT REMAINS IS THE FOUR CONCRETE BASES OF THE LEGS OF THE TOWER.  A C AND GS BENCH MARK DISK STAMPED K 28 1962 IS CEMENTED FLUSH IN A DRILL HOLE IN THE CONCRETE BASE OF THE SOUTHWEST LEG.  A PLAIN DISK, STAMPED OR 1 FENWICK 1966, IS SET IN THE TOP OF A 4 INCH TILE, PROJECTING ABOUT 10 INCHES, AND IN THE APPROXIMATE CENTER OF THE CONCRETE BASES.  AIRLINE DISTANCE AND DIRECTION FROM NEAREST TOWN 1.5 MILES NORTH OF THE DELAWARE-MARYLAND STATE LINE.

(26.6 M) WEST-NORTHWEST OF A STEEL DRAIN COVER, 82 FT (25.0 M) WEST OF THE SERVICE ROAD, 78.9 FT (24.0 M) NORTHWEST OF THE NORTHWEST CORNER OF THE TRANSFORMER ON THE NORTHEAST SIDE OF THE VORTAC, AND 69.3 FT (21.1 M) NORTHEAST OF THE MOST NORTHWESTERLY OF THE TWO RED AND WHITE STRIPPED POSTS ON THE NORTHWEST SIDE OF THE VORTAC. PROCEED THROUGH THE GATE AND DRIVE STRAIGHT, NORTHWEST FOR 0.1 MI (0.2 KM) TO THE ENTRANCE TO TAXIWAY C, CONTINUE STRAIGHT, NORTHWEST ON TAXIWAY C FOR 0.1 MI (0.2 KM) TO TAXIWAY B, TURN RIGHT, NORTH ON TAXIWAY AND GO 0.3 MI (0.5 KM) TO THE INTERSECTION WITH RUNWAY 9-27, TURN LEFT, WEST-SOUTHWEST ON RUNWAY 9-27 AND GO 0.3 MI (0.5 KM) TO THE VORTAC ACCESS ROAD, TURN LEFT ON ACCESS ROAD AND GO APPROXIMATELY 150 FT (45.7 M) TO STATION ON THE RIGHT.   LOCATED 133.4 FT (40.7 M) SOUTHWEST FROM A STEEL DRAIN COVER, 78.9 FT (24.0 M) NORTHWEST OF THE NORTHWEST CORNER OF THE TRANSFORMER ON THE NORTHEAST SIDE OF THE VORTAC, 63.9 FT (19.5 M) NORTHEAST OF THE MOST NORTHWESTERLY OF TWO RED AND WHITE STRIPPED POSTS ON THE NORTHWEST SIDE OF THE VORTAC, 27.4 M (89.9 FT) NORTH OF THE VORTAC BUILDING, AND 38.4 M (126.0 FT) WEST OF THE ACCESS ROAD. markers.description: BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1934 (JCT) ON THE SE SHORE OF INDIAN RIVER BAY AT THE NE EXTREMITY OF WHITE NECK, ABOUT 1 MILE NW FROM THE MOUTH OF WHITE CREEK.  THE STATION IS SET IN FIRM MARSH GROUND ON A SMALL BUT PROMINENT MARSH AND SAND POINT, ON THE NW SIDE OF WHICH A FEW SMALL PINE TREES ARE GROWING.  AN OLD EARTH FORT, CIRCULAR IN SHAPE AND OVERGROWN WITH TALL TREES, LIES ABOUT 70 METERS S OF THE STATION AT THE N EDGE OF THE HIGHER AND CULTIVATED GROUND.  THE STATION MARK IS ABOUT 11 METERS E OF THE EASTERN EXTREMITY OF THE BARE SAND WHICH EXTENDS ALONG THE NW SIDE OF THE POINT, AND 60 METERS SE FROM THE NE EXTREMITY OF THE POINT.  A LONE 4-FOOT SAND DUNE COVERED WITH SMALL BUSHES LIES ABOUT 27 METERS NW OF THE STATION.  STATION AND REFERENCE MARKS ARE STANDARD BRONZE DISKS IN A TILE,  THE STATION IS BEST REACHED BY WATER.                            STATION RECOVERY (1943)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1943 (FLG) RECOVERED AS DESCRIBED EXCEPT FOR THE FOLLOWING DISCREPANCIES--  STATION INDIAN TO REFERENCE MARK 1 IS 12.698 M. (41.66 FT.).  STATION INDIAN TO REFERENCE MARK 2 IS 9.500 M. (31.16 FT.).  REFERENCE MARK 1 TO REFERENCE MARK 2 IS 14.859 M. (48.75 FT.).                            STATION RECOVERY (1958)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1958 (JAW) STATION WAS RECOVERED AS DESCRIBED WITH CONSIDERABLE DIFFICULTY.  THE STATION MARK IS NOW FLUSH AT THE W EDGE OF THE BRUSHY AREA, 66 PACES N OF A PAIR OF FORKED POLES.  WE PUT AN IRON PIPE AND TWO WOOD STAKES AROUND THE MARK.  R. M. NO 1 WAS NOT RECOVERED.  R. M. NO 2 WAS FOUND 92 FT. SSW OF THE STATION PROJECTING 2 FT.  IT IS BELIEVED THIS MARK IS OUT OF POSITION AS IT WAS LAYING ON ITS SIDE AT ONE TIME AND ITS POSITION DOES NOT CHECK WITH ANYTHING.  REACHED FROM THE JCT. OF ROUTES 14 AND 26 IN BETHANY BEACH AS FOLLOWS--GO W. ON 26 3.5 MILES, TURN RIGHT, N, AT THE JOHN A. BISHOP LUMBER AND BOAT CO. AND GO 1.5 MILES AND TURN LEFT WITH THE BLACKTOP, CONTINUE 0.4 MILES AND TURN RIGHT, N, ON A SAND ROAD.  GO 0.4 MILE TO ROAD FORKS, TAKE RIGHT FORK, NE, GO 0.4 MILE TO A LANE TO A WHITEHOUSE, KEEP RIGHT STRAIGHT AHEAD FOR 0.5 MILE TO A WHITE SHINGLE HOUSE, BEAR LEFT BETWEEN THE CORN CRIB AND GARAGE AND GO 0.2 MILE TO END OF ROAD AT WATERS EDGE AND THE STATION TO THE NNE.  TWO NEW REFERENCE MARKS SHOULD BE ESTABLISHED.  THIS CAN BE DONE FROM STATION WHITE 1934 OR FROM HIGGINS HOUSE WEST CHIMNEY.                            STATION RECOVERY (1959)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1959 (WER) STATION MARK WAS RECOVERED AS DESCRIBED AND FOUND TO BE IN GOOD CONDITION EXCEPT FOR THE FOLLOWING.  IT IS 92 FEET SOUTH OF THE EAST-WEST SHORE LINE AND 92 FEET WEST OF THE NORTH-SOUTH SHORE LINE.  REFERENCE MARK NO. 1 WAS NOT RECOVERED.  REFERENCE MARK NO. 2 WAS DESTROYED.  REFERENCE MARK NO. 3 AND REFERENCE MARK NO. 4 WERE ESTABLISHED.  A NEW DESCRIPTION FOLLOWS.  TO REACH FROM THE JUNCTION OF STATE HIGHWAYS 14 AND 26 IN BETHANY BEACH, GO WEST ON HIGHWAY 26 FOR 3.8 MILES TO A PAVED SIDE ROAD RIGHT.  TURN RIGHT AND GO NORTH ON PAVED ROAD FOR 2 MILES TO A SAND SIDE ROAD RIGHT.  TURN RIGHT ON SAND ROAD AND GO 0.4 MILE TO A FORK.  TAKE RIGHT FORK AND GO 0.4 MILE TO A LANE LEADING TO A WHITE HOUSE.  CONTINUE STRAIGHT AHEAD FOR 0.5 MILE TO A WHITE HOUSE ON THE LEFT.  BEAR LEFT, PASSING BETWEEN CORN CRIB AND SCREENED-IN BUILDING, ON FIELD ROAD FOR 0.1 MILE TO A FORK.  TAKE RIGHT FORK AND GO 0.15 MILE TO END OF ROAD AT SHORE LINE AND STATION.  REFERENCE MARK NO. 3, A STANDARD DISK STAMPED INDIAN NO 3 1934, IS SET IN CONCRETE AT THE CENTER OF A 12-INCH TERRACOTTA PIPE WHICH IS SURROUNDED BY A MASS OF CONCRETE AND PROJECTS 5 INCHES.  IT IS 83 FEET WEST OF THE NORTH-SOUTH SHORE LINE.  REFERENCE MARK NO. 4, A STANDARD DISK STAMPED INDIAN NO 4 1934, IS SET IN CONCRETE AT THE CENTER OF A 12-INCH TERRACOTTA PIPE WHICH IS SURROUNDED BY A MASS OF CONCRETE AND PROJECTS 2 INCHES.  IT IS 55 FEET SOUTH OF THE EAST-WEST SHORE LINE.                            STATION RECOVERY (1961)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1961 (JKW) STATION AND R.M.S 3 AND 4 WERE RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION.  R.M.1 WAS FOUND DESTROYED.  THE STATION WAS STAMPED INDIAN 1934 AND THE R.M.S WERE STAMPED INDIAN NO 3 1934 AND INDIAN NO 4 1934.  THE PREVIOUS RECOVERY NOTE BY W.E.R. IN 1959 IS COMPLETE AND ADEQUATE.                            STATION RECOVERY (1962)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1962 (RWT) THE STATION, REFERENCE MARKS 3 AND 4 WERE RECOVERED AND FOUND TO BE IN GOOD CONDITION.  NOTE--A NEW TO REACH FOLLOWS--  TO REACH THE STATION FROM THE POST OFFICE IN DAGSBORO, DELAWARE, GO SOUTH ON MAIN STREET AND STATE HIGHWAY 26 FOR 0.2 MILE TO A SIDE ROAD LEFT,(WHICH IS STATE HIGHWAY 26) TURN LEFT AND GO EAST ON STATE HIGHWAY 26 FOR 2.3 MILES TO Y-FORK INTERSECTION, TAKE RIGHT FORK WHICH IS STATE HIGHWAY 26 FOR 1.55 MILES TO A CROSSROAD, CONTINUE EAST ON STATE HIGHWAY 26 FOR 1.55 MILES TO A REVERSE Y-FORK INTERSECTION AND THE ST. GEORGES METHODIST CHURCH ON THE RIGHT, TURN LEFT AND GO EASTERLY ON STATE HIGHWAY 26 FOR 0.35 MILE TO A SIDE ROAD LEFT, TURN LEFT AND GO NORTHERLY ASPHALT ROAD FOR 1.0 MILE TO A CROSSROAD, TURN RIGHT AND GO EASTERLY ON ASPHALT ROAD FOR 0.75 MILE TO A FORK AND SIGN INDIAN RIVER VIEW 1 MILE, TAKE LEFT FORK AND GO NORTHERLY ON ASPHALT ROAD FOR 0.4 MILE TO A SIDE SAND ROAD RIGHT, TURN RIGHT AND GO 0.4 MILE TO A CROSSROAD, CONTINUE STRAIGHT AHEAD ON SAND ROAD FOR 0.5 MILE TO A WHITE HOUSE, HERE CONTINUE BY PASSING BETWEEN THE CHICKEN HOUSE AND THE CORN CRIB ON FIELD ROAD FOR 0.25 MILE TO THE SHORE LINE, TURN LEFT AND GO NORTH FOR 0.05 MILE TO THE STATION AS DESCRIBED.  STATION IS A STANDARD DISK SET IN THE TOP OF A 8-INCH TILE PIPE FILLED WITH CONCRETE WHICH IS FLUSH WITH THE SURFACE OF THE GROUND, STAMPED INDIAN 1934.  IT IS 89.5 FEET EAST OF THE WEST SHORE LINE, 87.0 FEET SOUTH OF THE SOUTH SHORE LINE, 2.4 FEET EAST-SOUTHEAST OF A STANDARD METAL WITNESS POST AND MARKER AND 1.5 FEET SOUTH-SOUTHWEST OF A 2-INCH IRON PIPE WHICH PROJECTS ABOUT 30 INCHES ABOVE THE SURFACE OF THE GROUND.  REFERENCE MARK 3, IS A STANDARD DISK SET IN THE TOP OF 12-INCH TILE PIPE FILLED WITH CONCRETE WHICH PROJECTS ABOUT 4 INCHES ABOVE THE SURFACE OF THE GROUND, STAMPED INDIAN NO 3 1934.  IT IS 94.5 FEET SOUTH OF A STANDARD METAL WITNESS POST AND MARKER AND 83.4 FEET WEST OF THE WEST SHORE LINE.  REFERENCE MARK 4 IS A STANDARD DISK SET IN THE TOP OF A 12-INCH TILE PIPE FILLED WITH CONCRETE WHICH PROJECTS ABOUT 2 INCHES ABOVE THE SURFACE OF THE GROUND, STAMPED INDIAN NO 4 1934.  IT IS 74.2 FEET WEST OF A STANDARD METAL WITNESS POST AND MARKER AND 50.6 FEET SOUTH OF THE SHORE LINE.  HEIGHT OF LIGHT ABOVE STATION MARK 1 METER.
markers.setting: SET IN CONCRETE IN A CLAY TILE PIPE

markers.description: BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1909 (ES) OBSERVED FROM MIDWAY, MASSEY AND MUSTARD.  ACCURATE OBSERVATIONS ON THIS.                            STATION RECOVERY (1920)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1920 (HAS) NOT DESCRIBED, BUT TOWER ON MAIN BUILDING USED AS HYDROGRAPHIC SIGNAL IN 1920.  THE TOWER IS THE MOST PROMINENT FEATURE OF THE STATION AND IT IS PRESUMED THIS IS THE POINT LOCATED.                            STATION RECOVERY (1934)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1934 (JCT) STATION RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION AND APPARENTLY IN PLACE.  THE CENTER OF THE LOOKOUT CUPOLA ON TOP THE ROOF OF THE MAIN COAST GUARD BUILDING.                            STATION RECOVERY (1961)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1961 (ETJ) THERE IS NO ORIGINAL DESCRIPTION, BUT ACCORDING TO THE G.P.S PUBLISHED FOR THIS STATION AND FOR INDIAN RIVER LIFE SAVING STATION, THEY ARE THE SAME.  STATION IS THE CUPOLA OR LOOKOUT TOWER WHICH IS THE HIGHEST PART OF THE INDIAN RIVER INLET COAST GUARD STATION, WHICH IS LOCATED ABOUT 1.8 MILES NORTH OF INDIAN RIVER INLET.                            STATION RECOVERY (1961)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1961 (JKW) STATION RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION.  THE STATION IS THE CENTER OF THE CUPOLA ATOP THE MAIN BUILDING AT THE INDIAN RIVER COAST GUARD STATION.  THE STATION IS LOCATED ABOUT 1.5 MILES NORTH OF INDIAN RIVER INLET, ALONG THE EAST SIDE OF STATE HIGHWAY 14.                            STATION RECOVERY (1962)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1962 (RWT) THE STATION WAS RECOVERED IN VERY POOR CONDITION DUE TO THE STORM IN MARCH 7, 1962.  THIS STATION IS EXPECTED TO BE TORN DOWN IN THE NEAR FUTURE.                            STATION RECOVERY (1970)  RECOVERY NOTE BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 1970 (JKW) STATION RECOVERED IN FAIR CONDITION.  THE 1961 RECOVERY NOTE BY E.T.J. IS ADEQUATE.  THE COAST GUARD PROPERTY IS NOW USED BY THE PARK SERVICE.  NO CHANGES HAVE BEEN MADE WITH THE BUILDING OR CUPOLA.  AIRLINE DISTANCE AND DIRECTION FROM NEAREST TOWN 1.8 MILES N OF INDIAN RIVER INLET.                            STATION RECOVERY (1997)  RECOVERY NOTE BY US POWER SQUADRON 1997 RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION.                            STATION RECOVERY (2006)  RECOVERY NOTE BY GEOCACHING 2006 (EK) RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION.

BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1962 (RWT) THE STATION IS THE APEX AND CENTER OF THE INDIAN RIVER COAST GUARD TOWER CUPOLA.  LOCATED ON THE NORTH SIDE OF INDIAN RIVER INLET, BETWEEN STATE HIGHWAY 14 AND THE ATLANTIC SHORE LINE, ABOUT 7.5 MILES SOUTH OF REHOBOTH BEACH AND 5.0 MILES NORTH OF BETHANY BEACH.  THE STRUCTURE IS OF 4-ANGLE IRON LEGS WITH AN OBSERVATION BUILDING MOUNTED AT THEIR APEX.  THE STRUCTURE IS GRAY IN COLOR WITH AN OVERALL HEIGHT OF APPROXIMATELY 80.0 FEET.                            STATION RECOVERY (1970)  RECOVERY NOTE BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 1970 (JKW) STATION RECOVERED.  THE TOWER CUPOLA HAS BEEN ALTERED SLIGHTLY.  THE BASIC STRUCTURE HAS NOT BEEN CHANGED.  THE ORIGINAL DESCRIPTION IS ADEQUATE.  AIRLINE DISTANCE AND DIRECTION FROM NEAREST TOWN AT INDIAN RIVER INLET.                            STATION RECOVERY (2006)  RECOVERY NOTE BY GEOCACHING 2006 (EK) TOWER IS GONE - ONLY THE FOUNDATION REMAINS.

BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1934 (JCT) LOCATED ON THE S BANK OF INDIAN RIVER ON WHITE NECK ON THE PROMINENT WOODED POINT MIDWAY BETWEEN IRONS LANE LANDING AND THE MOUTH OF BLACKWATER CREEK.  THE STATION IS SET NEAR THE CENTRAL PART OF THE POINT IN THE OUTER FRINGE OF SMALL PINES AND CEDARS AND ABOUT 28 METERS S FROM THE HIGH-WATER LINE.  A SMALL HOUSE IS LOCATED ABOUT 50 METERS TO SE OF THE STATION AMONG LARGE TREES.  THE SOIL IS FLAT AND SANDY AND NO UNDERGROUND STATION MARK COULD BE SET DUE TO THE WET CONDITION OF THE GROUND AT TIME OF MARKING THE STATION.  SURFACE AND REFERENCE MARKS ARE STANDARD BRONZE DISKS IN A TILE.  THE STATION IS BEST REACHED BY WATER.                            STATION RECOVERY (1943)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1943 (FLG) RECOVERED AS DESCRIBED WITH THE FOLLOWING DISCREPANCIES--  1.  REFERENCE MARK 1 IS 38.78 FEET OR 11.819 METERS SW OF THE STATION.  2.  REFERENCE MARK 2 IS 45.73 FEET OR 13.939 METERS E OF THE STATION.  3.  FROM REFERENCE MARK 1 TO REFERENCE MARK 2 IT IS 55.09 FEET OR 16.792 METERS.  4.  THE OLD HOUSE REFERRED TO IN THE ORIGINAL DESCRIPTION HAS BEEN TORN DOWN.                            STATION RECOVERY (1961)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1961 (JKW) STATION AND R.M. 1 WERE RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION.  R.M. 2 APPEARS TO HAVE BEEN HIT BY SOME VEHICLE AND IS TILTED NORTHWARD.  THE STATION IS STAMPED IRON 1934 AND THE R.M.S ARE STAMPED IRON NO 1 1934 AND IRON NO 2 1934.  THE PREVIOUS RECOVERY NOTE BY F.L.C. IN 1943 IS COMPLETE AND ADEQUATE.                            STATION RECOVERY (1962)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1962 (RWT) NOTE--THIS STATION WAS NOT OCCUPIED ON THIS DATE.  THE STATION MARK, REFERENCE MARKS NO. 1 AND NO. 2 WERE RECOVERED AS DESCRIBED AND FOUND IN GOOD CONDITION.  REFERENCE MARK NO. 2 IS LEANING TO THE WEST.  IT IS SOLID AND IN GOOD CONDITION.  A NEW TO REACH THE STATION AND ADDITIONAL NOTES ARE IN THE FOLLOWING.  THE STATION MARK IS 55.0 FEET SOUTH OF A 4-INCH PINE TREE, 39.0 FEET EAST OF THE SHORE LINE, 32.4 FEET WEST OF AN 8-INCH PINE TREE WITH A TRIANGULAR BLAZE AND THE MARK PROJECTS ABOUT 2 INCHES ABOVE THE SURFACE OF THE GROUND.  REFERENCE MARK NO. 1 IS 48.2 FEET WEST-SOUTHWEST OF AN 8-INCH TRIANGULAR BLAZED PINE TREE, 38.78 FEET, 11.820 METERS EAST OF THE STATION AND PROJECTS ABOUT 2 INCHES ABOVE THE SURFACE OF THE GROUND.  THE MONUMENT IS LEANING TO THE WEST, BUT IN GOOD CONDITION.  REFERENCE MARK NO. 2 IS 21.4 FEET EAST-SOUTHEAST OF A 10-INCH TRIANGULAR BLAZED PINE TREE, 45.09 FEET, 13.744 METERS SOUTH-SOUTHWEST OF THE STATION AND THE MARK PROJECTS ABOUT 1 INCH ABOVE THE SURFACE OF THE GROUND.  54.61 FEET AND 16.646 METERS BETWEEN REFERENCE MARK NO. 1 AND NO. 2.  TO REACH THE STATION FROM THE POST OFFICE IN DAGSBORO, DELAWARE.  GO SOUTH ON MAIN STREET AND STATE HIGHWAY 26 FOR 0.2 MILE, THENCE TURN LEFT AND GO EAST ON STATE HIGHWAY 26 FOR 2.3 MILES TO A Y-FORK INTERSECTION.  TAKE THE RIGHT HAND FORK AND GO SOUTH-SOUTHEAST ON STATE HIGHWAY 26 FOR 1.55 MILES TO A CROSSROAD.  CONTINUE EAST ON STATE HIGHWAY 26 FOR 1.55 MILES TO A REVERSE Y-FORK INTERSECTION, ST GEORGES METHODIST CHURCH ON THE RIGHT, WEST, SIDE OF THE HIGHWAY AT THE WEST EDGE OF CLARKSVILLE, DELAWARE.  TAKE THE LEFT HAND FORK AND CONTINUE EAST ON HIGHWAY 26 FOR 0.4 MILE TO A SIDE ROAD LEFT.  TURN LEFT AND GO NORTH ON A MACADAM ROAD FOR 1.05 MILES TO A CROSSROAD.  CONTINUE NORTH ON THE MACADAM ROAD FOR 0.9 MILE TO A FARM ROAD ON THE LEFT.  TURN LEFT AND GO WEST ON THE FARMROAD FOR 0.05 MILE TO A FARM HOUSE AND A TRACK ROAD ON THE RIGHT.  TURN RIGHT AND GO NORTH-NORTHWEST ON A FARM ROAD, PASSING BETWEEN THE FARM HOUSE AND A CHICKEN HOUSE, AND FOLLOW THE TRACK ROAD THROUGH THE WOODS FOR 0.25 MILE TO A TRIPLE FORKS AT THE CORNER OF WOODS AND A CULTIVATED FIELD.  TAKE THE MIDDLE ONE OF THREE FORKS AND GO NORTH-NORTHWEST ON THE WOODS ROAD FOR 0.35 MILE TO THE EDGE OF WOODS, THE SANDY BEACH AND THE STATION ON THE LEFT, WEST, SIDE OF THE WOODS ROAD.                            STATION RECOVERY (1974)  RECOVERY NOTE BY LOCAL ENGINEER (INDIVIDUAL OR FIRM) 1974 RECOVERED BY GILBERT INC.  STATION FOUND IN GOOD CONDITION BURIED ABOUT TWO FEET BELOW SURFACE.  RM 1 FOUND IN GOOD CONDITION ABOVE GROUND.  RM 2 WAS DESTROYED BY BRUSH CUTTING IN THE AREA.

markers.description: BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1909 (ES) THIS IS ON A SMALL ISLAND IN LITTLE ASSAWOMAN BAY A LITTLE N OF THE LINE BETWEEN FENWICK LIGHTHOUSE AND RODGERS 2.  THE ISLAND IS ABOUT HALF MARSH AND HALF HAMMOCK LAND.  THE STATION IS ON THE N SIDE.  STATION IS MARKED WITH A BEER BOTTLE SET IN CEMENT 3 FEET BELOW SURFACE, ABOVE WHICH IS CEMENT POST 15 INCHES IN DIAMETER WITH COPPER TRIANGULATION MARK FASTENED IN 1-INCH GALVANIZED-IRON PIPE 18 INCHES LONG.  REFERENCE MARK IS CEMENT POST FINISHED 8 INCHES SQUARE WITH BOTTLE MARKING CENTER.                            STATION RECOVERY (1934)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1934 (JCT) NO TRACE OF STATION OR REFERENCE MARKS COULD BE FOUND AFTER AN EXTENSIVE SEARCH IN THE VICINITY.  THE ISLAND ON WHICH THE STATION IS SET IS COVERED WITH A DENSE GROWTH OF BRUSH AND MARSH GRASS.  IT IS POSSIBLE THAT THE STATION MIGHT BE RECOVERED BY USING A PLANE-TABLE TO OBTAIN ITS EXACT LOCATION.  EVERY SMALL ISLAND IN THE VICINITY WAS SEARCHED OVER IN ORDER TO MAKE CERTAIN THE STATION WAS NOT MISSED.                            STATION RECOVERY (1942)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1942 (WDP) THE FOLLOWING DISCREPANCIES WERE NOTED IN THE FIELD WITH THE ORIGINAL DESCRIPTION--  (1) DELETE A LITTLE N OF LINE BETWEEN FENWICK LIGHTHOUSE AND RODGERS 2.  RODGERS 2 IS LOST.  (2) REFERENCE MARK IS LOCATED 44.17 FEET SE OF STATION, NOT 44.5 FEET.  THE STATION IS LOCATED ON THE N SIDE OF A SMALL HALF MARSH AND HALF HUMMOCK ISLAND IN LITTLE ASSAWOMAN BAY, 30 FEET N OF THE N WALL OF THE PINEY CEDAR GUNNING CLUBS CHARLES CABIN, 10 FEET N OF A NAIL IN A BLAZED 6-INCH OAK TREE, AND ABOUT 60 FEET E OF THE WESTERN SHORE.  THE STATION IS A BRONZE DISK TRIANGULATION STATION, NOT STAMPED, SET IN THE TOP OF A 15-INCH IN DIAMETER CONCRETE MONUMENT, WHICH EXTENDS 4 INCHES ABOVE THE GROUND.  THE STATION IS IN GOOD CONDITION, EXCEPT FOR A SLIGHT TILT.  REFERENCE MARK NO. 1 IS LOCATED 44.17 FEET ESE OF THE STATION.  THE MARK IS THE CENTER OF A BOTTLE SET FLUSH WITH THE TOP OF AN 8-INCH SQUARE CONCRETE MONUMENT, WHICH IS FLUSH WITH THE GROUND.  THE MARK IS IN GOOD CONDITION.                            STATION RECOVERY (1961)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1961 (RMS) THE STATION WAS RECOVERED AS DESCRIBED BY W.D.P. IN 1942.  THE MARK IS TILTED SLIGHTLY.  THE REFERENCE MARK WAS NOT RECOVERED BUT IS PROBABLY INTACT.

markers.description: BY NATIONAL OCEAN SERVICE 1982 (RHH) THE STATION IS LOCATED ON THE WEST SIDE OF THE CHRISTINA RIVER IN WILMINGTON ON ABANDONED INDUSTRIAL PROPERTY.  ALTHOUGH THE STATION IS ACCESSIBLE BY LAND VIA MARYLAND AVENUE AND BEECH STREET, A DESCRIPTION BY BOAT FOLLOWS.  TO REACH THE STATION FROM THE MOUTH OF THE CHRISTINA RIVER, GO WESTERLY UP THE RIVER ABOUT 3 MILES TO THE SECOND OF TWO PENN CENTRAL RAILROAD BRIDGES (THE 6TH BRIDGE ACROSS THE RIVER) TO THE STATION ON A CONCRETE OUTFALL ON THE WEST SIDE OF THE RIVER ABOUT 1/4 MILE DOWNRIVER FROM THE SECOND RAILROAD BRIDGE.  HEIGHT OF LIGHT SHOWN ABOVE THE MARK WAS 1.55 METERS.

markers.description: PTIVE TEXT AVAILABLE.

BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1962 (RWT) THE STATION IS LOCATED IN A CULTIVATED FIELD, 3.8 MILES NORTHEAST OF FEDERALSBURG, 6.0 MILES WEST-SOUTHWEST OF BRIDGEVILLE AND ON PROPERTY OWNED BY MR. CLAUD JOHNSON.  TO REACH THE STATION FROM THE INTERSECTION OF MAIN STREET AND CENTRAL AVENUE IN FEDERALSBURG, MARYLAND, GO EAST ON STATE HIGHWAY 318 EAST CENTRAL AVENUE FOR 0.35 MILE TO THE JUNCTION OF STATE HIGHWAY 306 AND 318, KEEP RIGHT ON STATE HIGHWAY 318 FOR 2.85 MILES TO A SIDE ROAD LEFT, JUST AFTER PASSING A CHURCH ON THE LEFT, TURN LEFT, GO NORTH ON A GRAVELED ROAD FOR 0.3 MILE TO A SIDE ROAD RIGHT, TURN RIGHT, GO NORTHEAST ON A DIRT ROAD FOR 0.95 MILE TO A FARM LANE LEFT, JUST AFTER CROSSING A SMALL WOODEN BRIDGE, TURN LEFT, GO 0.05 MILE TO A FORK, TURN RIGHT AND GO ABOUT 125.0 FEET TO THE STATION ON THE RIGHT AS DESCRIBED.  THE STATION MARK IS A STANDARD DISK STAMPED JOHNSON 1962, SET IN TOP OF A SQUARE CONCRETE MONUMENT WHICH IS ABOUT 18 INCHES BELOW THE GROUND SURFACE.  IT IS 31.6 FEET EAST OF THE APPROXIMATE CENTER OF A DRIVEWAY AND 42.7 FEET SOUTHEAST OF THE SOUTHEAST CORNER OF A CHICKEN HOUSE.  REFERENCE MARK 1 IS A STANDARD DISK STAMPED JOHNSON NO 1 1962, SET IN TOP OF A SQUARE CONCRETE MONUMENT WHICH PROJECTS 3 INCHES ABOVE THE GROUND SURFACE.  IT IS 2.5 FEET NORTH OF AN EVERGREEN HEDGE ROW, 10.6 FEET NORTH OF THE APPROXIMATE CENTER OF A DRIVEWAY AND 33.6 FEET EAST OF A POWERLINE POLE.  REFERENCE MARK 2 IS A STANDARD DISK STAMPED JOHNSON NO 2 1962, SET IN TOP OF A SQUARE CONCRETE MONUMENT WHICH PROJECTS 3 INCHES ABOVE THE GROUND SURFACE.  IT IS 1.7 FEET EAST OF A LIGHT POLE, 1.7 FEET SOUTH OF THE SOUTH SIDE OF THE CHICKEN HOUSE AND 13.0 FEET NORTH OF THE DRIVEWAY.  BOUNDARY MONUMENT NO. 18 IS A 12 X 12 INCH LIMESTONE MONUMENT MARKED WITH THE LETTERS M AND P.  THE MONUMENT WAS RECOVERED IN A PRONE POSITION, TOP CHIPPED AND ONE CORNER WITH A BAD CRACK.  THE FOUNDATION WAS SEARCHED FOR BUT NOT FOUND.  THE MONUMENT WAS NOT TRAVERSE OR OBSERVED.  IT IS NOW LOCATED IN A CULTIVATED FIELD ABOUT 200.0 FEET NORTH OF THE NORTHEAST CORNER OF A CHICKEN HOUSE.  TO REACH THE AZIMUTH MARK FROM THE MAIN ROAD AND THE DRIVEWAY, GO NORTH-NORTHEAST ON THE GRAVELED ROAD FOR 0.45 MILE TO A CROSSROAD, TURN LEFT AND GO WEST ON A FARM ROAD FOR 0.3 MILE TO AN OLD BARN AND A LIGHT POLE ON THE RIGHT AND THE AZIMUTH MARK AS DESCRIBED.  THE AZIMUTH MARK IS A STANDARD DISK STAMPED JOHNSON 1962, SET IN TOP OF A SQUARE CONMONUMENT WHICH PROJECTS 3 INCHES ABOVE THE GROUND SURFACE.  IT IS 1.5 FEET SOUTH-SOUTHWEST OF A LIGHT POLE, 0.9 FEET SOUTH-SOUTHWEST OF A STANDARD METAL WITNESS POST AND MARKER, 32.0 FEET NORTH-NORTHEAST OF THE APPROXIMATE CENTER OF A DIM FARM LANE AND 51.2 FEET SOUTHEAST OF THE NORTHEAST CORNER OF A BARN.  HEIGHT OF LIGHT ABOVE STATION MARK 30 METERS.                            STATION RECOVERY (1975)  RECOVERY NOTE BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 1975 (CLN) THE STATION AND ALL MARKS WERE RECOVERED AND FOUND IN GOOD CONDITION AS DESCRIBED IN THE 1961 DESCRIPTION.  A SHORTER DISTANCE OF 0.01 FOOT OR 0.004 METER WAS NOTED TO REFERENCE MARK 1.  A LONGER DISTANCE OF 0.02 FOOT OR 0.004 METER WAS NOTED TO REFERENCE MARK 2.  THE DIRECTION TO ALL MARKS WERE WITHIN CLOSE AGREEMENT WITH THE 1962 OBSERVATIONS.  AIRLINE DISTANCE AND DIRECTION FROM NEAREST TOWN 3-3/4 MILES NORTHEAST OF FEDERALSBURG.                            STATION RECOVERY (1976)  RECOVERY NOTE BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 1976 (CLN) THE STATION AND ALL MARKS WERE RECOVERED AND FOUND IN GOOD CONDITION AS PREVIOUSLY DESCRIBED.  THE PREVIOUS DESCRIPTIONS ARE ADEQUATE.  THE MARYLAND-DELAWARE BOUNDARY MONUMENT NUMBER 18 WAS RESET AT THIS DATE, SEE DESCRIPTION THEREOF.  AIRLINE DISTANCE AND DIRECTION FROM NEAREST TOWN 2 MILES NORTHWEST OF ATLANTA.

TO REACH STATION FROM THE INTERSECTION OF BOWERS BEACH ROAD (ALSO KNOWN AS MAIN STREET) AND ROAD TO A SIDE ROAD LEFT, TURN LEFT AND DRIVE NW 0.3 MI ON THE SIDE ROAD TO A DEAD END.  PARK AND WALK NW ABOUT 55 M (180.4 FT) TO THE STATION. STATION IS A DRILL HOLE IN THE TOP OF A LARGE CONCRETE BLOCK WHICH APPEARS TO BE AN ABANDONED LOADING RAMP.  THE DRILL HOLE HAS AN ORANGE TRIANGLE PAINTED AROUND IT, AND ---JONES--- PAINTED BENEATH IT.  IT IS ABOUT 16 M (52.5 FT) SE OF A UTILITY POLE, ABOUT 8 M (26.2 FT) SW OF THE BAY HIGH WATERLINE, 2.1 M (6.9 FT) NE OF THE SW EDGE OF THE BLOCK, AND 1.75 M (5.7 FT) NW OF THE SE EDGE OF THE BLOCK.  THE TOP SURFACE OF THE BLOCK IS ABOUT 1 M (3.3 FT) ABOVE THE GROUND. BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1933 (GLA) THIS STATION IS AT KITTS HUMMOCK ON THE W SHORE OF DELAWARE BAY ABOUT 8 MILES SE OF DOVER AND 3 MILES N OF BOWERS.  STATION MARK IS A STANDARD BRONZE DISK IN A TILE. UNDERGROUND MARK IS A BLOCK OF CONCRETE BELOW THE GROUND CONTAINING A STANDARD BRONZE DISK. REFERENCE MARKS NOS.1 AND 2 ARE STANDARD BRONZE DISKS SET IN CONCRETE IN THE TOP OF A TILE.  REFERENCE MARK NO.1 IS SSW OF THE STATION ON THE CREST OF THE LOW SAND RIDGE BACK OF THE BEACH, ON LINE WITH THE E SIDE OF THE S HOUSE AND 70 FEET S OF THE S SIDE OF THE PORCH OF THE HOUSE.  REFERENCE MARK NO.2 IS NW OF THE STATION, 3 FEET SW OF THE SW CORNER OF THE S PORCH OF THE S HOUSE.  TO REACH FROM DOVER GO E 1.0 MILE FROM MAIN PART OF TOWN TO ROAD FORK.  TAKE RIGHT FORK AND PROCEED SE 5 MILES ON PAVED ROAD TO CROSSROADS, CONTINUE STRAIGHT AHEAD 3 MILES TO END OF ROAD AT KITTS HUMMOCK.  TURN RIGHT ON BEACH AND CONTINUE ABOUT 1/2 MILE TO THE STATION JUST BEYOND THE LAST HOUSE OF THE VILLAGE.  THE STATION IS ON THE BEACH ABOUT 5 FEET W OF THE HIGH WATER LINE, AND 29 FEET SSE OF THE SE CORNER OF THE S HOUSE IN KITTS HUMMOCK.                            STATION RECOVERY (1947)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1947 (TBR) STATION MARK AND REFERENCE MARK 1 WERE FOUND WASHED OUT ON BEACH.  IT IS RECOMMENDED THAT STATION AND REFERENCE MARK 1 BE CONSIDERED AS LOST.  REFERENCE MARK 2 WAS SEARCHED FOR BUT NOT FOUND.                            STATION RECOVERY (1973)  RECOVERY NOTE BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 1973 (LFS) THE STATION WAS SEARCHED FOR BUT NOT FOUND.  LOCAL RESIDENTS REPORTED SEEING THE MONUMENTS NEAR THE WATER LINE DURING STORMS AND THEY SAID SINCE THEN THEY HAVE BEEN WASHED AWAY.  THE SMALL VILLAGE HAS BEEN ENLARGED AND CONSTRUCTION WORK HAS TOOK PLACE IN THE AREA OF THE STATION.  NO OBJECTS IS VISIBLE FROM THE GROUND TO SET IN TO CHECK THE ANGLES.  THERE IS A REMOTE POSSIBILITY THAT THE DISKS MAY STILL BE INTACT.  AIRLINE DISTANCE AND DIRECTION FROM NEAREST TOWN AT KITTS HAMMOCK.
markers.setting: SET IN CONCRETE IN A CLAY TILE PIPE
markers.stability: MARK OF QUESTIONABLE OR UNKNOWN STABILITY

markers.description: BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1961 (RWT) THE STATION IS LOCATED ABOUT 2.5 MILES SOUTHEAST OF GLASGOW, DELAWARE, 3.0 MILES SOUTHEAST OF ELKTON, MARYLAND AND ON PROPERTY OWNED BY MR. P LAGANO, WHO LIVES IN THE HOME ACROSS THE ROAD FROM THE STATION.  TO REACH THE STATION FROM THE JUNCTION OF U.S. HIGHWAYS 40 AND 213 ABOUT 1/2 MILE SOUTH OF THE BUSINESS DISTRICT OF ELKTON, MARYLAND.  GO SOUTH ON U.S. HIGHWAY 213 FOR 1.3 MILES TO A CROSSROAD.  TURN LEFT AND GO EAST ON A BLACKTOP ROAD FOR 1.65 MILES TO A SIDE ROAD ON THE RIGHT.  TURN RIGHT AND GO SOUTH ON A BLACKTOP ROAD FOR 0.05 MILE TO POWERLINE POLE NO. 12175, A METAL WITNESS POST AND MARKER AND THE AZIMUTH MARK ON THE RIGHT, SOUTH, SIDE OF THE ROAD.  CONTINUE EAST ON THE BLACKTOP ROAD FOR 0.5 MILE TO A WIRE GATE ON THE LEFT, NORTH, SIDE OF THE ROAD AT THE SOUTHWEST CORNER OF A CULTIVATED FIELD.  PASS THROUGH THE GATE, THENCE TURN LEFT AND GO EAST ALONG THE NORTH SIDE OF AN EAST AND WEST FENCELINE FOR 0.05 MILE TO THE STATION.  THE STATION MARK, A STANDARD DISK STAMPED LAGANO 1961, IS SET IN THE TOP OF A SQUARE CONCRETE MONUMENT ABOUT 14 INCHES BELOW THE SURFACE OF THE GROUND.  IT IS 13.0 FEET NORTH OF A STANDARD METAL WITNESS POST AND MARKER, 15.3 FEET NORTH OF AN EAST AND WEST FENCELINE AND 31.6 FEET NORTH OF THE CENTERLINE OF A BLACKTOP ROAD.  REFERENCE MARK 1, A STANDARD DISK STAMPED LAGANO NO 1 1961, IS SET IN THE TOP OF A SQUARE CONCRETE MONUMENT PROJECTING ABOUT 2 INCHES ABOVE THE SURFACE OF THE GROUND.  IT IS 94.0 FEET WEST OF THE STANDARD METAL WITNESS POST AND MARKER, 17.2 FEET NORTH OF THE CENTERLINE OF A BLACKTOP ROAD, 2.5 FEET NORTH OF A FENCELINE AND 1.0 FOOT SOUTH OF THE SOUTH EDGE OF CULTIVATED FIELD AND IS ABOUT 1.0 FOOT LOWER THAN THE STATION.  REFERENCE MARK 2, A STANDARD DISK STAMPED LAGANO NO 2 1961, IS SET IN THE TOP OF A SQUARE CONCRETE MONUMENT PROJECTING ABOUT 3 INCHES ABOVE THE SURFACE OF THE GROUND.  IT IS 88.0 FEET EAST OF THE STANDARD METAL WITNESS POST AND MARKER, 18.5 FEET NORTH OF THE CENTERLINE OF A BLACKTOP ROAD, 1.6 FEET NORTH OF AN EAST AND WEST FENCELINE, 1.0 FEET SOUTH OF THE SOUTH EDGE OF A CULTIVATED FIELD.  THE AZIMUTH MARK, A STANDARD DISK STAMPED LAGANO 1961, IS SET IN THE TOP OF A SQUARE CONCRETE MONUMENT PROJECTING ABOUT 2 INCHES ABOVE THE SURFACE OF THE GROUND.  IT IS 16.0 FEET WEST OF THE CENTERLINE OF A BLACKTOP ROAD, 1.5 FEET NORTH-NORTHEAST OF A STANDARD METAL WITNESS POST AND MARKER AND 1.3 FEET EAST OF POWERLINE POLE NO. 12175.  MONUMENT NO 78, IS THE MASON-DIXON STATE LINE MONUMENT, LOCATED IN THE FIELD NORTH OF THE STATION.  IT PROJECTS ABOUT 20 INCHES AND LEANS SLIGHTLY TO THE SOUTH-SOUTHWEST.  A SMALL CROSS WAS ETCHED AT THE APEX AND CENTER OF THE MONUMENT TO HOLD THE CENTER POINT TO MEASURE TO.  HEIGHT OF LIGHT ABOVE STATION MARK 30 METERS.                            STATION RECOVERY (1986)  RECOVERY NOTE BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 1986 (RGP) THE STATION AMRK, BOTH REFERENCE MARKS AND THE AZIMUTH WERE ALL RECOVERED AND FOUND IN GOOD CONDITION AS DESCRIBED IN THE MOST RECENT INFORMATION AVAILABLE.  A DIFFERENCE IN DIRECTION OF MINUTE AND THIRTYSIX SECONDS WAS NOTED TO REFERENCE MARK TWO. ALL OTHER DISTANCES AND DIRECTIONS WERE WITHIN CLOSE AGREEMENT WITH THE MOST RECENT INFORMATION AVAILABLE.  THE BOUNDARY MONUMENT NO. 78 WAS FOUND OUT OF POSITION BY ABOUT 325 FEET.  IT WAS RESET IN A SAFE PLACE LOCATION IN A WOODED FENCE LINE ON THE BOUNDARY.  SEE DESCRIPTION THEREOF.                            STATION RECOVERY (2013)  RECOVERY NOTE BY DELAWARE COASTAL PROGRAM 2013 MARK NOT FOUND.

J3 DP AND L 214, 56.0 FEET WEST OF THE CENTER OF THE INTERSECTION OF A GRAVELED DRIVE-WAY, 35.0 FEET EAST OF THE CENTERLINE OF THE SOUTH BOUND TRAFFIC LANE OF U.S. HIGHWAY 13 AND 34.0 FEET WEST OF THE CENTERLINE OF THE NORTH BOUND TRAFFIC LANE OF U.S.  HIGHWAY 13.   TO REACH THE STATION FROM THE JUNCTION OF U.S. HIGHWAY 13, STATE HIGHWAYS 6, 300 AT THE INTERSECTION OF COMMERCE STREET IN THE CENTRAL SECTION OF SMYRNA. IT IS 16.0 FEET EAST OF THE CENTERLINE OF THE SOUTH BOUND TRAFFIC LANE OF U.S. HIGHWAY 13 AND 4.3 FEET EAST OF THE EAST EDGE OF THE PAVEMENT AND ABOUT THE SAME ELEVATION AS THE STATION.  REFERENCE MARK 2, A STANDARD DISK STAMPED LAMBERSON 2 NO 2 1961, IS SET IN THE TOP OF A 10-INCH SQUARE CONCRETE MONUMENT FLUSH WITH THE SURFACE OF THE GROUND.  IT IS 17.0 FEET EAST OF THE CENTERLINE OF THE SOUTH BOUND TRAFFIC LANE OF U.S. HIGHWAY 13 AND 5.0 FEET EAST OF THE EAST EDGE OF THE PAVEMENT AND ABOUT THE SAME ELEVATION AS THE STATION.  THE AZIMUTH MARK, A STANDARD DISK STAMPED LAMBERSON 2 1961, IS SET IN THE TOP OF A 10-INCH SQUARE CONCRETE MONUMENT FLUSH WITH THE SURFACE OF THE GROUND.  IT IS 37.6 FEET EAST OF THE CENTERLINE OF THE SOUTH BOUND TRAFFIC LANE OF U.S. HIGHWAY 13, 34.3 FEET WEST OF THE CENTERLINE OF THE NORTH BOUND TRAFFIC LANE OF U.S. HIGHWAY 13 AND 12.5 FEET NORTH OF AN 18-INCH MAPLE TREE.   LAMBERSON 1933 IS A STANDARD DISK SET IN TOP OF A SQUARE CONCRETE MONUMENT ABOUT 18 INCHES BELOW THE SURFACE OF THE GROUND.  IT IS 225.0 FEET SOUTH OF A FARM HOUSE AND 104.0 FEET SOUTH OF AN IMPLEMENT SHED.  HEIGHT OF LIGHT ABOVE STATION MARK 34.10 METERS.                            STATION RECOVERY (1977)  RECOVERY NOTE BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 1977 (JLC) THE STATION MARK, REFERENCE MARKS 1, 2, AZIMUTH MARK AND STATION LAMBERSON 1933 WERE RECOVERED AND FOUND IN GOOD CONDITION.  THE DISTANCE AND DIRECTIONS TO REFERENCE MARKS 1 AND 2 CHECKED WITH THE 1961 OBSERVATIONS.  THE DIRECTION TO THE AZIMUTH MARK CHECKED WITH PREVIOUS OBSERVATIONS.  THE DISTANCE TO LAMBERSON 1933 WAS FOUND TO BE LONGER BY 0.001 METER AND THE DIRECTION WAS FOUND TO BE LESS BY 10.5 SECONDS.   DUE TO VARIOUS CHANGES A NEW AND COMPLETE DESCRIPTION FOLLOWS.   THE STATION IS LOCATED ABOUT 3 MILES SOUTH OF BLACKBIRD, 3 MILES NORTH OF SMYRNA AND ON STATE HIGHWAY RIGHT-OF-WAY PROPERTY.   TO REACH THE STATION FROM THE JUNCTION OF U.S. HIGHWAY 13 AND STATE HIGHWAY 896 ABOUT 6-1/2 MILES NORTH OF SMYRNA, GO SOUTHERLY ON HIGHWAY 13 FOR 3.6 MILES TO THE STATION ON THE LEFT LOCATED IN THE MEDIAN OF U.S. HIGHWAY 13.   STATION MARKS, STAMPED LAMBERSON 2 1961 ARE STANDARD DISKS.  THE SURFACE MARK IS SET IN THE TOP OF A SQUARE CONCRETE MONUMENT THAT IS ABOUT 2 INCHES BELOW THE GROUND SURFACE.  THE UNDERGROUND MARK IS SET IN AN IRREGULAR MASS OF CONCRETE ABOUT 48 INCHES BELOW THE GROUND SURFACE.  THEY ARE 84 FEET SOUTHWEST OF A POWER POLE NUMBER 214, 34.5 FEET EAST OF THE CENTER LINE OF THE SOUTH BOUND LANE OF HIGHWAY 13 AND 33.5 FEET WEST OF THE CENTER LINE OF THE NORTH BOUND LANE OF HIGHWAY 13.   REFERENCE MARK 1, STAMPED LAMBERSON 2 NO 1 1961 IS A STANDARD DISK SET IN THE TOP OF A SQUARE CONCRETE MONUMENT THAT IS ABOUT 2 INCHES BELOW THE GROUND SURFACE.  IT IS 53 FEET WEST OF THE CENTER OF THE NORTH BOUND LANE OF HIGHWAY 13 AND 15.5 FEET EAST OF THE CENTER OF THE SOUTH BOUND LANE OF HIGHWAY 13.   REFERENCE MARK 2, STAMPED LAMBERSON 2 NO 2 1961 IS A STANDARD DISK SET IN THE TOP OF A SQUARE CONCRETE MONUMENT THAT IS ABOUT 2 INCHES BELOW THE GROUND SURFACE.  IT IS 51 FEET WEST OF THE CENTER OF THE NORTH BOUND LANE OF HIGHWAY 13 AND 16 FEET EAST OF THE CENTER OF THE SOUTH BOUND LANE OF HIGHWAY 13.   AZIMUTH MARK, STAMPED LAMBERSON 2 1961 IS A STANDARD DISK SET IN THE TOP OF A SQUARE CONCRETE MONUMENT THAT IS ABOUT 4 INCHES BELOW THE GROUND SURFACE.  IT IS 37.5 FEET EAST OF THE CENTER OF THE SOUTH BOUND LANE OF HIGHWAY 13, 34.5 FEET WEST OF THE CENTER OF THE NORTH BOUND LANE OF HIGHWAY 13 AND 5 FEET EAST OF THE EAST EDGE OF A ROW OF SHRUBS. markers.description: BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1933 (GLA) THIS STATION IS ON LISTON POINT ON THE DELAWARE SHORE OF THE DELAWARE RIVER, ABOUT 8 MILES ESE OF ODESSA, DELAWARE, 7 MILES NE OF SMYRNA, DELAWARE, 7 MILES NE OF SMYRNA, DELAWARE, AND 4 MILES ABOVE THE MOUTH OF THE SMYRNA RIVER.  IT IS ABOUT 200 YARDS NW OF THE EXTREME OUTER EDGE OF LISTON POINT ON WHICH IS LOCATED A UNITED STATES ARMY ENGINEERS TRIPOD.  IT IS ON THE HIGHEST PART OF THE BEACH ABOUT 30 FEET BACK FROM THE HIGHWATER LINE.  STATION MARK IS A STANDARD BRONZE DISK IN A TILE. UNDERGROUND MARK IS A BLOCK OF CONCRETE BELOW THE GROUND CONTAINING A STANDARD BRONZE DISK. REFERENCE MARKS NOS.1 AND 2 ARE STANDARD BRONZE DISKS SET IN CONCRETE IN THE TOP OF A TILE.  REFERENCE MARK NO.1 IS SSW OF THE STATION, 25.5 FEET W OF A SQUARE GRANITE MONUMENT.  REFERENCE MARK NO.2 IS NW OF THE STATION, ALONG LINE BETWEEN SANDY BEACH AND GRASS COVERED MARSH.  THE MONUMENT MARKING THE BOUNDARY BETWEEN THE DELAWARE RIVER AND DELAWARE BAY IS SSW OF THE STATION.  IT IS A SQUARE GRAY GRANITE MONUMENT ABOUT 8 FEET HIGH AND HAS A POINTED TOP.  ON THE RIVER SIDE IT IS LETTERED MOUTH OF THE DELAWARE RIVER AND OTHER EXPLANATORY MATTER.  THE STATION IS BEST REACHED BY BOAT WITH A CHART AS A GUIDE.                            STATION RECOVERY (1946)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1946 (ELJ) STATION IS DESTROYED.  UNDERGROUND MARK STILL REMAINS BUT IS UNDER WATER AT HIGH WATER, AND IS IN FAIR CONDITION.

BY US ARMY CORPS OF ENGINEERS 1933 (GLA) THIS STATION IS ON THE EXTREME OUTER END OF LISTON POINT ON THE W BANK OF THE DELAWARE RIVER ABOUT 2-1/2 MILES N OF COLLINS BEACH. THE STATION IS MARKED BY A 1 1/4-INCH IRON PIPE 6 FEET LONG DRIVEN IN THE GROUND.  ABOVE THE STATION IS ERECTED A 60-FOOT SQUARE SKELETON STEEL TOWER WITH THE BASE ANCHORED IN CONCRETE. IT IS 20-1/2 FEET NORTH OF THE CENTERLINE OF THE EAST BOUND TRAFFIC LANE OF U.S. HIGHWAY NO. 13 ALTERNATE, 21 FEET SOUTH OF THE CENTERLINE OF THE WEST BOUND TRAFFIC LANE OF U.S. HIGHWAY NO. 13 ALTERNATE, 36 FEET NORTHEAST OF A SEWER MAN-HOLE COVER AND ABOUT 170 FEET NORTHEAST OF FOUR TRAFFIC LIGHTS.  THE MARK IS A STANDARD TRIANGULATION DISK, SET IN A 10 BY 10 INCH CONCRETE MONUMENT.  FLUSH WITH THE GROUND, AND THE DISK IS STAMPED LORE 1958. markers.description: BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1962 (RWT) THE STATION IS LOCATED ABOUT 1.0 MILE EAST-NORTHEAST OF OAK ORCHARD, ON THE NORTH BANK OF THE INDIAN RIVER, ON THE SOUTH CENTRAL POINT OF THE LARGE MARSH AREA MIDWAY BETWEEN OAK ORCHARD AND THE MOUTH OF LINGOS CREEK, 42.0 FEET NORTH OF HIGH WATERLINE, 100.0 FEET NORTH OF AN OLD FISH TRAP, NOT IN USE, AND 2.9 FEET WEST OF A STANDARD METAL WITNESS POST AND MARKER.  TO REACH THE STATION FROM OAK ORCHARD.  GO NORTH ON STATE HIGHWAY 5 FOR 2.0 MILES TO A CROSSROAD INTERSECTION.  TURN RIGHT AND GO EAST ON STATE HIGHWAY 5 FOR 1.0 MILE TO A CROSSROAD.  TURN RIGHT AND GO SOUTH-SOUTHWEST ON A GRAVELED ROAD FOR 2.0 MILES TO THE CORNER OF A WOODS AND FIELD ON THE LEFT, JUST AFTER MAKING A SHARP TURN TO THE RIGHT IN THE GRAVELED ROAD.  TURN LEFT AND SOUTH-SOUTHEAST ON A TRACK FIELD ROAD ALONG THE EAST EDGE OF TIMBER AND WEST EDGE OF CULTIVATED FIELD FOR 0.9 MILE TO THE SHORE LINE AND END OF TRUCK TRAVEL.  FROM THE END OF TRUCK TRAVEL, PACK SOUTHWEST ALONG THE SHORE LINE FOR ABOUT 0.4 MILE TO AN OLD FISH TRAP, A STANDARD METAL WITNESS POST AND THE STATION.  THE STATION MAY ALSO BE REACHED BY BOAT FROM OAK ORCHARD.  THE STATION MARK, A STANDARD DISK STAMPED LUNGO 2 1962, IS SET IN TOP OF A 10-INCH SQUARE CONCRETE MONUMENT PROJECTING ABOUT 12 INCHES ABOVE THE SURFACE OF THE GROUND.  REFERENCE MARK 3, A STANDARD DISK STAMPED LUNGO 2 NO 3 1962, IS SET IN THE TOP OF A 10-INCH SQUARE CONCRETE MONUMENT PROJECTING ABOUT 12 INCHES ABOVE THE SURFACE OF THE GROUND.  IT IS 26.4 FEET NORTH OF A STANDARD METAL WITNESS POST AND MARKER AND 68.0 FEET NORTH OF THE SHORE LINE.  REFERENCE MARK 4, A STANDARD DISK STAMPED LUNGO 2 1962, IS SET IN TOP OF A 10-INCH SQUARE CONCRETE MONUMENT PROJECTING ABOUT 12 INCHES ABOVE THE SURFACE OF THE GROUND.  IT IS 33.0 FEET NORTH OF THE HIGH WATER LINE AND 19.6 FEET EAST OF A STANDARD METAL WITNESS POST AND MARKER AND ABOUT THE SAME ELEVATION AS THE STATION.  HEIGHT OF LIGHT ABOVE STATION MARK 2.0 METERS.
