markers.description: BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1932 (ERM) THIS STATION WAS FOUND WASHED OUT.  THE CONCRETE MASS FORMING THE SURFACE MARK HAS BEEN UNDERMINED BY WATER, CAUSING IT TO FALL OVER.  IT IS POSSIBLE THAT THE OLD POSITION CAN BE REPRODUCED FROM THE TRIPOD LEGS, THE BUTTS OF WHICH ARE STILL STANDING, AND CONNECTION MADE FROM NEW STATION.                            STATION RECOVERY (1946)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1946 (ELJ) THREE HOURS SPENT SEARCHING FOR THE STATION.  IT SHOULD BE CONSIDERED AS LOST.

BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1932 (CDM) STATION IS LOCATED AT MAHONS LIGHT, ABOUT 3 MILES E OF LITTLE CREEK, DELAWARE.  SURFACE, UNDERGROUND, AND REFERENCE MARKS ARE STANDARD BRONZE DISKS SET IN CONCRETE.  REFERENCE MARK NO.1 IS ABOUT 1/4 MILE E OF STATION, ON A POINT OF LAND ACROSS MAHONS RIVER FROM STATION.  REFERENCE MARK NO.2 IS 121.6 FEET S OF STATION, ABOUT 8 METERS W OF ROAD.  REFERENCE MARK NO.3 IS U.S.C. AND G.S. STANDARD BENCH MARK, DESIGNATED H 3 1931.  IT IS 72.0 FEET W OF STATION ABOUT 3 FEET N OF INCLINED DRIVE LEADING TO GARAGE.  TO REACH IT, GO E FROM DOVER ON DIVISION STREET 4.3 MILES TO LITTLE CREEK, TURN N ON DIRT ROAD AT W EDGE OF THE VILLAGE OF LITTLE CREEK.  MARK IS 64.2 FEET N OF NE CORNER OF PORCH OF THE LIGHTHOUSE BUILDING.  HEIGHT OF SIGNAL ABOVE STATION MARK - 37 METERS.                            STATION RECOVERY (1933)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1933 (GLA) THIS STATION WAS RECOVERED AND ALL MARKS FOUND IN GOOD CONDITION.  IT IS LOCATED AT MAHONS LIGHT WHICH IS ABOUT 3 MILES E OF LITTLE CREEK, DELAWARE.  STATION MARK IS 64.2 FEET N OF NE CORNER OF PORCH OF LIGHTHOUSE BUILDING.  STATION MARK, UNDERGROUND MARK, AND REFERENCE MARKS ARE BRONZE TABLETS SET IN CONCRETE. STATION MARK PROJECTS 5 INCHES ABOVE GROUND.  REFERENCE MARK NO.1 IS ABOUT 1/4 MILE E OF STATION, ON A POINT OF LAND ACROSS MAHONS RIVER FROM THE STATION.  REFERENCE MARK NO.2 IS 121.6 FEET S OF STATION, ABOUT 25 FEET W OF CENTER LINE OF SHELL ROAD.  REFERENCE MARK NO.3 IS A STANDARD U.S.C. AND G.S. BENCH MARK, STAMPED H3 - 1931.  IT IS 72.0 FEET W OF STATION, ABOUT 3 FEET N OF INCLINED DRIVE LEADING TO GARAGE.  ALL MARKS ARE IN SEMIMARSH EARTH AND ARE SUBMERGED BY FLOOD TIDES.  A 113-FOOT STEEL TOWER WAS ERECTED OVER THE STATION.  THIS STATION IS INACCESSIBLE BY TRUCK OR ORDINARY AUTOMOBILE AND ARRANGEMENTS SHOULD BE MADE WITH THE LIGHTHOUSE KEEPER TO MEET PARTIES IN BOAT OR SPECIAL CAR KEPT AT THE LIGHTHOUSE.  ARRANGEMENTS CAN BE MADE BY TELEPHONE.  TO REACH, GO E FROM DOVER ON DIVISION STREET 4.3 MILES TO LITTLE CREEK, TURN N ON DIRT ROAD AT W EDGE OF THE VILLAGE OF LITTLE CREEK AND CONTINUE TO LIGHTHOUSE.  (ROAD IS IN VERY POOR CONDITION).                            STATION RECOVERY (1946)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1946 (ELJ) STATION MARK AND REFERENCE MARKS 2 AND 3 WERE RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION.  REFERENCE MARK 1 WAS NOT FOUND.  DISTANCES TO REFERENCE MARKS 2 AND 3 WERE MEASURED AND FOUND TO BE CORRECT.  THE 1932 DESCRIPTION IS ADEQUATE EXCEPT FOR THE FOLLOWING CHANGES--  DELETE DESCRIPTION OF REFERENCE MARK 1.  ADD REFERENCE MARK 1 LOST.  CHANGE LETTER W IN DESCRIPTION OF REFERENCE MARK 2 TO E.  THE 1933 RECOVERY NOTES ARE MORE ADEQUATE THAN THE 1932 DESCRIPTION.                            STATION RECOVERY (1963)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1963 (RRG) THE STATION AND THE REFERENCE MARK WAS SEARCHED FOR BUT NOT RECOVERED.  THERE HAS BEEN CONSIDERABLE EROSION AND DESTRUCTION AT THE DESCRIBED LOCATION.                            STATION RECOVERY (1969)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1969 (JKW) R.M. 3 WAS RECOVERED.  IT IS AWASH AT HIGH WATER AS IT IS 32.0 FEET EAST OF HIGH-WATER LINE.  NONE OF THE OTHER MARKS COULD BE FOUND.  ALL ARE BELIEVED TO HAVE BEEN WASHED-OUT.  THE MARK IS LOCATED AT THE OLD ABANDONED COAST GUARD STATION AT PORT MAHON AND CAN BE EASILY REACHED BY TRUCK.                            STATION RECOVERY (1970)  RECOVERY NOTE BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 1970 (LFS) STATION AND REFERENCE MARK NO. 2 WERE SEARCHED FOR BUT NOT RECOVERED.  NO ATTEMPT WAS MADE TO REACH REFERENCE MARK NO. 1 AS A BOAT IS REQUIRED.  IT WAS REPORTED IN 1946 BY E.L.J. THAT REFERENCE MARK NO. 1 WAS NOT FOUND.  REFERENCE MARK NO. 3, BENCH MARK H 3 1931, WAS RECOVERED BUT THE MARK IS COVERED BY WATER AT HIGH TIDE AND ALMOST ENTIRELY EXPOSED.  AIRLINE DISTANCE AND DIRECTION FROM NEAREST TOWN 3 MILES EAST OF LITTLE CREEK.                            STATION RECOVERY (1973)  RECOVERY NOTE BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 1973 (LFS) REFERENCE MARK TWO WAS RECOVERED AT LOW TIDE.  THE MONUMENT WAS LEANING.  IT IS SURROUNDED BY WATER AT LOW TIDE.  REFERENCE MARK 1 WAS FOUND ON ITS SIDE.  THE DISK WAS REMOVED.  THE STATION MARKS FALLS OUT IN THE BAY UNDER ABOUT 6 FEET OF WATER AT LOW TIDE.  THE AREA AROUND THE STATION MARK APPEARS TO HAVE BEEN WASHED AWAY AND THE MARK WAS LOST.  THE AZIMUTH MARK WAS NOT FOUND AND IT IS BELIEVED IN A SWAMP.  THE STATION CAN BE CONSIDERED LOST.  AIRLINE DISTANCE AND DIRECTION FROM NEAREST TOWN AT MAHON LIGHT.                            STATION RECOVERY (1974)  RECOVERY NOTE BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 1974 (GTB) RECOVERED BY PLS.  REFERENCE MARK 2 WAS FOUND DESTROYED.  THE MARK WAS FOUND LYING ON ITS SIDE AT THE EDGE OF DELAWARE BAY.  EROSION HAD WASHED IT OUT.  ITS LOCATION WAS APPROXIMATELY 100 FEET S.E. OF THE S.E. CORNER OF THE ABANDONED COAST GUARD STATION AT PORT MAHON, DELAWARE.  THE DISC HAS BEEN REMOVED.

markers.description: BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1933 (GLA) THIS STATION IS THE INITIAL DELAWARE-PENNSYLVANIA STATE BOUNDARY MONUMENT OF THE CIRCULAR BOUNDARY BETWEEN THE TWO STATES AT THE DELAWARE RIVER SHORE ON THE DELAWARE-PENNSYLVANIA SIDE OF THE RIVER.  REFERENCE MARK NO.1 AND REFERENCE MARK NO.2 ARE STANDARD BRONZE DISKS SET IN CONCRETE.  REFERENCE MARK NO.1 IS ALONG SW FENCE LINE OF QUARANTINE STATION PROPERTY AND PROJECTS ABOUT 5 INCHES ABOVE SURFACE OF GROUND.  IT IS APPROXIMATELY N OF STATION 119 FEET.  REFERENCE MARK NO.2 IS ALONG THE SW FENCE LINE OF QUARANTINE STATION PROPERTY AND PROJECTS ABOUT 5 INCHES ABOVE THE GROUND.  IT IS APPROXIMATELY NE OF STATION 78 FEET.  THE FOLLOWING INSCRIPTIONS ARE CARVED ON THE SIDES OF MONUMENT.  EAST--1892  SOUTH DELAWARE THOMAS F. BAYARD, JOHN F. HOFECKER, B.L. LEWIS, M.D.--  WEST FIELD WORK EXECUTED BY UNITED STATES COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY  NORTH PENNSYLVANIA WAYNE MAC VEATCH, WM. H. MILLER, R. EMMET MONAGHAN, COMMISSIONER BENJ. H. SMITH, SURVEYOR.  TO REACH FROM EITHER WILMINGTON OR CHESTER, PENNSYLVANIA, TAKE U.S. HIGHWAY 13 TO POINT WHERE IT CROSSES THE DELAWARE-PENNSYLVANIA STATE LINE.  FROM HERE PROCEED 0.4 MILES NE (TOWARD PHILADELPHIA) AND TURN RIGHT (SE) ON BLACK SURFACED ROUGH ROAD WHICH FOLLOWS ALONG THE S SIDE OF PURE OIL COMPANY REFINERY PROPERTY AT MARCUS HOOK.  FOLLOW THIS ROAD ABOUT 0.4 MILE AND TURN RIGHT INTO THE U.S. QUARANTINE STATION.  THE MONUMENT IS ABOUT 50 FEET SW OF THE WIRE FENCE ALONG THE SW SIDE OF THE QUARANTINE STATION PROPERTY, ABOUT 10 FEET IN FROM THE HIGH-WATER LINE (EDGE OF BANK) IN AN AREA COVERED BY BRUSH AND TREES.  THE MONUMENT IS OF GRANITE, ABOUT 10 INCHES SQUARE ON TOP AND TAPERS TO ABOUT 15 INCHES AT BOTTOM, AND IS ABOUT 5 FEET HIGH.  STANDARD DISK IN DRILL HOLE IN TOP OF MONUMENT.  BORELLI, DEPOT, AND MALLOW SEXT. ARE VISIBLE FROM GROUND.  NOT KNOWN IF STATION HAS BEEN PREVIOUSLY OCCUPIED AND DESCRIBED.  HEIGHT OF SIGNAL ABOVE STATION MARK - 77 FEET.                            STATION RECOVERY (1946)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1946 (ELJ) STATION AND REFERENCE MARKS 1 AND 2 RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION.  DISTANCES TO REFERENCE MARKS WERE MEASURED AND FOUND TO BE CORRECT.  THE 1933 DESCRIPTION IS ADEQUATE EXCEPT FOR THE FOLLOWING CHANGES--  ADD TO DESCRIPTION OF REFERENCE MARK 1 IT IS ONE FOOT FROM THE FENCE.  ADD TO DESCRIPTION OF REFERENCE MARK 2 IT IS ONE FOOT FROM THE FENCE.  DELETE BLACK-SURFACED ROUGH ROAD.  ADD CONCRETE ROAD.  DELETE INTO THE U.S. QUARANTINE STATION.  ADD ALONG FENCE BETWEEN U.S. QUARANTINE STATION AND PROPERTY OF SUN OIL COMPANY.  FOLLOW THIS ROAD TO SUN OIL COMPANYS PUMP HOUSE.  PUMP HOUSE IS IN A WIRE FENCE ENCLOSURE.  THE STATION IS PLAINLY VISIBLE IN NW CORNER OF THIS ENCLOSURE.                            STATION RECOVERY (1957)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1957 (JCE) STATION RECOVERED AS DESCRIBED EXCEPT FOR THE FOLLOWING--REFERENCE MARK NO. 2 WAS NOT FOUND.  THE SUN OIL COMPANY HAS PURCHASED THE OLD QUARANTINE AREA AND IT IS UNDERSTOOD THAT IT IS GOING TO BE TORN DOWN FOR THE EXPANSION OF THE SUN OIL COMPANY.  A NEW TO REACH FOLLOWS--  TO REACH FROM THE PHILADELPHIA NATIONAL BANK AT MARKET STREET AND W. 10TH STREET IN MARCUS HOOK--GO SW ON U.S. HIGHWAY 13 FOR 0.6 MILE TO THE SUN OIL COMPANY AUTOMOTIVE LABORATORY.  TURN LEFT, S, AND GO 0.3 MILE, TURN RIGHT ON DIRT ROAD AT A NEW FILL ABOUT 100 YARDS BEFORE REACHING THE OLD U.S. QUARANTINE STATION AND JUST AFTER CROSSING A SINGLE RAILROAD TRACK, GO 0.25 MILE ON THIS DIRT ROAD SW TO A BRICK PUMPHOUSE JUST W OF THE W FENCE OF THE OLD QUARANTINE STATION AND THE 5 FOOT MONUMENT AND STATION.

BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1946 (ELJ) STATION RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION.  ACCORDING TO LOCAL AUTHORITY STATION IS IN ORIGINAL POSITION.                            STATION RECOVERY (1975)  RECOVERY NOTE BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 1975 (RST) THE PROMINENT SQUARE CONCRETE TOWER IS ON PROPERTY BELONGING TO THE USCG AT 313 LIGHTHOUSE ROAD NEAR THE COMMUNITY OF BELLEFONTE AND THE INDUSTRIAL PLANTS AT EDGEMOORE, DELAWARE.                            STATION RECOVERY (2004)  RECOVERY NOTE BY GEOCACHING 2004 (WD) THE LIGHT SITS ATOP A 100-FOOT TALL CONCRETE TOWER THAT STANDS IN A RSIDENTIAL NEIGHBORHOOD IN THE EDGEMOOR SECTION OF BELLFONTE, DELAWARE.  THE TOWER IS LOCATED ABOUT 100 FEET (30.5 M) SOUTHEAST OF BRANDYWINE BLVD AND ABOUT 100 FEET (30.5 M) NORTHWEST OF LIGHTHOUSE ROAD, ABOUT 0.45 MILES (0.72 KM) NORTHEAST OF THE INTERSECTION OF BRANDYWINE BLVD AND EDGEMOOR ROAD STATE HIGHWAY 3.  TO REACH THE STATION FROM THE STATE HIGHWAY 3 INTERCHANGE ON INTERSTATE HIGHWAY 95 NORTHEAST OF WILMINGTON, DELAWARE, GO SOUTH-SOUTHEAST ON STATE HIGHWAY 3 (MARSH ROAD) FOR 1.1 MILES (1.77 KM), CONTINUE SOUTHEAST ON STATE HIGHWAY 3 (EDGEMOOR ROAD) FOR 0.18 MILES (0.29 KM), THEN NORTHEAST ON BRANDYWINE BLVD FOR 0.45 MILES (0.72 KM) TO THE LIGHT ON THE RIGHT.                            STATION RECOVERY (2010)  RECOVERY NOTE BY GEOCACHING 2010 (LPC) RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION.

BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1932 (CDM) LOCATED AT MARVELS CROSSROADS, ABOUT 7.2 MILES SE OF MILFORD, DELAWARE, ON THE ROAD FROM MILFORD TO LEWES, DELAWARE.  MARK IS ABOUT 75 YARDS S OF THE FARMHOUSE ON THE PROPERTY OF MR. G.D. MARVEL.  27 FEET W OF CENTER LINE OF CONCRETE HIGHWAY.  24.5 FEET N OF NW CORNER OF N HEAD WALL OF CONCRETE CULVERT.  SURFACE, UNDERGROUND, AND REFERENCE MARKS ARE STANDARD BRONZE DISKS SET IN CONCRETE.  REFERENCE MARK NO.1 IS 138.6 FEET E OF STATION.  IN FENCE LINE.  ABOUT 6 METERS S OF GRAVEL ROAD.  REFERENCE MARK NO.2 IS 188.7 FEET S OF STATION.  ABOUT 27 FEET W OF CENTER LINE OF CONCRETE HIGHWAY.  REFERENCE MARK NO.3 IS ABOUT 1/2 MILE N OF STATION, ABOUT 10 METERS E OF CENTER LINE OF CONCRETE HIGHWAY.  HEIGHT OF SIGNAL ABOVE STATION MARK - 38 METERS.                            STATION RECOVERY (1943)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1943 (FLG) RECOVERED AS DESCRIBED WITH THE FOLLOWING ADDITIONAL INFORMATION --  1.  REFERENCE MARK 1 IS 138.59 FEET (42.242 METERS).  2.  REFERENCE MARK 2 IS 188.74 FEET (57.528 METERS).  3.  REFERENCE MARK 1 TO REFERENCE MARK 2 IS 179.35 FEET (54.666 METERS).                            STATION RECOVERY (1961)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1961 (JKW) STATION AND R.M. 1 AND 2 COULD NOT BE FOUND.  HEAVY CONSTRUCTION IN THIS AREA HAS PROBABLY DESTROYED THESE STATIONS ACCORDING TO LOCAL RESIDENTS.  THESE MARKS SHOULD BE CLASSIFIED LOST.  R.M. 3 WAS RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION.  THE MARK WAS STAMPED MARVEL NO 3 1932.  A NEW DESCRIPTION FOLLOWS.  THE R.M. IS LOCATED ABOUT 6.7 MILES S.E. OF MILFORD, DEL. ON STATE HWY NO. 14.  IT IS 25 FT. EAST OF THE CENTER LINE OF THE HWY 14, 72 FT. EAST INTERSECTION OF A NORTH AND SOUTH FENCE RUNNING WEST, AND 6 FT. WEST OF THE SECOND SYCAMORE TREE SOUTH OF TELEPHONE POLE NO. 26.                            STATION RECOVERY (1962)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1962 (CFO) NO EVIDENCE OF ANY OF THE MARKS WAS LOCATED.  THE HIGHWAY HAS BEEN WIDENED AND THE CROSSROAD MENTIONED CHANGED, PROBABLY ALL MARKS HAVE BEEN DESTROYED AT THIS STATION.                            STATION RECOVERY (2012)  RECOVERY NOTE BY DELAWARE COASTAL PROGRAM 2012 MARK NOT FOUND.

markers.description: BY MARYLAND DOT HIGHWAY ADMINISTRATION 2002 (SFK) THE STATION IS LOCATED ON THE MARYLAND-DELAWARE LINE ABOUT 10 MI (16.09 KM) WEST OF DOVER DELAWARE, 1.5 MI (2.41 KM) EAST OF TEMPLEVILLE, MARYLAND.  TO REACH THE STATION FROM THE INTERSECTION OF STATE HIGHWAY 302 AND STATE HIGHWAY 454 IN TEMPLEVILLE, GO NORTHEAST ALONG STATE HIGHWAY 302 FOR 1.1 MI (1.77 KM) TO A DRIVEWAY LEADING SOUTHEAST.  TURN RIGHT AND GO SOUTHEAST FOR 0.15 MI (0.24 KM) TO A BRICK HOUSE ON THE LEFT AND THE STATION LOCATED IN THE CENTER OF THE DRIVEWAY.  THE STATION IS A STANDARD DISK CEMENTED IN A DRILL HOLE IN A LARGE CONCRETE SLAB IN THE CENTER OF THE FARM LANE.  IT IS 73.2 FT (22.3 M) NORTHEAST OF STATION MARYDEL, 81.8 FT (24.9 M) NORTHEAST OF THE NORTHEAST CORNER OF A 2 1/2 STORY FARM HOUSE, 77.4 FT (23.6 M) NORTHEAST OF THE NORTH CORNER OF AN OUT-DOOR FIRE PLACE, 37.8 FT (11.5 M) SOUTHWEST OF THE NORTHWEST CORNER OF THE BRICK HOUSE.                            STATION RECOVERY (2007)  RECOVERY NOTE BY GEOCACHING 2007 (WD) RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION.
markers.setting: SET IN A PAVEMENT SUCH AS STREET, SIDEWALK, CURB, ETC.

markers.description: BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1909 (ES) THIS STATION IS ON THE N SIDE OF A WOODED RIDGE ON THE INDIAN RIVER NECK.  IT IS ON LAND OWNED BY C.E. MASSEY AND IS ABOUT SW FROM THE OLD FARMHOUSE OF PETER J. MASSEY.  STATION MARK IS COPPER TRIANGULATION-STATION MARK SET IN CEMENT 3 FEET BELOW SURFACE, COVERED WITH SAND AND ABOVE IT A CONCRETE BLOCK, IN WHICH IS SET 1-INCH GALVANIZED-IRON PIPE 18 INCHES LONG, IN WHICH IS FASTENED A COPPER TRIANGULATION MARK.  REFERENCE MARK NO.1 IS CEMENT POST WITH BOTTLE TO MARK CENTER.  REFERENCE MARK NO.2 IS CEMENT POST WITH CIRCLE AND NAIL TO MARK CENTER.  IT MAY BE REACHED FROM REHOBOTH OR OCEAN VIEW BY WATER OR BY LAND FROM THE RAILROAD.                            STATION RECOVERY (1932)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1932 (ERM) STATION AND REFERENCE MARKS ARE IN GOOD CONDITION.  PROPERTY NOW OWNED BY MR. CLAY MASSEY.  TO REACH THE STATION TAKE ROAD FROM MILLSBORO TO REHOBOTH TO JUNCTION OF THIS ROAD WITH ROAD ONTO HARBESON, ABOUT 6 MILES FROM MILLSBORO.  THIS DIRT ROAD IS KNOWN AS THE LONG NECK ROAD.                            STATION RECOVERY (1932)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1932 (CDM) THE STATION WAS DISCOVERED AS DESCRIBED BY MR. EDWIN SMITH.  THE TRIANGULATION STATION MARK WAS NOT CHANGED BUT STANDARD REFERENCE DISKS WERE ESTABLISHED IN PLACE OF THE BOTTLE AND NAIL WHICH MARKED THE OLD REFERENCE MARKS.  A REFERENCE MARK IS A STANDARD BRONZE DISK SET IN CONCRETE WAS ESTABLISHED AS AN AZIMUTH MARK ABOUT 0.6 MILE N BY W OF THE STATION ON MR. JOSHUA HICHENS PLACE.  IT IS ACROSS A SLOUGH FROM THE STATION AND IS REACHED FROM THE STATION BY TAKING THE FIRST ROAD LEADING RIGHT FROM THE ROAD BACK TO THE JUNCTION.  THIS ROAD LEADS INTO MR. HICHENS YARD. THE REFERENCE MARK IS AT THE SW CORNER OF THE MOST SOUTHERLY ONE OF A GROUP OF THREE OUT HOUSES.  STATION IS REACHED BY LEAVING THE MAIN HIGHWAY BETWEEN MILLSBORO, DELAWARE AND REHOBOTH, DELAWARE, AT THE JUNCTION OF THIS ROAD AND THE ROAD FROM INDIAN RIVER NECK TO HARBESON TURNING E ON THE INDIAN RIVER NECK ROAD.  THE ABOVE DESCRIBED JUNCTION IS ABOUT 6.5 MILES FROM MILLSBORO.  CONTINUE ON THE DIRT ROAD ABOUT 5.6 MILES TO THE END OF THE ROAD AT MR. MASSEYS PLACE.  ANYONE AT MR. MASSEYS CAN POINT OUT THE EXACT LOCATION OF THE STATION WHICH IS ABOUT 200 YARDS FROM THE MASSEY BARN.                            STATION RECOVERY (1943)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1943 (FLG) RECOVERED AS DESCRIBED, EXCEPT FOR THE FOLLOWING DISCREPANCIES--  1.  REFERENCE MARK 1 IS 37.14 FEET OR 11.321 METERS E OF THE STATION.  2.  REFERENCE MARK 2 IS 45.60 FEET OR 13.900 METERS SW OF THE STATION.  3.  FROM REFERENCE MARK 1 TO REFERENCE MARK 2 IT IS 60.89 FEET OR 18.560 METERS.  4.  REFERENCE MARK 3 (AZIMUTH MARK) IS NOW LOCATED ABOUT 50 FEET NE OF AN OLD ABANDONED HOUSE, AND 6 FEET SE OF AN OLD CHICKEN HOUSE, ON BLUFF POINT.                            STATION RECOVERY (1962)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1962 (JKW) THE STATION AND REFERENCE MARKS 1, 2, AND 3 WERE RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION.  DISTANCES BETWEEN STATION AND RMS 1 AND 2 WERE CHECKED AND FOUND CORRECT.  A NEW DESCRIPTION AS FOLLOWS--  THE STATION IS LOCATED ON THE NORTH SIDE OF A WOODED RIDGE ON THE INDIAN RIVER NECK, ABOUT 6 MILES SOUTH SOUTHWEST OF REHOBETH BEACH, ABOUT 2.5 MILES NORTHWEST OF INDIAN RIVER INLET, AND ABOUT 0.2 MILE WEST OF MASSEYS LANDING.  IT IS 550.0 FEET SOUTHWEST FROM THE END OF A BLACK TOP ROAD, 526.0 FEET EAST OF THE FIRST POINT OF WOODS ON THE SOUTH SIDE OF THE BLACK TOP ROAD, 365.0 FEET SOUTHWEST OF THE CENTERLINE INTERSECTION OF A PRIVATE DRIVEWAY, 92.0 FEET SOUTH OF THE CENTERLINE OF ROAD, 66.0 FEET SOUTHWEST OF A POWER POLE, 51.0 FEET SOUTH OF THE ROADWAY BANK AND 3.0 FEET EAST OF AN IRON WITNESS POST. THE STATION IS A STANDARD DISK, STAMPED MASSEY 1909-1932 SET IN TOP OF A 12 INCH ROUND CONCRETE MONUMENT WHICH IS FLUSH WITH THE GROUND.  RM 1 IS EAST OF THE STATION, 112.0 FEET SOUTH OF CENTERLINE OF THE ROAD AND 76.0 FEET SOUTH OF A POWER POLE.  IT IS MARKED BY A STANDARD DISK STAMPED MASSEY NO 1 1909 SET IN THE TOP OF A 12 INCH ROUND CONCRETE MONUMENT WHICH PROJECTS 12 INCHES ABOVE THE GROUND.  RM 2 IS SOUTHWEST OF THE STATION, 112.0 FEET SOUTHWEST OF A POWER POLE AND 131.0 FEET SOUTH OF CENTERLINE OF THE ROAD.  IT IS MARKED BY A STANDARD DISK STAMPED MASSEY NO 2 1909 SET IN THE TOP OF A 12 INCH ROUND CONCRETE MONUMENT WHICH PROJECTS 3 INCHES ABOVE THE GROUND.  RM 3 IS NORTHWEST OF THE STATION, 58.0 FEET SOUTHEAST OF THE NEAREST HOLLY BUSH, 50.0 FEET NORTHWEST OF THE SOUTHEAST CORNER OF AN OLD HOUSE AND 2.5 FEET SOUTH OF A 2 INCH SASSAFRAS BUSH.  TO REACH AZIMUTH MARK FROM THE STATION, TRAVEL WEST ON LONG NECK ROAD FOR 0.4 MILE TO FIRST ROAD ON THE RIGHT, TURN RIGHT ON UNPAVED ROAD AND GO ABOUT 0.6 MILE TO AN OLD HOUSE AND MARK.  TO REACH THE STATION FROM THE INTERSECTION OF STATE HIGHWAYS 14 AND 24 (WHICH IS ABOUT 3.0 MILES NORTHWEST OF REHOBETH BEACH), GO WEST ON STATE HIGHWAY 24 FOR 8.0 MILES TO LONG NECK ROAD, THEN TURN LEFT (EAST) AND GO 5.3 MILES TO STATION SITE.                            STATION RECOVERY (1962)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1962 (RWT) THE STATION MARK, REFERENCE MARKS 1 AND 2 WAS RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION.  THE AZIMUTH MARK WAS SEARCHED FOR BUT NOT RECOVERED.  A NEW AZIMUTH MARK WAS ESTABLISHED.  THE PROPERTY IS NOW OWNED BY MR. L.P. FAUCETT OF GEORGETOWN DELAWARE.  A NEW TO REACH FOLLOWS--  TO REACH THE STATION FROM LEWES, GO SOUTHWEST ON STATE HIGHWAY 18 FOR 2.0 MILES TO THE JUNCTION OF STATE HIGHWAY 14, TURN LEFT AND GO SOUTHEAST ON HIGHWAY 14 FOR 2.4 MILES TO THE JUNCTION OF STATE HIGHWAY 24, TURN RIGHT AND GO SOUTHWEST ON STATE HIGHWAY 24 FOR 7.5 MILES TO THE JUNCTION OF STATE HIGHWAY 5, TURN LEFT AND GO EASTERLY ON A MACADAM ROAD FOR 5.3 MILES TO THE STATION ON THE RIGHT.  THIS IS 0.1 MILE BEFORE REACHING MASSEY LANDING.  TO REACH THE AZIMUTH MARK FROM THE STATION, GO NORTH-NORTHEAST ACROSS A CULTIVATED FIELD FOR 0.15 MILES TO THE NORTHEAST EDGE OF THE FIELD AND THE AZIMUTH MARK AS DESCRIBED.  THE AZIMUTH MARK IS A STANDARD DISK STAMPED MASSEY 1909 RESET 1962, SET IN TOP OF A SQUARE CONCRETE MONUMENT WHICH PROJECTS ABOUT 2 INCHES ABOVE THE GROUND SURFACE.  IT IS 2.7 FEET SOUTH-SOUTHEAST OF A STANDARD METAL WITNESS POST AND MARKER, 12.0 FEET NORTH-NORTHWEST OF A 6-INCH WILD CHERRY TREE, 12.0 FEET NORTHEAST OF THE NORTHEAST CORNER OF THE CULTIVATED FIELD AND 27.0 FEET SOUTH OF A 12-INCH CEDAR TREE.  HEIGHT OF LIGHT ABOVE STATION MARK 34.01 METERS.                            STATION RECOVERY (1970)  RECOVERY NOTE BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 1970 (JKW) STATION MARK AND RMS 1 AND 2 WERE RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION.  THE AZIMUTH MARK WAS NOT SEARCHED FOR.  THE 1962 RECOVERY NOTE BY R.W.T. IS ADEQUATE WITH THE FOLLOWING ADDITIONS--STATION IS LOCATED IN THE WOODS, ABOUT 0.2 MILES WEST-SOUTHWEST OF THE MARINA AND ACROSS THE ROAD FROM THE EAST EDGE OF A CULTIVATED FIELD.  AIRLINE DISTANCE AND DIRECTION FROM NEAREST TOWN 6 MILES SSW OF REHOBOTH BEACH.                            STATION RECOVERY (2009)  RECOVERY NOTE BY DELAWARE DEPARTMENT OF TRANSPORTATION 2009 (BRC) RECOVERED AS DESCRIBED.
markers.setting: SET IN TOP OF CONCRETE MONUMENT
markers.stability: MAY HOLD, BUT OF TYPE COMMONLY SUBJECT TOSURFACE MOTION

markers.description: BY NATIONAL OCEAN SERVICE 1983 (WVH) THE STATION IS LOCATED IN DELAWARE CITY AT THE NORTH END OF THE JUNCTION OF THE CHESAPEAKE AND DELAWARE CANAL CUT AND DELAWARE RIVER, AT A PARK-LIKE AREA ON THE WATERFRONT.  TO REACH THE STATION FROM THE JUNCTION OF DE 9 AND COX NECK LANE IN DELAWARE CITY, GO NORTHEAST ON CLINTON STREET TO ITS END AT A PARK-LIKE AREA AND THE STATION IN THE GRASS AT THE EASTERNMOST CORNER OF THE PARK.  THE STATION IS A STANDARD NOS DISK STAMPED---MAXEY 1983---, SET INTO THE TOP OF A ROUND CONCRETE MONUMENT 19 CM IN DIAMETER FLUSH WITH GROUND.  IT IS LOCATED ABOUT 5.5 METERS (18 FT) SOUTHWEST FROM THE NORTHEASTERN BULKHEAD, 3.85 METERS (12.63 FT) NORTHWEST FROM THE SOUTHEASTERN BULKHEAD, AND 1.10 METERS (3.61 FT) SOUTH FROM A STANDARD NOS WITNESS POST SIGN.  HEIGHT OF LIGHT SHOWN ABOVE THE MARK WAS 1.57 METERS.                            STATION RECOVERY (2005)  RECOVERY NOTE BY GEOCACHING 2005 (WD) A CONCRETE WALL AND PIPE-RAILING WAS ADDED TO THE DESCRIBED BULKHEAD IN 2004, AND ADDITIONAL FILL WAS ADDED TO THE ENCLOSED PARK AREA.  THE STATION WAS NOT VISIBLE AT THE SURFACE AND THERE WAS NO WITNESS POST IN THE VICINITY.                            STATION RECOVERY (2013)  RECOVERY NOTE BY DELAWARE COASTAL PROGRAM 2013 MARK NOT FOUND.

markers.description: BY NATIONAL OCEAN SERVICE 1982 (RHH) THE STATION IS LOCATED IN THE DELAWARE RIVER ON THE CONCRETE PLATFORM SUPPORTING DEEPWATER RANGE FRONT LIGHT.  TO REACH THE STATION FROM THE MOUTH OF THE CHRISTINA RIVER, GO SOUTH ON THE DELAWARE RIVER TO THE DEEPWATER RANGE FRONT LIGHT JUST SOUTH OF THE DELAWARE MEMORIAL BRIDGE.  THE STATION IS A STANDARD NOS DISK STAMPED---MCMANN 1982---, SET INTO THE TOP OF AND FLUSH WITH THE CONCRETE LIGHT BASE.  IT IS LOCATED ON THE SOUTHWEST CORNER OF THE PLATFORM.  HEIGHT OF LIGHT SHOWN ABOVE THE MARK WAS 1.53 METERS.

markers.description: BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1935 (JB) THIS IS A FIRST-ORDER STATION LOCATED ON THE SUMMIT OF POLLY DRUMMOND HILL, APPROXIMATELY 2-3/4 MILES NE OF NEWARK, DELAWARE, AND 1-5/8 MILES E OF MILFORD CROSSROADS ON PROPERTY OF MR. L.B. WIGGINS.  IT IS IN THE NW CORNER OF CROSSROADS, 39.4 FEET NW OF NE CORNER OF HOUSE AND 40.4 FEET N OF SW CORNER OF SAME HOUSE WHICH IS OWNED BY MR. RICHARD W. COOPER.  IT IS LOCATED 13 PACES W OF CENTER LINE OF MAIN ROAD AND 6 PACES N OF ROAD TO MR. COOPERS GARAGE.  SURFACE, UNDERGROUND, REFERENCE AND AZIMUTH MARKS ARE STANDARD BRONZE DISKS SET IN CONCRETE AS DESCRIBED IN NOTES 1, 7 AND 11A.  REFERENCE MARK NO.1 IS 47.610 METERS N OF STATION, SET IN CONCRETE AND PROJECTS 4 INCHES.  REFERENCE MARK NO.2 IS E OF STATION 31.607 METERS AND IS SET IN CONCRETE.  IT PROJECTS 4 INCHES.  AZIMUTH MARK IS 0.4 MILE N OF STATION, 6 PACES S OF FENCE CORNER, 6 PACES E OF CENTER OF ROAD, AND 1 PACE S OF POWER POLE NO. 52.  IT PROJECTS 2 INCHES.  TO REACH STATION FROM NEWARK, DELAWARE, GO E ON ROUTE 273, 0.3 MILE FROM TRAFFIC LIGHT AT NORTH CHAPEL AND MAIN STREETS, BEAR LEFT ON U.S. HIGHWAY 2 AND GO 1.9 MILES TO CROSSROADS (CEMETERY AND CHURCH IN NW CORNER), TURN LEFT ON MACADAM ROAD WHICH CHANGES TO DIRT IN ABOUT 0.2 MILE AND GO 1.0 MILE TO STATION.  A 90-FOOT TOWER CLEARED ALL LINES OBSERVED.                            STATION RECOVERY (1948)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1948 (BK) THIS STATION IS DESTROYED DURING GRADING OF NEW CONSTRUCTION IN AREA.                            STATION RECOVERY (1952)  RECOVERY NOTE BY US GEOLOGICAL SURVEY 1952 THIS MARKER IS AT PRESENT LYING ON GROUND NEAR HOLE.  THE MONUMENT WAS ACCIDENTLY PLOWED OUT OF GROUND.  BOTH THE MONUMENT AND MARKER ARE IN GOOD CONDITION BUT NEED RESETTING BEFORE STATION IS LOST.                            STATION RECOVERY (1958)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1958 (JCE) REFERENCE MARKS NO. 1 AND 2 AND AZIMUTH MARK WERE RECOVERED AS DESCRIBED IN 1935 DESCRIPTIONS.  STATION MARK WAS FOUND DESTROYED ON THE CUT EMBANKMENT ABOUT 30 FEET FROM THE ORIGINAL POSITION.  THE UNDER GROUND MARK WAS RECOVERED BY C. F. ODGERS IN 1956 AND WAS REPORTED IN GOOD CONDITION.  AS IRON ROD WAS DRIVEN IN THE GROUND AT THIS POINT AND THE MONUMENT CONTACTED.  HOWEVER MR. SHAKESPEAE (PROPERTY OWNER) DID NOT WANT HIS LAWN DUG UP SO IT WAS DECIDED TO RELOCATE A NEW SURFACE MARK AT MEETING HOUSE HILL 1845 AND NOTHING FURTHER WAS DONE AT MEETING HOUSE HILL 2 1935.  TO REACH FROM THE JUNCTION OF STATE HIGHWAYS NO. 2, 72 AND 273 IN NEWARK, GO EASTERLY ON STATE HIGHWAY NO. 2 AND 273 FOR 0.75 MILES TO JUNCTION OF STATE HIGHWAYS NO. 2 AND 273.  CONTINUE STRAIGHT AHEAD THROUGH UNDERPASS AND GO NORTH THENCE EASTERLY ON CAPITOL TRAIL FOR 1.7 MILES TO CROSSROADS AT CEMETERY ON LEFT (NORTH) SIDE OF ROAD.  TURN LEFT AND CONTINUE NORTHERLY ON SURFACE ROAD FOR 1.0 MILE TO TOP OF HILL AND STATION IS LOCATED ON LEFT IN LAWN.  CONTINUE NORTHERLY ON SURFACE ROAD FOR 0.4 MILE TO AZIMUTH MARK NEAR POWERLINE POLE ON EAST SIDE OF ROAD.                            STATION RECOVERY (1991)  RECOVERY NOTE BY US POWER SQUADRON 1991 (EHK) RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION.                            STATION RECOVERY (2003)  RECOVERY NOTE BY US POWER SQUADRON 2003 (DWG) DESCRIPTION IS INADEQUATE WITH NO MEASUREMENTS TO MARK.  ROAD IMPROVEMENTS IN AREA.

markers.description: BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1881 ON THE HIGHEST PART OF THE HILL, IN THE NORTHERN CORNER OF THE CROSSROADS, ON LAND BELONGING TO JOSEPH GILBERT.  STATION IS 73.2 FEET FROM LARGE OAK TREE ON OPPOSITE SIDE OF ROAD AND DIRECTLY BEHIND HOUSE IN WESTERN CORNER OF CROSSROADS.  69.4 FEET FROM CENTER OF ROAD LEADING TOWARD THE N, AND ABOUT 250 METERS FROM GRAND VIEW.  MARKING NOT KNOWN.                            STATION RECOVERY (1935)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1935 (JB) STATION RECOVERED.  ORIGINAL DESCRIPTION OBSOLETE AND INDEFINITE WITH CONFLICTING AND QUESTIONABLE MEASUREMENTS.  THE STATION WAS RECOVERED BY ESTABLISHING A NEW STATION AND COMPUTING INVERSELY.  THE EARTHENWARE CONE, WITH A WAGON BOLT IN ITS CENTER WAS RECOVERED 2-1/2 FEET BELOW THE SURFACE OF THE GROUND.  THE NEW MEASUREMENTS ARE ALL MADE FROM THE CENTER OF THE WAGON BOLT IN THE CONE.  A CONNECTION WAS MADE TO THE NEW STATION.  THE CONE WAS BROKEN BY A CROWBAR WHILE DIGGING SO THE STATION WAS RE-MARKED BY A STANDARD DISK SET IN CONCRETE, THE TOP BEING 2.0 FEET BELOW THE SURFACE OF THE GROUND.  THE CONCRETE WAS POURED INTO THE HOLE.  ALL MEASUREMENTS TO THE BOLT IN THE CENTER OF THE CONE WERE MADE WHILE ITS ORIGINAL POSITION WAS INTACT.  THE DISK WAS CAREFULLY CENTERED OVER THE OLD STATION.  STATION IS REACHED FROM INTERSECTION OF NORTH CHAPEL AND MAIN STREETS IN NEWARK, DEL. BY GOING E ON MAIN STREET 0.3 MILE, THEN BEAR LEFT ON U.S. HIGHWAY 2, GO 1.9 MILE TO CROSSROADS (CEMETERY AND CHURCH IN NW CORNER).  TURN LEFT ON MACADAM ROAD (WHICH CHANGES INTO A DIRT ROAD IN ABOUT 0.2 MILE) AND GO 1.0 MILE TO TOP OF POLLY DRUMMOND HILL AND STATION.  1935 MEASURMENTS.  DISTANCE FROM STATION TO MEETING HOUSE HILL (2) 1935.  11.725 METERS (38.470 FEET).  DISTANCE FROM STATION TO CENTER LINE OF N-S ROAD.  71.0 FEET.  *DISTANCE FROM STATION TO EXTENSION OF W FENCE LINE ON N-S ROAD.  50.5 FEET.  DISTANCE FROM STATION TO NW CORNER OF BRICK CHIMNEY ON N SIDE OF HOUSE.  62.0 FEET.  *DISTANCE FROM STATION TO NE CORNER OF OLD BARN.  40.4 FEET.  DISTANCE FROM STATION TO CENTER LINE OF E-W ROAD.  16.0 FEET.  DISTANCE FROM STATION TO E-W BARB-WIRE FENCE.  7.9 FEET.  DISTANCE FROM STATION TO CORNER FENCE POST ON PROPERTY LINE W OF W SIDE OF BARN.  63.5 FEET.  STATION IS NOW ON PROPERTY OWNED BY MR. L.B. WIGGINS.  THE HOUSE NEAR THE STATION IS OWNED BY MR. RICHARD W. COOPER.  THE STANDARD DISK, MARKING THE STATION, WAS STAMPED MHH 1841-1935.  MHH STANDS FOR MEETING HOUSE HILL AND THE DATE 1841 WAS STAMPED BY MISTAKE FOR 1845.  *ONLY ORIGINAL MEASUREMENTS TO CHECK.                            STATION RECOVERY (1958)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1958 (JCE) STATION RECOVERED AS DESCRIBED BY J.B. JR. IN 1935.  A NEW SURFACE MARK AND REFERENCE MARKS NO. 3 AND 4 WERE ESTABLISHED.  THE AZIMUTH MARK FOR MEETING HOUSE HILL 2 1935 IS VISIBLE FROM GROUND AND WAS USED AS AZIMUTH MARK.  DUE TO LOCATION OF STATION, A TOWER COULD NOT BE BUILT OVER THE MARK.  THEREFORE AN ECCENTRIC POINT WAS OCCUPIED.  A COMPLETE NEW DESCRIPTION FOLLOWS--  STATION IS LOCATED IN A LAWN ON PROPERTY OF MR. E. SHAKESPEARE ON THE SUMMIT OF POLLY DRUMMOND HILL ABOUT 2-3/4 MILES NORTHEAST OF NEWARK AND ABOUT 8-1/2 MILES WEST-SOUTHWEST OF WILMINGTON.  STATION IS 20 FEET NORTH-NORTHEAST OF APPROXIMATE CENTERLINE OF DRIVEWAY, 55 FEET NORTH OF NORTHWEST CORNER OF THE HOUSE, 32 FEET EAST-NORTHEAST OF UTILITY POLE, 14-1/2 FEET EAST-NORTHEAST OF APPROXIMATE CENTERLINE OF DRIVEWAY AND 71 FEET WEST OF APPROXIMATE CENTERLINE OF ROAD.  THE MARK IS A STANDARD STATION DISK SET IN A 12X12 INCH CONCRETE MONUMENT, FLUSH WITH THE GROUND AND THE DISK IS STAMPED MEETING HOUSE HILL 1845 1935 1958.  NOTE--1A 7A.  REFERENCE MARK NO. 4 IS 25 FEET NORTHWEST OF THE NORTHWEST CORNER OF HOUSE, 15 FEET EAST-NORTHEAST OF THE NORTHEAST CORNER OF GARAGE AND 15 FEET SOUTH-SOUTHEAST OF APPROXIMATE CENTERLINE OF DRIVEWAY.  THE MARK IS A STANDARD REFERENCE DISK SET IN A DRILL HOLE IN THE CONCRETE SIDEWALK.  THE MARK IS SET FLUSH AND THE DISK IS STAMPED MEETING HOUSE HILL NO 4, 1845.  REFERENCE MARK NO. 3 IS 22 FEET WEST OF APPROXIMATE CENTERLINE OF ROAD, 23-1/2 FEET NORTH OF APPROXIMATE CENTERLINE OF DRIVEWAY, 47-1/2 FEET NORTH OF NORTHEAST CORNER OF HOUSE AND 38 FEET SOUTH OF A TELEVISION ANTENNA POLE.  THE MARK IS A STANDARD DISK SET IN A 12X12 INCH CONCRETE MONUMENT, FLUSH WITH THE GROUND AND THE DISK IS STAMPED MEETING HOUSE HILL NO 3 1845.  NOTE--11A  AZIMUTH MARK IS 16 FEET EAST OF APPROXIMATE CENTERLINE OF ROAD, 19 FEET SOUTH OF FENCE CORNER 1 FOOT WEST OF FENCELINE AND 2 FEET SOUTHEAST OF POWERLINE POLE NO. 52.  THE MARK IS A STANDARD AZIMUTH MARK DISK SET IN A 12X12 INCH CONCRETE MONUMENT, PROJECTS 6 INCHES AND THE DISK IS STAMPED MEETING HOUSE HILL 2 1935.  NOTE--16A.  TO REACH FROM THE JUNCTION OF STATE HIGHWAYS NO. 2, 72 AND 273 (S. CHAPEL ST. AND DELAWARE AVE.) IN NEWARK, GO EASTERLY ON STATE HIGHWAYS NO. 2 AND 273 FOR 0.75 MILE TO JUNCTION OF STATE HIGHWAYS NO. 2 AND 273.  KEEP STRAIGHT AHEAD THRU UNDER PASS ON CAPITOL TRAIL AND GO NORTH THENCE EASTERLY FOR 1.7 MILE TO SIDE ROAD LEFT AT CEMETERY ON LEFT.  TURN LEFT AND GO NORTHERLY ON SURFACED ROAD FOR 1.0 MILE TO TOP OF HILL AND STATION ON LEFT IN LAWN AS DESCRIBED.                            STATION RECOVERY (1991)  RECOVERY NOTE BY US POWER SQUADRON 1991 (EHK) RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION.

markers.description: BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1958 (JEG) THE STATION IS LOCATED ABOUT 4 MILES SOUTHEAST OF THE POST OFFICE IN WILMINGTON AND 4 MILES NORTHEAST OF THE NEW CASTLE COUNTY-WILMINGTON AIRPORT, ON THE WEST BRIDGE ABUTMENT OF THE DELAWARE MEMORIAL BRIDGE OVER THE DELAWARE RIVER.  IN THE APPROXIMATE CENTER OF THE SIDEWALK WHERE IT IS WIDER OVER THE BRIDGE ABUTMENT THAT SUPPORTS THE CABLE ON THE NORTH SIDE OF THE BRIDGE.  THE STATION IS 102 FEET EAST OF A 45 MILE SPEED LIMIT SIGN, 19 FEET WEST OF THE WEST END OF THE STEEL CABLE HOUSING, 7 FEET SOUTH OF THE CONCRETE BANISTER AND 5 FEET NORTH OF THE NORTH EDGE OF THE CURBING.  TO REACH THE STATION FROM THE TOLL GATES OF THE DELAWARE MEMORIAL BRIDGE.  GO EAST ON U.S. HIGHWAY 40 FOR 1.25 MILES TO THE LARGE ABUTMENT WHERE THE SIDEWALK GETS WIDER AND THE STATION ON THE LEFT, NORTH, SIDE OF THE BRIDGE, AS DESCRIBED.  THE AZIMUTH MARK IS IN THE LARGE CONCRETE PROCTOR DIVIDER AT THE EAST SIDE OF TOLL BOOTH NUMBER 8, AS DESCRIBED.  THE STATION MARK, A STANDARD DISK STAMPED MEMORIAL 1958, IS SET IN A DRILL HOLE WITH CONCRETE IN THE TOP OF A CONCRETE SIDEWALK FLUSH WITH THE SURFACE OF THE SIDEWALK.  REFERENCE MARK NUMBER 1, A STANDARD DISK STAMPED MEMORIAL NO 1 1958, IS SET IN A DRILL HOLE WITH CONCRETE IN THE TOP OF A CONCRETE SIDEWALK FLUSH WITH THE SURFACE OF THE SIDEWALK.  IT IS 11 FEET NORTH OF THE CONCRETE CURBING AND 6 INCHES SOUTH OF THE NORTH CONCRETE BANISTER AND 3 FEET WEST OF THE WEST END OF THE STEEL CABLE HOUSING.  REFERENCE MARK NO 2, A STANDARD DISK STAMPED MEMORIAL NO 2 1958, IS SET IN A DRILL HOLE WITH CONCRETE FLUSH WITH THE SURFACE OF THE SIDEWALK.  IT IS 11 FEET NORTH OF THE NORTH EDGE OF THE CURBING AND 6 INCHES SOUTH OF THE CONCRETE BANISTER.  THE AZIMUTH MARK, A STANDARD DISK STAMPED MEMORIAL 1958, IS SET IN A DRILL HOLE WITH CONCRETE IN THE TOP OF A LARGE CONCRETE PROCTOR DIVIDER, WHICH PROJECTS ABOUT 3-FEET ABOVE THE SURFACE OF THE PAVEMENT.  IT IS 4 FEET EAST OF THE EAST SIDE OF TOLL GATE BOOTH NUMBER 8.                            STATION RECOVERY (1965)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1965 (JCB) THE STATION, AZIMUTH MARK AND REFERENCE MARKS 1 AND 2 WERE RECOVERED AS DESCRIBED AND FOUND IN GOOD CONDITION.  NO MEASUREMENTS WERE CHECKED DUE TO INABILITY TO PARK ON THE BRIDGE.  NOTE--STOPPING ON BRIDGE BY POLICE CARS ONLY.
markers.setting: SET IN A PAVEMENT SUCH AS STREET, SIDEWALK, CURB, ETC.
markers.stability: MARK OF QUESTIONABLE OR UNKNOWN STABILITY

markers.description: BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1962 (RWT) THE STATION IS LOCATED ABOUT 5.0 MILES SOUTH OF REHOBOTH BEACH AND 2.5 MILES NORTH OF THE INDIAN RIVER INLET.  ON THE PROPERTY OWNED BY THE STATE.  TO REACH THE STATION FROM THE POST OFFICE IN REHOBOTH BEACH, GO SOUTH ON CITY ROUTE 14, FOR 1.4 MILES TO THE JUNCTION OF BYPASS HIGHWAY 14, CONTINUE SOUTH ON HIGHWAY 14 FOR 3.6 MILES TO A TALL STEEL TOWER ON THE LEFT AND STATION.  STATION IS A STANDARD DISK STAMPED METAL 1962, SET IN 10 X 10 INCH SQUARE CONCRETE MONUMENT, THAT IS FLUSH WITH THE GROUND.  IT IS 10.5 FEET SOUTHEAST OF THE NORTHWEST LEG OF THE TOWER.  10.0 FEET SOUTHWEST OF THE NORTHEAST LEG OF THE TOWER.  11.0 FEET NORTHWEST OF THE SOUTHEAST LEG OF THE TOWER.  11.0 FEET NORTHEAST OF THE SOUTHWEST LEG OF THE TOWER.  REFERENCE MARK NO. 1 IS A STANDARD DISK STAMPED METAL NO. 1 1962, SET IN A 10 X 10 INCH SQUARE CONCRETE MONUMENT, PROJECTING 6 INCH FROM THE GROUND.  IT IS 1.4 FEET WEST OF A STANDARD METAL WITNESS POST.  44.4 FEET SOUTH OF A FOUR LEGGED TOWER 48.5 FEET SOUTH OF THE SOUTHEAST LEG OF THE TOWER.  REFERENCE MARK NO. 2 IS A STANDARD DISK STAMPED METAL NO 2 1962, SET IN A 12 X 12 INCH SQUARE CONCRETE MONUMENT, THAT IS FLUSH WITH THE GROUND.  IT IS 1.9 FEET SOUTH OF A STANDARD METAL WITNESS POST.  46.0 NORTHWEST OF THE NORTHWEST OF LEG OF TOWER.  51.7 FEET NORTHWEST OF THE SOUTHWEST LEG OF THE TOWER.  300 FEET EAST OF DIRT ROAD.  HEIGHT OF LIGHT ABOVE STATION MARK 1.32 METERS.                            STATION RECOVERY (1966)  RECOVERY NOTE BY LOCAL ENGINEER (INDIVIDUAL OR FIRM) 1966 (RTF) RECOVERED BY BE BEAVIN CO.  STATION AND R.M. 2 FOUND IN GOOD CONDITION.  R.M. 1 LAYING OVER ON ITS SIDE.  REHOBOTH TANK IS VISIBLE FROM GROUND.                            STATION RECOVERY (1970)  RECOVERY NOTE BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 1970 (JKW) LOST.  THE STEEL TOWER HAS BEEN TORN DOWN, BUT ITS FOOTINGS STILL REMAIN.  A BROKEN MONUMENT WAS FOUND WHICH IS BELIEVED TO HAVE BEEN THE STATION MARK.  RM 1 WAS REPORTED DESTROYED IN 1966.  RM 2 WAS RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION.  THE ORIGINAL DESCRIPTION IS ADEQUATE FOR THE RECOVERY OF THE RM WITH THE FOLLOWING ADDITION--IT IS ABOUT 250 FEET EAST OF EAST LANE OF PAVED ROAD.  AIRLINE DISTANCE AND DIRECTION FROM NEAREST TOWN 5 MILES SOUTH REHOBOTH BEACH.                            STATION RECOVERY (1972)  RECOVERY NOTE BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 1972 (LFS) THE STATION WAS SEARCHED FOR BUT NOT FOUND.  REFERENCE MARK 1 WAS NOT FOUND.  THEY WERE BELIEVED DESTROYED DURING THE DEMOLITION OF THE LOOKOUT TOWER WHICH WAS IN THE AREA OF THIS STATION.  REFERENCE MARK 2 WAS RECOVERED AND FOUND IN GOOD CONDITION.  A ATTEMPT WAS MADE AT THIS TIME TO RE-CONSTRUCT THE STATION BUT TRIANGULATION STATION ROUND 1962 COULD NOT BE GOTTEN INTO.  (SEE DESCRIPTION THEREOF) IN THE FUTURE IF ACCESS TO STATION ROUND IS GOTTEN THIS STATION WILL BE RE-ESTABLISHED WITH THE DISTANCE TO THE LONE REFERENCE MARK AND THE DIRECTION TO ROUND 1962.  THERE IS NO OTHER OBJECTS VISIBLE FROM THE GROUND.  AIRLINE DISTANCE AND DIRECTION FROM NEAREST TOWN 5 MILES SOUTH OF REHOBOTH BEACH.

THE STATION IS THE CENTER OF THE BRIDGES N ELEVATED COUNTERPOISE STRUCTURE. BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1943 (RLS) THE STATION IS A GREY STANDPIPE OF THE MIDDLETOWN WATERWORKS IN THE NE QUARTER OF TOWN, 12 METERS N OF LAKE STREET, AND ABOUT 32 METERS W OF COCKS STREET.                            STATION RECOVERY (2000)  RECOVERY NOTE BY US POWER SQUADRON 2000 RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION.                            STATION RECOVERY (2006)  RECOVERY NOTE BY GEOCACHING 2006 (APC) STATION OBSERVED IN NORTHWEST QUADRANT OF THE INTERSECTION OF LAKE STREET AND COX STREET.   STANDPIPE IS NOW A FADED BLUE-GREEN COLOR.

BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1909 (ES) THIS STATION IS ON A SLIGHT ELEVATION OF SAND ABOUT 1/4 MILE N OF THE HALF-WAY HOUSE BETWEEN REHOBOTH LIFE SAVING STATION AND THE INDIAN RIVER LIFE SAVING STATION.  IT IS VERY MUCH NEARER THE OCEAN THAN REHOBOTH BAY.  WHEN THE SIGNAL IS GONE AND THE MARKS COVERED WITH SAND IT WILL BE BEST LOCATED BY DIRECTIONS TO THE LIFE SAVING STATION AND OTHER TRIANGULATION STATIONS.  THE MARKS ARE AS FOLLOWS--A COPPER TRIANGULATION STATION MARK SET IN CEMENT 1/2 FOOT BELOW SURFACE AND COVERED WITH SAND.  ABOVE THIS IS A CEMENT BLOCK IN WHICH IS SET 1-INCH GALVANIZED-IRON PIPE 18 INCHES LONG IN WHICH IS FASTENED A COPPER TRIANGULATION MARK.  NO REFERENCE MARK WAS PUT IN.                            STATION RECOVERY (1920)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1920 (HAS) SIGNAL ERECTED IN 1919 STILL STANDING AND USED AS A HYDROGRAPHIC SIGNAL IN 1920.  SITE NOT VISITED.                            STATION RECOVERY (1934)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1934 (JCT) NO TRACE OF STATION OR REFERENCE MARKS COULD BE FOUND AFTER A THOROUGH SEARCH OVER A LARGE AREA IN THE VICINITY.  IF THE STATION STILL EXISTS, ALL OF THE MARKS ARE COVERED BY SAND.  NO EFFORT WAS MADE TO LOCATE THE EXACT POSITION OF THE OLD STATION BY PLANE TABLE OR OTHER MEANS.

markers.description: BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1935 (JB) THIS IS A FIRST-ORDER STATION, LOCATED ABOUT 2-1/2 MILES N OF NEWARK, DELAWARE, 11 MILES WSW OF CENTER OF WILMINGTON, DELAWARE, ON STATE HIGHWAY PROPERTY IN TRIANGULAR-SHAPED PIECE OF LAND AT THE INTERSECTION OF TWO ROADS AND 34.5 FEET SE OF THE CENTER OF THE ROAD, 17.5 FEET SW OF CENTER OF ROAD AND 30.5 FEET N OF CENTER OF ROAD.  IT IS SET FLUSH WITH THE SURFACE OF THE GROUND.  SURFACE, UNDERGROUND, REFERENCE AND AZIMUTH MARKS ARE STANDARD BRONZE DISKS SET IN CONCRETE AS DESCRIBED IN NOTES 1A, 7A AND 11A.  REFERENCE MARK NO.1 IS SET IN CONCRETE 22.5 FEET E OF ROAD GOING N, 75 FEET NE OF N POINT OF TRIANGLE, 1 FOOT W OF FENCE, AND 37.109 METERS NE OF STATION.  IT PROJECTS 4 INCHES.  REFERENCE MARK NO.2 IS SET IN CONCRETE 33.452 METERS SE OF STATION, 42.5 FEET NE OF E POINT OF TRIANGLE, 4 FEET W OF TELEPHONE POLE AND 1 FOOT S OF FENCE.  IT PROJECTS 2 INCHES.  AZIMUTH MARK IS LOCATED APPROXIMATELY 0.3 MILE SW OF STATION IN YARD OF ABANDONED HOUSE, FORMERLY THE RANKIN FARM, NOW OWNED BY HALLECK DUPONT.  AZIMUTH MARK IS LOCATED APPROXIMATELY AT INTERSECTION OF TWO ROWS OF MAPLE TREES, 10 PACES E OF 36-INCH TREE, 15 PACES NW OF 4-FOOT TREE AND 35 PACES E OF NE CORNER OF HOUSE.  TO REACH FROM STATION, GO 100 YARDS W TO DIRT ROAD LEFT, TURN LEFT AND FOLLOW STRAIGHT ROAD 0.3 MILE TO AZIMUTH MARK.  TO REACH STATION FROM STRICKERSVILLE, PA., GO S ON ROUTE 796, 0.2 MILE TO MACADAM ROAD LEFT, TURN LEFT AND GO 1.8 MILES TO T-ROAD, TURN RIGHT AND GO 1.1 MILES TO STATION SITE.  A 90-FOOT TOWER CLEARED ALL LINES.  NO CUT-INS V.G.                            STATION RECOVERY (1961)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1961 (RWT) THE STATION MARK, REFERENCE MARKS NUMBER 1 AND 2 WAS RECOVERED AS DESCRIBED AND FOUND TO BE IN GOOD CONDITION.  THE AZIMUTH MARK WAS SEARCHED FOR BUT NOT RECOVERED.  IT IS BELIEVED TO OF BEEN DESTROYED BY CONSTRUCTION OF A GOLF COURSE.  A NEW AZIMUTH MARK WAS ESTABLISHED.  A COMPLETE DESCRIPTION FOLLOWS--  TO REACH THE STATION FROM THE EASTERN SECTION OF NEWARK, GO NORTH ON STATE HIGHWAY 72 AND CHAPPEL STREET FOR 2.25 MILES TO A CROSS ROAD AND A LARGE FACTORY ON THE LEFT, TURN LEFT AND GO WEST-NORTHWEST ON A CONCRETE HIGHWAY FOR 0.45 MILE TO A Y-FORK AND THE STATION AS DESCRIBED.  TO REACH THE AZIMUTH MARK FROM THE STATION, GO NORTH-NORTHEAST ON A NARROW CONCRETE DRIVEWAY FOR 0.17 MILE TO THE AZIMUTH MARK ON THE RIGHT AS DESCRIBED.  THE AZIMUTH MARK, A STANDARD REFERENCE MARK DISK STAMPED MILFORD AZI 1961, IS SET IN TOP OF A SQUARE CONCRETE MONUMENT WHICH PROJECTS 1 INCH ABOVE THE GROUND SURFACE AND DESCRIBED BY NOTE 11A.  IT IS 1.8 FEET SOUTH-SOUTHWEST OF A STANDARD METAL WITNESS POST AND MARKER, 8.2 FEET WEST-NORTHWEST OF A FENCE LINE, 20.7 FEET EAST-SOUTHEAST OF THE APPROXIMATE CENTER OF THE CONCRETE DRIVE WAY AND 34.1 FEET NORTHEAST OF A TELEPHONE POLE NUMBER 23.  HEIGHT OF LIGHT ABOVE STATION MARK 30 METERS.                            STATION RECOVERY (1983)  RECOVERY NOTE BY US POWER SQUADRON 1983 (JCK) AZIMUTH MARK 1961 WAS RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION.  BOOK DESCRIPTION GOOD BUT FACTORY SHOULD BE REPLACED BY OPPOSITE DUPONT ENGINEERING BLDGS LOUVIER, AT PRESENT MARKER AS UNDER WIRE FENCE, ABOUT 20 FEET S OF THE Y ENTRANCE TO 9 FEET RD.                            STATION RECOVERY (1992)  RECOVERED 1992 RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION.                            STATION RECOVERY (2001)  RECOVERY NOTE BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 2001 (DB) THIS REPORT WAS SUBMITTED BY THE US POWER SQUADRONS.                            STATION RECOVERY (2003)  RECOVERY NOTE BY US POWER SQUADRON 2003 (RBG) CHANGE DESCRIPTION - THERE IS NO LONGER A WITNESS POST, NO FENCE, AND NO TELEPHONE POLE.  POWER IN THE AREA IS NOW UNDERGROUND CABLE.                            STATION RECOVERY (2004)  RECOVERY NOTE BY GEOCACHING 2004 (WD) RECOVERY NOTE BY GEOCAC (WD) STATION MARK NOT FOUND.  REFERENCE MARKS NUMBER 1 AND 2 AND AZIMUTH MARK WERE FOUND IN GOOD CONDITION. THE TRIANGULAR PIECE OF LAND FORMED BY THE INTERSECTION OF THOMPSON STATION ROAD AND NINE FOOT ROAD HAS BEEN BISECTED BY A PAVED EXTENSION OF NINE FOOT ROAD. REFERENCE MARK NUMBER 1 WAS RECOVERED AS DESCRIBED. REFERENCE MARK NUMBER 2 WAS LOCATED ABOUT 17.0 FEET (5.18M) NORTHWEST OF UTILITY POLE 43063 42492 AND ABOUT 12 FEET (3.65 M) NORTH OF A WOOD RAIL FENCE. THE AZIMUTH MARK WAS RECOVERED AS DESCRIBED.                            STATION RECOVERY (2013)  RECOVERY NOTE BY DELAWARE COASTAL PROGRAM 2013 THE NEW AZIMUTH MARK THAT WAS ESTABLISHED IN 1961 WAS RECOVERED.

markers.description: BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1962 (RWT) THE STATION IS LOCATED ABOUT 2.0 MILES EAST OF LEWES, DELAWARE, ON THE TOP AND CENTER OF AN OLD ABANDONED U.S. ARMY ARTILLERY RANGE CONTROL TOWER ABOUT 60.0 FEET IN HEIGHT AND ON THE U.S. ARMY FORT MILES RESERVATION.  TO REACH THE STATION FROM THE POST OFFICE IN LEWES, DELAWARE.  GO EAST ON MAIN STREET FOR 0.05 MILE TO THE INTERSECTION OF GILLS NECK ROAD AND SAVANNAH ROAD.  TURN LEFT AND GO NORTHEAST ON SAVANNAH ROAD FOR 0.47 MILE TO A FORK, FORT MILES ROAD.  TAKE THE RIGHT HAND FORK AND GO SOUTHEAST ON FORT MILES ROAD FOR 1.62 MILES TO THE MAIN GUARD GATE INTO THE FORT MILES RESERVATION. PASS THROUGH THE GATE AND GO EAST ABOUT 50.0 FEET ON POST LANE TO THE INTERSECTION OF ENGINEER ROAD ON THE RIGHT.  TURN RIGHT AND GO SOUTH ON ENGINEER ROAD FOR 0.29 MILE TO THE INTERSECTION OF ENGINEER ROAD AND ORDINANCE ROAD AND THE AZIMUTH MARK IN THE SOUTHEAST ANGLE OF THE INTERSECTION. CONTINUE SOUTH ON ENGINEER ROAD FOR 0.16 MILE TO A T-INTERSECTION OF HIGH ROAD AND ENGINEER ROAD.  TURN RIGHT AND GO SOUTHWEST ON HIGH ROAD FOR 0.07 MILE TO THE INTERSECTION OF STUMP ROAD AND ENGINEER ROAD.  TURN RIGHT AND GO WEST ON STUMP ROAD FOR 0.07 MILE TO A TRACK ROAD AND SILO NO. 573 AND THE STATION AS DESCRIBED.  THE STATION MARK, A STANDARD DISK STAMPED MILITARY 1962, IS SET IN A DRILL HOLE WITH CONCRETE IN THE TOP AND CENTER OF THE CONCRETE SILO ROOF ABOUT 3 INCHES LOWER THAN THE TOP OF THE CONCRETE ROOF IN A 10-INCH SQUARE HOLE.  IT IS 10.0 FEET FROM THE EDGE OF THE ROOF AND 9.0 FEET FROM THE GUARD RAIL WHICH IS ABOUT 3.0 FEET HIGH AROUND THE TOP OF THE ROOF.  REFERENCE MARK 1, A STANDARD DISK STAMPED MILITARY NO 1 1962, IS SET IN THE TOP OF A 10-INCH SQUARE CONCRETE MONUMENT PROJECTING ABOUT 3 INCHES ABOVE THE SURFACE OF THE GROUND.  IT IS 83.0 FEET SOUTHWEST OF THE WEST EDGE OF BLDG. NO. T560, 45.0 FEET SOUTH OF THE CENTERLINE OF STUMP ROAD, 26.8 FEET NORTH OF A POWERLINE POLE WITH NO NUMBER AND 5.0 FEET NORTH OF A STANDARD METAL WITNESS POST AND MARKER.  REFERENCE MARK 2, A STANDARD DISK STAMPED MILITARY NO 2 1962, IS SET IN THE TOP OF A 10-INCH SQUARE CONCRETE MONUMENT PROJECTING ABOUT 4 INCHES ABOVE THE SURFACE OF THE GROUND.  IT IS 136.0 FEET NORTH OF THE CENTERLINE OF STUMP ROAD, 92.0 FEET NORTHEAST OF THE NORTH ONE OF TWO ADJOINING POWERLINE POLE NO. B119 WHICH ARE ABOUT 12.0 FEET APART, 80.6 FEET NORTHWEST OF POWERLINE POLE NO. 4 AND 3.8 FEET EAST OF A STANDARD METAL WITNESS POST AND MARKER.  AZIMUTH MARK, A STANDARD DISK STAMPED MILITARY 1962, IS SET IN THE TOP OF A 10-INCH SQUARE CONCRETE MONUMENT PROJECTING ABOUT 5 INCHES ABOVE THE SURFACE OF THE GROUND.  IT IS 43.0 FEET SOUTH OF THE CENTERLINE OF ORDINANCE ROAD, 15.0 FEET EAST OF THE CENTERLINE OF ENGINEER ROAD, 8.2 FEET NORTH OF FIRE HYDRANT NO. 510, 3.0 FEET WEST OF POWERLINE POLE NO. B111 AND 1.8 FEET NORTH OF A STANDARD METAL WITNESS POST AND MARKER.  HEIGHT OF LIGHT ABOVE STATION MARK 2.0 METERS.                            STATION RECOVERY (1969)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1969 (JKW) THE TOWER, UPON WHICH STATION IS LOCATED, WAS RECOVERED.  R.M. 2 WAS RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION.  IT PROJECTS 1 FOOT ABOVE GROUND.  R.M. 1 WAS NOT RECOVERED BUT IS BELIEVED TO BE INTACT.  IT IS BURIED UNDER A LARGE SAND DUNE.  THE FORT MILES RESERVATION IS NOW CAPE HENLOPEN STATE PARK.  THE ORIGINAL DESCRIPTION IS ADEQUATE IN OTHER RESPECTS.                            STATION RECOVERY (1975)  RECOVERY NOTE BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 1975 (EAB) STATION MARK WAS RECOVERED AND IT WAS FOUND TO BE IN GOOD CONDITION.  THIS MARK IS SET IN A DRILL HOLE IN ABOUT THE CENTER OF A CONCRETE SILO ROOF THAT IS ABOUT 60 FEET TALL.  AT THIS TIME I FOUND A IRON DOOR HAD BEEN PUT AT THE ENTRANCE TO GO INTO THIS SILO WITH SOME OF THE IRON BARS MISSING.  BY PASSING THROUGH THE MISSING BARS WAS MY ENTRANCE WAY TO THIS STATION MARK.  I TALKED TO THE RANGER IN CHARGE AND HE MENTIONED THAT ANYONE IN NEED TO USE THIS MARK AND THEY COULD NOT GET TO THE TOP WAS TO CONTACT HIM.  HIS OFFICE IS ABOUT 0.35 MILE NORTH OF THIS STATION SITE.  REFERENCE MARK NO 1 WAS NOT RECOVERED.  REFERENCE MARK NO 2 WAS RECOVERED, BUT THE CONCRETE POST WITH THE DISK STILL INTACT WAS FOUND LYING FLAT WITH THE GROUND DESTROYED.  THE AZIMUTH MARK WAS FOUND TO BE IN GOOD CONDITION AS IT IS DESCRIBED IN THE 1962 DESCRIPTION.  TO REACH THE STATION SITE FROM IN THE EAST EDGE OF THE TOWN OF LEWES, AT THE ENTRANCE TO THE CAPE MAY-LEWES FERRY.  GO EASTERLY FOLLOWING THE PAVED ROAD FOR 0.9 MILE TO FORKS IN THE ROAD.  KEEP THE RIGHT FORK AND GO SOUTHERLY FOLLOWING A PAVED ROAD FOR 0.15 MILE TO A SIDE ROAD ON THE RIGHT AND THE RANGER OFFICE ABOUT 300 WEST.  CONTINUE ON FOR ABOUT 0.1 MILE TO ANOTHER SIDE ROAD ON THE RIGHT.   CONTINUE ON SOUTHERLY FOR 0.1 MILE TO FORKS IN THE ROAD, TAKE THE RIGHT FORK AND CONTINUE ON SOUTHWESTERLY FOR 0.15 MILE TO A GUARD SHELTER IN THE CENTER OF THE ROAD, CONTINUE ON FOR ABOUT 100 FEET TO A SIDE ROAD ON THE RIGHT, TURN RIGHT AND GO WEST FOR ABOUT 0.1 MILE TO THE STATION.
markers.setting: SET IN A MASSIVE STRUCTURE
markers.stability: PROBABLY HOLD POSITION/ELEVATION WELL

markers.description: BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1962 REFERENCE MARK 1, A STANDARD DISK STAMPED MILITARY NO 1 1962, IS SET IN THE TOP OF A 10-INCH SQUARE CONCRETE MONUMENT PROJECTING ABOUT 3 INCHES ABOVE THE SURFACE OF THE GROUND.  IT IS 83.0 FEET SOUTHWEST OF THE WEST EDGE OF BLDG. NO. T560, 45.0 FEET SOUTH OF THE CENTERLINE OF STUMP ROAD, 26.8 FEET NORTH OF A POWERLINE POLE WITH NO NUMBER AND 5.0 FEET NORTH OF A STANDARD METAL WITNESS POST AND MARKER.  TO REACH THE STATION SITE FROM IN THE EAST EDGE OF THE TOWN OF LEWES, AT THE ENTRANCE TO THE CAPE MAY-LEWES FERRY.  GO EASTERLY FOLLOWING THE PAVED ROAD FOR 0.9 MILE TO FORKS IN THE ROAD.  KEEP THE RIGHT FORK AND GO SOUTHERLY FOLLOWING A PAVED ROAD FOR 0.15 MILE TO A SIDE ROAD ON THE RIGHT AND THE RANGER OFFICE ABOUT 300 WEST.  CONTINUE ON FOR ABOUT 0.1 MILE TO ANOTHER SIDE ROAD ON THE RIGHT.  CONTINUE ON SOUTHERLY FOR 0.1 MILE TO FORKS IN THE ROAD, TAKE THE RIGHT FORK AND CONTINUE ON SOUTHWESTERLY FOR 0.15 MILE TO A GUARD SHELTER IN THE CENTER OF THE ROAD, CONTINUE ON FOR ABOUT 100 FEET TO A SIDE ROAD ON THE RIGHT, TURN RIGHT AND GO WEST FOR ABOUT 0.1 MILE TO THE STATION.

markers.description: BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1909 (ES) THIS IS ON THE HIGHEST LAND JUST S OF THE MOUTH OF MILLERS CREEK.  APPROACHING THE STATION BY WATER IT APPEARS TO BE AT A POINT OF WOODS BUT THESE WOODS ARE HAMMOCKS.  WHEN PLOTTED ON THE CHART IT WILL NOT BE DIFFICULT TO FIND.  STATION IS MARKED WITH A BOTTLE IN CEMENT 3 FEET BELOW SURFACE AND ABOVE THIS A BLOCK OF CEMENT WITH COPPER TRIANGULATION MARK FASTENED IN A 1-INCH GALVANIZED-IRON PIPE 18 INCHES LONG.  THE REFERENCE MARK IS NEAR THE WOODS AND IS A BOTTLE BOTTOM UP IN CEMENT 3 FEET BELOW SURFACE OVER WHICH IS A CEMENT POST FINISHED 8 INCHES SQUARE.                            STATION RECOVERY (1934)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1934 (JCT) NO TRACE OF STATION OR REFERENCE MARKS COULD BE FOUND AFTER AN EXTENSIVE SEARCH.  THIS STATION WAS UNDOUBTEDLY LOST IN 1929 WHEN SEARCHED FOR BY C.F. EHLERS, BUT SINCE NO RECOVERY NOTE WAS AVAILABLE, IT WAS SEARCHED FOR AGAIN BY THIS PARTY.  STATION MILLER CREEK 2, ESTABLISHED BY C.F. EHLERS IN 1929, IS IN THIS GENERAL LOCALITY.  STATION MILLERS CREEK, 1909, SHOULD BE REMOVED FROM THE RECORDS.                            STATION RECOVERY (1961)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1961 (ETJ) THE STATION WAS RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION.  REFERENCE MARK NO. 1 WAS THOROUGHLY SEARCHED FOR, BUT NOT FOUND.  TRACTORS HAVE BEEN WORKING IN THIS AREA AND THE REFERENCE MARK HAS PROBABLY BEEN DESTROYED.  REFERENCE MARK NO. 2 WAS NOT FOUND IN 1942, NOR BY THIS PARTY.  THE STATION IS 136 FT. N.E. OF 12 INCH TRIANGULAR BLAZED TREE.                            STATION RECOVERY (1962)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1962 (RMS) THE STATION MARK WAS RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION.  R.M. NO 1 COULD NOT BE RECOVERED.  TWO NEW REFERENCE MARKS WERE ESTABLISHED.  A COMPLETE NEW DESCRIPTION FOLLOWS--  THE STATION IS LOCATED ON LOWER MILLER NECK, SOUTH OF THE ENTRANCE TO MILLERS CREEK, AND JUST WEST OF THE NARROWS ON A WOODED RIDGE OF HIGH GROUND CALLED FOX RIDGE LYING IN THE MARSH IMMEDIATELY N OF GOOSE POND.  TO REACH THE STATION FROM THE INTERSECTION OF DEL. 361 AND 363 GO SOUTH ON DEL. 363.  TURN LEFT ON DEL. 364 AND GO 1.1 MILE TO FORK, TAKE LEFT FORK AND GO 0.6 MILE TO DIRT ROAD ON RIGHT AND DELAWARE STATE GAME RESERVATION SIGN.  TURN RIGHT ON DIRT ROAD FOR 1.0 MILE TO DIRT ROAD ON LEFT WITH SIGN TO STRAWBERRY LANDING.  TURN LEFT AND GO 0.6 MILE AND THEN, TURN RIGHT AND GO 0.2 MILE TO DIRT ROAD AND STATION SITE ON LEFT.  THE PREVIOUSLY UNSTAMPED STATION DISK WAS STAMPED *MILLER CREEK 2 1929 BY THIS PARTY.  THE DISK IS SET IN CONCRETE FLUSH WITH THE GROUND AT THE BASE OF A CHERRY TREE STUMP WHICH HAS 2 TWO-INCH CHERRY TREES GROWING NEXT TO IT.  IT IS 24 FT. N OF AN EAST-WEST ROAD, 157.0 FT. E OF A DIRT ROAD INTERSECTION AND 5 FEET NW OF A STANDARD WITNESS POST.  REFERENCE MARKS NO 3 AND NO 4 ARE STANDARD REFERENCE MARK DISKS SET IN 10-INCH SQUARE CONCRETE MONUMENTS FLUSH WITH THE GROUND AND STAMPED *MILLER CREEK 2 NO 3 1929 AND MILLER CREEK 2 NO 4 1929, RESPECTIVELY.  R.M. NO 3 IS SW OF STATION, 70 FEET SSELY OF DIRT ROAD INTERSECTION, 23 FEET E OF A NORTH-SOUTH ROAD, AND 6 FEET NE OF A 16-INCH PINE TREE.  R.M. NO 4 IS N OF THE STATION, 75 FEET NORTH OF A EAST-WEST ROAD, 170 FEET NE OF A DIRT ROAD INTERSECTION, AND 10 FEET SOUTH OF A MARSH POND.  *ALL MARKS WERE RESTAMPED MILLERS CREEK 1909 1962.                            STATION RECOVERY (1962)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1962 (JCE) STATION SURFACE AND UNDERGROUND MARKS WERE RECOVERED AND FOUND TO BE IN GOOD CONDITION.  A THOROUGH SEARCH WAS MADE FOR THE ORIGINAL REFERENCE MARK, STATION MILLER CREEK 2 1929, AND REFERENCE MARK NO. 1.  A TILE FULL OF CONCRETE WITH SIGNS OF A DISK HAVING BEEN REMOVED WAS FOUND ON TOP OF THE GROUND IN THE VICINITY.  FROM THE DESCRIPTION THIS COULD HAVE BEEN EITHER THE STATION MARK OF MILLER CREEK 1929 OR REFERENCE MARK NO. 1.  THIS STATION MARK AND TWO REFERENCE MARKS ESTABLISHED BY R.M. SUNDEAN WERE STAMPED IN ERROR AND HAVE BEEN CHANGED.  THE STATION AND REFERENCE MARKS 3 AND 4 ARE STAMPED MILLERS CREEK 1909 1962 INSTEAD OF MILLER CREEK 1929.  EXCEPT FOR THE CHANGE IN STAMPING THE 1962 DESCRIPTION BY R.M.S. WAS FOUND TO BE ADEQUATE.                            STATION RECOVERY (1962)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1962 (RWT) THE STATION MARK AND REFERENCE MARKS 3 AND 4 WERE FOUND TO BE IN GOOD CONDITION, AS DESCRIBED.  A NEW TO REACH IS AS FOLLOWS.  TO REACH THE STATION FROM THE JUNCTION OF STATE HIGHWAYS 14 AND 26 IN BETHANY BEACH DELAWARE, GO WEST FOR 0.1 MILE TO A SIDE ROAD LEFT AND BETHANY BEACH POST OFFICE, TURN LEFT AND GO SOUTH FOR 0.45 MILE TO A SIDE ROAD LEFT, CONTINUE AHEAD FOR 1.0 MILE TO A SIDE ROAD LEFT JUST AFTER CROSSING ASSAWOMAN CANAL, TURN LEFT AND GO 2.15 MILES TO A REVERSE Y FORK, CONTINUE AHEAD FOR 1.25 MILES TO A FORK AND SIGN CAMP BARNES TURN LEFT, EASTERLY, FOR 1.2 MILES TO A FORK AND SIGN CAMP BARNES WITH TOWN AND COUNTRY BEAUTY SALON ON THE RIGHT, TAKE LEFT FORK, NORTHEAST, AND GO 0.65 MILE TO A SAND ROAD RIGHT AND SIGN ASSAWOMAN WILDLIFE AREA, TURN RIGHT, EAST AND GO 0.4 MILE TO A SIDE ROAD LEFT AND SIGN SASSAFRAS LANDING, CONTINUE AHEAD, EASTERLY ON A SAND ROAD FOR 0.85 MILE TO A SMALL POND ON THE RIGHT AND A SIDE ROAD LEFT, TURN LEFT, AND ON SAND ROAD FOR 0.6 MILE TO SIDE ROAD RIGHT WITH A CHAIN ACROSS THE ROAD AND SIGN STATE GAME MANAGEMENT REFUGE, NO TRESPASSING, TURN RIGHT, SOUTHEAST FOR 0.2 MILE BETWEEN PONDS ON A ELEVATED ROAD TO A STAND OF PINE TREES AND A FORK, TAKE THE LEFT FORK FOR 250 FEET TO THE STATION AND A STANDARD METAL WITNESS POST ON THE LEFT.  HEIGHT OF LIGHT ABOVE STATION MARK 1.36 METERS.                            STATION RECOVERY (1975)  RECOVERY NOTE BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 1975 (EAB) THIS STATION SITE WAS RECOVERED BY USING THE 1962 TO REACH AND IT IS ADEQUATE.  STATION MARK WAS RECOVERED AND IT WAS STAMPED MILLERS CREEK 2 1909, IT SEEMS TO BE LEANING TO THE WEST SOME, NO ATTEMPT WAS MADE TO RECOVERED THE SUB-SURFACE MARK.  THIS MARK WAS FOUND TO BE 151.2 FEET NORTH OF A LONE PINE TREE WITH A 6.2 FEET CIRCUMFERENCE, 24.2 FEET NORTHWEST OF THE CENTER LINE OF A SAND TRACK ROAD, 1 FOOT WEST OF A STEEL WITNESS POST ABOUT 4 INCHES BELOW THE GROUND LEVEL.  REFERENCE MARK NO 3 WAS RECOVERED AND IT WAS FOUND TO BE IN GOOD CONDITION.  IT IS 64.0 FEET SOUTHEAST OF THE CENTER LINE OF A TRACK ROAD, 24.5 FEET EAST OF THE CENTER LINE OF ANOTHER SAND ROAD, 6 FEET NORTHEAST OF A LONE PINE TREE WITH A 6.2 FEET CIRCUMFERENCE AND 4 INCHES BELOW THE GROUND LEVEL.  REFERENCE MARK NO 4 WAS RECOVERED AND IT WAS FOUND TO BE IN GOOD CONDITION.  IT IS 9 FEET SOUTHEAST OF THE WATERS EDGE, 1 FOOT WEST OF A STEEL WITNESS POST, IN A BRUSH AREA.  AIRLINE DISTANCE AND DIRECTION FROM NEAREST TOWN 2.8 MILES SOUTH SOUTHWEST OF BETHANY BEACH.
markers.setting: SET INTO TOP OF METAL PIPE DRIVEN INTO GROUND
markers.stability: MARK OF QUESTIONABLE OR UNKNOWN STABILITY

markers.description: BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1929 (CFE) SAME APPROXIMATE LOCATION AS MILLER CREEK, 1909.                            STATION RECOVERY (1934)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1934 (JCT) STATION AND REFERENCE MARK RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION.  NO TRACE OF REFERENCE MARK NO. 2 COULD BE FOUND, AND IT HAS PROBABLY BEEN DESTROYED, AS ITS LOCATION WAS DETERMINED TO BE JUST OVER AN OLD FOX DEN THAT HAD RECENTLY BEEN DUG UP BY HUNTERS.  DESCRIPTION OF MILLER CREEK 2 SHOULD BE AS FOLLOWS--  ON LOWER MILLER NECK S OF THE ENTRANCE TO MILLERS CREEK, AND JUST W OF THE NARROWS.  LOCATED ON THE RIDGE OF HIGH GROUND CALLED FOX RIDGE LYING IN THE MARSH IMMEDIATELY N OF GOOSE POND.  THE RIDGE IS WOODED EXCEPT FOR A SMALL CLEARING ABOUT 100 METERS BACK FROM ITS EASTERN END.  THE STATION IS SET IN THE W EDGE OF THIS CLEARING NEXT THE TRUNK OF A DETACHED CHERRY TREE.  IT IS ABOUT 110 METERS NW FROM THE EDGE OF GOOSE POND, ABOUT 50 METERS SE FROM THE EDGE OF A SMALL POND ON THE N SIDE OF THE RIDGE, AND ABOUT 85 METERS NE FROM A THIRD AND STILL SMALLER POND LOCATED IN THE RIDGE ITSELF.  THE SURFACE-STATION MARK IS STANDARD BRONZE DISK SET IN A TILE AS DESCRIBED.  NO SEARCH WAS MADE FOR AN UNDERGROUND-STATION MARK, AND NONE IS LISTED ON THE ORIGINAL DESCRIPTION CARD.  REFERENCE MARK NO. 1 IS A STANDARD BRONZE DISK, SET IN CONCRETE, IN THE TOP OF A TILE AS DESCRIBED.                            STATION RECOVERY (1942)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1942 (WDP) THE STATION IS LOCATED ON LOWER MILLER NECK S OF THE ENTRANCE TO MILLERS CREEK, AND JUST W OF THE NARROWS, ON A WOODED RIDGE OF HIGH GROUND CALLED FOX RIDGE LYING IN THE MARSH IMMEDIATELY N OF GOOSE POND AT THE TRUNK OF A DETACHED CHERRY TREE BETWEEN TWO SMALL CLEARINGS, ABOUT 110 METERS NW FROM THE EDGE OF GOOSE POND, ABOUT 50 METERS SE FROM THE EDGE OF A SMALL POND ON THE N SIDE OF THE RIDGE, AND ABOUT 85 METERS NE FROM A THIRD AND STILL SMALLER POND LOCATED IN THE RIDGE ITSELF.  A WOODS ROAD GOES DIRECTLY TO THE STATION.  THE STATION IS A BRONZE DISK TRIANGULATION STATION MARK, NOT STAMPED, SET IN THE TOP OF AN IRREGULAR MASS OF CONCRETE WHICH IS VERY SLIGHTLY ELEVATED ABOVE THE SURFACE OF THE GROUND.  THE STATION IS IN GOOD CONDITION.  REFERENCE MARK NO. 1 IS LOCATED 5.970 METERS W OF THE STATION.  THE MARK IS A BRONZE DISK REFERENCE MARK, WITH THE ARROW POINTING TOWARD THE STATION, STAMPED NO.1 1929, SET IN THE TOP OF A 7 1/2-INCH ROUND CONCRETE MONUMENT, WHICH IS 2 INCHES BELOW THE SURFACE OF THE GROUND.  THE MARK IS IN GOOD CONDITION.  REFERENCE MARK NO. 2 WAS THOROUGHLY SEARCHED FOR.  ITS LOCATION WAS DETERMINED TO BE OVER AN OLD FOX DEN WHICH HAS BEEN DUG UP BY HUNTERS.  IT IS RECOMMENDED THAT THIS MARK BE CLASSIFIED AS DESTROYED.                            STATION RECOVERY (1962)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1962 (JCE) A THOROUGH SEARCH WAS MADE FOR STATION BUT IT WAS NOT RECOVERED.  A TILE FULL OF CONCRETE WITH SIGNS OF A DISK HAVING BEEN REMOVED WAS FOUND ON TOP OF THE GROUND IN THE VICINITY.  FROM THE DESCRIPTION THIS COULD HAVE BEEN EITHER THE STATION MARK OR REFERENCE MARK NO. 1.  THERE HAS BEEN CONSIDERABLE GRADING DONE AND A ROAD HAS BEEN BUILT IN THE VICINITY OF THE MARKS SO IT IS QUITE POSSIBLE THAT THE MARKS HAVE BEEN DESTROYED.
markers.setting: SET IN CONCRETE IN A CLAY TILE PIPE
markers.stability: MARK OF QUESTIONABLE OR UNKNOWN STABILITY

markers.description: BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 2019 STATION IS A GPS CORS. markers.description: BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1934 (JCT) STATION RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION.  LOCATED IN SOUTHERN PORTION OF MILLSBORO, DELAWARE, AT PLANT OF HOUSTON-WHITE COMPANY, A LARGE LUMBER AND MANUFACTURING COMPANY.  THE TANK IS STEEL, ALUMINUM PAINTED, AND ABOUT 60 FEET HIGH.                            STATION RECOVERY (1943)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1943 (FLG) RECOVERED AS DESCRIBED, EXCEPT THAT THE TANK IS NOW BUFF COLORED.                            STATION RECOVERY (1961)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1961 (JKW) STATION RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION.  THE ORIGINAL DESCRIPTION BY C.D.M. IN 1932 IS COMPLETE AND ADEQUATE.

BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1934 (JCT) STATION RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION.  THE TANK IS DESIGNATED INCORRECTLY AND HAS NO ORIGINAL DESCRIPTION.  IT IS NOT OWNED BY HOUSTON-WHITE, COMPANY.  LOCATED IN THE NW SECTION OF MILLSBORO, DELAWARE.  A TALL STEEL WATER TANK, ALUMINUM PAINTED, AND ABOUT 120 FEET HIGH.  THE TANK FURNISHES THE WATER SUPPLY FOR THE TOWN OF MILLSBORO, AND IS OWNED BY THE TOWN.                            STATION RECOVERY (1962)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1962 (JKW) STATION RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION.  THE 1934 RECOVERY NOTE IS ADEQUATE FOR RECOVERY.                            STATION RECOVERY (2007)  RECOVERY NOTE BY GEOCACHING 2007 (WS) RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION.

BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1958 (JEG) THE STATION IS LOCATED ABOUT 3.6 MILES NORTHEAST OF THE NEW CASTLE COUNTY-WILMINGTON AIRPORT, ABOUT 2 MILES SOUTH-SOUTHWEST OF THE POST OFFICE IN WILMINGTON,AND ABOUT 0.3 MILE WEST OF THE CHRISTIANA RIVER AND IS IN A GRASSY TRIANGULAR ISLAND THAT IS FORMED BY U.S. HIGHWAY NUMBER 13, ALTERNATE U.S. HIGHWAY NUMBER 13 AND ROGERS STREET.  THE MARK IS 104 FEET NORTHWEST OF THE CENTER OF ALTERNATE U.S. HIGHWAY NUMBER 13, 104 FEET NORTHEAST OF THE CENTER OF ROGERS STREET AND 77 FEET NORTHWEST OF POWERLINE POLE NUMBER GDP AND L 24G.  TO REACH THE STATION FROM THE NEW CASTLE COUNTY-WILMINGTON AIRPORT.  GO NORTHEAST ON U.S. HIGHWAY NUMBER 13 AND U.S. HIGHWAY NUMBER 40 FOR 1.7 MILES TO THE JUNCTION OF U.S. HIGHWAY NUMBER 13 AND U.S. HIGHWAY NUMBER 40.  KEEP LEFT ON U.S. HIGHWAY NUMBER 13, AND GO 1.2 MILES TO THE AZIMUTH MARK ON THE RIGHT, SOUTH, SIDE OF THE HIGHWAY AS DESCRIBED.  CONTINUE NORTHEAST ON U.S. HIGHWAY NUMBER 13 FOR 0.5 MILE TO THE JUNCTION OF U.S. HIGHWAY NUMBER 13 AND ALTERNATE HIGHWAY NUMBER 13.  KEEP RIGHT ON ALTERNATE U.S. HIGHWAY NUMBER 13, AND GO 0.1 MILE TO THE INTERSECTION OF ALTERNATE U.S. HIGHWAY NUMBER 13 AND ROGERS STREET AND THE STATION ON THE LEFT AS DESCRIBED.  THE STATION MARK IS A STANDARD DISK, STAMPED MILLSIDE 1958, SET IN THE TOP OF A SQUARE CONCRETE MONUMENT WHICH IS FLUSH WITH THE SURFACE OF THE GROUND.  REFERENCE MARK NUMBER 1, A STANDARD DISK STAMPED MILLSIDE NO 1 1958, IS SET IN THE TOP OF A SQUARE CONCRETE MONUMENT WHICH IS FLUSH WITH THE SURFACE OF THE GROUND.  IT IS LOCATED 27 FEET WEST OF THE CENTER OF ROGERS STREET, 20 FEET EAST OF A 10-INCH ASH TREE AND 5 FEET WEST OF THE WEST CURBING OF ROGERS STREET.  REFERENCE MARK NUMBER 2 IS A STANDARD DISK, STAMPED MILLSIDE NO 2 1958, SET IN THE TOP OF A SQUARE CONCRETE POST WHICH IS FLUSH WITH THE SURFACE OF THE GROUND.  IT IS LOCATED 29 FEET WEST-SOUTHWEST OF POWERLINE POLE NUMBER GDP AND L 24G, 27 FEET NORTHWEST OF THE CENTER OF ALTERNATE U.S. HIGHWAY NUMBER 13 AND 1 FOOT NORTHWEST OF THE HIGHWAY CURBING.  THE AZIMUTH MARK IS A STANDARD DISK, STAMPED MILLSIDE 1958, SET IN THE TOP OF A SQUARE CONCRETE MONUMENT WHICH IS FLUSH WITH THE SURFACE OF THE GROUND.  IT IS LOCATED 55 FEET SOUTH OF THE CENTER OF THE TWO LANE EAST BOUND TRAFFIC OF U.S. HIGHWAY NUMBER 13, 3 FEET NORTH OF POWERLINE POLE NUMBER DPL 44 WITH THREE TRANSFORMERS AND A SWITCH BOX AND 2 FEET NORTHEAST OF A WHITE WITNESS POST.                            STATION RECOVERY (1965)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1965 (JCB) THE STATION, AZIMUTH MARK AND REFERENCE MARKS 1 AND 2 WERE RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION.  THE ORIGINAL DESCRIPTION DOES NOT ADEQUATELY DESCRIBE THE STATION.  A COMPLETE NEW DESCRIPTION FOLLOWS.  THE STATION IS LOCATED ABOUT 3 MILES NORTHEAST OF THE GREATER WILMINGTON AIRPORT, 2 MILES SOUTH-SOUTHWEST OF THE POST OFFICE IN WILMINGTON, IN A LARGE GRASSY TRIANGLE FORMED BY U.S. HIGHWAYS 13, 13 A AND ROGERS ROAD.  IT IS 77 FEET WEST-SOUTHWEST OF THE APPROXIMATE CENTERLINE OF ROGERS ROAD, 77 FEET NORTHWEST OF POWERLINE POLE 24G, 97 FEET NORTH-NORTHWEST OF THE CENTERLINE OF HIGHWAY 13 A, 32-1/2 FEET NORTH-NORTHEAST OF A 14-INCH ASH TREE.  THE MONUMENT IS FLUSH WITH THE GROUND AND THE DISK IS STAMPED MILLSIDE 1958.  (NOTE 1A, 7A)  REFERENCE MARK NO. 1 IS 77.07 FEET NORTH OF THE STATION, 141 FEET NORTH-NORTHWEST OF THE CURB ALONG HIGHWAY 13 A, 28 FEET WEST OF THE APPROXIMATE CENTERLINE OF ROGERS ROAD, 20 FEET EAST OF A 14-INCH ASH TREE AND 5 FEET WEST OF THE CURB ALONG ROGERS ROAD.  THE MONUMENT IS FLUSH WITH THE GROUND AND THE DISK IS STAMPED MILLSIDE NO 1 1958.  REFERENCE MARK NO 2 IS 77.35 FEET SOUTHEAST OF THE STATION, 28 FEET SOUTHWEST OF POWERLINE POLE NO 24 G, 9-1/2 FEET EAST-SOUTHEAST OF A HIGHWAY SIGN AND 1 FOOT NORTHWEST OF THE CURB OF HIGHWAY 13 A.  THE MONUMENT IS 2 INCHES UNDERGROUND AND THE DISK IS STAMPED MILLSIDE NO 2 1958.  THE AZIMUTH MARK IS 55 FEET SOUTH OF THE CENTERLINE OF THE NORTHEAST BOUND TRAFFIC LANE OF U.S. HIGHWAY 13, 3 FEET NORTH OF POWERLINE POLE NO. 44, 10 FEET EAST-NORTHEAST OF A FIRE HYDRANT, 14 FEET SOUTHEAST OF A STORM DRAIN GRATE AND NEAR THE NATIONAL SHOE STORE.  THE MONUMENT IS 4 INCHES UNDERGROUND AND THE DISK IS STAMPED MILLSIDE 1958.  TO REACH THE STATION FROM THE MAIN ENTRANCE TO THE GREATER WILMINGTON AIRPORT, GO NORTHEAST ON U.S. HIGHWAY 40 AND 13 FOR 1.7 MILES TO THEIR JUNCTION.  BEAR LEFT ON HIGHWAY 13 FOR 1.3 MILES TO THE NATIONAL SHOE STORE AND THE AZIMUTH MARK ON THE RIGHT.  CONTINUE AHEAD ON HIGHWAY 13 FOR 0.5 MILE TO A JUNCTION WITH HIGHWAY 13 A.  BEAR RIGHT FOR 0.1 MILE TO ROGERS ROAD AND THE STATION ON THE LEFT. BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1943 (FLG) THE STATION IS A LIGHTHOUSE ON THE NW SHORE OF THE MISIPILLION RIVER AND ABOUT 20 METERS N OF ENTRANCE CHANNEL RANGE. THE STATION IS THE LIGHT ON TOP OF A FOUR LEGGED STEEL STRUCTURE THAT IS LOCATED ABOUT 60 FT. SOUTH OF A WOODEN LIGHTHOUSE THAT IS ABOUT THE SAME HEIGHT AS THE STEEL STRUCTURE.  THE LIGHTHOUSE IS NO LONGER IN USE AND IT IS NOT THE STATION AS MENTIONED IN THE 1943 RECOVERY NOTE.  THE FOUR LEGGED STEEL STRUCTURE IS ABOUT 60 FT. IN HEIGHT.  AIRLINE DISTANCE AND DIRECTION FROM NEAREST TOWN ABOUT 1 MILE NORTH OF SLAUGHTER BEACH. REFER TO THE 1982 LIGHT LIST NO. 2158.                            STATION RECOVERY (2001)  RECOVERY NOTE BY US POWER SQUADRON 2001 (SAL) STATION NOT FOUND. STRUCTURE IS BADLY RUSTED AND SURROUNDED BY EIGHT FOOT HIGH CHAIN LINK FENCE. STATION SHOULD BE CONSIDERED DESTROYED.

BY US GEOLOGICAL SURVEY 1952 STATION DESTROYED.

BY US ARMY CORPS OF ENGINEERS 1933 (GLA) THIS STATION IS ON PROPERTY OF THE LIGHTHOUSE BUREAU, ON THE DELAWARE SIDE OF THE DELAWARE RIVER, ABOUT 3 MILES E OF WILMINGTON, AT THE EDGEMOOR LIGHTHOUSE DEPOT.  IT IS SET IN THE CENTER OF THE OUTER END OF THE SW PIER AND IS MARKED BY A STANDARD U.S.E. BRONZE DISK STAMPED MOOR 1932.  IT IS 4.75 METERS SW OF THE NE SIDE OF THE PIER.  4.35 METERS NE OF THE SW SIDE OF THE PIER.  AND 2.25 METERS NW OF THE END OF THE PIER.  THIS STATION WAS NOT OCCUPIED, HOWEVER EDGEMOOR 1933 WHICH WAS OCCUPIED IS TO THE N, AT THE NW END OF THE WHARF.  A TRAVERSE CONNECTION WAS MADE, AND THE DISTANCE WAS FOUND TO BE 132.258 METERS.  MOOR CAN BE OCCUPIED AND USED FOR RIVER TRIANGULATION.  TO REACH FROM WILMINGTON.  GO NE ON U.S. HIGHWAY 13 ABOUT 2 MILES TO THE POINT WHERE IT CROSSES THE SHELL POT CREEK AT SHELL POT PARK.  CONTINUE ABOUT 0.05 MILES TO A MACADAM ROAD TO THE RIGHT.  TURN RIGHT AND GO 1.4 MILES OR 0.4 MILE PAST AN OVERPASS TO A ROAD LEADING TO THE LEFT.  TURN ON THIS ROAD AND FOLLOW IT 0.3 MILE TO THE DEPOT AND THE STATION.                            STATION RECOVERY (1946)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1946 (ELJ) MARK IS COVERED BY COAL BIN AND COULD NOT BE RECOVERED.                            STATION RECOVERY (1964)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1964 0.5 MI E FROM WILMINGTON. 0.25 MILE SOUTHEAST ALONG EDGEMOOR ROAD FROM THE UNDERPASS OF THE PENNSYLVANIA RAILROAD UNDER THE ROAD AT WILMINGTON, THENCE 0.25 MILE EAST ALONG A BLACK TOP ROAD, AT THE U.S. ARMY ENGINEERS EDGEMOOR SUB-OFFICE, SET ON TOP OF THE SOUTH END OF THE CONCRETE WHARF ALONG THE WEST SIDE OF THE SLIP, 7.5 FEET NORTH OF SOUTH EDGE OF WHARF, 14 FEET EAST OF WEST EDGE OF WHARF, 14.5 FEET WEST OF EAST EDGE OF SLIP, AND FLUSH WITH PAVED AREA.                            STATION RECOVERY (1982)  RECOVERY NOTE BY NATIONAL OCEAN SERVICE 1982 (RHH) THE STATION WAS RECOVERED AS DESCRIBED.  THE PROPERTY IS NOW OWNED BY DUPONT CHEMICAL COMPANY.  HEIGHT OF LIGHT SHOWN ABOVE THE MARK WAS 1.5 METERS.                            STATION RECOVERY (2013)  RECOVERY NOTE BY DELAWARE COASTAL PROGRAM 2013 BEHIND A LOCKED GATE ON THE PROPERTY OF THE EDGEMOOR DUPONT PLANT.

markers.description: BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1960 (JCC) STATION IS LOCATED ABOUT 6-1/2 MILES NORTH OF WILMINGTON, DELAWARE.  ABOUT 9.0 MILES WEST OF CHESTER, PENNSYLVANIA.  AND JUST SOUTH OF THE DELAWARE-PENNSYLVANIA STATE LINE.  LOCATED ON PROPERTY OWNED BY MR. A. A. MOUSLEY.  TO REACH FROM THE TALLEYVILLE FIRE COMPANY, TALLEYVILLE, DELAWARE.  GO NORTH ON U.S. HIGHWAY 202 FOR 2.35 MILES TO A CROSSROAD AND THE DELAWARE-PENNSYLVANIA STATE LINE AND STATION ON THE RIGHT.  STATION MARK, A STANDARD DISK SET IN THE TOP OF A 10-INCH SQUARE CONCRETE MONUMENT, STAMPED MOUSLEY 1960.  PROJECTS ABOUT 1 INCH.  IT IS 3.7 FEET NORTHEAST OF A STANDARD METAL WITNESS POST.  12.6 FEET NORTH OF A TRIANGLE BLAZED 6-INCH OAK TREE.  19.6 FEET EAST-NORTHEAST OF A TRIANGLE BLAZED 8-INCH OAK TREE.  13.3 FEET SOUTH-SOUTHEAST OF A TRIANGLE BLAZED 10-INCH OAK TREE.  40.7 FEET EAST OF A NORTH-SOUTH FENCE LINE.  87.0 FEET EAST OF THE CENTERLINE OF THE NORTH BOUND TRAFFIC LANE OF U.S. HIGHWAY 202.  50.7 FEET SOUTH OF THE APPROXIMATE CENTER OF A GRAVEL SIDE ROAD.  REFERENCE MARK NO. 1.  A STANDARD DISK SET IN THE TOP OF A 10-INCH SQUARE CONCRETE MONUMENT, STAMPED MOUSLEY NO 1 1960.  PROJECTS ABOUT 2 INCHES.  IT IS 25.0 FEET SOUTHEAST OF A 24-INCH OAK TREE.  55.0 FEET SOUTH OF THE APPROXIMATE CENTER OF A GRAVEL SIDE ROAD.  REFERENCE MARK NO. 2.  A STANDARD DISK SET IN THE TOP OF A 10-INCH SQUARE CONCRETE MONUMENT, STAMPED MOUSLEY NO 2 1960.  PROJECTS--FLUSH WITH THE GROUND SURFACE.  IT IS 4.5 FEET SOUTHWEST OF A 24-INCH OAK TREE.  45.5 FEET NORTH OF THE APPROXIMATE CENTER OF A GRAVEL ROAD.  37.8 FEET NORTH-NORTHEAST OF A 20-INCH OAK TREE.  44.4 FEET NORTHEAST OF A DELAWARE-PENNSYLVANIA BOUNDARY MARKER.  59.3 FEET EAST OF THE CENTERLINE OF THE NORTH BOUND TRAFFIC LANE OF U.S. HIGHWAY 202.  AZIMUTH MARK, A STANDARD DISK CEMENTED IN A DRILL HOLE IN THE NORTH END OF A CONCRETE CULVERT.  STAMPED MOUSLEY 1960.  IT IS 15.0 NORTH OF THE APPROXIMATE CENTER OF DRIVEWAY TO CONCORD MOTEL.  4.5 FEET WEST OF CONCORD MOTEL ENTRANCE LIGHT POST.  24.0 FEET EAST OF CENTERLINE OF THE NORTH BOUND TRAFFIC LANE OF U.S. HIGHWAY 202.  TO REACH AZIMUTH MARK FROM STATION, GO NORTH ON U.S. HIGHWAY 202 FOR 0.35 MILE TO AZIMUTH ON THE RIGHT.  BOUNDARY MONUMENT NO. 16 WAS FOUND IN VERY POOR CONDITION AND HAD BEEN PUSHED OVER TO A 53 DEGREE ANGLE.  THE MARK PROJECTS ABOUT 4 INCHES ON THE EAST SIDE.  A PRECISE TIE WAS MADE BETWEEN THE MONUMENT AND STATION MOUSLEY.  THE MONUMENT WAS RESET IN AN UPRIGHT POSITION AND LOWERED.  SEE DESCRIPTION THEREOF.  HEIGHT OF LIGHT ABOVE STATION MARK 30.47 METERS.                            STATION RECOVERY (1965)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1965 (JCB) THE STATION, AZIMUTH MARK AND REFERENCE MARK NO. 1 WERE RECOVERED AS DESCRIBED WITH ONE EXCEPTION.  THE GRAVELED SIDE ROAD RIGHT USED IN DESCRIBING THE MARKS HAS BEEN PAVED.  THE MARKS WERE FOUND IN GOOD CONDITION.  REFERENCE MARK NO 2 WAS SEARCHED FOR BUT NOT FOUND.  A LARGE AREA WHERE IT WAS LOCATED HAS BEEN EXCAVATED FOR A HOUSE SITE.  A REFERENCE MARK NO 3 WAS ESTABLISHED AT THIS TIME.  IT IS 43.44 FEET WEST OF THE STATION, 43 FEET EAST OF THE CENTERLINE OF THE NORTHBOUND TRAFFIC LANE OF U.S. HIGHWAY 202, 42 FEET SOUTH OF THE APPROXIMATE CENTERLINE OF STATE LINE ROAD, 16-1/2 FEET NORTHEAST OF POWERLINE POLE NO. 190 AND 3-1/2 FEET WEST OF A WIRE FENCE.  THE MONUMENT IS FLUSH WITH THE GROUND AND THE DISK IS STAMPED MOUSLEY NO 3 1960.  THE ORIGINAL DESCRIPTION ADEQUATELY DESCRIBES THE STATION AND THE TO REACH IS GOOD.
