BY NATIONAL OCEAN SERVICE 1984 THE STATION IS A NAVIGATION LIGHT LOCATED ON THE NW BANK OF MURDERKILL RIVER IN BOWERS, DELAWARE. TO REACH STATION PROCEED BY BOAT. STATION IS THE CENTER OF THE HIGHEST VERTICAL POINT OF A ---QK FL W--- LIGHT ATOP A FOUR-LEGGED SKELETON TOWER.  A RED AND WHITE RANGE MARKER IS ATTACHED TO THE E SIDE OF THE TOWER.  REFER TO 1982 LIGHT LIST NO. 2160.

BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1946 (ELJ) ACCORDING TO MR. W.W. STOKESBURY, BOWERS, DELAWARE, MURDERKILL R. RANGE HAS BEEN IN PRESENT POSITION FOR PAST FIFTY YEARS.  STATION RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION.                            STATION RECOVERY (1969)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1969 (JKW) STATION RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION.  ACCORDING TO LOCAL RESIDENTS, THIS IS THE SAME LIGHT LOCATED IN 1933.  LOCATED ON SOUTH SIDE OF HIGHWAY, ABOUT 0.6 MILE WEST OF BOWERS BEACH.                            STATION RECOVERY (1983)  RECOVERY NOTE BY NATIONAL OCEAN SERVICE 1983 THE STATION IS A NAVIGATION LIGHT LOCATED ON THE SE SIDE OF BOWERS BEACH ROAD ABOUT 1.0 KM (0.60 MI) SW OF BOWERS. TO REACH STATION PROCEED TO BOWERS BEACH AREA. STATION IS THE CENTER OF THE HIGHEST VERTICAL POINT OF A ---F W--- LIGHT ATOP A FOUR-LEGGED STEEL SKELETON TOWER.  A RED AND WHITE RANGE MARKER IS ATTACHED TO THE ENE SIDE OF THE TOWER.  REFER TO THE 1982 LIGHT LIST NO. 2161. A CGS BM STAMPED---P36 1963--- IS ON THE CONCRETE BASE OF THE NNW TOWER LEG.

BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1909 (ES) THIS STATION IS ON THE ANGOLA SHORE OF REHOBOTH BAY JUST S OF LOVE CREEK.  IT IS ON AN ELEVATION IN THE MARSH ABOUT S OF THE ROBSON FARMHOUSE.  THE ELEVATION IS SURROUNDED BY HARD MARSH AND ON THE S SIDE ARE SOME SCATTERED TREES.  THE STATION IS ON THE HIGHEST POINT AND SHOULD BE EASILY FOUND.  LAND IS OWNED BY JAMES MUSTARD.  STATION IS MARKED WITH COPPER TRIANGULATION-STATION MARK SET IN CEMENT 3 FEET BELOW SURFACE AND WITH BLOCK OF CEMENT ABOVE, IN WHICH IS SET ANOTHER COPPER TRIANGULATION-STATION MARK FASTENED IN 1-INCH GALVANIZED-IRON PIPE 18 INCHES LONG.  REFERENCE MARK IS NEARLY IN LINE TO STATION INLET AND IS A CEMENT BLOCK WITH BOTTLE TO MARK CENTER.                            STATION RECOVERY (1934)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1934 (JCT) STATION AND REFERENCE MARKS RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION.  DESCRIPTION REVISED TO READ AS FOLLOWS--ON W SHORE OF REHOBOTH BAY ON ANGOLA NECK ON ELEVATION IN MARSH KNOWN AS HORSE ISLAND.  ELEVATION OR HUMMOCK IS ABOUT 1/2 MILE S ALONG SHORE LINE FROM TWO SMALL COTTAGES AT END OF FARM ROAD WHICH ARE DIRECTLY ON SHORE ON REHOBOTH BAY.  ELEVATION IS FIRST ONE S OF COTTAGES, IS OVERGROWN WITH DENSE GROWTH OF BRIARS AND VINES, AND HAS SMALL CLUMP OF 30-FOOT PINES GROWING ON ITS INSHORE END.  STATION IS LOCATED ON HIGHEST PART OF HUMMOCK ABOUT 30 METERS NE FROM EDGE OF THE CLUMP OF PINES.  SURFACE, AND UNDERGROUND MARKS ARE STANDARD BRONZE DISKS SET IN CONCRETE.  REFERENCE MARK IS A CONCRETE BLOCK WITH GLASS BOTTLE MARKING ITS CENTER.  BEST REACHED BY BOAT FROM REHOBOTH BAY, BUT MAY BE REACHED BY LAND AS FOLLOWS--FROM VILLAGE OF ANGOLA, DELAWARE, GO N ON MACADAM ROAD 1/4 MILE.  TURN RIGHT ON COUNTY ROAD (DIRT) AND PROCEED E TO ITS END.  TURN LEFT AND GO N 1/4 MILE TO JUNCTION WITH FARM ROAD FROM E AT 3 LARGE OAKS.  TURN RIGHT AND FOLLOW FARM ROAD TO FORK.  TAKE RIGHT FORK TO FARM OF SYLVESTER BOOKHAMMER, AND FROM THERE FIELD ROAD TO COTTAGES ON REHOBOTH BAY.  WALK S ALONG SHORE LINE TO HORSE ISLAND.  SKETCH SHOWING LOCATION OF STATION MUSTARD.                            STATION RECOVERY (1943)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1943 (FLG) RECOVERED AS DESCRIBED, EXCEPT FOR THE FOLLOWING DISCREPANCY--  THE REFERENCE MARK IS LOCATED 79.85 FEET OR 24.338 METERS SE OF THE STATION.                            STATION RECOVERY (1954)  RECOVERY NOTE BY US GEOLOGICAL SURVEY 1954 STATION RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION.  THE DESCRIPTION IS GOOD EXCEPT FOR THE FACT THAT THE HUMMOCK IS NO LONGER COVERED WITH BRUSH BUT IS NOW CLEARED AND ON A FARM OWNED BY HOWARD BRIMMER.  REFERENCE MARK WAS BURIED ABOUT 12 INCHES BY MR. BRIMMER.                            STATION RECOVERY (1962)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1962 (JKW) THE STATION WAS RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION.  R.M. NO. 1 WAS NOT FOUND.  THE STATION IS LOCATED ON ANGOLA NECK, ON THE WEST SHORE OF REHOBOTH BAY, JUST SOUTH OF ENTRANCE TO LOVE CREEK, ABOUT 4 MILES SOUTHWEST OF REHOBOTH BEACH, AND ABOUT 4 MILES NORTHWEST OF INDIAN RIVER INLET, THE STATION IS ON THE HIGHEST POINT OF A CULTIVATED FIELD, 137.0 FEET SOUTH OF A FENCE LINE, 136.0 FEET SOUTH WEST OF A 8 INCH OAK TREE, 95.8 FEET SOUTHEAST OF A 12 INCH OAK TREE AND 2.0 FEET NORTH OF AN IRON WITNESS POST.  THE STATION IS A STANDARD DISK, NOT STAMPED SET IN THE TOP OF A 10 INCH ROUND CONCRETE MONUMENT WHICH IS FLUSH WITH THE GROUND.  R.M. 2 IS SOUTH OF THE STATION, 200.0 FEET WEST OF A CEDAR BUSH, AND 139.4 FEET SOUTHEAST OF A 12 INCH OAK TREE.  IT IS MARKED BY A STANDARD DISK, STAMPED MUSTARD NO 2 1909 SET IN TOP OF A 10 INCH ROUND CONCRETE MONUMENT WHICH PROJECTS 3 INCHES ABOVE THE GROUND.  R.M. 3 IS SOUTHEAST OF THE STATION, 80.0 FEET SOUTH OF MARSHLINE AND 66.0 FEET WEST OF A CEDAR BUSH.  IT IS MARKED BY A STANDARD DISK, STAMPED MUSTARD NO 3 1909 SET IN THE TOP OF A 10 INCH ROUND CONCRETE MONUMENT WHICH PROJECTS 3 INCHES ABOVE THE GROUND.  TO REACH THE STATION FROM THE INTERSECTION OF STATE HIGHWAYS 14 AND 24(WHICH IS ABOUT 3.0 MILES NORTHWEST OF REHOBOTH BEACH), GO WEST ON STATE HIGHWAY 24 FOR 3.0 MILES TO FIRST ROAD ON THE LEFT JUST WEST OF LOVE CREEK BRIDGE, THEN TURN LEFT, (EAST SOUTHEAST) AND GO 1.6 MILES ON BLACKTOP ROAD TO THE JOY BEACH ROAD TO THE LEFT, THEN TURN LEFT(EAST) AND GO 0.4 MILES ON UNPAVED ROAD TO FORK IN ROAD THEN TRAVEL PAVED ROAD STRAIGHT AHEAD 0.9 MILES TO JOY BEACH, THEN WALK WEST ALONG THE SHORE ABOUT 0.4 MILES TO STATION.  IT IS ON THE HIGHEST POINT IN A CULTIVATED FIELD, WEST OF A HOUSE AND CEDAR BUSHES.  THE LAND NOW IS UNDER CULTIVATION AND THE TREES HAVE BEEN CLEARED AWAY, TWO NEW REFERENCE MARKS WERE SET DURING RECOVERY.                            STATION RECOVERY (1962)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1962 (RWT) THE STATION MARK WAS RECOVERED, BUT IN POOR CONDITION.  IT APPARENTLY HAD BEEN HIT BY MACHINERY AND WAS LEANING.  A NEW MONUMENT AND MARK WAS ESTABLISHED HOLDING THE POINT OVER THE UNDERGROUND STATION MARK.  REFERENCE MARK NO. 1 WAS NOT RECOVERED.  A NEW REFERENCE MARK 2 AND 3 HAD BEEN ESTABLISHED, IT IS ASSUMED BY THE PHOTOGRAMMETRY PARTY AT A PREVIOUS DATE.  AN AZIMUTH MARK WAS ESTABLISHED ON THIS DATE.  A NEW TO REACH THE STATION IS AS FOLLOWS.  TO REACH THE STATION FROM THE JUNCTION OF STATE HIGHWAYS 14 AND 18 ABOUT 2.0 MILES SOUTHWEST OF LEWES, DELAWARE.  GO SOUTH-SOUTHEAST ON STATE HIGHWAY 14 FOR 2.64 MILES TO THE JUNCTION OF STATE HIGHWAY 24.  TURN RIGHT AND GO WEST ON STATE HIGHWAY 24 FOR 2.5 MILES TO LOVE CREEK BRIDGE.  CONTINUE STRAIGHT AHEAD, SOUTHWEST, ON STATE HIGHWAY 24 FOR 0.44 MILE TO A SIDE ROAD LEFT.  TURN LEFT AND GO EAST ON A BLACKTOP ROAD FOR 1.66 MILES TO A SIDE ROAD LEFT, AND SIGN JOY BEACH.  TURN LEFT AS PER SIGN JOY BEACH AND GO NORTHEAST ON A BLACKTOP ROAD FOR 0.38 MILE TO A FORK AT THE END OF THE BLACKTOP.  TAKE THE RIGHT HAND FORK AND CONTINUE NORTHEAST ON A GRAVELED ROAD FOR 0.97 MILE TO A TRACK ROAD ON THE RIGHT AND THE AZIMUTH MARK AS DESCRIBED.  TURN RIGHT AND GO SOUTH ON THE TRACK ROAD ALONG THE HIGH WATER LINE FOR 0.35 MILE TO THE STATION ON A SMALL KNOLL WHICH IS NOW UNDER CULTIVATION.  THE STATION MARK, A STANDARD DISK STAMPED MUSTARD 1909, IS SET IN TOP OF A 10-INCH SQUARE CONCRETE MONUMENT PROJECTING ABOUT 10 INCHES ABOVE THE SURFACE OF THE GROUND.  IT IS 95.6 FEET EAST OF A 15-INCH OAK TREE, 92.4 FEET NORTH OF AN EAST AND WEST FENCELINE AND 1.2 FEET NORTH OF A STANDARD METAL WITNESS POST.  REFERENCE MARK 2, A STANDARD DISK STAMPED MUSTARD NO 2 1909, IS SET IN THE TOP OF A 8-INCH CONCRETE CYLINDER PROJECTING ABOUT 2-INCHES ABOVE THE SURFACE OF THE GROUND.  IT IS 140.0 FEET EAST OF A 15-INCH OAK TREE, 1.1 FOOT WEST OF A STANDARD METAL WITNESS POST AND MARKER AND 1.0 FEET NORTH OF AN EAST AND WEST FENCELINE,  REFERENCE MARK 3, A STANDARD DISK STAMPED MUSTARD NO 3 1909, IS SET IN THE TOP OF AN 8-INCH CONCRETE CYLINDER PROJECTING ABOUT 3 INCHES ABOVE THE SURFACE OF THE GROUND.  IT IS 78.0 FEET SOUTH OF A FENCE CORNER, 14.0 FEET EAST OF THE EAST EDGE OF THE CULTIVATED FIELD AND 1.6 FEET WEST OF A STANDARD METAL WITNESS POST AND MARKER.  AZIMUTH MARK, A STANDARD DISK STAMPED MUSTARD 1909 1962, IS SET IN A DRILL HOLE IN TOP OF A 6-INCH WIDE, 2.0 FOOT SQUARE CONCRETE STORM SEWER.  IT IS SET IN THE SOUTHEAST END OF THE CONCRETE WALL, 190.0 FEET WEST OF THE SHORELINE, 162.0 FEET EAST OF THE CENTER OF THE INTERSECTION OF THE EAST AND WEST GRAVELED ROAD AND THE SIDE TRACK ROAD, 18.0 FEET SOUTH OF THE CENTERLINE OF THE EAST AND WEST ROAD AND 2.2 FEET EAST OF A STANDARD METAL WITNESS POST AND MARKER.  NOTE--THE STATION IS ON PROPERTY OWNED BY MR. C. HOWARD BRIMER.  HEIGHT OF LIGHT ABOVE STATION MARK 2.0 METERS.                            STATION RECOVERY (1971)  RECOVERY NOTE BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 1971 (JKW) STATION MARK, RMS 2 AND 3, AND AZIMUTH MARK WERE RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION.  THE 1962 RECOVERY NOTE BY R. W. T. IS ADEQUATE WITH THE FOLLOWING CHANGES--  THE DISTANCE AND DIRECTION TO RM 3 IS INCORRECT.  DISTANCE IS 131.50 FEET NOT 59.05 OR 123.80 AND THE DIRECTION IS 14-02-39.8 NOT 04-02-39.8.  DELETE REFERENCES TO FENCE LINES AS THEY HAVE BEEN REMOVED.                            STATION RECOVERY (1975)  RECOVERY NOTE BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 1975 (EAB) THIS STATION SITE WAS RECOVERED BY THE 1962 DESCRIPTION OF R.W.T., AND ALL MARKS WERE FOUND TO BE IN GOOD CONDITION.  IT WAS LEARNED THAT THIS PROPERTY NOW IS OWNED BY MR JOHN W. GIBSON, PICKETT STREET, ARLINGTON VIRGINIA.

markers.description: BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 1996 (AJL) STATION IS LOCATED ABOUT 11 MI (17.7 KM) SOUTH OF NEWARK, 5 MI (8.0 KM) NORTH OF MIDDLETOWN, 1 MI (1.6 KM) SOUTH OF THE CHESAPEAKE AND SELEWARE CANAL, AND AT THE NORTH END OF THE MIDDLETOWN-SUMMIT AIRPARK. TO REACH THE STATION FROM THE JUNCTION OF U.S.  HIGHWAY 301 AND STATE HIGHWAY 299, GO NORTH ALONG U.S.  301 FOR 4.3 MI (6.9 KM) TO THE JUNCTION OF STATE HIGHWAY 896.  CONTINUE NORTH ALONG U.S.  301 FOR 1.0 MI (1.6 KM) TO THE AIRPORT ENTRANCE ON THE LEFT.  TURN LEFT THEN RIGHT FOLLOWING PARKING LOT, THEN LEFT AT THE FIRST HANGAR TO THE APRON AND TIE DOWN AREA.  CONTINUE WESTERLY FOR 0.05 MI (0.08 KM) TO THE PARALLEL TAXIWAY.  TURN RIGHT AND GO NORTHERLY ALONG TAXIWAY FOR 0.2 MI (0.3 KM) TO THE END OF THE TAXIWAY.  CONTINUE NORTHERLY INTO GRASS AREA FOR 0.05 MI (0.08 KM) TO THE STATION ON THE RIGHT. IT IS 166 FT (50.6 M) WEST FROM THE CORNER OF A METAL HANGAR, 135 FT (41.1 M) EAST-SOUTHEAST FROM THE NORTHEAST CORNER OF THE RUNWAY END, AND 105 FT (32.0 M) EAST-NORTHEAST FROM THE EAST EDGE OF THE RUNWAY. markers.description: BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1958 (JEG) STATION IS LOCATED ALONG NAAMAN ROAD, ON LAND OWNED BY THE COLORADO FUEL AND IRON COMPANY, ABOUT 7 MILES NORTHEAST OF THE CENTER OF WILMINGTON, AND ABOUT 1 MILE NORTHWEST OF WHERE NAAMAN CREEK RUNS INTO THE DELAWARE RIVER.  REACHED FROM 11TH AND KING STREETS (POST OFFICE) IN WILMINGTON BY GOING NORTH ON KING STREET FOR 0.35 MILE TO A TRAFFIC LIGHT, JUST AFTER CROSSING A BRIDGE THAT SPANS THE BRANDYWINE RIVER, AND WHERE U.S. HIGHWAYS 13 AND 202 BEAR TO THE RIGHT, BEAR RIGHT AND CONTINUE ON THE TWO HIGHWAYS, NORTHERLY FOR 0.2 MILE TO THE JUNCTION OF THE TWO HIGHWAYS, CONTINUE NORTHERLY, ON HIGHWAY 13 FOR 6.6 MILES TO NAAMAN ROAD LEFT AND THE JUNCTION OF U.S. HIGHWAY 13 AND 13A.  TURN LEFT AND FOLLOW NAAMAN ROAD, EASTERLY FOR 0.9 MILE TO THE STATION ON THE LEFT, JUST AFTER PASSING A TWO-STORY BRICK HOUSE ON THE LEFT.  CONTINUE EASTERLY, ON NAAMAN ROAD FOR 0.2 MILE TO THE AZIMUTH MARK ON THE RIGHT.  STATION IS A STANDARD DISK, STAMPED NAAMAN 1958, SET IN THE TOP OF A SQUARE CONCRETE MONUMENT WHICH IS 14 INCHES BELOW THE GROUND SURFACE.  IT IS 144 FEET SOUTHEAST OF NAAMAN ROAD, 166 FEET WEST OF THE NORTHWEST CORNER OF THE TWO-STORY BRICK HOUSE AND 138 FEET SOUTH-SOUTHEAST OF A 4 IN X 4 IN WHITE WITNESS POST.  REFERENCE MARK 1 IS A STANDARD DISK, STAMPED NAAMAN NO 1 1958, SET IN THE TOP OF A SQUARE CONCRETE MONUMENT WHICH IS FLUSH WITH THE GROUND SURFACE.  IT IS 35 FEET SOUTH-SOUTHEAST OF NAAMAN ROAD, AND 2 FEET SOUTHWEST OF THE WHITE WITNESS POST.  REFERENCE MARK 2 IS A STANDARD DISK, STAMPED NAAMAN NO 2 1958, SET IN THE TOP OF A SQUARE CONCRETE MONUMENT WHICH IS FLUSH WITH THE GROUND SURFACE.  IT IS 35 FEET SOUTH-SOUTHEAST OF NAAMAN ROAD, 83 FEET NORTHWEST OF THE NORTHWEST CORNER OF THE TWO-STORY BRICK HOUSE, AND 120 FEET SOUTH OF A POWERLINE POLE.  AZIMUTH MARK IS A STANDARD DISK, STAMPED NAAMAN 1958, SET IN THE TOP OF A SQUARE CONCRETE MONUMENT WHICH IS FLUSH WITH THE GROUND SURFACE.  IT IS 32 FEET NORTHEAST OF NAAMAN ROAD, 1 FOOT EAST OF A POWERLINE POLE, AND 80 FEET SOUTHEAST OF A DIRT SIDE ROAD.  A 4 IN X 4 IN WHITE WITNESS POST WAS SET 2 FEET WEST OF THE MARK.                            STATION RECOVERY (1964)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1964 (JCB) STATION WAS RECOVERED AS DESCRIBED AND ALL MARKS WERE FOUND TO BE IN GOOD CONDITION.  A CUT TO AN AVERAGE DEPTH OF 32 FEET WAS TO BE MADE IN THE VICINITY OF STATION EXTENDING FROM 600 FEET TO OVER 1000 FEET IN ALL DIRECTIONS, FOR A BRIDGE OVER THE INTERSTATE HIGHWAY AND AN INTERSECTION SO THERE IS NO SUITABLE LOCATION FOR A NEW STATION.  THE STATION MARK, REFERENCE MARKS AND THE AZIMUTH MARK ARE TO BE DESTROYED BY THE CONSTRUCTION.                            STATION RECOVERY (1964)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1964 (RRG) THE STATION AND BOTH REFERENCE MARKS WERE SEARCHED FOR BUT NOT RECOVERED THIS DATE.  THE AZIMUTH MARK WAS FOUND AND IN GOOD CONDITION.  THE AREA WHERE THE STATION IS DESCRIBED IS NOW UNDER CONSTRUCTION FOR A NEW HIGHWAY AND POSSIBLY THEY HAVE BEEN DESTROYED.                            STATION RECOVERY (1965)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1965 (JCB) THE STATION AND REFERENCE MARKS 1 AND 2 HAVE BEEN DESTROYED BY ROAD CONSTRUCTION.  THE AZIMUTH MARK WAS RECOVERED IN POOR CONDITION.  IT WAS DISTURBED WHEN A POWERLINE POLE, 1 FOOT DISTANT, WAS REMOVED.                            STATION RECOVERY (1981)  RECOVERY NOTE BY DE DEPT OF HIGHWAYS 1981 (DW) (NAAMAN 1958) AZI COULD NOT LOCATE.  DISTANCE AND DIRECTION FROM NEAREST TOWN--0.95 MILES NW OF NAAMANS CORNER.                            STATION RECOVERY (2013)  RECOVERY NOTE BY DELAWARE COASTAL PROGRAM 2013 HOUSE DESCRIBED IS NO LONGER PRESENT.

markers.description: BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 1974 THE SATAION MARK IS A STANDARD DISK STAMPED NECK NO 3 1974, SET IN THE TOP OF A 12-INCH CYLINDRICAL CONCRETE MONUMENT THAT PROJECTS 4 INCHES ABOVE THE GROUND SURFACE.  IT IS 25 FEET SOUTHEAST OF A 24-INCH RED BUD TREE, 23 FEET NORTH-NORTHWEST OF THE CENTER OF THE PAVED ROAD AND 3 FEET EAST-SOUTHEAST OF A POWERLINE POLE NUMBER 25-22 WITH A TRANSFORMER.  TO REACH THE STATION FROM THE POST OFFICE IN SELBYVILLE, DELAWARE, GO SOUTHWEST ON CHURCH STREET FOR .25 MILE TO A RAILROAD CROSSING, CONTINUE SOUTHWEST ON CHURCH STREET FOR .35 MILE TO THE JUNCTION OF US HIGHWAY 113.  TURN LEFT AND GO SOUTH ON US HIGHWAY 113 FOR .3 MILE TO A CROSSROAD JUST AFTER CROSSING THE MARYLAND-DELAWARE STATE LINE. TURN RIGHT AND GO WEST-SOUTHWEST ON A PAVED ROAD FOR 1.05 MILES TO A CROSS- ROAD.  CONTINUE SOUTHWEST ON PAVED ROAD FOR .6 MILE TO A T-ROAD JUNCTION.  TURN RIGHT AND GO NORTHWEST ON PAVED ROAD FOR 1.25 MILES TO A SHARP CURVE TO THE LEFT.  CONTINUE SOUTHERLY ON PAVED ROAD FOR .5 MILE TO A SAND ROAD RIGHT.  TURN RIGHT AND GO WESTERLY ON A SAND ROAD FOR 1.15 MILE TO A WOODEN BRIDGE.  CONTINUE AHEAD ON SAND ROAD FOR .85 MILE TO A T-ROAD JUNCTION.  TURN RIGHT AND GO NORTHERLY ON SAND ROAD FOR .5 MILE TO THE STATION ON THE RIGHT. markers.description: BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1933 (GLA) THIS STATION IS ON THE MUNICIPAL PIER AT THE END OF DELAWARE STREET IN NEW CASTLE, DELAWARE.  THE STATION IS IN THE N CORNER OF THE PIER, JUST SE OF A SEA WALL WHICH IS A CONTINUATION OF A BUILDING (THE WALL IS CONCRETE AND ABOUT 3 FEET HIGH).  THE MARK IS 15.5 FEET SE OF THE SEA WALL MENTIONED ABOVE.  12.2 FEET SW OF BULKHEAD.  98 FEET NE OF CENTER OF DELAWARE STREET.  AND IS FLUSH WITH THE GROUND.  SURFACE, UNDERGROUND, AND REFERENCE MARKS ARE STANDARD BRONZE DISKS SET IN CONCRETE AS DESCRIBED IN NOTES 1B, 7A, AND 11B.  REFERENCE MARK NO.1 IS SE OF THE STATION NEAR THE E CORNER OF THE PIER.  8.6 FEET S OF MOORING POST.  19.5 FEET NE OF RUNWAY.  34 FEET NW OF E CORNER OF PIER.  THE DISTANCE BETWEEN REFERENCE MARK NO.1 AND THE STATION WAS USED FOR THE BASE OF A TRIANGLE IN LOCATING NEW CASTLE-UNITED STATES ARMY ENGINEERS 1900.  THE MARK IS FLUSH WITH THE GROUND.  REFERENCE MARK NO.2 IS S OF THE STATION, SET IN A DRILLED HOLE WITH CONCRETE IN THE SW BULKHEAD.  THE MARK IS AT THE END OF THE SW BULKHEAD WHICH IS THE W CORNER OF THE PIER.  FOR A DETAILED NOTE OF NEW CASTLE-UNITED STATES ARMY ENGINEERS 1900 SEE DESCRIPTION. TO REACH THE STATION FROM THE BOAT RAMP IN NEW CASTLE, GO BY BOAT NORTH TO THE NORTHERNMOST ICE BREAKER IN THE RIVER AND THE STATION. BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1933 (GLA) THIS STATION IS THE CENTER OF THE BALL ON TOP OF THE SQUAT BLACK WATER TANK AT THE BELLANCA AIRCRAFT CORPORATION FACTORY ON THE E SIDE OF BELLANCA AIRPORT ABOUT 1 MILE W OF NEW CASTLE.  THIS TANK IS ABOUT 100 FEET HIGH.  IT HAS TWO RED LIGHT SET ECCENTRIC TO THE BALL ON THE TOP.                            STATION RECOVERY (1962)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1962 (VES) STATION WAS RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION.  LOCAL AUTHORITIES STATED THE TANK IS ESSENTIALLY THE SAME AS WHEN ITS POSITION WAS ESTABLISHED IN 1933.  THE POSITION WAS VERIFIED BY PLOTTING AND COMPARING NEAR-BY DETAIL.                            STATION RECOVERY (1975)  RECOVERY NOTE BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 1975 (RST) STATION RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION, A NEW DESCRIPTION FOLLOWS--STATION IS ON THE PROPERTY ONCE KNOWN AS THE BELLANCA AIRPORT ABOUT ONE MILE WEST OF THE CITY OF NEW CASTLE.  THE AIRPORT IS NO LONGER ACTIVE AND THE BUILDINGS NOW ARE OCCUPIED BY THE AMERICAN CAN COMPANY.  THE BUILDINGS ARE PROMINENTLY MARKED AND THERE ARE ROAD SIGNS DIRECTING TRAFFIC TO THE SITE.  THE TANK HAS AN ORANGE CONICAL TOP AND A WHITE CYLINDERICAL BODY WITH AMERICAN CAN COMPANY IN BLACK LETTERS ON THE WEST SIDE.  THE HEMISPHERICAL BOTTOM, 4 LEGS AND CENTER STANDPIPE ARE PAINTED BLACK.                            STATION RECOVERY (1981)  RECOVERY NOTE BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 1981 (DRM) STATION RECOVERED AS DESCRIBED IN GOOD CONDITION.  AIRLINE DISTANCE AND DIRECTION FROM NEAREST TOWN--1 MILE WEST OF NEW CASTLE.                            STATION RECOVERY (1984)  RECOVERY NOTE BY US POWER SQUADRON 1984 (JLM) THE TANK IS NOW PAINTED WHITE WITH BLUE CENTER STRIP AND ALUMINUM LEGS.  THE INSCRIPTION READS HOOVER UNIVERSAL.  THE LOCATION IS AS GIVEN LAT. AND LONG., THE STREETS ARE 14TH AND OAK ST.                            STATION RECOVERY (1997)  RECOVERY NOTE BY US POWER SQUADRON 1997 RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION.

BY US POWER SQUADRON 1984 (JLM) LIGHT BLUE AND WHITE DOME ON A BRICK BUILDING WITH A WEATHERVANE ON TOP.  IT IS LOCATED BETWEEN MARKET AND 3RD ST. ON EAST SIDE OF DELAWARE ST.                            STATION RECOVERY (1997)  RECOVERY NOTE BY US POWER SQUADRON 1997 RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION.                            STATION RECOVERY (2002)  RECOVERY NOTE BY US POWER SQUADRON 2002 (WPS) BLUE OF DOME HAS FADED TO APPEAR NEARLY WHITE.                            STATION RECOVERY (2007)  RECOVERY NOTE BY GEOCACHING 2007 (WS) RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION.

BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1933 (GLA) THIS STATION IS THE CENTER OF THE TALL BLACK WATER TANK AT THE PLANT OF THE DELAWARE RAYON COMPANY ON THE W BANK OF THE DELAWARE RIVER ABOUT 1-1/2 MILES SW OF NEW CASTLE.  THE TANK IS JUST NW OF THE TWIN STACKS NEAR THE SE CORNER OF THE PLANT.  IT IS A TALL BLACK TANK WITHOUT BALL OR FINIAL AT TIP.  IT IS ABOUT 100 FEET HIGH.                            STATION RECOVERY (1975)  RECOVERY NOTE BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 1975 (RST) THE ORIGINAL POSITION WAS RECOVERED.  A NEW DESCRIPTION FOLLOWS--THE STATION IS THE CENTER OF A TALL CONICAL TOPPED, HEMISPHERICAL BOTTOMED, CYLINDERICAL BODIED WATER TANK SUPPORTED BY FOUR LEGS WITH A CENTER STANDPIPE.  THE TANK IS PAINTED WHITE WITH CROWN ZELLERBACK COMPANY LETTERS PAINTED IN RED ON THE NORTHWEST SIDE OF THE TANK.  THE PROPERTY IS ON THE WEST SIDE OF THE DELAWARE RIVER, 1-1/2 MILES ON RT. 9 SOUTH OF NEW CASTLE, DELAWARE ACROSS RT. 9 FROM THE NEW CASTLE AMOCO REFINERY WHICH HAS A VERY PROMINENT RED AND WHITE STACK ON THE SITE.                            STATION RECOVERY (1984)  RECOVERY NOTE BY US POWER SQUADRON 1984 (JLM) THE TANK WAS DEMOLISHED ACCORDING TO MANAGER OF CROWN ZELLERBACK AT 1700 7/25/84.

BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1933 (GLA) THIS STATION IS THE CENTER OF THE SOUTHEASTERLY ONE OF TWIN STACKS AT THE PLANT OF THE DELAWARE RAYON COMPANY ON THE W BANK OF THE DELAWARE RIVER ABOUT 1-1/2 MILES SW OF NEW CASTLE.  THESE STACKS ARE AMONG BUILDINGS AT THE SE CORNER OF THE PLANT.  THEY ARE YELLOW-BRICK STACKS WITH SLIGHT CORBEL AT THE TOP.  THEY ARE ABOUT 100 FEET HIGH.                            STATION RECOVERY (1975)  RECOVERY NOTE BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 1975 (RST) STATION WAS RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION.  THE PROPERTY NOW BELONGS TO THE CROWN ZELLERBACK COMPANY.  IT IS RIVER FRONT PROPERTY AND IS SOUTH OF NEW CASTLE ON RT. 9.  THE AMOCO REFINERY IS TO THE NORTHEAST ACROSS RT. 9.  THE MOST PROMINENT FEATURE IN THE AREA IS THE RED AND WHITE AMOCO STACK.  THE MANAGER OF THE CROWN ZELLERBACK FACILITY INDICATED THAT THE STACK MAY BE DEMOLISHED AS TIME AND FUNDS PERMIT.                            STATION RECOVERY (1984)  RECOVERY NOTE BY US POWER SQUADRON 1984 (JLM) THE STACK NEAREST THE WATER HAS BEEN DEMOLISHED - THIS WAS THE APPARENT 1218 MARK.  THE SECOND STACK MENTIONED IS UNUSED - THE PICTURE IS OF IT.  INFORMATION FROM MANAGER OF CROWN ZELLERBACK AT 1700 7/25/84.

BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1933 (GLA) THIS STATION IS THE CROSS ON THE SPIRE OF THE EMMANUEL PROTESTANT EPISCOPAL CHURCH IN A SMALL CEMETERY AT THE W CORNER OF HARMONY STREET AND MARKET STREET, FACING W.  THE CHURCH IS A CONCRETE BUILDING WITH A SQUARE CONCRETE BELFRY OVER THE FRONT (W) CENTER OF THE BUILDING.  THE BELFRY HAS A CLOCK ON EACH SIDE.  IT HAS AN OCTAGONAL GRAY SLATE SPIRE RISING ABOUT 60 FEET ABOVE THE BELFRY.  SPIRE HAS GOLD BALL AND CROSS AT TIP.  THE BUILDING WAS ERECTED IN 1703.                            STATION RECOVERY (1948)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1948 (ELJ) STATION WAS RECOVERED.  DESCRIPTION ADEQUATE.                            STATION RECOVERY (1984)  RECOVERY NOTE BY US POWER SQUADRON 1984 (JLM) STATION HAD BURNED A COUPLE OF YEARS AGO.  STATION HAS BEEN REBUILT IN PLACE (1983) THE SPIRE IS WHITE SHINGLED W/THREE DORMER-TYPE DOORS AND A GOLD CROSS ON A GOLD BALL.  THE CROSS IS THE REFERENCE POINT.  LOCATION IS AS BEFORE.                            STATION RECOVERY (1991)  RECOVERY NOTE BY US POWER SQUADRON 1991 (MAR) MARK NOT FOUND.

BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1933 (GLA) THIS STATION IS THE FINIAL OF THE BELFRY OF THE BUILDING USED AS THE MASONIC HALL, ODD FELLOWS HALL, AND TOWN HALL.  IT IS ON THE W SIDE OF DELAWARE STREET BETWEEN W 3RD STREET AND W 4TH STREET.  IT IS A RED-BRICK BUILDING TRIMMED WITH WHITE STONE AND HAS A WHITE SHEET METAL CORNICE.  THERE IS A TOWER ABOVE THE FRONT CENTER OF THE BUILDING WITH A SMALL DOME SUPPORTED BY EIGHT COLUMNS.  FINIAL AT CENTER OF DOME HAS CARDINAL DIRECTION POINTERS AND WEATHER VANE.  FINIAL ALSO HAS A LARGE BALL AT THE BASE AND A SMALLER ONE NEAR THE TOP.  THE BUILDING WAS ERECTED IN 1879.                            STATION RECOVERY (1946)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1946 (ELJ) STATION RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION.  THE ORIGINAL DESCRIPTION IS ADEQUATE.                            STATION RECOVERY (1984)  RECOVERY NOTE BY US POWER SQUADRON 1984 (JLM) THE MASONIC HALL IS THERE WITH TWO CHIMNEYS, BUT NO BELFRY TOWER REMAINS.                            STATION RECOVERY (1991)  RECOVERY NOTE BY US POWER SQUADRON 1991 (MAR) MARK NOT FOUND.

BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 1986 0.1 MILE (0.2 KM) EAST ALONG DELAWARE 4 (MARKET STREET) FROM THE NEWPORT POST OFFICE TO THE ON RAMP TO DELAWARE 141 SOUTH BOUND, GO ABOUT 0.2 MILES (0.3 KM) SOUTH ON DELAWARE 141 UNTIL YOU COME TO THE END OF WALL OF BRIDGE OVER THE CHRISTINA RIVER, LOCATED 3 FEET (0.9 M) NORTH OF THE END OF THE WALL IN THE SOUTHWEST CORNER OF THE BRIDGE, 12.5 FEET (3.8 M) SOUTH OF EXPANSION JOINT ON SOUTH SIDE OF BRIDGE. OWNERSHIP-- ROAD RIGHT OF WAY.  TO REACH FROM THE STATE HIGHWAY 141 OVERPASS BRIDGE OVER THE SOUTH BOUND LANE OF INTERSTATE HIGHWAY 95, GO NORTHERLY ON STATE HIGHWAY 141 FOR 0.75 KM (0.45 MI) TO THE STATION ON THE LEFT.  THE STATION MARK IS A STANDARD NGS BENCH MARK DISK STAMPED---NEWPORT AZ MK RESET 1986---SET IN THE TOP OF THE SOUTH END OF THE WEST PARAPET WALL FOR THE SOUTH BOUND LANE OF THE HIGHWAY 141 BRIDGE.  IT IS 9.0 METERS (29.5 FT) WEST FROM THE CENTER OF THE SOUTH BOUND LANE OF THE HIGHWAY, 0.9 METERS (3.0 FT) NORTH FROM THE SOUTH END OF THE WEST PARAPET WALL, 2.7 METERS (8.9 FT) NORTHEAST FROM A OVERHEAD LIGHT, 2.3 METERS (7.5 FT) NORTH FROM THE CENTER OF A DROP INLET, 1.1 METERS (3.6 FT) NORTH-NORTHEAST FROM A WITNESS POST AND 0.9 METER (3.0 FT) ABOVE THE BRIDGE DECK.  THE STATION IS LOCATED 0.8 KM (0.50 MI) NORTH ALONG STATE HIGHWAY 141 FROM INTERSTATE HIGHWAY 95, IN THE SOUTH END OF THE WEST PARAPET WALL FOR THE SOUTH BOUND LANE OF THE STATE HIGHWAY 141 BRIDGE OVER THE CHRISTIANA RIVER WHICH IS JUST SOUTH FROM NEWPORT, 9.0 METERS (29.5 FT) WEST FROM THE CENTER OF THE SOUTH BOUND LANE ON STATE HIGHWAY 141, 0.9 METERS (3.0 FT) NORTH FROM THE SOUTH END OF THE PARAPET WALL, 2.7 METERS (8.9 FT) NORTHEAST FROM A OVERHEAD STREET LIGHTPOLE AND 2.3 METERS (7.5 FT) NORTH-NORTHEAST FROM THE CENTER OF A DROP INLET.  BENCH MARK NEWPORT AZ MK RESET 1986 REPLACES OLD STATION.                            STATION RECOVERY (2004)  RECOVERY NOTE BY GEOCACHING 2004 (WD) RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION.

BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1933 (GLA) THIS STATION IS THE CENTER OF THE BALL ON TOP OF THE WATER TANK AT THE KREBS COMPANY PLANT BETWEEN THE CHRISTIANA RIVER AND THE PENNSYLVANIA RAILROAD AND ON THE W SIDE OF SOUTH JAMES STREET, NEWPORT, DELAWARE.  THE TANK IS A SQUAT TANK PAINTED WHITE WITH LETTERS KREBS PONOLITH ON THE NE AND NW SIDES.  IT IS ABOUT 110 FEET HIGH.                            STATION RECOVERY (1966)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1966 (EP) THIS STATION RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION, PREVIOUS DESCRIPTION IN-ADEQUATE.  NEW DESCRIPTION FOLLOWS.  THIS TANK IS NOW LOCATED ON THE PROPERTY OF E.I. DU PONT DE NEMOURS-PIGMENTS DEPARTMENT-NEWPORT PLANT, IT WAS PREVIOUSLY KNOWN AS KREBS COMPANY.  THE TANK IS ABOUT 110 FEET HIGH AND IS THE EASTERLY AND SLIGHTLY LARGER ONE OF TWO SIMILAR SQUAT TANKS.  IT IS PAINTED A DULL RED AND GREY WITH DU PONT IN LARGE RED LETTERS ON THE NORTH AND SOUTH SIDES.  IT IS 750 FEET WEST OF JAMES STREET AND JUST SOUTH OF WATER STREET, WHICH RUNS WESTERLY THROUGH THE DU PONT PLANT FROM JAMES STREET.  IT IS LOCATED NEAR BUILDING A-100.                            STATION RECOVERY (1984)  RECOVERY NOTE BY US POWER SQUADRON 1984 (JLM) STATION RECOVERED GOOD.  TANK IS IN THE SAME LOCATION BUT IS PAINTED RED ON TOP AND BOTTOM AND WHITE IN THE MIDDLE.  COMPANY IS NOW OWNED BY CIBA-GEIGY INC. (SWITZERLAND).                            STATION RECOVERY (1999)  RECOVERY NOTE BY US POWER SQUADRON 1999 RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION.                            STATION RECOVERY (2003)  RECOVERY NOTE BY US POWER SQUADRON 2003 (DWG) TANK IS NOW PAINTED BLUE.

BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1959 (JCE) STATION, AZIMUTH MARK AND REFERENCE MARK NO. 2 WERE RECOVERED AS DESCRIBED AND AZIMUTH MARK AND REFERENCE MARK NO. 2 WERE FOUND IN GOOD CONDITION.  STATION MARK WAS FOUND DAMAGED AND REFERENCE MARK NO. 1 IS BELIEVED DESTROYED.  THEREFORE A NEW SURFACE MARK AND REFERENCE MARK NO. 3 WERE ESTABLISHED.  AN ERROR WAS FOUND IN THE DISTANCE TO AZIMUTH MARK AND THE CORRECT DISTANCE SHOULD PROBABLY BE 740.452 METERS INSTEAD OF 740.452 FEET AS LISTED IN 1933 DESCRIPTIONS.  HOWEVER THIS DISTANCE WAS NOT CHECKED DUE TO CONSIDERABLE CLEARING THROUGH SWAMP.  A COMPLETE NEW DESCRIPTION FOLLOWS--  STATION IS LOCATED IN A VACANT LOT NEAR THE SOUTHEAST CORNER OF DU PONT PROPERTY, JUST EAST OF LOUIS POTZER RESIDENCE ABOUT 2.0 MILES NORTH OF NEW CASTLE COUNTY AIRPORT, ABOUT 3-1/2 MILES NORTHEAST OF CHRISTIANA AND ABOUT 0.6 MILES SOUTH OF NEWPORT.  STATION IS 34 FEET WEST-NORTHWEST OF APPROXIMATE CENTERLINE OF SURFACED ROAD, 45 FEET NORTH OF POWERLINE POLE NO. 57, 61 FEET EAST-SOUTHEAST OF EAST CORNER OF HOUSE AND 27.8 FEET NORTH OF A 6X6 INCH CONCRETE PROPERTY CORNER POST.  THE MARK IS A STANDARD STATION DISK SET IN A 12X12 INCH MONUMENT, FLUSH WITH THE GROUND AND THE DISK IS STAMPED NEWPORT 1933 1958.  NOTE--1A 7A.  REFERENCE MARK NO. 2 IS 23 FEET SOUTHEAST OF EAST CORNER OF SHED AND NEAR THE NORTHEAST EDGE OF YARD.  THE MARK IS A STANDARD REFERENCE DISK SET IN A 12X12 INCH CONCRETE MONUMENT, PROJECTS 2 INCHES AND THE DISK IS STAMPED NEWPORT NO 2 1933.  REFERENCE MARK NO. 3 IS 31 FEET WEST-NORTHWEST OF APPROXIMATE CENTERLINE OF SURFACED ROAD AND 63 FEET SOUTHWEST OF POWERLINE POLE NO. 58.  THE MARK IS A STANDARD REFERENCE DISK SET IN A 12X12 INCH CONCRETE MONUMENT, FLUSH WITH THE SURFACE OF GROUND AND THE DISK IS STAMPED NEWPORT NO 3 1933 1958.  AZIMUTH MARK IS A STANDARD AZIMUTH DISK SET IN A DRILL HOLE IN A CONCRETE COLUMN NEAR THE DOOR OF CONTROL-HOUSE ON THE EAST SIDE OF DRAW BRIDGE OVER THE CHRISTIANA RIVER WHICH IS IN THE SOUTH EDGE OF NEWPORT.  THE DISK IS STAMPED NEWPORT 1933 AZIMUTH.  A TRAVERSE CONNECTION WAS MADE TO R.M. NO. 2 AND THE DISTANCE IS SHOWN BELOW.  A CHECK WAS MADE ON THE DIRECTION TO REFERENCE MARK NO. 2 AND TANK, SQUAT, BLK. AZ. MK. AND FOUND TO BE CORRECT.  TO REACH FROM TRAFFIC SIGNAL AT JUNCTION OF NORTH JAMES ST. AND EAST MARKET ST. (MAIN STREET INTERSECTION) IN NEWPORT, GO SOUTHERLY ON NORTH JAMES STREET FOR 0.15 TO BRIDGE OVER CHRISTIANA RIVER AND AZIMUTH ON LEFT (EAST) SIDE OF ROAD.  CONTINUE SOUTHERLY FOR 0.35 MILE TO SIGNAL LIGHT AT SIDE ROAD RIGHT.  TURN RIGHT AND GO WESTERLY ON SURFACED FOR 0.2 TO STATION ON RIGHT (NORTHWEST) SIDE OF ROAD AS DESCRIBED.                            STATION RECOVERY (1965)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1965 (JCB) STATION, AZIMUTH MARK AND RM 1 AND RM 2 WERE RECOVERED AS DESCRIBED.  A STEEL WITNESS POST WAS SET 2 FEET N OF STATION MARK. POTZER, 45 1/2 FEET NORTH OF POWERLINE POLE 57, 27 1/2 FEET NORTH OF A CONCRETE PROPERTY LINE MARKER, 190.5 FEET SOUTHEAST OF R.M. 2, 66.4 FEET SOUTHWEST OF R.M. 3, 12 FEET WEST-SOUTHWEST OF THE APPROXIMATE CENTERLINE OF A DIRT ROAD AND SET IN THE TOP OF A CONCRETE POST FLUSH WITH THE GROUND. markers.description: BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1958 (JCE) STATION IS LOCATED ABOUT 2.0 MILES NORTH OF NEW CASTLE COUNTY AIRPORT, ABOUT 3-1/2 MILES NORTHEAST OF CHRISTIANA AND ABOUT 0.6 MILE SOUTH OF NEWPORT.  STATION IS NEAR THE NORTHEAST EDGE OF THE BACK YARD OF MR. LOUIS POTZER RESIDENCE AND 23 FEET SOUTHEAST OF THE EAST CORNER OF A SHED.  THE MARK IS A STANDARD REFERENCE DISK SET IN A 12X12 INCH CONCRETE MONUMENT, FLUSH WITH THE SURFACE OF GROUND AND THE DISK IS STAMPED NEWPORT NO 2 1958.  NEWPORT 1933 IS 34 FEET WEST-NORTHWEST OF APPROXIMATE CENTERLINE OF SURFACED ROAD, 45 FEET NORTH OF POWERLINE POLE NO. 57 AND 61 FEET EAST-SOUTHEAST OF EAST CORNER OF HOUSE.  THE MARK IS A STANDARD STATION DISK SET IN A 12X12 CONCRETE MONUMENT, FLUSH WITH THE SURFACE OF GROUND AND THE DISK IS STAMPED NEWPORT 1933 1958.  REFERENCE MARK NO. 3 IS 31 FEET WEST-NORTHWEST OF APPROXIMATE CENTERLINE OF SURFACED ROAD AND 63 FEET SOUTHWEST OF POWERLINE POLE NO. 58.  THE MARK IS A STANDARD REFERENCE DISK SET IN A 12X12 INCH CONCRETE MONUMENT, FLUSH WITH THE GROUND AND THE DISK IS STAMPED NEWPORT NO 3 1933 1958.  AZIMUTH MARK IS A STANDARD AZIMUTH DISK SET IN DRILL HOLE IN THE TOP OF A CONCRETE COLUMN WHICH IS NEAR THE DOOR OF THE CONTROL HOUSE ON THE EAST SIDE OF BRIDGE OVER THE CHRISTIANA RIVER IN THE SOUTH EDGE OF NEWPORT.  THE DISK IS STAMPED NEWPORT 1933 AZIMUTH.  A TRAVERSE CONNECTION WAS MADE TO NEWPORT 1933 AND THE DISTANCE IS SHOWN ABOVE.  TO REACH FROM THE TRAFFIC LIGHT AT THE INTERSECTION OF NORTH JAMES STREET AND EAST MARKET STREET (MAIN INTERSECTION) IN NEWPORT, GO SOUTHERLY ON NORTH JAMES STREET FOR 0.15 MILE TO AZIMUTH MARK ON LEFT AS DESCRIBED.  CONTINUE SOUTHERLY FOR 0.35 MILE TO SIGNAL LIGHT AT SIDE ROAD RIGHT.  TURN RIGHT AND GO SOUTHWESTERLY ON SURFACED ROAD FOR 0.25 MILE TO DRIVEWAY RIGHT.  TURN RIGHT AND GO NORTHERLY ON DRIVEWAY FOR 0.05 MILE TO SMALL SHED IN BACK YARD OF MR. LOUIS POTZERS RESIDENCE AND STATION AS DESCRIBED.  HEIGHT OF LIGHT ABOVE STATION MARK 30 METERS.                            STATION RECOVERY (1965)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1965 0.5 MI S FROM NEWPORT. 190.5 FEET NORTHWEST OF NEWPORT, DESCRIBED, 224 1/2 FEET NORTHWEST OF THE CENTERLINE OF THE ROAD, 129.4 FEET NORTH-NORTHWEST OF THE NORTH CORNER OF WHITE BRICK POTZER RESIDENCE, 22 1/2 FEET SOUTHEAST OF THE EAST CORNER OF A SHED AND SET IN TOP OF A CONCRETE POST PROJECTING 4 INCHES.                            STATION RECOVERY (1966)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1966 (EP) THIS STATION WAS RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION, BUT THE DESCRIPTION IS INADEQUATE.  NEW REFERENCES WERE MADE.  IT IS 45.0 FEET SOUTHWEST OF A 12 INCH FORKED TREE, OF UNDETERMINED ORIGIN.  34.1 FEET SOUTHEAST OF THE SOUTHEAST CORNER OF THE CONCRETE FOUNDATION FOR TWO GAS PUMPS.  THE DISTANCE FROM NEWPORT 1933 WAS NOT CHECKED BECAUSE OF THE MANY JUNKED CARS IN LINE.  THE SHED MENTIONED IN THE PREVIOUS DESCRIPTION WAS TORN DOWN TO MAKE WAY FOR THE GAS PUMPS.                            STATION RECOVERY (1966)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1966 RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION.                            STATION RECOVERY (1981)  RECOVERY NOTE BY UNIVERSITY OF DELAWARE 1981 MARK NOT FOUND.                            STATION RECOVERY (1986)  RECOVERY NOTE BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 1986 (RGP) RECOVERED AS DESCRIBED IN GOOD CONDITION.  A NEW WITNESS POST WAS SET 0.9 METERS (3.0 FT) SOUTHEAST FROM THE MARK.  PREVIOUS DESTRUCTION REPORT IS AN ERROR.                            STATION RECOVERY (2003)  RECOVERY NOTE BY US POWER SQUADRON 2003 (RLG) NOT ACCESSIBLE.  AREA IS A SALVAGE YARD WITH A GUARD DOG AND A CHAIN LINK FENCE.

markers.description: BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1933 (GLA) STATION ST GEORGE IS ON THE PROPERTY OF THE UNITED STATES ARMY ENGINEERS AND ABOUT 0.15 MILE S OF ST. GEORGES WHICH IS A LITTLE TOWN ON HIGHWAY 13 BETWEEN SMYRNA AND WILMINGTON.  STATION ST GEORGES IS ON EMBANKMENT JUST E OF S END OF ST. GEORGES DRAWBRIDGE.  27 FEET E OF W BANK OF TERRACE.  24 FEET S OF S BANK OF CANAL.  THE MARK PROJECTS 4 INCHES.  THE UNITED STATES ARMY ENGINEERS STATION H.B. IS IN ST. GEORGES, ON THE LAWN OF N.R. BUCKSONS HOUSE.  THE MARK IS ON THE S SIDE OF THE DRIVEWAY.  49.9 FEET NW OF SW CORNER OF THE HOUSE.  40.4 FEET W OF NW CORNER OF THE HOUSE.  106 FEET E OF HIGHWAY 13. 75.44 FEET SE OF STATION ST. GEORGE, UNITED STATES COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1933.  95.50 FEET E OF REFERENCE MARK NO.2 (U.S.C. AND G.S. 1933).  THE MARK PROJECTS 2 INCHES AND IS A STANDARD UNITED STATES ARMY ENGINEERS MARK. markers.description: BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1932 (CDM) LOCATED ABOUT 1 MILE S OF THE TOWN OF SELBYVILLE, DELAWARE.  IN THE TOP OF A GRANITE MONUMENT MARKING THE DELAWARE-MARYLAND STATE LINE.  MARK IS 221 FEET E OF CENTER LINE OF U.S. HIGHWAY 113, AND OPPOSITE A SIGN MARKING THE STATE LINE.  GRANITE MONUMENT STICKS UP ABOUT 2 FEET ABOVE THE SURFACE OF THE GROUND.  STATION MARK IS A STANDARD BRONZE DISK WEDGED IN A DRILL HOLE IN A BOULDER AS DESCRIBED.  REFERENCE MARKS ARE STANDARD BRONZE DISKS SET IN CONCRETE AS DESCRIBED.  REFERENCE MARK NO.1 IS 240.75 FEET SW OF STATION.  8 METERS E OF CENTER LINE OF U.S. HIGHWAY 113.  5 METERS N OF CENTER LINE OF DIRT ROAD CROSSING U.S. HIGHWAY 113.  REFERENCE MARK NO.2 IS ABOUT 1/4 MILE W OF STATION ON THE E SIDE OF A ROAD RUNNING N AND S, NEAR A DRAINAGE DITCH.  REFERENCE MARK NO.3 IS 210.7 FEET WNW OF STATION, ABOUT 8 METERS E OF CENTER LINE OF U.S. HIGHWAY 113.  HEIGHT OF SIGNAL ABOVE STATION MARK - 33 METERS.                            STATION RECOVERY (1932)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1932 RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION.                            STATION RECOVERY (1942)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1942 (WDP) THE FOLLOWING DISCREPANCY WAS NOTED IN THE FIELD WITH ORIGINAL DESCRIPTION--  THE STATION IS 242 FEET E OF CENTER LINE OF U.S. HIGHWAY 113, NOT 221 FEET.  THE STATION IS LOCATED ABOUT 1 MILE S OF THE TOWN OF SELBYVILLE, DELAWARE, IN THE TOP OF A GRANITE MONUMENT MARKING THE DELAWARE-MARYLAND STATE LINE, 242 FEET E OF THE CENTER LINE OF U.S. HIGHWAY 113, AND OPPOSITE A SIGN MARKING THE STATE LINE.  THE STATION IS A BRONZE DISK TRIANGULATION STATION MARK, STAMPED NORMAN 1932, SET IN THE TOP OF A 6-INCH BY 10-INCH GRANITE MONUMENT, WHICH PROJECTS 14 INCHES ABOVE THE GROUND.  THE STATION IS IN GOOD CONDITION.  REFERENCE MARK NO.1 IS LOCATED 240.75 FEET SSW OF THE STATION, AND 26.24 FEET E OF THE CENTER LINE OF U.S. HIGHWAY 113.  THE MARK IS A BRONZE DISK REFERENCE MARK, WITH THE ARROW POINTING TOWARD THE STATION, STAMPED NORMAN NO.1 1932, SET IN A 12-INCH SQUARE CONCRETE MONUMENT, WHICH IS FLUSH WITH THE GROUND.  THE STATION IS IN GOOD CONDITION.  REFERENCE MARK NO.2 IS LOCATED ABOUT 1/4 MILE W OF STATION, 21 FEET E OF CENTER LINE OF DIRT ROAD, AND 15 FEET S OF CENTER LINE OF A DRAINAGE DITCH.  THE MARK IS A BRONZE DISK REFERENCE MARK, WITH THE ARROW POINTING TOWARD THE STATION, STAMPED NORMAN NO.2, 1932, SET IN THE TOP OF A 12-INCH SQUARE CONCRETE MONUMENT, WHICH IS 1 INCH BELOW GROUND.  THE MARK IS IN GOOD CONDITION.  REFERENCE MARK NO.3 IS LOCATED 210.69 FEET WNW OF THE STATION, 26.2 FEET E OF THE CENTER LINE OF U.S. HIGHWAY 113.  THE MARK IS A BRONZE DISK REFERENCE MARK, WITH THE ARROW POINTING TOWARD THE STATION, STAMPED NORMAN NO.3 1932, SET IN A 12-INCH SQUARE CONCRETE MONUMENT, WHICH EXTENDS 2 INCHES ABOVE GROUND.  THE MARK IS IN GOOD CONDITION.                            STATION RECOVERY (1955)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1955 (WFD) THE STATION IS ABOUT 1 MILE SW OF THE CENTER OF SELBYVILLE, DELAWARE, 242 FEET EAST OF THE CENTER OF US HIGHWAY 113, AND IN THE NE ANGLE OF A CROSSROAD.  TO REACH THA STATION FROM THE JUNCTION OF US HIGHWAY 113 AND MAIN STREET AT THE W EDGE OF SELBYVILLE, GO SOUTH ON HIGHWAY 113 FOR 0.2 MILE TO THE STATION ON THE LEFT.  TO REACH THE AZIMUTH MARK FROM THE CROSSROAD, GO WEST FOR 0.3 MILE TO THE MARK ON THE RIGHT.  THE STATION MARK IS A 6 BY 12 INCH GRANITE MONUMENT THAT PROJECTS 18 INCHES  AND MARKS THE MARYLAND DELAWARE STATE LINE.  A STANDARD DISK IS STAMPED NORMAN 1932.  REFERENCE MARK 3 IS 60 FEET NORTH OF A POWERLINE POLE AND 24 FEET EAST OF THE CENTER OF US HIGHWAY 113.  THE MARK PROJECTS 1 INCH AND THE DISK IS STAMPED NORMAN 1932.  REFERENCE MARK 4 IS 45 FEET EAST OF THE EAST EDGE OF A PARKING AREA.  THE MARK PROJECTS 1 INCH AND THE DISK IS STAMPED NORMAN NO 4 1932.  REFERENCE MARK 5 IS 33 FEET NORTH OF THE NORTH EDGE OF THE PARKING AREA.  THE MARK PROJECTS 2 INCHES AND THE DISK IS STAMPED NORMAN NO 5 1932.  THE AZIMUTH MARK IS 16 FEET NORTH OF THE CENTER OF A PAVED ROAD, 5 FEET EAST OF A TELEPHONE POLE, AND 2 FEET EAST OF A 4 BY 4 INCH WHITE WOODEN WITNESS POST.  THE MARK PROJECTS 4 INCHES AND THE DISK IS STAMPED NORMAN 1955.                            STATION RECOVERY (1962)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1962 (JKW) STATION MARK AND RM 3 WERE RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION.  DISTANCE BETWEEN STATION AND RM WAS CHECKED AND FOUND CORRECT.  REFERENCE MARK 1 IS BELIEVED TO BE DESTROYED.  THERE HAS BEEN A LARGE BUILDING CONSTRUCTED IN THE AREA AND THE MARK HAS PROBABLY BEEN COVERED OVER WITH BLACK TOP.  REFERENCE MARK 2 IS BELIEVED TO BE DESTROYED.  THE ROAD HAS BEEN PAVED AND WIDENED AND A DITCH DUG ALONG ITS SIDE.  ITS POSITION PLACES THE MARK IN THE DITCH.  THE RECOVERY NOTE BY WDF IN 1942 IS ADEQUATE WITH THE FOLLOWING ADDITIONS.  A NEW REFERENCE MARK WAS SET.  RM 4 IS SOUTH OF THE STATION, 204.0 FEET EAST OF THE CENTERLINE OF US HIGHWAY 113, 82.0 FEET NORTH- EAST OF THE NORTHEAST CORNER STONE BUILDING AND 3.0 FEET EAST OF FENCE CORNER IT IS MARKED BY A STANDARD DISK STAMPED NORMAN 4 1932 SET IN THE TOP OF A 10 INCH ROUND CONCRETE MONUMENT WHICH PROJECTS 3 INCHES ABOVE THE GROUND.                            STATION RECOVERY (1962)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1962 (CFO) THE STATION, AZIMUTH MARK AND REFERENCE MARKS 3 AND 5 WERE RECOVERED AS DESCRIBED IN THE 1955 RECOVERY NOTE.  REFERENCE MARK 4 HAS EVIDENTLY BEEN MOVED BY A MARK RELOCATION PARTY AS IT IS NEW LOOKING AND DOES NOT FIT THE DESCRIPTION.  IT IS 60 FEET SOUTH OF THE STATION (ROUGH MEASUREMENT), AND 3 FEET NORTHEAST OF THE NORTHWEST CORNER OF A PICKET FENCE.  THE MARK PROJECTS ABOUT 5 INCHES.  THE ORIGINAL DESCRIPTION IS ADEQUATE.                            STATION RECOVERY (1974)  RECOVERY NOTE BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 1974 (LAL) THE STATION MARK, REFERENCE MARK 4, REFERENCE MARK 5 AND THE AZIMUTH MARK WERE RECOVERED AND FOUND TO BE IN GOOD CONDITION.  REFERENCE MARK 3 *SEARCHED FOR AND IS BELIEVED DESTROYED.  REFERENCE MARK 6 WAS ESTABLISHED AT THIS TIME.  IT IS BELIEVED REFERENCE MARK 4 HAS BEEN MOVED BECAUSE A DIFFERENCE OF 7.266 METERS WAS FOUND.  DUE TO THE CHANGE, A NEW DESCRIPTION FOLLOWS.  THE STATION IS LOCATED IN THE SOUTH EDGE OF SELBYVILLE, DELAWARE, IN THE NORTHEAST ANGLE OF A CROSSROADS AT THE MARYLAND DELAWARE STATE LINE, ON THE PROPERTY OF MR. WILLIAM PENZA, SELBYVILLE, DELAWARE, PHONE 302-734-9770.  TO REACH THE STATION FROM POST OFFICE IN SELBYVILLE, DELAWARE, GO SOUTHWEST ON CHURCH STREET FOR 0.25 MILES TO A RAILROAD CROSSING. CONTINUE SOUTHWEST ON CHURCH STREET FOR 0.35 MILE TO THE JUNCTION OF US HIGHWAY 113. TURN LEFT GO SOUTH ON US HIGHWAY 113 FOR 0.25 MILE TO THE MARYLAND DELAWARE STATE LINE AND THE STATION ON THE LEFT.  TO REACH THE AZIMUTH MARK FROM THE STATION, GO WEST ON A PAVED ROAD FOR 0.35 MILE TO THE AZIMUTH MARK ON THE RIGHT.  TO REACH REFERENCE MARK 6 FROM THE STATION, GO SOUTH ON US HIGHWAY 113 FOR 0.15 MILE TO A WHITE FRAME BUILDING ON THE RIGHT AND THE MARK ON THE RIGHT.  THE STATION MARK A STANDARD DISK STAMPED NORMAN 1932, SET IN A DRILL HOLE IN THE TOP OF A 6 BY 12 INCH GRANITE BOUNDARY LINE MONUMENT THAT PROJECTS 20 INCHES ABOVE THE GROUND SURFACE.  IT IS 123 FEET NORTHEAST OF THE NORTHEAST CORNER OF A CONCRETE BUILDING, 78.5 FEET EAST OF A 12 INCH MAPLE TREE AND IN THE SOUTH EDGE OF A CULTIVATED FIELD.  REFERENCE MARK 4, A STANDARD DISK STAMPED NORMAN NO 4 1932, IS SET IN THE TOP OF A 12-INCH CYLINDRICAL CONCRETE MONUMENT THAT PROJECTS 3 INCHES ABOVE THE GROUND SURFACE.  IT IS 136 FEET NORTH OF THE CENTER OF A PAVED ROAD AND 82 FEET NORTHEAST OF THE NORTHEAST CORNER OF THE CONCRETE BUILDING.  REFERENCE MARK 5, A STANDARD DISK STAMPED NORMAN NO 5 1932, IS SET IN THE TOP OF A 12-INCH CYLINDRICAL CONCRETE MONUMENT THAT IS FLUSH WITH THE GROUND SURFACE.  IT IS 47 FEET EAST-NORTHEAST OF A POWERLINE POLE WITH A TRANSFORMER, 28.7 FEET NORTHWEST OF A 12-INCH MAPLE TREE AND 10 FEET WEST OF THE WEST EDGE OF A CULTIVATED FIELD.  REFERENCE MARK 6, A STANDARD DISK STAMPED NORMAN 1932 NO 6 1974, IS SET IN THE TOP OF A 12-INCH CYLINDRICAL CONCRETE MONUMENT THAT IS FLUSH WITH THE GROUND SURFACE.  IT IS 51 FEET WEST-SOUTHWEST OF A 40-INCH OAK TREE AND 39 FEET EAST-SOUTHEAST OF A 40-INCH OAK TREE.  AZIMUTH MARK, A STANDARD DISK STAMPED NORMAN 1955, SET IN THE TOP OF A 12-INCH CYLINDRICAL CONCRETE MONUMENT THAT IS FLUSH WITH THE GROUND SURFACE.  IT IS 48 FEET NORTH-NORTHEAST OF A POWERLINE POLE NUMBER 20 G, 16 FEET NORTH OF THE CENTER OF A PAVED ROAD AND 4 FEET SOUTH OF A METAL WITNESS POST WITH SIGN.  THE BOUNDARY LINE MONUMENT THE STATION MARK IS SET IN THE TOP OF IS BOUNDARY LINE MONUMENT 10.                            STATION RECOVERY (1976)  RECOVERY NOTE BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 1976 (CLN) THE STATION AND ALL MARKS WERE RECOVERED AND FOUND IN GOOD CONDITION AS PREVIOUSLY DESCRIBED.  AIRLINE DISTANCE AND DIRECTION FROM NEAREST TOWN IN THE SOUTH EDGE OF SELBYVILLE.                            STATION RECOVERY (1986)  RECOVERY NOTE BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 1986 THE MARK IS LOCATED ABOUT 32.25 KM (20.05 MI) EAST-NORTHEAST OF SALISBURY, IN THE SOUTH EDGE OF SELBYVILLE AND ON THE MARYLAND-DELAWARE STATE LINE.  OWNERSHIP--MARYLAND STATE HIGHWAY ADMINISTRAION. TO REACH THE MARK FROM THE POST OFFICE AT SELBYVILLE, GO SOUTHWEST ON CHURCH STREET FOR 0.95 KM (0.60 MI) TO A CROSSROADS.  TURN LEFT AND GO SOUTH ON U.S. HIGHWAY 113 FOR 0.4 KM (0.25 MI) TO A CROSSROADS AND THE MARK IN THE NORTHEAST ANGLE OF THE INTERSECTION. THE MARK IS SET IN A DRILL HOLE IN THE TOP OF THE OLD MARYLAND DELAWARE BOUNDARY MONUMENT AND IT PROJECTS 0.5 M (1.6 FT) ABOVE THE SURFACE OF THE GROUND.  IT IS 50.2 M (164.7 FT) EAST-NORTHEAST OF THE PROJECTED CENTER OF THE NORTH BOUND LANE OF U.S. HIGHWAY 113, 59.2 M (194.2 FT) NORTH OF THE CENTER OF MORRIS ROAD, 40.2 M (131.9 FT) EAST-SOUTHEAST OF A POWERLINE POLE NUMBERED 57373 96222, AND 2.0 M (6.6 FT) SOUTH OF THE SOUTH EDGE OF A CULTIVATED FIELD.                            STATION RECOVERY (2007)  RECOVERY NOTE BY GEOCACHING 2007 (WD) FOUND THE STATION IN GOOD CONDITION, AND THE STONE ON WHICH IT IS MOUNTED IS ERECT AND STABLE.  THE BUILDINGS IN THE IMMEDIATE VICINITY OF THE STATION HAVE BEEN RAZED, AND THE AREA TURNED INTO A SMALL PARK. NONE OF THE REFERENCE MARKS OR THE AZIMUTH MARK WERE FOUND AFTER A ONE-HOUR SEARCH.  THE STATION IS ABOUT 200 FEET EAST OF THE NORTHBOUND LANES OF US HIGHWAY 113, 194.2 FEET NORTH OF THE CENTERLINE OF HOTEL ROAD (FORMERLY NORRIS ROAD), AND 13 FEET SOUTH OF THE SOUTH EDGE OF PAVEMENT OF MASON DRIVE.

markers.description: BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1929 (CFE) THIS STATION LOCATED AT BETHANY BEACH.                            STATION RECOVERY (1934)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1934 (JCT) STATION AND REFERENCE MARKS RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION AND APPARENTLY IN PLACE.  THE DESCRIPTION SHOULD BE AS FOLLOWS--  LOCATED ABOUT 2/3 MILE S FROM THE CENTER OF BETHANY BEACH, DELAWARE, ON FLAT SANDY SOIL ABOUT MIDWAY BETWEEN A DIRT ROAD AND THE SAND DUNES ALONG THE OCEAN BEACH.  THE STATION IS SET ON THE SW SIDE OF A THICK CLUMP OF SMALL PINES, 34.5 METERS E FROM THE CENTER LINE OF THE DIRT ROAD, AND IS SURROUNDED BY SCATTERED SCRUB PINES.  THE DIRT ROAD MAKES A DECIDED SWING W, THEN BACK TO E, JUST TO NW OF THE STATION.  THE SURFACE-STATION MARK IS A STANDARD BRONZE DISK IN A TILE.  NO SEARCH WAS MADE FOR AN  UNDERGROUND-STATION MARK, AND THE ORIGINAL RECORDS LIST NONE.  BOTH REFERENCE MARKS NO.1 AND NO.2 ARE STANDARD BRONZE DISKS SET IN CONCRETE IN THE TOP OF A TILE.  THE HOUSE CHIMNEY LISTED AMONG DISTANCE AND DIRECTIONS TO PROMINENT OBJECTS ON THE ORIGINAL DESCRIPTION NO LONGER EXISTS.  THERE IS NO HOUSE IN THE IMMEDIATE VICINITY OF THE STATION.  TO REACH STATION--ENTERING BETHANY BEACH FROM W ON PAVED HIGHWAY FROM OCEAN VIEW, TURN S ON SECOND PROMINENT DIRT ROAD INTERSECTING HIGHWAY AFTER PASSING THROUGH WOODS.  THIS IS THE INTERSECTION REACHED JUST BEFORE COMING ABREAST OF THE LARGE HEXAGONAL-SHAPED AUDITORIUM BUILDING ON THE N SIDE OF THE HIGHWAY.  GO S ON DIRT ROAD TO ITS INTERSECTION WITH DIRT ROAD RUNNING E AND W ALONG S EDGE OF WOODS.  TURN LEFT (E) AND PROCEED TO NEXT INTERSECTION BY FARMHOUSE.  TURN RIGHT (S) AT FARMHOUSE AND PROCEED TO DISTINCT CURVE MENTIONED ABOVE.  STATION IS ON E SIDE OF ROAD JUST BELOW THIS CURVE.  IN 1934 J.C.T. REPORTS THAT THE CHIMNEY MENTIONED IN THE ORIGINAL DESCRIPTION NO LONGER EXISTS.                            STATION RECOVERY (1943)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1943 (FLG) RECOVERED AS DESCRIBED EXCEPT FOR THE FOLLOWING DISCREPANCIES--  REFERENCE MARK 1 IS NOW 12.785 M.(41.94 FT.) FROM THE STATION, INSTEAD OF 12.78 M.  REFERENCE MARK 2 IS NOW 10.731 M. (35.21 FT.) FROM THE STATION, INSTEAD OF 10.74 M.  THERE IS A NEW PAVED ROAD (STATE ROUTE 14) PARALLELING THE SHORE ABOUT 110 M. E OF THIS STATION.                            STATION RECOVERY (1961)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1961 (RMS) STATION MARK AND REFERENCE MARKS RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION.  THE DISTANCES TO THE REFERENCE MARKS WERE VERIFIED.  THE PUBLISHED DESCRIPTION IS INADEQUATE, A NEW DESCRIPTION FOLLOWS--  STATION IS LOCATED ABOUT 0.9 MILES S OF THE CENTER OF BETHANY BEACH ON THE WEST SIDE OF STATE HWY. 14, IN SCRUB PINE ON NORTH SIDE OF SHORT ROAD AND ABOUT DUE WEST OF TELEPHONE POLE NO. 236 WHICH IS THE ONLY POLE IN THE MEDIUM STRIP OF HWY. 14.  STATION SURFACE MARK IS A STANDARD TRIANGULATION DISK STAMPED NORTH 1929, SET IN A TILE , PROJECTS 3 INCHES AND IS 3 FEET E OF A STEEL WITNESS POST.  REFERENCE MARK NO. 1 IS E OF THE STATION, A STANDARD REFERENCE MARK DISK STAMPED NO 1 1929 SET IN THE TOP AS AND PROJECTS 6 INCHES.  REFERENCE MARK NO. 2 IS S OF THE STATION, A STANDARD REFERENCE MARK DISK STAMPED NO 2 1929 SET IN THE TOP OF A TILE AS DESCRIBED IN NOTE 13A AND PROJECTS 3 INCHES.  TO REACH THE STATION FROM THE JUNCTION OF HIGHWAYS 14 AND 26 IN BETHANY BEACH, GO SOUTH ON HWY. 14 FOR 0.9 MILES TO THE END OF THE DUAL LANES AND SHORT ROAD ON THE RIGHT AND THE STATION IN THE NORTHWEST QUADRANT OF THE INTERSECTION.                            STATION RECOVERY (1962)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1962 (RWT) THE STATION MARK AND REFERENCE MARKS 1 AND 2 WERE RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION.  A COMPLETE DESCRIPTION FOLLOWS--  THE STATION IS LOCATED IN ABOUT 1.0 MILE SOUTH OF BETHANY BEACH, ALONG THE WEST SIDE OF STATE HIGHWAY 14 IN A VERY THICK BRUSHY AREA AND SURROUNDED BY SCATTERED SCRUB PINE TREES.  THE PROPERTY IS NOW OWNED BY MR. PHILLIP SHORT.  TO REACH THE STATION FROM THE JUNCTION OF STATE HIGHWAY 14 AND 26 IN BETHANY BEACH, GO SOUTH ON STATE HIGHWAY 14 BY-PASS FOR 1.0 MILE TO A SIDE ROAD RIGHT, (SHORT ROAD), * TO REACH THE AZIMUTH MARK FROM THIS POINT CONTINUE SOUTH ON HIGHWAY 14 BY-PASS FOR 0.05 MILE TO THE AZIMUTH MARK ON THE RIGHT, JUST BEFORE REACHING A GRAVELED ROAD RIGHT.  * TURN RIGHT AND GO WEST ON SHORT ROAD FOR 150.0 FEET TO A DIM WOODS ROAD RIGHT, TURN RIGHT, GO NORTH ON THE WOODS ROAD FOR ABOUT 300.0 FEET TO THE STATION AS DESCRIBED.  THE STATION MARK IS A STANDARD DISK STAMPED NORTH 1929, SET IN CONCRETE IN TOP OF TILE. PROJECTS 4 INCHES ABOVE THE GROUND SURFACE.  IT IS 4.8 FEET SOUTHEAST OF A STANDARD METAL WITNESS POST AND MARKER AND 38.18 FEET NORTH OF AN 8-INCH TRIANGULAR BLAZED PINE TREE.  REFERENCE MARK 1 IS A STANDARD DISK STAMPED NORTH NO 1 1929, SET IN CEMENT IN TOP OF TILE AND PROJECTS 6 INCHES ABOVE THE GROUND SURFACE.  IT IS 45.7 FEET EAST-SOUTHEAST OF THE WITNESS POST AND MARKER AND 59.0 FEET EAST-NORTHEAST OF AN 8-INCH TRIANGULAR BLAZED ASH TREE.  REFERENCE MARK 2 IS A STANDARD DISK STAMPED NORTH NO 2 1929, SET IN CONCRETE IN TOP OF TILE AND PROJECTS 4 INCHES ABOVE THE GROUND SURFACE.  IT IS 3.0 FEET NORTHWEST OF AN 8-INCH TRIANGULAR BLAZED ASH TREE AND 38.1 FEET EAST OF THE STANDARD METAL WITNESS POST AND MARKER.  THE AZIMUTH MARK IS A STANDARD DISK STAMPED NORTH 1962, SET IN TOP OF SQUARE CONCRETE MONUMENT AND AND PROJECTS ABOUT 4 INCHES ABOVE THE GROUND.  IT IS 2.0 FEET WEST OF A STANDARD METAL WITNESS POST AND MARKER, 30.0 FEET NORTH OF THE APPROXIMATE CENTER OF A GRAVELED ROAD, 38.6 FEET WEST OF THE CENTERLINE OF STATE HIGHWAY 14 AND 57.3 FEET NORTH OF A POWERLINE POLE NUMBER 234-T.  HEIGHT OF LIGHT ABOVE STATION MARK 25.78 METERS.

markers.description: BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1943 (FLG) THERE WAS NO ORIGINAL DESCRIPTION FOR THIS STATION, BUT IT IS PROBABLY THE MOST EASTERLY HOUSE ON OAK ORCHARD BEACH.  THIS IS A PROMINENT HOUSE FROM THE RIVER AND IS DARK-SHINGLED WITH A RED ROOF.  THE HOUSE IS LOCATED ON THE N SHORE OF INDIAN RIVER AND ON THE W SHORE OF A CREEK WHICH LEADS N.                            STATION RECOVERY (1961)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1961 (JKW) STATION RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION.  THE PREVIOUS RECOVERY NOTE BY F.L.G. IN 1943 IS COMPLETE AND ADEQUATE.

BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1933 (GLA) THIS STATION IS ON THE PROPERTY OF THE WATKINS PACKING COMPANY, ODESSA, DELAWARE.  SURFACE, UNDERGROUND, REFERENCE, AND AZIMUTH MARKS ARE STANDARD BRONZE DISKS SET IN CONCRETE.  REFERENCE MARK NO.1 IS N OF THE STATION AND 15 FEET W OF THE BLUFF EDGE.  IT PROJECTS 3 INCHES ABOVE THE EARTHS SURFACE.  REFERENCE MARK NO.1 IS N OF THE STATION AND 15 FEET W OF THE BLUFF EDGE.  IT PROJECTS 3 INCHES ABOVE THE EARTHS SURFACE.  REFERENCE MARK NO.2 IS W OF THE STATION AND JUST N OF AN E-W FENCE PARALLELING THE LANE.  IT PROJECTS 4 INCHES ABOVE THE EARTHS SURFACE.  AZIMUTH MARK IS 1.2 MILES DISTANT.  GO ACROSS BRIDGE AND FOLLOW PAVED ROAD SE TO THE INTERSECTION WITH THE FIRST PAVED ROAD TO THE RIGHT.  TURN RIGHT AND MARK IS ABOUT 300 YARDS DOWN THIS ROAD ON THE LEFT HAND SIDE.  IT IS 30 FEET E OF THE CENTER LINE OF THE ROAD AND PROJECTS 6 INCHES ABOVE THE EARTHS SURFACE.  MARK ESTABLISHED ON THE BRIDGE IS A STANDARD DISK STAMPED APPOQUINIMINK CEMENTED IN DRILL HOLE IN THE E BRIDGE APPROACH ON THE S SIDE.  IT IS 1 FOOT E OF THE E END OF THE DRAW SPAN AND 4.6 FEET N OF THE GUARD WALL ALONG THE S SIDE OF THE BRIDGE APPROACH.  APEX OF THE EASTERNMOST END OF GUARD WALL ON THE SW SIDE OF THE BRIDGE WAS ALSO LOCATED.  TO REACH FROM THE TRAFFIC LIGHT IN THE S BOUND LANE OF U.S. HIGHWAY 13 AT ODESSA, DELAWARE--TURN LEFT AND GO 0.4 MILE TO WHERE STREET DROPS DOWN THE HILL TO BRIDGE.  HERE TURN LEFT AND GO ONE BLOCK.  TURN RIGHT INTO LANE AND STATION WILL BE FOUND AT ITS FOOT NEAR THE BLUFF.  STATION IS 25 FEET W OF BLUFF EDGE, 33 FEET NE OF CORNER OF COW SHED, AND APPROXIMATELY 230 FEET E OF STREET INTERSECTION.  STATION MARK PROJECTS 2 INCHES ABOVE THE EARTHS SURFACE.                            STATION RECOVERY (1946)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1946 (ELJ) A COMPLETE NEW DESCRIPTION IS AS FOLLOWS--THIS STATION IS ON THE PROPERTY OF THE WATKINS PACKING CO., ODESSA, DELAWARE.  SURFACE, UNDERGROUND AND REFERENCE MARKS ARE STANDARD BRONZE DISKS SET IN CONCRETE.  TO REACH STATION FROM TRAFFIC LIGHT IN THE S BOUND LANE OF U.S. HIGHWAY 13 AT ODESSA, TURN LEFT AND GO 0.4 MILE TO WHERE STREET DROPS DOWN THE HILL TO BRIDGE.  HERE TURN LEFT AND GO ONE BLOCK.  TURN RIGHT INTO LANE AND STATION WILL BE FOUND AT ITS FOOT NEAR BLUFF.  STATION IS25 FEET N OF BLUFF EDGE, 42 FEET SE OF CORNER OF COW SHED AND 250 FEET S OF STREET INTERSECTION.  STATION PROJECTS 2 INCHES ABOVE THE EARTHS SURFACE AND IS STAMPED ODESSA 1933.  REFERENCE MARK 1 IS E OF THE STATION AND 15 FEET N OF THE BLUFF EDGE.  IT PROJECTS 3 INCHES ABOVE THE EARTHS SURFACE AND IS STAMPED RM 1.  REFERENCE MARK 2 IS N OF THE STATION AND JUST W OF A N-S FENCE PARALLELING THE LANE.  NO. 2 PROJECTS 4 INCHES ABOVE THE EARTHS SURFACE AND IS STAMPED RM 2.  THE AZIMUTH MARK AS DESCRIBED IN THE 1933 DESCRIPTION COULD NOT BE FOUND.  HOWEVER, PIECES OF CONCRETE WERE FOUND NEAR THE PROBABLE LOCATION OF THE AZIMUTH MARK.  IT IS, THEREFORE, SUGGESTED THE AZIMUTH MARK BE CONSIDERED DESTROYED.                            STATION RECOVERY (2013)  RECOVERY NOTE BY DELAWARE COASTAL PROGRAM 2013 MARK NOT FOUND.

BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1958 (JCE) STATION IS LOCATED ABOUT 3.0 MILES SOUTHEAST OF NEWARK, ABOUT 2.0 MILES WEST-SOUTHWEST OF THE VILLAGE OF CHRISTIANA AND ABOUT 1-1/2 MILES SOUTH OF THE OGLETOWN CROSSROADS.  STATION IS 36 FEET EAST OF APPROXIMATE CENTERLINE OF DRIVEWAY, 64 FEET SOUTHEAST OF POWERLINE POLE AND 48 FEET SOUTH OF APPROXIMATE CENTERLINE OF ROAD.  THE MARK IS A STANDARD STATION DISK SET IN A 12 INCH CONCRETE CYLINDER WHICH IS ABOUT 12 INCHES BELOW THE SURFACE OF THE GROUND AND THE DISK IS STAMPED OGLETOWN 1958.  REFERENCE MARK NO. 1 IS 18 FEET SOUTH OF APPROXIMATE CENTERLINE OF ROAD.  THE MARK IS A STANDARD REFERENCE DISK SET IN 12X12 INCH CONCRETE MONUMENT WHICH PROJECTS 4 INCHES AND THE DISK IS STAMPED OGLETOWN NO 1 1958.  REFERENCE MARK NO. 2 IS 34 FEET WEST OF POWERLINE POLE AND 15 FEET SOUTH OF APPROXIMATE CENTERLINE OF ROAD.  THE MARK IS A STANDARD REFERENCE DISK SET IN A 12X12 INCH CONCRETE MONUMENT WHICH PROJECTS 4 INCHES AND THE DISK IS STAMPED OGLETOWN NO 2 1958.  AZIMUTH MARK IS 20 FEET SOUTH OF POWERLINE POLE, 17 FEET WEST OF APPROXIMATE CENTERLINE OF ROAD AND 3-1/2 FEET SOUTH OF WITNESS POST.  THE MARK IS A STANDARD AZIMUTH DISK SET IN A 12X12 INCH CONCRETE MONUMENT WHICH PROJECTS 2 INCHES AND THE DISK IS STAMPED OGLETOWN 1958.  TO REACH FROM THE JUNCTION OF U.S. HIGHWAY NO. 40 AND STATE HIGHWAY NO. 896 IN GLASGOW, GO NORTHERLY ON STATE HIGHWAY NO. 896 FOR 2.0 MILES TRAFFIC LIGHT AT CROSSROADS.  TURN RIGHT AND GO EASTERLY FOR 2.5 MILES TO SIDE ROAD LEFT AT NURSERY.  TURN LEFT AND GO NORTHERLY FOR 0.65 MILE TO SIDE ROAD LEFT.  (CONTINUE NORTHERLY FOR 0.35 MILE TO AZIMUTH MARK ON LEFT (WEST) SIDE OF ROAD AS DESCRIBED).  TURN LEFT AND GO WESTERLY FOR 0.15 MILE TO STATION ON LEFT AT DRIVEWAY AS DESCRIBED.  HEIGHT OF LIGHT ABOVE STATION MARK 33 METERS.                            STATION RECOVERY (1959)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1959 3.2 MI W FROM CHRISTIANA. 2.35 MILES SOUTHWEST ALONG OLD BALTIMORE PIKE FROM THE JUNCTION OF STATE HIGHWAYS 7 AND 273 AT CHRISTIANA, THENCE ABOUT 0.65 MILE NORTH ALONG SALEM CHURCH ROAD, THENCE ABOUT 0.2 MILE WEST ALONG A GRAVEL ROAD, 46 FEET SOUTH OF THE CENTER LINE OF THE GRAVEL ROAD, 35 FEET EAST OF THE CENTER LINE OF A DRIVE LEADING SOUTH TO A FARMHOUSE, 76.7 FEET WEST-SOUTHWEST OF R M 1, 92.7 FEET SOUTHEAST OF R M 2, AND SET IN TOP OF A CONCRETE POST 1 FOOT BELOW THE SURFACE OF THE GROUND. DISK SENT IN BY DELAWARE HIGHWAY DEPARTMENT.                            STATION RECOVERY (1973)  RECOVERY NOTE BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 1973 (CLN) THE STATION MARK WAS RECOVERED AND FOUND IN GOOD CONDITION AS DESCRIBED IN THE 1958 DESCRIPTION.  REFERENCE MARKS ONE AND TWO WERE NOT FOUND.  THE AZIMUTH MARK WAS NOT FOUND.  A REFERENCE MARK THREE WAS FOUND WITH THE ARROW POINTING 180 DEGREES OFF OF THE STATION.  THERE WAS NO INFORMATION ON THE REFERENCE WHICH WAS FOUND.  A SEARCH IS BEING MADE TO ALL SURVEY OUTFITS IN THE AREA TO FIND OUT WHO SET THE MARK AND IF ANY OTHER MARKS WERE SET.  THIS STATION WILL BE OCCUPIED AND RE-MARKED WHEN THE SUBJECT INFORMATION IS OBTAINED.  AIRLINE DISTANCE AND DIRECTION FROM NEAREST TOWN 3 MILES SOUTHEAST OF NEWARK.                            STATION RECOVERY (1979)  RECOVERY NOTE BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 1979 (RGP) THE STATION MARK WAS RECOVERED AND FOUND IN GOOD CONDITION.  BOTH REFERENCE MARKS HAD BEEN DESTROYED.  THE AZIMUTH MARK WAS SEARCHED FOR BUT NOT FOUND, IT IS BELIEVED DESTROYED BY THE PLACING OF A UNDERGROUND GAS LINE.  TWO NEW REFERENCE MARKS AND A NEW AZIMUTH MARK WAS ESTABLISHED.  THE REFERENCE MARK 3 WHICH WAS ESTABLISHED, HAD BEEN SET BY SOME LEVEL CREW BACK AROUND 1958 AND HAD NOT BEEN TIED TO THE STATION.  THE ARROW ON THE MARK IS POINTING NEARLY 180 DEGREES OFF OF THE STATION.  A COMPLETE NEW DESCRIPTION FOLLOWS.  THE STATION IS LOCATED ABOUT 3 MILES SOUTHEAST OF NEWARK, 2 MILES WEST-SOUTHWEST OF CHRISTIANA, 1-1/2 MILES SOUTH OF OGLETOWN CROSSROADS AND 0.1 MILE NORTH OF INTERSTATE HIGHWAY 95.  TO REACH THE STATION FROM THE INTERSECTION OF U.S. HIGHWAY 40 AND STATE HIGHWAY 896 IN GLASGOW, GO NORTH ON STATE HIGHWAY 896 FOR 2.1 MILES TO A CROSSROADS.  TURN RIGHT AND GO EAST ON OLD BALTIMORE PIKE FOR 0.8 MILE TO THE JUNCTION OF STATE HIGHWAY 72.  CONTINUE EAST ON OLD BALTIMORE PIKE FOR 1.8 MILES TO A SIDE ROAD LEFT.  TURN LEFT AND GO NORTH ON SALEM ROAD FOR 0.7 MILE TO A OVERPASS BRIDGE AND THE AZIMUTH MARK NUMBER 2 ON THE RIGHT.  CONTINUE NORTH ON SALEM ROAD FOR 0.2 MILE TO A SIDE ROAD LEFT.  TURN SHARP LEFT AND GO SOUTH THEN WEST ON A PAVED ROAD FOR 0.25 MILE TO THE STATION ON THE LEFT.  THE STATION IS A STANDARD US COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY (NOW NOS) DISK STAMPED---OGLETOWN 1958---SET INTO THE TOP OF AN IRREGULAR MASS OF CONCRETE RECESSED 30 CM (12 INCHES) BELOW THE GROUND LOCATED 11.9 METERS (39 FEET) S FROM THE CENTER OF THE PAVED ROAD, 11.0 METERS (36 FEET) E FROM THE CENTER OF A DIRT ROAD LEADING SOUTH, 7.6 METERS (25 FEET) SE FROM A POWERLINE POLE NUMBERED K600 11 44347 40246, AND 0.64 METER (2.1 FEET) W FROM A WITNESS POST.  REFERENCE MARK NO. 3 IS A STANDARD US COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY (NOW NOS) DISK STAMPED---OGLETOWN NO 3 1958---SET INTO THE TOP OF A SQUARE CONCRETE MONUMENT 20 CM (8 INCHES) ON SIDE PROJECTING 10 CM (4 INCHES) ABOVE THE GROUND.   THE ARROW ON THIS MARK IS POINTING ABOUT 180 DEGREES OFF OF THE STATION.  THE MARK IS LOCATED 25.82 METERS (84.7 FEET) NW FROM THE WITNESS POST, 16.2 METERS (53 FEET) W FROM THE POWERLINE POLE NUMBERED K600 11 44347 40246, 11.6 METERS (38 FEET) W FROM THE CENTER OF THE DIRT ROAD, AND 8.5 METERS (28 FEET) S FROM THE CENTER OF THE PAVED ROAD.  REFERENCE MARK NO. 4 IS A STANDARD NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY DISK STAMPED---OGLETOWN 1958 NO 4 1979---SET INTO THE TOP OF A ROUND CONCRETE MONUMENT 25 CM (10 INCHES) IN DIAMETER PROJECTING 3 CM (1 INCH) ABOVE THE GROUND LOCATED 20.79 METERS (68.2 FEET) N FROM THE WITNESS POST, 8.2 METERS (27 FEET) N FROM THE CENTER OF THE PAVED ROAD, 1.2 METERS (4 FEET) NE FROM A POWERLINE GUY POLE NUMBERED K600 10 44349 40250, AND 1.2 METERS (4 FEET) SE FROM A GUY ANCHOR.  AZIMUTH MARK NO. 2 IS A STANDARD NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY DISK STAMPED---OGLETOWN 1958 AZ 2 1979---CEMENTED IN A DRILL HOLE IN THE EAST SIDEWALK OF AN OVERPASS BRIDGE WHERE SALEM ROAD CROSSES INTERSTATE HIGHWAY 95.  MARK IS LOCATED W FROM THE EAST BANISTER, E FROM THE CENTER OF SALEM ROAD, AND S FROM THE NORTH EDGE OF THE BRIDGE. markers.description: BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1962 (RWT) THE STATION IS LOCATED ABOUT 3.7 MILES SOUTH OF BETHANY BEACH, DELAWARE, 2.5 MILES NORTH OF THE MARYLAND-DELAWARE STATE LINE, ON THE HIGHEST SAND DUNE IN THE VICINITY AND ON PROPERTY OWNED BY MR. BLAINE T. PHILLIPS.  A LAWYER OF WILMINGTON, DELAWARE.  TO REACH THE STATION FROM THE JUNCTION OF STATE HIGHWAYS 14 AND 26 IN BETHANY BEACH.  GO SOUTH ON STATE HIGHWAY 14 FOR 3.98 MILES TO A SMALL COTTAGE ON THE LEFT, EAST, SIDE OF THE HIGHWAY AND THE END OF TRUCK TRAVEL.  FROM THE END OF TRUCK TRAVEL, PACK EAST ABOUT 250.0 FEET TO THE NORTHEAST OF THE COTTAGE, TO THE HIGHEST POINT OF THE DUNE AND THE STATION.  THE STATION MARK, A STANDARD DISK STAMPED PHILLIPS 1962, IS SET IN THE TOP OF A 10-INCH SQUARE CONCRETE MONUMENT PROJECTING ABOUT 3 INCHES ABOVE THE SURFACE OF THE GROUND.  IT IS 250.0 FEET NORTHEAST OF THE NORTHEAST CORNER OF THE COTTAGE, 7.1 FEET WEST OF A STANDARD METAL WITNESS POST AND MARKER AND 4.4 FEET SOUTH OF AN EAST AND WEST FENCE LINE AND PROPERTY LINE.  REFERENCE MARK 1, A STANDARD DISK STAMPED PHILLIPS NO 1 1962, IS SET IN THE TOP OF A 10-INCH SQUARE CONCRETE MONUMENT PROJECTING ABOUT 2 INCHES ABOVE THE SURFACE OF THE GROUND.  IT IS 48.7 FEET WEST OF A STANDARD METAL WITNESS POST AND MARKER, 3.9 FEET SOUTH OF THE EAST AND WEST FENCELINE AND IS ABOUT 12-INCHES BELOW STATION ELEVATION.  REFERENCE MARK 2, A STANDARD DISK STAMPED PHILLIPS NO 2 1962, IS SET IN THE TOP OF A 10-INCH SQUARE CONCRETE MONUMENT PROJECTING ABOUT 1 INCH ABOVE THE SURFACE OF THE GROUND.  IT IS 32.9 FEET SOUTH OF THE EAST AND WEST FENCELINE, 28.2 FEET SOUTH OF A STANDARD METAL WITNESS POST AND MARKER AND ABOUT 12-INCHES BELOW STATION ELEVATION.  AN AZIMUTH MARK WAS NOT ESTABLISHED FOR THIS STATION.  HEIGHT OF LIGHT ABOVE STATION MARK 2.0 METERS.                            STATION RECOVERY (1967)  RECOVERY NOTE BY US GEOLOGICAL SURVEY 1967 STATION AND REFERENCE MARKS FOUND WASHED OUT AND LAYING ON SAND.                            STATION RECOVERY (1970)  RECOVERY NOTE BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 1970 (MNW) THE SURFACE STATION MARK AND REFERENCE MARKS CAN BE ASSUMED DESTROYED.  THREE CONCRETE POSTS, EACH SHOWING AN IMPRINT OF A DISK WERE RECOVERED LAYING ABOVE GROUND AT THE STATION SITE.  NO SEARCH WAS MADE FOR THE UNDERGROUND MARK.  AIRLINE DISTANCE AND DIRECTION FROM NEAREST TOWN 3.7 MILES SOUTH OF BETHANY BEACH.                            STATION RECOVERY (1972)  RECOVERY NOTE BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 1972 (LFS) A SEARCH WAS MADE FOR THE STATION AND NO MARKS WERE FOUND.  THE SAND DUNE WHICH THE STATION WAS ON IS NOW GONE.  IT WAS WASHED AWAY DURING SOME STORM.  THE AREA WHERE THE STATION WAS IS NOW ABOUT 10 FEET LOWER THAN THE SAND DUNES IN THE IMMEDIATE AREA OF THE STATION LOCATION.  THE STATION CAN BE DETERMINED DESTROYED.  AIRLINE DISTANCE AND DIRECTION FROM NEAREST TOWN 4 MILES SOUTH OF BETHANY BEACH.

markers.description: BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1961 (RWT) (THERE WERE NO REFERENCE MARKS TAKEN AT THIS STATION).  THE STATION IS LOCATED ABOUT 2.0 MILES NORTH OF BURRSVILLE, ABOUT 6.0 MILES EAST-NORTHEAST OF DENTON MARYLAND, ON THE PROPERTY OWNED BY MR. EDGAR PIERSON.  TO REACH THE STATION FROM THE GENERAL STORE IN BURRSVILLE, GO NORTHERLY FOR 0.05 MILE TO A FORK, KEEP THE RIGHT FORK AND CONTINUE NORTHERLY FOR 0.2 MILE TO A SIDE ROAD RIGHT, TURN RIGHT, GO NORTHEASTERLY ON MACDAM ROAD FOR 0.7 MILE TO A SIDE ROAD RIGHT, CONTINUE NORTH ON THE MACADAM ROAD FOR 0.25 MILE TO A FIELD ROAD LEFT, TURN LEFT ON FIELD ROAD FOR 0.1 MILE AND STATION.  AZIMUTH MARK, A STANDARD DISK STAMPED PIERSON 1961, SET IN THE TOP OF A 10 X 10 INCH SQUARE CONCRETE MONUMENT, IS ABOUT 8 INCHES BELOW GROUND SURFACE.  IT IS 3.0 FEET SOUTH OF A CULTIVATED FIELD.  3.0 FEET NORTH OF A CULTIVATED FIELD.

markers.description: BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1934 (JCT) LOCATED ON THE S SIDE OF INDIAN RIVER AT THE NORTHEASTERN EXTREMITY OF PINE NECK AND DIRECTLY OPPOSITE WILLOWBANK POINT ON THE N SHORE OF THE RIVER.  THE STATION IS LOCATED NEAR THE CENTER AND ON THE HIGHEST PART OF A SMALL HUMMOCK OF HIGH GROUND IN THE MARSH.  THIS HUMMOCK IS THE SECOND AND SMALLER SITUATED TO THE N OF THAT SECTION OF MARSH KNOWN AS THREE POINTS, AND IS ABOUT 50 METERS W FROM A SHORT STRIP OF SAND BEACH.  IT IS SEPARATED FROM THE BEACH BY A STRIP OF TALL WATER GRASS, AND A SMALL LAGOON MAKES INTO THE MARSH ON ITS N SIDE.  THE STATION IS 12.8 METERS SW OF A SMALL OAK TREE WHICH IS THE ONLY TREE GROWING ON THE HUMMOCK, AND IS SURROUNDED BY SHORT GRASS AND SCATTERED BUSHES.  SURFACE AND REFERENCE MARKS ARE STANDARD BRONZE DISKS IN A TILE.  UNDERGROUND MARK IS  A BLOCK OF CONCRETE BELOW THE GROUND CONTAINING A STANDARD BRONZE DISK.  THE WITNESS MARK IS A LONE OAK.  THIS STATION IS READILY ACCESSIBLE ONLY FROM THE WATER.                            STATION RECOVERY (1943)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1943 (FLG) RECOVERED AS DESCRIBED, EXCEPT FOR THE FOLLOWING DISCREPANCIES--  1.  REFERENCE MARK 1 IS 35.27 FEET OR 10.749 METERS SE OF THE STATION.  2.  REFERENCE MARK 2 IS 38.41 FEET OR 11.707 METERS W OF THE STATION.  3.  FROM REFERENCE MARK 1 TO REFERENCE MARK 2 IT IS 56.01 FEET OR 17.073 METERS.  4.  THE LONE OAK DESCRIBED IS NOW DEAD AND IT IS BROKEN OFF ABOUT 7 FEET FROM THE GROUND.                            STATION RECOVERY (1954)  RECOVERY NOTE BY US GEOLOGICAL SURVEY 1954 STATION RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION.  ALL MENTION OF MARSH SHOULD BE DELETED FROM DESCRIPTION AS SAME HAS BEEN FILLED IN COMPLETELY WITH DREDGE MATERIAL.                            STATION RECOVERY (1961)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1961 (JKW) STATION AND RMS WERE RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION.  THE DISTANCES WERE CHECKED AND FOUND TO BE CORRECT.  THE STATION MARK WAS STAMPED PINE 1934 AND THE RMS WERE STAMPED NO. 1 1934 AND NO. 2 1934 RESPECTIVELY.  THE PREVIOUS RECOVERY NOTES ARE ADEQUATE WITH THE FOLLOWING ADDITIONS.  (1) THE STATION IS 44.5 FEET NORTH OF A 12 INCH PINE TREE.  (2) THE STATION IS 69.0 FEET NORTHEAST OF A 12 INCH PINE AND 54.0 FEET SOUTHWEST OF AN 8 INCH PINE.  THESE ARE THE ONLY PINE TREES ON THE HUMMOCK.  THE STATION CAN BEST BE REACHED BY BOAT.                            STATION RECOVERY (1962)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1962 (RWT) THIS STATION WAS NOT OCCUPIED ON THIS DATE.  THE STATION MARK, REFERENCE MARKS NO. 1 AND NO. 2 WERE RECOVERED AS DESCRIBED AND FOUND IN GOOD CONDITION.  THERE ARE NOW THREE REASONABLE LARGE PINE TREES ON THE STATION POINT AND ONLY ONES IN THE AREA THAT CAN BE USED FOR REFERENCE POINTS FOR LOCATING THE STATION.  NEW NOTES AND MEASUREMENTS ARE AS FOLLOW--  THE STATION MARK IS 70.3 FEET NORTHEAST OF A 10-INCH PINE TREE, 54.3 FEET SOUTHWEST OF THE MOST EASTERLY ONE OF THREE PINE TREES AND 44.5 FEET NORTH-NORTHWEST OF A 14-INCH PINE TREE.  REFERENCE MARK NO. 1 IS 18.2 FEET NORTHEAST OF A 14-INCH PINE TREE.  REFERENCE MARK NO. 2 IS 21.0 FEET EAST OF AN 8-INCH PINE TREE.  NOTE--THE STATION IS BEST REACHED BY BOAT.
markers.setting: SET IN CONCRETE IN A CLAY TILE PIPE
markers.stability: MARK OF QUESTIONABLE OR UNKNOWN STABILITY

CONTINUE SOUTHEASTERLY ON STATE HIGHWAY NO. 273 FOR 0.45 MILE TO HILLSIDE HEIGHTS SIGN AND STATION ON RIGHT (SOUTHWEST) SIDE OF HIGHWAY AS DESCRIBED. STATION RECOVERY (1962)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1962 (JS) REFERENCE MARK NO. 3 IS 155.225 FEET SOUTH OF AND ACROSS HIGHWAY 273 FROM REFERENCE MARK NO. 1.  16.3 FEET SOUTH OF NORTHEAST CORNER OF TYDOL GASOLINE STATION BUILDING, 9.1 FEET NORTH OF SOUTHEAST CORNER OF SAME BUILDING, 1.45 FEET FROM EAST WALL OF BUILDING.  THE MARK IS A STANDARD REFERENCE MARK DISK SET IN A DRILL HOLE OF THE PAVEMENT ALONG THE EAST WALL OF THE TYDOL GASOLINE STATION.  THE DISH IS STAMPED PINESWAMP NO. 3 1958 - 1962.  AZIMUTH MARK IS 45 FEET NORTHEAST OF HIGHWAY 273, 10 FEET NORTHWEST OF POWER LINE POLE 8, 33 FEET NORTHEAST OF A 2-FOOT BELL SYSTEM MANHOLE COVER, 2.2 FEET NORTH OF NORTH CURB OF WEST-BOUND LANE OF HIGHWAY 273. STATION, REFERENCE MARKS NO. 1 AND NO. 2, AND THE AZIMUTH MARK WERE RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION.  IN THE NEAR FUTURE R. M. BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1933 (GLA) THIS STATION IS ABOUT 1 MILE N OF PORT PENN.  AND 2.5 MILES S OF DELAWARE CITY AT THE EDGE OF THE MARSH ALONG THE E SIDE OF THE PORT PENN-DELAWARE CITY HIGHWAY.  THE MARK IS SET AT THE E EDGE OF THE E SHOULDER OF THE HIGHWAY.  27 FEET E OF THE CENTER LINE OF THE ROAD.  AND 70 FEET ESE OF TELEPHONE POLE NO.112.  THE MARK IS SET FLUSH.  SURFACE, UNDERGROUND, AND REFERENCE MARKS ARE STANDARD BRONZE DISKS SET IN CONCRETE AS DESCRIBED IN NOTES 1A, 7A, AND 11A.  REFERENCE MARK NO.1 IS SSW OF THE STATION.  SET IN THE N END OF THE CULVERT OF A ROAD LEADING INTO A FIELD TO THE W.  20 FEET W OF THE CENTER LINE OF THE HIGHWAY.  51 FEET SSE OF TELEPHONE POLE NO.113.  AND 18 FEET E OF THE W RIGHT-OF-WAY FENCE.  REFERENCE MARK NO.2 IS NW OF THE STATION.  38 FEET W OF THE CENTER LINE OF THE HIGHWAY.  36 FEET N OF TELEPHONE POLE NO.112.  AND 1 FOOT E OF THE W RIGHT-OF-WAY FENCE.  THE MARK PROJECTS 4 INCHES.  TO REACH FROM PORT PENN, GO N ON THE DELAWARE CITY HIGHWAY 1.1 MILES OR 0.25 MILE PAST A T-ROAD (W) TO THE STATION.  TO REACH FROM DELAWARE CITY, GO S ON THE PORT PENN HIGHWAY 2.3 MILES FROM THE ENTRANCE TO FORT DUPONT TO THE STATION.  IT IS ABOUT 0.3 MILE SW OF THE BAKER REAR RANGE LIGHT, LOCALLY KNOWN AS THE PORT PENN LIGHT. AZIMUTH MARK IS A STANDARD DISK STAMPED PURPLE 1961, SET IN TOP OF A SQUARE CONCRETE MONUMENT WHICH PROJECTS 1 INCH ABOVE THE GROUND SURFACE.  IT IS 2.4 SOUTHWEST OF A STANDARD METAL WITNESS POST, 4.0 FEET SOUTHWEST OF A POWERLINE POLE NUMBER 60, 17.0 FEET SOUTH OF THE APPROXIMATE CENTER OF THE MACADAM ROAD AND ABOUT 5.0 FEET NORTH OF THE NORTH EDGE OF A CULTIVATED FIELD.  BOUNDARY MONUMENT NO. 73 IS A 11 IN X 11 IN LIMESTONE BOULDER WHICH PROJECTS 30 INCHES ABOVE THE GROUND SURFACE AND HAS THE LETTER P ON THE EAST SIDE AND THE LETTER M ON THE WEST SIDE.  THE MONUMENT WAS RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION.  THE PROPERTY OWNER STATED THAT THE MONUMENT HAS BEEN MOVED A SHORT DISTANCE.  IT IS LOCATED IN A EAST AND WEST FENCE LINE, 51.0 FEET EAST OF A FIELD ENTRANCE, 233.0 FEET WEST OF A FIELD ENTRANCE AND 244.0 FT WEST OF A STANDARD METAL WITNESS POST.  HEIGHT OF LIGHT ABOVE STATION MARK 30.20 METERS.                            STATION RECOVERY (1975)  RECOVERY NOTE BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 1975 (CLN) THE STATION AND ALL MARKS WERE RECOVERED AND FOUND IN GOOD CONDITION AS DESCRIBED IN THE 1961 DESCRIPTION.  A LONGER DISTANCE OF 0.04 FOOT WAS NOTED TO REFERENCE MARK 1 AND A LONGER DISTANCE OF 0.15 FOOT WAS NOTED TO REFERENCE MARK 2.  THE DIRECTION TO ALL MARKS WERE WITHIN CLOSE AGREEMENT WITH THE 1961 OBSERVATIONS.  THE DISTANCE AND DIRECTION TO THE STATE BOUNDARY LINE WAS CHECKED AND WAS FOUND TO BE IN THE EDGE OF A CULTIVATED FIELD.  A IRON STAKE WAS DROVE INTO THE GROUND ON A LINE ABOUT 43 FEET NORTH OF THE COMPUTED POINT.  THERE IS A SEPARATE REPORT ON BOUNDARY MONUMENT NUMBER 73.  AIRLINE DISTANCE AND DIRECTION FROM NEAREST TOWN 2 MILES ESE OF CHESAPEAKE CITY.                            STATION RECOVERY (1976)  RECOVERY NOTE BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 1976 (CLN) THE STATION SURFACE DISK WAS FOUND DESTROYED.  THE SUB-SURFACE DISK WAS RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION ALONG WITH ALL OTHER MARKS.  THE DISTANCE AND DIRECTION TO BOTH REFERENCE MARKS AND THE AZIMUTH MARK WAS CHECKED, THEN A NEW STATION SURFACE MONUMENT SET OVER THE OLD SUB-SURFACE DISK.  A COMPLETE NEW DESCRIPTION FOLLOWS.  THE STATION IS LOCATED ABOUT 12 MILES SOUTH OF NEWARK, 2 MILES SOUTHEAST OF CHESAPEAKE CITY, AND ABOUT 1 MILE SOUTH OF THE C AND D CANAL.  THE PROPERTY IS OWNED BY MR. CLEVER CARTER AND MR. CARTER LIVES JUST NORTH OF THE STATION.  TO REACH FROM THE POST OFFICE IN CHESAPEAKE CITY, GO EAST AND NORTHEAST ON STATE HIGHWAY 286 FOR 0.5 MILE TO A T-INTERSECTION.  TURN RIGHT AND GO EAST ON STATE HIGHWAY 286 FOR 1.3 MILE TO A CROSSROADS.  CONTINUE EAST ON STATE HIGHWAY 286 FOR 0.3 MILE TO MR. CLEVERS HOME ON THE RIGHT.  TURN RIGHT AND GO SOUTH CROSSING A FIELD AND PASSING MR. CLEVERS HOME FOR 0.2 MILE TO THE STATION IN A FENCE LINE.  THE STATION MARK IS A STANDARD DISK STAMPED PURPLE 1961 1976, SET IN THE TOP OF A 14-INCH MASS OF CONCRETE 16-INCHES BELOW THE SURFACE.  IT IS 100 FEET SOUTH OF A WOODED AREA IN A CULTIVATED FIELD, 94 FEET SOUTH OF A WITNESS POST, 85 FEET EAST OF A WITNESS POST, AND 2 FEET NORTH OF A WOODED FENCE LINE.  REFERENCE MARK ONE IS A STANDARD DISK STAMPED PURPLE NO. 1 1961, SET IN THE TOP OF A 10-INCH SQUARE CONCRETE MONUMENT WHICH IS FLUSH WITH THE SURFACE.  IT IS 10 FEET SOUTH OF THE SOUTH EDGE OF THE WOODED AREA IN THE FIELD, AND 1.2 FEET SOUTHWEST OF A WITNESS POST.  (NOTE 11A).  REFERENCE MARK TWO IS A STANDARD DISK STAMPED PURPLE NO. 2 1961, SET IN THE TOP OF A 10-INCH SQUARE CONCRETE MONUMENT WHICH IS FLUSH WITH THE SURFACE.  IT IS 4 FEET NORTH OF THE WOODED FENCE LINE AND 1 FOOT WEST OF A WITNESS POST.  (NOTE 11A).  THE AZIMUTH MARK IS A STANDARD DISK STAMPED PURPLE 1961 SET IN THE TOP OF A 10-INCH SQUARE CONCRETE MONUMENT PROJECTING 1-INCH.  IT IS 18 FEET SOUTH OF THE CENTER OF STATE HIGHWAY 286, 5 FEET NORTH OF A POWERLINE POLE, AND 2.5 FEET WEST OF A WITNESS POST.  TO REACH THE AZIMUTH MARK FROM THE PAVED ROAD AT MR. CLEVERS HOME, CONTINUE WEST ON STATE HIGHWAY 286 FOR 0.1 MILE TO THE MARK ON THE RIGHT.  THE MARYLAND-DELAWARE BOUNDARY MONUMENT 73 WAS RE-ESTABLISHED AT THIS DATE, SEE DESCRIPTION THEREOF.  AIRLINE DISTANCE AND DIRECTION FROM NEAREST TOWN 2 MILES SOUTHEAST OF CHESAPEAKE CITY.
