markers.description: BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1932 (CDM) LOCATED ABOUT 150 YARDS S OF THE NAVAL RADIO COMPASS STATION ON CAPE HENLOPEN.  ON TOP OF A LOW KNOLL.  ABOUT 250 FEET E OF THE ROAD LEADING TO THE RADIO STATION.  SURFACE, UNDERGROUND, AND REFERENCE MARKS ARE STANDARD BRONZE DISKS SET IN CONCRETE.  REFERENCE MARK NO. 1 IS ABOUT 1/4 MILE S OF STATION, AND ABOUT 10 METERS E OF THE ROAD.  AT A POINT WHERE THE ROAD LEADING TO THE STATION CURVES TO THE WESTWARD.  REFERENCE MARK NO. 2 IS 318.7 FEET SW OF STATION.  3 METERS E OF CENTER LINE OF ROAD.  REFERENCE MARK NO. 3 IS 241.8 FEET WNW OF STATION.  ABOUT 3 METERS S OF CENTER LINE OF THE ROAD.  TO REACH THE STATION FROM LEWES, GO ON GRAVEL ROAD BY COAST GUARD STATION.  HEIGHT OF SIGNAL ABOVE STATION MARK - 31 METERS.                            STATION RECOVERY (1943)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1943 (FLG) THIS STATION IS LOCATED ABOUT 2.5 MILES NE OF LEWES, ON CAPE HENLOPEN INSIDE THE FORT MILES MILITARY RESERVATION.  THE MARK IS LOCATED ON A LOW SAND HILL 230 METERS S OF THE COAST GUARD RADIO DIRECTION FINDING STATION, 93 METERS E OF THE INTERSECTION OF THE PAVED ROAD LEADING N AND A GRAVEL ROAD LEADING E, 35 METERS S OF THE GRAVEL ROAD LEADING E, AND 26 METERS WSW OF CONCRETE MILITARY BUILDING NO. T-115.  STATION MARK IS A BRONZE STATION DISK, STAMPED RADIO 1932, AND SET IN THE TOP OF A 12-INCH SQUARE CONCRETE MONUMENT WHICH EXTENDS 18 INCHES ABOVE THE GROUND.  IT IS IN GOOD CONDITION.  REFERENCE MARKS 1 AND 2 HAVE BEEN DESTROYED BY THE CONSTRUCTION OF A NEW ROAD.  REFERENCE MARK 3 IS LOCATED 241.30 FEET (73.548 METERS) WNW OF THE STATION AND ABOUT 3 METERS S OF AN OLD ROAD.  IT IS A BRONZE REFERENCE DISK, STAMPED RADIO R M NO 3 1932, AND SET IN THE TOP OF A 12-INCH SQUARE CONCRETE MONUMENT WHICH EXTENDS 5 INCHES ABOVE THE GROUND.  IT IS IN GOOD CONDITION.                            STATION RECOVERY (1945)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1945 (TBR) THE STATION IS ABOUT 2.5 MILES NE OF LEWES, ON CAPE HENLOPEN, WITHIN THE FORT MILES MILITARY RESERVATION, ON A LOW E-W SAND RIDGE, ABOUT 230 METERS S OF THE COAST GUARD RADIO DIRECTION FINDING STATION BUILDING (STATION HAS BEEN DISCONTINUED), 93 METERS E OF THE S T-INTERSECTION OF POINT ROAD AND PRETTYMAN LANE (BOTH ROADS ARE PAVED), 88 METERS W OF POINT ROAD, 35 METERS S OF PRETTYMAN LANE, AND 26 METERS WSW OF SW CORNER OF CONCRETE BLOCK BUILDING NO. T-115, WEATHER OBSERVATORY.  EROSION HAS EXPOSED ABOUT 2 FEET OF THE MONUMENT.  THE ADJACENT AREA WAS WATTLED WITH OAK BRUSH WIRED DOWN.  STATION MARK IS A BRONZE STATION DISK SET IN CONCRETE.  SUB-SURFACE MARK IS A BRONZE STATION DISK SET IN CONCRETE.  REFERENCE MARKS 1 AND 2, REPORTED IN 1943 AS HAVING BEEN DESTROYED BY ROAD BUILDING OPERATIONS, WERE NOT FOUND.  REFERENCE MARK 3 IS A BRONZE REFERENCE DISK SET IN CONCRETE.  IT IS NW OF THE STATION, 42 METERS E OF POINT ROAD, 26.5 METERS N OF PRETTYMAN LANE, AND 3 METERS S OF ABANDONED GRAVEL ROAD.  MARK PROJECTS 0.1 METER.  REFERENCE MARK 4, A BRONZE DISK, WAS ESTABLISHED W OF THE STATION IN A DRILL HOLE IN THE TOP OF, AND 0.3 METER FROM THE END OF, THE NW WINGWALL OF THE SECOND CONCRETE CULVERT S OF THE S INTERSECTION OF POINT ROAD AND PRETTYMAN LANE.                            STATION RECOVERY (1962)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1962 (RWT) THE STATION MARK, REFERENCE MARKS NO. 1 (AZIMUTH MARK), NO. 3 AND NO. 4 WERE RECOVERED AS DESCRIBED AND FOUND IN GOOD CONDITION.  THE STATION MARK NOW PROJECTS ABOUT 18 INCHES ABOVE THE SURFACE OF THE GROUND.  A NEW TO REACH THE STATION FOLLOWS--  TO REACH THE STATION FROM THE POST OFFICE IN LEWES, DELAWARE.  GO SOUTHEAST ON MAIN STREET FOR 0.05 MILE TO THE INTERSECTION OF GILLS NECK ROAD AND SAVANNAH ROAD.  TURN LEFT AND GO NORTHEAST ON SAVANNAH ROAD FOR 0.47 MILE TO A FORK (FORT MILES ROAD).  TAKE THE RIGHT HAND FORK AND GO SOUTHEAST ON FORT MILES ROAD FOR 1.62 MILES TO THE MAIN GUARD GATE INTO THE MILITARY RESERVATION. PASS THROUGH THE GUARD GATE AND CONTINUE EAST ON POST LANE FOR 0.75 MILE TO A SIDE ROAD LEFT, POINT ROAD, TURN LEFT AND GO NORTH ON POINT ROAD FOR 0.05 MILE TO REFERENCE MARK NO. 1, THE AZIMUTH MARK ON THE RIGHT, EAST, SIDE OF POINT ROAD. CONTINUE NORTH ON POINT ROAD FOR 0.3 MILE TO THE INTERSECTION OF PRETTYMAN LANE ROAD ON THE RIGHT.  TURN RIGHT AND GO EAST ON PRETTYMAN LANE ROAD FOR 0.1 MILE TO BUILDING NO. T115 AND THE STATION ON THE RIGHT, SOUTH, SIDE OF PRETTYMAN LANE.  THE DISTANCES AND DIRECTIONS TO THE REFERENCE MARKS CHECKED WITH THE PREVIOUS DATA.  THE STATION MARK IS 115.0 FEET SOUTH OF THE CENTERLINE OF PRETTYMAN LANE, 85.0 FEET WEST OF THE SOUTHWEST CORNER OF BUILDIND NO. T115 AND 2.3 FEET WEST OF A STANDARD METAL WITNESS POST AND MARKER.  REFERENCE MARK NO. 1, THE AZIMUTH MARK IS 109.0 FEET SOUTH OF FIRE HYDRANT NO. 205, 78.0 FEET SOUTHEAST OF GUY POLE NO. G602A, 58.0 FEET WEST OF THE CENTERLINE OF POINT ROAD AND 1.5 FEET WEST OF A STANDARD METAL WITNESS POST AND MARKER. *REFERENCE MARK NO. 3 IS 163.0 FEET NORTHEAST OF THE CENTER OF THE INTERSECTION OF POINT ROAD AND PRETTYMAN LANE AND 88.6 FEET NORTH OF THE CENTERLINE OF PRETTYMAN LANE.  THE MARK PROJECTS ABOUT 2 INCHES ABOVE THE SURFACE OF THE GROUND.  REFERENCE MARK NO. 4 IS 307.55 FEET WEST OF THE STATION, 182.0 FEET SOUTH OF THE CENTER OF THE INTERSECTION OF POINT ROAD AND PRETTYMAN LANE, 39.6 FEET SOUTH OF POWERLINE POLE NO. G612 AND 20.0 FEET WEST OF THE CENTERLINE OF POINT ROAD AND PROJECTS ABOUT 2 INCHES ABOVE THE SURFACE OF THE GROUND.  HEIGHT OF LIGHT ABOVE STATION MARK 34.12 METERS.                            STATION RECOVERY (1969)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1969 (JKW) STATION MARK AND RMS 3 AND 4 WERE RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION.  THE AZIMUTH MARK WAS NOT FOUND.  THE 1962 RECOVERY NOTE BY R.W.T. IS ADEQUATE WITH THE FOLLOWING ADDITIONS--RM 3 IS 41.0 FEET NORTH-NORTHEAST OF A POWER POLE.  RM 4 IS IN THE NORTH END OF ABUTMENT OF CULVERT ON WEST SIDE OF ROAD.                            STATION RECOVERY (1975)  RECOVERY NOTE BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 1975 (EAB) THE STATION MARK WAS RECOVERED AND IT WAS FOUND TO BE IN GOOD CONDITION.  THE STATION MARK IS NOW PROJECTING ABOUT 20 INCHES BUT STILL IS SOLID IN THE GROUND.  REFERENCE MARK NO 3 WAS RECOVERED AND IT WAS FOUND TO BE IN GOOD CONDITION.  IT IS NOW 1 FOOT SOUTHWEST OF A STEEL WITNESS POST AND SIGN AND THE MARK IS ABOUT FLUSH WITH THE GROUND.  REFERENCE MARK NO 4 WAS RECOVERED AND IT WAS FOUND TO BE IN GOOD CONDITION.  I FOUND THE MARK TO BE IN A DRILL HOLE IN THE NORTHWEST WING OF A CONCRETE CULVERT.  IT WAS FOUND TO BE 183 FEET SOUTH OF THE CENTER LINE OF A EAST-WEST BLACK TOP ROAD, 18 FEET WEST OF THE CENTER LINE OF A NORTH-SOUTH BLACK TOP ROAD, 9 INCHES SOUTHEAST OF THE NORTHWEST END OF THE CONCRETE CULVERT WING AND ABOUT 8 INCHES LOWER THAN THE BLACK TOP ROAD.  REFERENCE MARK NO 1, THE AZIMUTH MARK WAS RECOVERED AND IT WAS FOUND TO BE IN GOOD CONDITION.  IT WAS FOUND TO BE 62 FEET SOUTHEAST OF A POWER POLE WITH A SMALL TRIANGLE ON IT, 59 FEET EAST OF THE CENTER LINE OF A PAVED ROAD, 2.3 FEET WEST OF A STEEL WITNESS POST AND THE MARK IS PROJECTING ABOUT 3 INCHES.  TO REACH THE STATION FROM IN THE EAST EDGE OF THE TOWN OF LEWES, AT THE ENTRANCE TO THE CAPE MAY-LEWES FERRY.  GO EASTERLY FOLLOW THE PAVED ROAD FOR 0.9 MILE TO FORKS IN THE ROAD, KEEP THE LEFT FORK AND CONTINUE ON EASTERLY FOLLOWING THE PAVED ROAD FOR 0.8 MILE TO A SIDE ROAD ON THE LEFT.  TURN LEFT AND GO NORTHERLY FOLLOWING THE PAVED ROAD FOR 0.05 MILE TO THE AZIMUTH MARK ON THE RIGHT, CONTINUE ON EASTERLY FOLLOWING THE PAVED ROAD FOR 0.45 MILE TO A SIDE ROAD ON THE RIGHT.  TURN RIGHT AND GO EAST FOR ABOUT 0.05 MILE TO THE STATION MARK ON THE RIGHT AND BUILDING NUMBER T 115 AHEAD ON THE RIGHT ALSO.                            STATION RECOVERY (1980)  RECOVERY NOTE BY LOCAL ENGINEER (INDIVIDUAL OR FIRM) 1980 (WW) RECOVERED BY VANDEMARK LYNCH INC.  RADIO-1932 GOOD.  RM NO. 1-1932 AZIMUTH MARK GOOD.  RM NO. 3 1932 GOOD.  RM NO 4 1932 GOOD.  STATION AND REFERENCE MARKS ADEQUATLY DESCRIBED.  NOTE-DELETE, BUILDING NUMBER T 115 IN DESCRIPTION BY E.A. BEAUCHAMP 1975.

markers.description: BY NATIONAL OCEAN SERVICE 1984 THE STATION IS LOCATED ON TOP OF A BUNKER IN A SAND DUNE AT FORT MILES ARMY RECREATIONAL AREA ON CAPE HENLOPNEN, DELAWARE. TO REACH STATION FROM THE LEWES FERRY TERMINAL FOLLOW ROUTE 9 E FOR 0.9 MI TO CAPE HENLOPEN STATE PARK AND FORT MILES ARMY RECREATIONAL AREA.  TAKE FIRST RIGHT IN PARK TOWARD FT. MILES AND FOLLOW MAIN ROAD FOR 0.8 MI TO FORK ON LEFT WITH A LOCKED ENTRANCE GATE.  FOLLOW ROAD UP THE HILL FOR 0.2 MI TO THE LOCKED GATE AT BUNKER WITH A WHITE WHIP ANTENNA ON TOP, WHICH IS THE STATION. STATION IS RERFERNCE MARK NO. 2 FOR STATION---BUNKER 1984---, WHICH IS A 80 FT WHIP ANTENNA ON TOP OF A SAND DUNE.  IT IS LOCATED 15.021 M (49.3 FT) NW OF STATION---BUNKER 1984--- AND 8.772 M (28.8 FT) NNE OF STATION---BUNKER 1984 RM 1---. TO REACH THE STATION FROM THE S END OF REEDY ISLAND, PROCEED BY BOAT S TO THE S END OF THE DIKE AND THE STATION. THE STATION IS THE CENTER OF THE HIGHEST VERTICAL POINT OF A ---FL W 2.5 SEC--- LIGHT ATOP A SKELETON TOWER. markers.description: BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1946 (ELJ) THIS LIGHT HAS BEEN MOVED FROM ITS ORIGINAL POSITION.
BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1946 (ELJ) ACCORDING TO LOCAL INFORMATION, THIS LIGHT WAS MOVED FROM ITS ORIGINAL POSITION WHEN NORTH JETTY WAS EXTENDED.

BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1933 (GLA) STATION RECOVERED AS FOLLOWS--THIS STATION IS ON THE S END OF REEDY ISLAND WHICH IS NOW DIVIDED BY A CHANNEL A SHORT DISTANCE N OF THE LIGHTHOUSE.  THE STATION IS ON THE TOP OF THE ROCK DIKE TO THE S OF THE LIGHTHOUSE AND APPROXIMATELY IN LINE WITH THE AXIS OF THE REEDY ISLAND JETTY TO THE S.  THE MARK IS 63 FEET S OF TH SW CORNER OF THE PORCH OF THE LIGHTHOUSE.  50.5 FEET W OF THE SW POST OF THE FOG BELL FRAME.  AND 50 FEET NW OF THE E WATERS EDGE.  THE STATION WAS RE-MARKED ACCORDING TO NOTE 1A.  THE MARK PROJECTS 6 INCHES.  THE NEW MARK WAS STAMPED REEDY 1900 1933.  THERE IS, SSW OF THE STATION, A TRIANGLE WITH A 1/2 INCH HOLE IN THE CENTER CUT IN ONE OF THE BOULDERS OF THE DIKE.  THIS WAS EVIDENTLY USED AS AN ECCENTRIC STATION AT SOME TIME.  IT WAS USED AS A REFERENCE MARK AT THIS OCCUPATION.  IT IS 88.3 FEET SW OF THE SW POST OF THE FOG BELL FRAME.  TWO NEW REFERENCE MARKS WERE SET AS FOLLOWS--  REFERENCE MARK NO.1 SSW OF THE STATION.  97.6 FEET SW OF THE SW POST OF THE FOG BELL FRAME.  9.3 FEET SSW OF THE OLD REFERENCE MARK, AND APPROXIMATELY IN LINE WITH THE E SIDE OF THE JETTY TO THE S.  REFERENCE MARK NO.2 IS 41 FEET WNW OF THE STATION.  59.6 FEET SW OF THE SW CORNER OF THE PORCH OF THE LIGHTHOUSE.  83.2 FEET WNW OF THE SW POST OF THE FOG BELL FRAME AND 40 FEET E OF THE W WATERS EDGE.  TO REACH THE STATION, GO TO PORT PENN, DELAWARE, THENCE S ABOUT 0.5 MILE TO THE PARK LANDING.  FROM HERE IT IS NECESSARY TO GO BY BOAT TO THE ISLAND.  AT THE TIME THIS PARTY WORKED HERE, MR. FRED HILL, THE LIGHTHOUSE KEEPER, PROVIDED TRANSPORTATION AT A SIGNAL FROM THE DOCK.  A 37-FOOT STEEL TOWER WAS ERECTED TO SEE OVER THE LIGHTHOUSE TO THE N.                            STATION RECOVERY (1946)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1946 (ELJ) STATION RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION.  THE RECOVERY NOTE OF 1933 IS ADEQUATE.  DISTANCES TO REFERENCE MARKS WERE MEASURED AND FOUND TO BE CORRECT.                            STATION RECOVERY (1984)  RECOVERY NOTE BY NATIONAL OCEAN SERVICE 1984 (WVH) THE STATION WAS RECOVERED AS DESCRIBED.  HEIGHT OF LIGHT SHOWN ABOVE THE MARK WAS 1.73 METERS.                            STATION RECOVERY (1986)  RECOVERY NOTE BY NATIONAL OCEAN SERVICE 1986 THE STATION IS LOCATED ON THE S END OF REEDY ISLAND WHICH IS NOW DIVIDED BY A CHANNEL A SHORT DISTANCE N OF THE LIGHTHOUSE.  THE STATION IS ON THE TOP OF THE ROCK DIKE TO THE S OF THE LIGHTHOUSE AND APPROXIMATELY IN LINE WITH THE AXIS OF THE REEDY ISLAND JETTY TO THE S. TO REACH THE STATION, GO TO PORT PENN, DELAWARE, THENCE S ABOUT 0.5 MI TO THE PARK LANDING.  FROM HERE IT IS NECESSARY TO PROCEED BY BOAT TO THE ISLAND.  A 37-FT STEEL TOWER WAS ERECTED TO SEE OVER THE LIGHTHOUSE TO THE N. THE STATION IS 15.39 M (50.5 FT) W OF THE SW CORNER OF THE PORCH OF THE LIGHTHOUSE AND 15.24 M (50.0 FT) NW OF THE E WATERS EDGE.  THE MARK PROJECTS 6 IN.  THERE IS A TRIANGLE WITH A 1/2 IN HOLE IN THE CENTER CUT IN ONE OF THE BOULDERS OF THE DIKE SSW OF THE STATION.  IT IS 26.91 M (88.3 FT) SW OF THE SW POST OF THE FOG BELL FRAME.

markers.description: BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 1992 STATION IS LOCATED ABOUT 5.3 KM (3.29 MI) EAST-SOUTHEAST OF THE JUNCTION OF STATE ROUTE 1 AND U.S.HIGHWAY 9 AT CAPE HENLOPEN, 1.45 KM (0.90 MI) SOUTHEAST OF THE CAPE-MAY-LEWES FERRY TERMINAL, 6.45 KM (4.01 MI) NORTH OF REHOBETH BEACH DELAWARE, 48.3 KM (30.01 MI) NORTHEAST OF SALSBURY MARYLAND, IN THE CAPE HENLOPEN STATE PARK ON THE NORTH SIDE OF A PARK ROAD AND ABOUT 219.5 M (720.14 FT) SOUTHEAST OF A ROAD TO A CONCRETE OBSERVATION TOWER.  OWNERSHIP--U.S.GOVERNMENT, U.S. DEPARTMENT OF INTERIOR.  NOTIFY PAT COOPER (ASST.PARK MNGR.) AT PARK OFFICE, TELEPHONE 302-856-5339.   NOTE-A LINE OF SIGHT TO USCG RADIO BEACON SITE HAS BEEN CLEARED BY RECON PARTY AND MUST BE MAINTAINED WHEN ESTABLISHING STATION. TO REACH THE STATION FROM THE ENTRANCE GATE TO THE CAPE-MAY-LEWES FERRY TERMINAL, LOCATED ABOUT 5.3 KM (3.29 MI) EAST-SOUTHEAST OF THE JUNCTION OF STATE ROUTE 1 AND U.S. HIGHWAY 9 AT CAPE HENLOPEN, GO EAST-SOUTHEAST ON U.S. HIGHWAY 9 FOR 1.45 KM (0.90 MI) TO ENTRANCE TO THE CAPE HENLOPEN STATE PARK.  TAKE RIGHT FORK ,SOUTHERLY, ON CONCRETE ROAD FOR 0.16 KM (0.10 MI) TO A ROAD ON THE RIGHT TO THE PARK OFFICE. CONTINUE SOUTHERLY ON CONCRETE ROAD FOR 0.4 KM (0.25 MI) TO A FORK. TAKE LEFT FORK, EASTERLY, ON THE CONCRETE ROAD FOR 0.64 KM (0.40 MI) TO A LOCKED GATE ON THE LEFT AND A ROAD RIGHT TO A CONCRETE OBSERVATION TOWER.  CONTINUE EASTERLY ON CONCRETE ROAD FOR 222 M (728.34 FT) AND THE STATION SITE ON THE LEFT AT A FIBERGLASS WITNESS POST. STATION SITE IS 9.3 M (30.51 FT) NORTH FROM THE CENTER OF THE ROAD, 4 M (13.12 FT) WEST-SOUTHWEST FROM A SNOW FENCELINE, 90.79 M (297.87 FT) WEST FROM THE CENTER OF A ROAD LEADING NORTH THROUGH A GATE TO THE USCG RADIO BEACON SITE LLNR NUMBER 185, 219.5 M (720.14 FT) SOUTHEAST FROM THE CENTER OF A SAND ROAD TO A OBSERVATION TOWER AND 0.31 M (1.02 FT) WEST OF A FIBERGLASS WITNESS POST, AT A FLAGGED RAILROAD SPIKE.                            STATION RECOVERY (1995)  RECOVERY NOTE BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 1995 (ALG) RECOVERED AS DESCRIBED.                            STATION RECOVERY (2008)  RECOVERY NOTE BY GEOCACHING 2008 (EK) RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION.                            STATION RECOVERY (2012)  RECOVERY NOTE BY DELAWARE COASTAL PROGRAM 2012 RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION.                            STATION RECOVERY (2013)  RECOVERY NOTE BY DELAWARE COASTAL PROGRAM 2013 (ARD) RECOVERED AS DESCRIBED BY ALAN R DRAGOO MASER CONSULTING.

markers.description: BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1946 (ELJ) STATION IS LOCATED ON THE W SIDE OF DELAWARE BAY, ON NATIONAL WILDLIFE REFUGE 15 MILES SE OF SMYRNA.  IT IS 0.2 MILE S OF MOUTH OF HAY DITCH AND 1.5 MILES N OF MOUTH OF LEIPSIC RIVER.  STATION MARK IS A BRONZE STATION DISK, STAMPED REFUGE 1946, SET IN THE TOP OF AN 8-INCH-DIAMETER CONCRETE CYLINDER AND PROJECTS 8 INCHES ABOVE GROUND.  IT IS LOCATED IN THE CENTER OF A SMALL CLUMP OF BUSHES, 28.0 METERS INSHORE FROM MEAN HIGH WATER, 3 FEET ABOVE MEAN HIGH WATER, AND 30.0 METERS S OF A LARGE SEMICIRCULAR CLUMP OF BUSHES.  REFERENCE MARK 1 IS A BRONZE REFERENCE DISK, STAMPED REFUGE 1946 R M NO 1, AND SET IN THE TOP OF AN 8-INCH-DIAMETER CONCRETE CYLINDER FLUSH WITH THE GROUND.  IT IS 59.95 FEET NE OF THE STATION.  REFERENCE MARK 2 IS A BRONZE REFERENCE DISK, STAMPED REFUGE 1946 R M NO 2, AND SET IN THE TOP OF AN 8-INCH-DIAMETER CONCRETE CYLINDER PROJECTING 6 INCHES ABOVE GROUND.  IT IS 57.32 FEET SE OF THE STATION.                            STATION RECOVERY (1969)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1969 (JKW) LOST.  THERE WERE NO MARKS FOUND AFTER A THOROUGH SEARCH.  THE SHORE HAS ERODED BADLY AND SOME OF THE MARKS MAY BE COVERED BY SAND.

markers.description: BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1932 (CDM) LOCATED ON TOWN PROPERTY, IN REHOBOTH, DELAWARE.  ABOUT 100 YARDS NE OF A BRICK SCHOOLHOUSE.  NW OF THE INTERSECTION OF SECOND STREET AND BALTIMORE AVENUE.  39.8 FEET W OF W EDGE OF CONCRETE BASE TO WATER STANDPIPE.  73.0 FEET E OF BRICK PUMP HOUSE.  ABOUT 2-1/2 FEET S OF PROPERTY LINE FENCE.  SURFACE, UNDERGROUND, AND REFERENCE MARKS ARE STANDARD BRONZE DISKS SET IN CONCRETE.  REFERENCE MARK NO. 1 IS ABOUT 0.25 MILE E OF STATION.  AT E END OF BALTIMORE AVENUE.  1 FOOT N OF SIDEWALK ON THE N SIDE OF THE STREET.  11 METERS W OF W SIDE OF BOARDWALK.  REFERENCE MARK NO. 2 IS 149.2 FEET SE OF STATION.  ABOUT 8 METERS E OF CENTER LINE OF SECOND STREET.  REFERENCE MARK NO. 3 IS 151.5 FEET SW OF STATION.  55.8 FEET S OF SW CORNER OF BRICK PUMP HOUSE.  HEIGHT OF SIGNAL ABOVE STATION MARK - 38 METERS.                            STATION RECOVERY (1938)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1938 (WHJ) REFERENCE MARK NO. 2 HAS BEEN RE-ESTABLISHED ON THE SAME AZIMUTH BUT AT A DISTANCE OF 151.725 FEET FROM THE STATION.  THIS NEW MARK IS WELL ANCHORED IN A CONCRETE POST 12 INCHES SQUARE BY 3 FEET 6 INCHES DEEP AND IS LOCATED IN THE REAR LAWN OF THE NEW POST OFFICE.  IT IS FURTHER PROTECTED BY A MARGINAL CURB LAID ALONG THE INSIDE OF THE SIDEWALK.  THE ABOVE DESCRIPTION WAS RECEIVED IN A LETTER DATED APRIL 6, 1938 FROM WILLARD H. JOHNSON, CITY MANAGER, CITY OF REHOBOTH BEACH, DELAWARE.  REFERENCE MARK NO. 2 DISK WAS RECEIVED AT THE OFFICE 4/7/38.                            STATION RECOVERY (1941)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1941 REPORT BY MR. RITTENHOUSE, REHOBOTH BEACH, DELAWARE--  THE TRIANGULATION STATION ABOUT 22 FEET WEST OF THE OLD WATER TOWER HAS BEEN DESTROYED DURING THE CONSTRUCTION OF A NEW WATER TOWER NEARBY.  THE REFERENCE MARKS ARE STILL IN PLACE.                            STATION RECOVERY (1943)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1943 (FLG) THE STATION MARK WAS DESTROYED IN 1941.  THE 3 REFERENCE MARKS WERE RECOVERED AS DESCRIBED.  A 1/2-INCH PIPE FLUSH WITH THE GROUND NOW MARKS THE POSITION OF THE STATION WITHIN ABOUT 0.05 FOOT.  THERE IS A HOUSE ON RANGE BETWEEN R.M. 2 AND R.M. 3.  PIPE TO R.M. 2 IS 151.69 FEET.

markers.description: BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1962 (RWT) THE STATION IS LOCATED AT THE WATER TANK AND STANDPIPE IN REHOBOTH BEACH, DELAWARE, NORTHWEST OF THE INTERSECTION OF SECOND STREET AND BALTIMORE AVENUE AND ON PROPERTY OWNED BY THE CITY OF REHOBOTH BEACH.  STATION IS A STANDARD DISK SET IN THE TOP OF A 10 X 10 INCH CONCRETE MONUMENT WHICH IS FLUSH WITH THE GROUND SURFACE, STAMPED REHOBOTH 2 1962.  IT IS 61.0 FEET NORTH OF THE APPROXIMATE CENTERLINE OF A DRIVEWAY.  24.9 FEET WEST OF THE NORTHWEST LEG OF THE WATER TANK.  23.1 FEET NORTHEAST OF THE NORTHEAST CORNER OF THE PUMP HOUSE.  22.6 FEET SOUTH-SOUTHEAST OF A FENCE CORNER.  REFERENCE MARK 2 IS A STANDARD DISK SET IN THE TOP OF A 12 X 12 INCH CONCRETE MONUMENT WHICH IS FLUSH WITH THE GROUND SURFACE, STAMPED REHOBOTH NO 2 1938 1932.  IT IS 24.0 FEET EAST OF THE APPROXIMATE CENTER OF THE STREET.  14.0 FEET NORTH OF POWERLINE POLE.  12.0 FEET SOUTH OF THE NORTH END OF SHRUBBERY.  THIS MARK WAS NOT MEASURED BECAUSE OF TREES AND SHRUBBERY.  REFERENCE MARK 3 IS A STANDARD DISK SET IN THE TOP OF A 12 X 12 INCH CONCRETE MONUMENT WHICH PROJECTS ABOUT 6 INCHES ABOVE THE GROUND SURFACE, STAMPED REHOBOTH NO 3 1932.  IT IS 71.3 FEET SOUTHWEST OF POWERLINE POLE 76F.  56.0 FEET SOUTH-SOUTHWEST OF THE SOUTHWEST CORNER OF THE PUMP HOUSE.  15.0 FEET SOUTH OF THE APPROXIMATE CENTERLINE OF A TRACK ROAD.  9.1 FEET NORTHEAST OF A 24 INCH WILD CHERRY TREE.  REFERENCE MARK 4 IS A STANDARD DISK SET IN THE TOP OF A 10 X 10 INCH CONCRETE MONUMENT WHICH IS FLUSH WITH THE GROUND SURFACE, STAMPED REHOBOTH 2 NO 4 1962.  IT IS 48.6 FEET NORTH-NORTHEAST OF THE SOUTHEAST CORNER OF A FENCE.  20.5 FEET WEST OF THE APPROXIMATE CENTER OF ROAD.  6.1 FEET EAST OF A FENCE LINE.  2.1 FEET SOUTH OF POWERLINE POLE 6.  REFERENCE MARK 5 IS A STANDARD DISK SET IN THE TOP OF A 10 X 10 INCH CONCRETE MONUMENT WHICH IS FLUSH WITH THE GROUND SURFACE, STAMPED REHOBOTH 2 NO 5 1962.  IT IS 42.8 FEET WEST-NORTHWEST OF POWERLINE POLE 76C.  18.1 FEET WEST OF THE MAIN WATER MAIN LEADING TO THE STANDPIPE.  12.0 FEET NORTH OF THE APPROXIMATE CENTER OF THE DRIVEWAY.  AZIMUTH MARK IS A STANDARD DISK SET IN THE TOP OF A 12 X 12 INCH CONCRETE MONUMENT WHICH IS FLUSH WITH THE GROUND SURFACE, STAMPED REHOBOTH 2 1962.  IT IS 68.0 FEET SOUTH-SOUTHEAST OF SOUTHEAST CORNER OF WHITE HOUSE.  61.0 FEET EAST OF THE APPROXIMATE CENTER OF GRAVELED ROAD.  44.6 FEET NORTHWEST OF POWERLINE POLE 76P.  4.0 FEET SOUTHWEST OF A 6 INCH IRON PIPE.  3.9 FEET NORTH OF A 6 INCH IRON PIPE.  TO REACH THE AZIMUTH MARK FROM THE STATION, GO SOUTH-SOUTHWEST FOR 0.15 MILE TO THE AZIMUTH MARK ON THE RIGHT.  HEIGHT OF LIGHT ABOVE STATION MARK 38 METERS.                            STATION RECOVERY (1962)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1962 AT REHOBOTH BEACH. ON CITY PROPERTY, 118.7 FEET SOUTHWEST OF REHOBOTH 2 RM 1, 84.5 FEET NORTHWEST OF REHOBOTH 2 RM 2, 97.5 FEET WEST OF THE WEST CURB OF SECOND STREET, 23 FEET NORTHEAST OF THE NORTHEAST CORNER OF BRICK PUMP-HOUSE, 23 FEET WEST OF THE WEST CORNER OF CONCRETE FOOTING FOR THE NORTHWEST LEG OF THE CITY WATER TOWER.  SET IN A CONCRETE POST LEVEL WITH THE GROUND.                            STATION RECOVERY (1970)  RECOVERY NOTE BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 1970 (JKW) STATION MARK AND RMS 3,4,AND 5 WERE RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION.  RM 2 AND THE AZIMUTH MARK WERE NOT FOUND.  RM 2 MAY BE INTACT AS THE AREA SEEMS TO HAVE NOT BEEN DISTURBED.  THE AZIMUTH MARK IS BELIEVED TO BE DESTROYED.  A LARGE BUILDING HAS BEEN CONSTRUCTED NEAR THE SITE OF THE AZIMUTH MARK.  THE ORIGINAL DESCRIPTION IS ADEQUATE WITH THE FOLLOWING CHANGES--RM 3 IS NOW LOCATED IN THE PARKING LOT.  DELETE REFERENCE TO ROAD AND WILD CHERRY TREE.  DELETE REFERENCE TO POWER POLE AT RM 5.  AIRLINE DISTANCE AND DIRECTION FROM NEAREST TOWN AT REHOBOTH BEACH.                            STATION RECOVERY (1972)  RECOVERY NOTE BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 1972 (LFS) THE STATION MARK, REFERENCE MARKS 2,3,4 AND 5 WERE ALL RECOVERED AND FOUND IN GOOD CONDITION AS DESCRIBED IN THE 1962 DESCRIPTION.  REFERENCE MARK 2 WAS REPORTED DESTROYED IN 1970 BUT I FOUND IT IN THE EXACT LOCATION AS DESCRIBED IN THE 1962 DESCRIPTION.  THE AZIMUTH MARK WAS SEARCHED FOR BUT NOT FOUND. IT IS BELIEVED IT IS STILL INTACE UNDER A NEWLY CONSTRUCTED PARKING LOT WHICH IS WHERE THE AZIMUTH MARK WAS.  THERE IN A LARGE BUILDING ON LINE TO THE AZIMUTH MARK NOW AND THE DIRECTION COULD NOT BE CHECKED AT THIS DATE.  DUE TO NEWLY PLANTED TREES AND SHRUB BUSHES THE DISTANCE TO REFERENCE MARKS 2 AND 3 COULD NOT BE OBSERVED AT THIS DATE.  A STEEL TOWER WOULD BE REQUIRED TO SEE THE AZIMUTH MARK IF IT IS STILL INTACT AND ALSO THE REFERENCE MARKS 2 AND 3.  DUE TO THE OBSTRUCTIONS NO OBSERVATIONS WERE MADE AT THIS DATE.  AIRLINE DISTANCE AND DIRECTION FROM NEAREST TOWN IN REHOBOTH BEACH.                            STATION RECOVERY (1975)  RECOVERY NOTE BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 1975 (EAB) STATION MARK WAS RECOVERED AND FOUND TO BE IN GOOD CONDITION.  IT IS 20.5 FEET SOUTH OF THE SOUTH WALL OF A NEW MOTEL THAT IS UNDER CONSTRUCTION.  REFERENCE MARK NO 2 WAS RECOVERED AND FOUND TO BE IN GOOD CONDITION.  IT IS 16 FEET NORTH OF THE NORTH EDGE OF A CONCRETE CURB, 2.7 FEET WEST OF A IRON GUARD RAIL, 1 FOOT EAST OF THE EAST EDGE OF A CONCRETE SIDEWALK AND 5 INCHES BELOW THE GROUND LEVEL IN A ROW OF BUSHES.  REFERENCE MARK NO 3 WAS NOT RECOVERED IT IS NOW UNDER A PILE OF DIRT DUE TO A BASEMENT BEING DUG AT THIS TIME.  REFERENCE MARK NO 4 WAS NOT FOUND.  IT APPEARS AS THO THE STREET HAS BEEN WIDEN AND A NEW CURB BUILT.  REFERENCE MARK NO 5 WAS RECOVERED AND FOUND TO BE IN GOOD CONDITION.  AZIMUTH MARK WAS NOT RECOVERED BY ME.  IT APPEARS AS IT WAS IN A PAVED PARKING NOW.  AIRLINE DISTANCE AND DIRECTION FROM NEAREST TOWN IN THE TOWN OF REHOBOTH BEACH.                            STATION RECOVERY (1981)  RECOVERY NOTE BY UNIVERSITY OF DELAWARE 1981 NOTE-- THE SCHOOL HAS BEEN TORN DOWN WHEN HALL WAS REBUILT, AND THE SCHOOL YARD IS NOW A BLACK TOPPED PARKING LOT. NO BASEBALL BACKSTOP IS THERE ANYMORE.

BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1962 (RWT) THE STATION IS THE BALL SHAPED VENT AT THE APEX AND CENTER OF THE MUNICIPAL WATER TANK.  THE STRUCTURE IS OF 6-STEEL CHANNEL IRON LEGS WITH AN ELLIPSOIDAL TOP AND BOTTOM TANK MOUNTED AT THEIR APEX. markers.description: BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1962 (RWT) THE STATION IS LOCATED ALONG THE EAST ROAD RIGHT-OF-WAY OF A NORTH AND SOUTH BLACKTOP ROAD, IN THE VILLAGE OF RELIANCE, ABOUT 5.5 MILES WEST OF SANFORD, DELAWARE, 5.5 MILES SOUTHEAST OF FEDERALSBURG, MARYLAND AND ABOUT 0.1 MILE SOUTH OF THE CENTRAL SECTION OF RELIANCE.  TO REACH THE STATION FROM THE INTERSECTION OF MAIN STREET AND CENTRAL AVENUE IN FEDERALSBURG.  GO EAST ON CENTRAL AVENUE FOR 0.2 MILE TO A SIDE STREET ON THE RIGHT, STATE HIGHWAY 313.  TURN RIGHT AND GO SOUTH ON STATE HIGHWAY 313 FOR 1.7 MILES TO WHERE THE HIGHWAY TURNS SHARP TO THE RIGHT.  CONTINUE SOUTH-SOUTHEAST ON STATE HIGHWAY 577 FOR 3.65 MILES TO THE SMALL VILLAGE OF RELIANCE, A SIDE ROAD ON THE RIGHT HAND SIDE OF THE HIGHWAY AT THE MARYLAND AND DELAWARE STATE LINE.  TURN RIGHT AND GO SOUTH ON THE STATE LINE ROAD FOR 0.1 MILE TO A STANDARD METAL WITNESS POST AND MARKER, POWERLINE POLE NO. 148-16 AND THE STATION ON THE LEFT, EAST, SIDE OF THE BLACKTOP ROAD.  TO REACH THE AZIMUTH MARK, BENCH MARK A65, GO NORTH ON THE STATE LINE ROAD FOR 0.1 MILE TO THE JUNCTION OF U.S. HIGHWAY 20 AND STATE HIGHWAY 577.  TURN LEFT AND GO SOUTHWEST ON U.S. HIGHWAY 20 FOR 0.4 MILE TO A STANDARD METAL WITNESS POST AND MARKER AND MARK ON THE RIGHT, NORTH SIDE OF THE HIGHWAY.  THE STATION MARK, A STANDARD DISK STAMPED RELIANCE 1962, IS SET IN TOP OF A 10-INCH SQUARE CONCRETE MONUMENT FLUSH WITH THE SURFACE OF THE GROUND.  IT IS 43.1 FEET SOUTH OF POWERLINE POLE NO. 148-16, 28.9 FEET EAST OF THE CENTERLINE OF A BLACKTOP ROAD, 5.8 FEET NORTH OF A STANDARD METAL WITNESS POST AND MARKER AND 4.4 FEET EAST OF A CUT BANK.  REFERENCE MARK 1, A STANDARD DISK STAMPED RELIANCE NO 1 1962, IS SET IN TOP OF A 10-INCH SQUARE CONCRETE MONUMENT FLUSH WITH THE SURFACE OF THE GROUND.  IT IS 47.4 FEET NORTH OF A STANDARD METAL WITNESS POST AND MARKER, 31.6 FEET EAST OF THE CENTERLINE OF A BLACKTOP ROAD, 2.0 FEET SOUTH OF POWERLINE POLE NO. 148-16 AND ABOUT STATION ELEVATION.  REFERENCE MARK 2, A STANDARD DISK STAMPED RELIANCE NO 2 1962, IS SET IN TOP OF A 10-INCH SQUARE CONCRETE MONUMENT FLUSH WITH THE SURFACE OF THE GROUND.  IT IS 28.3 FEET EAST OF THE CENTERLINE OF A BLACKTOP ROAD, 46.0 FEET SOUTHEAST OF THE CENTERLINE OF THE INTERSECTION OF A DRIVEWAY AND THE BLACKTOP ROAD, 19.7 FEET SOUTH OF A STANDARD METAL WITNESS POST AND MARKER, 4.4 FEET SOUTHEAST OF A ROAD SIGN AND STATION ELEVATION.  THE AZIMUTH MARK, A STANDARD COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY BENCH MARK DISK STAMPED A65 1942, IS SET IN TOP OF A 6 INCH SQUARE CONCRETE MONUMENT PROJECTING ABOUT 5 INCHES ABOVE THE SURFACE OF THE GROUND.  IT IS 91.0 FEET NORTHWEST OF THE CENTERLINE OF THE INTERSECTION OF A DRIVEWAY, 24.3 FEET NORTHEAST OF THE CENTERLINE OF U.S. HIGHWAY 20, 4.0 FEET WEST OF A STANDARD METAL WITNESS POST AND MARKER, 1.0 FEET SOUTHWEST OF A FENCE LINE AND ABOUT 1.0 FOOT LOWER THAN THE SURFACE OF THE HIGHWAY.  BOUNDARY MONUMENT NO. 12 WAS NOT RECOVERED.  IT IS REPORTED TO BE IN THE CENTER OF THE BLACKTOP ROAD, ABOUT 2.0 FEET UNDER THE ROAD SURFACE.  HEIGHT OF LIGHT ABOVE STATION MARK 2 METERS.                            STATION RECOVERY (1975)  RECOVERY NOTE BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 1975 (CLN) THE STATION MARK, REFERENCE MARKS 1 AND 2 WERE RECOVERED AND FOUND IN GOOD CONDITION AS DESCRIBED IN THE 1962 DESCRIPTION.  THE BENCH MARK WHICH WAS USED FOR AN AZIMUTH MARK WAS NOT FOUND AND BELIEVED DESTROYED WHEN THE ROAD WAS REPAIRED.  TRIANGULATION STATION DODD 1962 IS VISIBLE FROM THE GROUND AND MAY BE USED AS AZIMUTH MARK.  A POINT WAS SELECTED FOR BOUNDARY MONUMENT NUMBER 12, THERE IS A SEPARATE REPORT ON IT.  AIRLINE DISTANCE AND DIRECTION FROM NEAREST TOWN--1/4 MILE SOUTH OF RELIANCE.                            STATION RECOVERY (1976)  RECOVERY NOTE BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 1976 (CLN) THE STATION AND BOTH REFERENCE MARKS WERE RECOVERED AND FOUND IN GOOD CONDITION AS PREVIOUSLY DESCRIBED.  THE AZIMUTH MARK WAS SEARCHED FOR BUT NOT FOUND AS PREVIOUSLY REPORTED.  THE DISTANCE AND DIRECTION TO ALL MARKS CHECKED PREVIOUS OBSERVATIONS.  THE MARYLAND-DELAWARE BOUNDARY MONUMENT NUMBER 12 WAS RESET AT THIS DATE.  SEE DESCRIPTION THEREOF.  AIRLINE DISTANCE AND DIRECTION FROM NEAREST TOWN IN RELIANCE. markers.description: BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1962 (RWT) THE STATION IS LOCATED ON A SMALL KNOLE, 2.0 MILES SOUTHEAST OF SHARPTOWN, MARYLAND.  7.5 MILES WEST-SOUTHWEST OF LAUREL, DELAWARE AND ON PROPERTY OWNED BY MR. H.J. RIDER.  TO REACH THE STATION FROM SHARPTOWN, MARYLAND.  GO SOUTHEASTERLY ON STATE HIGHWAY 348 FOR 1.7 MILES TO THE MARYLAND-DELAWARE STATE LINE.  CONTINUE ABOUT 100.0 FEET TO A FIELD ROAD ON THE RIGHT, JUST EAST OF A HOUSE, *TURN RIGHT AND GO SOUTH ON THE FIELD ROAD FOR 0.25 MILE TO THE TOP OF A NARROW RIDGE AND THE DELAWARE-MARYLAND BOUNDARY MONUMENT THE RIGHT AND THE STATION ON THE LEFT AS DESCRIBED.  THE STATION MARK IS A STANDARD DISK STAMPED RIDER 1962, SET IN TOP OF A SQUARE CONCRETE MONUMENT WHICH PROJECTS 3 INCHES ABOVE THE GROUND SURFACE, IT IS 4.2 FEET WEST OF A STANDARD METAL WITNESS POST AND MARKER AND 30.0 FEET EAST OF THE APPROXIMATE CENTER OF THE FIELD ROAD.  REFERENCE MARK 1 IS A STANDARD DISK STAMPED RIDER NO 1 1962, SET IN TOP OF A SQUARE CONCRETE MONUMENT WHICH PROJECTS 5 INCHES ABOVE THE GROUND SURFACE.  IT IS 11.0 FEET WEST OF THE APPROXIMATE CENTER OF THE FIELD ROAD 76.6 FEET SOUTHWEST OF THE WITNESS POST.  REFERENCE MARK 2 IS A STANDARD DISK STAMPED RIDER NO 2 1962, SET IN TOP OF A SQUARE CONCRETE MONUMENT WHICH PROJECTS 4 INCHES ABOVE THE GROUND SURFACE.  IT IS 11.0 FEET WEST OF THE APPROXIMATE CENTER OF THE FIELD ROAD AND 83.6 FEET NORTHWEST OF THE WITNESS POST.  BOUNDARY MONUMENT NO. 4 IS A 12 X 12 LIMESTONE MONUMENT MARKED WITH THE LETTERS M AND P AND PROJECTS ABOUT 25 INCHES ABOVE THE GROUND SURFACE.  THE MONUMENT LEANS SLIGHTLY WEST BUT IS CONSIDERED IN GOOD CONDITION.  IT IS LOCATED 7.0 FEET WEST OF THE APPROXIMATE CENTER OF THE FIELD ROAD AND 49.5 FEET SOUTHWEST OF THE WITNESS POST.  *CONTINUE EAST ON STATE HIGHWAY 348 FOR 0.05 MILE TO THE AZIMUTH MARK ON THE LEFT AS DESCRIBED.  THE AZIMUTH MARK IS A STANDARD DISK STAMPED RIDER 1962, SET IN TOP OF A SQUARE CONCRETE MONUMENT WHICH PROJECTS 1 INCH ABOVE THE GROUND SURFACE.  IT IS 1.7 FEET EAST-SOUTHEAST OF A STANDARD METAL WITNESS POST AND MARKER, 2.2 FEET EAST-SOUTHEAST OF A POWERLINE POLE NUMBER 33, 15.6 FEET EAST-SOUTHEAST OF A 12-INCH SYCAMORE TREE, 30.3 FEET SOUTH-SOUTHWEST OF THE APPROXIMATE CENTERLINE OF STATE HIGHWAY 24 AND 225.0 FEET EAST OF THE FARM ROAD LEADING TO THE STATION.  HEIGHT OF LIGHT ABOVE STATION MARK 25.06 METERS.                            STATION RECOVERY (1987)  RECOVERY NOTE BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 1987 (RGP) THE DESIGNATED MARK WAS RECOVERED WITH CHANGES NOTED BELOW -- THE STATION MARK, REFERENCE MARK TWO, BOUNDARY MONUMENT FOUR AND THE AZIMUTH MARK WERE RECOVERED AND FOUND IN GOOD CONDITION. THE REFERENCE MARK ONE WAS FOUND DESTROYED.  A SHORTER DISTANCE OF 0.008 METERS OR 0.03 FT WAS NOTED TO REFERENCE MARK TWO. A LONGER DISTANCE OF 0.023 METERS OR 0.09 FT WAS NOTED TO THE BOUNDARY MONUMENT NUMBER FOUR. A DIFFERENCE IN DIRECTION OF ONE MINUTE AND THIRTY ONE SECONDS WAS NOTED TO THE BOUNDARY MONUMENT. IT IS BELIEVED THE BOUNDARY MONUMENT MAY HAVE SETTLED SLIGHTLY DUE TO ITS LARGE SIZE. NO OTHER DIFFERENCES WERE NOTED. THE MOST RECENT INFORMATION AVAILABLE WAS USED AS A REFERENCE. A COMPLETE NEW DESCRIPTION FOLLOWS.   THE STATION IS LOCATED ABOUT 3.2 KM (2 MI) SOUTHEAST OF SHARPTOWN, 12.1 KM (7.5 MI) WEST-SOUTHWEST OF LAUREL AND ATOP A SMALL KNOLL. OWNERSHIP--HOMER J. RIDER, ROUTE 3, LAUREL DELAWARE 19956.   TO REACH THE STATION FROM THE POST OFFICE IN SHARPTOWN, GO WEST FOR 0.15 KM (0.1 MI) ON FOURTH STREET TO A CROSSROADS.  TURN LEFT AND GO SOUTH FOR 0.8 KM (0.5 MI) ON MAIN STREET TO A CROSSROADS.  CONTINUE STRAIGHT AHEAD AND GO SOUTH FOR 2.15 KM (1.35 MI) ON STATE HIGHWAY 348 TO A DIRT ROAD RIGHT AT THE STATE BOUNDARY.  TURN RIGHT AND GO SOUTH FOR 0.4 KM (0.25 MI) ON THE DIRT ROAD TO THE STATION ON THE LEFT.   THE STATION IS A STANDARD NGS DISK STAMPED---RIDER 1962---, SET INTO THE TOP OF A SQUARE CONCRETE MONUMENT 30 CM ON SIDE FLUSH WITH GROUND. LOCATED 8.8 METERS (29.0 FT) EAST FROM THE CENTER OF THE DIRT ROAD, 26.7 METERS (87.7 FT) NORTH-NORTHWEST FROM THE CENTER OF A DITCH, 11.9 METERS (39.0 FT) EAST FROM THE EASE SIDE OF A WOODED HEDGE 18.0 METERS (59.0 FT) NORTH-NORTHEAST OF A 22-INCH TREE AND 1.3 METERS (4.2 FT) WEST-NORTHWEST FROM A WITNESS POST.   REFERENCE MARK NO. 2 IS A STANDARD NGS DISK STAMPED---RIDER NO 2 1962---, SET INTO THE TOP OF A SQUARE CONCRETE MONUMENT 30 CM ON SIDE PROJECTING 0.3 CM ABOVE GROUND.  LOCATED 25.5 METERS (83.7 FT) NORTHWEST FROM THE WITNESS POST, 3.1 METERS (10.3 FT) WEST FROM THE CENTER OF THE DIRT ROAD, 49.5 METERS (162.4 FT) NORTH FROM THE DITCH AND 39.9 METERS (130.9 FT) NORTH FROM THE 22-INCH TREE.  MARK IS 1.3 METERS BELOW THE STATION.   REFERENCE POINT NO. 2 IS BOUNDARY MONUMENT FOUR, IT IS THE TOP AND CENTER OF MARYLAND DELAWARE BOUNDARY MONUMENT. IT IS A 32 CM SQUARE LIMESTONE POST WITH A P ON THE EAST SIDE AND A M ON THE WEST SIDE AND IT PROJECTS 0.7 METERS ABOVE THE GROUND.  THAT IS ---UNSTAMPED---, SET INTO THE GROUND 2.7 METERS (8.9 FT) WEST FROM THE CENTER OF THE DIRT ROAD, 19.4 METERS (63.6 FT) NORTH-NORTHWEST FROM THE DITCH, 10.8 METERS (35.5 FT) NORTHWEST FROM THE 22-INCH TREE AND 15.3 METERS (50.1 FT) SOUTHWEST FROM THE WITNESS POST.  MARK IS 0.4 METERS ABOVE THE STATION.   AZIMUTH MARK NO. 1 IS A STANDARD NGS DISK STAMPED---RIDER 1962---, SET INTO THE TOP OF A SQUARE CONCRETE MONUMENT 30 CM ON SIDE FLUSH WITH GROUND.  LOCATED 9.1 METERS (29.7 FT) SOUTH FROM THE CENTER OF STATE HIGHWAY 24, 51.8 METERS (169.9 FT) WEST-NORTHWEST FROM THE NORTHWEST CORNER OF A BUILDING, 0.7 METERS (2.2 FT) EAST FROM A POWERLINE POLE NUMBERED 44091 98848, 0.5 METERS (1.8 FT) EAST-SOUTHEAST FROM A WITNESS POST.  TO REACH THE AZIMUTH FROM THE STATION, GO NORTH FOR 0.4 KM (0.25 MI) ON THE DIRT ROAD TO STATE HIGHWAY 24, TURN RIGHT AND GO EAST FOR 0.15 KM (0.1 MI) ON STATE HIGHWAY 24 TO THE MARK ON THE RIGHT.                             STATION RECOVERY (2008)  RECOVERY NOTE BY GEOCACHING 2008 (WD) FOUND THE STATION IN GOOD CONDITION.  THE DESCRIBED LOCATION FOR REFERENCE MARK NO. 2 IS COVERED BY A PILE OF UTILITY POLES.  THE STATION IS LOCATED IN A CLEARING IN A WOODED AREA ON AGRICULTURAL PRIVATE PROPERTY, AND ABOUT 47.6 FEET NORTHEAST OF BOUNDARY MONUMENT 4.  TO REACH FROM THE INTERSECTION OF MARYLAND STATE HIGHWAY 313 AND MARYLAND STATE HIGHWAY 348 (LAUREL ROAD) ON THE SOUTH EDGE OF SHARPTOWN, MARYLAND, GO SOUTHEAST ON MARYLAND STATE HIGHWAY 348 FOR ABOUT 1.3 MILES TO THE STATE BOUNDARY LINE.  CONTINUE EAST, NOW ON DELAWARE STATE HIGHWAY 24 (SHARPTOWN ROAD) FOR ABOUT 0.2 MILES TO THE INTERSECTION WITH ROAD 505.  TURN RIGHT AND GO SOUTHEAST ON ROAD 505 FOR ABOUT 0.25 MILES TO THE FARMSTEAD ON THE RIGHT.  FROM THE FARMSTEAD, DRIVE SOUTHWEST ON A DIRT ROAD THAT PASSES BETWEEN TWO LONG CHICKEN HOUSES  FOR ABOUT 650 YARDS TO THE WEST END OF A CULTIVATED FIELD ON THE RIGHT.  TURN RIGHT AND DRIVE NORTH ALONG THE FIELD FOR ABOUT 150 YARDS TO A CLEARING IN THE WOOD LINE AT THE NORTHWEST CORNER OF THE FIELD AND THE BOUNDARY MONUMENT ON THE LEFT AND THE STATION ON THE RIGHT.

markers.description: BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 1987 (RGP) THE STATION IS LOCATED ABOUT 3.2 KM (2 MI) SOUTHEAST OF SHARPTOWN AND NEAR THE MARYLAND DELAWARE STATE BOUNDARY. OWNERSHIP--ROAD RIGHT-OF-WAY.  TO REACH THE STATION FROM THE POST OFFICE AT SHARPTOWN, GO WEST FOR 0.15 KM (0.1 MI) ON FOURTH STREET TO A CROSSROADS. TURN LEFT AND GO SOUTH FOR 0.8 KM (0.5 MI) ON MAIN STREET TO A CROSSROADS.  CONTINUE STRAIGHT AHEAD AND GO SOUTHEAST FOR 2.15 KM (1.35 MI) ON STATE HIGHWAY 348 TO THE MARYLAND DELAWARE STATE BOUNDARY.  CONTINUE STRAIGHT AHEAD AND GO EAST FOR 0.15 KM (0.1 MI) ON DELAWARE STATE HIGHWAY 24 TO THE STATION ON THE RIGHT.  THE STATION IS A STANDARD NGS DISK STAMPED---RIDER 1962---, SET INTO THE TOP OF A SQUARE CONCRETE MONUMENT 30 CM ON SIDE FLUSH WITH GROUND. LOCATED 9.1 METERS (29.7 FT) SOUTH FROM THE CENTER OF STATE HIGHWAY 24, 51.8 METERS (169.9 FT) WEST-NORTHWEST FROM THE NORTHWEST CORNER OF A BUILDING, 0.7 METERS (2.2 FT) EAST FROM A POWERLINE POLE NUMBERED 44091 98848 AND 0.5 METERS (1.8 FT) EAST-SOUTHEAST FROM A WITNESS POST.                            STATION RECOVERY (2008)  RECOVERY NOTE BY GEOCACHING 2008 (WD) RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION.                            STATION RECOVERY (2013)  RECOVERY NOTE BY DELAWARE COASTAL PROGRAM 2013 RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION.

markers.description: BY CITY OF LEWES DELAWARE 2005 (AWR) THE STATION IS LOCATED IN LEWES, 493 FEET (150.3 M) NORTHEAST OF THE MAIN POST OFFICE, 1.08  MI (1.74 KM) WEST-SOUTHWEST OF THE DELAWARE RIVER AND BAY AUTHORITY FERRY TERMINAL,  AND 0.39 MI (0.63 KM) NORTHEAST OF THE BEEBE MEDICAL CENTER.   TO REACH FROM THE MAIN POST OFFICE IN LEWES, PROCEED 285 FEET (86.87 M) SOUTHEAST ON  FRONT STREET TO THE INTERSECTION OF SAVANNAH ROAD, THEN PROCEED 367 FEET (111.86 M)  NORTHEAST ON SAVANNAH ROAD TO STATION ON LEFT.   THE STATION IS LOCATED 25.0 FEET (7.62 M) NORTHWEST OF THE CENTERLINE OF SAVANNAH ROAD,  47 FEET (14.33 M) NORTH-NORTHWEST OF DRAWBRIDGE TRAFFIC SIGNAL, AND 5.4 FEET (1.65 M)  NORTHWEST OF THE BACK EDGE OF A CONCRETE SIDEWALK.  THE STATION IS A CENTER PUNCHED  BRONZE DISK SET IN A 1 FOOT (30 CM) DIAMETER CONCRETE POST.                            STATION RECOVERY (2008)  RECOVERY NOTE BY DELAWARE DEPARTMENT OF TRANSPORTATION 2008 (BRC) THE STATION IS LOCATED IN LEWES, 493 FEET (150.3 M) NORTHEAST OF THE MAIN POST OFFICE, 1.08  MI (1.74 KM) WEST-SOUTHWEST OF THE DELAWARE RIVER AND BAY AUTHORITY FERRY TERMINAL, AND 0.39 MI (0.63 KM) NORTHEAST OF THE BEEBE MEDICAL CENTER.   TO REACH FROM THE MAIN POST OFFICE IN LEWES, PROCEED 285 FEET (86.87 M) SOUTHEAST ON FRONT STREET TO THE INTERSECTION OF SAVANNAH ROAD, THEN PROCEED 367 FEET (111.86 M) NORTHEAST ON SAVANNAH ROAD TO STATION ON LEFT.   THE STATION IS LOCATED 25.0 FEET (7.62 M) NORTHWEST OF THE CENTERLINE OF SAVANNAH ROAD, 47 FEET (14.33 M) NORTH-NORTHWEST OF DRAWBRIDGE TRAFFIC SIGNAL, AND 5.4 FEET (1.65 M) NORTHWEST OF THE BACK EDGE OF A CONCRETE SIDEWALK.  THE STATION IS A CENTER PUNCHED BRONZE DISK SET IN A 1 FOOT (30 CM) DIAMETER CONCRETE POST.                            STATION RECOVERY (2012)  RECOVERY NOTE BY DELAWARE COASTAL PROGRAM 2012 RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION.                            STATION RECOVERY (2015)  RECOVERY NOTE BY RODGERS CONSULTING INC 2015 (JMB) RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION.

markers.description: BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1934 (JCT) ON THE NW SHORE OF INDIAN RIVER BAY AND THE S SIDE OF INDIAN RIVER NECK, ON THE SECOND PROMINENT POINT OF LAND W OF BURTON ISLAND.  THE STATION IS LOCATED ON THE SW SIDE OF THE POINT 10 METERS N OF THE HIGHWATER LINE AND JUST W OF THE HIGH CULTIVATED GROUND.  IT IS AT THE NORTHERN EXTREMITY OF A SMALL BARE SANDY AREA IN THE MARSH, AND ABOUT 300 METERS W ALONG THE SHORE LINE FROM A LARGE WOODEN GARAGE USED BY MEMBERS OF THE BURTON ISLAND GUN CLUB.  A LARGE MARSHY AREA LIES TO THE NW OF THE STATION.  SURFACE MARK IS A STANDARD BRONZE DISK IN A TILE. UNDERGROUND MARK IS A STANDARD BRONZE DISK SET IN CONCRETE.  REFERENCE MARKS ARE  STANDARD BRONZE DISK SET IN CONCRETE, IN THE TOP OF A TILE.  THE STATION MAY BE REACHED BY EITHER LAND OR WATER, BUT IS BEST APPROACHED FROM THE WATER.                            STATION RECOVERY (1943)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1943 (FLG) RECOVERED AS DESCRIBED, EXCEPT FOR THE FOLLOWING DISCREPANCIES--  1.  REFERENCE MARK 1 IS 46.26 FEET OR 14.100 METERS NE OF THE STATION.  2.  REFERENCE MARK 2 IS 41.95 FEET OR 12.785 METERS E OF THE STATION.  3.  REFERENCE MARK 1 TO REFERENCE MARK 2 IS 30.71 FEET OR 9.360 METERS.  4.  THE GARAGE DESCRIBED HAS BEEN DESTROYED.  5.  THE STATION IS NOW 7 METERS FROM HIGH-WATER LINE.                            STATION RECOVERY (1954)  RECOVERY NOTE BY US GEOLOGICAL SURVEY 1954 THE CONCRETE FILLED PIECE OF TILE WHICH HELD THE SURFACE MARKER WAS LYING ON ITS SIDE IN THE EDGE OF THE WATER.  CONSIDERABLE BEACH EROSION IN AREA SO THAT DESCRIPTION HARDLY APPLIES ANYMORE.  THERE IS A POSSIBILITY THAT ALL SURFACE MARKS MAY HAVE BEEN WASHED AWAY.  REFERENCE MARKS COULD NOT BE FOUND.                            STATION RECOVERY (1962)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1962 (RWT) (NO OBSERVATIONS WERE MADE AT THIS STATION ON THIS DATE).  THE STATION SURFACE MARK HAS BEEN DESTROYED, NO EVIDENCE OF THE SURFACE MONUMENT WAS RECOVERED.  THE SUB-SURFACE MARK WAS RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION.  IT IS NOW LOCATED ABOUT 12.0 FEET SOUTH OF THE SHORE LINE AND IS ONLY VISIBLE AT LOW TIDE.  REFERENCE MARK 1 WAS RECOVERED AND IN GOOD CONDITION.  IT IS NOW LOCATED AT THE HIGH WATER LINE AND IS ABOUT 6 INCHES BELOW THE GROUND SURFACE.  IT IS 4.0 FEET NORTH OF THE SHORE LINE, 104.6 FEET WEST OF A STANDARD METAL WITNESS POST AND MARKER AND 101.96 FEET SOUTHWEST OF TRIANGULATION STATION RIVER 2 1962.  RIVER 2 1962 WAS ESTABLISHED 44.3597 METERS NORTHEAST OF THIS STATION.  THE PROPERTY IS NOW OWNED BY THE L.P. FAUCETT INC. OF GEORGETOWN, DELAWARE.  THE DESCRIPTION WAS FOUND TO BE ADEQUATE.  HEIGHT OF LIGHT ABOVE STATION MARK 1 METER.
markers.setting: SET IN CONCRETE IN A CLAY TILE PIPE
markers.stability: MARK OF QUESTIONABLE OR UNKNOWN STABILITY

markers.description: BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1962 (RWT) THE STATION IS LOCATED ON THE NORTHWEST SHORE OF INDIAN RIVER BAY AND THE SOUTH SIDE OF INDIAN RIVER NECK, ON THE SECOND PROMINENT POINT OF LAND WEST OF BURTON ISLAND, 3.0 MILES WEST-SOUTHWEST OF MASSEY LANDING, 6-1/2 MILES WEST-NORTHWEST OF INDIAN RIVER INLET BRIDGE AND ON PROPERTY OWNED BY THE L.P. FAUCETT INC. OF GEORGETOWN, DELAWARE.  TO REACH THE STATION FROM THE JUNCTION OF STATE HIGHWAY 14 AND 18 ABOUT 2.0 MILES SOUTHWEST OF LEWES, GO SOUTHEAST ON STATE HIGHWAY 14 FOR 2.4 MILES TO THE JUNCTION OF STATE HIGHWAY 24, TURN RIGHT, GO WEST ON STATE HIGHWAY 24 FOR 7.5 MILES TO THE JUNCTION OF STATE HIGHWAY 5, TURN LEFT, GO EAST ON A MACADAM ROAD FOR 4.65 MILES TO A PRIVATE FARM LANE ON THE RIGHT, TURN RIGHT, GO SOUTH ON THE FARM ROAD FOR 0.45 MILE TO BUILDINGS, TURN LEFT IN FRONT OF THE HOUSE THROUGH A GATE AND FOLLOW A FIELD ROAD EAST AND SOUTH FOR 0.25 MILE TO THE SHORE LINE, TURN RIGHT, GO WEST FOR 0.15 MILE TO THE SOUTHWEST CORNER OF A CULTIVATED FIELD AND THE STATION AS DESCRIBED.  THE STATION MARK IS A STANDARD DISK STAMPED RIVER 2 1962, SET IN TOP OF A SQUARE CONCRETE MONUMENT WHICH PROJECTS 1 INCH ABOVE THE GROUND SURFACE.  IT IS 4.15 FEET SOUTH-SOUTHWEST OF A STANDARD METAL WITNESS POST AND MARKER, 36.3 FEET SOUTH-SOUTHEAST OF A 6-INCH TRIANGULAR BLAZED PINE TREE AND 37.0 FEET NORTH OF THE HIGH WATER LINE.  REFERENCE MARK 1 IS A STANDARD DISK STAMPED RIVER NO 1 1934, SET IN TOP OF TILE WHICH IS ABOUT 6 INCHES BELOW THE GROUND SURFACE.  IT IS 4.0 FEET NORTH OF THE NORTH EDGE OF THE SHORE LINE AND 104.6 FEET WEST OF THE WITNESS POST AND MARKER.  REFERENCE MARK 3 IS A STANDARD DISK STAMPED RIVER 2 NO 3 1962, SET IN A SQUARE CONCRETE MONUMENT WHICH PROJECTS 4 INCHES ABOVE THE GROUND SURFACE.  IT IS 7.9 FEET NORTH-NORTHEAST OF A 6-INCH PINE TREE, 18.0 FEET WEST OF THE WEST EDGE OF A CULTIVATED FIELD, 40.0 FEET NORTH-NORTHWEST OF THE WITNESS POST AND 80.0 FEET NORTH OF THE HIGH WATER LINE.  REFERENCE MARK 4 IS A STANDARD DISK STAMPED RIVER 2 NO 4 1962, SET IN TOP OF A SQUARE CONCRETE MONUMENT WHICH PROJECTS 4 INCHES ABOVE THE GROUND SURFACE.  IT IS 24.0 FEET NORTH OF THE HIGH WATER LINE, 31.0 FEET WEST OF THE WITNESS POST, 52.0 FEET SOUTHWEST OF THE 6-INCH PINE TREE AND 68.0 FEET WEST OF THE WEST EDGE OF THE CULTIVATED FIELD.  RIVER 1934 IS A STANDARD DISK STAMPED RIVER 1934, SET IN A 6-INCH CONCRETE CYLINDER.  THIS MARK WAS FORMERLY A SUB-SURFACE STATION MARK FOR RIVER 1934.  IT IS NOW LOCATED ABOUT 12.0 FEET SOUTH OF THE SHORE LINE AND IS ONLY VISIBLE AT LOW TIDE.  HEIGHT OF LIGHT ABOVE STATION MARK 1 METER.                            STATION RECOVERY (2009)  RECOVERY NOTE BY INDIVIDUAL CONTRIBUTORS 2009 (ZSW) PROPERTY IS NOW OWNED BY DELAWARE NATURAL RESOURCES AND ENVIRONMENTAL CONTROL AND THERE IS A LOCKED GATE AT THE PUBLIC ROAD.  ALL OF THE BUILDINGS ARE GONE AND THE MARK IS NOW ON THE BEACH.

markers.description: BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1961 (RWT) THE STATION IS LOCATED IN THE CENTER OF A FIELD ROAD, 4.5 MILES EAST-NORTHEAST OF MILLINGTON, MARYLAND, 6.0 MILES NORTHWEST OF KENTON, DELAWARE AND ON PROPERTY OWNED BY MR. JOHN T. ROBINSON.  TO REACH THE STATION FROM THE CROSSROADS IN MILLINGTON, MARYLAND, GO EAST ON STATE HIGHWAY 291 FOR 4.3 MILES TO THE STATE LINE, CONTINUE EAST ON DELAWARE STATE HIGHWAY 6 FOR 0.65 MILE TO A GRAVELED ROAD LEFT, TURN LEFT AND GO NORTH ON THE GRAVELED ROAD FOR 0.65 MILE TO THE AZIMUTH MARK ON THE LEFT, CONTINUE NORTH ON THE GRAVELED ROAD FOR 0.3 MILE TO A FARM LANE ON THE LEFT, TURN LEFT AND GO WEST ON THE FARM LANE FOR 0.15 MILE TO THE RESIDENCE OF MR. ROBINSON, TURN RIGHT AND GO NORTH AROUND THE BARN AND THEN LEFT, WEST ON A FIELD ROAD FOR 0.3 MILE TO A LONE WILD CHERRY TREE AND THE STATION.  THE STATION MARK IS A STANDARD DISK STAMPED ROBINSON 1961, SET IN TOP OF A SQUARE CONCRETE MONUMENT WHICH IS ABOUT 12 INCHES BELOW THE GROUND SURFACE.  IT IS 46.0 FEET EAST-SOUTHEAST OF A 48-INCH CHERRY TREE, 45.0 FEET NORTHWEST OF A STANDARD METAL WITNESS POST AND MARKER AND 41.3 FEET WEST OF A NORTHWEST FENCE CORNER.  REFERENCE MARK 1 IS A STANDARD DISK STAMPED ROBINSON NO 1 1961, SET IN TOP OF A SQUARE CONCRETE MONUMENT WHICH IS FLUSH WITH THE GROUND SURFACE.  IT IS 1.0 FOOT NORTH OF THE FENCE LINE, 1.0 FOOT EAST OF THE NORTHWEST FENCE CORNER AND 15.3 FEET NORTH OF THE STANDARD METAL WITNESS POST AND MARKER.  REFERENCE MARK 2 IS A STANDARD DISK STAMPED ROBINSON NO 2 1961, SET IN TOP OF A SQUARE CONCRETE MONUMENT WHICH IS FLUSH WITH THE GROUND SURFACE.  IT IS LOCATED IN THE NORTH AND SOUTH FENCE LINE, 25.2 FEET SOUTH OF THE STANDARD METAL WITNESS POST AND MARKER AND 39.8 FEET SOUTH OF THE NORTHWEST FENCE CORNER.  AZIMUTH MARK IS A STANDARD DISK STAMPED ROBINSON 1961, SET IN TOP OF A SQUARE CONCRETE MONUMENT WHICH 12 INCHES BELOW THE GROUND SURFACE.  IT IS 2.5 FEET NORTHWEST OF A STANDARD METAL WITNESS POST AND MARKER AND 25.8 FEET WEST OF THE APPROXIMATE CENTER OF THE GRAVELED ROAD.  BOUNDARY MONUMENT NO. 56 IS A 12 X 12 INCH GRANITE MONUMENT WHICH PROJECTS ABOUT 24 INCHES ABOVE THE GROUND SURFACE.  THE MONUMENT IS MARKED M AND P AND LEANS SLIGHTLY EAST.  VERY SMALL CHIPS HAVE BEEN BROKEN OFF OF THE TOP EDGE OF THE MONUMENT.  IT IS 1.0 FOOT EAST OF AN EAST AND WEST FENCE LINE AND 10.0 FEET NORTH OF THE LARGEST TREE IN THE AREA.  HEIGHT OF LIGHT ABOVE STATION MARK 1 METER.

markers.description: BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1961 (RWT) (THERE WERE NO REFERENCE MARKS TAKEN AT THIS STATION).  THE STATION IS LOCATED ABOUT 6.0 MILES NORTHWEST OF KENTON DELAWARE, 4-1/2 MILES EAST-NORTHEAST OF MILLINGTON MARYLAND AND ON PROPERTY OWNED BY MR. JOHN T. ROBINSON WHO GAVE PERMISSION.  TO REACH THE STATION FROM THE CROSSROADS IN MILLINGTON MARYLAND, GO EASTERLY ON STATE HIGHWAY 291 FOR 4.3 MILES TO THE STATE LINE, CONTINUE EASTERLY ON DELAWARE STATE HIGHWAY 6 FOR 0.65 MILE TO A SIDE ROAD LEFT, TURN LEFT NORTHERLY ON GRAVELED ROAD FOR 0.65 MILE TO THE STATION ON THE LEFT.  AZIMUTH MARK, IS A STANDARD DISK SET IN THE TOP OF A 10 X 10 INCH CONCRETE MONUMENT WHICH IS ABOUT 12 INCHES BELOW THE SURFACE OF THE GROUND, STAMPED ROBINSON 1961.  IT IS 25.8 FEET WEST OF THE APPROXIMATE CENTER OF THE GRAVELED ROAD AND 2.5 FEET NORTHWEST OF A STANDARD METAL WITNESS POST AND MARKER.  HEIGHT OF LIGHT ABOVE STATION MARK 1 METER.                            STATION RECOVERY (2012)  RECOVERY NOTE BY DELAWARE COASTAL PROGRAM 2012 MARK NOT FOUND.

markers.description: BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1909 (ES) SW OF LITTLE ASSAWOMAN BAY, IN A CULTIVATED FIELD, ON THE PROPERTY OF E.H. DERICKSON.  NO SURFACE MARK WAS PLACED.  THE SUB-SURFACE MARK IS A STANDARD BRONZE DISK SET IN CEMENT NEARLY 3 FEET BELOW THE SURFACE OF THE GROUND.  REFERENCE MARK IS A CEMENT POST 8 INCHES SQUARE WITH BOTTLE IN CENTER.  IT IS NEAR THE SW CORNER OF THE BARNYARD FENCE ON THE PROPERTY OF J.E. DERICKSON AND IS 81.45 METERS (267.2 FEET) FROM THE STATION N 3 DEG 04 MIN W.                            STATION RECOVERY (1929)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1929 (CFE) STATION NOT RECOVERED.  REFERENCE MARK RECOVERED 11.6 METERS FROM THE SW CORNER OF THE BARN AND 40.1 METERS FROM THE SE CORNER OF THE HOUSE.                            STATION RECOVERY (1934)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1934 (JCT) STATION AND REFERENCE MARK RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION.  DESCRIPTION SHOULD READ AS FOLLOWS--  LOCATED NEAR BAYVILLE, DELAWARE, ON FARM OF E.H. DERICKSON IN A CULTIVATED FIELD ON THE W SIDE OF LITTLE ASSAWOMAN BAY.  THE STATION IS A STANDARD DISK SET IN CEMENT 3 FEET BELOW THE SURFACE OF THE GROUND AND HAS NO SURFACE-STATION MARK.  THE SINGLE REFERENCE MARK IS A CEMENT POST 8 INCHES SQUARE WITH BOTTLE FOR CENTER.  BOTH MARKS ARE IN THE NW PART OF THE CULTIVATED FIELD NEAR THE FARMHOUSE AND BARN OF J.E. DERICKSON, WHICH ARE SEPARATED FROM THE FIELD BY A WAGON ROAD.  THE REFERENCE MARK IS NEAR THE SW CORNER OF THE BARNYARD FENCE, 11.6 METERS FROM THE SW CORNER OF THE BARN, AND 40.1 METERS FROM THE SE CORNER OF THE FARMHOUSE.  TO RECOVER THE STATION MARK, SET THEODOLITE OVER REFERENCE MARK AND INITIALING ON FENWICK ISLAND LIGHTHOUSE, MEASURE THE ANGLE S 43 DEG 01 MIN W IN A CLOCKWISE DIRECTION.  THEN MEASURE FROM THE REFERENCE MARK 81.45 METERS ALONG THIS LINE AND DIG FOR STATION.  THE STATION MARK IS ALSO 90.65 METERS FROM THE SW CORNER OF THE BARN.                            STATION RECOVERY (1942)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1942 (WDP) THIS STATION WAS THOROUGHLY SEARCHED FOR BY TWO MEN FOR 1-1/2 HOURS, BUT NO TRACE OF IT COULD BE FOUND.  IT IS RECOMMENDED THAT THIS STATION BE CLASSIFIED AS LOST.  REFERENCE MARK NO. 1 WAS FOUND DESTROYED.                            STATION RECOVERY (1962)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1962 (WMR) LOST.  THE AREA WAS SEARCHED BUT THE MARK COULD NOT BE FOUND.  NONE OF THE REFERENCE POINTS COULD BE IDENTIFIED AND THE MARK WAS BURIED 3 FEET UNDERGROUND.  THIS STATION SHOULD BE CONSIDERED LOST.                            STATION RECOVERY (1962)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1962 (CFO) THE STATION AND REFERENCE MARK WAS SEARCHED FOR BUT NOT FOUND.  THE HOUSE, BARN AND BARN LOT FENCE USED AS REFERENCE POINTS FOR THE STATION AND REFERENCE MARK ARE NO LONGER IN EXISTANCE.  THE AREA HAS BEEN MADE INTO A FIELD AND PLACED UNDER CULTIVATION AND THE REFERENCE MARK HAS PROBABLY BEEN REMOVED FROM THE FIELD.  THE STATION MARK WAS PLACED ABOUT 3 FEET UNDERGROUND AND IS PROBABLY STILL IN PLACE BUT WITHOUT A SINGLE REFERENCE POINT IT COULD NOT BE FOUND.

markers.description: BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1933 (GLA) THIS STATION IS ON CITY PROPERTY IN WILMINGTON, DELAWARE, AT THE RODNEY RESERVOIR.  STATION, AND UNDERGROUND MARKS ARE STANDARD BRONZE DISKS SET IN CONCRETE AS DESCRIBED IN NOTES 1B, AND 7A.  REFERENCE MARK NO.2 IS W OF THE STATION AND SET IN THE CONCRETE SIDEWALK 6 INCHES SE FROM SW RAIL POST OF STEPS GOING UP TERRACE FROM N-CLAYTON STREET.  THE MARK IS FLUSH WITH THE WALK.  REFERENCE MARK NO.1 IS S OF THE STATION AND SET IN THE CONCRETE SIDEWALK.  IT IS N OF LAMP POST 8 FEET AND 73 FEET SE OF STEPS LEADING UP TERRACE FROM N-CLAYTON STREET.  THE MARK IS FLUSH WITH THE WALK.  TO REACH FROM DOWNTOWN WILMINGTON, GO W ON W-8TH STREET ABOUT 1 MILE FROM MARKET STREET TO TOP OF GRADE AT RESERVOIR, HERE TAKE STREET ON W SIDE OF THE RESERVOIR (N-CLAYTON STREET) FOR ONE BLOCK TO W-9TH STREET AND STATION.  STATION IS ON LOWER TERRACE OF THE RESERVOIR AT THE CORNER OF N-CLAYTON AND W-9TH STREETS.  THE MARK IS 31.6 FEET S OF STEPS (CONCRETE) AT N CORNER OF TERRACE.  58.5 FEET NE OF CENTER OF SIDEWALK.  63.3 FEET E OF CONCRETE STEPS GOING UP TERRACE FROM N-CLAYTON STREET. 150 FEET N OF BRICK BUILDING.  THE MARK IS FLUSH WITH THE GROUND.                            STATION RECOVERY (1958)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1958 (JEG) STATION MARK AND REFERENCE MARK 1 AND 2 WERE FOUND TO BE IN GOOD CONDITION.  THE OLD DESCRIPTION WAS FOUND TO BE INADEQUATE AND A COMPLETE NEW DESCRIPTION FOLLOWS.  STATION IS LOCATED ON WILMINGTON CITY PROPERTY, IN THE WESTERN SECTION OF THE CITY, ABOUT 160 FEET NORTH OF THE WILMINGTON, RODNEY RESERVOIR.  REACHED FROM WEST-8TH AND MARKET STREETS INTERSECTION IN WILMINGTON BY GOING WEST, ON WEST-8TH STREET FOR 1.0 MILE.  TURN RIGHT, NORTH, AND FOLLOW NORTH-CLAYTON STREET FOR 1 BLOCK TO THE STATION ON THE RIGHT.  STATION MARK IS A STANDARD DISK, STAMPED RODNEY 1933, SET IN THE TOP OF A CONCRETE CYLINDER MONUMENT WHICH IS FLUSH WITH THE GROUND SURFACE.  IT IS 79 FEET SOUTH-SOUTHWEST OF WEST-9TH-STREET, 74 FEET SOUTH-SOUTHEAST OF NORTH-CLAYTON STREET, 152 FEET NORTH OF THE NORTHWEST CORNER OF THE RESERVOIR CONTROL BUILDING, 32 FEET SOUTHEAST OF SOME CONCRETE TERRACE-STEPS LEADING DOWN TO THE STREET.  THE SURFACE AND UNDERGROUND MARKS ARE DESCRIBED IN NOTES 1B, 7A.  REFERENCE MARK 1 IS A STANDARD DISK, STAMPED RODNEY NO 1 1933, CEMENTED IN A DEPRESSION, IN THE TOP OF A CONCRETE SIDEWALK WHICH IS FLUSH WITH THE GROUND SURFACE.  IT IS 71 FEET NORTH-NORTHWEST OF THE NORTHWEST CORNER OF THE RESERVOIR CONTROL BUILDING, 140 FEET SOUTH-SOUTHWEST OF WEST-9TH STREET.  REFERENCE MARK 2 IS A STANDARD DISK, STAMPED RODNEY NO 2 1933, CEMENTED IN A DEPRESSION, IN THE TOP OF A CONCRETE SIDEWALK WHICH IS FLUSH WITH THE GROUND SURFACE.  IT IS 1 FOOT SOUTH-SOUTHEAST OF SOME CONCRETE TERRACE-STEPS LEADING DOWN TO THE STREET, 139 FEET SOUTH-SOUTHWEST OF WEST-9TH STREET.  THERE IS NO AZIMUTH MARK.  MEASUREMENT FROM REFERENCE MARK 1 TO REFERENCE MARK 2 - 71.52 FT. 21.800 M.                            STATION RECOVERY (1965)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1965 (JCB) THE STATION AND REFERENCE MARKS 1 AND 2 WERE RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION.  THE ORIGINAL DESCRIPTION IS ADEQUATE FOR STATION RECOVERY BUT COULD STAND IMPROVEMENT.  A COMPLETE NEW DESCRIPTION FOLLOWS.  THE STATION IS LOCATED ON CITY PROPERTY, AT THE RODNEY RESERVOIR WHICH IS ON A HIGH HILL ABOUT 1 MILE WEST OF MARKET STREET, AT THE CORNER OF WEST 9TH AND CLAYTON STREETS AND ON THE LOWER TERRACE OF THE RESERVOIR PARK.  IT IS 63.3 FEET EAST-NORTHEAST OF THE CENTER OF THE TOP STEP LEADING FROM CLAYTON STREET TO THE TERRACE, 58.5 FEET NORTHEAST OF THE APPROXIMATE CENTERLINE OF THE PARK SIDEWALK AND 31.6 FEET SOUTH OF THE CENTER OF THE TOP STEP AT THE NORTH CORNER OF THE TERRACE.  THE MONUMENT IS 2 INCHES UNDERGROUND AND THE DISK IS STAMPED RODNEY 1933. (NOTE 1B, 7A)  REFERENCE MARK NO. 1 IS 82.35 FEET SOUTH OF THE STATION, 77 FEET NORTHWEST OF THE NORTH CORNER OF A BRICK PUMPHOUSE AND 1.6 FEET NORTHEAST OF THE SOUTHWEST EDGE OF THE SIDEWALK.  THE DISK IS SET IN A DRILLHOLE IN THE SIDEWALK AND IS STAMPED RODNEY NO. 1 1933.  REFERENCE MARK NO. 2 IS 65.80 FEET WEST OF THE STATION, SET IN A DRILLHOLE IN THE SIDEWALK AT THE TOP OF THE STEPS LEADING FROM CLAYTON STREET.  IT IS 6 INCHES SOUTHEAST OF THE RAIL POST AT THE SOUTHWEST EDGE OF THE STEPS AND THE DISK IS STAMPED RODNEY NO 2 1933.                            STATION RECOVERY (1997)  RECOVERY NOTE BY US POWER SQUADRON 1997 RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION.                            STATION RECOVERY (2004)  RECOVERY NOTE BY URS COMPANY 2004 RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION.                            STATION RECOVERY (2013)  RECOVERY NOTE BY DELAWARE COASTAL PROGRAM 2013 LOCATED BEHIND A LOCKED GATE.

markers.description: BY NATIONAL OCEAN SERVICE 1984 (WVH) THE STATION IS LOCATED ON THE NORTHEAST END OF PEA PATCH ISLAND IN DELAWARE RIVER.  TO REACH THE STATION FROM THE MOUTH OF SALEM RIVER, GO BY BOAT NORTHWEST 7.1 KM (4.4 MILES) TO THE NORTHEAST END OF PEA PATCH ISLAND AND THE STATION ON THE SANDY SHORELINE.  THE STATION IS A STANDARD NOS DISK STAMPED---ROGER 1983---, SET INTO THE TOP OF A ROUND CONCRETE MONUMENT 25 CM IN DIAMETER FLUSH WITH GROUND. IT IS LOCATED ABOUT 11 METERS (35 FT) WEST FROM THE HIGH WATER MARK, AND 1.8 METERS (6.0 FT) EAST FROM A STANDARD NOS WITNESS POST SIGN.  HEIGHT OF LIGHT SHOWN ABOVE THE MARK WAS 1.52 METERS.                            STATION RECOVERY (1997)  RECOVERY NOTE BY US POWER SQUADRON 1997 MARK NOT FOUND.

markers.description: BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1962 (RWT) THE STATION IS THE CENTER OF THE LIGHT AT THE APEX AND CENTER OF THE ROOSEVELT INLET RANGE LIGHT, SOUTH ONE OF FOUR.  LOCATED ABOUT 400 YARDS SOUTH OF THE SOUTH END OF THE INLET IN THE NORTHWEST SECTION OF LEWES, DELAWARE.  THE STRUCTURE IS A 4-STEEL LEGGED STRUCTURE WITH A WOOD FRAME BOX, WHICH HAS A ROTATING LIGHT MOUNTED IN ITS TOP AND CENTER.  IT IS RED AND WHITE WITH AN OVERALL HEIGHT OF APPROXIMATELY 25.0 FEET.                            STATION RECOVERY (1969)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1969 (JKW) STATION RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION.  THE ORIGINAL DESCRIPTION IS ADEQUATE.                            STATION RECOVERY (2001)  RECOVERY NOTE BY US POWER SQUADRON 2001 (SAL) RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION.                            STATION RECOVERY (2012)  RECOVERY NOTE BY DELAWARE COASTAL PROGRAM 2012 RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION.

BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1962 (RWT) THE STATION IS THE BLUE LIGHT AT THE TOP, BUT NOT THE CENTER OF THE EAST ONE OF FOUR RANGE LIGHTS OF THE ROOSEVELT INLET.  LOCATED ABOUT 1.5 MILES NORTH-NORTHWEST OF THE BUSINESS DISTRICT OF LEWES, DELAWARE, ON THE NORTHEAST END OF THE SMALL CANAL RUNNING SOUTH.  THE STRUCTURE IS OF 4-STEEL CHANNEL IRON LEGS WITH A BLUE LIGHT MOUNTED AT ITS APEX AND NEAR THE CENTER.  THE OVERALL HEIGHT IS APPROXIMATELY 20.0 FEET.                            STATION RECOVERY (1969)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1969 (JKW) STATION RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION.  NO EVIDENCE OR INFORMATION FOUND INDICATED THAT THIS LIGHT WAS REBUILT OR MOVED AFTER IT WAS LOCATED IN 1962.  THE DESCRIPTION BY R.W.T. IN 1962 IS ADEQUATE FOR RECOVERY.                            STATION RECOVERY (2001)  RECOVERY NOTE BY US POWER SQUADRON 2001 (SAL) RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION.

BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1962 (RWT) THE STATION IS LOCATED ON THE SOUTH ONE OF TWO CONCRETE MILITARY OBSERVATION TOWERS, 2.5 MILES SOUTH OF REHOBOTH BEACH, 4.5 MILES NORTH OF INDIAN RIVER INLET AND ON PROPERTY OF THE STATE ROAD DEPARTMENT.  TO REACH THE STATION FROM THE POST OFFICE IN REHOBOTH BEACH, GO SOUTH ON CITY ROUTE 14 FOR 1.4 MILES TO THE JUNCTION OF STATE HIGHWAY 14 BY-PASS, CONTINUE SOUTH ON STATE HIGHWAY 14 FOR 1.25 MILES TO THE NORTH ONE OF TWO CONCRETE OBSERVATION TOWERS AND THE AZIMUTH MARK IS LOCATED ON THE LEFT, EAST SIDE OF STATE HIGHWAY 14, CONTINUE SOUTH ON HIGHWAY 14 FOR 0.22 MILE TO THE SECOND CONCRETE TOWER AND THE STATION IS LOCATED ON THE TOP CENTER ON THE CONCRETE TOWER AS DESCRIBED.  THE STATION MARK IS A STANDARD DISK STAMPED ROUND 1962, SET IN CEMENT IN A 4 INCH PIPE LOCATED IN THE CENTER OF THE MILITARY CONCRETE OBSERVATION TOWER.  IT IS 5.0 FEET WEST OF THE DOOR TO THE TOP OF THE TOWER, 6.2 FEET NORTHEAST OF THE CHIMNEY AND 6.6 FEET EAST OF A CONTROL BOX.  REFERENCE MARK 1 IS A STANDARD DISK STAMPED ROUND NO 1 1962, SET IN TOP OF A SQUARE CONCRETE MONUMENT WHICH PROJECTS 3 INCHES ABOVE THE GROUND SURFACE.  IT IS 1.0 FEET WEST OF A STANDARD METAL WITNESS POST AND MARKER, 115.0 FEET SOUTH-SOUTHWEST OF THE SOUTHWEST EDGE OF THE OBSERVATION TOWER AND 120.0 FEET EAST OF THE CENTER LINE OF STATE HIGHWAY 14.  REFERENCE MARK 2 IS A STANDARD DISK STAMPED ROUND NO 2 1962, SET IN TOP OF A SQUARE CONCRETE MONUMENT WHICH PROJECTS 8 INCHES ABOVE THE GROUND SURFACE.  IT IS 3.0 FEET SOUTH-SOUTHEAST OF A STANDARD METAL WITNESS POST AND MARKER, 52.0 FEET EAST OF THE APPROXIMATE CENTER LINE OF STATE HIGHWAY 14 AND ABOUT 1 FOOT HIGHER THAN THE HIGHWAY.  THE AZIMUTH MARK IS A STANDARD DISK STAMPED ROUND 1962, SET IN TOP OF A SQUARE CONCRETE MONUMENT WHICH PROJECTS 5 INCHES ABOVE THE GROUND SURFACE.  IT IS 1.7 FEET WEST OF A STANDARD METAL WITNESS POST AND MARKER, 1.7 FEET SOUTH OF A POWER LINE POLE AND 52.0 FEET EAST OF THE CENTER LINE OF STATE HIGHWAY 14.  REFERENCE MARK 2 WAS OBSERVED AND TRAVERSED.  HEIGHT OF LIGHT ABOVE STATION MARK 1 METER.                            STATION RECOVERY (1966)  RECOVERY NOTE BY LOCAL ENGINEER (INDIVIDUAL OR FIRM) 1966 (RTF) RECOVERED BY BE BEAVIN CO.  STATION MARK DESTROYED.  4-INCH PIPE O.K.  R.M.S AND AZIMUTH MARK FOUND IN GOOD CONDITION.  CAPE MAY L.H. IS VISIBLE FROM STATION.                            STATION RECOVERY (1970)  RECOVERY NOTE BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 1970 (JKW) STATION MARK NOT ACTUALLY RECOVERED, BUT TOWER IS IN GOOD CONDITION.  RM 2 AND THE AZ MK WERE RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION.  RM 1 IS BELIEVED TO BE DESTROYED.  A NEW PARKING AREA HAS BEEN CONSTRUCTED NEAR THE TOWER.  ENTRANCE TO TOWER IS SEALED WITH BRICK.  ORIGINAL DESCRIPTION IS ADEQUATE EXCEPT--RM 2 IS 62.8 FT E OF CENTERLINE OF E LANE OF HWY.  AZ MK IS 55.5 FT E OF CENTERLINE OF E LANE OF HWY.                            STATION RECOVERY (1972)  RECOVERY NOTE BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 1972 (LFS) A ATTEMPT WAS MADE TO VISIT THE STATION.  THE STATION IS ON A OLD MILITARY PILL BUNKER AND ALL OF THE ENTRANCES HAS BEEN CEMENTED OVER AND IT IS IMPOSSIBLE TO ENTER THE BUNKER WITHOUT BUSTING THE CONCRETE.  THE BUNKER IS ABOUT 35 FEET HIGH AND IMPOSSIBLE TO ENTER WITHOUT GOING UP THE INSIDES.  REFERENCE MARK 2 WAS RECOVERED AND FOUND IN GOOD CONDITION.  IT IS BELIEVED REFERENCE MARK 1 IS STILL INTACT BUT UNDER A NEW PARKING AREA WHICH HAS BEEN CONSTRUCTED IN THE AREA OF THE MARK.  THE AZIMUTH MARK WAS RECOVERED AND FOUND IN GOOD CONDITION.  AIRLINE DISTANCE AND DIRECTION FROM NEAREST TOWN 2-1/2 MILES SOUTH OF REHOBOTH BEACH.                            STATION RECOVERY (1975)  RECOVERY NOTE BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 1975 (EAB) THIS STATION MARK WAS NOT ACTUALLY RECOVERED BY ME, AS MENTIONED IN THE 1962 DESCRIPTION, IT IS A DRILL HOLE IN THE ROOF OF A CONCRETE SILO.  THIS CONCRETE SILO WAS RECOVERED AND IT WAS FOUND TO BE IN GOOD CONDITION, BUT THE ENTRANCE DOOR IS NOW SEALED.  REFERENCE MARK NO 1 WAS NOT RECOVERED BY ME.  REFERENCE MARK NO 2 WAS RECOVERED AND IT WAS FOUND TO BE IN GOOD CONDITION.  THIS MARK WAS ALSO OCCUPIED IN 1962.  IT WAS FOUND TO BE 129.4 FEET NORTHWEST OF THE CENTER OF THE DOOR WAY ENTRANCE INTO THE CONCRETE SILO WHICH IS NOW CLOSED.  THE AZIMUTH MARK WAS RECOVERED AND IT WAS FOUND TO BE IN GOOD CONDITION.  IT WAS FOUND TO BE 14 FEET SOUTH SOUTHEAST OF A BRACE POWER POLE NUMBER 396X.  AIRLINE DISTANCE AND DIRECTION FROM NEAREST TOWN 2.5 MILES SOUTH OF REHOBOTH BEACH.

AZIMUTH MARK IS A STANDARD DISK STAMPED SCHEPENIS 1961, SET IN THE TOP OF A SQUARE CONCRETE MONUMENT WHICH PROJECTS ABOUT 1-INCH ABOVE THE SURFACE OF THE GROUND. BOUNDARY MONUMENT NO. 44 IS A 12 X 12 INCH LIMESTONE MONUMENT WHICH PROJECTS ABOUT 30 INCHES ABOVE THE SURFACE OF THE GROUND AND MARKED WITH THE LETTERS P AND M.  IT IS LOCATED IN THE EAST EDGE OF THE WOODS ABOUT 3.0 FEET WEST OF THE EAST EDGE OF THE CULTIVATED FIELD.  THE MONUMENT IS IN A PLUMB POSITION EXCEPT FOR SMALL CHIPS ON THE CORNER AND IS IN GOOD CONDITION.  HEIGHT OF LIGHT ABOVE STATION MARK 30 METERS.

markers.description: BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1961 (RWT) THE STATION IS LOCATED IN THE NORTHEAST CORNER OF A CROSSROADS, 2.5 MILES NORTH OF THE SMALL VILLAGE OF WHITELEYSBURG, 3.8 MILES SOUTHEAST OF GOLDSBORO, MARYLAND, 4.0 MILES NORTHEAST OF GREENSBORO, MARYLAND AND ON PROPERTY OWNED BY MR. CHARLES CHOEE.  TO REACH THE STATION FROM GREENSBORO, MARYLAND, GO EAST ON STATE HIGHWAY 314 FOR 0.4 MILE TO THE JUNCTION OF STATE HIGHWAY 313 AND 314, KEEP THE EXTREME LEFT FORK AS PER SIGN BOYCE MILL, GO NORTHEASTERLY FOR 4.0 MILES TO THE CROSSROADS AND THE DELAWARE-MARYLAND STATE LINE AND THE STATION ON THE LEFT AS DESCRIBED.  THE STATION MARK IS A STANDARD DISK STAMPED SCHULTIE 1961, SET IN TOP OF A SQUARE CONCRETE MONUMENT WHICH IS 2 INCHES BELOW THE GROUND SURFACE.  IT IS 14.0 FEET WEST-SOUTHWEST OF A STANDARD METAL WITNESS POST AND MARKER, 55.0 FEET NORTHEAST OF THE APPROXIMATE CENTER OF THE CROSSROADS AND 59.0 FEET EAST OF A TELEPHONELINE POLE KA17548.  REFERENCE MARK 1 IS A STANDARD DISK STAMPED SCHULTIE NO 1 1961, SET IN TOP OF A SQUARE CONCRETE MONUMENT WHICH PROJECTS 4 INCHES ABOVE THE GROUND SURFACE.  IT IS 37.5 FEET SOUTHEAST OF THE WITNESS POST, 70.0 EAST-NORTHEAST OF THE APPROXIMATE CENTER OF THE CROSSROADS AND 91.5 FEET EAST-SOUTHEAST OF THE TELEPHONELINE POLE KA17548.  B.M. 26 RHP (REFERENCE MARK 2) IS A STANDARD U.S. GEOLOGICAL SURVEY DISK STAMPED RHP26 1955 SET IN TOP OF A 8 X 8 INCH CONCRETE MONUMENT WHICH PROJECTS ABOUT 5 INCHES ABOVE THE GROUND SURFACE.  IT IS 2.0 FEET NORTH-NORTHEAST OF THE TELEPHONE POLE KA17548, 38.0 FEET NORTHWEST OF THE APPROXIMATE CENTER OF THE CROSSROADS, 70.5 FEET WEST-SOUTHWEST OF THE WITNESS POST AND 0.317 METERS HIGHER THAN THE STATION MARK.  TO REACH THE AZIMUTH MARK FROM THE CROSSROAD AT THE STATION, GO SOUTH ON THE MACADAM ROAD FOR 0.31 MILE TO THE AXIMUTH MARK ON THE LEFT AS DESCRIBED.  THE AZIMUTH MARK IS A STANDARD DISK STAMPED SCHULTIE 1961, SET IN TOP OF A SQUARE CONCRETE MONUMENT WHICH PROJECTS 2 INCHES ABOVE THE GROUND SURFACE.  IT IS 1.9 FEET NORTH OF A STANDARD METAL WITNESS POST AND MARKER, 2.0 FEET SOUTHEAST OF A POWERLINE POLE DEC-E43-190-12-22 AND 22.0 FEET NORTHEAST OF THE APPROXIMATE CENTER OF THE MACADAM ROAD.  BOUNDARY MONUMENT NO. 37 IS LYING IN A PRONE POSITION UNDER THE NORTH EDGE OF THE MOST NORTHERN FARM BUILDING AT THE FIRST FARM NORTH OF THE STATION.  THE MONUMENT APPEARS TO BE IN GOOD CONDITION.  HEIGHT OF LIGHT ABOVE STATION MARK 1.40 METERS.                            STATION RECOVERY (1975)  RECOVERY NOTE BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 1975 (CLN) THE STATION MARK AND THE AZIMUTH MARK WERE RECOVERED AND FOUND IN GOOD CONDITION AS DESCRIBED IN THE 1962 DESCRIPTION.  REFERENCE MARK 1 AND BENCH MARK 26 RHP WERE FOUND OUT OF POSITION.  BOTH MARKS HAVE BEEN HIT AND TILTED ABOUT 20 DEGREES TO THE WEST.  DUT TO ABOUT 1-1/2 FOOT OF WATER IN THE DITCH WHERE THEY ARE LOCATED, IT WAS IMPOSSIBLE TO RESET THEM AT THIS TIME.  THE ENTIRE AREA AROUND THE STATION WAS COVERED WITH WATER.  THE REFERENCE MARKS WILL BE RESET DURING THE SUMMER OF 1975, AFTER THE WATER IS GONE.  AIRLINE DISTANCE AND DIRECTION FROM NEAREST TOWN 2-1/2 MILES NORTH OF WHITELEYSBURG.                            STATION RECOVERY (1976)  RECOVERY NOTE BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 1976 (CLN) THE STATION MARK AND THE AZIMUTH MARK WERE RECOVERED AND FOUND IN GOOD CONDITION.  REFERENCE MARK ONE AND BENCH MARK 26PHR WERE FOUND DESTROYED.  A NEW REFERENCE MARK THREE WAS ESTABLISHED AT THIS DATE.  THE MARYLAND-DELAWARE BOUNDARY MONUMENT NUMBER 37 WAS RESET AT THIS DATE AND MAY BE USED FOR A REFERENCE MARK.  A COMPLETE NEW DESCRIPTION FOLLOWS.  THE STATION IS LOCATED 2-1/2 MILES NORTH OF WHITLEYSBURG, 3-3/4 MILES SOUTHEAST OF GOLDSBORO, AND 4 MILES NORTHEAST OF GREENSBORO.  THE STATION IS ON ROAD RIGHT-OF-WAY.  TO REACH FROM THE INTERSECTION OF STATE HIGHWAYS 313, 314, AND 404 IN THE EAST EDGE OF GREENSBORO, GO EAST ON STATE HIGHWAY 314 FOR 100 FEET TO A SIDE ROAD LEFT.  TURN LEFT AND GO NORTHWEST ON A PAVED ROAD FOR 1.0 MILE TO A SIDE ROAD LEFT.  CONTINUE STRAIGHT AHEAD AND GO EAST ON ROAD 110 FOR 3.15 MILES TO A CROSSROADS AND THE STATION ON THE LEFT.  THE STATION MARK IS A STANDARD DISK STAMPED SCHULTIE 1961, SET IN THE TOP OF A 10-INCH SQUARE CONCRETE MONUMENT WHICH IS FLUSH WITH THE SURFACE.  IT IS 58 FEET EAST OF A POWERLINE POLE NUMBERED DEC 190 12-26, 42 FEET NORTH OF THE CENTER OF ROAD 110, 32 FEET EAST OF THE CENTER OF HOLLY SPRINGS ROAD AND 1.5 FEET SOUTHEAST OF A WITNESS POST.  REFERENCE MARK THREE IS A STANDARD DISK STAMPED SCHULTIE 1961 NO. 3 1976 SET IN THE TOP OF A 10-INCH ROUND CONCRETE WHICH IS FLUSH WITH THE SURFACE.  IT IS 90 FEET SOUTH OF THE WITNESS POST, 81 FEET SOUTHEAST OF THE POWERLINE POLE NUMBERED DEC 190 12-26, 39 FEET SOUTH OF THE CENTER OF ROAD 110, AND 24 FEET EAST OF THE CENTER OF HOLLY SPRINGS ROAD.  THE MARYLAND-DELAWARE BOUNDARY MONUMENT NUMBER 37 IS A 12-INCH SQUARE LIMESTONE MONUMENT WITH A P ON THE EAST SIDE AND AN M ON THE WEST SIDE WHICH IS CARVED IN THE STONE.  IT HAS A 1-INCH CARVED CROSS IN THE APEX OF THE STONE WHICH MARKS THE POINT INTERSECTED.  IT PROJECTS 24 INCHES ABOVE THE SURFACE.  THE SUB-SURFACE MARKER IS A MARYLAND-DELAWARE BOUNDARY DISK STAMPED N-S NO. 37 1976, SET IN AN 8-INCH MASS OF CONCRETE WHICH IS 42 INCHES BELOW THE SURFACE.  THEY ARE 225 FEET WEST OF THE CENTER OF HOLLY SPRINGS ROAD, 201 FEET WEST OF THE POWERLINE POLE AND 3 FEET EAST OF A WITNESS POST.  THE AZIMUTH MARK IS A STANDARD DISK STAMPED SCHULTIE 1961, SET IN THE TOP OF A 10-INCH SQUARE CONCRETE WHICH IS FLUSH WITH THE TOP OF THE EDGE OF THE FIELD AND PROJECTING 1 FOOT ON THE WEST SIDE.  IT IS 23 FEET EAST OF THE CENTER OF HOLLY SPRINGS ROAD, 5.8 FEET WEST-SOUTHWEST OF A POWERLINE POLE NUMBERED DEC 190 12-22, AND 2.9 FEET NORTHEAST OF A WITNESS POST.  TO REACH THE AZIMUTH MARK FROM THE STATION, GO SOUTH ON HOLLY SPRINGS ROAD FOR 0.35 MILE TO THE MARK ON THE LEFT.  THE MARYLAND-DELAWARE BOUNDARY MONUMENT NUMBER 37 WAS SET AT THIS DATE, SEE DESCRIPTION THEREOF.  AIRLINE DISTANCE AND DIRECTION FROM NEAREST TOWN 2-1/2 MILES NORTH OF WHITELEYSBURG. BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1934 (JB) THE SECOND-ORDER STATION IS ON THE GROUNDS OF THE SEAFORD HIGH SCHOOL APPROXIMATELY 250 YARDS NNW OF THE SCHOOL, 82.1 FEET SW OF THE BOTTOM OF THE S OF THE AEROPLANE SIGN SEAFORD, 20 FEET E OF THE CENTER LINE OF A DIRT ROAD, AND 18.2 FEET N OF ONE OF THE ROW OF TREES.  THE STATION MARK PROJECTS 6 INCHES ABOVE GROUND AND IS STAMPED SEAFORD 1934.  SURFACE, UNDERGROUND, AND REFERENCE MARKS ARE STANDARD BRONZE DISKS SET IN CONCRETE.  REFERENCE MARK NO.1, THE AZIMUTH MARK, IS 0.45 MILE NE OF THE STATION, ACROSS U.S. HIGHWAY 13 FROM TELEPHONE POLE NO.21, ABOUT 9 PACES W OF THE CENTER LINE OF U.S. HIGHWAY 13 AND ABOUT 5 PACES S OF A TELEPHONE POLE.  THE MARK PROJECTS 6 INCHES ABOVE GROUND AND IS STAMPED SEAFORD NO.1 1934.  REFERENCE MARK NO.2 IS 150.35 FEET SSW OF THE STATION, AND 22 FEET W OF THE CENTER LINE OF A DIRT ROAD.  THE MARK PROJECTS 6 INCHES ABOVE GROUND AND IS STAMPED SEAFORD NO.2 1934.  REFERENCE MARK NO.3 IS 107.41 FEET NNW OF THE STATION, 81.3 FEET SW OF A CONCRETE FENCE POST (MOST WESTERLY), AND 21.5 FEET W OF THE CENTER LINE OF A DIRT ROAD.  THE MARK PROJECTS 6 INCHES ABOVE GROUND AND IS STAMPED SEAFORD NO.3 1934.  TO REACH THE STATION FROM THE BRIDGE OVER THE NANTICOKE RIVER ON U.S. HIGHWAY 13 IN SEAFORD, FOLLOW U.S. HIGHWAY 13 N FOR ABOUT 0.5 MILE TO THE JUNCTION OF STATE HIGHWAY 20 LEADING W, TURN LEFT (W) ON STATE HIGHWAY 20 FOR ABOUT 0.2 MILE TO SEAFORD HIGH SCHOOL, TURN RIGHT (N) ON TAR ROAD--THEN A DIRT ROAD FOR ABOUT 0.1 MILE TO THE STATION.  A 103-FOOT TOWER WILL CLEAR ALL LINES.                            STATION RECOVERY (1945)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1945 (GBW) STATION AND R.M.S 2 AND 3 WERE FOUND AS DESCRIBED.  R.M. 1 (AZIMUTH MARK) WAS SEARCHED FOR BUT NOT FOUND.  THERE HAS BEEN CONSIDERABLE BUILDING ON THE W SIDE OF U.S. HIGHWAY 13, AND THE MARK MAY HAVE BEEN DESTROYED IN HOUSE DRIVE CONSTRUCTION.  A DIFFERENT SYSTEM OF TELEPHONE POLE NUMBERING IS IN USE.  STATION IS ON THE W EDGE OF THE SEAFORD SCHOOL PLAYGROUND, ON THE EDGE OF AN EXCAVATION FOR LEVELING THE PLAYGROUND.  THE MARKER IS EXPOSED 18 INCHES ON THE E AND 10 INCHES ON THE W SIDES AND IS NOTICEABLY INCLINED TOWARD THE PLAYGROUND (E).  THERE IS NO AIRPLANE SIGN IN THE VICINITY.  REFERENCE MARK 3 IS NOW 6 INCHES UNDERGROUND, IN A CULTIVATED FIELD, BUT APPEARED TO BE UPRIGHT AND FIRM (NOT MOVED BY CONTACT WITH THE PLOW).  THE STONE FENCE POST OF THE 1934 DESCRIPTION HAS BEEN REMOVED.  USING THE 100-FOOT CHAIN H-3373, R.M. 2 TO STATION WAS 150.50 FEET AND R.M. 3 TO STATION WAS 107.48 FEET.                            STATION RECOVERY (1963)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1963 1 MI N FROM SEAFORD. 0.6 MILE NORTH ALONG THE PENNSYLVANIA RAILROAD FROM THE STATION AT SEAFORD, THENCE 0.25 MILE EAST ALONG STATE HIGHWAY 20, THENCE 0.15 MILE NORTH ALONG MARKET STREET, AT THE HIGH SCHOOL, NEAR THE NORTHWEST CORNER OF THE PLAYGROUND, 27 FEET EAST OF CENTER LINE OF THE STREET, 185 FEET SOUTH OF NORTHWEST CORNER OF FENCE SURROUNDING PLAYGROUND, 18 FEET NORTH OF 5TH TREE (IN A ROW OF TREES ALONG WEST SIDE OF PLAYGROUND) SOUTH OF NORTHWEST CORNER OF PLAYGROUND, 4 FEET EAST OF FENCE LINE LEADING NORTH AND SOUTH, 1 FOOT ABOVE LEVEL OF STREET, AND SET IN THE TOP OF A CONCRETE POST PROJECTING 1 INCH.                            STATION RECOVERY (1980)  RECOVERY NOTE BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 1980 (RGP) THE STATION SURFACE MARK WAS FOUND IN VERY POOR CONDITION.  THE STATION SUB-SURFACE MARK WAS FOUND IN GOOD CONDITION.  A NEW STATION SURFACE MARK WAS SET DIRECTLY OVER THE OLD SUB-SURFACE MARK.  THE REFERENCE MARKS WERE NOT FOUND AND BELIEVED DESTROYED BY ROAD CONSTRUCTION.  TWO NEW REFERENCE MARKS AND A NEW AZIMUTH MARK WERE ESTABLISHED.  A COMPLETE NEW DESCRIPTION FOLLOWS--  THE STATION IS LOCATED IN THE NORTH PART OF SEAFORD ON THE GROUNDS OF THE SEAFORD HIGH SCHOOL AND JUST WEST OF A SPORTS RACE TRACK BLEACHERS.  TO REACH THE STATION FROM THE INTERSECTION OF U.S. HIGHWAY 13 AND STATE HIGHWAY 20 IN THE EAST PART OF SEAFORD, GO WEST ON STATE HIGHWAY 20 FOR 1.3 MILE TO A CROSSROADS.  TURN RIGHT AND GO NORTH ON NORTH MARKET STREET FOR 0.15 MILE TO THE STATION ON THE RIGHT.  THE STATION IS A STANDARD NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY DISK STAMPED ---SEAFORD 1934 1980---SET INTO THE TOP OF A ROUND CONCRETE MONUMENT 25 CM (10 INCHES) IN DIAMETER FLUSH WITH THE GROUND LOCATED 750 FEET NORTH FROM THE SEAFORD ELEMENTARY SCHOOL, 53.0 METERS (174 FEET) SE FROM NANTICOKE STREET, 14.6 METERS (48 FEET) NE FROM A POWERLINE POLE NUMBERED 19, 8.5 METERS (28 FEET) NE FROM THE CENTER OF NORTH MARKET STREET, 1.2 METERS (4 FEET) NE FROM A WOVEN WIRE FENCE, AND 1.10 METERS (3.6 FEET) NE FROM A WITNESS POST.  THE UNDERGROUND MARK IS A STANDARD US COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY (NOW NOS) DISK STAMPED---SEAFORD 1934---SET INTO AN IRREGULAR MASS OF CONCRETE 0.9 METER (3 FEET) BELOW THE SURFACE.  REFERENCE MARK NO. 4 IS A STANDARD NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY DISK STAMPED---SEAFORD 1934 NO 4 1980---CEMENTED IN A DRILL HOLE IN A CONCRETE SLAB WHICH SUPPORT THE BLEACHERS FOR THE HIGH SCHOOL SPORTS FIELD AND TRACK.  IT IS LOCATED 10.7 METERS (35 FEET) NE FROM THE CENTER OF NORTH MARKET STREET, 5.55 METERS (18.2 FEET) NW FROM THE WITNESS POST, 3.4 METERS (11 FEET) NE FROM THE WOVEN WIRE FENCE, 1.2 METERS (4 FEET) NE FROM THE SOUTHWEST EDGE OF THE CONCRETE SLAB, AND 0.15 METER (0.5 FOOT) HIGHER THAN THE STATION.  REFERENCE MARK NO. 5 IS A STANDARD NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY DISK STAMPED---SEAFORD 1934 NO 5 1980---SET IN A DRILL HOLE IN THE CONCRETE SLAB THAT SUPPORTS THE BLEACHERS FOR THE SPORTS FIELD.  IT IS LOCATED 11.6 METERS (38 FEET) NE FROM THE CENTER OF NORTH MARKET STREET, 6.1 METERS (20 FEET) SE FROM THE WITNESS POST, 2.7 METERS (9 FEET) NE FROM A 24-INCH MAPLE TREE, 1.8 METERS (6 FEET) NE FROM THE SOUTHWEST EDGE OF THE CONCRETE SLAB, AND 0.15 METER (0.5 FOOT) HIGHER THAN THE STATION.  AZIMUTH MARK NO. 2 IS A STANDARD NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY DISK STAMPED---SEAFORD 1934 AZ 2 1980---SET IN A DRILL HOLE IN THE CURB ALONG THE SOUTH SIDE OF VIRGINIA AVENUE.  IT IS LOCATED 50.9 METERS (167 FEET) W FROM THE WEST ENTRANCE TO THE SEAFORD HIGH SCHOOL, 17.22 METERS (56.5 FEET) NE FROM A POWERLINE POLE NUMBERED 721 A FL 26, 11.3 METERS (37 FEET) NE FROM THE CENTER OF NORTH MARKET STREET, AND 4.9 METERS (16 FEET) SE FROM THE CENTER OF VIRGINIA AVENUE.  TO REACH THE AZIMUTH MARK FROM THE STATION, GO NORTH ON NORTH MARKET STREET FOR 0.25 MILE TO VIRGINIA AVENUE AND THE AZIMUTH MARK IN THE SOUTHEAST ANGLE OF THE INTERSECTION, ABOUT 100 YARDS SOUTH OF THE SEAFORD POLICE STATION.
