RIDER.  TO REACH THE STATION FROM THE JUNCTION OF STATE HIGHWAYS 313 AND 348 IN SHARPTOWN, MARYLAND.  GO EAST-SOUTHEAST ON STATE HIGHWAY 348 FOR 1.7 MILES TO THE MARYLAND-DELAWARE STATE LINE AND A TRACK ROAD ON THE LEFT, NORTH, SIDE OF THE HIGHWAY.  TURN LEFT AND GO NORTH ON A TRACK ROAD, BETWEEN TWO CULTIVATED FIELDS FOR 0.75 MILE TO THE MARYLAND AND DELAWARE STATE LINE MONUMENT, A STANDARD METAL WITNESS POST AND MARKER, TWO TRIANGULAR BLAZED TREES AND THE STATION ON THE RIGHT, EAST SIDE OF THE ROAD.  CONTINUE NORTH ON THE TRACK ROAD ALONG THE WEST SIDE OF THE TIMBERLINE FOR 0.15 MILE TO WHERE THE TRACK ROAD ENTERS THE TIMBER, A TRACK ROAD, A STANDARD METAL WITNESS POST AND THE AZIMUTH MARK ON THE LEFT, WEST, SIDE OF THE ROAD.  THE STATION MARK, REFERENCE MARKS NO. 1 AND NO. 2 AND THE AZIMUTH MARK ARE STANDARD DISKS SET IN THE TOPS OF 10-INCH SQUARE CONCRETE MONUMENTS FLUSH WITH THE SURFACE OF THE GROUND.  THE STATION MARK IS STAMPED SHARPTOWN 1962.  IT IS 35.0 FEET NORTH OF A 10-INCH TRIANGULAR BLAZED MAPLE TREE, 23.0 FEET SOUTH OF A 14-INCH TRIANGULAR BLAZED TWIN TRUNKED WHITE OAK TREE, 14.0 FEET EAST OF THE CENTERLINE OF A NORTH AND SOUTH TRACK ROAD AND 6.3 FEET NORTH OF A STANDARD METAL WITNESS POST AND MARKER.  REFERENCE MARK 1, STAMPED SHARPTOWN NO 1 1962, IS 29.8 FEET SOUTH-SOUTHWEST OF A STANDARD METAL WITNESS POST AND MARKER, 7.4 FEET EAST OF THE CENTERLINE OF THE NORTH AND SOUTH TRACK ROAD, 6.0 FEET WEST-NORTHWEST OF A 10-INCH TRIANGULAR BLAZED MAPLE TREE AND ABOUT THE SAME ELEVATION AS THE STATION.  REFERENCE MARK 2 IS STAMPED SHARPTOWN NO 2 1962.  IT IS 41.0 FEET NORTH-NORTHWEST OF A STANDARD METAL WITNESS POST AND MARKER, 8.0 FEET NORTHWEST OF A 14-INCH TRIANGULAR BLAZED TWIN TRUNKED WHITE OAK TREE, 6.5 FEET EAST OF THE CENTERLINE OF A NORTH AND SOUTH TRACK ROAD AND 6.0 FEET WEST OF A TIMBERLINE AND ABOUT THE SAME ELEVATION AS THE STATION.  THE AZIMUTH MARK IS STAMPED SHARPTOWN 1962.  IT IS 44.0 FEET WEST-SOUTHWEST OF THE SOUTHEAST CORNER OF A TIMBERLINE, 36.0 FEET WEST OF THE CENTERLINE OF A NORTH AND SOUTH TRACK ROAD ALONG THE SOUTH WEST SIDE OF A TIMBER, 8.0 FEET NORTH OF THE CENTERLINE OF AN EAST AND WEST TRACK ROAD ALONG THE SOUTH SIDE OF A TIMBER AND NORTH EDGE OF A FIELD AND 1.3 FEET SOUTH OF A STANDARD METAL WITNESS POST AND MARKER.  BOUNDARY MONUMENT NO. 5, A 12 INCH SQUARE GRANITE STONE PROJECTING ABOUT 30 INCHES ABOVE THE SURFACE OF THE GROUND, WITH THE COAT OF ARMS ON THE EAST AND WEST SIDES AND CHIPPED ON THE EAST SIDE NEAR THE TOP.  THE MONUMENT IS PLUMB AND IN GENERAL GOOD CONDITION.  A SMALL CROSS WAS INSCRIBED IN ITS TOP AND CENTER FOR TRAVERSE PURPOSE.  IT IS 69.5 FEET NORTH OF A STANDARD METAL WITNESS POST AND MARKER, 42.0 FEET NORTH-NORTHWEST OF A TWIN TRUNKED TRIANGULAR BLAZED WHITE OAK TREE.  HEIGHT OF LIGHT ABOVE STATION MARK 2 METERS.                            STATION RECOVERY (1962)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1962 RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION.                            STATION RECOVERY (1976)  RECOVERY NOTE BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 1976 (CLN) THE STATION AND BOTH REFERENCE MARKS WERE RECOVERED AND FOUND IN GOOD CONDITION AS PREVIOUSLY DESCRIBED.  THE AZIMUTH MARK WAS FOUND DESTROYED.  THE MONUMENT HAD BEEN PULLED OUT OF THE GROUND AND THE DISK WAS MISSING.  THE AREA AROUND WHERE THE MARK WAS LOCATED HAS BEEN CLEARED AND THE AREA CULTIVATED.  THERE IS NO SUITABLE PLACE TO SET A NEW MARK AT THIS DATE.  THE SHARPTOWN MUNICIPAL WATER TANK IS VISIBLE FROM THE GROUND AND MAY BE USED AS AN AZIMUTH.  A DIFFERENCE OF 3 MINUTES AND 20 SECONDS IN DIRECTION WAS NOTED TO REFERENCE MARK 1.  ALL OTHER DISTANCES AND DIRECTIONS AGREED WITH THE 1961 OBSERVATIONS.  THE MARYLAND-DELAWARE CROWN STONE NUMBER 5 WAS RESET AT THIS DATE, SEE DESCRIPTION THEREOF.  AIRLINE DISTANCE AND DIRECTION FROM NEAREST TOWN 1 MILE EAST OF SHARPTOWN.                            STATION RECOVERY (1984)  RECOVERY NOTE BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 1984 THE STATION IS LOCATED ABOUT 1.0 MILE EAST-SOUTHEAST OF SHARPTOWN, MARYLAND, ALONG THE EAST SIDE OF A NORTH AND SOUTH TRACK ROAD ALONG THE MARYLAND AND DELAWARE STATE LINE AND ON PROPERTY OWNED BY MR. markers.description: BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1933 (GLA) THIS STATION IS ON SLAUGHTER BEACH (FOWLERS BEACH) ABOUT 13 MILES E OF MILFORD, DELAWARE.  SURFACE, UNDERGROUND, AND REFERENCE MARKS ARE STANDARD BRONZE DISKS SET IN CONCRETE.  REFERENCE MARK NO.1 IS S OF THE STATION, JUST NW OF THE NW END OF THE GATE.  THE MARK PROJECTS 10 INCHES.  REFERENCE MARK NO.2 IS NW OF THE STATION, 225 FEET W OF S OF THE OLD BULKHEAD PILING.  THE MARK PROJECTS 4 INCHES.  TO REACH FROM MILFORD GOING S ON THE MAIN STREET TURN LEFT ON EAST FRONT STREET, LARGE PRESBYTERIAN CHURCH ON THE SE CORNER, CONTINUE E ON THIS ROAD 0.7 MILE TO CROSSROADS, HERE TURN RIGHT (S) ON THE REHOBOTH BEACH ROAD AND GO 4.9 MILES TO PAVED ROAD TO THE LEFT TURN LEFT AND FOLLOW THIS ROAD 1.6 MILES TO GRAVEL ROAD TO THE RIGHT (SIGN READING PRIME HOOK NECK), TURN RIGHT FOR 1.8 MILES TO T-INTERSECTION, HERE TURN LEFT AND GO 0.4 MILE TO A POINT WHERE THE GRAVEL MAKES A SHARP RIGHT TURN AND A DIRT ROAD CONTINUES STRAIGHT AHEAD, GO STRAIGHT AHEAD ON THE DIRT ROAD FOR 2.3 MILES TO THE STATION AND BEACH.  THE STATION IS ABOUT 245 FEET SW OF THE HIGH WATER MARK.  315 FEET S OF THE S END OF OLD BULKHEAD PILING.  174 FEET NNE OF A GATE IN BARBWIRE FENCE.  THE MARK PROJECTS 6 INCHES.                            STATION RECOVERY (1943)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1943 (FLG) RECOVERED AS DESCRIBED WITH THE FOLLOWING DISCREPANCIES AND ADDITIONAL INFORMATION--  THE FENCE HAS BEEN BURNED DOWN AND THE GATE IS NOT IDENTIFIABLE.  REFERENCE MARK 1 IS 91.93 FEET (28.020 METERS) NW OF THE STATION.  REFERENCE MARK 2 IS 174.13 FEET (53.075 METERS) S OF THE STATION.  REFERENCE MARK 1 TO REFERENCE MARK 2 - 221.09 FEET (67.388 METERS).  THE STATION IS LOCATED 700 FEET NW OF AN ARMY WATCH TOWER, 52.5 METERS N OF THE INTERSECTION OF DIRT ROAD AND A ROAD LEADING TO THE TOWER, 24 METERS SE OF THE CENTER OF A DIKE CROSSING THE DRAINAGE DITCH, AND 4 METERS S OF THE S EDGE OF THE DITCH.  REFERENCE MARK 1 IS 26 METERS E OF THE ROAD INTERSECTION AND 1.2 METERS N OF THE CENTER OF THE ROAD LEADING TO THE WATCH TOWER.  REFERENCE MARK 2 IS 15 METERS SW OF THE CENTER OF THE DIKE ACROSS THE DRAINAGE DITCH AND 6 METERS S OF THE S EDGE OF THE DITCH.  ALL MARKS ARE IN GOOD CONDITION.                            STATION RECOVERY (1946)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1946 (ELJ) STATION MARKS AND REFERENCE MARKS 1 AND 2 WERE RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION.  DISTANCES WERE MEASURED TO REFERENCE MARKS AND FOUND TO BE CORRECT.  THE 1933 DESCRIPTION IS ADEQUATE EXCEPT FOR THE FOLLOWING CHANGES--  1.  DELETE JUST NW OF THE NW END OF GATE AS THE GATE IS NOW GONE.  2.  CHANGE GRAVEL TO READ BLACK TOP IN TWO PLACES IN DESCRIPTION OF THE STATION MARK.  3.  CHANGE THE STATION IS ABOUT 245 FEET SW OF THE HIGH-WATER MARK TO THE STATION IS ABOUT 130 FEET SW OF THE HIGH-WATER MARK.  4.  DELETE 174 FEET NNE OF A GATE IN A BARB-WIRE FENCE AS THIS IS NOW GONE.  5.  ADD THE AZIMUTH MARK CANNOT BE SEEN FROM THE GROUND.                            STATION RECOVERY (1962)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1962 (JKW) LOST.  THE STATION MARK AND REFERENCE MARKS 1 AND 2 WERE NOT RECOVERED AFTER A TWO-HOUR SEARCH.  THE MARKS ARE BELIEVED TO BE COVERED-OVER BY SEVERAL FEET OF FILL OR DESTROYED.  THE ROAD HAS BEEN WIDENED AND THE STATION SITE CHANGED BY LEVELING AND FILLING.  THE LANDOWNER NEARBY STATES THAT HE HASNT SEEN THE MARKS FOR A NUMBER OF YEARS.                            STATION RECOVERY (1970)  RECOVERY NOTE BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 1970 (LFS) STATION AND REFERENCE MARKS WERE SEARCHED FOR BUT NOT RECOVERED.  A CONCRETE MONUMENT WITHOUT DISK WAS FOUND LYING ON THE BEACH.  A MR. KEN BESSINGER OF MILFORD, DELAWARE STATED IN A LETTER THAT HE HAD FOUND THIS MARK WITH A DISK STAMPED SLAUGHTER 1933. SEVERAL UNSUCCESSFUL ATTEMPTS WERE MADE TO CONTACT MR. BESSINGER.  AIRLINE DISTANCE AND DIRECTION FROM NEAREST TOWN 13 MILES EAST OF MILFORD.                            STATION RECOVERY (1977)  RECOVERY NOTE BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 1977 (CLN) A SEARCH WAS MADE FOR THE STATION AND NO MARKS WERE FOUND.  THE ENTIRE BEACH IN THE AREA OF THE OLD PILING HAS BEEN WASHED AWAY.  THIS STATION WAS PREVIOUSLY REPORTED DESTROYED BY J.K.W. IN 1962, HOWEVER DUE TO A REPORT OF A MARKER LAYING ON THE BEACH IN 1968, ANOTHER SEARCH WAS MADE.  IT IS NEARLY CERTAIN THAT THE STATION AND ALL MARKS ARE DESTROYED.  AIRLINE DISTANCE AND DIRECTION FROM NEAREST TOWN AT FOWLERS BEACH.

SPIRE IS 100 FEET ABOVE STREET LEVEL.  *OFFICE STATEMENT--ONE OF THESE DISTANCES IS INCORRECT. BY NATIONAL OCEAN SERVICE 1983 THE STATION IS LOCATED AT THE OFFSHORE END OF THE S MISPILLION JETTY ABOUT 6.3 MI ENE OF THE TOWN OF MILFORD, DELAWARE. TO REACH STATION PROCEED BY BOAT, LAND AT THE STEEL LADDER NEAR THE NE SIDE OF THE STRUCTURE. STATION IS A 5/8-INCH DIA HOLE ON A WOODEN PLATFORM ON THE N CORNER OF THE 5 FT X 5 FT X 30 FT STEEL TOWER (5 SECTIONS TOWER) OF THE MISPILLION S JETTY LT 1.  IT IS 6.5 INCHES ON EACH SIDE OF THE NW AND NE SIDE OF THE TOWER, 1.38 M (4.5 FT) NE FROM THE W CORNER OF THE STEEL TOWER, 1.68 M (5.5 FT) N FROM THE LIGHT BRACKET OF MISPILLION S JETTY LT 1.

markers.description: BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1943 (FLG) THE STATION IS THE S GABLE OF SPEARS BATHOUSE WHICH STANDS ON A DOCK DIRECTLY OFFSHORE FROM OAK ORCHARD.                            STATION RECOVERY (1961)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1961 (JKW) STATION RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION, AND A CHECK WITH THE LOCAL RESIDENTS VERIFIED THIS STATION.  THE RECOVERY NOTE BY F.L.G. IN 1943 IS COMPLETE AND ADEQUATE.

BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1958 (JEG) THE STATION IS LOCATED ON CHERRY ISLAND AND NEAR A DIKE, ABOUT 1.3 MILES SOUTHEAST OF THE POST OFFICE IN WILMINGTON, AND ABOUT 1.0 MILE NORTHWEST OF WHERE THE CHRISTIANA RIVER RUNS INTO THE DELAWARE RIVER.  IT IS 56 FEET WEST OF THE TOP OF THE DIKE, 53 FEET NORTHEAST OF THE CENTER OF A GRAVELED ROAD, 18 FEET NORTHWEST OF THE ROAD LEADING TO THE DIKE AND 4 FEET SOUTH-SOUTHEAST OF A WHITE WITNESS POST.  TO REACH THE STATION FROM THE POST OFFICE IN WILMINGTON AT THE INTERSECTION OF 11TH STREET AND MARKET STREET.  GO SOUTH ON MARKET STREET FOR 0.3 MILE TO THE INTERSECTION OF 7TH STREET AND MARKET STREET.  TURN LEFT ON 7TH STREET AND GO EASTERLY FOR 1.25 MILES TO THE BRIDGE OVER THE BRANDYWINE RIVER.  CROSS OVER THE BRIDGE AND CONTINUE EASTERLY ON A GRAVELED ROAD FOR 0.15 MILE TO FIVE SETS OF RAILROAD TRACKS.  CROSS THE TRACKS AND CONTINUE EASTERLY ON THE GRAVELED ROAD FOR 0.3 MILE TO A FORK*.  TAKE THE RIGHT FORK AND GO 0.4 MILE TO THE AZIMUTH MARK ON THE RIGHT, WEST, SIDE OF THE ROAD.  *CONTINUE EAST ON THE GRAVELED ROAD FOR 0.1 MILE TO A SIDE ROAD AND THE STATION ON THE LEFT AS DESCRIBED.  THE STATION MARK IS A STANDARD DISK, STAMPED SPOIL 1958, SET IN THE TOP OF A SQUARE CONCRETE MONUMENT WHICH IS FLUSH WITH THE SURFACE OF THE GROUND.  REFERENCE MARK NUMBER 1 IS A STANDARD DISK, STAMPED SPOIL NO 1 1958, SET IN THE TOP OF A SQUARE CONCRETE MONUMENT WHICH IS FLUSH WITH THE SURFACE OF THE GROUND.  IT IS LOCATED 30 FEET NORTH OF THE CENTER OF THE ROAD LEADING TO THE DIKE.  REFERENCE MARK NUMBER 2 IS A STANDARD DISK, STAMPED SPOIL NO 2 1958, SET IN THE TOP OF A SQUARE CONCRETE MONUMENT WHICH IS FLUSH WITH THE SURFACE OF THE GROUND.  IT IS 49 FEET NORTHEAST OF THE CENTER OF A GRAVELED ROAD AND 19 FEET SOUTHEAST OF THE CENTER OF THE ROAD LEADING TO THE DIKE.  THE AZIMUTH MARK, A STANDARD DISK STAMPED SPOIL 1958, IS SET IN THE TOP OF A SQUARE CONCRETE MONUMENT WHICH IS FLUSH WITH THE SURFACE OF THE GROUND.  IT IS 18 FEET NORTH OF THE CENTER OF A TRACK ROAD AND 2 FEET WEST OF A WHITE WITNESS POST.                            STATION RECOVERY (1965)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1965 (JB) THE STATION AND REFERENCE MARK NO. 1 WERE RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION.  REFERENCE MARK NO. 2 WAS FOUND IN A HORIZONTAL POSITION, HAVING BEEN DOZED OUT OF THE GROUND.  THE AZIMUTH MARK WAS SEARCHED FOR BUT NOT FOUND.  THERE ARE SIGNS OF DOZER WORK IN THE AREA AND THE MARK HAS PROBABLY BEEN DESTROYED.  THE ORIGINAL DESCRIPTION IS INADEQUATE.  A COMPLETE NEW ONE FOLLOWS.  THE STATION IS LOCATED ON CHERRY ISLAND, ABOUT 1-1/2 MILES SOUTHEAST OF THE WILMINGTON POST OFFICE, 1/2 MILE EAST-SOUTHEAST OF THE OLD ABANDONED 7TH STREET BRIDGE ACROSS THE CHRISTIANA RIVER, APPROXIMATELY 100 YARDS NORTHWEST OF THE REMAINS OF AN OLD BASEMENT AND ABOUT 150 FEET EAST OF AN INTERSECTION OF DIRT ROADS.  IT IS 73 FEET WEST OF THE TOP OF A LARGE DIKE, AT A SHARP TURN IN THE DIKE, 75 FEET SOUTHEAST OF A 6-INCH IRON PIPE FILLED WITH CONCRETE AND PROJECTING ABOUT 2 FEET.  50 FEET NORTHEAST OF THE APPROXIMATE CENTERLINE OF A TRACK ROAD WHICH LEADS TO THE DIKE, 4.3 FEET SOUTHEAST OF A CHARRED 4X4-INCH WITNESS POST AND 1/2 FOOT NORTHWEST OF A STEEL WITNESS POST.  THE MONUMENT IS FLUSH WITH THE SURFACE OF THE GROUND AND THE DISK IS STAMPED SPOIL 1958.  REFERENCE MARK NO. 1 IS 33.78 FEET NORTH-NORTHEAST OF THE STATION, 78 FEET EAST-SOUTHEAST OF THE CONCRETE FILLED 6-INCH IRON PIPE AND 16 FEET WEST OF THE BASE OF THE DIKE.  THE MONUMENT IS 6 INCHES UNDERGROUND AND THE DISK IS STAMPED SPOIL NO 1 1958.  TO REACH THE STATION FROM THE OVERPASS AT THE INTERSECTION OF EDGEMOOR ROAD WITH U.S. HIGHWAY 13 A (GOVERNOR PRINTZ BLVD.), GO SOUTHEAST ON EDGEMOOR ROAD FOR 0.15 MILE TO A CROSSROAD AT THE ENTRANCE TO DUPONT EDGE MOORE PLANT.  TURN RIGHT AND GO SOUTHWEST AS PER SIGN SEWAGE TREATMENT PLANT FOR 0.95 MILE TO A SIDEROAD RIGHT AT THE SOUTHWEST END OF A CONCRETE BRIDGE.  TURN RIGHT AND GO NORTHWEST AND WESTERLY ON A GRAVELED ROAD FOR 0.25 MILE TO A FORK.  KEEP LEFT, STRAIGHT AHEAD, SOUTHWEST, ON A NARROW DIRT ROAD FOR 0.25 MILE TO A FORK.  BEAR RIGHT AND GO NORTHWEST FOR A SHORT DISTANCE.  THENCE WEST-SOUTHWEST ON A ROAD BETWEEN TWIN POWERLINE POLES FOR 0.65 MILE TO A T-ROAD (ABOUT 130 FEET EAST OF A RAILROAD CROSSING).  TURN LEFT AND GO EAST-SOUTHEAST ON A DIRT ROAD FOR 0.35 MILE TO A SIDEROAD RIGHT.  KEEP LEFT, STRAIGHT AHEAD, FOR APPROXIMATELY 150 FEET TO THE STATION ON THE LEFT ON A LOW BANK.                            STATION RECOVERY (1965)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1965 0.5 MI ESE FROM WILMINGTON. 0.15 MILE SOUTHEAST ALONG EDGEMOOR ROAD TO A CROSSROAD AT THE DUPONT EDGE MOORE PLANT.  TURN RIGHT AND GO SOUTHWEST ON THE SEWAGE PLANT ROAD FOR 0.95 MILE TO A SIDEROAD RIGHT, AT THE SOUTHWEST END OF A CONCRETE BRIDGE.  TURN RIGHT AND GO NORTHWEST AND WESTERLY ON A GRAVELED ROAD FOR 0.25 MILE TO A FORK.  KEEP LEFT, STRAIGHT AHEAD, SOUTHWEST, ON A NARROW DIRT ROAD FOR 0.25 MILE TO A FORK.  BEAR RIGHT, NORTHWEST, FOR ABOUT 0.05 MILE, THENCE WEST-SOUTHWEST ON A CINDERED ROAD, BETWEEN POWERLINE POLES, FOR 0.65 MILE TO A T-ROAD (ABOUT 130 FEET EAST OF A RR CROSSING).  TURN LEFT AND GO EAST-SOUTHEAST ON A DIRT ROAD FOR 0.35 MILE TO A SIDEROAD RIGHT.  KEEP LEFT, STRAIGHT AHEAD, FOR APPROXIMATELY 150 FEET TO THE MARK ON THE LEFT, ON A LOW BANK. IT IS ON CHERRY ISLAND ABOUT 1/2 MILE EAST-SOUTHEAST OF THE OLD ABANDONED 7TH STREET BRIDGE, APPROXIMATELY 100 YARDS NORTHWEST OF THE REMAINS OF AN OLD BASEMENT, 73 FEET WEST OF THE TOP OF A LARGE DIKE, 75 FEET SOUTHEAST OF A CONCRETE FILLED 6-INCH IRON PIPE, PROJECTING 2 FEET, 50 FEET NORTHEAST OF THE APPROXIMATE CENTERLINE OF DIRT ROAD, 1/2 FOOT NORTHWEST OF A STEEL WITNESS POST AND IS SET IN THE TOP OF A CONCRETE POST SET FLUSH WITH THE GROUND.  NOTE-- THE PERMANENT CLOSING OF THE 7TH STREET BRIDGE MAKES A MORE CIRCUITOUS ROUTE NECESSARY.                            STATION RECOVERY (1981)  RECOVERY NOTE BY UNIVERSITY OF DELAWARE 1981 MARK NOT FOUND.

markers.description: BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1933 (GLA) THIS STATION IS ON THE PROPERTY OF THE UNITED STATES ARMY ENGINEERS AND ABOUT 0.15 MILE S OF ST. GEORGES WHICH IS A LITTLE TOWN ON HIGHWAY 13 BETWEEN SMYRNA AND WILMINGTON.  THE STATION IS ON EMBANKMENT JUST E OF S END OF ST. GEORGES DRAWBRIDGE.  27 FEET E OF W BANK OF TERRACE.  24 FEET S OF S BANK OF CANAL.  THE MARK PROJECTS 4 INCHES.  SURFACE, UNDERGROUND, REFERENCE, AND WITNESS MARKS ARE STANDARD BRONZE DISKS SET IN CONCRETE AS DESCRIBED IN NOTES 1B, 7A, AND 11B.  REFERENCE MARK NO.1 IS E OF THE STATION.  14.75 FEET S OF NE CORNER OF A WHITE GARAGE.  1.5 FEET W OF SW CORNER OF GARAGE.  AND 2 FEET N OF CONCRETE DRAIN AT THE FOOT OF THE BANK.  THE MARK PROJECTS 4 INCHES.  REFERENCE MARK NO.2 IS SW OF THE STATION AND SET IN THE SE ABUTMENT OF THE BRIDGE AT THE END OF THE IRON RAILING.  THE MARK IS 180.68 FEET E OF S OF THE CENTER OF BRIDGE SPAN.  19.5 FEET E OF CENTER OF ROAD (HIGHWAY 13).  AND 95.50 FEET W OF A UNITED STATES ARMY ENGINEERS STATION H.B..  THE MARK IS SET IN A DRILLED HOLE WITH CONCRETE.  THE AZIMUTH MARK IS NE OF THE STATION.  20 FEET FROM CENTER OF ROAD AND ON FENCE LINE.  PROJECTS 3 INCHES.  TO REACH FROM STATION GO N 0.2 MILE, TAKE ROUTE E FOR 0.2 MILE TO MARK ON S SIDE OF ROAD.  THE UNITED STATES ARMY ENGINEERS STATION H.B. IS IN ST. GEORGES, ON THE LAWN OF N.R. BUCKSONS HOUSE.  THE MARK IS ON THE S SIDE OF THE DRIVEWAY.  49.9 FEET NW OF SW CORNER OF THE HOUSE.  40.4 FEET W OF NW CORNER OF THE HOUSE.  106 FEET E OF HIGHWAY 13. 75.44 FEET SE OF STATION ST. GEORGE, UNITED STATES COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1933.  95.50 FEET E OF REFERENCE MARK NO.2 (U.S.C. AND G.S. 1933).  THE MARK PROJECTS 2 INCHES AND IS A STANDARD UNITED STATES ARMY ENGINEERS MARK.                            STATION RECOVERY (1946)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1946 (ELJ) STATION WAS NOT RECOVERED.  EMPLOYEE OF U.S.E. WHO HAD USED THE STATION IN PAST EIGHT YEARS, STATED THAT STATION WAS DESTROYED IN EXCAVATING AND TERRACING CANAL BANKS.  FOUR HOURS WERE SPENT SEARCHING FOR STATION.  REFERENCE MARK 1 WAS ALSO DESTROYED AT TIME STATION MARK WAS DESTROYED.  LIFT BRIDGE WAS REPLACED BY HIGH LEVEL FIXED BRIDGE IN 1942.  REFERENCE MARK 2 WAS DESTROYED WHEN OLD BRIDGE WAS REMOVED.  AZIMUTH MARK WAS RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION.                            STATION RECOVERY (1952)  RECOVERY NOTE BY US GEOLOGICAL SURVEY 1952 THIS BRIDGE HAS BEEN DESTROYED BY NEW BRIDGE ACROSS CANAL.  THE MARKER MUST HAVE BEEN DESTROYED ALSO BY CANAL EXCAVATION AS NOTHING WILL FIT DESCRIPTION IN AREA.  THE MARKER HAS BEEN SEARCHED FOR EXTENSIVELY.  WOULD RECOMMEND IT BE CALLED DESTROYED.  IT WAS ALSO SEARCHED FOR UNSUCCESSFULLY IN 1951 BY TRAVERSE PARTY.

markers.description: BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1958 (JCE) STATION IS LOCATED ABOUT 3-1/2 MILES SOUTHWEST OF THE POST OFFICE IN WILMINGTON, ABOUT 1/2 MILE NORTHWEST OF DELAWARE STATE HOSPITAL AND JUST EAST OF THE EAST BANK OF CHRISTIANA RIVER.  STATION IS 21 FEET SOUTHEAST OF APPROXIMATE CENTERLINE OF DRIVEWAY AND 13 FEET NORTH-NORTHWEST OF THE NORTHWEST CORNER OF SHED.  THE MARK IS A STANDARD STATION MARK DISK SET IN A 12X12 INCH CONCRETE MONUMENT, FLUSH WITH THE GROUND AND THE DISK IS STAMPED STATE FARM 1958.  REFERENCE MARK NO. 1 IS 12-1/2 FEET NORTHWEST OF APPROXIMATE CENTERLINE OF DRIVEWAY, 36-1/2 FEET NORTHWEST OF NORTHWEST CORNER OF SHED AND 35-1/2 FEET WEST-NORTHWEST OF NORTHEAST CORNER OF SHED.  THE MARK IS A STANDARD REFERENCE MARK DISK SET IN A 12X12 INCH CONCRETE MONUMENT, PROJECTS 2 INCHES AND THE DISK IS STAMPED STATE FARM NO 1 1958.  REFERENCE MARK NO. 2 IS 17-1/2 FEET NORTHWEST OF APPROXIMATE CENTERLINE OF DRIVEWAY, AND 11 FEET SOUTH OF A 36 INCH TREE.  THE MARK IS A STANDARD REFERENCE MARK DISK SET IN A 12X12 INCH CONCRETE MONUMENT, PROJECTS 2 INCHES AND THE DISK IS STAMPED STATE FARM NO 2 1958.  TO REACH FROM NEW CASTLE COUNTY-WILMINGTON AIR PORT, GO NORTHEAST ON U.S. HIGHWAY NO. 13 FOR 1.7 MILES TO JUNCTION OF U.S. HIGHWAY NO. 40.  KEEP LEFT AND CONTINUE NORTHEAST ON U.S. HIGHWAY NO. 13 FOR 0.2 MILE TO SIDE ROAD LEFT AT ENTRANCE TO DELAWARE STATE HOSPITAL. TURN LEFT CROSSING THE SOUTHWEST BOUND LANE OF TRAFFIC AND CONTINUE TO ENTRANCE OF DELAWARE STATE HOSPITAL.  CONTINUE NORTHERLY FOR 0.2 MILE TO CROSS STREET AT WATER TANK.  TURN RIGHT AND GO 0.1 MILE TO RIGHT TURN.  TURN RIGHT AND GO SOUTHERLY FOR 0.1 MILE TO SIGN BIGGS.  TURN LEFT AND GO 0.1 MILE TO STREET LEFT AT SIGN BIGGS.  TURN LEFT AND GO 0.05 MILE TO GREENHOUSE.  CONTINUE NORTHERLY FOR 0.35 MILE TO CHAIN LINK GATE AT RAILROAD TRACKS.  CONTINUE NORTHEASTELY OR 0.25 MILE TO CHRISTIANA RIVER AND STATION AS DESCRIBED.  HEIGHT OF LIGHT ABOVE STATION MARK 30 METERS.                            STATION RECOVERY (1965)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1965 (JCB) THE STATION AND REFERENCE MARKS 1 AND 2 WERE RECOVERED AND FOUND IN GOOD CONDITION.  THE ORIGINAL DESCRIPTION IS INADEQUATE.  A COMPLETE NEW DESCRIPTION FOLLOWS.  THE STATION IS LOCATED ABOUT 3-1/2 MILES SOUTHWEST OF THE POST OFFICE, 1/2 MILE NORTHWEST OF THE DELAWARE STATE HOSPITAL AND ABOUT 100 YARDS SOUTH-SOUTHWEST OF A TWO-STORY FARMHOUSE.  IT IS 22 FEET SOUTHEAST OF THE APPROXIMATE CENTERLINE OF A DRIVEWAY, 30 FEET NORTH OF A PEAR TREE, 15 FEET NORTHWEST OF THE NORTHEAST CORNER OF A SMALL BUILDING AND 13 FEET NORTH-NORTHWEST OF THE NORTHWEST CORNER OF THE BUILDING. THE MONUMENT IS FLUSH WITH THE GROUND AND THE DISK IS STAMPED STATE FARM 1958.  REFERENCE MARK NO. 1 IS 73.93 FEET NORTHWEST OF THE STATION, 64 FEET WEST-SOUTHWEST OF THE SOUTHWEST ONE OF TWO HUGE SYCAMORE TREES AND 13 FEET NORTHWEST OF THE APPROXIMATE CENTERLINE OF THE DRIVEWAY.  THE MONUMENT PROJECTS 4 INCHES AND THE DISK IS STAMPED STATE FARM NO 1 1958.  REFERENCE MARK NO. 2 IS 80.34 FEET SOUTHWEST OF THE STATION, 18 FEET NORTHWEST OF THE APPROXIMATE CENTERLINE OF THE DRIVEWAY, 12 FEET SOUTH OF A 24-INCH LEANING WILLOW TREE AND 1 FOOT SOUTHEAST OF A STEEL WITNESS POST.  THE MONUMENT PROJECTS 4 INCHES AND THE DISK IS STAMPED STATE FARM NO 2 1958.  TO REACH THE STATION FROM THE MAIN ENTRANCE TO THE DELAWARE STATE HOSPITAL, GO NORTHERLY ON THE MAIN ROAD THROUGH THE HOSPITAL GROUNDS FOR 0.15 MILE TO A CROSS-STREET.  TURN RIGHT AND GO NORTHEASTERLY (PASSING THE POWERHOUSE ENROUTE) FOR 0.25 MILE TO A CROSSROAD.  TURN LEFT AND GO NORTHERLY ON A MACADAM STREET FOR 0.1 MILE TO A GATE IN A CHAIN LINK FENCE.  PASS THROUGH THE GATE AND CONTINUE NORTHERLY ACROSS A RAILROAD TRACK FOR 0.25 MILE TO A DRIVEWAY RIGHT AND A DUMPING AREA ON THE LEFT.  CONTINUE AHEAD FOR 0.05 MILE TO A SMALL BUILDING ON THE RIGHT AND THE STATION AS DESCRIBED.                            STATION RECOVERY (1965)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1965 1 MI N FROM FARNHURST. 0.7 MILE NORTH ALONG THE PENNSYLVANIA RAILROAD FROM OVERPASS OF U.S. HIGHWAYS 13 AND 40 OVER TRACKS AT FARNHURST, THENCE ABOUT 0.25 MILE NORTHWEST ALONG ROADS THROUGH DELAWARE STATE HOSPITAL GROUNDS, 21 FEET SOUTHEAST OF CENTERLINE OF A CINDER DRIVE, PARALLEL TO RIVER, AND LEADING TO A 2-STORY FARM HOUSE, 58 YARDS SOUTHWEST OF WEST CORNER OF HOUSE, 80.35 FEET SOUTH OF RM NO. 1, 74 FEET EAST-NORTHEAST OF RM NO. 2, 13 FEET NORTHWEST OF WEST CORNER OF A BROODER HOUSE, ABOUT LEVEL WITH CINDER DRIVE AND SET IN THE TOP OF A CONCRETE POST 1 INCH BELOW SURFACE OF GROUND. markers.description: BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 1974 (LAL) THE STATION IS LOCATED ABOUT 3 MILES WEST OF SELBYVILLE AND ON LAND OWNED BY MR. CURTIS STEEN, DAGSBORO, DELAWARE.  PERMISSION WAS GRANTED BY MR. CLIFTON MURRAY, SELBYVILLE, DELAWARE, TELEPHONE NUMBER 436-5579, MR. MURRAY LEASES THE PROPERTY.  TO REACH THE STATION FROM THE POST OFFICE IN SELBYVILLE, DELAWARE, GO SOUTHWEST ON CHURCH STREET FOR 0.6 MILE TO THE JUNCTION WITH U.S. HIGHWAY 113.  TURN LEFT AND GO SOUTH ON U.S. HIGHWAY 113 FOR 0.3 MILE TO A PAVED CROSSROAD, JUST AFTER CROSSING THE STATE LINE.  TURN RIGHT AND GO WESTERLY ON THE PAVED ROAD FOR 1.1 MILES TO A PAVED T-ROAD.  TURN RIGHT AND GO NORTHERLY ON THE PAVED ROAD FOR 1.25 MILES TO A SHARP CURVE TO THE LEFT AND A FIELD ROAD RIGHT AND REFERENCE MARK 3.  TURN RIGHT AND GO EASTERLY ON THE FIELD ROAD FOR 0.1 MILE TO A SHARP TURN TO THE LEFT.  TURN LEFT AND GO NORTHERLY ON THE FIELD ROAD FOR 0.1 MILE TO A T-FIELD ROAD.  TURN RIGHT AND GO EASTERLY ON THE FIELD ROAD FOR 0.05 MILE TO A T-DITCH AND THE STATION ON THE RIGHT.  STATION MARKS ARE STANDARD DISKS STAMPED STEEN 1974.  THE SURFACE DISK IS SET IN THE TOP OF A 12-INCH CYLINDRICAL CONCRETE MONUMENT THAT IS 2 INCHES BELOW THE GROUND SURFACE.  IT IS 6 FEET EAST-SOUTHEAST OF THE CENTER OF THE FIELD ROAD AND 6 FEET NORTH-NORTHWEST OF THE DRAINAGE DITCH.  THE UNDERGROUND DISK IS SET IN THE TOP OF AN IRREGULAR MASS OF CONCRETE 42 INCHES BELOW THE GROUND SURFACE.  REFERENCE MARK 1, A STANDARD DISK STAMPED STEEN NO 1 1974, IS SET IN THE TOP OF A 12-INCH CYLINDRICAL CONCRETE MONUMENT THAT IS FLUSH WITH THE GROUND SURFACE.  IT IS 12 FEET WEST-NORTHWEST OF THE DRAINAGE DITCH AND IN THE CENTER OF THE FIELD ROAD.  REFERENCE MARK 2, A STANDARD DISK STAMPED STEEN NO 2 1974, IS SET IN THE TOP OF A 12-INCH CYLINDRICAL CONCRETE MONUMENT THAT IS 1 INCH BELOW THE GROUND SURFACE.  IT IS 12 FEET WEST-SOUTHWEST OF THE DRAINAGE DITCH AND IN THE CENTER OF THE FIELD ROAD.  REFERENCE MARK 3, A STANDARD DISK STAMPED STEEN NO 3 1974, IS SET IN THE TOP OF A 12-INCH CYLINDRICAL CONCRETE MONUMENT THAT PROJECTS 3 INCHES ABOVE THE GROUND SURFACE.  IT IS 26 FEET NORTH OF THE CENTER OF THE PAVED ROAD, 15 FEET WEST OF THE CENTER OF THE FIELD ROAD AND 3 FEET SOUTH-SOUTHWEST OF A TELEPHONE POLE.  THE MARK SERVES AS AN AZIMUTH MARK.                            STATION RECOVERY (1976)  RECOVERY NOTE BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 1976 (CLN) THE STATION AND ALL MARKS RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION AS DESCRIBED IN 1974 DESCRIPTION.  A DIFFERENCE OF 2 MINUTES AND 22 SECONDS IN DIRECTION WAS NOTED TO REFERENCE MARK 1.  A DIFFERENCE OF 1 MINUTE AND 52 SECONDS IN DIRECTION WAS NOTED TO REFERENCE MARK 2.  THE DISTANCE TO BOTH MARKS WERE WITHIN CLOSE AGREEMENT WITH THE 1974 OBSERVATIONS.  THE MARYLAND-DELAWARE BOUNDARY MONUMENT NUMBER 13 WAS ESTABLISHED AT THIS DATE.  THE SURFACE MARK IS A MARYLAND-DELAWARE BOUNDARY DISK STAMPED E-W NO. 13 1976, SET IN THE TOP OF A 10-INCH ROUND CONCRETE MONUMENT PROJECTING 1-INCH.  THE SUB-SURFACE MARKER IS A STANDARD NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY TRIANGULATION STATION DISK STAMPED E-W NO. 13 1976, SET IN AN 8-INCH MASS OF CONCRETE 42 INCHES BELOW THE SURFACE.  THEY ARE 14.1 FEET NORTHEAST OF STEEN RM 1 1974, 11 FEET SOUTH-SOUTHWEST OF THE T-INTERSECTION IN THE DITCHES, 5 FEET EAST-NORTHEAST OF THE NORTH-SOUTH DITCH, 2 FEET EAST OF THE CENTER OF THE CENTER OF THE FIELD ROAD, AND 1 FOOT NORTHWEST OF A WITNESS POST.  AIRLINE DISTANCE AND DIRECTION FROM NEAREST TOWN 3 MILES WEST OF SELBYVILLE.

markers.description: BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1932 (CDM) STONE 2 IS ON BIG STONE BEACH ON DELAWARE BAY.  SURFACE, UNDERGROUND, AND REFERENCE MARKS ARE STANDARD BRONZE DISKS SET IN CONCRETE.  REFERENCE MARK NO.1 IS 98.24 FEET SW OF THE STATION ACROSS SANDY CONTINUATION OF ROAD AND IN THE MARSH GRASS.  REFERENCE MARK NO.2 IS 146.75 FEET W OF THE STATION ON EDGE OF N SIDE OF ROAD.  REFERENCE MARK NO.3 IS 0.25 MILE W OF THE STATION AND 24 FEET S OF CENTER LINE OF DIRT ROAD AND ABOUT 15 FEET S OF WHERE DIM ROAD LEADS OFF SE FROM DIRT ROAD.  TO REACH, LEAVE HIGHWAY 113, 4 MILES SE OF FREDERICA AT FILLING STATION WITH LIGHTHOUSE REPRODUCTION ON E SIDE OF HIGHWAY.  TURN LEFT, GO NE 3.7 MILES ON HARD SURFACED ROAD TO THOMPSONVILLE CHURCH ON E SIDE OF THE ROAD.  TURN RIGHT GO 0.1 MILE ON DIRT ROAD TURN RIGHT, STORE ON LEFT, GO 0.1 MILE, TURN LEFT, GO 1.2 MILES, TURN LEFT, GO 2.5 MILES TO BEACH.  THE STATION IS 30 METERS PAST THE END OF THE HARD SAND ROAD 50 TO 75 METERS W OF TEMPORARY HOUSES.  HEIGHT OF SIGNAL ABOVE STATION MARK - 39 METERS.                            STATION RECOVERY (1932)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1932 RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION.                            STATION RECOVERY (1933)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1933 (GLA) STONE 2 IS A BIG STONE BEACH ON DELAWARE BAY.  STATION, UNDERGROUND, AND REFERENCE MARKS ARE STANDARD DISKS SET IN CONCRETE.  REFERENCE MARK NO.1 IS 98.24 FEET SW OF THE STATION ACROSS SANDY CONTINUATION OF THE ROAD AND AT EDGE OF MARSH GRASS.  REFERENCE MARK NO.2 IS 146.75 FEET W OF THE STATION ON THE N EDGE OF THE ROAD.  REFERENCE MARK NO.3 IS 0.25 MILE W OF THE STATION, 24 FEET S OF CENTER LINE OF DIRT ROAD, AND 15 FEET S OF DIM ROAD LEADING SE.  MARKS PROJECT ABOUT 2 INCHES.  TO REACH FOLLOW ROUTE 113 4.0 MILES SE OF FREDERICA TO A MACADAM T-ROAD.  THERE IS A FILLING STATION WITH A LIGHTHOUSE REPRODUCTION ON THE E SIDE OF ROUTE 113.  FOLLOW THIS ROAD NE 3.7 MILES TO THOMPSONVILLE CHURCH WHICH IS ON E SIDE OF THE HIGHWAY.  TURN RIGHT AND GO 0.1 MILE ON GRAVEL ROAD.  TURN RIGHT AND GO 0.1 MILE.  TURN LEFT AND GO 1.2 MILES TO CROSSROADS.  TURN LEFT AND GO 2.5 MILES TO BIG STONE BEACH AND THE STATION.  THE MARK IS 30 METERS BEYOND THE END OF THE HARD SAND ROAD AND ABOUT 75 METERS W OF SEVERAL SMALL HOUSES.  A 103-FOOT TOWER WAS ERECTED.  THERE ARE SEVERAL LIGHTHOUSES VISIBLE FROM THE GROUND INCLUDING CAPE MAY LIGHTHOUSE.                            STATION RECOVERY (1956)  RECOVERY NOTE BY US GEOLOGICAL SURVEY 1956 STATION, REFERENCE MARKS 1 AND 3 WERE NOT FOUND.  REFERENCE MARK 2 WAS FOUND, BUT HAS BEEN HIT BY ROAD EQUIPMENT.                            STATION RECOVERY (1970)  RECOVERY NOTE BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 1970 (LFS) STATION WAS SEARCHED FOR BUT NO TRACE OF ANY OF THE MARKS COULD BE FOUND.  THE ROAD HAS BEEN REBUILT, SHOULDERS GRADED AND ROAD HARD SURFACED WHICH PROBABLY DESTROYED MARKS.  AIRLINE DISTANCE AND DIRECTION FROM NEAREST TOWN 3-1/2 MILES EAST OF THOMPSONVILLE.                            STATION RECOVERY (1970)  RECOVERY NOTE BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 1970 (JKW) STATION AND REFERENCE MARK 1 WERE RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION. REFERENCE MARKS 2 AND 3 WERE NOT FOUND AND ARE BELIEVED TO BE DESTROYED.  STATION IS LOCATED AT BIG STONE BEACH, 300 FEET WEST OF HIGH-WATER LINE, 135.7 FEET SOUTHWEST OF UTILITY POLE PB 103H, 127.8 FEET NORTH OF THE CENTER OF OLD OBSERVATION TOWER, 98.5 FEET NORTH OF NORTH EDGE OF FENCE AROUND OBSERVATION TOWER, 91.0 FEET NORTHWEST OF UTILITY POLE KYI-169 17-40, 88.0 FEET WEST-NORTHWEST OF THE CENTERLINE OF ROAD INTERSECTION, 69.5 FEET WEST OF THE CENTERLINE OF DIRT ROAD, 25.9 FEET NORTH OF THE CENTERLINE OF MAIN PAVED ROAD TO BEACH.  STATION IS 1.5 FEET BELOW THE SURFACE OF THE GROUND.  THE DISK IS STAMPED STONE 1932 NOT STONE 2 1932.  RM 1 IS 72.0 FEET SOUTH OF THE CENTERLINE OF MAIN PAVED ROAD TO BEACH, 27.0 FEET SOUTH OF NORTH EDGE OF TALL MARSH REEDS, 23.8 FEET WEST OF NORTHWEST CORNER OF FENCE AROUND OBSERVATION TOWER AND 1.2 FEET NORTH OF IRON PIPE DRIVEN INTO THE GROUND. THE MARK PROJECTS 0.2 FOOT AND IS STAMPED STONE NO 1 1932 - NOT STONE 2 1932.  DISTANCE TO RM 1 OF 98.24 FEET WAS VERIFIED.                            STATION RECOVERY (1973)  RECOVERY NOTE BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 1973 (LFS) A SEARCH WAS MADE FOR THE STATION BUT NO MARKS WERE FOUND.  I HAD NO ANGLES TO GO BY TO SET ON THE STATION.  THE SWAMP GRASS WAS 6 TO 8 FEET HIGH AND I COULD NOT SEE OVER IT.  THE AREA HAS A LOT OF LOOSE SAND ON IT AND IT IS POSSIBLE TO HAVE COVERED THE STATION.  HOWEVER THERE HAS BEEN A LOT OF ROAD WORK IN THE AREA ALSO.  I FEEL THE STATION IS LOST OR ELSE COVERED WITH SAND.  AIRLINE DISTANCE AND DIRECTION FROM NEAREST TOWN 2-1/2 MILES EAST OF THOMPSONVILLE.                            STATION RECOVERY (1980)  RECOVERY NOTE BY LOCAL ENGINEER (INDIVIDUAL OR FIRM) 1980 (WN) RECOVERED BY VANDEMARK LYNCH INC.  STONE 1932 GOOD - STATION AND REFERENCE  STONE NO 1 1932 GOOD - MARK DESCRIPTION BY JKW 1970 IS ADEQUATE.                            STATION RECOVERY (1980)  RECOVERY NOTE BY LOCAL ENGINEER (INDIVIDUAL OR FIRM) 1980 (WW) STONE 1932 RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION.  STONE NO 1 1932 RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION.  STATION AND REFERENCE MARK DESCRIPTION BY JKW 1970 IS ADEQUATE.                            STATION RECOVERY (1983)  RECOVERY NOTE BY NATIONAL OCEAN SERVICE 1983 THE STATION IS LOCATED AT BIG STONE BEACH ABOUT 300 FT W OF MHWL. TO REACH STATION PROCEED TO THE BIG STONE BEACH AREA. STATION MARK IS A STANDARD CGS BRONZE SURVEY DISK SUBMERGED 1.5 FT. IT IS LOCATED 38.95 M (127.8 FT) N OF CENTER OF OLD OBSERVATION TOWER, 30.023 M (98.5 FT) N OF N EDGE OF FENCE AROUND TOWER, 27.737 M (91.0 FT) NW OF UTILITY POLE KYI-169 17-40, AND 0.3 M (1.0 FT) N OF A METAL POST. TO REACH THE STATION FROM THE JUNCTION OF U.S. HIGHWAY 301 AND STATE HIGHWAY 299 IN THE WEST EDGE OF MIDDLETOWN, GO NORTH FOR 6.9 KM (4.3 MI) ON HIGHWAY 301 TO THE JUNCTION OF STATE HIGHWAY 896. THE UNDERGROUND MARK IS A STANDARD NGS DISK STAMPED ---SUMMIT 1986---, SET INTO AN IRREGULAR MASS OF CONCRETE 1.0 METERS BELOW THE SURFACE.   DESCRIBED BY C.L. SMITH, TYPED BY R.L. markers.description: BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1961 (RWT) THE STATION IS LOCATED IN DENSE WOODS AND VERY SWAMPY LAND, 2.0 MILES WEST OF HARTLY, DELAWARE, 2-1/2 MILES NORTH-NORTHEAST OF TEMPLEVILLE, MARYLAND AND ON PROPERTY OWNED BY MR. STEVE SZELESTEI.  TO REACH THE STATION FROM THE JUNCTION OF STATE HIGHWAY 44 AND 11 IN HARTLY, GO NORTHWEST ON STATE HIGHWAY 44 FOR 1.55 MILES TO A CROSSROADS, TURN LEFT, GO SOUTHWEST ON THE MAIN TRAVELED ROAD FOR 1.15 MILES TO A T-ROAD JUNCTION, TURN RIGHT FOR ABOUT 150 FEET AND THEN TURN LEFT ACROSS A CULTIVATED FIELD FOR ABOUT 150 FEET TO THE EAST EDGE OF THE WOODS AND A DIM WOODS ROAD, CONTINUE WEST ON THE WOODS ROAD FOR 0.1 MILE TO THE STATION AS DESCRIBED.  THE STATION MARK IS A STANDARD DISK STAMPED SZELESTEI 1961, SET IN TOP OF A SQUARE CONCRETE MONUMENT WHICH PROJECTS ABOUT 2 INCHES ABOVE THE GROUND SURFACE.  IT IS 8.1 FEET SOUTH-SOUTHEAST OF A STANDARD METAL WITNESS POST AND MARKER, 30.0 FEET WEST-SOUTHWEST OF A FOUR TRUNKED OAK TREE AND 45.0 FEET EAST-SOUTHEAST OF A 12-INCH TRIANGULAR BLAZED MAPLE TREE.  REFERENCE MARK 1 IS A STANDARD DISK STAMPED SZELESTEI NO 1 1961, SET IN TOP OF A SQUARE CONCRETE MONUMENT WHICH PROJECTS 4 INCHES ABOVE THE GROUND SURFACE.  IT IS 71.6 FEET NORTH-NORTHEAST OF THE WITNESS POST AND 72.6 FEET NORTH-NORTHWEST OF THE FOUR TRUNKED OAK TREE.  REFERENCE MARK 2 IS A STANDARD DISK STAMPED SZELESTEI NO 2 1961, SET IN TOP OF A SQUARE CONCRETE MONUMENT WHICH PROJECTS 3 INCHES ABOVE THE GROUND SURFACE.  IT IS 78.0 FEET SOUTH-SOUTHEAST OF THE FOUR TRUNKED OAK TREE AND 93.2 FEET SOUTHEAST OF THE WITNESS POST.  REFERENCE MARK 3 IS A STANDARD DISK STAMPED SZELESTEI NO 3 1961, SET IN TOP OF A SQUARE CONCRETE MONUMENT WHICH PROJECTS 2 INCHES ABOVE THE GROUND SURFACE.  IT IS 2.5 FEET WEST OF THE WITNESS POST AND 55.0 FEET SOUTH OF THE APPROXIMATE CENTER OF THE WOODS ROAD.  BOUNDARY MONUMENT NO. 49 WAS RECOVERED BROKEN OR ERODED OFF WITH THE TOP PORTION LYING IN A PRONE POSITION.  THE REMAINING BASE IS BADLY ERODED.  THE TOP IS IN EXCELLENT CONDITION.  THE POINT MEASURED TO AND OBSERVED TO WAS A CROSS MARK SCRIBED IN THE FOUNDATION OF THE MONUMENT.  THE FOUNDATION IS LOCATED 35.0 FEET WEST-NORTHWEST OF A 12-INCH TRIANGULAR BLAZED MAPLE TREE AND 74.6 FEET WEST OF A STANDARD METAL WITNESS AND MARKER.  HEIGHT OF LIGHT ABOVE STATION MARK 29.88 METERS.                            STATION RECOVERY (2007)  RECOVERY NOTE BY GEOCACHING 2007 (WD) FOUND THE STATION IN A HEAVILY WOODED AREA.  SEARCHED FOR BUT COULD NOT FIND ANY OF THE REFERENCE MARKS.  TO REACH FROM THE INTERSECTION OF US HIGHWAY 301 AND MARYLAND STATE HIGHWAY 300 (SUDLERSVILLE ROAD), GO EASTERLY ON MD STATE HIGHWAY 300 FOR ABOUT 8.5 MILES TO THE INTERSECTION WITH ANDERSON CORNER ROAD.  TURN RIGHT AND GO SOUTHEAST ON ANDERSON CORNER ROAD FOR ABOUT 1.5 MILES TO THE STATE BOUNDARY LINE.  CONTINUE SOUTHEAST, NOW ON BUTTERPAT ROAD, FOR ABOUT 0.6 MILES TO THE SZELESTEI FARM ON THE RIGHT.  FROM THE NORTHWEST CORNER OF THE FARM YARD, PACK WEST FOR ABOUT 80 FEET TO AN EARTHEN CROSS-OVER OF AN EAST-WEST DRAINAGE DITCH.  TURN RIGHT AND PACK NORTH ALONG THE WEST SIDE OF A NORTH-SOUTH DRAINAGE DITCH FOR ABOUT 0.1 MILES TO A DIM TRACK ROAD LEADING WEST.  TURN LEFT AND PACK WESTERLY ALONG THE DIM TRACK ROAD FOR ABOUT 170 FEET TO THE STATION.

markers.description: BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1909 (ES) THIS STATION IS ON WHAT IS KNOWN AS THOMPSONS ISLAND THOUGH IT IS NOT NOW AN ISLAND.  IT IS BETWEEN THE CANAL AND NE PART OF REHOBOTH BAY.  IT IS NOT ON HIGHEST POINT, BUT ON A HILL N OF HIGHEST.  STATION IS MARKED WITH COPPER TRIANGULATION STATION MARK SET IN CEMENT 3 FEET BELOW SURFACE AND ABOVE THIS A CEMENT BLOCK IN WHICH IS SET A COPPER TRIANGULATION STATION MARK FASTENED IN 1-INCH GALVANIZED-IRON PIPE 18 INCHES LONG.  REFERENCE MARK NO. 1 IS CEMENT POST WITH BOTTLE TO MARK CENTER AND IS TO W.  REFERENCE MARK NO. 2 IS CEMENT POST WITH CIRCLE AND NAIL TO MARK CENTER AND IS TO N.                            STATION RECOVERY (1932)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1932 (ERM) STATION RECOVERED, MARK AND REFERENCES IN GOOD CONDITION.  TO REACH, GO OUT CANAL ROAD, THROUGH FARM.                            STATION RECOVERY (1934)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1934 (JCT) STATION AND REFERENCE MARKS RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION.  ORIGINAL DESCRIPTION REVISED TO READ AS FOLLOWS--ON THOMPSON ISLAND AT THE NE CORNER OF REHOBOTH BAY AND E OF THE ENTRANCE TO THE LEWES AND REHOBOTH CANAL.  THE ISLAND IS CONNECTED WITH THE MAINLAND BY THE SPOIL BANK ON THE E SIDE OF THE CANAL.  THE STATION AND REFERENCE MARKS ARE SET ON THE MOST NORTHERLY HILL ON THE ISLAND IN OPEN GRASS-COVERED GROUND, WHICH WAS ONCE CULTIVATED.  SURFACE AND UNDERGROUND MARKS ARE STANDARD BRONZE DISKS SET IN CONCRETE.  REFERENCE MARK NO. 1 IS A CONCRETE POST WITH GLASS BOTTLE MARKING CENTER.  REFERENCE MARK NO. 2 IS A CONCRETE POST WITH CIRCLE AND NAIL MARKING CENTER. REFERENCE MARK 1 IS 13.670 METERS (44.85 FEET) NW OF THE STATION.  2.  REFERENCE MARK 2 IS 14.100 METERS (46.26 FEET) NE OF THE STATION. markers.description: BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1958 (JCE) STATION IS LOCATED ABOUT 1.6 MILES NORTH OF CHRISTIANA, ABOUT 2-1/2 MILES SOUTHWEST OF NEWPORT AND ABOUT 1.0 MILE SOUTH OF DELAWARE PARK.  STATION IS 58 FEET WEST OF FENCELINE, 86 FEET SOUTH-SOUTHWEST OF SOUTHWEST CORNER OF POULTRY HOUSE AND 90 FEET WEST-NORTHWEST OF NORTHWEST CORNER OF BARN.  THE MARK IS A STANDARD STATION DISK SET IN A CONCRETE CYLINDER WHICH IS ABOUT 1.5 FEET BELOW THE SURFACE OF GROUND AND THE DISK IS STAMPED TIANA 1958.  REFERENCE MARK NO. 1 IS 26-1/2 FEET SOUTH OF SOUTHWEST CORNER OF POULTRY HOUSE AND 1-1/2 FEET WEST OF FENCELINE.  THE MARK IS A STANDARD REFERENCE DISK SET IN A 12X12 INCH CONCRETE MONUMENT, FLUSH WITH THE GROUND AND THE DISK IS STAMPED TIANA NO 1 1958.  REFERENCE MARK NO. 2 IS 16 FEET WEST OF THE SOUTHWEST CORNER OF A CONCRETE BLOCK MILK HOUSE AND 1-1/2 FEET WEST OF FENCELINE.  THE MARK IS A STANDARD REFERENCE DISK SET IN A 12X12 INCH CONCRETE MONUMENT, FLUSH WITH THE GROUND AND THE DISK IS STAMPED TIANA NO 2 1958.  DELAWARE PARK, WATER TANK IS VISIBLE FROM GROUND AND WAS USED AS AZIMUTH MARK.  TO REACH FROM THE SIGNAL LIGHT AT THE MAIN INTERSECTION IN CHRISTIANA, GO NORTHERLY ON STATE HIGHWAY NO. 7 FOR 1.65 MILE TO INTERSECTION OF CHURCHMANS ROAD.  TURN LEFT AND GO WESTERLY ON CHURCHMANS ROAD FOR 0.15 MILE TO FARM DRIVEWAY ON LEFT (SOUTH) SIDE OF ROAD.  TURN LEFT AND GO SOUTHWESTERLY ON DRIVEWAY FOR 0.05 MILE TO BARN.  TURN RIGHT AND GO WEST-NORTHWEST FOR 90 FEET TO STATION AS DESCRIBED.  HEIGHT OF LIGHT ABOVE STATION MARK 30 METERS. markers.description: BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 1974 (LAL) NO MEASUREMENT BETWEEN RMS DUE TO HEAVY TRAFFIC.  THE STATION IS LOCATED ABOUT 5.0 MILES NORTHWEST OF PARSONSBURY, MARYLAND, 3.7 MILES EAST OF DELMAR, 2.6 MILES SOUTHWEST OF WARD, DELAWARE AND ON LAND OWNED BY MR. PRESTON TOWNSEND, MILLSBURY, DELAWARE.  TO REACH THE STATION FROM THE JUNCTION OF U.S. HIGHWAY 13 AND STATE ROAD 54 AT THE EAST EDGE OF DELMAR, GO EAST ON STATE ROAD 54 FOR 1.8 MILES TO A PAVED SIDE ROAD RIGHT AND REFERENCE MARK 3 ON THE RIGHT, CONTINUE EAST ON STATE ROAD 54 FOR 0.5 MILE TO A PAVED SIDE ROAD LEFT AND THE STATION IN THE NORTHWEST ANGLE OF THE PAVED ROAD AND STATE ROAD 54.  STATION MARKS ARE STANDARD DISKS STAMPED TOWNSEND 1974.  THE SURFACE DISK IS SET IN THE TOP OF A 12-INCH CYLINDRICAL CONCRETE MONUMENT THAT IS 18 INCHES BELOW THE GROUND SURFACE.  IT IS 88 FEET WEST OF THE CENTER OF THE PAVED ROAD, 53 FEET NORTH OF THE CENTERLINE OF STATE ROAD 54, 31 FEET NORTHEAST OF TELEPHONE POLE NUMBER 623-85 AND 29 FEET WEST-NORTHWEST OF A TELEPHONE POLE.  THE UNDERGROUND DISK IS SET IN THE TOP OF AN IRREGULAR MASS OF CONCRETE 40 INCHES BELOW THE GROUND SURFACE.  REFERENCE MARK 1, A STANDARD DISK STAMPED TOWNSEND NO 1 1974, IS SET IN THE TOP OF A 12-INCH CYLINDRICAL CONCRETE MONUMENT THAT IS FLUSH WITH THE GROUND SURFACE.  IT IS 70 FEET NORTH OF THE CENTERLINE OF STATE ROAD 54, 23 FEET EAST-SOUTHEAST OF THE CENTER OF THE PAVED ROAD AND 4 FEET SOUTHWEST OF POWERLINE POLE NUMBER 2D.  REFERENCE MARK 2, A STANDARD DISK STAMPED TOWNSEND NO 2 1974, IS SET IN THE TOP OF A 12-INCH CYLINDRICAL CONCRETE MONUMENT THAT IS FLUSH WITH THE GROUND SURFACE.  IT IS 43 FEET SOUTH-SOUTHWEST OF THE CENTERLINE OF STATE ROAD 54, 23 FEET EAST OF THE CENTER OF RUM RIDGE ROAD AND 2 FEET NORTH-NORTHEAST OF RUM RIDGE ROAD SIGN.  REFERENCE MARK 3, A STANDARD DISK STAMPED ANDREWS NO 3 1974, IS SET IN THE TOP OF A 12-INCH CYLINDRICAL CONCRETE MONUMENT THAT IS FLUSH WITH THE GROUND SURFACE.  IT IS 53 FEET EAST OF THE CENTER OF MELSON ROAD, 27 FEET SOUTH OF THE CENTERLINE OF STATE ROAD 54, 8 FEET NORTHWEST OF POWERLINE POLE NUMBER 48B-10 AND 4 FEET EAST-SOUTHEAST OF MELSON ROAD SIGN.  THE MARK SERVES AS AN AZIMUTH MARK.  BOUNDARY MONUMENT 25, IS AN IRON PIN SET IN AN IRREGULAR MASS OF CONCRETE 18 INCHES BELOW THE GROUND SURFACE.  IT IS 13.8 FEET NORTH OF THE OLD BOUNDARY MONUMENT, WHICH WAS OFFSET WHEN THE HIGHWAY WAS UNDER CONSTRUCTION AND 9 FEET SOUTH OF THE CENTERLINE OF STATE ROAD 54.  BOUNDARY MONUMENT 25 OFFSET, A 6 BY 10 INCH GRANITE MONUMENT THAT PROJECTS 2 FEET ABOVE THE GROUND SURFACE.  IT IS 22.8 FEET SOUTH OF THE CENTERLINE OF STATE ROAD 54 AND 13.8 FEET SOUTH OF BOUNDARY MONUMENT 25.  HEIGHT OF LIGHT ABOVE STATION MARK 34.89 METERS.                            STATION RECOVERY (1974)  RECOVERY NOTE BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 1974 RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION.                            STATION RECOVERY (1976)  RECOVERY NOTE BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 1976 (CLN) THE STATION AND ALL MARKS WERE RECOVERED AND FOUND IN GOOD CONDITION AS PREVIOUSLY DESCRIBED.  AIRLINE DISTANCE AND DIRECTION FROM NEAREST TOWN 3-1/2 MILES EAST OF DELMAR. markers.description: BY DE-PA BOUNDARY COMM 1986 (JDR) THE STATION IS LOCATED NEAR THE PENNSYLVANIA-DELAWARE STATE LINE, IN A PASTURE ON A FARM WHOSE OWNER IS NOT KNOWN.  IT IS ABOUT 1 MILE NORTH OF THE DUPONT MANSION AND 100 FEET SOUTHEAST OF A SMALL LAKE.  A DELAWARE-PENNSYLVANIA BOUNDARY COMMISSION SURVEY DISK SET IN TOP OF A 12 INCH SQUARE CONCRETE POST THAT IS FLUSH WITH THE GROUND.  IT IS 61.5 FEET SOUTHEAST OF A FENCE CORNER, 56.4 FEET NORTHWEST OF A FENCE CORNER, 19.0 FEET NORTHWEST OF THE CENTER OF A METAL GATE AND 2.7 FEET SOUTHWEST OF A RAIL FENCE AND POST.  THE DISK IS STAMPED--- GPS TRIG E 1986---.  TO REACH FROM THE INTERSECTION OF DELAWARE STATE HIGHWAYS 92 AND 100, GO NORTH ON HIGHWAY 100 FOR 1.65 MILES TO CROSSROADS.  TURN RIGHT IN A NORTHEAST DIRECTION FOR 0.25 MILE TO A LARGE STONE WATER TOWER ON THE RIGHT AND A NARROW PAVED ROAD ON THE LEFT.  TURN LEFT AND GO NORTH AND NORTHEAST ON A NARROW PAVED ROAD FOR 1.2 MILES TO A LARGE WHITE BARN ON THE RIGHT.  TURN RIGHT DOWN DRIVEWAY FOR ABOUT 130 FEET TO A METAL GATE.  PASS THROUGH A GATE, THEN AHEAD THROUGH BARN LOT FOR 150 FEET TO A METAL GATE. markers.description: BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1909 (ES) IT WAS FOUND THAT THE TUNNEL E CHIMNEY COULD NOT BE SEEN FROM THE HOTEL TOWER AND SO A POLE 77 FEET HIGH SW FROM THE OLD HOUSE WAS SET.  THIS POLE WAS SUPPORTED BY TWO SETS OF THREE IRON GUYS, THE TOP SET BEING 11 FEET FROM TOP OF POLE AND WAS THE POINT OBSERVED UPON.  WHEN OBSERVATIONS WERE COMPLETED THE STATION WAS MARKED WITH A COPPER TRIANGULATION-STATION MARK SET IN CEMENT 3 FEET BELOW SURFACE.  THIS POINT IS SOUTHEASTERLY FROM THE WELL AND WESTERLY FROM A WALNUT TREE.  REFERENCE MARK NO. 1 IS SQUARE CEMENT POST WITH BOTTLE TO MARK CENTER AT SE CORNER OF HOUSE.  REFERENCE MARK NO. 2 IS ROUND CEMENT POST WITH NAIL FOR CENTER AT NW CORNER OF THE HOUSE.  THIS PROPERTY IS OWNED BY DAVID DAISY AND OCCUPIED BY ROBERT COOPER.  IT IS BEST REACHED BY ROAD FROM OCEAN VIEW, DELAWARE.  THE FARM IS GENERALLY KNOWN AS THE HARRY TUNNEL PROPERTY.  IN NOVEMBER A 50-FOOT TRIPOD AND SCAFFOLD SIGNAL WAS BUILT IN ORDER TO SEE THE BETHEL CHURCH SPIRE AND THE HOTEL TOWER.  THE LEAVES WERE WELL OFF THE TREES AND HAD THEY NOT BEEN IT WOULD HAVE REQUIRED AN 80-FOOT SIGNAL TO SEE THE BETHEL CHURCH OR THE CUTTING OF SEVERAL LARGE TREES ABOUT MIDWAY ON THE LINE.  WHILE THE SIGNAL WAS BEING BUILT, SEARCH WAS MADE FOR THE OLD STATION TUNNEL.  AN AREA OF 30 BY 50 FEET WAS DUG OVER AND NO MARKS WERE FOUND AND NO INDICATIONS THAT THE SUBSOIL HAD EVER BEEN DISTURBED.                            STATION RECOVERY (1934)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1934 (JCT) THE STATION MARK COULD NOT BE LOCATED BY THIS PARTY, DUE TO FAILURE TO RECOVER REFERENCE MARK NO. 1, BUT IT IS PROBABLY IN PLACE AND RECOVERABLE BY USE OF A PLANETABLE OR OTHER MEANS FOR RECOVERING THE EXACT LOCATION OF THE MARK.  A LARGE AREA WAS DUG OVER BUT THE MARK WAS NOT FOUND.  THE OLD TUNNEL HOUSE MENTIONED IN THE ORIGINAL DESCRIPTION BURNED DOWN YEARS AGO, AND ANOTHER HOUSE HAS SINCE BEEN BUILT APPROXIMATELY ON THE SAME SITE.  REFERENCE MARK NO. 2 WAS RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION NEAR THE NW CORNER OF THE PRESENT HOUSE.  REFERENCE MARK NO. 1 WAS NOT RECOVERED, BUT IS BELIEVED TO BE UNDER THE HOUSE WHICH IS VERY LOW TO THE GROUND.  THE WALNUT TREE MENTIONED IN THE ORIGINAL DESCRIPTION HAS BEEN DESTROYED.  THE HOUSE AT PRESENT IS UNOCCUPIED.                            STATION RECOVERY (1943)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1943 (FLG) STATION AND REFERENCE MARKS WERE RECOVERED AS DESCRIBED BY E.S. IN 1909 AND IN GOOD CONDITION.  REFERENCE MARK 1 IS NOW 18.030 M. (59.15 FT.) NE OF THE STATION.  REFERENCE MARK 2 IS NOW 11.651 M. (38.22 FT.) N OF THE STATION.                            STATION RECOVERY (1958)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1958 (JAW) STATION WAS RECOVERED AS DESCRIBED IN BOOK 377 PAGE 7.  THE STATION AND REFERENCE MARKS WERE FOUND IN GOOD CONDITION.  THE OLD MARK WAS FOUND ABOUT 2-1/2 FT.  UNDERGROUND, BRICKS FROM THE OLD CHIMNEY IN THE HOUSE WERE LAYED OVER THE TOP OF THE STATION SO THAT THE STATION COULD BE FOUND WITH A PRODDING BAR.  THE BRICKS SHOULD BE HIT ABOUT 1 FT. BELOW THE SURFACE.  BOTH REFERENCE MARKS WERE FOUND AS DESCRIBED EACH BEING 1 FT. FROM THE CORNERS OF THE OLD HOUSE AND ARE FLUSH OR JUST UNDER THE SOD.  BOTH THE NAIL AND THE TOP OF THE BOTTLE ARE EASY TO IDENTIFY.  A NEW MEASUREMENT OF 26.5 FT. SW OF THE SW CORNER OF THE OLD HOUSE MIGHT HELP TO LOCATE THE STATION MARK HOWEVER THE OLD HOUSE IS ABOUT TO FALL DOWN AND IT WONT BE THERE MUCH LONGER.  THE MEASUREMENTS TO THE RMS DESCRIBED CHECKED.  REACHED FROM THE JCT. OF ROUTES 14 AND 26 IN BETHANY BEACH AS FOLLOWS--GO W. ON 14 0.2 MILE TURN LEFT, S, AT THE BETHANY BEACH P O, GO 1.3 MILES TO WOODEN BRIDGE OVER THE ASSAWOMAN CANAL, CONTINUE OVER BRIDGE 0.1 MILE AND TURN LEFT, S, ON A SAND ROAD AND GO 0.75 MILE TO A TRIANGLE BLAZE ON TWIN PINE AT EDGE OF WOODS AT AN OLD WOODS ROAD.  WE LEFT TRUCK HERE AND WALKED ABOUT 1/2 MILE BACK TO THE OLD HOUSE AND STATION.  A TRUCK MIGHT BE DRIVEN TO THE STATION BY CLEARING THE OLD WOODS ROAD BUT A SMALL BRIDGE IS OUT AND IT WOULD BE A HARD CROSSING.  FOLLOW WOODS ROAD AND TURN LEFT AT A FORKS AND CONTINUE TO THE OLD HOUSE AND STATION.                            STATION RECOVERY (1961)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1961 (ETJ) STATION WAS RECOVERED AS DESCRIBED AND ALL MARKS FOUND IN GOOD CONDITION.  THE DESCRIPTION IS ADEQUATE, EXCEPT FOR THE FOLLOWING--THE STATION IS ABOUT 1600 FT. SOUTH OF ROAD FROM TRIANGULAR BLAZED PINE TREE.                            STATION RECOVERY (1961)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1961 (RMS) STATION MARK AND REFERENCE MARKS WERE RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION AS DESCRIBED BY J.A.W. IN 1958.  THE DISTANCES TO THE REFERENCE MARKS WERE VERIFIED.  REFERENCE MARK NO. 1 WAS LOCATED AT GROUND LEVEL AT THE S.E. CORNER OF THE HOUSE AND REFERENCE MARK NO. 2 WAS RECOVERED AT GROUND LEVEL AT THE N.W. CORNER OF THE HOUSE.  STATION IS 8.8 METERS SOUTHWEST FROM CENTER OF WELL ON SOUTH SIDE OF HOUSE.                            STATION RECOVERY (1962)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1962 (RWT) THE STATION, REFERENCE MARKS 1 AND 2 WERE RECOVERED AND FOUND TO BE IN GOOD CONDITION.  A REFERENCE MARK 3 WAS SET AT THIS DATE.  NOTE--A NEW TO REACH FOLLOWS--  TO REACH THE STATION FROM THE JUNCTIONS OF STATE HIGHWAY 14 AND STATE HIGHWAY 26 IN BETHANY BEACH, GO WEST ON STATE HIGHWAY 14 FOR 0.2 MILE TO A SIDE ROAD LEFT AT THE BETHANY BEACH POST OFFICE, TURN LEFT AND GO SOUTHERLY FOR 1.3 MILES TO A WOODEN BRIDGE OVER THE ASSAWOMAN CANAL, CONTINUE OVER BRIDGE FOR 0.1 MILE TO A SIDE ROAD LEFT, TURN LEFT AND GO SOUTHWESTERLY ON ASPHALT ROAD FOR 0.85 MILE TO A TRIANGULAR BLAZE ON A TWIN PINE AT THE EDGE OF THE WOODS AND SIDE ROAD LEFT, TURN LEFT AND GO SOUTHEAST ON TRACK ROAD FOR 0.2 MILE TO A BRIDGE, CONTINUE ON TRACK ROAD FOR 0.2 MILE TO A BRIDGE, CONTINUE ON TRACK ROAD FOR 0.15 MILE TO THE OLD HOUSE AND THE STATION AS DESCRIBED.  STATION IS A STANDARD DISK SET IN THE TOP OF A 12-INCH CONCRETE CYLINDER WHICH IS 18 INCHES BELOW THE SURFACE OF THE GROUND, STAMPED TUNNEL 2 1909.  IT IS 67.2 FEET SOUTHEAST OF A 15-INCH TRIANGULAR BLAZED PINE TREE, 26.6 FEET SOUTHWEST OF THE SOUTHWEST CORNER OF OLD BUILDING AND 3.7 FEET SOUTH OF STANDARD METAL WITNESS POST AND MARKER.  REFERENCE MARK 1 IS A SQUARE 12 X 12 INCH CEMENT MONUMENT WITH A BOTTLE SET IN THE CENTER FOR THE MARK WHICH IS ABOUT 1-INCH BELOW THE SURFACE OF THE GROUND.  IT IS 56.6 FEET SOUTHWEST OF A STANDARD METAL WITNESS POST AND MARKER AND 1.5 FEET SOUTHEAST OF THE CORNER OF THE BUILDING.  REFERENCE MARK 2 IS A ROUND CONCRETE MONUMENT WITH A NAIL SET IN THE CENTER FOR THE MARK WHICH IS FLUSH WITH THE SURFACE OF THE GROUND.  IT IS 66.4 FEET EAST OF A 15-INCH TRIANGULAR BLAZED PINE TREE, 34.6 FEET NORTH OF A STANDARD METAL WITNESS POST AND MARKER AND 7.5 FEET SOUTHWEST OF THE CORNER OF THE OLD BUILDING.  REFERENCE MARK 3 IS A STANDARD DISK SET IN THE TOP OF A 10 X 10 INCH CONCRETE MONUMENT WHICH PROJECTS ABOUT 1-INCH ABOVE THE SURFACE OF THE GROUND, STAMPED TUNNEL 2 1909 1962 NO 3.  IT IS 19.2 FEET NORTHWEST OF A 15-INCH TRIANGULAR BLAZED PINE TREE AND 3.5 FEET NORTH-NORTHWEST OF A STANDARD METAL WITNESS POST AND MARKER.  HEIGHT OF LIGHT ABOVE STATION MARK 26 METERS.

markers.description: BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1932 (CDM) AT UNION PUBLIC SCHOOL 2.55 MILES W OF FREDERICA, ON THE N SIDE OF HIGHWAY FROM FREDERICA TO FELTON.  STATION IS LOCATED IN BACK OF THE SCHOOL PLAYGROUND NEAR THE PROPERTY LINE OF STATE AND MR. ROBERT CLARK, 13.5 FEET S OF THE WIRE FENCE MARKING THE PROPERTY LINE, 115 FEET E OF THE NW CORNER OF SAME FENCE.  SURFACE, UNDERGROUND, AND REFERENCE MARKS ARE STANDARD BRONZE DISKS SET IN CONCRETE.  REFERENCE MARK NO.1 IS 114.03 FEET E OF THE STATION AND 100 FEET INSIDE OR S SIDE OF THE FENCE AT THE BACK OF THE SCHOOL LOT.  REFERENCE MARK NO.2 IS 155.14 FEET WSW OF THE STATION AND 0.6 FOOT E OF THE FENCE ON THE W SIDE OF THE SCHOOL LOT.  REFERENCE MARK NO.3 IS 0.6 MILE W OF THE STATION, 5 PACES N OF E AND W CONCRETE HIGHWAY AND ABOUT 20 INCHES NNE OF TELEPHONE POLE AND 6 FEET FROM NW DRAINAGE DITCH.  HEIGHT OF SIGNAL ABOVE STATION MARK - 39 METERS.                            STATION RECOVERY (1967)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1967 (JCB) STATION AND REFERENCE MARKS 1 AND 2 WERE RECOVERED AS DESCRIBED AND FOUND TO BE IN GOOD CONDITION.  REFERENCE MARK NO. 3 (AZIMUTH MARK) HAD BEEN DESTROYED BY HIGHWAY IMPROVEMENTS.  THE OBJECTS LISTED IN THE DESCRIPTION ARE NO LONGER VISIBLE FROM THE GROUND.  THE ORIGINAL DESCRIPTION IS ADEQUATE FOR RECOVERY.  AIRLINE DISTANCE AND DIRECTION FROM NEAREST TOWN 2-1/2 MILES WEST OF FREDERICA.                            STATION RECOVERY (1969)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1969 (JKW) STATION MARK AND R.M. 2 WERE RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION.  R.M. 1 WAS NOT FOUND DUE TO A NEARBY NEST OF YELLOW JACKETS.  IT IS BELIEVED TO BE INTACT.  THE DISTANCE TO R.M. 2 WAS VERIFIED.  THE ORIGINAL DESCRIPTION IS ADEQUATE WITH THE FOLLOWING ADDITIONS--R.M. 2 IS 117.0 FEET NORTHWEST OF THE NORTHWEST CORNER OF ABANDONED SCHOOL BUILDING.  BOTH MARKS PROJECT 2 INCHES.  THE AZIMUTH MARK WAS REPORTED LOST IN PRIOR RECOVERY NOTES.                            STATION RECOVERY (1973)  RECOVERY NOTE BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 1973 (LFS) THE STATION MARK AND REFERENCE MARK TWO WERE RECOVERED AND FOUND IN GOOD CONDITION.  REFERENCE MARK ONE WAS NOT FOUND.  IT IS BELIEVED THAT REFERENCE MARK ONE IS STILL INTACT BUT IN HEAVY BRUSH.  I LOOKED FOR IT AS LONG AS TIME WOULD PERMIT.  THE AZIMUTH MARK WAS SEARCHED FOR BUT NOT FOUND.  IT IS BELIEVED DESTROYED BY THE CONSTRUCTION OF A PIPE LINE.  TWO NEW REFERENCE MARKS WERE ESTABLISHED AT THIS DATE.  THE OLD REFERENCE MARK IS VERY CLOSE TO A CULTIVATED FIELD AND IS IN DANGER OF BEING DESTROYED IN THE FUTURE.  A COMPLETE NEW DESCRIPTION OF THE STATION FOLLOWS.  THE STATION IS LOCATED ABOUT 15 AIRLINE MILES SOUTH OF DOVER, 6 MILES EAST OF FELTON AND ABOUT 2 MILES WEST OF FREDERICA.  IT IS ON THE NORTH SIDE OF A OLD SCHOOL AND ON STATE OWNED PROPERTY.  TO REACH FROM THE FIRE STATION IN FREDERICA, GO WEST ON STATE HIGHWAY 12 (FRONE STREET) FOR 2.1 MILES TO THE OLD SCHOOL HOUSE ON THE RIGHT AND THE STATION.  THE STATION MARK IS A STANDARD DISK STAMPED UNION 1932, SET IN THE TOP OF A 12-INCH SQUARE CONCRETE MONUMENT WHICH PROJECTS 4 INCHES.  IT IS 200 FEET NORTH OF THE NORTH EDGE OF THE OLD SCHOOL HOUSE, 15 FEET SOUTH OF A WOODED FENCE LINE AND 1.5 FEET SOUTHWEST OF A WITNESS POST.  REFERENCE MARK TWO IS A STANDARD DISK STAMPED UNION NO 2 1932, SET IN THE TOP OF A 12-INCH SQUARE CONCRETE MONUMENT WHICH IS FLUSH WITH THE SURFACE.  IT IS IN THE NORTH-SOUTH FENCE LINE AT THE WEST BOUNDRY LINE OF THE SCHOOL GROUNDS.  IT IS 155 FEET SOUTHWEST OF THE WITNESS POST, 100 FEET SOUTH OF THE NORTHWEST CORNER OF THE WOODED FENCE LINE AND FEET NORTHWEST OF THE NORTH SIDE OF THE OLD SCHOOL HOUSE.  REFERENCE MARK 4 IS A STANDARD DISK STAMPED UNION 1932 NO 4 1973, SET IN THE TOP OF A 10-INCH ROUND CONCRETE MONUMENT WHICH IS FLUSH WITH THE SURFACE.  IT IS 205 FEET NORTH OF THE NORTH SIDE OF THE OLD SCHOOL HOUSE, 22.7 FEET EAST OF THE WITNESS POST AND 10 FEET SOUTH OF THE WOODED FENCE LINE.  REFERENCE MARK FIVE IS A STANDARD DISK STAMPED UNION 1932 NO 5 1973, SET IN THE TOP OF A 10-INCH ROUND CONCRETE MONUMENT WHICH IS FLUSH WITH THE SURFACE.  IT IS 205 FEET NORTH OF THE NORTH SIDE OF THE OLD SCHOOL HOUSE, 32.5 FEET WEST OF THE WITNESS POST AND 10 FEET SOUTH OF THE WOODED FENCE LINE.  AIRLINE DISTANCE AND DIRECTION FROM NEAREST TOWN 2 MILES WEST OF FREDERICA.                            STATION RECOVERY (1982)  RECOVERY NOTE BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 1982 (CLN) THE STATION MARK, REFERENCE MARKS FOUR AND FIVE WERE RECOVERED AND FOUND IN GOOD CONDITION.  REFERENCE MARK ONE WAS FOUND IN FAIR CONDITION AFTER A VERY EXTENSIVE SEARCH.  IT WAS COVERED WITH GARBAGE AND DIRT.  REFERENCE MARK TWO WAS ALSO FOUND IN FAIR CONDITION BUT A CHAIN LINK FENCE HAS BEEN BUILT DIRECTLY OVER THE CENTER OF THE DISK. THE AZIMUTH MARK WAS SEARCHED FOR BUT NOT FOUND.  A NEW AZIMUTH MARK NUMBER TWO WAS ESTABLISHED.  A SHORTER DISTANCE OF 0.02 FT (0.61 CM) OR 0.006 METERS (0.020 FT) WAS NOTED TO REFERENCE MARK TWO.  A LONGER DISTANCE OF 0.02 FT (0.61 CM) OR 0.005 METER (0.016 FT) WAS NOTED TO REFERENCE MARK FOUR.  A LONGER DISTANCE OF 0.01 FT (0.30 CM) OR 0.004 METER (0.013 FT) WAS NOTED TO REFERENCE MARK FIVE.  THE ANGLES TO ALL OF THE MARKS WERE WITHIN CLOSE AGREEMENT WITH THE MOST RECENT INFORMATION AVAILABLE.  THE OLD SCHOOL IS NOW OWNED BY THE UNITED CEREBAL PALSEY AND IT HAS BEEN REBUILT INTO A CHILDRENS CAMP.  THERE ARE NOW NUMEROUS CAMPING FACILITIES AND PLAY GROUND EQUIPMENT IN THE AREA OF THE STATION.  THE STATION IS LOCATED ABOUT 12.9 KM (8.00 MI) NORTH-NORTHWEST OF MILFORD, 4.0 KM (2.50 MI) EAST OF FELTON AND 4.0 KM (2.50 MI) WEST OF FREDERICA. OWNERSHIP--UNITED CEBERAL PALSEY, CAMP LENAPA.  TO REACH THE STATION FROM THE FIRE STATION IN FREDERICA WHICH IS ABOUT 50 METERS (164.0 FT) NORTH FROM THE POST OFFICE AND AT THE INTERSECTION OF BUSINESS ROUTE U.S HIGHWAY 113 AND STATE HIGHWAY 12, GO WEST ON STATE HIGHWAY 12 FOR 4.2 KM (2.60 MI) TO THE STATION ON THE RIGHT, BEHIND THE CAMP LENAPA OFFICE BUILDING.  THE STATION IS A STANDARD CGS DISK STAMPED,---UNION 1932---.  SET INTO THE TOP OF A SQUARE CONCRETE MONUMENT, 12 INCHES, 30 CM IN DIAMETER/ON SIDE, PROJECTION 2 INCHES 5 CM ABOVE/BELOW THE GROUND.  THE STATION IS LOCATED 92.2 METERS (302.5 FT) NORTH FROM THE CENTER OF STATE HIGHWAY 12, 61.4 METERS (201.4 FT) NORTH FROM THE NORTHEAST CORNER OF THE BUILDING, 19.8 METERS (65.0 FT) NORTHWEST FROM THE WEST CORNER OF A PAVILION NAMED DELAWARE, 17.4 METERS (57.1 FT) NORTH FROM THE NORTHEAST CORNER OF A PAVILION NAMED MARMOT AND 0.3 METERS (1.0 FT) WEST FROM A WITNESS POST.                            STATION RECOVERY (2021)  RECOVERY NOTE BY US POWER SQUADRON 2021 (DLT) NO WITNESS POST.  PAVILIONS ARE NOW UNNAMED, BUT MARMOT IS THE NORTH PAVILION AND DELAWARE IS SOUTH OF IT.

markers.stability: MAY HOLD, BUT OF TYPE COMMONLY SUBJECT TOSURFACE MOTION

markers.description: BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1961 (RWT) THE STATION IS LOCATED ABOUT 2.0 MILES SOUTH OF MARYDEL, DELAWARE, 1.5 MILES NORTHEAST OF HENDERSON, MARYLAND AND ON PROPERTY OWNED BY MR. WM E. VANEERDE.  TO REACH THE STATION FROM THE ROAD SOUTH OF THE RAILROAD STATION IN MARYDEL.  GO SOUTH-SOUTHEAST ON A BLACKTOP ROAD FOR 1.0 MILE TO A FORK.  TAKE THE RIGHT HAND FORK AND GO SOUTH ON A GRAVELED ROAD FOR 1.0 MILE TO A T-ROAD INTERSECTION.  TURN RIGHT AND GO SOUTHWEST ON A GRAVELED ROAD FOR 0.4 MILE TO A FARM HOUSE ON THE LEFT AND A FIELD ROAD ON THE RIGHT AND THE AZIMUTH MARK ABOUT 100.0 FEET SOUTHWEST OF THE FIELD ROAD ENTRANCE. TURN RIGHT AND GO NORTH-NORTHWEST ON THE FIELD ROAD FOR 0.2 MILE TO AN OLD BUILDING SITE, THE BOUNDARY MONUMENT, A STANDARD METAL WITNESS POST AND MARKER AND THE STATION.  THE STATION MARK, A STANDARD DISK STAMPED VANEERDE 1961, IS SET IN TOP OF A 10-INCH SQUARE CONCRETE MONUMENT WHICH IS ABOUT 18 INCHES BELOW THE SURFACE OF THE GROUND.  IT IS 100.0 FEET WEST OF AN OLD BUILDING SITE, 24.8 FEET NORTH-NORTHWEST OF A STANDARD METAL WITNESS POST AND MARKER AND 27.0 FEET NORTH-NORTHWEST OF A 36-INCH POPLAR TREE.  REFERENCE MARK 1, A STANDARD DISK STAMPED VANEERDE NO 1 1961, IS SET IN TOP OF A 10-INCH SQUARE CONCRETE MONUMENT FLUSH WITH THE SURFACE OF THE GROUND.  IT IS 62.0 FEET NORTHEAST OF A 36-INCH POPLAR TREE, 59.0 FEET NORTHEAST OF A STANDARD METAL WITNESS POST AND MARKER AND ABOUT 12 INCHES ABOVE THE STATION MARK.  REFERENCE MARK 2, A STANDARD DISK STAMPED VANEERDE NO 2 1961, IS SET IN TOP OF A 10-INCH SQUARE CONCRETE MONUMENT FLUSH WITH THE SURFACE OF THE GROUND.  IT IS 20.0 FEET SOUTH-SOUTHEAST OF A STANDARD METAL WITNESS POST AND MARKER, 20.9 FEET SOUTH-SOUTHEAST OF A 36-INCH POPLAR TREE AND ABOUT 24 INCHES HIGHER THAN THE STATION.  THE AZIMUTH MARK, A STANDARD DISK STAMPED VANEERDE 1961, IS SET IN TOP OF A 10-INCH SQUARE CONCRETE MONUMENT PROJECTING ABOUT 3 INCHES ABOVE THE SURFACE OF THE GROUND.  IT IS 110.0 FEET WEST OF A FIELD ENTRANCE, 28.0 FEET NORTH OF THE CENTER OF THE INTERSECTION OF A GRAVELED DRIVEWAY AND GRAVELED ROAD, 14.0 FEET WEST OF AN UNDERGROUND TELEPHONE LINE AND 2.0 FEET SOUTH OF A STANDARD METAL WITNESS POST AND MARKER.  BOUNDARY MONUMENT NO. 43, A 12-INCH SQUARE LIMESTONE MONUMENT PROJECTING ABOUT 30 INCHES ABOVE THE SURFACE OF THE GROUND, UPRIGHT AND FIRMLY SET AND IN GOOD CONDITION.  IT HAS THE LETTER M CUT ON THE WEST SIDE AND THE LETTER P ON THE EAST SIDE.  IT IS 121.0 FEET NORTH-NORTHWEST OF A STANDARD METAL WITNESS POST AND MARKER AND 99.6 FEET NORTH-NORTHWEST OF A 36-INCH POPLAR TREE.  HEIGHT OF LIGHT ABOVE STATION MARK 2 METERS.

markers.description: BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1962 (RWT) THE STATION IS LOCATED ABOUT 7.0 MILES WEST-NORTHWEST OF DELMAR, DELAWARE, 4.0 MILES NORTHEAST OF MARDELA SPRINGS, MARYLAND, 4.0 MILES SOUTH-SOUTHEAST OF SHARPTOWN, MARYLAND, IN A DENSE WOODS LAND.  THE PROPERTY IS OWNED BY MR. CLYDE COOPER.  TO REACH THE STATION FROM SHARPTOWN, MARYLAND.  GO SOUTH-SOUTHEAST AND EAST ON STATE HIGHWAY 348 FOR 1.7 MILES TO THE STATE LINE.  CONTINUE EAST ON DELAWARE STATE HIGHWAY 24 FOR 1.0 MILE TO A SIDE ROAD RIGHT.  TURN RIGHT AND GO SOUTH ON A BLACKTOP ROAD FOR 1.5 MILES TO A CROSSROAD IN THE CENTER OF THE SMALL VILLAGE OF COLUMBIA, THE COLUMBIA MERCHANTILE STORE ON THE WEST SIDE OF THE ROAD AND THE COLUMBIA CHURCH BUILDING ON THE EAST SIDE OF THE BLACKTOP ROAD.  TURN RIGHT AND GO WEST ON A BLACKTOP ROAD FOR 1.45 MILES TO A CROSSROAD.  TURN LEFT AND GO SOUTH ON A MACADAM ROAD FOR 0.65 MILE TO A DIM WOODS ROAD ON THE EAST SIDE OF THE BLACKTOP ROAD.  TURN LEFT AND GO EAST ON THE TRACK WOODS ROAD FOR 0.3 MILE TO A VERY DIM CROSSROAD.  TURN LEFT AND GO NORTH ON A DIM TRACK WOODS ROAD FOR 0.15 MILE TO THE END OF THE TRACK ROAD, A 8-INCH TRIANGULAR BLAZED PINE TREE AT THE END OF THE ROAD AND TRUCK TRAVEL.  FROM THE END OF TRUCK TRAVEL, PACK NORTHEAST ABOUT 162.0 FEET TO THE STATION VINE, THENCE PACK SOUTHEAST FOR 0.1 MILE TO A STANDARD METAL WITNESS POST AND MARKER AND THE STATION.  THE STATION IS A STANDARD AZIMUTH MARK DISK, STAMPED VINE 1962, SECURED TO THE TOP OF A 5/8 INCH COPPER ROD FLUSH WITH THE SURFACE OF THE GROUND AND REINFORCED BY CONCRETE.  IT IS 3.5 FEET SOUTH OF A 30-INCH OAK TREE, 1.5 FEET NORTH-NORTHWEST OF A STANDARD METAL WITNESS POST AND MARKER AND 1.5 FEET SOUTH OF A 8-INCH PINE TREE.  NO REFERENCE MARKS WERE ESTABLISHED FOR THIS STATION  HEIGHT OF LIGHT ABOVE STATION MARK 2.0 METERS.

markers.description: BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1961 (RWT) THE STATION IS LOCATED ABOUT 5-1/2 MILES SOUTHEAST OF GLASGOW DELAWARE, 2.0 MILES NORTHEAST OF CHESAPEAKE CITY MARYLAND AND ON PROPERTY OWNED BY MR. FRANCIS WARREN WHO LIVES ABOUT 0.4 MILE NORTHWEST OF THE STATION.  TO REACH THE STATION FROM THE GENERAL STORE IN CHESAPEAKE CITY, GO EASTERLY ON STATE HIGHWAY 285 FOR 2.0 MILES TO THE AZIMUTH MARK ON THE RIGHT AND A SIDE ROAD LEFT, TURN LEFT AND GO NORTHERLY ON ASPHALT ROAD FOR 0.35 MILE TO A FENCE LINE ON THE LEFT, TURN LEFT AND FOLLOW FENCE LINE FOR 0.3 MILE TO THE STATION. IT IS 57.6 FEET EAST OF A 4-INCH HICKORY TREE, 3.5 FEET NORTH OF A STANDARD METAL WITNESS POST AND MARKER AND 3.5 FEET NORTH OF A FENCE LINE.  REFERENCE MARK 1, IS A STANDARD DISK SET IN THE TOP OF A 10 X 10 INCH CONCRETE MONUMENT WHICH IS FLUSH WITH THE SURFACE OF THE GROUND, STAMPED WARREN NO 1 1961.  IT IS 100.5 FEET EAST OF A 4-INCH HICKORY TREE AND 1.0 FEET NORTH OF A FENCE LINE.  REFERENCE MARK 2, IS A STANDARD DISK SET IN THE TOP OF A 10 X 10 INCH CONCRETE MONUMENT WHICH IS FLUSH WITH THE SURFACE OF THE GROUND, STAMPED WARREN NO 2 1961.  IT IS 42.0 FEET WEST OF A STANDARD METAL WITNESS POST AND MARKER, 15.5 FEET EAST OF A 4-INCH HICKORY TREE AND 1.0 FEET NORTH OF A FENCE LINE. *  AZIMUTH MARK, IS A STANDARD DISK SET IN THE TOP OF A 10 X 10 INCH CONCRETE MONUMENT WHICH IS FLUSH WITH THE SURFACE OF THE GROUND, STAMPED WARREN 1961.  IT IS 43.0 FEET SOUTHWEST OF POWERLINE POLE NUMBER J 205, 21.0 FEET SOUTH OF A T-ROAD INTERSECTION, 13.0 FEET SOUTH OF THE APPROXIMATE CENTER OF STATE HIGHWAY 285 AND 2.0 FEET WEST OF HIGHWAY SIGN PAVEMENT ENDS.  *AND IS 43.0 FEET EAST OF A STANDARD METAL WITNESS POST AND MARKER. STATION RECOVERY (1975)  RECOVERY NOTE BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 1975 (CLN) THE STATION MARK, REFERENCE MARK 1 AND THE AZIMUTH MARK WERE RECOVERED AND FOUND IN GOOD CONDITION.  REFERENCE MARK 2 WAS FOUND DESTROYED.  A NEW REFERENCE MARK 3 WAS ESTABLISHED IN THE NEAR SAME POSITION AS THE FORMER REFERENCE MARK 2.  THE BOUNDARY MONUMENT NUMBER 75 HAS BEEN DESTROYED.  THE MONUMENT IS NOW IN THE PRONE POSITION NEAR WHERE REFERENCE MARK 1 IS SET.  THE OLD POSITION OF THE MONUMENT WAS REESTABLISHED AND A IRON STAKE DROVE ON THE POINT WHERE THE MARYLAND-DELAWARE LINES MEET. THERE IS A SEPARATE REPORT ON BOUNDARY MONUMENT NUMBER 75.  A COMPLETE NEW DESCRIPTION OF THE STATION FOLLOWS.  THE STATION IS LOCATED 5-1/2 MILES SOUTH OF GLASGOW DELAWARE, 2 MILES NORTHEAST OF CHESAPEAKE CITY AND JUST EAST OF THE STATE LINE.  THE PROPERTY IS OWNED BY JOHN LOSTEN DAIRY INC., ROUTE 2, CHESAPEAKE CITY.  TO REACH THE STATION FROM THE CENTER OF THE SMALL TOWN OF NORTH CHESAPEAKE CITY, GO EAST ON A PAVED ROAD FOR 2.0 MILES TO A SIDE ROAD LEFT AND THE AZIMUTH MARK ON THE RIGHT.  TURN LEFT AND GO NORTH ON A PAVED ROAD FOR 0.35 MILE TO A HIGHLINE CROSSING.  TURN LEFT AND GO WEST ACROSS A FIELD FOR 0.35 MILE TO THE TOP OF A SMALL ROLLING HILL AND THE STATION.  THE STATION MARK IS A STANDARD DISK STAMPED WARREN 1961, SET IN THE TOP OF A 10-INCH SQUARE CONCRETE MONUMENT WHICH IS 18-INCHES BELOW THE SURFACE.  IT IS 46 FEET WEST OF A WITNESS POST AND 44 FEET EAST OF A WITNESS POST.  REFERENCE MARK 1 IS A STANDARD DISK STAMPED WARREN NO 1 1961, SET IN THE TOP OF A 10-INCH SQUARE CONCRETE MONUMENT WHICH IS FLUSH WITH THE SURFACE.  IT IS 2 FEET WEST OF A WITNESS POST.  REFERENCE MARK 3 IS A STANDARD DISK STAMPED WARREN 1961 NO 3 1975, SET IN THE TOP OF A 10-INCH SQUARE CONCRETE MONUMENT WHICH IS FLUSH WITH THE SURFACE.  IT IS 2 FEET EAST OF A WITNESS POST.  THE AZIMUTH MARK IS A STANDARD DISK STAMPED WARREN 1961, SET IN THE TOP OF A 10-INCH SQUARE CONCRETE MONUMENT WHICH IS 2-INCHES BELOW THE SURFACE.  IT IS 43 FEET SOUTHWEST OF A POWERLINE POLE NUMBERED J 205, 21 FEET SOUTHWEST OF THE CENTER OF THE T-INTERSECTION, 13 FEET SOUTH OF THE CENTER OF THE PAVED ROAD AND 2.1 FEET NORTH OF A WITNESS POST.  AIRLINE DISTANCE AND DIRECTION FROM NEAREST TOWN 2 MILES NORTHEAST OF CHEASPEAKE CITY.                            STATION RECOVERY (1976)  RECOVERY NOTE BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 1976 (CLN) UNABLE TO MEASURE BETWEEN RMS.  THE STATION AND ALL MARKS WERE RECOVERED AND FOUND IN GOOD CONDITION AS DESCRIBED IN THE 1975 DESCRIPTION.  ALL DISTANCES AND DIRECTIONS WERE WITHIN CLOSE AGREEMENT WITH THE PREVIOUS OBSERVATIONS.  THE OLD CROWN STONE FOR BOUNDARY MONUMENT NUMBER 75 WAS RESET AT THIS DATE, SEE DESCRIPTION THEREOF. STATION RECOVERY (1977)  RECOVERY NOTE BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 1977 (CLN) THE STATION MARK WAS RECOVERED AND FOUND IN GOOD CONDITION.  THE REFERENCE MARKS WERE NOT DUG DOWN TO. markers.description: BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1934 (JB) STATION IS ON THE PROPERTY OF W.G. WHARTON, IN A SMALL CLEARING SURROUNDED BY WOODS, 76 FEET SE OF A 24-INCH BLACK JACK TREE, 62 FEET NNE OF THE CENTER LINE OF A DIRT ROAD, AND 25.5 FEET W OF A 30-INCH HOLLOW SWEET GUM TREE.  THE STATION PROJECTS 6 INCHES ABOVE GROUND AND IS STAMPED WHARTON 1934.  THIS IS A SECOND-ORDER STATION.  SURFACE, UNDERGROUND AND REFERENCE MARKS ARE STANDARD BRONZE DISKS SET IN CONCRETE.  REFERENCE MARK NO. 1 IS 48.27 FEET S OF THE STATION, 25.5 FEET NE OF THE CENTER LINE OF A DIRT ROAD, 9.5 FEET W OF AN 18-INCH OAK TREE WITH A STUMP ON THE N SIDE, 8.6 FEET N OF A 30-INCH OAK TREE WITH A STONE EMBEDDED IN THE ROOT WHICH IS ON THE DELAWARE-MARYLAND BOUNDARY.  THE MARK IS IN A FENCE LINE AND ON THE DELAWARE-MARYLAND BOUNDARY.  THE MARK PROJECTS 6 INCHES ABOVE GROUND AND IS STAMPED WHARTON NO. 1 1934.  A 103-FOOT TOWER CLEARED LINES.  REFERENCE MARK NO. 2 IS 68.32 FEET WSW OF THE STATION, AND 11 FEET SSW OF THE CENTER LINE OF A DIRT ROAD.  THE MARK IS FLUSH WITH THE SURFACE OF THE GROUND AND IS STAMPED WHARTON NO. 2 1934.  AZIMUTH MARK IS APPROXIMATELY 0.3 MILE NNW OF THE STATION, APPROXIMATELY 0.15 MILE NE OF THE MAIN DIRT ROAD, 74 PACES NW OF A GROUP OF PEACH TREES, AND 2 FEET SE OF A FENCE LINE.  THE MARK IS VISIBLE FROM THE GROUND WITH CLEARING.  THE MARK PROJECTS 6 INCHES ABOVE GROUND AND IS STAMPED WHARTON AZIMUTH MARK 1934.  TO REACH THE STATION FROM THE POST OFFICE AT MASSEY GO N ON A CONCRETE ROAD FOR ABOUT 2.3 MILES TO MILEAGE MARKER 23 AND A DIRT CROSS ROAD, THEN TURN RIGHT ON A DIRT ROAD AND FOLLOW THE MAIN-TRAVELED ROAD FOR ABOUT 2.4 MILES TO A CROSS ROAD WHICH IS ABOUT 75 YARDS E OF GALT RAILROAD STATION, TURN RIGHT ON A DIRT ROAD FOR ABOUT 0.8 MILE TO A BEND IN THE ROAD AND THE STATION.                            STATION RECOVERY (1943)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1943 (RLS) RECOVERED EXCEPT FOR THE FOLLOWING--  R.M. 2 IS 89.52 FEET WSW OF THE STATION, NOT 68.32 FT.  THE DISK HAS BEEN KNOCKED OUT OF THE CONCRETE MONUMENT, PROBABLY BY A ROAD SCRAPER.  HOWEVER, THE HOLE REMAINS, SHOWING THE LOCATION OF THE DISK.  DELETE THE PHRASE 25.5 FEET W OF A 30-INCH HOLLOW SWEET GUM TREE.  WITH REFERENCE TO AZIMUTH MARK, IT IS 74 PACES SE OF A SINGLE PEACH TREE, NOT 74 PACES NW OF A GROUP OF PEACH TREES.                            STATION RECOVERY (1961)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1961 (CLN) THE STATION MARK, REFERENCE MARK 1 AND REFERENCE MARK 4 WERE RECOVERED AND FOUND IN GOOD CONDITION AS DESCRIBED.  REFERENCE MARK 3 WAS NOT FOUND, HOWEVER IT IS BELIEVED STILL INTACT UNDER WATER AND ICE.  IN DRY WEATHER IT CAN PROBABLY BE RECOVERED.  THE DISTANCES AND DIRECTIONS TO BOTH THE REFERENCE MARKS WHICH WERE FOUND, AGREED WITH THE PREVIOUS 1961 OBSERVATIONS.  AIRLINE DISTANCE AND DIRECTION FROM NEAREST TOWN 1 MILE SOUTHEAST OF GOLTS.                            STATION RECOVERY (1961)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1961 (RWT) THE STATION MARK, REFERENCE MARK 1 WAS RECOVERED AS DESCRIBED AND FOUND IN GOOD CONDITION.  REFERENCE MARK 2 WAS DESTROYED DUE TO ROAD CONSTRUCTION.  THE AZIMUTH MARK WAS SEARCHED FOR BUT NOT RECOVERED, IT IS BELIEVED TO OF BEEN DESTROYED DUE TO CONSERVATION.  REFERENCE MARKS NUMBER 3 AND 4 WAS ESTABLISHED.  THE DESCRIPTION WAS FOUND TO BE ADEQUATE EXCEPT THAT THE ROAD TO GOLTS IS NOW PAVED AND THE RAILROAD STATION IS GONE.  REFERENCE MARK 3 IS A STANDARD DISK STAMPED WHARTON NO 3 1934, SET IN TOP OF A SQUARE CONCRETE MONUMENT WHICH PROJECTS 1-INCH ABOVE THE GROUND SURFACE.  IT IS 30.0 FEET NORTHEAST OF THE APPROXIMATE CENTER OF THE GRAVELED ROAD, 67.6 FEET WEST-NORTHWEST OF A STANDARD METAL WITNESS POST AND MARKER 81.0 FEET NORTHEAST OF AN 18-INCH TRIANGULAR BLAZED OAK TREE AND IS ABOUT THE SAME ELEVATION AS THE STATION MARK.  REFERENCE MARK 4 IS A STANDARD DISK STAMPED WHARTON NO 4 1934, SET IN TOP OF A SQUARE CONCRETE MONUMENT WHICH PROJECTS 6 INCHES ABOVE THE GROUND SURFACE.  IT IS 1.9 FEET WEST-NORTHWEST OF A STANDARD METAL WITNESS POST AND MARKER, 5.0 FEET SOUTH OF AN 8-INCH TRIANGULAR BLAZED OAK TREE AND 24.0 FEET NORTH OF THE APPROXIMATE CENTER OF THE GRAVELED ROAD.  THE MASON AND DIXON BOUNDARY MONUMENT WAS NOT RECOVERED.  HEIGHT OF LIGHT ABOVE STATION MARK 33.99 METERS.                            STATION RECOVERY (1976)  RECOVERY NOTE BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 1976 (CLN) THE STATION AND ALL MARKS WERE RECOVERED AND FOUND IN GOOD CONDITION AS DESCRIBED IN THE PREVIOUS DESCRIPTION.  THE DISTANCES AND DIRECTION TO ALL MARKS WERE WITHIN CLOSE AGREEMENT WITH THE PREVIOUS OBSERVATIONS.  THE MARYLAND-DELAWARE BOUNDARY MONUMENT NUMBER 60 WAS RESET AT THIS DATE, SEE DESCRIPTION THEREOF.  DUE TO THE HIGH WATER TABLE, THE REFERENCE MARK 3 COULD NOT BE LOCATED AT THIS DATE, HOWEVER IT IS BELIEVED STILL INTACT.  AIRLINE DISTANCE AND DIRECTION FROM NEAREST TOWN 3 MILES SOUTHEAST OF SASSAFRAS.                            STATION RECOVERY (2013)  RECOVERY NOTE BY DELAWARE COASTAL PROGRAM 2013 THE BENCHMARK IS LOCATED 4 FT IN FRONT OF A METAL WITNESS POST, 20 YDS NORTHEAST OF MCKAYS CORNER ROAD, AND 1.1 MILES WEST OF SAWMILL ROAD INTERSECTION.

markers.description: BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1934 (JCT) ON THE S BANK OF INDIAN RIVER ON THE MOST NORTHERLY POINT OF WHITE NECK ABOUT 1/2 MILE NE ALONG THE SHORE LINE FROM IRONS LANE LANDING.  THE STATION IS LOCATED ON A PROMINENT POINT OF HIGH GROUND COVERED WITH SCATTERED TREES AND BRUSH WHICH CONSTITUTES THE FIRST SUCH POINT E OF IRONS LANE LANDING.  THE MARK IS SET ON THE NW SIDE OF THE POINT IN A LINE OF SCATTERED TREES WHICH GROW ALONG THE NW SIDE OF THE HIGHEST GROUND.  IT IS ABOUT 20 METERS SW FROM THE END OF AN OLD WAGON TRAIL RUNNING APPROXIMATELY N AND S AND ENDING AT THE HIGH-WATER LINE.  THE LARGEST TREE IN THE IMMEDIATE VICINITY IS A BUSHY OAK 7.05 METERS NE OF THE STATION ON THE W SIDE OF AND NEAR THE END OF THE OLD WAGON TRAIL.  A LOW SANDY AREA LIES BETWEEN THE STATION AND THE HIGH-WATER LINE ON THE NW.  SURFACE AND REFERENCE MARKS ARE STANDARD BRONZE DISKS IN A TILE.  UNDERGROUND MARK IS A BLOCK OF CONCRETE BELOW THE GROUND CONTAINING A STANDARD BRONZE DISK.  WITNESS MARK IS A BUSHY OAK.  THE STATION IS BEST REACHED BY WATER. REFERENCE MARK 1 TO REFERENCE MARK 2 IS 67.72 FEET OR 20.640 METERS.  4.  THE BUSHY OAK REFERRED TO IN THE ORIGINAL DESCRIPTION HAS BEEN CHOPPED DOWN. OF ROUTES 14 AND 26 IN BETHANY BEACH AS FOLLOWS--GO W ON 26 3.5 MILES, TURN RIGHT, N, AT THE JOHN A. BISHOP LUMBER AND BOAT CO. AND GO 1.5 MILES AND TURN LEFT WITH THE BLACKTOP, CONTINUE 0.4 MILES AND TURN RIGHT, N, ON A SAND ROAD, GO 0.4 MILE TO ROAD FORKS, KEEP LEFT FORK STRAIGHT AHEAD AND GO 0.25 MILE, TURN LEFT, W, INTO A WOODS ROAD, GO 0.5 MILE TO DIM FORKS, KEEP LEFT AND GO 0.35 MILE TO FORKS, KEEP RIGHT FORK AND GO TO THE EDGE OF THE WOODS NEAR THE BEACH AND RM NO 1 ON LEFT AT EDGE OF WOODS NEAR TRAIL. markers.description: BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 1976 (CLN) THE STATION SURFACE DISK WAS RECOVERED AND FOUND IN GOOD CONDITION IN THE TOP OF THE OLD MARYLAND-DELAWARE BOUNDARY MONUMENT NUMBER 34.  IT WAS REMOVED AND THE SUB-SURFACE DISK WAS ALSO FOUND IN GOOD CONDITION.  THE OLD MARYLAND-DELAWARE MONUMENT NUMBER 34 WAS THEN RESET 8 FEET TO THE WEST ON THE STATE LINE AND A NEW STATION SURFACE DISK SET DIRECTLY OVER THE OLD SUB-SURFACE DISK.  REFERENCE MARK ONE AND THE AZIMUTH MARK (RM 3) WERE RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION.  REFERENCE MARK 2 WAS NOT FOUND AND BELIEVED DESTROYED.  A NEW REFERENCE MARK 4 WAS SET AT THIS DATE.  A COMPLETE NEW DESCRIPTION OF THE STATION FOLLOWS.  THE STATION IS LOCATED ABOUT 1/4 MILE SOUTHEAST OF WHITELEYSBURG, 3-1/4 MILES EAST-SOUTHEAST OF GREENSBORO, AND 18-1/2 MILES SOUTHWEST OF DOVER.  IT IS ON PROPERTY OWNED BY MR. MARVIN SENNEY AND MR. SENNEY LIVES JUST NORTHEAST OF THE STATION.  TO REACH FROM THE INTERSECTION OF MARYLAND STATE HIGHWAY 314, DELAWARE STATE HIGHWAY 12, DELAWARE COUNTY ROAD 452 AND 59 IN THE SMALL TOWN OF WHITELEYSBURG, GO SOUTH-SOUTHWEST ON DELAWARE STATE HIGHWAY 12 FOR 0.1 MILE TO THE END OF TRUCK TRAVEL IN WET WEATHER.  TURN LEFT AND GO EAST ACROSS A CULTIVATED FIELD FOR 0.2 MILE TO THE STATION JUST WEST OF A WOODED AREA AND IN THE CULTIVATED FIELD.  THE STATION SURFACE MARK IS A STANDARD DISK STAMPED WHITELEY 1934 1976 SET IN THE TOP OF A 12 BY 20 INCH MASS OF CONCRETE WHICH IS 14 INCHES BELOW THE SURFACE.  THE SUB-SURFACE DISK IS STAMPED WHITELEY 1934, SET IN AN 8-INCH MASS OF CONCRETE 40 INCHES BELOW THE SURFACE.  THEY ARE 177 FEET NORTH OF A FIELD DITCH, 173 FEET NORTHWEST OF A WITNESS POST, 93 FEET WEST OF THE WEST EDGE OF A WOODED AREA, AND 6 FEET NORTHEAST OF A WITNESS POST.  REFERENCE MARK ONE IS A STANDARD DISK STAMPED WHITELEY NO 1 1934 SET IN THE TOP OF A 10-INCH SQUARE CONCRETE MONUMENT WHICH IS FLUSH WITH THE SURFACE.  IT IS 120 FEET NORTH OF A WITNESS POST AND 8 FEET EAST OF EAST EDGE OF A FIELD.  REFERENCE MARK 4 IS A STANDARD DISK STAMPED WHITELEY 1934 NO 4 1976 SET IN THE TOP OF A 10-INCH ROUND CONCRETE MONUMENT WHICH IS FLUSH WITH THE SURFACE.  IT IS 174 FEET SOUTHEAST OF A WITNESS POST, 150 FEET NORTH OF SOUTHWEST CORNER OF WOODED AREA AT THE DITCH, 8 FEET EAST OF EAST EDGE OF FIELD, AND 2 FEET SOUTH OF A WITNESS POST.  THE AZIMUTH MARK IS A STANDARD REFERENCE MARK DISK STAMPED WHITELEY NO 3 1934, SET IN THE TOP OF A 10-INCH SQUARE CONCRETE MONUMENT WHICH IS FLUSH WITH THE SURFACE.  IT IS 25 FEET WEST OF POWERLINE POLE NUMBERED 60 166-23, 18 FEET SOUTH OF THE CENTER OF STATE HIGHWAY 314, AND 1.8 FEET NORTH OF A WITNESS POST.  TO REACH THE AZIMUTH MARK FROM THE CROSSROADS IN WHITELEYSBURG, GO WEST ON STATE HIGHWAY 314 FOR 0.3 MILE TO THE MARK ON THE LEFT.  AIRLINE DISTANCE AND DIRECTION FROM NEAREST TOWN 1/4 MILE SOUTHEAST OF WHITELEYSBURG.
