BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1962 (RWT) THE STATION IS LOCATED AT THE INDIAN RIVER INLET, BETWEEN THE INLET AND THE COAST GUARD STATION, 5.0 MILES NORTH OF BETHANY BEACH, 7-1/2 MILES SOUTH OF REHOBOTH BEACH AND ON PROPERTY OWNED BY THE U.S. COAST GUARD.  TO REACH THE STATION FROM THE POST OFFICE IN REHOBOTH BEACH, GO SOUTH ON CITY ROUTE 14 FOR 1.4 MILES TO THE JUNCTION OF STATE HIGHWAY 14, CONTINUE SOUTH ON STATE HIGHWAY 14 FOR 6.4 MILES TO THE INDIAN RIVER INLET BRIDGE, TURN LEFT AND GO EAST ALONG THE NORTH SIDE OF THE INLET FOR 392.6 FEET TO THE STATION AS DESCRIBED.  THE STATION MARK IS A STANDARD DISK STAMPED WINDY 1962, SET IN TOP OF A SQUARE CONCRETE MONUMENT WHICH IS FLUSH WITH THE GROUND SURFACE.  IT IS 55.0 FEET SOUTH-SOUTHWEST OF THE SOUTHWEST LEG OF THE COAST GUARD TOWER, 65.0 FEET NORTH-NORTHEAST OF THE NORTH EDGE OF THE INLET, 67.5 FEET NORTH OF THE STANDARD METAL WITNESS POST AND MARKER, 98.0 FEET SOUTH-SOUTHEAST OF A POWERLINE POLE AND 392.6 FEET EAST-SOUTHEAST OF THE NORTHEAST ABUTMENT OF THE INDIAN RIVER BRIDGE.  REFERENCE MARK 2 IS A STANDARD DISK STAMPED WINDY NO 2 1962, SET IN TOP OF A SQUARE CONCRETE MONUMENT WHICH IS FLUSH WITH THE GROUND SURFACE.  IT IS 3.5 FEET WEST OF A POWERLINE POLE, 67.2 FEET NORTHWEST OF THE NORTHWEST LEG OF THE COAST GUARD TOWER AND 158.7 FEET NORTH OF THE STANDARD METAL WITNESS POST AND MARKER.  REFERENCE MARK 1 IS A STANDARD DISK STAMPED WINDY NO 1 1962, CEMENTED IN A DRILL HOLE IN THE CONCRETE FOUNDATION OF THE SOUTHEAST LEG OF THE COAST GUARD TOWER.  IT IS 5.55 FEET SOUTH-SOUTHEAST OF THE SOUTHEAST LEG OF THE COAST GUARD TOWER AND 113.85 FEET NORTHEAST OF THE STANDARD METAL WITNESS POST AND MARKER.  HEIGHT OF LIGHT ABOVE STATION MARK 22.04 METERS.                            STATION RECOVERY (1966)  RECOVERY NOTE BY LOCAL ENGINEER (INDIVIDUAL OR FIRM) 1966 (RTF) RECOVERED BY BE BEAVIN CO.  STATION NOT FOUND.  A NEW BRIDGE HAS BEEN BUILT ACROSS THE INLET.  DID NOT SEARCH THOROUGHLY AS A BRIDGE PIER IS ON LINE WITH STATION HAPPY.  R.M. 1 FOUND IN GOOD CONDITION.                            STATION RECOVERY (1970)  RECOVERY NOTE BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 1970 (JKW) STATION MARK DESTROYED.  RMS 1 AND 2 WERE RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION.  THE MONUMENT FOR THE STATION MARK WAS FOUND LYING HORIZONTALLY ABOUT TWO FEET BELOW THE SURFACE OF THE GROUND.  THE SUB-SURFACE MARK IS PROBABLY INTACT.  THE ORIGINAL DESCRIPTION IS ADEQUATE WITH THE FOLLOWING ADDITIONS--A NEW BRIDGE HAS BEEN BUILT ACROSS THE INLET.  RM 2 IS 147.3 FEET EAST OF THE NORTHEAST CORNER OF BRIDGE ABUTMENT, 83.5 FEET NORTHEAST OF A POWER POLE AND 3 FEET BELOW THE SURFACE OF THE GROUND.  DISTANCE FROM RM 1 TO RM 2 IS 89.95 FEET.  AIRLINE DISTANCE AND DIRECTION FROM NEAREST TOWN AT INDIAN RIVER INLET.                            STATION RECOVERY (1972)  RECOVERY NOTE BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 1972 (LFS) THE STATION SUB-SURFACE DISK AND BOTH REFERENCE MARKS WERE RECOVERED AND FOUND IN GOOD CONDITION.  THE STATION SURFACE DISK WAS FOUND DESTROYED.  THE SUB-SURFACE DISK AND MONUMENT WAS GIVEN VERY CAREFUL EXAMINATION AND IT SHOWED NO SIGN OF BEING DISTURBED.  THE DISK WAS FOUND UNDER ABOUT 5-1/2 FEET OF LOOSE BLOWN IN SAND.  IT WAS LEFT INTACT AND A 5-1/2 FOOT DEEP CONCRETE MONUMENT WITH A STATION DISK IN THE TOP WAS PLACED OVER THE ORIGINAL DISK.  BOTH REFERENCE MARKS ARE NOW UNDER ABOUT 3 FEET OF SAND.  A LONGER DISTANCE OF 0.026 METERS WAS FOUND TO REFERENCE MARK 1.  A LONGER DISTANCE OF 0.021 METERS WAS FOUND TO REFERENCE MARK 2.  A SMALLER ANGLE OF 1 MINUTE AND 48 SECONDS WAS FOUND BETWEEN THE REFERENCE MARKS.  IT IS BELIEVED THAT IF ANY LOCAL MOVEMENT TOOK PLACE, IT WAS A LARGE AREA MOVEMENT CAUSED BY THE SHIFTING SANDS.  A COMPLETE NEW DESCRIPTION OF THE STATION FOLLOWS.  THE STATION IS LOCATED ABOUT 7-1/2 MILES SOUTH OF ROHOBOTH BEACH, 5 MILES NORTH OF BETHANY BEACH AND JUST NORTH OF INDIAN RIVER INLET.  IT IS ON STATE OWNED PROPERTY.  TO REACH THE STATION FROM THE POST OFFICE IN ROHOBOTH BEACH, GO SOUTH ON BAYARD AVENUE FOR 1.4 MILES TO STATE HIGHWAY 14.  BEAR LEFT AND CONTINUE SOUTH ON STATE HIGHWAY 14 FOR 6.1 MILES TO A LARGE BRIDGE OVER INDIAN RIVER INLET AND THE STATION JUST EAST OF THE BRIDGE.  THE STATION SUB-SURFACE DISK IS STAMPED WINDY 1962.  THE STATION SURFACE DISK IS STAMPED WINDY 1962 1972.  THEY ARE BOTH STANDARD DISKS.  THE SURFACE DISK IS 126 FEET EAST OF THE MOST NORTHERLY ONE OF THE BRIDGE PIERS, 65 FEET SOUTHWEST OF THE SOUTHEAST LEG OF A LOOKOUT TOWER 41 FEET EAST OF A POWERLINE POLE NUMBER IH 75 AND 26.4 FEET SOUTHEAST OF A 6 FOOT HIGH, 8-INCH ROUND WOODEN POLE WITH A WITNESS SIGN NAILED TO THE SOUTHEAST SIDE.  REFERENCE MARK 1 IS A STANDARD DISK STAMPED WINDY NO 1 1962, CEMENTED IN A DRILL HOLE IN THE SOUTHEAST LEG OF THE LOOKOUT TOWER.  IT IS 1 FOOT SOUTHEAST OF THE SOUTHEAST STEEL LEG OF THE LOOKOUT TOWER.  REFERENCE MARK 2 IS A STANDARD DISK STAMPED WINDY NO 2 1962, SET IN THE TOP OF A 10-INCH SQUARE CONCRETE MONUMENT WHICH IS 3 FEET BELOW THE SURFACE.  IT IS 147 FEET EAST OF THE MOST NORTHERLY BRIDGE PIER, 83 FEET NORTHEAST OF POWERLINE POLE NUMBER 91 IH 75 AND 3.5 FEET WEST OF THE OLD STUB OF A FORMER POWERLINE POLE.  NO AZIMUTH MARK AT THIS STATION.  AIRLINE DISTANCE AND DIRECTION FROM NEAREST TOWN 5 MILES NORTH OF BETHANY BEACH.                            STATION RECOVERY (1975)  RECOVERY NOTE BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 1975 (EAB) THE SURFACE STATION MARK, ABOUT 2 FEET OF THIS CONCRETE POST WITH THE DISK STILL INTACT WAS RECOVERED BROKEN OFF AND FOUND LYING FLAT ABOUT 2 FEET UNDER THE GROUND LEVEL.  THE STATION MARK DISK I NOTICED WAS STAMPED WINDY 1962 1972.  THE SUB-SURFACE MARK WAS RECOVERED AND IT WAS FOUND TO BE IN GOOD CONDITION.  THIS SUB-SURFACE MARK WAS FOUND TO BE UNDER THE BOTTOM PART OF THE REST OF THE CONCRETE POST THAT THE SURFACE MARK WAS SET IN.  THE SUB-SURFACE MARK IS ABOUT 5.8 FEET BELOW THE GROUND LEVEL.  WHEN I WAS FILLING UP THIS HOLE I PLACED THE BOTTOM PART OF THE OLD CONCRETE POST UP-RIGHT OVER THE SUB-SURFACE MARK, THAN BY PLACING THE PART OF THE CONCRETE POST WITH THE DISK STILL IN IT, I LAYED THIS PART FLAT WITH THE GROUND ON THE TOP OF THE UP-RIGHT PIECE OF THE CONCRETE POST.  NOW THIS PIECE OF CONCRETE POST THAT IS LYING FLAT WITH THE GROUND IS 1.5 FEET BELOW THE GROUND LEVEL.  TO HELP IN RECOVERING THIS SUB-SURFACE IT IS 145.3 FEET EAST SOUTHEAST OF THE MOST EXTREME EAST EDGE OF THE NORTHERLY ONE OF THE BRIDGE PIERS, 50.6 FEET NORTH OF THE NORTH EDGE OF A CONCRETE WALK ALONG THE NORTH SHORE OF THIS INLET, 17.3 FEET WEST OF THE CENTER OF A SMALL TRIANGLE THAT IS INSCRIBED ON A PYLON IN A ROW OF PYLONS AND THE SUB-SURFACE MARK BEING ABOUT 5.5 FEET BELOW THE GROUND LEVEL.  REFERENCE MARK NO 1 WAS RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION AS IT IS DESCRIBED IN THE 1962 AND THE 1972 DESCRIPTIONS.  REFERENCE MARK NO 2 WAS RECOVERED AND IT WAS FOUND TO BE IN GOOD CONDITION.  IT WAS FOUND TO BE 147.3 FEET NORTHEAST OF THE MOST EXTREME EAST EDGE OF THE NORTHERLY ONE OF THE BRIDGE PIERS, 68.0 FEET WEST NORTHWEST OF THE NORTHWEST LEG OF THE STEEL LOOKOUT TOWER AND 2.5 FEET BELOW THE GROUND LEVEL.

markers.description: BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1961 (RWT) THE STATION IS LOCATED IN A DENSE WOODS AND LOW SWAMP AREA, PROPERTY OWNED BY MR. SZELESTEI, ABOUT 2.0 MILES SOUTHWEST OF HARTLY, DELAWARE AND ABOUT 1.5 MILES NORTHEAST OF TEMPLEVILLE.  TO REACH THE STATION FROM THE POST OFFICE IN TEMPLEVILLE, MARYLAND.  GO EAST ABOUT 100 YARDS TO A SIDE ROAD LEFT.  TURN LEFT AND GO NORTH-NORTHEAST ON A GRAVELED ROAD FOR 2.0 MILES TO A TRIANGULAR BLAZED TREE ON THE RIGHT AT A PILE OF RUBBISH AND NO DUMPING SIGN AND A DIM TRACK ROAD.  TURN RIGHT AND GO SOUTH ON THE WOODS ROAD FOR 0.3 MILE TO A DIM CROSS ROAD AND A TRIANGULAR BLAZED TREE ON THE RIGHT IN A REASONABLE OPEN AREA IN THE WOODS.  TURN RIGHT AND GO EAST-NORTHEAST ON A WOODS ROAD FOR 0.1 MILE TO A FORK.  TAKE THE RIGHT FORK AND CONTINUE EAST ON THE WOODS ROAD FOR 0.15 MILE TO A FORK, ABOUT 100.0 FEET BEFORE REACHING THE CORNER OF A CULTIVATED FIELD AND AN OLD BRIDGE OVER A DITCH, THE BRIDGE IS IN POOR CONDITION.  TURN SHARP LEFT AND GO SOUTH-SOUTHWEST ON A TRACK WOODS ROAD FOR 0.3 MILE, KEEPING THE MAIN TRAVELED ROAD TO A TRIANGULAR BLAZED TREE ON THE LEFT.  TURN LEFT AND GO SOUTHEAST ON A VERY DIM TRACK WOODS ROAD FOR 0.15 MILE TO A STANDARD METAL WITNESS POST AND MARKER, THE BOUNDARY MONUMENT AND THE STATION.  THE STATION MARK, A STANDARD DISK STAMPED WONDER 1961, IS SET IN TOP OF A 10-INCH SQUARE CONCRETE MONUMENT PROJECTING ABOUT 3 INCHES ABOVE THE SURFACE OF THE GROUND.  IT IS 57.0 FEET EAST OF A 24-INCH TRIANGULAR BLAZED OAK TREE, 19.2 FEET NORTH-NORTHEAST OF A 8-INCH TRIANGULAR BLAZED OAK TREE AND 6.0 FEET WEST OF A STANDARD METAL WITNESS POST AND MARKER.  REFERENCE MARK 1, A STANDARD DISK STAMPED WONDER NO 1 1961, IS SET IN TOP OF A 10-SQUARE CONCRETE MONUMENT, PROJECTING ABOUT 5 INCHES ABOVE THE SURFACE OF THE GROUND.  IT IS 89.0 FEET SOUTH OF A STANDARD METAL WITNESS POST AND MARKER AND ABOUT STATION ELEVATION.  REFERENCE MARK 2, A STANDARD DISK STAMPED WONDER NO 2 1961, IS SET IN TOP OF A 10-INCH SQUARE CONCRETE MONUMENT PROJECTING ABOUT 4 INCHES ABOVE THE SURFACE OF THE GROUND.  IT IS 87.0 FEET WEST-NORTHWEST OF A STANDARD METAL WITNESS POST AND MARKER, 24.0 FEET WEST OF A 24-INCH TRIANGULAR BLAZED OAK TREE AND ABOUT STATION ELEVATION.  REFERENCE MARK 3, A STANDARD DISK STAMPED WONDER NO 3 1961, IS SET IN TOP OF A 10-SQUARE CONCRETE MONUMENT PROJECTING ABOUT 5 INCHES ABOVE THE SURFACE OF THE GROUND.  IT IS 47.0 FEET SOUTH OF WOODS ROAD AND 1.1 FEET NORTHEAST OF A STANDARD METAL WITNESS POST AND MARKER.  BOUNDARY MONUMENT NO. 48, A 12-INCH SQUARE CONCRETE MONUMENT PROJECTING ABOUT 30 INCHES ABOVE THE SURFACE OF THE GROUND, BADLY ERODED AT THE BOTTOM.  THE UPPER PART IS IN GOOD CONDITION, BUT SLIGHTLY OUT OF PLUMB.  IT IS 87.7 FEET SOUTHWEST OF A STANDARD METAL WITNESS POST AND MARKER, 79.0 FEET SOUTHWEST OF A 8-INCH TRIANGULAR BLAZED OAK TREE.  HEIGHT OF LIGHT ABOVE STATION MARK 34 METERS.
